long_text: And Chennai Super Kings' highest run-scorer hits the winning runs! CSK are IPL 2018 champions. Driven through the covers
full just outside off, and Rayudu suffles across to the off side before driving it to mid off
yorker on off, and dug away to the square-leg fielder
full just outside off, and defended towards cover point. We'll have to wait.
full just outside off, and this time it's been caressed! The last one was brute force but this was pure timing. Proper front-foot straight drive past the bowler
full on middle, but Watson makes some extra room and then drills it past the bowler. Kaul's lucky that he got out of the delivery's way. Smokes this to the long-off boundary
length ball outside off, and Rayudu punches it off the back foot to sweeper cover. Ten needed now
low full toss on middle, and Watson mistimes a bunt to long off
back of a length on off, and that's been comfortably pulled to the fielder at deep backward square

short_text: Rashid Khan to Watson, FOUR runs
long_text: dropped just in front of Hooda at deep backward square! And then it bounces away to the boundary. A horror evening for Hooda. It was a full ball on middle that Watson had slog swept to the leg side

short_text: Rashid Khan to Watson, FOUR runs
long_text: full on off, but Watson's picked the wrong'un. Goes down on one knee, and then ramps it past the keeper's left. He's doing this in style!
full on leg stump, and worked off the front foot to the leg side. Calls early for the single

full outside off, and defended with soft hands to cover. They take the single and that's an IPL hundred for Watson The first IPL finals hundred while chasing, the second in all IPL finals. Take a bow, legend. Also his second of the season
full just outside off, and driven with the turn to long off. Gets Watson back on strike and the crowd's gone ballistic
full on off, but it's not spinning. Watson drives it past the non-striker to long on. Moves to 99
back of a length on off, and Watson fends it off the back foot. Comes off the bat's outside edge and runs down to third man
back of a length outside off, and slapped to deep point. Well stopped by the man in the deep
slower ball again. Fuller outside off, and driven away from his body to KW at cover
short ball, and it's the offcutter too, but Rayudu picks the length early. Comes dancing down the wicket and then slaps it inside out over long off. Ambati's done waiting
back of a length outside off, and punched off the back foot to cover. Starts the over with two dot balls
length ball on middle, and angling into his body. Cramped for space, so fended towards the leg side

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rayudu, 1 leg bye
long_text: length ball on middle, and he glances it fine down the leg side. Work for the man at short fine leg. Final time out of the season

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run
long_text: ripper! Full outisde off and it's the wrong'un once again. Hits his front pad, but looks like impact is outside off. The appeal for lbw is turned down as well but Rashid has convinced his captain to review. Missing everything

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run
long_text: full on off and zipping straight through. Fended off the back foot on this occasion

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run
long_text: extra bounce! Short on off, and turning into the batsman again. Whipped off his hips to short fine leg

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run
long_text: edged to first slip! But goes to the fielder on the bounce. Pitches outside off, and spins into Rayudu

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run
long_text: full on off, and defended towards the leg side. Goswami scampers across to stop the single
slower ball outside off, and that's in Watto's arc. Stands tall and pulls this over deep midwicket. What a show from Watto. Ninety-seven runs
yorker on leg stump, and going down the leg side. Watson does well to skip away from the ball's line
chops it past short third man for another boundary! Moves on to the nineties It was angling into the batsman, but he did really well to open his bat's face
good length outside off, and Rayudu opens his bat's face to run this down to Bhuvi at third man

goes short! Brathwaite's appealing for the caught behind, and Williamson reviews. It was a quick delivery that rose onto Raina. Raina misses the pull, and the ball brushes his top glove. Raina's walking even before the third umpire gives his decision. Rayudu's already made his way out
length ball on middle, but Watson mistimes his pull. Played along the ground to sweeper on the leg side
back of a length on middle, and cramps Raina for space. But still he manages to clip it off his hips to deep backward square
overpitched just outside off, but luck's going Watto's way! Steers it between gully and point, and the over ends with a boundary. Twenty-seven runs off the over!
wide outside off, but he's got to bowl this again. Over the tramlines
hat-trick of sixes! Length ball outside off, and Watson opens his stance to go towards the leg side. Drags this from outside off and slaps it over long on once again
misses the yorker again, and Watson sends this over cow corner! Low full toss on middle, but Watson gets his front leg out of the way and deposits this into the stands. Delightful hitting

goes short outside off, and Watson simply checks his pull shot. Doesn't matter. It comes off the bat's bottom half, but the shot soars over long on! How powerful is this man. Replays show that the knuckle ball just didn't come off

low full toss outside off, and this time Watson drives it over extra cover. Off the bat's toe end, but still finds the gap past wide long off. Sharma misses the yorker-length, and is punished by Watto on this occasion
wide yorker outside off. Watson tries to steer it square, but can't get bat to ball. An excellent start for the bowling side
slower ball to end the over. It's wide outside off, so Watson is forced to reach at it. Flat-bats it past the bowler's left, and takes a single to keep the strike

slower ball on off, but it's always angling into Watson. He attempts to pull, and despite it not coming off the bat's middle, the shot has enough behind it for the ball to race away to the square-leg boundary
back of a length on middle, but angling into Raina. He backs away to make some room, but can only chop it down to short third man

attempts to cut it late, but he can only steer it to short third man. Watson's halfway down the wicket, so the fielder has a shy at the stumps. He misses, and now that allows CSK to take the run after all. Bhuvi the guilty man, and Brathwaite's not pleased one bit
back of a length on off stump, but he's taken the pace off the ball. Raina walks inside the line of the ball, and nudges it to the vacant area on the leg side
angling into his pads, and clipped away to deep midwicket. Gets Raina back on strike
full on middle, and that's been lifted over long on! Leans into this, and times it beautifully over the fielder on the boundary
wide outside off, and allows Watson to free his arms. Slaps a cut to Rashid Khan at sweeper cover
muscles this pull down the ground. Was a length ball outside off. Long on cleans up
length ball on off, and Raina has the luxury to go onto the back foot. Punched to mid on
wide outside off, and that's been cut off the back foot. Goes to the sweeper at deep point
flat outside leg stump, and Watson goes down on one knee and thumps it over deep backward square leg! What a classy way to get to your fifty. A freebie to start his spell

short_text: Rashid Khan to Raina, FOUR runs
long_text: flat down leg, errant line. Just a bit of bat on Raina's sweep and the ball races away to the fine leg boundary.
picks the googly, maybe on line. Short and wide, he goes back and pulls to deep midwicket
another googly, punched to deep midwicket. CSK very happy with this.

short_text: Rashid Khan to Raina, no run
long_text: the googly around off, pushed to Rashid's left. He gets across acrobatically and throws back to the keeper too.
a googly outside off, driven to long-off
flat and straight, worked to deep midwicket for a run
just over cover! Wanted to always go over but didn't quite time that. A slower ball outside off, chipped over the fielder
knew that was his area. 115 kph, a knuckle ball outside off. Watson knows the fielder is up so just slaps the ball over the fielder. Lands just inside.

he goes for the catch! Good effort. A low full toss is hit away to the sweeper cover. Rashid runs in, decides to go for the catch and nearly gets there. He gets body behind ball, as my cricket coach used to say, and stops it from going past.
clears long-on. Another knuckle ball outside off, Watson looks to muscle that over midwicket but he can only splice it. Such is the power of Watson that it clears the fielder easily.
good length on middle and leg, a wristy flick to deep square leg, on the bounce.
a nice slower ball on middle, a knuckle ball. Chipped to long-on for a run. Should have been two there.
a wide googly outside off, turning in. Pushed to cover.
the flat legbreak, worked to midwicket

short_text: Rashid Khan to Watson, 1 leg bye
long_text: 92 kph, the googly on middle and leg. Watson misses a flick, going down? A muted appeal is rejected.
a googly down leg, worked down to short fine leg for a quick single
the wide legbreak outside off, drilled down to long-off for one

short_text: Rashid Khan to Watson, no run
long_text: the legbreak to start outside off, punched back to the bowler
that's rubbish. Short and waaay down leg, flicked away down to the fine leg boundary again. Almost went for six. His lines were awful. 16 off that.
good length on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
poor bowling. Drops short down leg, pulled down to the fine leg boundary. The fielder is far too square, which means that's a terrible delivery.

lands safe! Full outside off, Watson wants to hit straight, his preferred hitting range against seam. But the ball skews over point. Rashid runs in from sweeper cover and can only collect on the bounce
it's Watson's bread and butter. On the pads and Kaul just nonchalantly flicks that over square leg. That's just a flick, people. Wow.
full outside off, driven to long-on with a wristy whip. Some pressure on CSK.
back of a length outside off, pushed to Hooda at point.

a slower ball down leg, Watson misses a slog. Raina steals a leg bye, but Sandeep kicks the ball onto the stumps. Raina's full-length dive saves him. That's the commitment you want to see in an IPL final
130 kph, too straight and Watson smashes it right back. Full and in the arc. Watson can't quite get underneath it but can get enough power. Thwack past mid-off
catch that Rashid, says Watson. Full and straight, it's like Watson was waiting for that. Not even that short but he heaves it away, T20 style over midwicket. Way into the stands.
a slower ball outside off, 113 kph, sliced to point. A diving save again

picks that length, rocks back and pulls on the bounce to deep midwicket. Rashid "can do anything" Khan just plucks the ball with one hand. And says so what? Watson lets out an expletive. Can't quite say what was here.
the knuckle ball goes wrong. Full and waaaay down leg
full on off and middle, worked to deep midwicket. 3-1-9-0 for Bhuvi. He'll be back later.
flicked away uppishly to deep square leg for a run.
131 kph, good length on off, blocked back. This has been special from  Bhuvneshwar. Interesting move from KW to keep him going too.
on a length outside off, 139 kph, inside-edged into the pad. Raina wants one. Watson says he can't make it.
drifts down leg, worked to square leg for a run. Now 6 off 14
full and straight, worked down to backward square leg

beautiful bowling. Watson's pressure results in the wicket of du Plessis. He charges down, but it's the slower knuckle ball. Faf does not pick that. As a result, he goes through with the lofted drive and the ball goes straight up instead of far back. Sandeep says I got this to his team-mates. He's got it.
slogged away with bad timing to deep midwicket. Full and straight, heaved away
back to normalcy. Back of a length outside off, guided to backward point. Hooda doesn't throw this time.
131 kph, smashed for four. Overpitched around off, and drilled past the bowler. Can't bowl that length
that's closer! But still sliding. A knuckle ball down leg, Watson looks to slog sweep but misses. Struck on the pad, but going down. 0 off 10

short_text: Sandeep to du Plessis, 1 leg bye
long_text: a slower ball down leg, off the pad towards backward point. A big appeal as the ball misses bat and strikes pad, but not out.
good length outside off, 140 kph. Another slapped punch to point. Watson is 0 off 9

breaks that streak! And it's five. Bhuvneshwar has the right to be seething. Good length outside off, dabbed to backward point for a run. Hooda runs in and throws unnecessarily at the batsman's end. No back-up. FIVE.

short_text: Bhuvneshwar to du Plessis, no run
long_text: make that 10! Back of a length outside off, 119 kph, pushed to cover

short_text: Bhuvneshwar to du Plessis, no run
long_text: awesome bowling. Some nervous cheers from the crowd. Good length and straight, defended back. NINE DOTS.

short_text: Bhuvneshwar to du Plessis, no run
long_text: back of a length on middle and leg, 129 kph, pushed back to the bowler. SOOO many dots to begin.

short_text: Bhuvneshwar to du Plessis, no run
long_text: good length outside off, away movement. Guided to point
full and straight, 126 kph. Another push to mid-on. Watson is now 0 off 8
full and straight, 129 kph. Excellent delivery because it keeps the pressure on Watson. Defended
full and straight, wobbly through the air, pushed to mid-off for a single.

short_text: Sandeep to du Plessis, no run
long_text: full outside off, 129 kph, a leaden-footed drive to cover

short_text: Sandeep to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: that's width and CSK's first runs of the chase. Back of a length and a tad wide, carved away through cover. A slapped carve

short_text: Sandeep to du Plessis, no run
long_text: a gentle loosener to stand. Full and swinging back in, defended by Faf
maiden to start! Second of the match! Another beauty, back of a length, pitches and deviates away to leave Watson hanging.
short and wide outside off, slashed away to backward point. Five dots. Pressure on Watson.
good stop. 133 kph, full and wide outside off. Dabbed towards backward point. Hooda runs to his left and stops a run with a dive.
well bowled. Back of a length outside off, the ball comes back in this time. That's Bhuvi's strength. Defended awkwardly.
full and wide outside off, more away movement. Left alone
beauty to start! Back of a length outside off, the ball pitches and moves away like a snake. Beats the bat.

Holes out but Sunrisers finish on 178 for 6. Short outside off again, and he tries to pull it towards the leg side. off the bat's toe end, and caught easily by Rayudu. Who's got the momentum at the break?

flat-batted over long on! He's not even hit it well, but Brathwaite's so powerful that the ball soars over Rayudu. It was short, and Brathwaite clearly hadn't timed it well, but hey, welcome to T20 cricket
slower ball on the fourth-stump line, and Brathwaite misses! Gold dust. Brathwaite swings blindly towards the leg side, but he's through with his shot way too early
low full toss on off stump, and that's been mistimed to long off. Was in his arc, but just couldn't get his bat under the delivery

back of a length outside off, and Yusuf tries to pull it square. It comes off the bat's toe end, so the delivery goes nowhere. Brathwaite, however, wants to steal a run, but Yusuf's not interested. Shardul chooses not to have an aim at the stumps
that's all over the place! Short on middle, and angling down the leg side. Signs of frustration on Dhoni's face
low full toss on leg stump, and that's been nudged to deep midwicket. Brathwaite pushes his partner to return for the second

finally connects, and that's a biggie! Loopy delivery wide outside off, and Brathwaite waits for this delivery. Gets his front leg out of the way, and then smashes it over Rayudu at long on. A good way for SRH to end the over
swing and a miss! It's the slower ball, but he drops the length short. Brathwaite attempts a leg-side slog, but he's through his shot way too early
tries to be cheeky, but that doesn't come off! Length ball on off, and Brathwaite walks inside the delivery's line to paddle it over short fine leg. Can't connect at all though
back of a length on off, and Yusuf's cramped for space. All he can do is punch it towards short cover for a single
in the air for a long time once again, but lands safe! Full on middle stump, and Brathwaite's leg-side slog comes off the bat's toe end. It falls just in front of long on

first strike! Back of a length on middle, and angling into Ricky. He tries to drive it straight over Ngidi, but plays it down the wrong line. The ball goes over the top of leg stump and through to Dhoni
ends his spell with the offcutter, but Yusuf flat-bats it over the umpire for four! Rayudu at long on tries his best to cut it off, but he's just a bit too slow. Dhoni's not pleased

short on off, and Brathwaite mistimes his pull. It's in the air for ages, but the ball lands between deep midwicket and long on. Bravo's not happy. I think he had started celebrating as soon as the ball went in the air
length ball outside off, and Yusuf slaps it to point. They need to hurry for the single, but the fielder chooses not to throw at the stumps
deft, but well stopped by backward point. It was a yorker on off, and Brathwaite did well to steer it behind square. Good effort inside the circle
full outside off, and that's been walloped! In Brathwaite's arc, and he smashes it over Bravo's head
brilliant yorker on leg stump, but oh that's cruel! It goes down the leg side as Brathwaite skips his toes out of the way. Wide called by umpire Erasmus
full on off, and that's been driven past the bowler's left. Man at long off though
slower ball, but going down the leg side. The batsman did move towards the off side, but Bravo was just a bit too wide
full outside off, and he tries to slog it towards midwicket. He's through his shot too early and the shot's been dragged to deep square leg. Deceived completely by the (lack of) pace. Taken by Shorey
length ball on of, and angling into the batsman. Turned off his pads to square leg and gets Hooda back on strike
muscled over long on! Sheer power. Back of a length outside off, and Yusuf simple pulls it over the non-striker's head. Stand-and-deliver stuff
short outside off, and he attempts to steer it fine. Plays it fine, but can't beat Bravo at third man
full outside off, and he tries to drive it over cover. Comes off the bat's outside edge, and flies down to third man
chipped over midwicket! Lands safe. It was a short-ish ball on off, and the batsman was rather surprised. Checks his leg-side clip, and eventually lifts it towards the leg side
full on leg stump, and that's been whipped off his pads to deep backward square. Off the mark

full toss outside off, and that's been struck straight to Raina at cover! Bravo's going to feel very lucky. Shakib did hit it well, but Raina's a beast in the field. Time out as Hooda makes his way out
offcutter outside off, and Yusuf punches it to the vacant short cover region. He calls nice and early for the single
lands on middle, and Shakib wants to send this to deep midwicket. Slogs hard at it, but mistimes it to the sweeper on the leg side
full on off, and angling into his pads. Yusuf loses his balance as he tries to clip it off his pads. Mistimed to square leg this time
short and wide outside off, but Yusuf stands tall, rides the bounce, and then cuts it in front of cover! Slapped with disdain

sliding defense from Shakib! Full on off, and he came down the ground to drive at it. Checks his shot at the last moment, but his feet go sliding. Looked rather uncomfortable. Hope he hasn't overstretched his hamstring

width offered outside off, and that's been comfortably cut to deep point. They jog back for the second run. Bad throw from the deep, so the batsmen contemplate taking a third, but eventually choose not to
big heave, but Shakib misses it completely! Flighted outside leg, and it's the topspinner this time
full on leg stump, and Yusuf whips it down the ground to wide long-on
wide outside off again, but this time Yusuf's done waiting. Big stride forward, and then extends his arms to lift it over extra cover! Ridiculous
full outside off, and turning further away. Yusuf checks his shot thinking it'll be a wide, but the umpire says that's fine
short, but Yusuf manages to pull this over midwicket. Comfortably played infact, and he'll keep the strike
slashed away to third man this time. Length ball on middle, and Shakib attempted that cut once again. Came off the bat's thick edge
slower ball, and pitching on middle. Tapped off the back foot past the non-striker to long on for a walking single
wide outside off, and that's been slapped past point! Deep point huffs and puffs, but has no chance in cutting it off. Allows Yusuf to free his arms, and the big man doesn't disappoint
back of a length on middle, and Shakib chops this cut to third man. It was too close to his body for that shot to be played perfectly
full outside off, and he drives this straight over the umpire. Hit well, but too well. That means it's only a single as long on cuts it off
full on middle, and turning away from Yusuf. He taps it off the front foot towards short cover and calls for a quick single
tries the cut, but it's too full for it. Was wide outside off, but Yusuf can't connect
short on middle, but spinning across Yusuf's body. He pulls it - along the ground - to the region near deep midwicket. Big strides allow him to come back for the second
steered past first slip! Nice effort by Ngidi in the deep, but he just failed to parry it back. It was a length ball outside off, and Yusuf used Karn's pace to place it well
length ball outside off, and zipping straight through. Pathan rocks back, and cuts this from very close to his body

legspinner's dream ball! Sweeeet. Full, but wide outside off, and KW couldn't pick the line. He came shimmying down the wicket trying to play it big, but the ball drifts away from the batsman, lands near the tramlines, and then Dhoni does the rest. A rare pre-meditated shot attempted by Williamson
good length on off, and KW taps it off the back foot. Plays it past Shakib's left to long on, and he calls early for the run
slipped? Full toss on middle, but not of the pace that would worry the batsman. Nudged off his pads to the vacant midwicket region for a single
full outside off, and Williamson connects with the drive once again. But Faf's on the 30-yard circle, prepared for that very shot
slower ball outside off, but way too slow. KW goes deep into his crease, winds up big, and then smashes this pull through the midwicket region
full on off, and that's been creamed! Gets his front leg out of the way, and drives it beautifully. Finds the gap between deep point and extra cover
length ball on off, and angling into his body. Tucks it towards midwicket off the back foot
full outside off again, and Shakib goes for the leg-side slog once again. Not timed as well, but still has behind this shot to send it to the wide long-on boundary. Seventeen off the over
massive! Is this Shakib's night? Tossed up outside off, and Shakib's quick to get down on one knee, and thumps it over cow corner. Uff
quicker ball on leg stump and going down leg. KW tries to sweep, but changes his shot late. Hits his front leg, but impact outside leg

drops just short of gully! And the ball then goes through for a boundary. Heart-in-mouth stuff. Flights it just a bit extra this time, and KW tries to drive. Comes off the bat's outside half, and slices it to the off side
good length on off stump, and he smothers it with the turn. Played off his pads to square leg
full on leg stump, and defended towards cover point with the bat's open face
full and straight, flicked away towards long-on. Jadeja prevents two. 4-0-25-0, very tidy.
a short and wide delivery outside off, Williamson misses an attempted upper cut.
good length on off, worked to square leg, 133 kph
good length outside off, comes back in with that around-the-wicket angle. Chopped to Bravo at backward point.
a slower ball down leg, worked to deep midwicket, 109 kph
short outside off, pulled to midwicket. Mostly toe-ended.
flat and straight, worked to square leg for one
shortish and wide again, cut to the deep point fielder
excellently played. Short and wide, spinning in. Shakib cuts towards short third man. Watson labours down, in slow motion, to his left. Allows the ball to go through

the wild slog and Jadeja strikes! Flat and straight, as anticipated, Dhawan looks to slog sweep that over midwicket but he doesn't make contact. The ball beats the slog, clips the thigh pad and then knocks into the stumps. That'll slow Sunrisers down. Again, the first over after a time-out.
some flight on middle, Williamson makes room and chips the ball to long-off for one
slow outside off, pushed to long-on for one.
that's filth from Bravo. A slower ball down leg, a full toss as well. Williamson just swivels on a sweep and clears short fine leg. The catch is taken, but by a ballboy outside the boundary.
picks the slower ball outside off, full and wide. Williamson gets underneath the length and lofts the ball cleanly over cover for four.
a very slow slower ball on off, pushed in front of point for one

short_text: Bravo to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: 132 kph, another good delivery. Using the bouncer well this time, short and down leg. Dhawan looks to pull,  but misses. Bravo and Dhoni appeal, Bravo more vociferously. No glove.

short_text: Bravo to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: excellent bowling. The wide yorker outside off, the ball creeps under Dhawan's shot.

short_text: Bravo to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: a slower ball outside off, drilled to cover
looked for six, didn't get it. Some flight on middle and leg, swivel-heaved away to long-on

short_text: Karn to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: slog-swept into the gap at square leg. Some flight but the line isn't great. Heaved away to deep square leg, finds the gap

short_text: Karn to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: the googly, lots of flight on that. Driven back to the bowler
strays down leg, wide.
83 kph, misfield from Raina. Full outside off, KW comes down and pushes to Raina's left. He lets the ball through, slightly hurried by the pace of the ball
short and wide outside off, cut away to backward point for a run. A good start from Karn
flat and straight, worked away to wide long-on, but for one. Faf is too quick.
well played, well bowled. Short and wide, a dab to third man for a run
much much better. Good length on off, but because he's got all those runs, this is a good result for Sunrisers. Tip and run to cover
too straight this time, down leg and flicked away nonchalantly through square leg for two. Good stop by Karn, running to his right from fine leg.

short_text: Thakur to S Dhawan, SIX runs
long_text: in the slot and outta here! Full and straight, Dhawan sees that early and whacks the ball easily over long-on. That's not a bad line, but awful length with a batsman under pressure.

short_text: Thakur to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: nicely driven but finds Jadeja at cover. Full and wide, driven elegantly
another typical single from KW. 135 kph, full on off, tapped with soft hands into the off side. That's such an important T20 stroke, converts a good ball into a single.
starts with a wide down leg.
charges down but gets a slower ball outside off, chopped to mid-off
smashed on the midriff! Back of a length on middle and leg, Williamson misses a pull, and winces almost as the ball makes contact with his body
thinks of carving the ball over the keeper, but withdraws from the shot late and wisely. A bouncer is way over the head of Williamson.
that's tripe. What was that? 114 kph, a slower ball, that's okay. But it's short too. Williamson waits and waits and pulls through square leg.
good length outside off, dabbed towards cover for nothing
the top-edged pull waaaay over fine leg. Short on middle and leg, Williamson looks to pull, but gets a thick leading edge which flies over the fielder.
now comes the ugly slog. Good length on middle and leg, a wild swing from Dhawan. Inside-edged into the pad for one.
maiden over! In the fourth over! That's a very unusual result for Williamson and T20s, at this point of an innings. An overpitched delivery is caressed to cover for nothing.
142 kph. Now five dots! Back of a length and wider outside off, Williamson now goes cutting but misses. Pressure now on KW and Sunrisers.
139 kph, excellent bowling. Now using the width of the crease, goes wider, full and moving back in. Pushed to mid-on for nothing.
THREE DOTS! Full again outside off, pushed to cover. Not exactly the T20 way, to bat so cautiously in the Powerplay.
full outside off, no swing. Skewed away off the outside half to point. Two dots.
full on off, Williamson has shuffled across so far, like he usually does in white-ball cricket. Pushed to mid-on

short_text: Chahar to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: 126 kph, just about medium pace but it's very tight. Back of a length on off, pushed back.
fuller than a good length outside off. Some swing. But it's very well played, soft hands, a dab to point for one
shortish, but on leg. Worked down to fine leg for a run

short_text: Chahar to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: nicely bowled. Full and swinging in, worked to midwicket. Absolutely no room for Dhawan. Surely a plan?
lovely shot. Backward point takes some pace off the ball by getting a hand on it. Short and wide, slashed towards backward point's left. Third man cleans up.
too short! Back of a length outside off, Williamson drags a pull to midwicket
full on middle and leg, pushed to mid-on for a tight, but well-judged single.

that same line and length. And a terribly-judged second from Goswami! CSK's first wicket. Worked away towards backward square leg. Fine leg gets across quickly, he's holding the ball by the time Goswami turns around. Dhawan looks at his partner mid-way through and knows that's an iffy call, but trusts his partner. Maybe, he shouldn't have. Dhoni takes off the bails with Goswami well short.
full on leg, 143 kph. Beaten for pace again. Struck on the pad, the ball then ricochets away for one towards point.

short_text: Ngidi to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: 142 kph. A LEAVE! I saw that earlier today at Lord's, didn't think I would tonight. Back of a length outside off, Dhawan lets that go.

short_text: Ngidi to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: that's wayward. Back of a length down leg, nudged down towards fine leg for two. Karn gets across to his left and cuts the ball off, but was his back leg touching the boundary? Looks like that. Yep, that's four. Good call.
some pace? 137 kph, back of a length down leg, hurries Goswami. A thick inside edge onto the thigh and then towards point.

short_text: Chahar to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: good length outside off, 134 kph, carved to backward point. Decent comeback from Chahar.
shortish and wide, a bit of width. Cut down to third man for a single.
back of a length outside off, moving away. Tapped to backward point for a good single. The kind of single Dhawan likes to take with Rohit for India.

short_text: Chahar to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: good length delivery outside off, punched away to backward point
back of a length down leg, some swing yes. Worked away down to fine leg for a run.
swings in from around the wicket, full and straight. Smashed to long-on, on the bounce!
no-ball first up! That's nerves, that's jitters. The ball slips out, a high full toss outside off is over the waist. Carved to third man. Dhoni thinks it's below the waist.
drilled down to long-off, but it doesn't matter.  SRH have arrested a four-match losing streak  and will play Chennai Super Kings in Sunday's final.  KKR's campaign has come to a shuddering halt
walks across to paddle fine, but misses. It's all but over now.
right into the blockhole outside off, dug back. He goes for the catch but he took it on the bounce.

he's picked out Rashid at deep midwicket! Oh, dear. Surely that's the end of KKR's hopes? This was hit well, but he got more elevation than distance. Swirling in the air, Rashid came in from the ropes and then took it well with his palms facing upwards. Brathwaite's decision of going around the stumps to cramp the batsmen for room has worked so far. Is that the final nail in KKR's coffin?

he's whipped this straight to Rashid at deep midwicket. Wasn't far from clearing the ropes, right intent. Just the execution was a little off. Mavi backed away, got under the delivery and hit it well. Rashid was on the move to his left, kept his composure and took this. The crucial thing from KKR's point of view is Shubman Gill will be on strike.

short_text: Brathwaite to Shivam Mavi, FOUR runs
long_text: sliced over backward point, one bounce into the ropes. Poor from Carlos, bowls too full and straight. Enough pace for Mavi to work with
he's cleared the ropes! Uses the depth of the crease to get under the length and belt this over wide long-off. This is magnificent. The match is alive.
lofted over the infield, but Williamson, running back from cover, can't get there. They scamper back for the second
carved to sweeper cover, SRH won't mind the singles.
walks across and whips this full toss on the bounce to deep midwicket
another ripper of a yorker, squeezed to cover but they chance a run. Williamson misses a direct hit at the striker's end. Gill would've been walking back had that hit. Had three stumps to aim at

the off stump has been flattened! Chawla went to wallop this over long-off, swung through early, missed it and heard the death rattle. Cross-seam delivery this from Kaul, landed just a touch ahead of length. Chawla didn't get anywhere close to that. KKR right on the edge.
belted back, Bhuvi gets a hand, but it will be cruel to call that a chance!  Deflects this to the boundary. So hard was that hit by Gill. Much-needed for KKR.
paddled but can't beat the fine leg fielder.
angles this full delivery into the base of leg stump to cramp Gill, who works this to deep midwicket
third yorker in a row, Chawla toe-ends this back towards the bowler, Bhuvi can't stop it cleanly on his followthrough, parries this to mid-off
superb yorker-length ball, looks to muscle this over long-on, but can't get underneath the length, down to the fielder for a single
right into the blockhole, Chawla squeezes this towards backward point as they scamper a run
can't get hold of a juicy full toss, mistimes this to deep midwicket
another superb yorker that tailed in late towards middle, squeezed to sweeper cover
yorker-length on off, squeezed to Williamson at cover
hit back past Kaul but there's no timing, they'll scamper a single
looks to arch back and help this over the keeper to third man, misses.
whips this full delivery on the pads to deep midwicket

he's hit this into his hometown Moradabad! Remember the shot! Full and angling in full, Chawla had decided he'll heave this come hell or high water, got enough bat on it. Wild hit, way over deep midwicket.
slips this full delivery way down leg, good take by Saha. Wide called and rightly so
slower length ball on middle, punched to Dhawan at deep cover
slapped away to the cover boundary! Angles this in from around the stumps, Gill makes room and punches this past a diving Williamson
steers this gently towards third man to get off the mark off his fourth delivery
angles back in from wide of the crease to skid in and hit Chawla on the pads as he looks to work this to the leg side
slices this down to square third man, good work by Kaul. A sliding stop

short_text: Rashid Khan to Chawla, no run
long_text: defends this length ball on middle with soft hands

short_text: Rashid Khan to Chawla, no run
long_text: sharp turn, comes back in to beat the inside edge and hit him on the pad

they've prised him out with the googly! Big, big wicket. He's off on a victory lap. Dhawan at a wide slip takes a smart catch. This is a googly that comes back in from length outside off, he goes for a hard cut shot but gets a thick outside edge. Dhawan's reflexes simply superb.

short_text: Rashid Khan to Russell, no run
long_text: fizzing legbreak that he lands at length, defended from the crease.

short_text: Rashid Khan to Russell, no run
long_text: dabs this gently into the off side, towards short third man
crunching cover drive to the sweeper

did that take the edge? Yes! Russell played down the wrong line, the ball drifted in, he played outside the line. Lobbed off the pad as Saha fluffed it as he went for the catch.  Tough chance, big inside edge onto pad
punched to midwicket where there's a misfield by a diving Dhawan, some hesitation as well but they complete the run
cut away very nicely, into the gap between backward point and short third man. Couple for Gill
turns this indrifter into the leg side, Shakib runs across to stop that
deceived in flight,  just manages to chip this over Shakib.  That would've sent a few shivers down the KKR dugout
punches this through the line to sweeper cover
works this with the spin to deep midwicket. Picked the googly nicely there, did Gill
right to the pitch of the ball as he eases the drive to deep point
punched down to long on as he jogs the single
dabs this googly into the leg side to get off the mark

goes for another sweep, this time the umpire raises the finger. Rashid sets off on a victory lap! Huge moment in the match. Shapes to sweep, this is a length ball that spins back in to beat the sweep and hit him in front of middle and leg.

short_text: Rashid Khan to Lynn, no run
long_text: fifth successive sweep  he's played off Rashid. Not controlled, on the bounce to square leg

there's the key wicket  and he can't remain unbeaten tonight, though. This is superb from Shakib. Gets the ball to drift back in a long way from around the stumps, skid through to cramp Karthik for room as he shaped to cut. This didn't turn and took the underedge onto the stumps.
punched on the up past Shakib, to long-off
chipped, but lands short of Williamson at cover.
steps out and works this with the angle towards deep midwicket
drifting into middle and leg, squeezes this flick towards deep midwicket
rocks back and cuts hard to deep point
another short ball, this skidded through, doesn't get hold of the pull, down to deep midwcket

short_text: Rashid Khan to Karthik, FOUR runs
long_text: picks the length early, rocks back to open up the leg side and hammers this to bisect deep midwicket and long-on. Super stroke.  Half-tracker, a very rare one from Rashid
swept with the spin this time, much finer to Kaul at fine leg

short_text: Rashid Khan to Lynn, FOUR runs
long_text: ferocious sweep, beats square leg. Fetched this from length outside off and picked the bones out of that. Controlled it very nicely
googly that spins back in sharply, Karthik gets a thick inside edge towards backward square. Don't think he picked it

Oh, Uthappa! What have you done? Why would you want to reverse sweep the opposition's best bowler who can turn it a mile? Played too early, the ball drifted into middle and leg and flattened the leg stump.
back of a length and outside off, slower ball, Lynn jabs at it early and sends a thick outside edge between backward point and short third man. If ever, you needed proof this game is KKR's
realising slip has been pulled out now, Uthappa opens the face and secures a single down to third man
back of a length and outside off, punched to covers off the front foot
on a length and wider outside off, Uthappa stabs at it but the outside edge does not carry to Dhawan at wide slip
on a length and outside off, Uthappa lets the ball slide off the face to point
just short of a good length and angling in from over the wicket, punched back to the right of Bhuvneshwar
tossed on off, Lynn gets forward and pushes to mid-off
arrowed into the pads, whipped off the back foot through midwicket
full and slides in from round the wicket, defended to the leg side off the back foot

worked off the pads through midwicket. Rashid runs in from the deep, gathers the ball cleanly, and throws it to keeper. Saha does the rest. Rana chances a second. He slips after completing the first, still goes for the second, dishes out a desperate dive, but is caught short. The second wasn't on after the tumble. Fine throw from Rashid
pushed through on middle, Rana rolls out the reverse-sweep and hits it between backward point and short third man for four
full and drifts in on off, eased down to long-off
thigh-high short ball outside off, swatted across the line to deep midwicket
wide of the crease, full and holds its line outside off, Lynn has a crack at it and scythes it for a one-bounce four to the cover boundary
slower ball wide outside off, away from the reach of Lynn, he swings and misses
short and wide, Lynn throws his bat at ball and carves it up and over short third man

back of a length on middle, tip and run to short midwicket, where Williamson swoops down the ball. There's a mix-up between the wickets but Williamson can't throw the stumps down at the bowler's end. Run-out chance missed
back of a length on off, dabbed to the right of backward point
tossed up outside off, driven in the air but past the outstretched right hand of Rashid

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rana, no run
long_text: back of a length and outside off, chopped into the ground and the ball goes to backward point

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rana, no run
long_text: quick fizzer from Rashid, he beats Rana for pace and hits the pad but this might have been heading down the leg side

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rana, no run
long_text: googly, zips away outside off, keeps low and beats Rana
full on off, Lynn rolls out another sweep, this is hit along the ground to long leg

short_text: Rashid Khan to Lynn, no run
long_text: Rashid belts out an appeal for leg before. Umpire Nitin Menon calls it not out. Rashid chats with Saha and asks for a review. Pushed through on middle, skids off the pitch, and looks like Lynn has tickled the ball with the glove as he shapes to sweep. Ultra Edge detects a spike
full-toss on middle, 140ks, backs away and splices it to the left of a diving Brathwaite at mid-off
just short of a good length on off, Lynn clears his front leg and swipes only as far as mid-on
back of a length and attacking the stumps, punched wide of Khaleel at midwicket
back of a length on off, punched back to the bowler
slower full ball on off, hacked off the inside half through the gap at midwicket
length ball on off stump, 139ks, Lynn clears his front leg and plants Kaul into the stands beyond long-off. Powerful swing of the arms
bouncer outside off, Rana now ducks under this
Top-edged for a six over fine leg. 140.6ks, short ball, rushes Rana into a hook. He skies it over the fielder for another six
short and angling in at off, Rana hops and fends it off to cover
clears big Carlos at deep third man. Banged in short and outside off, Rana upper-cuts it and sends the ball beyond the boundary for six
full on middle, defensively pushed to mid-on
back of a length and angling in from over the wicket, played back to the bowler
back of a length and outside off, punched through the line to cover
short on the hips, clipped away to long leg
dug in short on leg stump, fended off to short fine leg for one
horrid ball, fine leg inside the circle, full-toss on leg stump, glanced away fine of short fine leg

Narine holes out to Brathwaite at mid-on. 113.4ks, slower knuckle ball on the leg stump, Narine attempts a loft but can only toe-end it in the air to Brathwaite inside the circle. Narine has done his job, though
dipping full-toss, swings away late, Narine toe-ends it in the air to the left of Shakib at cover
back of a length and attacking middle stump, Lynn quietly defends it back to the bowler
tucked off the hips through square leg for one
Make that four boundaries in a row. Knuckle ball, but the length is shortish. Narine reads the change-up. Clears his front leg and hoists it over the bowler's head
back of a length on the hips, 142.1ks, Narine clears his front leg again, this time he drags it away square of short fine leg for a hat-trick of boundaries
Bhuvneshwar errs too full and outside off, Narine gets under the length of this slower ball and carts it over mid-off inside the circle
full-toss angling away outside off, Narine now clears his front leg and crunches it to the left of covers for four
Smashed flat and hard for six. Length ball, angling away from Lynn, he backs away outside leg, fetches it from outside off and smears it over the covers
short at Narine's arm pit, 144.6ks, cramps the batsman for room, flapped away to square leg
lifter on middle, 144.3ks, Narine sways his upper body out of the way. That's the length to Narine, Khaleel
really full on off, 144.6ks, Lynn clears his front leg and hammers it wide of mid-off. Brathwaite throws himself to his left to stop the ball
back of a length on the pads, 143.5ks, tucked away to deep midwicket
really full and sliding down leg, 143.6ks, picked off fine on the leg side past the right of the keeper
slower one, 113.6ks, knuckle ball? Pitches outside leg and grazes the thigh pad of Narine and he sneaks in a leg bye
low full-toss outside off, scooped to backward point
keeps it on a back of a length, curls back in and finishes on off, punched back down the pitch
back of a length and more width outside off, Lynn throws his hands at the ball again and connects well this time. Scythed up and over point for four
back of a length and swings back in from outside off, Lynn throws his bat at ball and only collects fresh air
back of a length - the perfect length on this pitch - ducks back in on top of off, punched up to the covers

short_text: Prasidh to Rashid Khan, SIX runs
long_text: slower delivery, he fetches this from way outside off and muscles this over long-on. Is this a game-changing knock? Stunning hitting. Once again Prasidh lost his length, bowled too full. Rashid was expecting it as he waited, waited, waited and then clobbered it away.
has he clobbered this or what? Not much timing but plonks between the man running in from square leg and the boundary rider. They're back for the second.
full but far too wide outside off, pressure getting to Prasidh

short_text: Prasidh to Rashid Khan, SIX runs
long_text: remember that stroke! So reminiscent of that flick Carlos hit to win the World T20! Full and sliding in, Rashid takes a step outside off and brings his powerful wrists to flick this over deep backward square leg. Sensational. Used the depth of the crease superbly

short_text: Prasidh to Rashid Khan, FOUR runs
long_text: slower and fuller on middle, he holds his shape and then lofts this cleanly over the bowler's head. Long-off was in so all he needed to do was loft this over the infield
full and angling into middle and leg, whipped to deep midwicket
backs away and uses the width to slice this over backward point, clever from Bhuvi

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Rashid Khan, SIX runs
long_text: carved deep into the stands at deep cover. Chawla can only watch this sail over! Mavi went full and wide, Rashid was down on one knee as he reached out and then hammered that away

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Rashid Khan, no run
long_text: backs away and looks to eases this slower length ball over point, beaten.

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Rashid Khan, no run
long_text: drills this straight to the man at the edge of the ring at cover.

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Rashid Khan, SIX runs
long_text: bursts through Chawla's hands at deep point for six!  Steps out and slaps this length ball, would've been straight down his throat had he stayed right at the ropes. May have come in a little too much

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Rashid Khan, no run
long_text: beaten for pace! 142.4kph. Short of length outside off, Rashid looks to punch on the up but is beaten

gets more elevation than distance, Piyush Chawla running in from sweeper cover takes an excellent catch! Yusuf looked to go over long-off, sliced it. That said the ball was swirling, curved away late even as Chawla misjudged it as it descended. Somehow managed to stay low and complete it despite this being away from his body.

short_text: Prasidh to Rashid Khan, FOUR runs
long_text: thick outside edge that beats a leaping DK. Looked to hoick this across the line

stunning effort in the deep by Nitish Rana! This is yorker-length outside off, Carlos carves this with an opened bat face towards square third man, where he covers at least 20 yards around the ropes before diving. Recovers quickly and then throws right on the bounce to DK who whips the bails off to beat a diving Carlos.
flirts with the wide line. Saw the batsman backing away and bowled this wide. Easy call for Nitin Menon
misses a yorker, turns this into juicy full toss on middle and he muscles this over wide long-on. Too easy
right into the blockhole, base of middle stump, Carlos manages to dig this out
No power on the pull. Slower length ball which Yusuf drags from outside off to deep square on the bounce.
full and wide outside off, laced to sweeper cover
skids one at length outside off, Yusuf lunges forward and leaves alone
the reverse sweep, but there's no timing because of the length. Straight to point. The bounced more than Hooda would've liked. First wicket for Narine on the night.
goes for a mow, played too early and missed. Hit high on the right thigh.
leading edge but safe. Rolls between cover and point for a quick single.
full ball that drifts in to hit the pad as he looks to work this gently into the leg side
punched to sweeper cover
prods forward tentatively but had no clue about that googly, whizzes past the outside edge.
quicker one at length and angling away, punched to long off
hits this full toss down to long on to get off the mark
full and flat outside off, hit hard to long off
clean strike down the ground! Tossed up, he gets right to the pitch and belts this over the sightscreen.

Backing up too far and Shakib's gone!  Full on middle, this has been drilled back straight. This flicks Kuldeep's fingers along the way and smashes into the stumps even as Shakib is nowhere near the crease at the non-striker's end. This is a big, big moment in the game.
dabs this gently to short third man for a quick single.
floated outside off as Hooda advances, he reaches out and slices this over the infield, Uthappa was circling below the ball and allowed it to bounce before he took it at deep cover.
backs away and then slaps this short delivery on middle and leg to sweeper cover.
backs away, gets underneath the flight and plays this slog sweep all along the ground to beat wide long-on.
short and wide outside off, he reaches out and then slaps this to the deep point fence. No chance for the sweeper.
steps out and eases this length delivery down to long-on
another googly, this time it drifts away, Hooda steps out and then offers his bat with the pad tucked behind.
steps out but Kuldeep lands this wrong'un at length and gets it to bounce, he lunges further and smothers that
drags this short ball straight to deep midwicket. No timing
flatter and fuller on leg stump, he steps out and eases it to long-on
steps out and eases this down to long-on
driven with the spin to long off
looks to turn this behind square, gets it high on the bat, DK runs to his right to stop that.
hammered back on the bounce, good stop off his own bowling
turns this googly towards midwicket, Chawla runs quickly to his left to prevent a single
backs away to cut again, beaten. Wasn't far from the off stump.
backs away and gets underneath the flight to drill this, beats wide long-off. Gave all his might. Just a little bit of width that time from Chawla, punished.
steps out to drive but the ball drifts in and rolls back down to long-on off a thick inside edge
Once again looking to back away, only to see the bowler cleverly alter his line. Skids back in to hit him on the pad, but Shakib was miles outside leg.
rocks back and pulls this straight to Chawla at deep square leg
hit on the back pad by a knuckleball that spins away off length. Played down the wrong line
slaps this short delivery to Dre Russ who hares across to stop this cleanly at sweeper cover
steps out and works this full delivery towards midwicket
lands this length ball outside off, Shakib makes room but is cramped so he bunts this towards midwicket
spins away from length on off, punched to deep cover
chops this into the off side as he shaped to cut, cramped for room
struck on the pad, but impact outside off. This was another googly, beat his prod and deflected towards shirt third man. Impact outside off as well.

this is sensational from DK, not so much for the effort but for the alertness. This fizzing googly drifts in from length to hit Saha on the pad as he looks to defend, rolls to Karthik off the pad. By now, Saha is overbalanced and Karthik picks up the ball and breaks the bails even as Saha turns and looks to plonk the bat back in. The only reason why the third umpire was summoned perhaps was to check if the bails were broken by the gloves without the ball lodged in.
leading edge but safe, just eludes point. Shakib wanted to muscle this googly over deep midwicket
right int he slot, drilled to deep extra cover. Juicy from PC to his old KKR mate
tossed up slower and higher outside off, Saha stretches out for a sweep and nails it to the left of deep square leg for four
full on middle and leg, nudged through the vacant spaces at midwicket off the front foot
Shakib steps out, looks like a googly, Shakib somehow keeps it out
full and spins in, worked to leg
floated up on middle, Saha stretches out and paddles it fine of Narine at short fine leg. Narine simply escorts it to the boundary
another big appeal for lbw. Did that pitch outside the line of leg stump? Umpire Nitin Menon shoots down the appeal. DK calls for a review. Saha aims a sweep and smothers it with the bat
short and skids back in to hit Shakib on the mid-riff. He sneaks in a leg bye and another off a ricochet
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, punched through the line to short cover
full on the stumps, forward and bunted to midwicket
wide of the crease, short and slanting in towards the top of off, Saha hops and fends it towards point
overpitched and outside off, Saha leans into it and drives it crisply through the covers. Sweeper can't cut it off
back of a length and outside off, tucked around the corner
good length and spins away outside off, blocked off the back foot

Kuldeep has dismissed Dhawan and Williamson in the same over. He leaps for joy and celebrates. Williamson knows he has nicked off and walks off. Tossed up on off and breaks away outside off, Williamson does not read the googly, and tickles an edge behind to DK. Sharp catch from DK to his right
full and wide outside off, Williamson collapses his back knee and drives it through the covers
tossed on middle and turns away, googly? Saha now squirts a leading edge to point
lovely dip and turn for Kuldeep, Williamson does not meet the pitch and squirts a leading edge to the leg side

Kuldeep traps Dhawan lbw. He then collapses in his followthrough while appealing. Kuldeep loops it up on middle stump, straight ball, Dhawan misses it, looking to drag it away to the leg side with a sweep. He is pinned on the back thigh in line with middle. That's pretty adjacent and KKR find their first breakthrough
Chawla pushes this one wide of off, Dhawan drags a slog-sweep to deep midwicket

short_text: Chawla to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: dragged down outside off, Dhawan skips back and flat-bats it fiercely to the left of long-off
Chawla draws an appeal for leg before. Not given. Googly from Chawla, Saha attempts a sweep and ends up gloving it through backward square leg
floated up full on off, Dhawan stretches out and slog-sweeps to deep midwicket

short_text: Chawla to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: similar ball, too full on off, Dhawan clears his front leg and muscles a drive between Chawla and Saha now. No stopping that

short_text: Chawla to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: tossed on off, drilled straight back, Saha is in the firing line and cops a blow on the right leg
pushed through on off, 103.8ks, tip and run to the covers

short_text: Narine to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: back of a length, non-turner on leg stump, cramps the batsman for room and strikes the pad
skiddy offbreak, 101ks, finishes on off, nudged with the break to mid-on
slower through the air on leg stump, worked through square leg for one more
short on off stump, not much spin, Saha hangs back and forces a pull straight to deep midwicket. Should've smashed it to the fence
back of a length on middle, Dhawan sits back and whips a single to midwicket

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Saha, FOUR runs
long_text: where did that come from, Saha? 145.5ks outside off, but it's on a length. Saha clears his front leg and hoicks it over midwicket. Not middled, but Saha won't mind it. His strike-rate nudges past 100 now
banged in short and outside off, 138.7ks, Saha drags a pull through midwicket

short_text: Shivam Mavi to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: leg-stump full-toss, flicked away to deep square leg
back of a length and outside off, 108.1ks slower ball, Saha plays early and squirts it through the covers

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Saha, FOUR runs
long_text: back of a length and outside off, Saha plays away from the body and slices it away fine of deep third man. Saha uses the pace of Mavi to his advantage

short_text: Shivam Mavi to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: Dhawan rides the bounce of this 143ks short ball outside off and guides it to deep third man
lifter on middle, 141.4ks, Saha ducks under it. Saha: 6 off 12 balls
dug in short and outside off, pulled on the bounce to deep square leg

short_text: Russell to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: more and more width. Slower ball outside off, 123ks, sits up to be hit, Dhawan reads the change-up and threads the gap. Punched between backward point and the covers

short_text: Russell to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: more width. Overpitched and wide outside off, drilled to the covers off the front foot. He can't pierce the tightly packed off-side infield. Five men there

short_text: Russell to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: shorter and outside off, Dhawan lines it up and flat-bats it straight past the bowler and Saha for four. Width and that's Dhawan's release. Slip has been pulled out

short_text: Russell to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: back of a length and skids off the pitch, hits the thigh and lobs to slip, where Rana dives forward but can't catch the ball

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Saha, no run
long_text: back of a length on off stump, Saha brings his bat down in line in defence

short_text: Shivam Mavi to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: Dhawan forays down the track, Mavi attacks his ribs with a short ball, flapped to the leg side

DK calls for the skier but misjudges it and drops it. Mavi hits a hard length outside off, Saha pulls and sends a top-edge in the air. It soars to Mars. Then drops down. DK looks to settle under it and the ball swirls away from his reach. He can only finger-tip it away

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Saha, no run
long_text: good length, starts outside off, cuts back in, Saha has a big yahoo at it but only collects fresh air

short_text: Shivam Mavi to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: pretty full on middle stump, 144.1ks, pace like fire, jabbed behind square on the off side
Saha rides the bounce of this back of a length ball outside off, taps to Gill at backward point, and sets off for a risky single. Dhawan makes it in the end

short_text: Prasidh to S Dhawan, SIX runs
long_text: 140.4ks, but Prasidth sprays a full ball on the pads of Dhawan, feeds the opener's strengths. Dhawan simply picks it up and flicks it over the square leg boundary - the first of the night
slightly overpitched and outside off, Saha stretches out, gets close to the pitch and drives but Uthappa makes a tumbling save to his left at short extra cover
pitches outside leg and zips off the pitch to hit the thigh pad, Dhawan sneaks in a leg bye and finds some breathing space at the other end
re-set the radar, Prasidh. Back of a length and slanted down the leg side, away from the reach of the batsman's flick
wide of the crease, full and holds its line outside off, Saha is rooted to the crease as he drives and jams an inside edge past the leg stump
really full and outside off, Saha squeezes to short cover and threatens to run himself out but Dhawan sends him back. There simply wasn't a run there
he ventures wide of the crease, good length and holds its line outside off, no shot
prancing delivery, 142.7ks, jumps from a back of a length, jars the splice, and rolls away to the off side

short_text: Shivam Mavi to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: Dhawan ventures outside leg, Mavi bowls it on a back of a length outside off at 141ks, Dhawan jumps back in line with the stumps and jabs it away with an open face through the gap at point

short_text: Shivam Mavi to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: Mavi drags his length back and gets it to angle away in the corridor, Dhawan does not bite

short_text: Shivam Mavi to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: pitched further up and slanting away outside off, now Dhawan shoulders arms
short and skids back in off the pitch, cramps the batsman for room. He hops, skips, and gloves it in front of point for one

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Saha, no run
long_text: back of a length, starts outside off, and nips away further. Saha simply watches it through to the keeper. Encouraging carry
back of a length and swinging down the leg side, misses the bat, misses the thigh pad, and swerves down leg. DK throws himself to his left to stop the ball
top edged over the keeper! But KKR won't mind. The home boys win, and stay alive in IPL 2018! Rajasthan Royals are eliminated.
yorker on leg stump, and all he can do is bunt it down the ground. Just one ball left
slower ball, but wide outside off. Forces him to reach at it, and all he can do is slice it to first slip

yorker on leg stump, and Gowtham moved to the offside to try and paddle it fine. He misses, and the ball goes down the leg side. They want a wide, but not given. Probably because Gowtham moved around so much
full outside off, and he slices this drive over cover. In the air for a while, but lands safe. Russell at sweeper cover cleans up
full outside off, and Gowtham misses the big attempted slog! He expected the ball to angle in, but it held its line. KKR are through if Krishna can bowl five legal deliveries
short! And the umpire says 'dot ball!' Klaasen ain't happy, but the cal stands. He did try to pull, but was nowhere near the shot. Royals need 34 off the final over
low full toss on middle, and that's been muscled to the man at cow corner. They're swinging hard, but just not connecting. One ball to go
good length on off, and the batsman cannot connect with the pull! The delivery takes some extra bounce, and hits him above his waist
full on off, and he backs away to drive it over cover. He can only play it along the ground to long off
yorker on off, and the drive takes the bat's outside edge. It's running down to third man, but the fielders gets behind the ball
full on middle and leg, and Klaasen goes for the big shot. Misses the slog, as the ball comes off the bat's inside half
swept to square leg! Just three off the over. It was a dipping slower ball on off, and Binny tried to sweep. Plays it eventually with one hand, and it's completely out of control. Sliced to Lynn
banged in short outside off, but he misses the pull! Two dots in a row. Binny was through his shot way too early
yorker, wide outside of. Binny tries to stick his bat out and glance it square, but he can't connect. Huuuuge roar at the Eden, says Varun!
overpitched on leg stump, and that's been driven inside out to Narine at mid off
good length just outside off, and he mistimes a slog towards deep midwicket. He gets the second because of the poor timing
starts off with the slower ball! Lands just inside the tram-lines and Klaasen can't connect with the attempted heave over cover. Ooo, close. Could've easily been called a wide
good length outside off, and spinning into him. Punched off the back foot to long on for a walking single

in the air! And "hear that roar", says Varun from the Eden Gardens! Searles holds on at long on and the crowd goes ballistic. It was full on off, and he went for the pull once again. This time he can only slice it, and that brings an end to Samson's innings
backs away, and  carves it over point. Chawla saw him move, and therefore followed him. Good cricket all around
flat on middle, but turning in further. Samson mistimes his whip to deep backward square. But gets to fifty
low full toss outside off, and that's been drilled over cover! One-bounce four, and the Royals dugout celebrates. Tried to bowl the quicker one, but missed his length
full on off, and that's been driven with the help of his wrists to wide long on. Gets Samson back on strike
good length just outside off, and punched to extra cover off the back foot. He'll keep strike
reverse sweep over short third man! It's the offspinner, and Klaasen got into position early for the shot
full on off, and sneaks straight through this time. Drags his shot to deep midwicket on this occasion
sharp turn! Length ball on off, but sharply turning into the batsman. Misses the whip off his hips, and the ball hits his waist
length ball just outside off, and punched to long on off the back foot. Just a single
length ball just outside off, and punched to long on off the back foot. Just a single
full on middle, and driven down the ground to long off. They walk across for the single, and what an excellent final over from Kuldeep! Is this the last of Kuldeep for IPL 2018, I wonder
short on leg, and whipped off his pads to deep midwicket. Finally manages to get off strike
length ball on off, and pushed off the front foot. Can play it only to cover
huge appeal, but turned down. It was full, but pitches outside leg stump. Turns inwards, and hits him in front off stump. Not given
almost cleaned up first ball! Full on off, and turning away from him. Tried to play it towards the on-side, but the ball zips past the outside edge

caught and bowled, once again! Tossed up on leg stump, and it's the wrong'un. Rahane prepares to sweep, but he's played it way too early. Comes off the bat's toe end, and the leading edge is swallowed by the bowler
in the air, but short of cover! Full outside off and turning into the batsman. He's through his drive too early, so the ball lobs up. Safe eventually
sent into the stands! Uses the depth of the crease to make use of Narine's length. Slightly short, and it's been pulled to cow corner
goes for a wild swing, but misses completely! The ball hits his front pad, but impact's on leg stump. That would never have gone on to hit the stumps
good length outside off, but turning away this time! Mistimes his back-foot punch to Narine
full just outside off, and he misses the leg-side whip. The ball comes off the bat's inside half, and ricochets onto his pads
good length just outside off, but spinning into the batsman. Defended back to Narine
slower ball to end the over. It's the offcutter, and Rahane taps it down the ground to long on. Played gently enough for them to come back for the second
misses the pull completely! Back of a length just outside off, but the ball stays low. Rahane misses the shot
quicker ball! The extra bounce gets big on the batsman, but he still manages to fend it towards short cover. No one's there, so Samson rotates the strike as well
slower ball outside off, and Rahane punches it to the mid-on region off the front foot. Team hundred as well
back of a length just outside off, and he drags it to the midwicket fielder. They scamper across for one
good length on middle, and that's been flicked off his hips to deep midwicket
flighted outside off, and the ball turns inwards! Too close to his body for the cut, so Samson mistimes to short third man. He'll keep strike
almost a yorker on middle stump, and Samson's straight drive takes an inside edge. The ball ricochets onto his toes
flatter ball, and it turns away from the batsman. Tries to punch it towards cover, but comes off the bat's inside edge. It trickles down to midwicket, and Samson returns for two
full on off, but Rahane takes a step forward and smothers it towards cow corner. Man there though
flighted outside off, but too wide. Allows Samson to free his arms, and driven to long off for a single
full on off, and that's been caressed down the ground to long on. A walking single on offer
length ball on leg stump, and turning into his pads. Tapped towards the non-striker
low full toss outside off, and Rahane drives through the line. It trickles away to cover
full just outside off, and this time it's been defended off the front foot
slides just past the outside of his bat! A beautiful ball. Lands on off, and spin further away from the right-hander. Almost the dream delivery
attempts the paddle, but this comes off the bat's top edge. Falls over DK's head
full and lands just outside of. He's quick to get down on one knee, and sweeps it to deep bmidwicket
chance of a run out, but misses! Length ball outside off, and it's been steered to short third man. They want the single, and they're going for it! Safe eventually
slower ball, but wide outside off. Mistimes his cut to the off side, but has enough time to take the single

short_text: JPR Scantlebury-Searles to Samson, FOUR runs
long_text: width offered again, and Samson cuts it late enough for it to go between point and short third man. Absolutely played to perfection on this occasion

short_text: JPR Scantlebury-Searles to Samson, no run
long_text: punches this drive in the air, but it falls short of point. Length ball outside off again

short_text: JPR Scantlebury-Searles to Samson, SIX runs
long_text: pulled with disdain! Played so casually. Back of a length outside off, and Samson's so quick to play that kind of shot. Excellently played over cow corner
length ball, and too wide outside off. Comfortably cut off the back foot to deep point. A loose ball to start his spell
lofted with the spin, clean strike inside-out to the sweeper cover boundary. Lovely timing
too full, googly that he smothers nicely to ease this to long off
gets right to the pitch of the ball as he defends this back to Kuldeep
beaten by the wrong'un. Played at it with hard hands, spun to beat the edge. Tentative prod that
turns this gently with the spin towards square leg
too short, and punished! Samson opens up the leg side and pulls this to the right of deep midwicket.
delicate little dab, races past short third man. Welcome boundary. Not sure he intended to play it that fine but he'll take the runs
gentle little push with the spin towards midwicket
works this length ball from outside off towards long-on, the man coming in took a while to get off the blocks
cuts back in alarmingly to beat the inside edge and hit him high on the left thigh. Had no clue
whips this from outside off towards deep midwicket, aggressive running
spins back in from off, Rahane makes room and punches this to sweeper cover
picks the googly, gets forward and jabs this to cover. Superb first over from Kuldeep
paddled nicely down towards fine leg. Kuldeep went flat, so he had pace to work with.
leading edge that rolls to point. Bat was angled towards mid-on.
right to the pitch as he eases this to long off
hit on the back leg, but this one's turning too much. Rahane didn't pick it at all as he tried to work this to the leg side.
slider across the batsman, left alone. Drifted away as well
gets a good stride forward and he defends this full delivery back with a straight bat
goes back into the crease and punches this to long on
works this googly from length on middle to deep midwicket
works this length ball from outside off towards long on
drifts in from wide of the crease, punched to mid-on

He survived in the previous over but the lost review doesn't cost KKR. Tripathi chips this back and Chawla puts his right hand out on the followthrough to pluck that off running to the left. Tripathi jabbed at this googly, got it high on the bat and it lobbed. Eden roars
turns this shortish delivery gently behind square for an easy single
saved by an inside edge! Flatter length ball on off, he is struck on the pad but was very clearly a big edge. KKR review nevertheless, and lose one
goes big, clears the ropes again. This clears deep midwicket. This is the carrom bal that spins away from off, used his height to stretch forward, down on one knee and bang
down on one knee as he swings this over long-on. Clean strike, too full and get got underneath the flight nicely to back his strengths and clear the ropes.
sharp turn from middle and leg, hit on the thigh pad as he looks to whip this square
spinning back into middle and leg from length, turned wide of square leg
slips this down leg, will have to rebowl that
slower ball, but wide outside off. Tripathi waits for eternity trying to cut, but he misses. Wants the 'wide call' but the umpire isn't interested
full on off, and that's been driven down the ground. Played to mid off, and Chawla does well to intercept it
back of a length on off, and cramps the batsman for space this time. Defended towards cover, and that allows them to steal a single
good length on off, and that's been played to the midwicket fielder off the front foot. Calls early for the single
too short, and Rahane won't let those go. Cuts it, and the ball flies over point once again. Could've gone for six, but lands just short of the boundary
finds the gap! Pitches outside off, and he was quick to gauge the short length. Flawlessly pulled, and placed perfectly between the two fielders in the deep
it's the google again. Lands outside off, and jags into the batsman's pads. Tries to cut, but too close to his body. Checks that shot, and chops it down to point in the end
angling into his pads once again, and Rahane turns it off his pads to the fielder in the deep on the leg side

given! But will Rahane review? Yes he does. It was a skidder, that hit Rahane really low. The googly again that forces the error from the batsman. Way too much spin on offer, so wonder if that would've gone down leg. Replay time. And it's missing the stumps! Rahane survives.
good length outside off, but it's the wrong'un this time. Turns sharply into the batsman, and he punches it to cover point
flatter ball, on leg stump. Tripathi nudges it towards the vacant square leg region, but they settle for only the single
beautiful! Tripathi's a different batsman when he opens. It was flighted just outside off, and he leans into an excellent drive. Sweetly timed
length ball on off, and he fails to work it successfully towards the leg side. Defended eventually
full outside off, and Rahane chooses to defend it towards cover point. Played with soft hands
full on off, and that's drifting into his pads. Rahane takes a step forward, gets inside the line of the ball, and then drives it past midwicket for a classy four
Tripathi backs away so Prasidh follows him. Full outside leg, and Tripathi can't drag it towards the leg side. Hits the handle of his bat, and the bat goes flying! They take the single though
back of a length outside off, but angling into Tripathi. Tries an extravagant cut, and the ball finds the edge of his bat. Sliced to third man
full on off, and he's through his front-foot drive too quickly. Comes off the bat's top half, and lands just in front of the bowler
goes short, and Tripathi rides the bounce. Fends it off the back foot and carefully sees the over out
on off stump, and Rahane taps it with soft hands towards wide mid on. Will get Tripathi on strike
carved over point! Uses the pace to cut it over the infield! Width offered outside off, and easily done by Ajinkya Rahane. Looks so good
length ball just outside off. Angling into Rahane, so he fends it off the back foot. Tapped towards Tripathi at the non-striker's
back of a length outside off, and he misses the cut. The ball takes the bottom edge and goes to DK. Russell falls over on his follow through, but looks okay
falls in no man's land! Leading edge, and the ball teasingly soars over cover's head. Full on leg, and Rahane tried to play it towards square leg. Lucky, lucky
yorker, squeezed to the off side as they scamper a single. Russell finishes on 49.

backs away and drills this fuller delivery to the extra cover boundary. Laughlin didn't miss his length by much, went for a yorker and got punished. Long-off was no more than three metres away from the ball, had no chance

has he timed this? No. Excellent catch by Archer running around from long-off. The good thing though is they've crossed over, so Russell will be on strike. Archer had to be mindful of the long-on fielder running across too, but he stopped in his tracks to allow Archer to complete it.
mistimes a swing off a thick inside edge to long on, Samson hared in even as he hit it
backed away to swing this full toss over deep midwicket, but misses and hits his pads. Angled in and would've missed leg
swung away to the wide long-on boundary. This was a mishit but didn't matter. Backed away, and swung this from outside off
too far wide outside off. Russell has the presence of mind, lets it go. He was initially backing away, so Laughlin went outside off. Just outside the wide line
veers in a yorker but just ends up slipping this down, Russell manages to get out of the way. Wide. Can't fault him for the effort
backs away and belts this juicy full toss to sweeper cover. Just eight despite that six.

slower short of length ball that got stuck into the pitch, Russell backed away, held his shape very nicely and then flat-batted this over long-off. Deep into the stands. Lined himself up superbly. Forehand for six
right into the blockhole, he backs away to go over cover but can only manage to squeeze it back to the bowler
pulled nicely but down to deep square leg

short_text: Archer to JPR Scantlebury-Searles, no run
long_text: walks across to sweep this full delivery outside off, beaten. Just give the strike to Russell, mate!

short_text: Archer to JPR Scantlebury-Searles, no run
long_text: looks to swing this slower delivery over cow corner, beaten. Played too early
backs away but he's denied the free swing because Laughlin angles into his body. No problem. He still swings through, gets a top-edge that flies over the fine leg boundary.
Beaten! Backs away to carve this over point but Laughin shortened his length and angled it in to cramp him for room.
tails in late, yorker-length on middle, squeezed to midwicket
bounce and angled in from wide of the crease, Russell looks to pull, the ball deflects off the thigh pad to short fine leg

sitting up nicely for the pull, Russell has muscled this over deep midwicket. Too short, not the best delivery to bowl at this stage. Russell didn't get it anywhere near the middle but still managed to clear it

toe-ends this lofted hit and Rahane, moving backwards from the edge of the ring at cover, takes an excellent catch. Not easy, but he covered ground nicely. Big wicket, but DK's played a gem. Good execution of the slower ball, there as no pace to work with for DK.
works this off length from middle to deep midwicket
slower and fuller, lucky to get away with that. Russell mistimes this slog over cover to the fielder at the edge of the ring
