good length, on the pads, worked to deep midwicket
well bowled. Flat around off, pushed to cover for a quick single. Rohit puts in a dive and makes the single despite some quick work from Pant.
the googly on off, clipped to midwicket
short and wide outside off, cut away to backward point for a run
leg side-ish, and flicked away easily to the deep midwicket fielder
four more! Flat and wide outside off, Hardik drills a drive past cover for four more. Lots of power on that.
got underneath that sufficiently! Lots of flight on that, around off. Hardik clears his front leg and slogs the ball easily over long-on for a massive six.
quick and straight, pushed away to long-on. Six off the over
shortish outside off, punched away to long-on for a run
short and wide, sliced to deep cover for a run
shortish and wide outside off, punched away past cover for a couple.
the flat dart on off, Hardik gets forward and blocks
flat outside off, tapped in front of point for a run.
another googly outside off, driven to deep cover for one.
a very full delivery outside off, driven to long-on
chipped to cover! And Mumbai are collapsing, like RCB yesterday. A googly again outside off, Krunal just drives loosely and finds short cover. Very loose hands, just throwing his hands at the ball.
googly outside off, the ball beats the bat.
a googly down leg, Krunal sweeps that very fine for four. The fielder runs around and misfields. Surprise, surprise. This time the fielder is Harshal

sensational stuff from Maxwell and Boult! Boult has taken tougher ones than this, but this was Maxwell's catch. A legbreak around middle and leg, the ball was exceptionally full so Pollard went straight, full face and flat. Maxwell runs around to his left and takes a reverse-cupped catch, but he's falling over so he just throws the ball to Boult nonchalantly, running in from long-off. The best thing about that catch was that Boult ran towards Maxwell when the ball was in the air, realised very early what was at stake.

Mishra strikes again! Follows that up with a terrific googly, but it's wider outside off. Lewis doesn't read the variation, he just runs down and slogs across the line. Mishra's wiles ensure the ball is short enough to allow room for turn and bounce to beat the slog. Pant does the rest.
not the best line. It's another googly but well down leg, Lewis top-edges this slog sweep and gets it behind square. Enough timing and power for six, lands on the boundary cushion.
a flatter one down leg, worked to deep midwicket
a low full toss outside off, drilled to long-off
the big slog sweep, goes past Lewis. Lots of flight on that googly and Lewis can't make contact
a googly down leg, worked to midwicket

back of a length on middle, worked to deep square leg where guess who misfields. Shaw again. When your confidence is low, things never go your way, but he has only himself to blame. Extremely sloppy cricket.
strays down leg, worked to deep backward square leg for one

hit on the side of the helmet! A short slower ball around off and Lewis is through his shot too early. Because he's early through it, the side of the helmet meets the ball, and the ear! Needs some treatment, maybe a new helmet too.

dropped again! This is a much tougher chance, but dropped nonetheless. Full outside off, a thick outside half travels to backward point's left. Abhishek Sharma leaps to his left, but can't catch as the ball bursts out.
a shorter delivery down leg, pulled to deep backward square leg.
full and straight, pushed to cover
very quick down leg, swept away powerfully to deep backward square leg
flat and straight, pushed back to the bowler.

Prithvi Shaw having a shocker! An eaaaaasssy catch dropped. A flighted legbreak outside off, Mishra has done Pollard in all ends up. So he goes after a slog sweep, gets a thick outside edge at head height to slip. The ball just goes through his fingers, and then he looks at the ball, doesn't even go after it. Very sloppy work.
goes right through! The googly outside off, Pollard gets forward and prods but the ball finds a massive gap between bat and pad. Does not hit the stumps
starts with a googly, down leg. Pollard misses a flick. Struck on the pad.

strikes first ball does Mishy! Kishan picks out long-on. The first ball after the time-out too. He picked that ball to attack well, ran to the pitch of the legbreak and launched a swat to long-on. Shankar runs around the boundary nicely, to his left, and takes a good reverse-cupped catch with his feet inches away from the boundary.
out again with a direct hit. Short outside off, slapped to mid-off for a single. The bowler picks up neatly but misses at the non-striker's end.
too straight again, worked to deep square leg
138 kph, full on middle and off, punched to mid-off
good length on middle and leg, the ball seaming back in. A defensive block to extra cover
strays on the pads, doesn't want to offer room. Clipped to deep square leg
down leg again, another wide.
good length on off, tapped towards backward point for a run
a slower ball drifts down leg, wide.
six to finish the over! Lots of flight on off, Lewis comes down and hits it straight again. Full face, loads of power over long-off
short and down leg, Leiws works the ball easily over square leg. Got underneath the ball enough
again, this is much flatter through, smashed to cover
flat and wide outside off, punched to cover
six more! Lewis on fire. Flat outside off, Lewis steps out and nails a lofted drive right back. Over the bowler's head
flat outside off, pushed to cover. Kishan is sent back, makes it back with a full-length dive
that's an awful over. A 122 kph slower ball, but it's wide outside off. He can bowl that now because there is a sweeper cover in place.
and smashed over midwicket! 128 kph, a short delivery outside off, sits up for Lewis at that pace and walloped with the cross bat.
poor delivery again. It's full and wide outside off, right in the slot to loft the ball over cover. Iyer can't chase it down either. The length is not very good.
full outside off, tapped down to third man off the open face

dropped! Full and wide outside off, smashed through to cover. About knee height for Vijay Shankar. The ball just pops out and goes to Iyer at a straighter cover. Iyer picks the ball and misses the stumps at the bowler's end, well out had Iyer hit. Boult does the backing up.
poor ball. Overpitched outside off, drilled away through cover with so much ease. No hassle at all.
flat and straight, Lewis skews a lofted drive away towards midwicket via the inside half.
darted in, quick, worked to long-on
shortish and wide outside off, swatted towards cover, who lazily fields and allows one
three dots! Lots of flight on that as well, defended
nicely bowled again, full outside off, defended to cover
flat around off, chopped towards extra cover
terrific over from Boult, short outside off. Kishan tries to lace a cut through backward point but makes no contact
138 kph, full and straight, more away movement, chipped towards mid-on from the crease.
too full this time, on middle, blocked to mid-on
beauty! A full delivery on middle, it straightens after pitching, towards off. Kishan is drawn into a leg-side stroke, which is why he's opened up as he defends
back of a length, and slightly wide outside off, cut to backward point
a short delivery outside off, swinging away, pulled away through midwicket for a run.
googly, on middle and off. Kishan gets forward and defends to cover.
a googly outside off, worked to midwicket

12 runs and a wicket in the opening over so far! Lamichhane strikes, a googly down leg, Suryakumar looks to work the ball through midwicket but a leading edge carries all the way to Shankar at long-on. He ran in quite a bit and took a good catch.
just over cover! He hit that with the spin. A legbreak outside off, Suryakumar gets underneath the length and lofts the ball over the infield.
4 and now 6. Another poor delivery, short and on the pads. Suryakumar stays low and pulls the ball over backward square leg for six.
oh that's tripe to start. A short legbreak, a filthy long-hop on middle and the batsman pulls merrily over midwicket
swings and misses, they scamper a bye. Daredevils have ended well.
slaps this slower delivery to long-off

launched straight back over, this smashes into the sightscreen. Massive strike, right in his hitting arc. Shankar got the timing right this time. Can't bowl length. Held his shape superbly, held pose for the cameras later.
toe-ends a slog, went midwicket, got this to point. They scamper a run
lofted, but on the bounce to long-on. No timing again
juicy full toss on leg stump, swung away into the gap at deep backward square leg.
full and angling wide, Shankar looks to reach out and slice this over but misses.

high full toss, was it above the waist? He's thumped this to Rohit, who hurts his left shoulder in trying to attempt the catch. He's not wincing in pain but is in some discomfort. The physio attends to him immediately.  Another drop
slips this down leg, he looked to tickle this fine but missed.
squeezes this yorker-length delivery back past the bowler, to long-on
aims for a yorker at the base of leg stump, gets it wrong, even if not too far away. Wide called by Dharmasena
misses the yorker, turns out to be a half-volley that is drilled to sweeper cover.
makes room and lofts this inside-out to long-off.
sliced over, just eludes Rohit, who runs to his right from short third man.  Goes down as a dropped chance nevertheless . Slower and fuller from Bumrah, Shankar had to reach out to play this one
too full on the pads, flicked to fine leg
squeezes this yorker-length delivery outside off towards mid-on
sliced over cover, on the bounce to Ewin Lewis. Could he have gone for the catch? Looks like Lewis bailed out

that is sensational from the Under-19 boy! This is too short, he lines himself up properly and muscles this pull into the second tier. He's all of 17 but the shape and his timing is just magnificent. Crisp, clean strike against one of the better death bowlers.
walks across to pull, mistimes it towards Rohit coming in from deep midwicket
punches this straight to extra cover, big mix up with the running. Shankar was a long way down when he was sent back, a direct hit at the striker's end by Hardik and he would've been gone.
length angling away, steered towards point
flicks this low full toss on middle and leg to deep midwicket
holes out to long-on. Didn't get to the pitch of the ball, went through with the lofted it, but no elevation. Straightforward catch to Pollard. End of a magnificent innings.
sees him winding up and fires this full and wide, Pant reaches out for a wallop, loses his shape, balance but somehow manages to skews it into the gap at sweeper cover.
fires one into the blockhole, Pant somehow manages to jam his bat down to keep it out.
slapped to the man at the edge of the ring at extra cover.
whipped over the infield, down to brother Hardik
drills this straight to mid-off.
looks for the reverse lap, gave away his intention too early. missed it

one-handed whack, sails over deep midwicket! At the moment, he can even bat blindfolded and hit them for sixes, by the looks of it. Slower, too full and he got underneath that to muscle that away. Magnificent, unbelievable
slips a length ball down leg, Pant helps this along to beat short fine leg. Off the thigh pad, missed the bat. Races away.

hit on the pad to a full delivery he looks to whip over midwicket, but this pitched miles outside leg, and hit him outside leg as well. Thank god for DRS, that was a horrendous decision from umpire CK Nandan.

now he shows he can reverse pull as well! This one sails over third man. Helped of course by the length, too short. Pant had enough time to change his blade, half-stance and of course help that over. Raises the half-century stand
slashes, but gets a thick edge that runs wide of the keeper to the third man boundary
belted back down the ground, Fizz can't stop this on his followthrough, deflects it to long-on.  Pant's fifth 50 plus score in seven innings.  This one off 34 balls
driven firmly to mid-off. Bowled this full and slanted this across to Pant

belts this to hit Fizz flush on the toe as it deflects towards mid-on. They scamper back for the second because of the overthrow.  Fizz takes his left shoe off, awkward landing as well because he twisted his left leg
that's a one-handed wallop , dragged it from outside off to a slower ball, but it just sailed over wide long-on. Massive from Pant.
shaped to slog this deep into the stands at cow corner, got the bottom-edge that rolled to the leg side.
pulled in front of square, down to Hardik at deep midwicket
driven but can't pick the gap, straight to mid-off.
plays the short-arm jab down to long on
squeezes a yorker-length delivery on middle to midwicket
short of length on middle and leg, worked towards fine leg
width on a length ball outside off, forced to sweeper cover
slower and fuller on middle, turned to deep midwicket again.  It's time for another timeout
slower length ball on middle and leg, Pant wrists this to deep midwicket
gets across the stumps and whips this length ball to deep midwicket
short of length outside off, slapped to deep cover
pulled from outside off towards deep square leg
delightful! Length on off, Vijay packs a punch as he lofts this over long-on. Tremendous power.
steers this short of length delivery down to third man.
works this length ball on leg stump to deep midwicket
slower length ball that he works from outside off towards deep midwicket
looks to slap this over cover, ends up slicing this towards third man
short ball angling away, looks to slap this up and over third man but lets it go in the end
forced off the backfoot to sweeper cover
skiddy length ball on off, defended back.
slower and fuller on middle and leg, flicked to deep midwicket
too short, uses the width to punch to sweeper cover
slower ball, looked work to the leg side but ends up offering a dead bat.
length angling into middle and leg, punched to deep midwicket
closer to the stumps at length, dabbed to short third man. Pant refused the run. Could've so easily been another mix-up
punched to midwicket, good stop by Rohit.
full toss on middle and leg, punched to long-on
floats this full on middle and leg, flicked to deep midwicket
length on middle and leg, worked off his hip to deep square leg.
dabs this gently to point
uses the pace and then times this to perfection. Short third man had no chance. Short, hint of width and Shankar just laced it away.
pulled down to deep midwicket

oh, dear. He's hit this straight down the throat of deep midwicket. Too short, he picked the correct ball to pull, a googly, pulled but didn't connect as well as he would've liked. Krunal was mindful of the ropes behind him. He was no more than an inch or two in front of the ropes. After a promising start, Iyer has ended the season with a string of ordinary performances.
reaches out to slap this short delivery to sweeper cover
steps out and works this to short midwicket where Mustafizur misfields to give away a single
turns this gently to square leg, sensible
this is tremendous! There's deep midwicket and deep square, but he bisects the field again. Goes back deep into the crease and whip-pulls this. Strong bottom hands as well. Timed magnificently
slides one away, Pant looks at Dharmasena in anticipation of a wide, but not given and rightly so.

pulled from outside off to square leg, no control over the stroke, so no timing. Rohit hits direct at the striker's end, but there's no real danger of Iyer being out there because he was comfortably in.
back of length angling away, Pant stands tall and punches this to cover.
dabs this gently into the off side, towards short third man, as they jog the single
slaps this short delivery straight to sweeper cover

delightful wrist work. There's point, short third man. It's short, so Pant adjusts slightly to pick the gap between the two. Superbly done. Cut away in style, didn't bother keeping this down because he knew he was hitting this in the gap
length on middle and leg, knocked to deep midwicket.
steps out, gets to the pitch of the ball to smother it and whips this over deep midwicket, his favourite scoring area. That's the first six of the match.
flat-bats this short ball to long on
wrong'un at length, dabbed gently to short third man for a quick single
too short and sliding down, Pant pulls this with the spin to beat deep backward square. Valiant effort from Ewin Lewis. Poor from Markande
gets right to the pitch of the ball as he eases this to sweeper cover
touch short on middle and leg, worked behind square on the leg side for an easy single
beaten! Another cutter, a typical Mustafizur special. Iyer poked at it with an angled bat.
through the pull even before the short of length cutter arrived, on the bounce to Ishan Kishan.
driven but can't pick the gap, straight to cover point.
dabbed to short third man for a quick single
full and sliding into the pads, flicked superbly into the gap towards deep backward square leg.

delightful from Pant. Picks the length, stands tall and punches this between cover and point. What timing, special stroke. Who said his game's just about biffing the ball? Held the pose for the cameras too!
punches this wide of mid-on to get off the mark.
short of length delivery slanting away, defended from the crease.
gets half a stride in and defends this back towards the bowler.

right through, 144kph.  Maxwell's forgettable IPL is over. Bumrah gives him the silent treatment. Maxwell went for a glory hit, trying to belt this up and over his head. But the ball angled back in to sneak in off a big inside edge and flatten leg stump. This is the fourth time Bumrah has dismissed Maxwell.
bit of an inside edge onto the pad as he looked to hoick this over midwicket. Stifled appeal from Bumrah
looks to pull, but is beaten for pace. Angling down leg, wide called.
goes downtown, one bounce to the long-off boundary. Spotted the change in pace, but this was too full and he got to the pitch and have it a whack. Picked the slower delivery immediately.
works this to short fine leg for a quick single
hits the hard length, on middle. Defended to extra cover.
grips the surface, bounces extra. Maxwell slices this punch on the bounce to backward point.
off-cutter at length and angling away, steered to third man
stands tall and punches this to cover point.

what laziness, Shaw was taking a Sunday stroll and has to walk back. Defended to point by Maxwell, he called no and turned back immediately. Shaw was no more than four or five yards outside the crease even as Pandya threw the ball direct at the bowler's end. This is very poor, lack of game awareness. He didn't even make an attempt to get back in. Completely taken aback by Hardik Pandya's throw. Virender Sehwag like.
pulled behind square. Nice timing, once he beat short fine, he was always assured of a boundary. Too short, Shaw fetched it from outside off.
works this off his hip to deep square leg
punchy drive, beats mid-off. No chance for Krunal even though he was no more than a couple of yards away from the ball. That just kept gathering speed.
slower and fuller outside off, Maxwell takes a step across as he looks to whack this over cover, played too late. On the bounce to Ishan Kishan.
wallops this short ball up and over the ring, but there's long-on specifically for that kind of stroke from Shaw
back of length on off, Shaw gets on top of the bounce and defends back.
too short and drifting into middle and leg, Maxwell waits and then tickles this fine off his hip to beat short fine leg.
right back in the crease as he defends this incoming length ball to midwicket
works this length ball on middle and leg towards deep midwicket.
punches this length ball behind point, down to Krunal at square third man
slashed, too quick for Suryakumar Yadav at slip. By the time he cupped his hands, the ball had flown past him at first slip. Tough, tough chance.
angles in a full ball on off from wide of the crease, defended solidly.
swung away, not in control but manages to hoick this behind square on the leg side. First boundary
high backlift as he whips this length ball on middle and leg to deep midwicket
nice flight, lands this full on middle and leg, turned wide of short midwicket as they scamper a single.
touch short on middle, tucked towards short midwicket
drifts in, rolls off the thigh pad to short fine as Maxwell attempts a tickle. Oh, dear. Overthrow from Bumrah at the bowler's end, they get an extra run
short and drifting into middle and leg, whipped to backward square leg to get off the mark. Tumbling stop there by Surya, I think. Little wide and that was four.
low full toss on middle, and that's been tapped to long on. KKR qualify into the IPL playoffs! Celebrations in the KKR dugout. Hugs in the camp.
slower ball, and outside off stump. Attempts the drive but deceived by the pace. Goes past his bat's outside edge
good length on off, and Rana succumbs! Tries to play the pull, but he's mistimed it to fine leg. Bhuvneshwar the man there. Drama?
full and wide outside off, but Rana manages to find the boundary! Reaches at it, but manages to drill this cut past point. Deep point's dive is futile. Scores are tied
yorker on off, and that's been squeezed away to point. DK wants the single, but no chance. KKR need five off the final over to secure playoff qualification
full on of, and Rana backs away to make some extra room. Drives through the cover region. Man in the deep though
back of a length outside off, and this time he manages to drag the pull to deep midwicket
good length outside off, and angling slightly away after pitching. Tries to pull, but the ball goes under his bat. Through to Goswami
full on off, and pushed off the front foot to the midwicket region. No one's there, so long on has to give it a big chase. Enough time to sneak in the second run
yorker on leg stump, but ends up as a very low full toss. Clipped off his boots to deep backward square
yorker just outside off, and that's been played with the bat's open face. Glanced to deep point
good length outside off, and punched off the front foot to sweeper cover. Easy pickings
slower ball, full outside off. Too wide, says the umpire
full just outside off, and Russell winds up for a big slog. Tries to send it over long off, but toe ends it this time. In the air for ages, and mid off settles under it

back of a length on middle, and Russell ain't done trying to pull.Connects this time, and top edges it to fine leg. Good effort by Sandeep at fine leg, but the scoreboard won't show that. Diving effort, but dropped
short on middle, and Russell makes room to pull it away. Misses again!
full, but wide outside off. Forced to reach at it, but still manages to drive it safely past the cover region. Man in the deep
back of a length on off, and Russell goes for a wild swing of the bat. Misses completely
full toss outside off, and muscled to the wide long-on boundary for a single
pulled with disdain! Back of a length outside off, and DK picks the slower ball early. Thumps it to the cow-corner boundary thereafter. Flat, and one bounce four
full outside leg, but goes down as a wide. Karthik did try to flick it fine, but can't get bat to ball

falls to the pull once again! Wide outside off, but short. And that sends Uthappa chasing after it. Top-edges it, and Goswami runs towards square-leg to complete the catch. Brathwaite does the 'Run D World' dance
heavy ball. Full outside off, and driven square to the man in the deep. Easy single
full on leg stump, and the batsman some room on the leg side. Tries to play it towards midwicket, but misses. Hits his pads and goes towards short cover instead
leading edge! But falls in no man's land. Full on off, and he tries to flick it towards the leg side. Goes to cover point instead. Final time out of the night

short_text: Rashid Khan to Uthappa, SIX runs
long_text: huuuuuuuuge! Full on off, and he brings his front leg to the pitch of the ball, before depositing it over wide long on. Rashid's in disbelief

short_text: Rashid Khan to Uthappa, FOUR runs
long_text: full just outside off, and this time Uthappa manages to read the turn. Picks the legbreak, and then smashes it over Rashid's head
full outside off, but it's the googly! Sharp turn into the batsman, and he tries to defend. Takes the bat's inside edge, and then onto his pads
full on off, and pushed to wide mid on off the front foot. Forces the bowler to chase behind it, which allows the KKR batsmen to complete the second run
length ball on off, and he tries the reverse paddle. Plays it uncomfortably to short third man
almost a yorker outside off, but DK manages to drive it to cover. They're taking the quick run, and KW's throw gets the direct hit. But the batsman's in, and now they take another run
good length, but wide outside off. Plays it away from his body, but still manages to punch it beyond the fielder at cover. In the air for a while
length ball on middle, but angling down the leg side. Karthik swivels, and then drags it over the fine-leg boundary. Seventy-seven metres!
back of a length outside off, and he mistimes the pull to midwicket. Good stop by the infielder

full on off, and defended back to the bowler. He wants the single, but turns back eventually. Bhuvi, though, picks up the ball and has a shy at the stumps. Breaks it, but the batsman had dragged his bat in
low full toss on middle stump, and whipped off his pads to deep backward square
good length outside off, and angling into him. Carved off the back foot to cover point, but the non-striker sends the batsman back
yorker on off, and that's been fended down the ground to the man at long on
good length on off, and shaping into the batsman. Fended with soft hands towards the cover region, and he's off for a quick single
length ball outside off, and DK tries to glance it fine past the keeper's right. But can't get bat to ball, and the delivery sneaks past the outside of his bat
full on off, and angling into DK. Tapped to midwicket

full on off, and in his arc! Lynn swings through, and hits it flat to wide long-on, but Pandey's in the deep! Takes the catch, but lobs it up as he's going over the line, then comes back, and finally completes the catch. Classic T20 catch
full outside off, and he's down on one knee to sweep it to the man at deep backward square
full, but wide outside off. Driven along the ground to Dhawan at deep extra cover
length ball outside off, and punched to the cover region
full on off, and swept across the line to the man in the deep. A comfortable walking single
length ball outside off and turning into the batsman. Backs away and punches it down the ground at long on

short_text: Rashid Khan to Uthappa, no run
long_text: the reverse sweep doesn't come off. Full outside off, and Uthappa goes unconventional
full on off, and that's some sensible cricket on display. Defended off the front foot
length ball on off, and worked off his pads to the vacant midwicket region
deft! Best of both words from Uthappa. It was full outside off, but Uthappa uses the depth of the crease to bring out the late cut. Goes between point and short third man
full on off, and in Uthappa's arc. Big stride forward, and struck over the man at long on. Classic Robin!
full on middle, but straightens after pitching. Lynn thumps it straight, between the umpire and the non-striker, to long on
length ball on off stump, and Uthappa makes some room. Attempts to lift it over cover, but slices this over the infield instead
length ball on off, and slapped off the back foot to cover
slower ball outside off, but Lynn's been waiting for that length ball. Lines it up, gets his front leg away, and then slogs it over the long-on boundary. Fifty! Ninety-six metres
full just outside off, and Uthappa check drives over Lynn's head. A chip actually, which saves him. Lands just short of long on
good length on off, and Uthappa shuffles across to the off side. Works it behind square this time, and calls early for the second run
back of a length outside off, but the ball stays low! Uthappa considered pulling that square, but checks his shot at the end. Lets it go to Goswami on the bounce
yorker on off, and that's been dug away well. Managed to get his bat down and squeeze it towards the off side
flat outside off, and angling into Lynn again. He backs away and cuts it between point and cover
full on off and drifting into Lynn's pads. Fended off the front foot
length ball on off, and he backs away to carve it to sweeper cover. Uthappa wants the second, but Lynn does well to end him back. Would've been harakiri
overpitched just outside off, and that's been muscled down the ground past Shakib's left. Long off's there though
flatter, and full outside off. Pushed off the front foot to cover point by Uthappa
length ball outside off, and allows Lynn to free his arms. Cuts it to point, and the fielder can't hold on to it. Allows them to complete the run
drops it short on middle stump, pulled to deep square

dropped off his own bowling. Uthappa goes with the slog sweep and gets it off the toe-end. It hangs high in the mid-on area. He's running backwards and looks to be in a bad position as it comes down. Swerves away from him as he follows it and bounces back off the turf to hit him in the face. Not an easy chance, that one
length outside off, swept along the floor to long leg

short_text: Rashid Khan to Lynn, no run
long_text: trapped on the pads but they won't review the not-out decision. It's a googly that he tries to whip behind square off the back foot. Hits him on the back foot at middle-and-leg .did they think it was going down?
plans the reverse sweep and gets outside the line of off stump to set up for it. But it's a googly and it takes the inside edge before dribbling past the keeper on the leg side
length ball wide outside off, gets down and sweeps to long leg
short of a length and angled into the corridor. Backs away and under-edges a cut towards mid-off
full ball outside off, leans in and drives to long-on
yorker on leg stump, tapped into the mid-on region
short ball outside off, backs away and is so eager to wallop this behind point, he ends up losing his shape at the last moment and missing it
mistimed slog over deep midwicket. Length ball slanted into him. Gets outside the line of leg stump and lifts it 87 metres. Yep. Off the inside half.
length ball at off stump, defended off the back foot
length ball on middle stump, gets on the front foot and flicks to deep midwicket

short_text: Rashid Khan to Uthappa, no run
long_text: cramped and a big appeal.  Not out - on lbw and caught. Googly ripped in at Uthappa who was set up for a back foot punch. It's off his thigh to first slip
googly at a length outside off. Shuffles, gets the front foot press in and flicks this into the midwicket region
short of a length and spinning away outside off. Gets on the back foot and pushes to sweeper cover
length ball just outside off, pokes it through cover off the front foot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Lynn, no run
long_text: length ball, skidding through rapidly and spinning away outside off. An obligatory waft, beaten
bouncer dug in too short for him to attempt a shot. Looked higher than head-height from the front view, but play on says the umpire
graceful. Uthappa springs up quickly after his forward press and lifts this pull shot neatly over midwicket. Full control.
low full toss at middle stump. Drives inside-out but can't beat mid-off to his left
low full toss outside off, mistimed flick straight to midwicket
short of a length just outside off, slices to third man who is very fine
length ball on the pads. Looks to flick it fine, but can't get bat. According to everyone but the keeper, who collects and appeals excitedly. No review. Yeah, it's off the pad
in the air but down to third man. Anxious jab with hard hands at a length ball outside off and it's a thick outside edge
under edge through to the keeper on the bounce. Short ball outside off, gets too close as he tries to cut
good length outside off. Leans in to try and jab off the front foot. Thick inside edge to midwicket
short of a length outside off, backs away and chops to sweeper cover
bouncer outside off, lets it go after making room. That got a little too steep after he'd set up for it
misses the length this time and is punished. With some force. Overpitched this time on off stump and Lynn drills this between bowler and mid-off
yorker. Perfect. Lynn can't do more than get his front toe out of the way and dig this out
tossed up on off stump, defended solidly on the front foot
short of a length on off stump, punched firmly to long-off

gets him this time. Slightly shorter and a similar slow pace from Shakib. Narine beaten in flight again and this time it's off the inside half of the bat as he looks to slog. Pandey runs in and completes the catch easily
clears long-on. Slogs this high. He's beaten in flight a tad but has enough reach to get it off the middle and just get it over Pandey
poor ball. Dragged very short and Narine waits for it to come on before spanking it to the square leg boundary
tossed up full outside off. Lynn through the cover drive early, gets an inside edge that tickles through square leg
overpitched ball on the legs, but he can't get bat on this. Looks to flick and can only pick up a leg bye with the deflection
yorker on middle stump. Backs away again and is forced to jam this to mid-off
thumped over mid-off. The line and length is predictable - short of a length and in at the body. Lynn backs away in anticipation. Gets a knuckle ball that sits up nicely
short of a length at middle stump, pushes it into the off side from the crease
swatted away! Not connected too well, but this is Lynn, and this is the norm. Clears the ropes easily. Short ball into the body and he gets the slog out quickly
kncukle ball that floats away at an off stump line. Lynn solidly behind the line to defend off the back foot

clears the long-on boundary! Sandeep has gone for 20 in his first over. A slower ball. Narine looks like he knows it's coming. Steps out and meets it at the pitch in front of middle stump before launching it flat to long-on's right
now he misfires the yorker. Pushes it down leg side from around the wicket
slower ball, short and skidding down leg side. He steps out and swings at it. Can't hit
full outside off and bunted straight to mid-off
over extra cover. Finally gets one off well, somewhere close to the middle. Length ball outside off, swings clean under this and opens the face a touch to get it off the outside half of the bat
inside edge this time. Length ball skidding in at leg stump. Steps out and swings at it, gets runs wide of short fine
clears point with a mistimed slice. Narine wants to thump this over over but it's a slower ball drifting away from him and it takes the thick outside edge
wide bouncer first up. Narine goes after it but is too slow to get bat on it
whack. Poor ball and he slaps it away. Short of a length with a lot of width. It's well in front of cover
how did you do that Narine? Ridiculous stuff! An inswinging yorker coming in at middle stump. He opens his stance, and digs it out to third man from less than a yard in front of the stumps
nicely played but can't get it past mid-off. Outswinger, full and wide outside off. Leans in and drives firmly, right off the middle of the bat
chopped away easily. Short of a length and some width outside off. Lynn stays shuffles back a little and bisects cover and point
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
big inswinger to start. But it's a tad short of good length. Lynn keeps it out, taps it back to the bowler

back of a length on off, and he fails to connect with the short ball! The batsman's trying for a suicidal run, and DK throws down the stumps. The fourth wicket of the over! Sunrisers finish on 172 for 9

back of a length outside off, and he tries to send this over cover! The slog finds the bat's outside edge, and that's a skier! Rana's at fine leg, but DK has called for the catch. Takes it from almost near the boundary, and then falls over due to the momentum. Fourth wicket for Krishna!
good length on off, and too close to his body for the pull. Comes off the bat's top half, and Narine's under it at short fine leg. Great death-overs bowling from the youngster
creamed! Full outside off, and allows Shakib to free his arms. Drills this drive to the extra-cover boundary. Oof, what sound off the bat
pinpoint yorker on leg stump. The batsman did well to get his toes out of the way

full toss outside off, and that's been slogged towards the leg side. It's a flat shot, but Rinku Singh, the substitute, displays some excellent athleticism in the deep. Slides and takes a diving catch running forward. Prasidh applauds!
full and wide outside off. But a well-aimed yorker. Shakib tries to ramp it past short third man, but misses. DK collects and that's well done by Russell
good comeback! Short on off, and going over Shakib's shoulders. He tried to ramp it over DK, but can't get bat to ball
slower ball, but a length ball. Shakib settles deep into his crease, and pulls it over the square-leg umpire!
full on leg stump, and that's the short arm jab from Shakib. Excellent timing off the bat, but the fielder in the deep puts in the hard yards
full outside leg, and he backs away before inside-edging an on drive to deep backward square
back of a length on off, and that's way too quick for Carlos. Tried to pull, finds the top edge. DK races forward and completes a comfortable catch. Russell wins the battle of the West Indians
a yorker on leg stump, and Brathwaite manages to get enough behind that to play it down the ground. Long off cleans up
back of a length outside off. He backs away and punches it square to the man in the deep
full on middle, and he gets his front foot out of the way to get his bat swinging. Muscles it over wide long on thereafter!
attempted yorker on leg stump, and that's been inside-edged to the square-leg fielder
good length outside off, but angling into Pandey. He checks his punch, and glances it towards backward point on this occasion

almost a yorker on middle, that he tries to play the straight drive to. The shot ricochets onto his boot and then goes to the bowler's hands. Prasidh's asking for the catch! They're going upstairs, but the ball actually hit the ground before hitting Pandey's boots. False alarm
full outside off, and driven to cover point off the front foot. They'll take the run
quicker ball on leg stump, but that's too wide. Extras
good length on off, and offspin from Narine. Whipped towards midwicket off the back foot
good length on middle, and turning towards the leg side. Clipped off his hips to short fine leg on this occasion
good length outside off, and enough width for him to play the late cut. Played with soft hands, but well intercepted by short third man!
full on off, and in Pathan's slot. Goes for a big one, but toe-ends it unfortunately. Mid on, Uthappa, settles under it, and holds on to this catch. Narine strikes!
good length on off, and turning into his pads. Worked towards the deep square-leg fielder
slower ball to end the over. But wide outside off, which allows him to free his arms. Thumps a cut to the man in the deep
good length on middle, and once again worked off his hips to fine leg. Chawla the fielder there
short! On off, but always going over the batsman's head. Extras
length ball on middle, but angling down the leg side. Pandey flicks, and helps it on its way to fine leg
width offered outside off, and that's been cut off the back foot. Beats point, but third man does well to clean up
back of a length outside off, and that's been fended from near his face. Tapped to the cover region

given! Slower ball, on off stump, and Dhawan misses the big slog towards the leg side. Deceived by the lack of pace, and the ball hits his front leg. Impact in front of middle, and Gabbar's gotta go. Time out as well

full on middle, and this time he drills a drive past extra cover. Oh dear, a basic fielding error by Chawla at wide long off. Makes a mess of a fielding opportunity in the deep, and gifts Sunrisers some extra runs
back of a length, slower ball. Pandey tries to cut it over point, but he's completely deceived! Goes through to DK
short on middle, and that's fiery! Pandey hops across to the leg side in a bid to get away from the ball's line
full just outside off, and that's been whipped! Great use of the wrists, and placed excellently to the cow-corner region
good length on off, and Pandey opens his bat's face, but finds the man at point once again
short and wide outside off. Starts off with the offcutter, and Pandey mistimes a cut to point
full outside off, and wide enough for Pandey to free his arms. Drills this drive to sweeper cover
good length on middle, but sharp turn away from Dhawan. Flat-bats it to long off and completes his fifty!
full on off, and turning away from him. Defended towards short cover
full on leg, and Dhawan clips it off his pads to deep backward square

short_text: Kuldeep to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: good length on off, but the wrong'un comes into Dhawan's pads. Tapped towards the leg side
flighted on middle stump, and comfortably driven past the non-striker to mid off
starts off with a late cut. Length ball outside off, which he pokes to the fielder at short third man

back of a length outside off, and Williamson's forced to reach at it. Goes for the cut anyway, and he's perhaps timed it way too well! Straight to Russell at deep point, and the slower ball fetches Searles the big wicket!
length ball outside off, and this time it's been muscled to the man at cow corner. Took the pace off, Searles

short_text: JPR Scantlebury-Searles to Williamson, SIX runs
long_text: different angle, but the same result! Oh dear, KKR are losing the plot aren't they. Full outside leg, and Williamson gets down on one knee and paddles this over fine leg once more

short_text: JPR Scantlebury-Searles to Williamson, SIX runs
long_text: visionary! Williamson exposes his leg stump even before the ball was bowled. And when it pitched on leg stump, KW just whips it off his pads, and sends it over the fielder at fine leg!

short_text: JPR Scantlebury-Searles to S Dhawan, 3 runs
long_text: Narine drops it! In the air for ages, but it was one that swerves a lot. Full on middle, and Dhawan's leg-side whip was skied towards the off side. Rana, however, has the presence of mind to aim at the stumps. It's broken the bails, but also allows Sunrisers to steal an extra run
length ball on off, and Williamson shuffles across to the off side and nudges it to the square-leg region. Played with gentle hands, and that actually allows them to take the second
full on middle, and he's down on one knee to sweep it behind square! Prasidh Krishna manning that region
full on off, and pushed off the front foot to mid off
full on middle, but turns sharply into his pads. KW can't get bat to ball, and it hits his pads. Impact on leg stump, but would've gone down the leg side
full on off, and straightens after pitching. Defended off the front foot
on middle, and angling into his pads. Williamson pushes it off his pads to the vacant square-leg region, and there's enough time to come back for the second
length ball outside off, and then turning into KW. Cut off the back foot to the man in the deep
good length on middle, and it's the wrong'un this time. But Williamson drags it off the backfoot to deep midwicket with ease

over wide long on! Flighted on middle and leg, but Williamson comfortably gets his front leg out of the way and then thumps it towards the leg side. Too slow from Kuldeep, which gives the batsman that extra second
full on leg stump, and that's been clipped off his toes to cow corner. Gets KW on strike
nice, juicy full toss outside off, but Williamson can't put it away. Miscues a drive to mid off
good length on off, and turning away from Dhawan. Drags his shot to deep midwicket for a jogging run
half-tracker on off, and pulled along the grass to deep midwicket
misfield! Allows SRH to take another run. Full on middle, and the batsman comes down the wicket. Misses the slog, but manages to play it to backward square. The infielder can't collect
full just outside off, and driven down the ground to long off for a jogging single
full on middle, and the front-foot defense finds his outside edge. Goes to short third man, but that doesn't stop the batsmen from stealing a single
good length on off, and turning away from Dhawan. He punches it away from his body, but finds the man at deep extra cover
on middle, and angling into his pads. Rocks onto the back foot and punches it past the non-striker to long on
good length on off, and turning away from the batsman. Nudged to the cover-point region, and calls it early for a run
length ball on middle, and Williamson bends his knees and then pulls this along the ground to the square boundary. Perfectly placed
flighted again, but this time he gets his dancing shoes on. Comes down the wicket, and tries to slog it over long on, but can't get the distance. Taken at long on!
flighted on leg stump, and Dhawan pushes it nochalantly to the long-on region. Comfortable single
on middle, and turns it off the back foot to the midwicket region. Calls early for the single
ooo, googly! Full on middle, and turning into the batsman. Chops it towards the leg side for a quick run

short_text: JPR Scantlebury-Searles to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: back of a length on off, and this time the pull has been dragged to the sweeper fielder on the leg side. They jog across for the run
full toss, but very wide outside off. Goswami mistimes the cut to sweeper cover for a solitary run

short_text: JPR Scantlebury-Searles to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: good length outside off, and that's been whipped off the back foot to the vacant midwicket region. Searles goes chasing behind it, picks it up, and has an aim at the striker's end. Misses.
good length on leg stump, and angling into the batsman. He backed away to make some extra room, so the bowler did well to follow him. Punched towards cover with soft hands
good length outside off, and he backs away to slap this cut past the infield. Enough time to take the second run as well

short_text: JPR Scantlebury-Searles to Goswami, no run
long_text: wild! Short on leg stump, but going down the leg side. He's lucky that the batsman had shuffled across to the leg side as well. Hits his shoulder guard and goes to the keeper

short_text: Kuldeep to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: good length on off, and Dhawan goes deep into his crease this time. Pulls it along the ground in front of square, and that shot eventually beats wide long on! Ends the over with a boundary

short_text: Kuldeep to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: pitches outside leg, but spins across the batsman's body. Defended
flighted on middle and off, and Goswami attempts the late cut. Mistimed to short third man this time
flighted on leg stump, and he plays the reverse sweep! That audacity. Quick to adjust his position, and then drags the shot behind square
full on off, but turns into Dhawan this time. Cuts it to cover point for a quick run, but he played that shot from very close to his body. Always a dangerous option

short_text: Kuldeep to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: flat on off, and turning away from the batsman. Flat-batted back to Kuldeep off the back foot
short of a length outside off, punched to long-on off the back foot

short_text: Narine to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: short and wide outside off, looks to cut and is beaten on the outside edge
length ball down leg side, misses on the sweep

short_text: Narine to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: short of a length on leg stump and pulled straight to midwicket

short_text: Narine to S Dhawan, SIX runs
long_text: so simple. Gets to the pitch and calmly lofts this over long-on with a clean swing. Narine doesn't get grip or turn outside off because of that big stride
short of a length outside off, opens the face and runs it to short third man
short of a length and cramping him. He pushes it back down the pitch

short_text: Chawla to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: guides it past short third man. Chawla made to pay for his leg stump line. It's full, it's fast enough - Dhawan shovels it past the fielder
full on middle stump, driven down to long-on
loopy length ball outside off. Goswami reaches out for the aerial drive over off side but doesn't get to the pitch. Just manages to clear cover with the chip
short of a length on the stumps, tapped into the leg side with soft hands
through Uthappa! He's expecting this slice from Goswami to turn to his right at extra cover, but it goes straight after pitching a couple of yards in front
short of a length slider outside off, cut into the turf off the under-edge

short_text: Narine to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: full at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
short of a length at leg stump, tickled to short fine off the back foot
short of a length on middle stump, punched straight to midwicket off the back foot
short of a length on off stump, dabbed to short third man
well fielded. Overpitched ball outside off, bludgeoned off the front foot but Rana lunges to his right and stops one-handed at cover point
tossed up at off stump, gets on his knee and drills it along the floor to long-off
smart. Very smart batting from Goswami. He's dismantled Russell. Leaps to cover the bounce of another short one in the corridor and caresses it between point and backward point
short ball clears Karthik! This explodes from the pitch. He bangs it into the corridor and it keeps on climbing after passing the batsman
opens up the off side again! Superb stuff from Goswami. This one is overpitched on off stump and he uses the room to slice it through cover point
good bouncer but it's the second one! Free-hit coming up. Russell wins the battle, following Goswami down leg side with this bouncer, but it's come at a cost
oh glorious! Goswamu backs away and launches this length ball from his stumps far, far over extra cover! That is classy. Uses his wrists to open the face at the perfect moment

has him with the bouncer. The batsman has reviewed though, after what seems like a top-edge has been taken at slip .it's off the helmet. Got in an awful position for the hook. So bad, in fact, that the bat isn't anywhere near the ball. Thumps the top of the helmet and hangs up for Rana. No damage to the batsman from that impact. Life's good.
attempted offcutter lands on a length but is down leg side
length ball in the corridor and he's into the punch too early. Hits the inside half of the bat and rolls back to the bowler

short_text: Prasidh to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: good length just outside off, pushed into the covers on the up

short_text: Prasidh to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: length ball on middle stump, punched back at the bowler on the up

short_text: Prasidh to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: just evades Uthappa's hand at backward point. Short-ish again and Dhawan slices hard from underneath. Uthappa stretches to his right and can't hold on
bouncer at leg stump. Gets on top of the bounce nicely and drops it pitch side with soft hands
looks for the full inswinger. It starts at leg stump and goes down
short of a length at off stump, squares him up as he goes on the back foot. Thick outside edge down to third man

short_text: Prasidh to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: poor start. Short and wide and slanted across Dhawan. We've seen him long enough to know what that means. Spanks it over backward point
length ball on middle stump, drops it into the covers with soft hands to pinch the single

short_text: Rana to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: short of a length just outside off, sudbued flat-batted drive straight to extra cover

short_text: Rana to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: full ball down leg side, paddles it straight to short fine

short_text: Rana to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: length ball on off stump, tapped to extra cover off the back foot

short_text: Rana to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: another short of a length ball hooping in sharply at off stump. Dhawan chops straight to short third man

short_text: Rana to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: short of a length ball skidded into the man he calls bhaiyya in the Delhi Ranji team. Bhaiyya stands tall and slaps it to the cover boundary

swung away, but this is a steepler towards deep midwicket. Sanju Samson is running IN, K Gowtham is running back from the ingield, the ball curves in the air and as it comes down, Samson oses balance and fumbles, but Gowtham has the presence of mind to take this on the rebound. Stunning win for the Royals.  Bangalore boys Gowtham and Gopal have booted RCB out of IPL 2018.
reverse paddled past short third man. Lost his balance, was made to look ungainly but somehow connected. If he missed, would've been plumb in front of middle.
looks to back away and loft, can only get the bottom of the bat, rolls back to the bowler.
looks to muscle this short ball, toe-ends it and it rolls wide of the pitch
superb yorker angled in towards the base of leg stump, Chahal somehow manages to keep that out
hit back hard but Archer stops it with his boot, they'll scamper a run nonetheless
walks across to ramp this over short fine leg, beaten as he had no pace to work with.

full ball that tails in to beat his defence, there's an appeal for lbw. In the meanwhile, the non-striker hares across to force Chahal into the bye. Klaasen fires a throw at the bowler's end, a direct hit and Chahal would've been gone.
he's got more elevation than distance, would've been six at Chinnaswamy but the boundaries in Jaipur are huge. Swung away and Gowtham takes a simple catch off the toe end at wide long-on.
slower length ball outside off, deviates away. Southee heaves but can't connect.
lofted, but on the bounce to sweeper cover
full toss, swung across to the leg side off the inside edge, down to deep square
walks across the stumps, holds his shape and hoicks this slower ball into the gap at deep midwicket
slower length ball from around the stumps, squeezed to point for a quick single
full toss and he steps out to wallop this over mid-off. Clean strike
flicked neatly down to deep square leg.
slower length ball but way outside off, Siraj looked to upper cut but let it go. Two bounces to the keeper.
thick inside edge onto the pad, rolls to the off side for a single
full toss which angles in as he looks to flick, beaten. Hit high on the pad.
wild heave across the line to a slower length ball, beaten.
squeezes the drive to cover, a direct hit at the bowler's end from Rahane and he would've been gone
driven firmly to cover, Rahane misfields but it wouldn't have mattered because they've taken a single anyway
he's walloped this pull to deep square. Too short, Siraj had decided he'll pull no matter what. Hit it cleanly too.
shapes to squeeze this yorker outside off, beaten.
slower one, dipped on Siraj as he lunges forward and blocks
the middle and off stump has been flattened. Right through Umesh's defence. Hits the hard length this time, he played all around it. Royals roar.

stunning from Klaasen! Catch of the match. Sarfaraz looks to play a late cut, but strangely to another slower ball. Surely he can't be trying dinky strokes like those without pace to work with? Doesn't matter, he has to go. Klaasen's anticipation is top notch as he moves quickly to his right, dives low and puts his right hand out to pluck that inches from the ground.
pulls too early, misses and the short ball hits him below the helmet grille. Seems okay, and we'll carry on.
steps out to hoick but is deceived by the slower delivery that spins away past the outside edge to the keeper
ramps this up and over, but down to third man. Once again didn't have the pace to ramp this fine.
looks for the late dab off this length ball, but had no pace to work with, beaten. On the bounce to the keeper
lofted cleanly over mid-off. Picked the length up and went over.
length outside off, bunted wide of cover for a quick single
tucks this with the spin to short fine leg.
drives, gets a thick edge again that rolls to Unadkat at short third man.
googly that he lands outside off, Southee lunges forward and blocks
thick edge past short third man, they scamper back for the second.
beaten on the drive, sharp turn again from Sodhi.
touch short, pulled towards wide long on for a single
too full, drills this straight to cover. Brilliant spell from Shreyas
stretches out and defends this tossed up delivery with soft hands.

misreads the googly, gone. That could be the final nail in RCB's coffin this season? Class from Shreyas Gopal! Lands this outside off, AB is sucked into the drive, but is done in by the length as well as the ball rips back in to beat the inside edge. Klaasen is alert as he pulls off another superb stumping.
lunges forward and defends gently into the off side as they scamper a single
goes back into the crease and dabs this gently.
touch short outside off, punched to deep point for an easy single

shapes to drive, doesn't get to the pitch, is beaten for turn, and gets a thick edge that has been taken beautifully by Rahane at slip. Excellent captaincy to have himself stationed there. Superb from Sodhi. Dragged him forward into the drive, deceived him in flight and thank you very much. RCB slide further.
drives but the ball holds its line, thick inside edge to square leg.
squared up, leading edge that rolls wide of point for a quick single
eased with the spin to deep cover as he jogs the single

too short and he gets punished! So the single has now resulted in a boundary that brings up AB's sixth half-century this season. Too short, he stays his ground and flat-bats this into the gap at deep midwicket
tossed up outside off, AB drives to a misfielding Samson at sweeper cover, ran in too quickly and couldn't bend down properly. Gives away an extra single
rocks back and pulls this short ball to Samson at deep midwicket.
chops this cut to cover. Sharp turn from length again for Shreyas
eased with the spin to long off

there's the big wicket. Mandeep runs down under pressure to go over the top, beaten by sharp turn and Klaasen executes a straightforward stumping. Superb bowling, nicely tossed up him and deceived him in flight.  Big moment in the match.
dabs this to short third, looks for a single but is sent back
works this gently past midwicket for an easy single
works this with the spin to long-on, picked the googly off the hand.
eased with the spin to deep cover, sensibly done.
leading edge as this rolls to short third man. Mandeep was squared up, looked to work this to midwicket. Sharp turn for Sodhi
the googly that rips back in from length on off, worked to deep midwicket
driven nicely into the gap at sweeper cover, back for the second comfortably
steered with the spin to point

he's chipped this back to Shreyas, who leaps high to take an excellent return catch. The double-strike returns to stun RCB, the blue flags are out. The googly has done the trick. He's a short man, but timed his jump superbly.
driven with the spin to sweeper cover
turns this gently towards square leg with the spin to get off the mark

slides one across, Parthiv shapes to pull but this beats the underedge as he misses. In doing so, he dragged his back foot forward and it was on the line when the bails were whipped off. Stunning work from Klaasen. Parthiv's done his job though.
eased with the spin to long-off
defended back with the spin to the bowler. Didn't get to the pitch as he looked to loft over
too close to cut, goes through anyway. Can only squeeze this straight to point.
slides one from length outside off, cut away to deep point
leading edge but eludes the infield, on the bounce to long off. Parthiv looked to stretch out and work this leg side but was deceived by the googly.
shapes to drive, gets a thick inside edge past midwicket

to short again, he rocks back and pulls to deep midwicket where Archer makes a mess of it. Did all the hard work in getting to the ball, but as he tried to get up and recover to throw the ball back in, he ended up palming this over the boundary.
welcomes him with a reverse sweep past short third man. Flatter one that spins away from outside off, so AB was hitting it with the spin. Easy, he just helped it along.
length, spins away outside off, whipped to long-on
gets the front foot across and whips this fuller one through midwicket
under edge that gets through first slip. Not sure that carried. Nope, it didn't. Fell just short of him and bounced over him. They take three
gets down to sweep a length ball and gets a top-edge through backward square leg
short and wide, cut to sweeper cover
pitched up on middle and leg, driven to long-on
opens the face to a back of a length delivery and steers to short third man who dives and gets a hand to it. Stopped a certain boundary
shot! Extremely full outside off, and Parthiv drills it through extra cover with exquisite timing

dropped. Would have been a stunning catch but Samson gets his hands to it but can't hold on. Samson isn't standing as behind as he'd like. Parthiv swings at this length ball from outside off and crunches it off the middle to deep midwicket where Samson leaps and gets his right hand up but the ball pops out at the last minute
sees AB back away and drops it at a back of a length on the leg-stump line, and AB pulls it away to square leg
short of a length, backs away and punches to cover
swings wildly at this wide fuller ball and gets an outside edge that gets over short third man and carries to the boundary
leg-side fuller ball, clipped to backward square leg
short of a length, cuts him in half and goes over the stumps after missing the inside edge
oh, what a shot! Where do you bowl to this man! Advances down the ground and gets right under the ball before crunching it straight down the ground. Got so under it that his nose was over it
full and wide, crunched to sweeper cover
opens the face to one outside off and misses
full and angled in, he just has so much time to get in position, and then uses his wrists to flick it through midwicket
short of a length, this is a cutter, and AB make sure to give himself enough room, before punching it crisply with loads of timing through extra cover
tries to force a cut from close to the body and knocks it towards point
length ball, just outside off, tentatively defends into the surface as the ball lands close to the stumps
short and angled into him, can't be bowling there to AB, who pulls it away to deep backward square leg
short of a length on off, gets an inside edge to midwicket
full and flat on middle and leg, driven down to long-on

gone, Kohli's gone! This is a huge wicket for Royals. You got the feeling Kohli was playing for the 15.5 over requirement. Charges down the ground to force the pace, not quite full enough and he swipes only for the ball to spin in from a length and flatten the stumps
backs away and swings wildly at this back of a length delivery and misses. Gets past the keeper as well after missing leg stump
just back of a length, flat, punched wide of long-on
shortish on middle, curves in and he backs away and whips it to mid-on
flat length ball, punched to deep midwicket
and again. Archer drops it short to Parthiv who leans back and helps it over the keeper. This time the timing's so good that it carries all the way
short of good length, cuts into him from outside off and gets an inside edge to the on side
gets a top-edge to a short ball that drops short of deep midwicket
backs away to a short of a length ball and swings and misses
gets an inside edge to a back of a length delivery outside off
what a shot! Oh, that's stunning. Arches back to a short delivery that climbs outside off and just uses the pace to help it over with a ramp
backs away to force a cut but makes no contact and loses balance as the ball nearly shaves off-stump
shifts back to a short of a length delivery that curves into him and hurriedly whips it away to the on side
pitched up outside off, driven down to long-on
flat back of a length ball outside off, Kohli fends and gets an inside edge, lucky to not chop on
tucked to midwicket
length outside off that stays low, Kohli shuffles and the ball sneaks from beneath

walks across, so Southee fires this full and wide, he can't carve it so decides to scoot a bye. Parthiv flicks the underarm throw to Southee, who breaks the bails at the bowler's end with Gowtham not even in sight.
bowls this full and wide, inside the wide line though as Gowtham leaves.
squeezes this full delivery to short third man, a direct hit at the bowler's end from short third man and Gowtham would've been gone.  As it turns out, they sneak in an overthrow
too full, too straight and banged over long off. Hitting right out of the top drawer. Reach, height and timing - everything perfect for that stroke.
pulled magnificently. What were you doing inside the dressing room for so long, KG? Goes short and wide, Gowtham is across in a jiffy as he nails this pull in front of square to perfection.
squeezes this full length delivery straight to extra cover

looks to clear long off, but no timing and Moeen takes a simple catch at the ropes. Klassen backed away, Siraj bowled it full and wide. Slowed the pace down as well, so he couldn't get any timing on that as well despite having a good reach. Useful knock nonetheless.
sees him backing away and bowls a slower one outside off, Klaasen can't reach this. Nice awareness from Siraj
skiddy bouncer, Klassen fetches this pull from way outside off, gets it into the gap between deep midwicket and long on
full toss, he walks across and then scoops this deep into the stands at fine leg. Siraj looked for a yorker, missed his length completely.
carved away over backward point, clears the ropes. Opened the bat face and then got underneath the full length delivery to put this away. Lovely
right into the blockhole, Tripathi backs away and squeezes this to cover
toe-ends a slog to long on, called two but had to pull out as AB came around quickly.
down on one knee as he slogs this to deep midwicket where Kohli covers good ground and then dishes in a dive to stop that. The recovery too was top notch
slower and fuller outside off, Tripathi looked to biff this over midwicket but swung through early and missed.
dipping yorker on middle and leg, toe-ends a lofted hit to long on
backs away to to over the off side, Southee sees this and lands the slower ball wide but gets this outside the wide line. Rolls to Parthiv
too full, yorker length on off, drilled to long-off
right into the blockhole on middle, squeezed to long on
drifts in and gets some fizz off the delivery from length on middle, defended back.
top-edges a reverse sweep, can't get it past short third man.
swung across the line, but on the bounce to long on. Dragged it from wide outside off.
hit hard but can't pick the gap, straight to long off
tossed up on middle and leg, gets to the pitch and whips this to long on
flatter and fuller on off, Klaasen gets a thick inside edge on the drive past midwicket
drills this full delivery to wide long-off, doesn't want to chance a second against Kohli's strong arm.
slower and fuller outside off, slapped to deep cover as they hare back for the second
backs away and punches this length ball on the up between cover and mid-off. Lovely timing.
thick inside edge, flies past leg stump into the fine leg boundary. Went for a pull, no position to play it.
skiddy length ball back in from wide of the crease, Klaasen hops back and defends
slips back in to beat the underedge as Klaasen looks to punch on the up.
late cut, but straight to Sarfaraz at short third man
good, clean strike. Down the ground as he gets to the pitch and lofts it straight into the sightscreen. Magnificent timing and use of the feet
dabs this gently but straight to short third man
gets outside the line of off and works this to deep midwicket where de Grandhomme misfields to concede the second. Ran in too quickly, then lost his balance as he attempted a one-handed pick-up
punched back to the bowler. Looked to work it from way outside off towards midwicket
flatter on middle, worked wide of midwicket
full outside off, drilled off the inside of the bat towards mid-on

make that three in one over! Umesh is producing another sharp burst of bowling. And this is a stunning delivery. An extremely full ball, curving into him at pace and dipping to hit the pad. Klaasen reviews and could the angle save him here? No, it's actually an inside edge. Clear deflection onto the pad. Top delivery nonetheless
length, angled in at off, flicked to the left of deep midwicket
short of a length, defended in front of off from the crease

straight to short midwicket. Umesh again provides RCB with crucial strikes. Royals cannot afford to slow down anymore, and Samson has paid the price for checking his stroke here. Closes the face from outside off to a length ball and the follow-through isn't great as he's caught in two minds. Chips it straight to Moeen Ali

swings across the line to heave it over the leg side and gets hit on the pad. Umesh turns around and appeals and the umpire takes a long time to give it. Rahane asks for the review. A little too full for him to attempt that heave with a half-angled bat as the ball sneaks from underneath after keeping a little low. Seems to be be hitting the stumps, but he did take a big stride across which is what could save him. Nah, actually, it's umpire's call on impact
again floats it up well away from the batsman, forcing him to reach out for a drive to sweeper cover
takes it away from him and spins away, and that's got to be a wide. Tripathi was expecting the call, which is why he let it go. But not called by the umpire
comes down the track and goes inside-out to the left of long-off

comes down the track and heaves blindly without getting behind the line, gets a thick outside edge that runs away to third man. Nicely done by Chahal to flight it up and draw the batsman forward but taking it away from him
length ball on leg, pushed back to the right of the bowler
flat slider on leg, swept to deep square leg
comes down the track and there is an absolute lack of pace at 103.7kmph. Chips it straight over and the ball crashes on the bounce into the sightscreen
skews this short one off the top portion of the bat to deep midwicket. No pace again at 111.7kmph. Fifty for Tripathi
short around off, tries to pull and gets an under edge to deep square leg
cuts very late and finds backward point. Boundaries have completely dried up. They need some desperately
gives the charge and ends up awkwardly slapping a length ball to long-off
length, cuts into him at off, punched to wide long-on
fullish outside off, driven away to deep point
walks a long way across to paddle this one and gets hit on the pad as it rolls away to short fine leg. Impact outside off. Not too far away though
short and sitting up nicely on off, pulled to deep midwicket
back of a length, walks across prematurely and pulls it away to deep midwicket
full outside off, drilled down to long-on
pacy length ball outside off, uses that pace as he opens the face and runs it down to third man
full outside off, flicked away across the line to deep midwicket
length on off, whipped away wide of long-on
walks down the ground and waits for this slower one to come on before picking the gap between midwicket and long-on. Pushes back for a quick second
pats a length ball to midwicket for one
this one's the worst of the lot. Way down the leg side. That's three wides in the over
full and straight on off, crunches a drive to long-off
slid down the leg side again. Poor from de grandhomme
fuller ball outside off, slower in pace, and he mistimes the whip between midwicket and long-on. Kohli and Southee converge and Kohli slides and picks it up
sprays it down the leg side and gets past the attempted glance
shortish outside off, opens the face to third man
full outside off, carved away over the covers. Uppish but through the gap
slower length ball, angling in, tucked away through square leg
full outside off, leans into a drive to the left of sweeper cover
fullish at off at 144.8kmph, flicked between mid-on and midwicket
fullish length outside off, driven away to sweeper cover
pushes forward early and chips a punch to a length ball that nearly carries to backward point
good length outside off, opens the face to third man
short and wide, slapped to sweeper cover
crunches this length ball to cover where AB dives and saves it
gets an under-edge that nearly finds the stumps. Too much bounce outside off for him comfort and he can't et on top of it as he tries to pull
back of a length outside off, opens the face to third man
uses the inwards angle to turn around and guide it to backward square leg
too much bounce, catches him off guard and raps him on the pad as he misses the flick. Southee belts out an appeal, but then again, bounced too much
short of a length at 132.9ks on middle stump, pulled away to backward square leg
back of a length, cuts into him, whipped off the pads to deep backward square leg
full and straight on off, drilled down to long-on
short of a length, tucked around the corner to deep fine leg
sharp turn from middle, he goes back and defends back
wrong'un which he gently nudges towards midwicket for a quick single
pushed through quicker on off, defended with soft hands to the off side
drifts this in fuller on middle and leg, worked wide of short midwicket
shortens his length, Tripathi quickly transfers his weight back and slaps this through midwicket
steps out, gets outside leg and then lofts this inside-out over cover. Magnificent
steps out and hammers this down the ground, AB dives full stretch to his right at mid-off to save a certain boundary
angles this slower delivery down to third man
nips back in from outside off, firmly defended between cover and point
looks to biff this pull, no timing and just manages to get it into the gap at midwicket. Hit the top part of the bat
slower length ball on off, worked across to square leg
whipped superbly. Beats deep square leg. Lovely wrist work. Just a touch short from Southee, Rahane used the depth of the crease superbly to put that away.
short-arm jab, gets it up and over midwicket. This kept a touch low but the timing was superb. Fetched the pull from outside off.
pulled, but not in control. Gets this wide of mid-on
right in the slot, thumped over the bowler's head. No chance for mid-on. Lovely followthrough as he picked the length up
right behind the line of the length ball as he defends.
Lovely timing! Opened the bat face late to ease this behind point. Pure timing
punched straight to point

goes through him! Sharp turn to beat the inside edge and hit the pad. Big appeal from Parthiv, nearly four appeals. Moeen joined in late. May have been missing leg stump. RCB don't review Moeen hinted to Kohli that it may have gone down leg.
sharp turn from length outside off, defended back
gets outside the line of the stumps and sweeps this with the spin over deep backward square leg. The big stride was the key, neatly executed.
drifts in a quicker delivery on middle and leg, eased to long on
turns this gently towards the man coming in from mid-on, aggressive running. Misfield from Chahal
touch short, he rocks back and pulls to AB at deep midwicket
beaten by a beautiful away-swinger! Leans to drive, no feet and simply goes through with hard hands, done in by late swing. Zips through to the keeper.
gets half a stride in as he defends this length ball to point

he's gloved this down leg, so the move hasn't worked. Archer swivels back to pull but is cramped for room as the ball angles back in, faint little edge through to Parthiv. Fourth duck of the season for Jofra.
stands tall and punches this length ball to point
skiddy bouncer, Archer is late on the pull, toe-ends it to midwicket
length ball on middle, Archer works this to midwicket
drifts back in from wide of the crease, lands on length and spins back in. Tripathi defends. Excellent first over
slows it down nicely, tossed up on middle, Tripathi lunges forward and blocks
flatter and fuller outside off, Tripathi prods outside to get a thick inside edge. Excellent bowling
slider on middle, defended back with soft hands
reaches out and drives this straight to extra cover
crunched to wide long-off where superman AB hares around to his left to stop that
142 kph, full and straight, skewed away to long-on. And Daredevils take away a 34-run win.
a slower ball on off, inside-edged to square leg
full down leg, Chahar walks right across and misses a swing. Good non-call, not a wide.
short and wide, under-edged to the keeper for a run.
a full delivery outside off, Bravo backs away and chips a lofted drive towards cover. Shankar backtracks and takes it comfortably.
a low full toss down leg, worked to deep square leg for a run.
length on middle and leg, 134 kph, off the pad to third man. Sensational night for Harshal Patel: 4-0-23-1 and a terrific cameo.
a shortish and wide delivery outside off. And again, Jadeja plays over the line, another dot.
a shortish delivery outside off, swings too early again, to deep square leg.
a short and wide delivery outside off, cut to deep point for a run. That's the better option in these conditions, can't concede sixes to that.
a short slower ball down leg, worked to short fine leg, who falls over the ball, concedes an additional run.
just clears the boundary. Full on middle and off, Jadeja lofts the ball elegantly. Very high but just enough and clears the straight boundary.

that's the game! A stunning over this from Boult. Not just because he has conceded just five and taken out MS Dhoni, but his execution has been awesome. A low full toss from Boult, on middle and off. Dhoni broings out his bottom hand and whips the ball flat. But not enough distance. Iyer runs in and takes a good catch.
a full delivery on middle and leg, swung away to deep square leg for a run.

and now the short ball, around middle and leg. Pulled away to midwicket. Boult goes for the catch but falls over. Long-on throws wildly to the keeper and somehow Mishra gets around to his left to prevent four overthrows. CSK get three
awesome bowling. He has a clear plan (the easy part) and then he executes to Dhoni with deadly accuracy (soooo hard).
it's wide, but on a length. Dhoni's eyes light up and he swings, but toe-ends it back to the keeper. DOT.
creamed that, but he finds deep midwicket. Back of a length on off, pulled away with fierce power.

Avesh does not go for the catch. The bowler says go for it. Full and wide outside off, Jadeja looks to go over cover but the ball skews off the outside half, to the sweeper cover fielder. On the bounce!
and again. Another short and wide slower ball, chopped away down to gully for one.
short on middle and leg, pulled away down to short fine leg. Another dot.
another dot! A short slower ball outside off, Dhoni misses an attempted dab to third man.
a good length delivery on off and middle, worked to deep square leg for a run.
well bowled, the right length. Quick outside off, not full, not short. Jadeja misses a cut.
the legbreak outside off, pushed to cover. Excellent spell from the young leggie: 4-0-21-1.
short around off, pulled to deep midwicket
flat on off, worked to long-on. Dhoni knows what he's doing. Letting Jadeja take the risks now, he'll stay there till over No. 20 and take full responsibility then
flat and straight, driven to long-on for a run.
that's sloppy. Short and wide outside off, carved away to deep cover for a couple. A misfield from Harshal allows two.
