gets to the pitch and Jadeja goes boom! A googly outside off, Jadeja runs down, gets there and launches a massive six over the bowler's head. 89 metres back.
another dart, quick down leg. Dhoni misses a sweep. Struck on the pad.
quick and straight, pushed back to the bowler
tossed up outside off, worked to long-on with the spin.

top-edged sweep, down to short fine leg. It's always risky sweeping a wristspinner for this very reason. The googly ALWAYS produces extra bounce because there are more revolutions on the ball. So you'd rather go from bottom to top while sweeping. But Billings tries to keep this down, takes a thick leading edge straight to the fielder. Also, he had to drag the shot from well outside off.
a very quick delivery on off, maybe the low full toss, smashed to long-on
spin for Mishy. Flat on off and middle, the ball spins and beats the bat.
just short of cover! That's the shot I was referring to, dancing down and trying to work the ball to midwicket. But the ball spins away, takes the leading edge and lobs towards cover.
shortish and wide, the googly. Cut to point
just misses leg stump! The googly down leg, Billings looks for the reverse-swat (he plays that as well very well). But bottom-edged and just misses leg stump
runs down the pitch, meets the ball as it pitches and skews a lofted drive to long-on
too full, on-driven to long-on

he's picked out deep midwicket. And Lamichhane is pumped! That was a googly that Raina picked as soon as it was released because of the line - it was down leg. So Raina cleared his front leg and looked to smash that over midwicket, but he did not get underneath it well enough. All he did was pick out the fielder.
a very full delivery and Dhoni just pushes it back.
the googly outside off, Raina closes the bat face and gets a leading edge towards extra cover for a run
a legbreak outside off, tapped to point for a run. And Dhoni has 6000 T20 runs
quick and flat outside off, punched to cover from the crease
95 kph, flat and quick on middle and leg, pulled to deep midwicket
the flat delivery outside off, pulled to deep midwicket for a single.
flat and wide outside off, carved to point.
flat outside off, pushed to cover. 95 kph.
an offbreak on leg, worked to deep midwicket for a run
short and wide from Maxwell, and even though the ball is turning back in, Dhoni creates room by generating some power through the line of the ball and scything the ball through backward point.
flat outside off, punched to long-off from the back foot

that's the Raina trademark. A flat delivery outside off from Maxwell, Raina lofts the ball over cover so easily. I remember him playing a similar shot in the second IPL, with Matthew Hayden at the non-striker's end. Now, Hayden on air says "there is no better player of that shot"
another googly, on middle and leg. You can read that based on where it pitched. Nudged to square leg.
lots of flight outside off, driven with the spin to long-off
flat and wide outside off, chopped to extra cover for a tight run
comes down and chips the ball towards long-on, in typical Dhoni fashion
naughty. A googly outside off, punched away to the bowler's left. He dives over the ball in his follow-through
a full delivery outside off, drilled to deep cover for a run

good catch by Maxwell! He's hit that well, but he's met the ball too early. Rayudu came charging at the bowler but it was an offcutter. So Rayudu was through the shot a fraction of a second earlier than he would have liked. Therefore, the ball met the bat with its bat face already pointing up. That means the ball will always go higher up than further back. Hangs in the air for a long time. Maxwell takes a good reverse-cupped catch.
a short delivery down leg, helped down to fine leg for one. Another slower ball, 112 kph.
full and straight, pushed to long-on. Another fifty for Rayudu, off 28 balls. Sparkling form.
a slower ball down leg, worked to deep midwicket. Taking pace off the ball is a good option here.
better line, more on middle and leg, worked to deep square leg for one.
an excellent yorker but the line is errant. It's slightly leg side-ish and Rayudu flicks the ball easily through backward square leg for four. Just had to place the ball there.
full on off, and it's flatter this time. Driven to mid off, and they're taking the quick run. Rayudu would've been gone, except the fielder can't get the direct hit.
flighted on middle, but Rayudu comes down the wicket, converts it into a full toss, and then thumps it over Mishra's head. Oh, delighful.
full just outside off, and it's the one that's spinning away. Rayudu's quick to pick that, and drives it beautifully after getting to the pitch of the ball. Long off can't cut it off either
full on off, and defended back to the bowler off the front foot
full on leg, and Rayudu comes dancing down the wicket. Misses the drive, and it hits his front leg. Impact outside leg
bowls the cross seamer, almost like a pacer! Full on middle, and Raina pushes it towards midwicket and gets off strike
full on off, and Raina takes a big stride forward to drive to wide long on. He'll keep strike
fended by Raina on this occasion
full on middle, and worked off his toes to wide long on
full on off, and smothered with the spin to midwicket
full on off stump, from around the wicket. Defended off the front foot by Raina.
good length outside off, and punched off the back foot past the non-striker to long on
dropped first ball! Pant the guilty man. Good length outside off, and sliding further away from Raina. He tried to poke at it, but the ball found the outside edge. Oh dear
flighted on off, and turning away from Watson. He tries to lift it over Mishra, and this time it doesn't have the power to go over long off. Straight down Boult's throat in the deep
back of a length outside off, and he stands tall to punch it past the bowler's left. Mid off's there
flighted on middle, and Rayudu drives it straight back to Mishra. Meets the ball before it could even turn
full on middle, and Watson drives it to the cover region
full on middle, and he tries to slog it towards the leg side. The legspin takes the leading edge, and it goes to cover

short_text: Avesh Khan to Rayudu, SIX runs
long_text: Twenty-two runs off the over! What a way to end the Powerplay. Length ball on off, and Rayudu backs away to power it over wide long on this time. Swings away, and connects with it well enough for it to soar over the boundary rope. Big, big over. End of the Powerplay too, and they've taken the time-out as well

short_text: Avesh Khan to Rayudu, SIX runs
long_text: good length on middle, but Rayudu comes shimmying down the wicket. Swings his bat towards the leg side, and manages to get some connection behind it. Mistimed, but enough power for it to over the midwicket boundary

short_text: Avesh Khan to Rayudu, no run
long_text: good length on off, and Rayudu backs away before driving it through the cover region. A packed field inside the circle though

short_text: Avesh Khan to Rayudu, FOUR runs
long_text: four or six is the question! Drops just short of the boundary. Length ball on off and Rayudu swivels to slog it over the cow-corner region once again. Ten off three

short_text: Avesh Khan to Rayudu, no run
long_text: quick! Rayudu's too slow to play the pull. Short on off and angling into Rayudu. He tried to repeat that shot, but it's come off the bat's top half and over the bowler's head

short_text: Avesh Khan to Rayudu, SIX runs
long_text: full on off, and that's been thumped over cow corner! Once again Rayudu goes well to deep inside the crease, gets his front leg out of the way, and then powers it into the midwicket boundary

full on middle but angling into his pads. Watson misses the shot towards midwicket, and it raps him on his pads. Appeal for lbw turned down. Good decision, the bowler's natural angle would've taken it down the leg side
short on off, and Rayudu pirouettes on his toes to pull it to deep backward square
short outside off, and that's a wild shot from Rayudu. Tries to slap it over point, but absolutely no timing behind that. Through his shot way too early
slower ball, outside off, and Watson checks his slog. Muscles it over midwicket, and the ball falls in no man's land
full on off, and driven down the ground past the non-striker to mid on. No chance of a single
good length on off, and Watson rocks back to fend it off the back foot

short_text: Avesh Khan to Rayudu, no run
long_text: back of a length, but very wide outside off. Rayudu did shuffle across to the off side, but failed to connect with the cut. Through to Pant

short_text: Avesh Khan to Rayudu, FOUR runs
long_text: crunched through cover! Full, but just a bit too much outside the off side. Rayudu goes deep into his crease, and smashes it over extra cover. Great shot

length ball on off, and angling into Watson. He drops his hands, and defends it towards the leg side. Rayudu wants the quick single, and he manages to complete it easily. Watson looked kinda surprised by the pace!
full on off, and tries to slog towards the leg side. Slices it towards deep backward square though

short_text: Avesh Khan to Rayudu, no run
long_text: full on middle again, and almost a yorker this time. Dug away towards mid on, but no single on offer

short_text: Avesh Khan to Rayudu, no run
long_text: overpitched outside off, and Rayudu mistimes the straight drive. Plays it back to the bowler on this occasion
back of a length on leg stump, and Rayudu walks across to the off side. Whips it off his pads to square leg
on leg stump, but shaping down the leg side. Hits his pad though, and the ball drops near his toes. They scamper across for a run
yorker on leg! Great comeback ball, but Watson manages to dig it away towards the leg side
pulled for a flat six! Good length on middle, and way too comfortable for the big man. Thumps it over deep midwicket, with an excellent swing of the bat
good length on off, and gets big on Rayudu. He glances it down to third man to get off the mark
good length on off, and angling away from the batsman. Rayudu, playing his first ball, tries to defend towards cover, but the ball goes past his outside edge. Nice carry to Pant
full outside off, and turning into Watto again. Defended off the front foot to mid on
full outside off, and it's the legspinner. But Watson played for the googly, and the drive takes a leading edge. Goes to mid off
full just outside off, and defended towards the off side
flighted outside off, and it's the wrong'un this time! Turns sharply into Watson, who backs away and cuts to point
flighted outside off, and driven with the turn past cover. Iyer gives it a chase, and manages to pull it back. Abhishek Sharma cleans up
full on off, and going straight into Watson's pads. Defended back to the bowler off the back foot
back of a length on middle, and get big on Watson. He tried to defend off the back foot, comes off the bat's shoulder. Goes to third man
short on middle, and Watson manages to swivel and pull. Mistimes the shot to deep midwicket, and CSK are off the mark
full on middle, and this has been picked off his toes towards the leg side. Played to midwicket, but yet another dot
full on middle, and shaping into his pads again. Driven to mid off on this occasion. Three dots to start off
late inswing! But well defended by Watson. Full on middle, and angling back into his pads
good length outside off, and punched off the back foot to cover point
Bravo concedes 52 off four overs! That was the worst last over from Bravo I've seen ever. Ends with a full toss on off and Harshal smashes the ball straight back for six. Hits the sightscreen.
six more. A nice symmetry to this over: 6, 1, 6, 1, 6. In the slot again and Harshal drills a lofted drive over Bravo's head. Big hit again.
length down leg, worked to deep midwicket
another poor delivery. A length slower ball on middle and off, Shankar swats the delivery over midwicket. Picked the variation. Might want to change his line.
much better. A yorker outside off, jammed to long-on for one
that's a poor delivery. Right in the slot from DJ. A quick length delivery on middle and leg. A well-executed lofted heave over long-on. Full face of the bat.
a length delivery on middle and leg, slogged away to deep square leg.
excellent slower ball, the knuckle ball. On middle. A bit of extra bounce takes the ball over off and middle stump after beating a heave
a slower delivery outside off, mis-timed again to long-on for a run.
full and wide outside off, 134 kph, Harshal looked for a lap scoop but tapped it to point
a length delivery outside off, swatted to deep midwicket
just clears mid-off. A good length delivery outside off, Shankar chips a flat-batted swat over mid-off for a couple.
133 kph, a low full toss is worked away to deep midwicket for one.
a shorter slower ball outside off, flicked away into the gap at midwicket for two. Right in the gap. Even Sam Billings can't stop two.
a full toss on middle and leg, pulled away to deep midwicket. Very bad timing on that, under the waist.
full outside off, blocked to mid-off for a run. Nicely bowled from Bravo.
full on middle and leg, punched to long-on
that's a good slower ball, it deceived Harshal Patel. But he got there early and still flicked the ball over square leg for six. Enough power
a wide yorker that is well executed. Jammed away into the leg side.
digs it in, Shankar reads the length early, stays back and pulls over deep midwicket for a big six. Far too easy once he picked the length.
full down leg, worked to deep midwicket for one.
a back of a length delivery outside off, Shankar mis-times a pull to long-on for one
a short delivery outside off, the slower bouncer. Goes past Shankar's pull
a full delivery outside off, an open-faced dab to backward point.
boundary to end the over! That never hurts. Offcutter outside off, and slapped away to the point boundary
slower ball outside off, and Harshal waits for a long time before fending it back to the bowler
played to the man at deep square leg this time. On off, but angling into his pads. Billings in the deep
full toss outside off, and he plays the check-drive to cover. Well stopped!
deja vu! Same line, same length, same result. Good length on middle, and going down leg
good length on middle, but sliding down the leg side. A run added to Daredevils' total
full on off, and worked away towards deep midwicket this time. They walk across for one
yorker, outside off. And Patel squeezes it away towards point. Off the bat's toe end
lovely! Short on middle, and Shankar adjusts towards the off side, and flicks it fine past MSD's left. Collects four to end the over
full on off, and whips it off his pads to deep midwicket. Gets off the mark first ball

short on middle, and that's been top edged! Bhajji makes no mistake at mid on. Quicker ball, and his inexperience to the pace shows. Not as good a performance as last time for Abhishek. The ball got big on him, and eventually cramped him for space. Looks like it's the time-out as well
punched! But well stopped by Raina at cover. Stood tall, and played it well, but you know how good Raina is
plays it late, and chops it down to third man. Good length just outside off on this occasion
on off, and pushed off the back foot towards cover. Comes off the bat's outside half, and goes to deep backward point instead
plays it to midwicket to get off the mark. Nice use of the wrists to give it a whip

but he's gone this time! What a terrible way to get out. Full on leg, and he tried to play the reverse sweep. The quicker ball sneaks under his bat, and crashes into the leg stump. Pays the price for playing a pre-meditated shot
full on off, and turns away from the batsman. He defends down the wrong line, and MSD whips the bails off. Stumped? Naw, his back leg was always down
flat on middle again, and Shankar goes onto the back foot. Fended towards short cover
flatter on middle, and clipped off his pads to square leg. Two dots
full on off and driven to wide mid off
low full toss, and Shankar plays this towards wide long on. It was an attempted slower ball
full just outside off, and that's been drilled! Straight past Bravo, and even beats the man at long off! Bravo did well to get his feet out of the way
slower ball, and Maxwell mistimes to long on. It was full and wide outside off, and his attempted punch comes off the bat's inside half
full on off, and the straight drive goes to deep midwicket. That's because the bat turned in his hand
short on off, and he tries to hook it over square leg. Misses, and the ball goes through to MSD. Shankar looks at the umpire for a wide, but nope.
full on off, and pushed past the non-striker to long on. They walk across for another run
extras. Yorker, but outside leg. MSD does well to hang on to it
good length on off, and fended towards the off side
back of a length on off, and spinning away from Shankar. Tries to defend, but the ball sneaks just past his outside edge
full just outside off, and defended with the bat's open face to point
on leg stump, and clipped off his pads to midwicket. No one's there, so Jaddu has to go chasing behind it
gets off the mark first ball. Full on off, and pushed to wide long off with ease
full on middle and leg, and worked off his pads to deep midwicket. A walking single
full outside off, and Pant tries the big heave towards midwicket. Slices it though, and that's gone straight down third man's throat. Lungi gets Pant
slower ball, and a length delivery on leg stump. Pant shuffles across to the off side, and nudges it off his hips to deep midwicket
full on off, and Maxwell flicks it away to wide long on to get off the mark
cleaned him up! Iyer tries to make room and cut, but Ngidi bowls straight on off stump. Iyer misses, Ngidi hits. Crashes into the top of off stump
too close to his body for the cut! On the corridor of uncertainty, but Iyer attempted the square cut anyway. Through to Dhoni
back of a length on middle, and that's been pulled along the carpet. Man in the deep
he'll keep strike. Good length outside off and he walks down the wicket to tap it towards cover
flighted outside off, and Pant takes the bait! Slices it over Bhajji's head, and long off's getting under. Nope! Sails just over Bravo
grip and spin! On off, but turning away from Pant. Defended with soft hands
good length outside off, and cut away past point! Men there inside the circle, but Pant manages to thread the gap with perfection
tries the reverse, but can't connect! It was full outside off, but Pant expected it to be closer to him. Stopped by MSD
on his toes, and slogged over cow corner! Full on off, and muscled by Pant towards the leg side. The ball straightened after pitching, but Pant's just too good
full outside off, slogged away to long-on for one.
a slower ball outside off, driven to long-on for a run.
a slower ball down leg, Pant misses a flick. Off the pad to square leg.
a length delivery down leg, Pant swings across the line, off the thigh pad down to fine leg.
just over cover. Full outside off, chipped over cover for two. A sloppy effort from Thakur and Pant gets two
full outside off, Pant looks to drive but the ball goes past the outside edge, Just missed a straight ball.
angles this wide, but too wide. Called a wide.
a wide yorker outside off, jammed out. I wonder why spinners don't bowl that more, it's a very good defensive option, right?
and now a good single. Slow outside off, tapped to point for one
that's muscled. Feigns a forward movement then goes back, forcing a short delivery from Bhajj. Rocks back and carves his cut in front of cover. Lovely batting and execution
short and wide, 91 kph, carved away to deep point.
nicely bowled. Sees Iyer coming so he fires it wider. Defended to cover.
runs down and shovels a flick to long-on.
quick down leg, the pace beats Iyer's flick. Struck on the pad.
beautifully played. That's all class. Short and wide outside off, sliced away off the open face through backward point for four.
gets his body behind the ball, like my cricket coach used to say. Short and wide outside off, carved towards short third man. Harbhajan dives over the ball but his broad frame stops the ball.
on middle and leg, nudged away to deep midwicket again. One more run.
flat and wide outside off, wanted to slog sweep but had to improvise a dab to point.
on the pads from Jadeja, 96 kph, worked to midwicket for one.
130 kph, another bouncer on off. Pant gets over the bounce and pulls, but finds midwicket.
122 kph, a short delivery, aimed at the helmet. Pant watches this nicely, gets on top of the bounce and pulls through square leg for four. Nice.
and again! Wow, there is no improvisation or reassessment from Daredevils. Back of a length outside off, a swing and the ball goes over the bat.
full and wide outside off, another swing and miss from Pant.
full outside off, a leaden-footed drilled drive finds mid-off.
full and straight, some swing. Pant works the ball through backward square leg for a couple. He had to get bat on it because it swung back in.
awful bowling. Tripe. He digs a slower bouncer outside off with third man up? Iyer has four free runs if he makes contact: he does with an upper cut over Dhoni.
a slower ball down leg, Iyer stands his ground and slogs across the line. Misses. Struck on the pad, but going down leg.
clever batting! Makes room, clears his front leg, gets a ball to cut because it's short and wide. He goes from bottom to top and slices the ball over the infield, over point.

out with a direct hit! Good from Pant to trust his partner. But maybe he shouldn't have. A good length delivery down leg, Iyer pushes to mid-on, calls for one, realises his weight is on the back foot so he says no very late. But Pant is already down, he turns back and dives back. But the throw from the fielder is not accurate so he's fine. His wrist is not though. Some damage to his hand.
good length delivery on off, pushed to cover for one. That's much better cricket, if the ball is not there for the shot, you take one.

and it gets worse. What kind of a shot is that? It's a good length delivery on off, Shaw stands in his crease and looks to hoick the ball over midwicket. No feet movement, no regard for the fielder at long-on. Exuberance, I suppose. But all he can do is splice the ball to long-on. That was not a very pleasing innings.
flat and wide, Iyer tries an open-faced dab but misses.
dropped. Should have been taken. Quick and straight, it's another ugly across-the-line hoick that travels at head height to Thakur's right. He sticks out his right hand but the ball pops out.
good work. Flat and straight, Shaw slog-sweeps again over midwicket. Just clears the fielder. Thakur goes back and pulls the ball back in.
quick, flat and straight, defended
just over midwicket for a couple. Flat and straight, Shaw stays low and slogs a sweep over midwicket. He's looking quite bad with those strokes
full on off, quick. Iyer comes down and pushes away to long-off. More of a leading edge
back of a length outside off, Iyer makes room and slices a cut to backward point. Picks out the fielder very well. But a fumble allows one.
good length and straight, defended back towards mid-on

a full delivery on off, it's a wild slog over midwicket. Across the line. A thick outside edge races down to third man. I'm just wondering should such a young batsman be playing these shots so early in his career?
he's picked the length of that. A slower delivery on middle and leg, Shaw reads the length and swats over midwicket with so much ease. A poor delivery.
full delivery outside off, a massive swing and miss from Shaw.
a good change in length but too short. Dug in around middle, Shaw ducks. Too high.
swung away. Looking to go through the line. Full and wide outside off, Shaw throws his hands at the ball, mis-hit to mid-off
good length around off, Iyer defends towards point solidly
good length delivery outside off, tapped away towards backward point
that's better timing. Good length outside off, punched to wide mid-off. The fielder dives to his left and saves runs, Bhajji the fielder.
wow, Shaw struggling against swing! Full this time outside off, Shaw drives and is beaten comfortably. Very loose indeed
nice work. Good length outside off, outside-halved down to third man for a run. Thakur runs to his right and saves three.
was there glove on that? Sloppy glovework from Dhoni. Back of a length down leg, off the pad as Iyer misses a flick. Dhoni dives to his left, but the ball pops out for some leg byes.
beaten again! Good length delivery outside off, Shaw's feet are rooted in the crease as he drives. The ball beats the bat
hoicked away over square leg. Chahar tries the other one this time, the inswinger. Back of a length down leg, Shaw picks the length early and pulls easily over square leg
back of a length on middle and leg, punched away to mid-on from the back foot.
beaten on swing again! That's another beautiful delivery, back of a length outside off. Shaw looks to punch the ball through cover, but the ball swings and moves away late
back of a length outside off, Shaw stands tall and punches to cover from the back foot
beauty! Swing! A good length delivery pitched on off or just outside off. The ball pitches and swerves away from the prod late. Jaffa
yikes. That's a horror start. Short and very far down leg. Wide.

swings this full toss towards wide long-on, single is all Pandey will get.  Firecrackers go off in Bengaluru as RCB stay alive!  Sunrisers have been pipped at the post despite some shoddy bowling from Royal Challengers.
slices this up and over the infield, lands in no man's land behind point, they'll come back for the second. Chinnaswamy roars, the red flags are out
Kohli fluffs a simple chance at long-off  but Chinnaswamy applauds because they know barring a brain freeze, they can't lose this. Hooda looked to clear the ropes, toe-ended it
full toss angling down, swings and misses. Ball deflects off the pad towards short fine. A leg bye is all they'll get.  Siraj escapes with a juicy full toss
trying to be too cute, misses. Looks to ramp this over short third man but the length is too full and straight. Can't lay bat to it

scoops this straight to de Grandhomme at fine leg!  This went a mile in the air as he walked out to expose all three stumps and scoop, the ball went a mile, was swirling high and handsome, but de Grandhomme kept his composure to pull off a difficult catch. Is that the game? What a game.
misses his length, and gets pumped! Right underneath the length as he belts this to beat wide long-off.
in the blockhole, just inside the wide line. Pandey let it go, errs in judgment. Hits the turf in anger.
walks across to scoop, Southee bowls this full and wide, deflected gently to short third man, misfield from substitute Pawan Negi, but there's no damage done
into the blockhole perfectly, squeezed on the bounce over Southee's head, Kohli comes hustling in from long-off to keep it to a single
one bounce over long-off. Lined himself up, stayed right inside the crease, got underneath the length and clobbered this

gets underneath the length and belts this over, de Grandhomme comes in from long-on, and slides to stop but in doing so, ends up kicking this over the ropes. Oh, oh. Half-century for Pandey. CDG was late in getting down
slower ball gone wrong, way outside off.
right into the blockhole again, squeezes this to third man. Superb end to an over that started off badly
beaten! Once again tried to play that scoop over short third man. Beaten by the change in pace. Bowled that cross-seam
sees Pandey move around in the crease and spears this full and wide, but bowls this well outside the wide line outside off.
walks across to scoop, gets into a tangle as the ball hits the pad. They scamper a leg bye
swings this low full toss to deep midwicket
gets into position to scoop again, Siraj bowls length outside off, so Pandey gets down on one knee and ramps him cleverly over short third man. Stunning!

walks across the stumps and scoops this full delivery over short fine leg. All three stumps exposed. Siraj missed his yorker and watched him lap sweep. Pandey power. Finds an admirer in VVS from the dugout
nails another wide yorker to perfection, squeezed to cover. Just six from it, magnificent over under pressure
walks across and squeezes this wide yorker to Umesh again, at mid-off. Followed Williamson's movements there.
once again hit hard and flat, this time Umesh gets his body behind the line at mid-off.
drills this straight to mid-off, there's a misfield from Umesh to concede two when it should've been a dot. The Sydney harbour bridge
slower and fuller outside off, Pandey looks to go over Southee's head but mistimes it straight back to him. Dot ball
yorker-length outside off, Williamson walks across and squeezes this to third man
works this indrifter towards wide long-on, 100 partnership comes up
nurdled towards deep square as they jog the single
tossed up outside off, drilled to sweeper cover
short and fired down leg, wide called. Rightly so. Frustration for Chahal and RCB

turns this against the turn to deep square leg, the throw from de Grandhomme is on the bounce but a touch wide, Pandey hares back and is safe. Only just. Saved by a couple of centimetres. Great work by Parthiv as he gathered the throw and came up with an underarm flick onto the stumps
short and sliding in, Pandey swivels back and helps this to the deep square leg boundary. Poor ball from Chahal
turns this shortish delivery to deep square
clean strike to clear long-on. Big, big strike. Pandey is finding his hitting range, finally. Length ball from De Grandhomme, punished.
walks across and drives this full toss to the edge of the ring at cover
full toss angling in and he's deposited this over deep square leg. This is magnificent, didn't try to over-hit. All timing and class. Magical wrist work to flick this
slaps this to the edge of the ring at cover for a single
wrist work to the fore! Length and sliding into middle and leg, whipped to the square leg boundary
pulled, this was destined to reach the boundary, but Kohli put out a sliding stop, or nearly. Slipped in trying to pull it back in and ended up parrying it over the boundary
this is deep into the stands at deep midwicket. Fetched the pull from outside off, hit it off the middle. SRH aren't out of this by any means. Umesh has bowled out
whipped uppishly but down to AB on the bounce at deep midwicket
dabs this down to square third man
cut away, beats point like a tracer bullet as Shastri would say. Square third man stood no chance, magnificent timing.
defends this back down the ground to long-on. Was winding up to pull but the length wasn't there
cracked away but Moeen dives to his left to stop this wallop at cover
muscled over deep midwicket. May have challenged the sweeper in Hyderabad, not so in Bangalore. This was headed into the stands right from the moment he hit it.
right into the blockhole, squeezed to long-on
slower length ball again, slapped to deep cover
whipped Smith style over the infield towards deep midwicket, completes his half-century off 28 balls, top effort. 11th IPL fifty in his 28th game
full and straight on middle, quite loopy, Pandey mistimes this attempted lofted hit to long-on
slower length ball on off, punched to sweeper cover
steers this length ball straight to point
right into the blockhole on middle, squeezed to midwicket
slower length ball outside off, Williamson unfurls his wrists nicely. Opened it up nicely to slice this over point. Magnificent
pulled over deep midwicket! Flat hit. Too short, sitting up nicely, Williamson picked the length early
gets on top of the bounce and slaps this to a diving Mandeep at backward point, superb stop.
skiddy length ball on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
drifts in to sneak through the inside edge and hit the back pad. Drifting down.
gets forward and defends this full and flat delivery
touch short and angling in, turned to deep square leg
drifts in a full ball from wide of the crease, defended back
goes over cover, down to Umesh at sweeper cover, for a moment it looked like a risky second but Williamson completes it easily
fizz, turn and bounce. Williamson pokes and misses as this whizzes past the outside edge from middle and off
pulled on the bounce to AB at deep midwicket
works this with the spin to deep square leg this time
touch shorter and spinning back in, whipped to deep midwicket
goes over the ropes, clears deep midwicket. Clean loft, done with such class and composure. Got outside the line and then swung this with the spin. Delightful
whipped from outside off, bisects deep midwicket and wide long-on. Magnificent
hammers the pull to the square leg boundary. Too short from Moeen, he swivelled back and gave it a thump
eased down to Moeen at third man for an easy single
steps out, reaches out to this length ball and lofts this over cover. Clean strike
Sarfaraz has made a right royal mess at deep square leg!  Pulled straight to him, but he couldn't stop this as he bent low. Kicks the ropes in frustration
steers this length ball to third man to get off the mark
slapped to Mandeep on the bounce to point
forces this length ball to cover

today is a day of catches, physics-defying from AB!  It's that superman AB de Villiers. The catch is so good that Kohli and his mates do a 100 metre dash to run towards their mate. Magnificent, incredible. Hales steps out and muscles this length ball over deep midwicket, he thinks he's cleared it but doesn't know what's to come. AB leaps high, but realises the ball was swirling away. Instinctively puts his right hand out and pulls off a one-handed stunner even as it continued to curl away. Mind you. he was airborne when the ball lodged in his hand, so there was still a simple matter of having to land, keep control and be mindful of the ropes. All items checked. Wow
steps out and works this with the spin to deep square, Umesh is a busy man
sweeps but no timing, off a thick inside edge to deep square leg
was lining him up to go over long-on, but didn't get to the pitch and ended up defending from the crease
whipped uppishly to deep backward square leg, good work by Umesh
tossed up on middle and leg, worked wide of midwicket
uses the pace to run this down to third man
skiddy length ball, Williamson is cramped for room as he hops back and defends back past Umesh for a single
slower delivery on off, eased to third man
whips this from outside off towards Southee at deep midwicket
slashed away to point where Mandeep moves quickly to his right to stop that. Williamson has missed out
driven firmly but straight to mid-off
down one one knee as he helps this tripe delivery over short fine. Picked away without much fuss
slider on middle, he gets on top of the bounce and nudges to square leg
nudged uppishly towards midwicket
beats the diving mid-on fielder. Too much drift in from wide of the crease, Williamson meets this on the half-volley as he flicks imperiously
squeezes the drive to cover.

hit straight back!  Dhawan steps out to go over the top, can't get to the pitch and ends up chipping it back. Big wicket for RCB. Dhawan checked his shot because the ball gripped the surface and spun back in, may have been able to just clear the bowler had he gone through
length ball sliding into middle and leg, swung over deep square with an air of nonchalance

magnificent effort, but can't hold on at mid-on. Oh, Kohli has dropped a tough chance!  Drilled down the ground, Kohli took two steps to his left and then stretched to go with his left hand. Bobbled out as his elbow hit the turf
through with the pull early, hit on the body. Siraj changed the pace, rolled his fingers across the seam to bowl a slower bouncer
dabbed wide of point, down to square third man
squared up by the length, dabbed gently into the off side for a quick single

short_text: Siraj to S Dhawan, SIX runs
long_text: walloped in style! Dhawan gets into position quickly and belts this pull over deep midwicket. Welcome, Siraj
too close to the delivery as he hits this flat on the bounce to mid-on
mistimes this lofted hit to long-on. Dragged it from way outside off, toe-ended it
goes for a hoick, gets a thick inside edge towards deep midwicket
whips this full ball off the pad to Mandeep at deep square leg
drags this sweep to midwicket off a thick inside edge
driven back to Chahal, good stop off his own bowling.

short_text: Yadav to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: dabs this gently into the off side

Southee pulls off a stunner at deep square leg! This was pulled flat, but the ball was dying on Southee. He could've so easily looked to save the boundary, but he dived low and pulled it off inches from the ground.  Soft signal is out.  Understandable this time that the third umpire wants to look at multiple replays.  Oh, wait. Has he pressed the wrong button?  Not out flashes the big screen. Southee's face was in the firing line too, if he got a bad bounce, that could've so easily smashed into his face.  Oh, dear. Third umpire says not out.  He's overturned the decision. Kohli is shocked, Southee is shocked, shakes his head in disbelief.  Michael Clarke on air goes: "I can't believe that!"  The third umpire in question is  C Shamsuddin
punched but can't beat mid-off, refuses the single.
through with the pull even before the ball arrived, beaten.
the helicopter has taken off. The wristy whip from outside off to the deep midwicket boundary. Sensational from Hales. Not much wrong with the delivery, Umesh has an exasperated look.
looks to go over mid-on but gets a thick inside edge that just about clears midwicket. Lucky boundary, but he'll take the runs
punches this length ball to cover for a quick single
up, up and over. Not a half-volley, but he still decided to go downtown and cleared the straight boundary.
slower length ball on middle and leg, turned to short fine leg

short_text: Southee to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: once again gets besides the line of this delivery to steer to point

short_text: Southee to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: slower bouncer angling away, steered to backward point

short_text: Southee to S Dhawan, SIX runs
long_text: clobbered over long-on! Too full and angling away, Dhawan gets underneath the length and muscles this.
works this off his hip towards deep square, Southee cuts it off. Excellent first over
angles a length ball back into off, defended back to Umesh
slaps this length ball to mid-off, where AB puts off a diving stop. Saved a boundary

short_text: Yadav to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: steps out, Umesh shortens his length. Now Dhawan looks to flay over point but is beaten.

short_text: Yadav to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: jags back in from length on middle, sneaks off inside edge to hit him high on the left thigh.

short_text: Yadav to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: full and shaping back in, driven firmly to mid-off
139 kph, a low full toss down leg. Right in the slot again, another poor ball. Flicked away into the gap at backward square leg and RCB finish with 218
a length delivery outside off is swatted to deep midwicket
a quick delivery on leg, Sarfraz is beaten for pace, off the thigh pad into the off side.
dropped by Sandeep! A slower ball on leg, Sarfraz top-edges his hoick, it carries to a very fine fine leg. Sandeep runs in but puts the catch down, he had too much forward momentum.

Rashid takes that! He misjudged that as well but he's taken a one-handed stunner! Much like Trent Boult, Rashid misjudges this, comes in, and backtracks late. He then goes back, but this is much flatter so all he can do is stick out his right hand take the catch nonchalantly. It was a flat-batted swat from CdG.
a wide slower delivery outside off, it goes up towards Williamson at cover. The ball swerves and swirls and Williamson drops it.
a good yorker to finish. A low full toss on off, pushed to long-on. Thampi finishes with 4-0-70-0
a slower delivery on off, Sarfraz tried to play the same shot but all he can do is tap the ball to backward point
140 kph, a straight full toss. Sarfraz shows AB how to play it. Opens the bat face and just lets the ball hit bat, over short third man for six. Lovely hit.

squeezed past backward point for four. That's more awful bowling. It's full and straight, right in the slot for a nice T20 heave away over midwicket, but Sarfraz opens the face and guides the ball past the fielder. Nicely done.
gets away with that. Another poor ball, actually much worse than the previous delivery. It's a full toss on the pads, CdG picks out deep midwicket
that's tripe from Thampi. 97 kph, a very very very very slow delivery outside off. CdG says I can play that, slapped over cover for six. Huuge.
good stop from Goswami. Another slower ball outside off, tapped away towards the keeper, who dives to his right and stops three.
full and straight, worked away towards square leg.
misfield this time. A short and wide slower ball, cut away towards short third man. Thampi runs to his right but falls over the ball.
a good short slower ball, CdG misses it. Goswami fumbles and Sarfraz runs through. Good from him.

clears midwicket! A badly-judged catch from Rashid. That should have been taken by tonight's standards. A full delivery outside off is skewed away off the inside half. Rashid runs in, then backtracks after misjudging it. The ball then just clears him and clears the boundary
Dhawan takes the catch at long-off. A shortish length delivery outside off, hoicked away but with bad timing. The bat turns in his hands as well, taken by Dhawan. Easy catch.
finished with six. Flat and wide outside off, CdG lofts the ball nicely and cleanly over cover. No stopping that, into the stands.

wow, has he stopped that from six? The standard of fielding today is exceptional. A slog sweep looks to clear deep midwicket. Hooda is right on the boundary, sticks out his right hand and stops the momentum of the ball, his hand on its downward trajectory then pushes the ball back into the field of play.
flat outside off, a tap to short third man.
same line and length, but Mandeep plays a different shot, a flick into the gap at midwicket for two.
flat and quick again, outside-edged to short third man
flat and quick outside off, pushed to cover for one. Good single, good awareness from Mandeep
edged, but short of the keeper. Well bowled to finish. Another slower ball outside off, CdG gets a bit of bat on his swing.
keeps low, a back of the hand slower ball outside off. CdG waits and waits and swings, but the ball goes under

that's Thampi's fifty! And what a shot to take him there. To be honest, that's a plain awful delivery. Full and straight, right in the slot. And CdG lofts the ball over long-off with a full face. Beauty!
a slower delivery outside off, carved away to backward point. Carlos Brathwaite misfields and allows a second. Sloppy.
CdG too going after everything. Full and wide outside off, a thick outside edge over short third man.
full outside off, swatted away into the gap at midwicket for two. RCB have runs 150 and 151

short_text: Rashid Khan to Mandeep, no run
long_text: a googly outside off, patted back.

short_text: Rashid Khan to Mandeep, no run
long_text: the googly down leg, ricochets off the pad into the leg side

two in three! Rashid pulls things back. A flat googly outside off, Moeen reverse-paddles the ball from the back of the bat. It's a significant deflection, but Goswami gets his gloves to it, and parries the ball up and takes the rebound. Not the worst shot from Moeen, but another fantastic catch.

short_text: Rashid Khan to Ali, FOUR runs
long_text: Moeen doesn't care much. A legbreak outside off, flat-batted over the umpire for four. Straight and quick.

for all the pyrotechnics of RCB batting, that is spectacular from Dhawan! Stalls this innings, quietens the crowd with a typical T20 play. Events such as this change games. And all it needs to be is a catch. A flat delivery on middle and leg, AB stays low and sweeps towards deep square leg It seems like it's lobbing over Dhawan, but he stays calm, takes the catch and ensures his balance doesn't take him over by keeping a strong centre of gravity. Awesome catch. Not as good as Boult's, but very close.
a shortish delivery on off, pulled over long-on
full on leg, flicked away to deep midwicket

107 kph, how has that gone for six? YIKES! A slower ball outside off, a very good one. A wide knuckle ball that's just inside the tramline, it's the perfect line. But a deceived slap carries all the way over long-on
well bowled, 104 kph, a gutsy slower ball outside off, right in the slot, but it's the pace that deceives Moeen. Swing and miss
127 kph, a low full toss on middle and leg, chipped to long-on
a very similar delivery, a slow wide delivery outside off. AB goes from bottom to top and carves the ball over backward point.
that's what he does, forces you to bowl wides. Just outside the tramline and wide. But that's a good option from Sandeep
squeezed away towards short third man. Good stop from Thampi, to his left. A wide yorker is jammed away
full and wide, carved to deep point. Timing is extraordinary.
well bowled, a yorker on middle, pushed to long-on

wow, that's stunning batting. A full toss on middle and leg, de Villiers gets low again like the previous delivery and sweeps the ball over backward square leg for a humongouuuuuus six. OUT THE GROUND! 105 metre six.

it's the shot he plays when he feels at the top of his game. Remember him sweeping Steyn or Rabada or Holder? He tries it again, it's a slow delivery, he waits and pull-sweeps over short fine leg. AB at his best
drifts down leg, wide. Free run.
superb effort from Man Pan at long-on. A full delivery on leg, swatted away into the gap, but Pandey doesn't give up on it. Runs in and almost gets there, on the bounce.
what timing. A low full toss and Moeen this time drills a drive through cover to move to fifty. His maiden IPL fifty, first-pumps from Kohli too.
a shortish delivery outside off, 122 kph, slapped to long-off.
Moeen on faaaya! A short delivery on off and middle, Ali pulls fiercely and beautifully over square leg for six. A front-foot pull, that's how much T20 batting has changed.
a full delivery on middle, pushed to long-on. That may have been six if he decided to attack it, but the runs in the over are there so no.
another fifty for AB. And what an innings too. Just a tad short on middle, he stays back and pulls through midwicket for four. So easy
whew, what power! My word, what a shot.A shortish delivery outside off, but not too wide. He arches his back to make room, sounds weird I know, but that's what he did and sliced a cut through point.
full on off, swatted away off the inside half to deep midwicket. In the gap and two.
flat and quick again, on leg, reverse-swept away to third man

short_text: Rashid Khan to AB, no run
long_text: another googly down leg, he misses a swat. AB asks why is that not a wide with his expressions at the umpire.

short_text: Rashid Khan to AB, no run
long_text: AB misses a sweep, gets right outside the line for just this. The googly hits the pad, but outside the line
flat and wide outside off, 96 kph, very quick through the air. Hit to long-off
flat and wide, carved past point for a couple.

short_text: Rashid Khan to Ali, SIX runs
long_text: he's taking Rashid down too! Superb batting. Runs down the pitch and goes through the line. It's the googly so he hits the ball over long-off, with the spin.
length outside off, slapped to long-off

a great catch from Dhawan at long-on, but he backtracks into the boundary cushion. Slapped with fierce power from Ali, flat and hard. Dhawan takes an overhead catch but goes back into the boundary for six. This is a lovely cameo
127 kph, length outside off, punched to the sweeper cover
a length delivery outside off is slapped to long-off
a slower ball outside off, Ali's wild heave is missed.
a slower delivery outside off, tapped to short third man. A throw at the batsman's end misses, resulting in an overthrow.
flat and straight again, punched to cover. Excellent over from Shakib.
signs of a slow surface, but it's very slow from Shakib too, on middle and leg, wants to hit to cover, hits to the bowler
flat and straight, de Villiers drives back to Shakib. Well bowled again
very wide outside off, forcing Ali to drag a sweep, to deep midwicket
slow on middle, AB backs away and pushes to cover.
flight outside off, Ali flat-bats a slog to long-on. This is new-age T20 cricket, going after pretty much everything early in the over
a slower ball outside off, punched away to the sweeper cover from the back foot.
on the bounce! A slower delivery on leg, 98 kph, may have been too slow for AB. Pulled to deep square leg
that's pummeled. That's his decision making again. That's why the timing is so good, that's why it's right in the gap. Digs that in short on leg, and smashed over midwicket.
good batting, a slower ball outside off, tapped to point for one.
six more. Slightly shorter, he may have anticipated that length because of the errant first delivery. So he stays back and pulls nonchalantly over square leg. The 1-2 play, 12 runs off two balls.
smashed for six! That's good, clear, proactive batting from Ali. Doesn't want to leave all the scoring to AB, so when he gets a full delivery outside off, he lofts a lofted drive over mid-off.
a clear sign he has no sign which way it's spinning. A lovely T20 slog sweep, inside-edged to fine leg.

short_text: Rashid Khan to Ali, no run
long_text: the legbreak, flat and straight. Inside-edged into the pad and then back up towards the keeper.

short_text: Rashid Khan to Ali, no run
long_text: the googly outside off, goes past Ali's cut.
a tad short. That's the AB 1-2. Forcing a short delivery after a good shot of the full one, pulled to square leg.

short_text: Rashid Khan to AB, FOUR runs
long_text: it's all in the head. He premeditated that. He stayed low, got his pad outside the line in case he missed it and reverse-paddled that past slip.
a googly on off, tapped to cover for one. He read that well did Mo Ali.
excellently bowled, a yorker on middle, jammed out to mid-off. Very good over from Kaul.
full and straight, driven to cover.

AB's picking them before the bowler knows what he wants to bowl. As soon as he sees it's full and straight, he knows where he's going - over mid-on because the field is in. And even though it's not AB's best timing, it's good enough because his decision-making is so quick. Awesome. Just lands inside? This is taking an age from the third umpire. The 147th replay goes on screen. Woooohooo, a decision at last: it's four.
on middle and off, worked to deep square leg
a full delivery around off, not much swing, none at all. Pushed to point.
140 kph yorker on off. The ball that got Moeen in the 2015 World Cup against New Zealand from Southee. This time he jams down and taps to point.
pushed away to long-on

cleaned 'im up. You can't really say that often but that was poor game awareness from Kohli. He just got four against the opposition's best bowler, and went for six this time. It's a tossed up googly outside off, Kohli backs away and slogs across the line. He misses, the ball doesn't, hits off and middle stump. Maybe it was instinct or his determination to attack the best, but that wasn't the best decision he's made.

short_text: Rashid Khan to Kohli, FOUR runs
long_text: races away. Rashid drops short, Kohli goes back and pulls over midwicket for four. Just read the length quickly.

short_text: Rashid Khan to Kohli, no run
long_text: Williamson saves four. Flat and wide outside off, Kohli flat-bats that towards KW at mid-off. He races away and dives to his right

short_text: Rashid Khan to Kohli, no run
long_text: the googly on middle, worked to midwicket. Kohli comes down, AB says get back. And Virat does. Good early communication because it was the wrong call from Kohli

short_text: Rashid Khan to Kohli, no run
long_text: the wide yorker, going defensive from the outset. Excellent execution, goes under the bat
too much flight there, overpitched and Kohli chooses the safer option to drive with the spin to deep cover.
flatter through the air around off, chipped to deep cover again
flat and straight, some more spin but Kohli is an exceptional player of spin. Goes back and works to wide mid-on, against the spin
nicely bowled actually. Very slow outside off, bowling to his field. AB drives to deep cover and gets off strike.
a good defensive ball, flat and wide, hit to cover.

the same shots he played so well against Daredevils, bad news for Sunrisers. It's full outside off, he walks across and doesn't bother about the spin because it's a cross-batted slog with so much elegance over midwicket. What do you do?
full and straight, may have been a well-executed legcutter, defended back.
full and straight, he has the runs in the over so why take another risk? Too experienced for that so a checked drive to long-on.
another slower delivery outside off, carved to short third man. Loud call of "nooo" from Kohli.
doesn't want to overdo it, so he blocks a full delivery just to show he can.
nailed! 18 off 7 now is AB. This one is full outside off, he clears his front leg and nails a lofted drive over cover. This is glorious, free stroke-making
wow, it's so easy for him. It's not even wide, a good length delivery on the fourth or fifth stump channel. He makes room and carves a cut through point, that's a shot Warner has owned.

still shortish, can go a tad fuller and try to get AB out playing a lofted drive on this surface. The short length allows AB to go back and cut towards cover for one. Excellent over from Shakib, but well played too.
lots of spin actually already. Flat and wide, it takes plenty of spin and Kohli cuts away into the off side
full and flat outside off, pushed to mid-off for a run
excellent bowling. Slows the pace up outside off, AB checks his shot. Takes a thick leading edge towards point, does not carry. Lovely flight

just the start he had against Daredevils at this ground earlier in the season. He played the same shot against Nadeem and didn't look back. A flat delivery outside off, chipped over cover for four. Too good.
that's a fantastic start for AB. He loves it when he starts with four. A short flat delivery outside off, AB hurries back and nails a cut through point.

125 kph. Sunrisers strike early. A good catch from Kaul at third man. A back of a length delivery outside off, moves away too and may have bounced a tad extra. Parthiv heaves across the line, felt like he was there a touch early too. The ball takes a thick leading edge and goes very very high - more elevation than distance - and carries down to third man, who runs to his right and takes a good catch.
good single now. Back of a length outside off, tapped down towards point and Kohli calls his partner through.
yummy! A full delivery outside off, Kohli walks down to negate the swing. It's full enough and he nails a delectable off drive. Past the bowler, past mid-off. Lovely shot.
the umpire stops four! Ump S Ravi. A full delivery on the pads, Parthiv flicks right into the knee of the square leg umpire. He just could not get out of the way.
on the pads from Sandeep, a hint of away shape. Worked away to midwicket
good stop. Full and wide, swinging away. Parthiv goes chasing and hits the ball nicely but finds short cover. Actually, that has just carried to Hooda, to his right. The ball bursts out. Dropped!
it's a good shot but it won't be enough. To be fair it wouldn't be enough if he'd lifted that a few 100 metres further. Short ball into the ribs, pulled past short fine

misses the bouncer and is now involved in a run out appeal at the non-striker's end. Both the batsman and the bowler are caught napping. Axar beats Mitch to the stumps. Third umpire confirms he's in. But are Kings XI? Not really

short_text: McClenaghan to Axar Patel, SIX runs
long_text: at last! A poor ball that's been punished! Axar Patel lines up this full toss with a lot of width outside off and slaps it over long-on.

holes out to sweeper cover! It's the third length ball in a row from Mitch, and this time he even gets rewarded for it. Yuvraj uses the angle and tries to go off side - ends up slicing it straight to deep extra cover
leaves it alone and probably skips a heartbeat! But it's well judged in the end. Length ball pushed across the wide marker
oh he's missed a juicy length ball outside off. That was there for the six. Yuvraj swings and can't get bat on it
wide yorker outside off. Very wide. He swings across the line and misses. Ishan Kishan fumbles and they sneak a bye. That should have been a wide
overpitched outside off, drilled straight to long-off
inside edge onto body. A short ball and a nervous poke from Yuvraj. Single pitch side on the leg side
low full toss, opens up his body and punches to long-off

he's got him! There is one hero in the Mumbai Indians team too! 2 for 12 in his fourth over before this ball. Jasprit Bumrah's slower ball has deceived Rahul again. It's in the slot - overpitched outside off - and Rahul is looking to deposit this over long-off. It's off the toe-end and is taken well inside the boundary. It's a sensational, if not legendary innings, from this man. But he's fallen with 10 balls to go.
low full toss on middle stump, dragged along the floor to long-on
lovely bowling. Slower ball yorker. Dipping outside off, toe-ended to long-off. That wasn't the intention
slower ball. Pitches and cuts away from the wide marker. Rahul leaves
yorker outside off, jams it to extra cover from the crease
genius. KL Rahul knows exactly what's coming. He's made it so - he's making the bowler do it. Another slower ball dropped short, another reverse-swipe to third man
shot! Rahul with the reminder he's still around. Slower ball dropped short outside off. He swivels and reverse-swats this over short third man!
bye-bye! Don't. Bowl. Short. It's climbing up at Rahul's shoulder but he has swiveled much before it can get close and swatted to this to the long leg boundary
top edge lands well in front of deep midwicket. Short ball and he looks to pull. Hurried on it
backs away, gets a length ball. Can't make use of it. Gets it wide of long-off off the toe-end

short_text: Bumrah to Axar Patel, no run
long_text: short of a length outside off, driven on the up. Uppishly to extra cover.

appeal immediately, given immediately! Bumrah has turned it on! Stoinis has no answer to this mean bouncer headed for his face. Not even close to playing a hook. It's flicked the glove before half his swing is in. He's out before he can put in a semblance of a follow through. What. An. Over.
short ball in at the hips. He shovels it uppishly to deep midwicket

full toss outside off, driven to sweeper cover's right. It's running away, running away but so is Krunal Pandya! This family has been given the fielding gene, that's for sure. Slides to his right and keeps it in play
length ball, driven firmly back down the pitch. Deflects into the midwicket region off Bumrah's leg

good catch from Hardik Pandya. This ball has gone at least five stories up from what I can see. He has to run in from deep midwicket with half an eye on Evin Lewis who is coming in from deep square. For most of his journey, that ball is possibly just a dot in the sky. For some of it, it's swerving. And by the end, it's coming down hard. He is fully composed through it all and completes it. Good job. Finch was looking to bludgeon this length ball over deep square leg

what pressure?, Rahul asks as he jumps down once more and sends this flying into the second tier over long-on! What a player this guy is. He hasn't got to the pitch of this after stepping out but he goes through and launches it long
you gorgeous man! Rahul jumps down confidently to meet this length ball at leg stump and holds his shape - perfect shape - to cream this over  the straight boundary

lifts it over short third but hasn't hit it too well. Krunal pedals backwards and flicks it back for point who has given him an option. Rahul lifted this with a reverse-scoop, it was full on off stump
top edge! Lands to short third man's left. He's teasing Finch here. Loopy length ball spinning away from off. He's backing into the leg side and swinging for midwicket

loopy, tossed up ball on leg stump. Finch swings hard. Gets a thick inside edge to deep midwicket's right comes back very casually and just makes his ground as Kishan deflects the throw onto the stumps
short of a length slider at middle stump, pushed to long-on off the back foot
full on off stump, driven straight to long-off
overpitched outside off, driven hard but straight to sweeper cover
nice. Very nice. Steep bouncer is too much for Finch as he looks to hook. Carries nicely to Kishan
slower ball, short and wide outside off. Mistimed cut towards sweeper cover
gets it right. Well bowled. Rahul looks to clobber this length ball over midwicket from outside off. It's an offcutter that sits in the pitch and climbs past the outside edge
another one. This one barely lands on the pitch outside off
offcutter, very short and wide. Left alone
full toss on off stump, backs away and drills it to long-off
short of a length at middle stump, steps out and taps to long-on
length ball at middle stump, looks to get it fine with a paddle sweep but it's deflected into the off side
length on the stumps, driven to long-on

bludgeoned. Krunal Pandya, what are you doing sticking your hand out at that?! A full ball floated up at middle stump and the shot would have taken the bowler with it if he had miraculously reacted quick enough to get a hand on it
short of a length ball at off. An ugly hoick from Finch. Off the inside half of the bat and running away from Cutting at deep midwicket. He sprints and lunges to his right to stop this
length on middle stump, clips to deep midwicket off the front foot
offcutter dropped short outside off, slapped on the up to sweeper cover
short of a length on leg stump, whipped to deep square

just clears mid-off and Cutting's slide is not enough for him to pull this back. Short ball outside off, Finch backs away and picks the right direction to go with the drive on the up - but it's off the toe-end
short of a length outside off, mistimed chop to extra cover

there it is. Rahul's newfound superpower to find boundaries behind the wicket. Short ball angled into him and he caresses it with the pace past short fine leg. Not the smartest length from the bowler with fine leg in
length ball angled in at off stump. Skips across and whips to deep square
short of a length on middle stump, pushed towards long-on off the back foot
short of a length outside off, swats at it and gets a thick outside edge to third man
short of a length angled in the body. Looks to flick, cops it on the body
length ball at middle stump. Taps it into the mid-on region and they takes off for the quick one. Mitch Mac swoops down on it from midwicket to his left, but can't get a decent throw in. Good effort
short ball outside off. Looks to guide this to third man's right but finds point
length ball on middle stump, punches on the up to long-on
sixth fifty in seven chasing innings. Sixth in the tournament as well. Gets calmly behind this length ball and nudges to long-on. KL Rahul, once again, has got into the zone.
length on middle stump, punched to long-on
gets on his knee and swipes right. On the cricket field that's a four. Length ball angled in at leg stump and finds the long leg boundary
length just outside off, driven on the up to long-off
arm ball into the pads. Tickles to short fine's left off the back foot
short of a length skidder on middle stump. Shovelled to deep midwicket from deep in the crease
overpitched on off stump, with some shape in. Driven firmly to long-off
slower ball outside off, handsomely punched to sweeper's left on the up
backs away and makes room. But he finds backward point with the cut. Slower ball lifts up at off stump
short ball at middle stump, swivels and plays a short-arm pull to deep square
full ball at off stump, drives to sweeper cover
slower ball wide outside off. Mistimed drive on the up off the toe-end. It rolls out to extra cover
lots of power, but straight to long-off. Finch pummels this full ball outside off, along the floor
short of a length on middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
short of a length on leg stump, goes on the back foot, tickles it wide of short fine
slider on a length at middle stump. Goes on the back foot and flicks to deep midwicket
full and very wide outside off. Left alone
picks the googly but mis-hits the slog sweep. It trickles out to deep square
length on middle stump and he skips down to punch this to long-on
short of a length at off stump, punched to extra cover off the back foot
tossed up at middle stump, drives against the turn to long-on
length ball at leg stump. Plants the front leg out and tickles this to short fine
tossed up at middle stump, gets to the pitch and whips to deep midwicket
length ball outside off, pushed to extra cover off the front foot
oh no. Poor bowling. Rahul's been putting these away since he was 10. Short and wide. Decent pace on it too - perfect for a square cut that is executed perfectly
tossed up at off stump, leans in to drive to sweeper cover
short of a length on off stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
short of a length on middle stump, hurries him as he goes on the back foot and punches to deep midwicket
full on the stumps, stays in the crease and pokes this into the midwicket region with soft hands
short of a length skidder at off stump, steps out and drives to long-on
nice. Waits and waits. It's a slow turner from Markande, but it's very short. He hangs deep and bisects backward point and short third man
floated up at off stump, drives to extra cover with soft hands to steal the single
oh shot. A quicker one fired down leg side. Quickly gets down on a knee and uses the pace to ramp this over short fine
length ball into the pads, clipped into the square leg region
length on off stump, punched into the covers

dropped! An extremely difficult chance for Cutting at cover point. Rahul backs away and stabs aimlessly as this spins away from off stump. It floats high for Cutting who leaps to his right with his left-hand going at the ball and tips it over the bar
miscued but he doesn't need to more than clear mid-on. He does it. Beaten in flight and lofting agains the spin as he steps out, but it's one bounce and into the boundary

oh yeah! Is that Finch getting back into form? Two controlled chops and now an old-fashioned swing across the line to send this slower ball wayyyyyy over deep midwicket. A length ball on off and he's got such a sweet connection on this

well played again. Short ball outside off and this time it's a controlled square cut. Krunal runs to his left and puts in a slide at sweeper and doesn't even bother getting off the floor as he throws it in
deftly done. Short of a length outside off and he guides it past short third man with an open face
short of a length just outside off, pushed to cover off the back foot
slower ball, short of a length and into the pads. Deflected into the leg side as he looks to play the glance
short of a length outside off, tapped into the covers off the back foot
slower ball, full outside off. Leans in for the drive but can't time it. Gets it straight to extra cover

got him! The bouncer and the catch in the deep on the leg side - just like in the last game. Rohit points his finger and sprints at Ben Cutting, the fielder who went to his right at deep square to take this miscued hook. Mitch Mac is known for this specific wicket-taking ball. It's climbing, Gayle is swatting. Gayle is gone. Wankhede has burst into celebration
out of the way quickly. A bouncer slanted in at his throat and Gayle is hopping to get out of the way. A customary air-ramp to make it look more convincing. He misses
slower ball, full outside off. Opens the face and drives to sweeper cover
short of a length and cramping him. Drags it out to long-on with a half-pull
drilled. Mitch has changed ends and changed length. It's full and in at middle stump - perfect for Gayle to have a swing at it. And he does, four on the bounce at long-on

shot!/ Glorious flowing drive to beat extra cover to his left. An overpitched ball from Hardik, who has managed to be all over the place in a span of six balls. Nice transfer of weight through the forearms from Rahul as he extends them and keeps them along the floor

deceived but he makes the best of it. Short of a length ball climbing up at him, a knuckle ball. He's in position to try and flick this but has to follow with his hands as it cuts away. Runs it past slip
short of a length on off stump, stabbed into the off side from the crease
short ball on leg stump, tucked behind short fine off the back foot
a full-pace short ball this time. Close to off stump and he looks to cut. Thick outside edge over short third man
boom. Pandya messes up his slower ball. It's dug very short and it's sitting up at leg stump. Gayle stands tall and slaughters it, over deep square
short of a length and in at off stump. Defended to point off the back foot
beaten as he looks to carve one over point. It's a short of a length ball with some width, but it's also an offcutter that he doesn't pick
full and in at off stump. Front foot nice and close to the bat, with the full face offered. Drives straight to mid-off
slower ball, short of a length on leg stump. Taps it to midwicket off the back foot
nervous feet from Gayle and a slight loss of shape as he fends this away. A short of a length ball in the corridor
and there's the first one. A mean bouncer spitting across him. A tad too wide to make him play though. The crowd feels it
short of a length on off stump, defended solidly on the back foot
disappointed with himself as he can't get this square cut past backward point. A hint of width outside off and he makes good connection on it
beaten. Length ball pushed across the corridor. A lazy jab at it from Rahul and it skids past his outside edge
a superb landing 50 metres behind the keeper. Rahul didn't want it to go there. Trying to tickle a short ball from his hips only to get a top edge
full ball in at leg stump. Stands tall to nudge this to deep square
short of a length ball with some shape into the body. Jabs it into the cover off the back foot
can't scoop this slower length ball past short fine.
right into the blockhole, squeezed off the pad to the keeper. He walked across to flick but couldn't get any bat on it
walks across to help this over short fine, can only get hit on the pad, they scamper a legbye
walks across and sweeps this high full toss straight to short fine leg. McClenaghan was on one knee as he looked to play the stroke but this was clearly over his waist.  Freehit coming up
swing and a miss. Another slower length ball, looked to fetch it from outside off
looks for a slower ball, end up bowling it way outside off, rolled to the keeper
defended gently to short third man, back-of-the-hand delivery this time
helps this slower length ball over short third man, no one there. Cleverly done
swing and a miss. Slower and fuller outside off, he whacked the humid air instead of the ball
slower ball angling away, he looked to pull but missed
carved over point, too easy. Too full, he cleared his front leg, used the width and walloped it into the gap
defended back down to long on for a single
the knuckleball on length, Pandya looks to cut but can only get a thick outside edge that lobs straight to Ashwin at short third man.
full toss on the pas, flicked into the deep midwicket region where Mayank Dagar, the substitute, puts out a stunning one handed stop after a dive
slower ball gone wrong, way outside the wide line. Hardik swung and missed.
into his swinging arc as the ball drifts in from around the stumps, Mitch McClenaghan is down on one knee as he slogs this over cow corner! The carromball gone wrong this time
turns this flatter one on leg to square leg, they scamper a quick single
dags the slog sweep from outside off, picks out Axar at deep midwicket. As easy as they come. Cutting was hitting this against the turn as well.
uppish whip down to deep midwicket
goes back into the crease as he works this indrifter towards midwicket
punches this length ball to long on
driven back, excellent stop by Tye off his own bowling
stands tall and turns this from length towards the man coming in from long on, excellent running.
dug in short but way over Cutting's head as he ducks
slower length ball on middle, punched to wide long on
defends solidly to cover
leading edge, just wide of cover. Hit the deck hard, got some lift
flatter and fuller on off, defended.
legbreak drifting into mdidle and leg, worked to deep midwicket
gets across a long way and paddles this full delivery to fine leg

backs away and clobbers this straight to long-off. Ashwin bowled this just slightly wide outside off as he saw Pollard backing away, he went through with the stroke but didn't hit this off the middle and Finch takes an excellent catch moving to his left at long-off.
bowls this carrom ball wide, Pandya mistimes this slap to cover
length on middle, defended.

thumped over long-off, what a way to get to a half-century. This is some way to announce your return in style. Pollard is pumped, fist-pumps towards the dressing room  Clearly being left out hurt him. What a way to channel that hurt. He's delivered when his team needed him to.
slower ball, the result is the same. Yuvraj can't stop it at third man despite the effort to run around and get there. Pollard saw this full, went for the big hit and sliced it over.
squeezes this yorker through a thick outside edge to race away to the third man boundary. More frustration for Kings XI
punches this full toss to wide long on
too short, sticking into the surface because this is an offcutter, Krunal into the pull early and he toe-ends this straight to short fine leg.
squeezes this yorker into the gap at deep midwicket
thuds into the thigh pad as he shuffles across to whip, deflects to short fine
slower delivery but down leg, the umpire will have tougher decisions to make tonight
misses his length as he goes for a yorker, hammers this straight to long off
full toss angling into the pads and he's picked him to the deep square leg boundary. Too easy, he'll put those away even if his sleep
drills this past the diving extra cover fielder, Finch can't stop it despite a dive. Boundary when it should've just been a single
muscled over long-on. This is brute Pollard power to the fore. Fetched it from outside off but he knew what he was doing
driven back towards long on

short_text: Axar Patel to Pollard, SIX runs
long_text: backs away, Axar drifts this into his swinging arc and Pollard muscles this over deep midwicket. Onto the top tier
cramped for room, forces this nevertheless through cover off the backfoot
in the slot, Pollard drags this lofted hit down to long-on
short-arm jab down to deep midwicket
works this into the gap between deep square and deep midwicket
whips this flatter one to wide long on
has he overstepped? Pulled from outside off towards deep midwicket. Apparently not, my eyes were playing tricks.
forces this back past, down to long off
slower and fuller outside off and he's drilled this to beat long-off. Stoinis under pressure, crunching stroke that
short-arm jab but wow, that has sailed over deep midwicket. Picked the length early, transferred his weight back and bang!
helped up and over, just over the leaping Rajpoot at fine leg. Too short on leg stump and he just used the pace to help it along. Would've been a little nervous
pulled away, on the bounce to deep square leg
punched down to long-on

short_text: Axar Patel to Pollard, no run
long_text: turn and grip from length on off, defended back
short and sliding down leg, Pollard misses a nudge, well taken by Rahul
short on middle and leg, whipped to deep midwicket
eased back to Axar, who half-stops it on the dive, can't prevent the run, down to mid-off

short_text: Axar Patel to Pollard, no run
long_text: goes for a lofted hit down the ground, the ball drifts back in to take an inside edge, roll to the off side
driven firmly past the diving cover fielder, back for the second as Tiwary comes around from wide long off
turns this off his hip to midwicket
stands tall and punches this to the extra cover boundary. Sweet. Shot of the night so far
dabs this gently into the off side.
works this off his hip towards the man coming in from wide long on
beaten by one that nips away late. Went for a drive, minimal feet movement
thick inside edge to long-on. Looked to hit it straight
beaten! Looks to punch on the up but is late on the stroke.
defends this length ball from the crease solidly
stands tall and punches this short of length ball to cover
full and swings back in late, Pollard flicks to deep square off a thick inside edge

mistimes his pull and is gone as Yuvraj takes a dolly at the edge of the ring at mid-on! Huge moment in the match. This was short, Rohit cramped for room as he looks to take him on and hit in front of square, got it high on the bat.

short_text: Rajpoot to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: gentle dab towards point, wants the single but is sent back
pulled but cramped for room so no power, down to long-on
flatter one on middle and leg, worked off his hip past square leg
nice flight, the carromball this time, eased to long-off
punched to long-on as they jog the single. Touch short and drifting in
touch short, punched to short cover where there's a misfield

short_text: Ashwin to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: lunges forward and defends to short cover

short_text: Axar Patel to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
long_text: flatter one on middle and leg, tucked to midwicket
the reverse paddle to beat Gayle at short third man, just a single though. Didn't get enough bat on it

short_text: Axar Patel to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
long_text: dabs it gently into the off side with soft hands
gets to the pitch and works it down to long-on again, sensible

short_text: Axar Patel to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
long_text: eased with the spin to long-off to get off the mark
punched to long-on for an easy single

short_text: Tye to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: length ball that nips away from outside off, left alone
punches this length ball to point to get off the mark

knuckleball, knuckleball and them seam-up. is there some bat on it? Yes! Two in two and Tye is on fire. Surya his hustled for pace as this skids on, he looks to play the short-arm jab to square leg but ends up getting a thick bottom edge edge that lobs off the thigh pad and is taken by the keeper.
cross-batted heave but he can only hit it as far as mid-on. No timing, no power, dragged it from outside off. Clever from Tye, it's that knuckleball again.
slower and fuller on off, eased behind point
steps out but is cramped for room by the length, bunted to mid-off for a quick single
thick outside edge as he drives, this time to third man
steps out and slices this to clear deep point. Not where he wanted to hit it, but he'll take it. Wanted to go inside-out over cover. Beautiful piece of wood, I tell you
walloped deep into the stands at backward square leg! At Mohit's pace, that's asking for trouble. Swivels back and helps him over.
tucks him for room with a length ball into the ribcage, defended back
draws him forward on the drive, Kishan gets a thick edge past slip to beat third man. Streaky
angles in to hit Surya high on the thigh as he tries to work this square, they scamper a leg bye
thuds into his thigh pad as he tries to work this square. Beaten for pace, played down the wrong line
steps out and works this leg side, into the vacant spaces at deep midwicket
