beaten again!  At the moment, Kishan has no clue. Pokes tentatively, lucky there was no nick
beauty! Slants away and holds its line to beat Kishan's feeble push. Zips through to Rahul
slower and fuller again, Kishan lunges forward and defends
right through Lewis! The purplecap holder strikes gold! This is a knuckleball that comes back in to beat the inside edge and flatten off stump.
cleverly done, opens the bat face late to steer this past the keeper to beat third man
slower and fuller outside off, belted through the line to clear long-off. Stunning from Surya

top-edges a pull and this sails all the way. That's the shortest boundary at fine leg, around 57 metres. What does a bowler do? Hustles him for pace, causes him to rush into the stroke and then sees the ball sail away.
defended back, bowler parries it towards cover
pulled away handsomely. Too short, he picked the length early, swivelled back and hammered it to deep square leg
pulled away, but not timed well. A half-stop at midwicket by Ashwin keeps it to a single
slower ball on middle, mistimed pull to midwicket.
high and handsome! Picks the length ball, launches it straight back over the bowler's head.
punched to mid-off as they'll scamper a quick single
can't pick the gap, punched straight to mid-off
shapes to pull, this zips through to deflect off his thigh pad towards short square leg
slaps this length ball straight to mid-off
stands tall and punches straight to cover again
this time he leans into the drive, caresses it straight to Tiwary at cover
thick outside edge, flies past a vacant second slip to the third man boundary. There for the drive, he went with hard hands, ended up slicing it.
eases this length ball to Yuvraj at point
shapes back in from length, punched to point where there's a halfstop
slants a length ball away, but does so outside the wide line. Some early exercise for Maraius Erasmus
back of length on middle, punched wide of mid-on
hoists a short ball over long-on and take his team across the line. KKR move up to third place now in front of 61,000 of their supporters

outside edge flies away to the third man boundary. Gowtham does his best to stop it with a full length dive, it'll be a top effort if he has saved it. But it's unlikely  Yep, replays confirm he makes contact with the boundary while flicking the ball back
full on middle, whips it to midwicket
low full toss, which Russell swings away to long-on
clears the front leg and smears a half-volley outside off to the cover boundary. 145 kph coming down, several more going away
swivels on the back foot and pulls it down to long leg
finds a single behind point
tries to glide it fine to third man again, beaten for the second time
looks for third man again, angling the face of the bat against a shortish delivery coming into him. No connection

that's ridiculously good! Unadkat is bowling around the wicket, often taking all the pace off it. This one comes down at top pace, Karthik spots it and gently deflects it away to the third man boundary. Imagine your friend putting an arm around you, only to slap a sign that says "kick me!"
clears the front leg to smash a back of a length ball over long-on. But it's off-pace and it induces an inside edge ontp pad
wallops it to the point boundary, backing away against a short ball intending to cramp him. Sensational hitting, bounces only inches short of the rope
defends a good length ball on middle. That's Stokes' spell - and his season - done.
full on off stump, knocks it down towards mid-on
full on middle, Russell knocks it away to deep midwicket

half an appeal for lbw, with DK shuffling across his crease. They pinch a legbye and soon after that's done, Royals review. It's a good length ball angling into the right-hander, beating the inside edge, and would go down with the angle past the stumps. HawkEye says it might clip, and that means umpire's call

taken at deep point! It's short. It's wide. It needs to be whacked, which Lynn tries to do. But the connection is weak. It comes off the outside half of the bottom of the bat and goes only as far as Anureet.
turns a good length ball to long-on
beats him with a good length ball that drifts in on middle, grips the pitch and then zips away past the outside edge like they're mortal enemies
an awkward looking sweep shot, right off middle stump. Top-edge for a couple.
sees the ball lob up over his eyeline, loves the width on this, looks to smash through the covers. But the dip and turn do him in.
tosses it up on middle, Karthik blocks into the covers and sprints through
pulls out the reverse sweep, and he finds the boundary with third man up in the circle. The line of this ball merits the shot - outside off. No threat to the stumps
goes inside out, but he is too close to the ball on leg stump to drive it properly through the covers

top edge flies away past Buttler on the right. Lynn sees another short ball that he likes, this time he goes for a pull, and still gets the runs he wants. Perhaps more considering that part of the ground is well protected
good length outside off, slides it down to deep third man
leaps off his feet to control a short ball outside off and run it down to point
takes the pace off, but Lynn picks it and pulls to long-on
another cut shot, but this time he finds point

carves it to the point boundary! A little room to work with. A lot more pace to take advantage of. And the old Chris Lynn. The man nearly everyone comes to watch at the Gabba in the BBL pops out to prove it really is him
full, wide, smash and the ball disappears to the cover boundary. Karthik's skills in finishing a chase are fairly incredible
full on off stump, bunts it down to long-on
nudges a shortish delivery outside off to long-on
full on off stump, DK squeezes it out to the sweeper cover
reaches out to the short ball outside off and pummels it to deep square leg.
rolls his wrists to adjust to the slower ball on off stump and sends it skipping away through midwicket
blocks a shortish delivery on middle to point
makes sure to play close to the body, which is important against someone with good slower balls, and finds a single at midwicket
glides a full delivery on off stump to deep third man
picks the slower ball, sees fine leg up in the circle, and exploits it all beautifully with a pull shot. Lovely roll of the wrists, perfect placement, because deep square leg is also lurking.
pushes, with an open face, and this good length ball on off stump goes to point
blocks a back of a length delivery from round the wicket to cover
bounces short of long-on, where K Gowtham races in seeing Lynn loft a short and wide ball in his direction.
full and outside off, drives to deep point
tosses it up on middle and off, DK stretches forward to block

almost to the slip fielder! DK sets up for a pull because this is slow and short, but then the ball breaks sharply, and as a result, he has to dab it down into the off side. Does so well enough to beat Stokes
shifts over to off stump to deal with Sodhi's big-turning legbreaks and whips this through midwicket
beats him with a gorgeous legbreak, pretending to come into the right-hander a little way and then it pitches and changes direction. Gloriously fickle.
looks to smack the wide length ball on the up through the covers. But there is no contact
gets his hands up high to deal with the bounce on this back of a length delivery and somehow drives it through the covers. Superb timing
offcutter again, which Lynn glides to the sweeper cover
slower bouncer, moving across the right-hander, Lynn ignores it
back of a length on leg stump, Karthik deflects it to fine leg
full and outside off, knocks it down the pitch towards where mid-off would have been
goes for a sweep, dragging a well flighted delivery from outside off over to deep midwicket. And he even pinches an extra run
lovely drift into the right-hander, but Karthik stretches forward to cover it and blocks with soft hands
full on off stump, he pushes it off the front foot through to the sweeper cover
rocks back to cut a shortish delivery to the sweeper cover

huge appeal for lbw. Umpire Dharmasena says no but Royals want a second look. Regardless of what happens, this is a lovely delivery. Sodhi slows it up, and as a result, gets it to drift away. That drift has Rana nervous. He has no stride, he is playing outside the line as if he thinks this is a googly, but the ball turns sharply to pin him on the front pad and HawkEye shows it is hitting leg stump. Decision overturned. Royals rising.
flicks a quicker delivery on top of off stump through midwicket
full on off stump, flicks to long-on
fires it in from around the wicket, Rana reads the trick early and chops it behind point
lifts it over extra cover! It's the footwork again, bravely jumping down the pitch and this time hitting with the turn, perhaps because he isn't right to the pitch of this ball on off stump
stands back to punch a flatter delivery on off stump to long-on
shimmies down, reaching the pitch of the ball on off stump, and since he's right on top of it, he can work it against the turn through midwicket
yanks a full delivery from outside off through midwicket
on middle and leg, defended back.
the googly around off, 82 kph. Rana looks for the big slog sweep but all he can do is chop it back into his body
that's four. Always four when it beats the fielder. It's short and wide, reads it very carefully and correctly. Goes back and slashes his cut through point.
shortish delivery outside off, short enough for Lynn to go back and read the ball off the pitch. Worked to wide long-on
80.5 kph. Very hard hands from Lynn, which is why that ball almost popped back. A legbreak on middle, Lynn blocks and almost carries back to Ish.
the googly, read by Rana. He goes back and carves a cut to point
on middle and leg, worked into the gap at wide mid-on for a single.
back of a length around off, 135 kph, defended into the off side. Rana happy to play this out.
a slower ball that drifts down leg, wide.
another slower ball, shortish and wide, cut to the sweeper cover fielder.
full on middle and off, 140 kph, nudged away towards midwicket.
back of a length outside off, punched away towards cover. The fielder dives to his left but falls over the ball.
a good slower ball, 109 kph, some loop and dip on that. Ends up floating like a butterfly, and jamming down on Lynn as he blocks.
does it again! Backs away and chops a cut into the ground towards point for a couple.
149.6 kph. Back of a length on middle, Rana backs away, clears his front leg and carves a cut wide of backward point, to his left. That's his strength and he played to that.
good stop by Tripathi. Full and wide outside off, caressed away towards cover. Tripathi dives to his left
and again! 146 kph, back of a length outside off, the ball pitches and moves away again. Beaten quite convincingly
the beautiful Test 1-2! A nice full delivery that pitches and moves away. Rana's feet are rooted and his drive is beaten
Rana too has struggled against the bouncer already this IPL. A bouncer outside off, Rana avoids that watchfully.
too full and Lynn says why bother bowling there? An overpitched, hit-me, half-volley outside off. Lynn gently drills the drive through cover for four.

taken at deep square leg! 144 kph, it's another short delivery. Another well-directed bouncer. Uthappa struggles to time the ball or keep it down. He does neither and picks out the fielder. Stokes is using that length exceptionally well. Harried for pace.
nice timing. On the pads and flicked away nonchalantly into the gap at midwicket for two.
doesn't carry to mid-on! Another good delivery, back of a length on the body. He is so rushed on that that he splices the ball towards midwicket. Mid-on can't get around in time to catch
keeps low? Back of a length down leg, Lynn looks to pull, but the ball keeps a tad low. He is hit on the thigh or midriff
good single. Full and straight, pushed away to mid-on for a single.
147 kph, short around off, patted back

147 kph. "That's not the plan with third man up," says Warne with the host broadcaster. That indeed is a terrible plan. A short delivery outside off, Lynn just stays underneath the length and lofts the ball over short third man. Lands just inside

the look-away pull six from Lynn. Archer attacks the badge, it's a very good bouncer. But that's the risk on grounds like these. Lynn is hurried, he takes his eyes off the ball and then top-edges the pull over backward square leg.
shortish and wide outside off, slashed down to third man for a run
just short of Buttler! Back of a length outside off, Uthappa looks to guide this down to third man, an under edge is collected on the bounce.
full and straight, on-driven away to mid-on. Not the greatest timing
a slower ball down leg, nudged down to short fine leg. 0 off 5. Wicket maiden from Stokes.
a full delivery on middle and leg, chipped away to mid-on. Not found his fluency at all.
lovely shot, lovely stop. Shortish and wide outside off, carved away towards backward point.
a full delivery outside off is driven to extra cover.

Gowtham takes the catch and sends Narine off. 21 off 7, that's three runs a ball. Job done from Narine. But that's the length to bowl to Narine. Another short delivery outside off, Narine backs away and mis-times a pull. He was clearly rushed for pace there, and all he could do was splice the pull to cover.
that's how Narine plays the short deliveries. Gets outside the line and tries to hit short deliveries over point. Misses.
flat and quick outside off, Lynn blocks.
too close to that! BOOO! Full and straight, Narine comes down and hits to long-on. All along the ground.
flat on middle and leg, Narine backs away and slaps the ball over cover. Flat-batted glory for Narine. Bludgeoning both lengths.
toe-ended away over long-on. Narine is looking at the bottom of the bat. He runs down, gets close enough to the pitch and lofted pretty cleanly over long-on for six! Job done? 16 off 3.
flat and straight, around leg. Pulled over square leg for four. Lands just inside the boundary.
first ball six! Block the first ball? Watch the spin? Play with a straight bat? No, says Narine. It's full, straight and T20d away over midwicket for six. Too full and heaved away
that's it. A slower ball crashes into middle stump as Unadkat looks for a slog sweep. Misses it completely, but the umps are going to check on the no-ball. He's fine. Innings over.
low full toss on off stump, carves it to the sweeper cover
full toss on off stump, Unadkat whacks it to long-on
strikes him on the pad as Unadkat is late on the flick shot.
full toss on off stump, he carves it to sweeper cover
slower ball off the back of the hand, dipping on the right-hander. Anureet defends in front of middle and gets a single
full toss on middle, Anureet slices it to sweeper cover
pushes it down the ground

dropped by Krishna running in from cover. This is the quicker ball, and it that should have got a wicket. Unadkat is beaten for pace. He's swinging hard because it's short and outside off. But it goes straight up. There's an age for Krishna to get under it, but it pops out
goes for the slog, but he is deceived by the change of pace, and so goes up instead of long. Gill is coming in from long leg and takes it ever so cleanly
legcutter, which Archer picks, but the lack of room means he can only find cover
steers a back of a length delivery on and around off stump to deep point
whips it straight down the ground for a couple
full on off stump, defends
short-arm pulls it away to the square leg boundary. For half a second he seems cramped for room as the short ball comes up to his hips. But the bottom hand makes up for all that

appeal for the weirdest caught behind ever with KKR thinking the ball has come off the bottom edge, onto boot and then to the keeper. Soft signal is not out. The fun starts with a yorker, that Sodhi inside edges onto his back boot, bounces off his back pad and settles in DK's hands. Third umpire rules it out, rightly. Boy, if ever there was a sign that this game is KKR's
swings looking for the midwicket boundary but is utterly deceived by a slower ball. Goes through between the leg stump and the batsman's back thigh
looks for the pull as he sees a short ball with some room outside off. No connection
over the fielder at point! Unadkat is 22 from 12! And he's played some sparkling shots. Like rasping cut to a short and wide delivery.
tucks this off middle to deep square leg
waits until the very last second so he can read the turn off the pitch and then dabs the shortish delivery outside off to short third man
backs away as he cuts the shortish delivery turning into the stumps. Single to the sweeper
width on offer and Unadkat lashes it to the point boundary. Lovely placement, picks the gap to the right of the man inside the circle and to the left of the sweeper
spins away from the right-hander and he slices it to the left of backward point
gets right behind a back of a length delivery on middle and finds a single at mid-off

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Unadkat, no run
long_text: slower ball on off stump, Unadkat picks it and blocks down the pitch

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Unadkat, no run
long_text: full on middle and off stump, Unadkat smokes it to cover

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Unadkat, SIX runs
long_text: steps away on the leg side and pulls a bouncer that is following him, coming up towards his head, away to the deep square leg boundary. DK rushes up to his young bowler to have an urgent chat

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Unadkat, FOUR runs
long_text: spears it through the covers, Unadkat showing how its done. Stands still on leg stump, opens the face to place it to the right of the fielder

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Unadkat, no run
long_text: back of a length on middle, he clips to short midwicket
tosses it up on off stump, Sodhi comes forward to block. That's the end of a supremely good spell of spin bowling.

pops it back to the bowler! Fourth wicket for Kuldeep! This angle from around the wicket to Stokes has really been messing with him. The left-hander keeps playing the original line, with each ball pitching on leg stump, but since he isn't reading the ball out the hand, and with his team in tatters, he cannot attack. He can only nudge. Goes for a little flick, but there is just enough gap between the ball and bat for it to turn, claim a bit of the leading edge and return to where it came from.
works it away to deep square leg
defends on middle stump, but since he isn't to the pitch of the ball, which is also a googly, he ends up playing outside the line and gets an inside edege through square leg
sweeps a length ball on off stump out to long leg.
loops it up on leg stump, from around the wicket, Stokes makes room and drives to long-on

bounces him out! Hostile stuff! Gowtham has shown he is outrageously good at dispatching anything in his half out of the park. So makes perfect sense to test him with the short ball. And Mavi's really quick too. Gets it to come up towards his throat. Gowtham shuffles inside the line and tries to fend it away to fine leg. Only gloves it through to the keeper
short on middle, Stokes dabs it through point
opens the face and glides the short of a length ball outside off to deep third man
strays on the pads and Stokes whips it away to deep square leg

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Stokes, no run
long_text: slower ball, and Stokes, who is stuck in the crease, mistimes it to mid-off

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Stokes, no run
long_text: back of a length and outside off, Stokes chops it to point
goes back to flick a flatter delivery outside off through midwicket
goes back to flick a good length ball behind square leg
another googly! Gowtham presses forward to defend, thinking it will spin into him, but the ball darts past the outside edge and into the keeper's gloves
looks to nudge it through wide mid-on as Kuldeep goes around the wicket. Gets a leading edge down to long-off
full and on off stump, works it down to long-on

sensational googly! Binny does not pick it. He's lunging out of his crease, searching for ball so he could flick it through midwicket. But it just does not behaves the way he thinks it would. Drifts past the edge. Pitches and spins further. DK is ready and waiting behind the stumps and well
stays back now and works the length ball from off stump through midwicket
lunges forward to block a tossed up offbreak and is surprised by the dip on it. Binny thinks he can get to the pitch, but suddenly has to use his wrists to keep the ball down
good length and outside off, Binny lets it go

appeal for lbw as Samson sets up a pull shot. He is hitting with the turn, but the ball skids through and strikes him on the pads. DK wants to review. The impact is on the back leg, which is right in line with off stump, and HawkEye says it's hitting the stumps as well. Umpire Anil Chaudhary will have to change his on-field not-out decision
length ball on leg stump, Stokes flicks it away to deep midwicket
on the pads, spinning away from the left-hander. Stokes works it through midwicket
steps leg side, then back in normal position at the crease and sweeps a length ball in line with the stumps to the square leg boundary
full and on and around off stump, Stokes hits to long-on
full toss outside off which Samson slaps down to long-off
nice and full to the new batsman and Stokes jams it down the ground

reverse sweeps . straight to short third man! He was 11 runs away from becoming the first batsman in the IPL to score six fifties in a row. But with the run-rate slipping, with wickets falling, he knows it is up to him to shake Royals out of their funk. Goes for the unorthodox shot - a shot he's very confident playing - but the ball out the front of the hand bounces a little more than he expects
nice drift away from the right-hander and that is what makes Buttler a tad bit tentative. Reaches out to it and blocks as carefully as he could
a straight, very full delivery is jammed back to the bowler.
back of a length on middle and off, that's a better line. And therefore, earns a dot ball too. Pushed to cover.
back of a length outside off, 138 kph. A thick outside edge flies down to the third man boundary. He did attempt to open the face, but was that intentional? Don't think so.
a very full delivery on off, pushed to long-on
back of a length outside off, 137 kph, some width. Krishna may want to avoid that line. Cut away towards backward point
back of a length outside off, Samson opens the bat face and guides that down to third man for a run
that's too short, easy enough to read off the pitch. A stock delivery on middle and leg, worked to square leg
on leg stump, worked to deep midwicket. Buttler may just look to bat for a bit now.
the stock delivery, around off. Worked away to square leg for one
the conventional paddle sweep, Sanju tries first up. It's the googly, hits Samson on the body

80 kph, that's a weird shot. Is that a shot he plays well? I don't think so, which makes that reverse sweep a weird attempt. Looks to reverse sweep that ball - a lofted googly - through point. It's on leg stump too, indicating that was a premeditated shot. He misses, but the ball hits leg and middle stump. Kuldeep has confidence now, that's dangerous.
doesn't bother with the straight bat. A stock delivery on off, Rahane stays low and sweeps to deep square leg for a couple.
a full toss to finish. A quick one. Pushed back to the bowler, taken aback by the lack of accuracy
back of a length around off, some extra bounce. Punched to long-on.
a slower ball around off, worked wide of midwicket for a couple. Long-on had a lot of ground to cover
backs away, exposes his stumps and drills a drive to cover. A very good stop from Uthappa.
back of a length on off, nudged away towards midwicket, Rahane calls for two and makes it. Well placed, well run
full outside off, punched away to the sweeper cover.
breaks that pressure with a neat flick through backward square leg. Was an exceptional over till that point, but the line was errant and Rahane's off
more dots! A carrom ball outside off, worked to midwicket. Karthik sends him back for the last ball.
looks to slog sweep, but makes no contact. Slow and wide outside off, the ball turns back in. Rahane misses, so does Karthik
make that three. It's the carrom ball, short outside off, bunted away to mid-off
slow around off, worked to midwicket. Two dots for Rahane.
shortish and wide outside off, some spin back in. Pushed away towards cover for a quick single
back of a length outside off. Russell sticking with that length. Guides to gully, on the bounce.

gloved and gone! Eden Gardens goes wild. A short delivery down leg, Russell was quick and hustling. Tripathi is hurried on the pull and eventually, he can only get a glove on his pull, through to DK. That's a massive wicket, primarily because it's some relief.
back of a length on off, tapped away towards backward point for a quick single. Hit his glove almost. Seems that's the length to bowl here, hit the deck!
a low full toss, down the leg side. Tripathi misses a flick somehow, off the pad to third man
a slower ball, on the pads. worked away with soft hands into the gap in front of square leg for two.
slingy action. Full and wide outside off, Tripathi wants to play then bails out.

too full this time outside off. Buttler stays low and bottom-hands that drive away through wide mid-off. How he gets so much power on that is down to that bottom hand. In the slog overs, he would just loft that shot for six. He doesn't need to against Narine.
that's the better line. Some sarcastic cheers ring around the Eden Gardens. Flat and straight, blocked
drifts well down leg for a wide. Good take from Karthik, to his left.
flat and wide outside off, tapped to third man for a run.
a full delivery on middle, punched to cover from the crease.
11 in 12! A full delivery outside off, an offbreak. Tripathi stays low and swats the delivery over midwicket for four. Almost went for six.
DOT BALL! Full and wide, an offbreak, pushed to cover from the crease

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Buttler, FOUR runs
long_text: 10 boundaries in 10 balls! Wow, what a start for Royals. Probably his best delivery, close to a wide yorker but why would you want to bowl that with third man up? Buttler sees the ball early and scythes the ball through backward point.

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Buttler, SIX runs
long_text: nine in nine! 45 runs in 2.5 overs. Buttler backs away, then shuffles right back in line and scoops a straight delivery over fine leg for six. Too easy for Jos.

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Buttler, FOUR runs
long_text: yikes, that's an ugly flat-batted mow through midwicket. A slow, shortish delivery outside off is slapped wide of midwicket.

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Buttler, FOUR runs
long_text: a poor ball. Royals are flying. Short and wide outside off, Buttler slices an upper cut over point. Bad bowling.

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Buttler, SIX runs
long_text: that's a shot he's really good at. For Lancashire, for Somerset, for England, for Royals. Walks right across and just scoops a fast bowler over fine leg for six. How easy does batting look?

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Buttler, FOUR runs
long_text: short and wide, 139 kph. Buttler backed away too far and so had to stretch out too far to get bat on it. He gets that: a top edge and it flies over short third man.
that's splendid. Full and straight again, don't think that's the length you want to bowl here. Tripathi says thanks with a delightful, delectable on-drive through mid-on.
how has that gone for four? 143 kph, full on off, a bit of seam too. Tripathi now wants to work that ball through midwicket, but that away movement takes the outside edge and flies through gully!
and now he gets a poor delivery. Short and wide, plenty of width. Carved away past backward point. Earned that error with a calculated risk off the previous ball

that's what T20s are all about. Anticipation. The first ball of the over was tidy and straight. So Tripathi backs away and hopes it's there again. It is. He slices a carve off a full, straight delivery over point. Fantastic batting
good length outside off, 138 kph. He's generating decent speed. Pushed away towards cover for a quick, and well-judged single.
full, on middle. Defended towards mid-on. Nice start.

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Tripathi, no run
long_text: back of a length, the ball pitches and seams back in after pitching. Tripathi wants to play the ball into the off side but didn't account for that movement. The ball snakes in to hit Tripathi on the body, near the neck.

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Tripathi, no run
long_text: hitting the hard length. Back of a length down leg, hustles Tripathi for pace. Hits him on the body as he misses a flick.
good single. Back of a length around off, the ball seams back in. An inside edge into the pad, trickles back towards the keeper. Tripathi calls Buttler through.

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Buttler, no run
long_text: back of a length outside off, Buttler stays back and carves the ball to point. No feet movement, not much at least.

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Buttler, no run
long_text: a full, wide delivery outside off, Buttler looks to drive through the line but jabs it back

what a start! Did Rana get some hand on it? A back of a length delivery on middle and leg, it bounced and took off. Took the shoulder of the bat, towards Rana's right at wide slip. Somehow, the ball bursts out. That will go down as a drop.
that's the win. A bouncer wide outside off, he looks to hook, it's too big on him. Top edge over the keeper

dropped but it's also a no-ball. Kohli doesn't run. It's high and outside off, he lifts a simple catch for long-off who comes in, makes the ground, gets to the ball and then fails to hold on. Would have been game over if he had run there
full on off stump, drives to long-on
slower short ball at middle stump, hangs back and pulls to deep square
guided. Bouncer in the corridor. Parthiv arches backwards to make room and ramps it to the third man boundary
beaten. Another slower ball dying on the batsman from back of a length. Patel swings and it skids through from under his bat
knuckle ball at a length, wide outside off. Steps out and mistimes a drive to long-off
short of a length just outside off, dabs it to third man off the outside half
a short ball just outside off. Kohli onto the front foot to pummel this to deep midwicket's left with a flat bat
length on middle stump, looks to whip it, deflected pitch side off the pad

falls short of Mayank at deep midwicket. Parthiv miscues a pull. That gets too big on him. Slices it uppishly and it hangs enticingly for the fielder who pauses just a fraction before sprinting in and putting in a dive forward
length on the stumps, tapped to long-on
short and wide. Waits for it to arrive. Opens the face very late to get it past point
short ball just outside off, pulled on the up to long-on's left. Supremely timed

ohhhhh yesssss! Last ball of the Powerplay crunched over the long-off boundary. Kohli backs away to get full swinging room at this overpitched ball on off. Brings out the full swing too to lift this, flat
easy.  Short ball just outside off, third man is in. Opens the face and beats him
lovely bouncer has Kohli falling away into the leg side to get his head out of the way as he leaves. Of course, then he appears incensed that isn't a wide
inside edge onto pad, into the midwicket region. Parthiv looking to go behind square again. It's a full ball on middle stump
length ball at the stumps, punched down to long-on
steps out and yorks himself. Length ball outside off and he's forced to jam it into the covers
a whip that's blazed away to the backward square boundary! Mohit drops it short and can't get enough height on the attempted bouncer
nicely done Parthiv. Top skill to adjust for the slower ball after getting in position for the hook. He's falling into the off side a tad, but he keeps his eyes on it and steers it past short fine
full toss on middle stump and he manages only a feeble push out to deep midwicket
short ball skids on too quickly for him. Attempted hook deflected towards short fine off the glove
drilled. Parthiv lives for this - a full ball with lots of width outside off. Half a stride before getting very fast hands through this to get it to the cover boundary
slower ball to start. Short of a length and just outside off. Pulls to deep midwicket off the inside half
inside edge trickles past the stumps and rolls to short fine. Parthiv looking to flay one behind point but it's a knuckle ball

oh this looks plumb. It's not given and Ashwin reviews straight away. If there's no bat on this, I reckon Kohli will be in some trouble. Misses a length ball headed for leg stump as he plants the front foot across oh it's going down! That looked closer in real time. Turns out it's a very good decision. Among other things, Kings XI have lost their review now as well
bouncer climbs over his right shoulder. Nice height on that. Too steep for Kohli to try and hook
length ball just outside off, pulls but it's too quick. Hits the high part of the bat and trickles out to mid-on
slashes and misses. Knuckle ball again. Grips on the pitch and climbs over his attempted square drive on the up
beaten in pace as he steps out. It's a knuckle ball from Tye that stops on him and he's forced to fend into the covers off the outside half
well bowled. Length ball in the corridor beats the inside edge as Parthiv opens the face for the square drive

dropped. Finch lunges to his right at mid-off but can't hold onto this miscued shot. Kohli steps out again and turns this into a full toss. But his attempted shot is right off the toe-end and he ends up chipping it
slices over the off-side infield. Rajpoot getting special treatment. Length ball on off stump and Kohli is jumping down the pitch before if lands. Makes room and carves it over point
length ball pushed well down leg side, won't get bat on it, will get a run
length on middle stump, taps it to mid-on's right on the up
now he stays still and goes along the ground through midwicket. Short of a length ball at off stump, a short-arm pull past mid-on. Not timed too well, but it's a small ground

boom! Kohli was setting up for that shot with Rajpoot still two metres away from delivering. Length ball on middle stump, he has taken a tiny step into the leg side and whipped this well over the midwicket boundary

short of a length just outside off. Chopped to backward point who parries it to his right after tumbling. They sneak a single because of it and then they take an overthrow as mid-on tries to get to the throw backing up
glorious. Shot of the evening. The perfect cover drive. Length ball just outside off and Parthiv is quickly onto the front foot, leaning in to drill this between cover and extra cover
whipped. So easy. Overpitched on the leg stump and he gets it wide of short fine

close call! Length ball at middle stump, flicked straight to mid-on. It's timed well and Kohli has misjudged this one. Ashwin is onto it quickly to his right and fires a throw at the non-striker's end. Kohli would have been short
stays in the crease this time and punches nicely to find point. Short of a length in the corridor this time, no movement
leading edge. Kohli walks down the track to try and flick a length ball that's swinging away in the corridor
oh well played. Goes deep in the crease as this skids into him. Stand tall though and keeps his head still to punch it wide of mid-on off the back foot
length ball pushed into the pads. Flicked to square leg's left
length ball at off stump, stays in the crease and punches to mid-off with the turn
length on off stump, flicked to long-on off the front foot
pushes a slider in at a good length on middle stump. Parthiv makes room and pushes to mid-off
length ball pushed into the pads and he whips to deep square off the back foot

short_text: Ali to Axar Patel, 1 run, OUT
long_text: back of a length outside off, punched between wide long-on and deep midwicket. They try to push back for the second and has there been another run out? Yes. The bat's in the air as the zingers light up. Axar pays the price for failing to drag the bat across. Simply hangs it loose in the air and then tries to plant it down. But it's too late and he has to continue running in that direction towards the change rooms
length on off, stands tall and punches into the covers with bat and pad close together. An aesthetically pleasing shot, but quite useless in the situation
short, angled across off, Axar drags a pull to long-on
bowled down the leg side, Axar swings and misses
length around off, punches towards mid-on and takes on the fielder for another quick run. No direct throw this time
swings and misses at a fuller ball
tries to pull a short one and misses as it gets big on him
punches a length ball into the covers

length ball that keeps a little low around off, worked away to mid-on where there's a misfield and they decide to try and capitalise on it by stealing a second. Not a bad plan, except that they don't account for the fielder recovering in time and firing a dead accurate throw that grazes Moeen's hand and takes out the stumps. Mohit is just short of his ground. Oh, and the fielder was AB de Villiers!
pitched up outside off, drills this uppishy towards mid-off
straight on middle, flicked to deep midwicket
back of a length, spins in, tucked to square leg
fullish outside off, punched down to long-off
flicked uppishly through square leg

short_text: Yadav to Axar Patel, no run
long_text: full, angled across off, Axar leans forward into a drive to the covers
back of a length around off, drops it into covers for one

has he nicked off here? Yes, sounded like a feather. Tye tries to pull this shortish one that gets a little too big on him outside off and gets a mild top-edge that goes through to the keeper. Seems like he wanted to review that. At least that was the signal to the umpire but he ends up walking right past him
ripper that nearly shaves the outside edge. Short of a length, opening him up as it jags away ever-so-slightly off the deck
fuller around leg, pushed down the pitch
back of a length, tucked to square leg

has Ashwin run himself out here? He's put in a dive that may have just saved him, No, in fact, it hasn't. That's pretty incredible. A wide, bad throw but Ashwin is nowhere in the frame as Parthiv breaks the stumps. The Kings XI captain dropped this length ball into the covers and just set off for the single but was sent back by an uninterested Axar. Kings XI in quite the mess here

and he's picked out deep midwicket. Kings XI falling apart here. Finch picks up this length ball from middle and off and fails to get hold of this slog, skews it straight into the hands of Kohli in the deep
short of a length around off, Axar punches off the backfoot to long-off
back of a length, flat trajectories, shovelled flat on the bounce to deep square leg
slides on outside off, Finch backs away and chops it to the right of cover
backs away and Moeen follows him with a shortish delivery. The angle only helps Finch as he swivels and mows a pull over deep midwicket

short_text: Grandhomme to Axar Patel, no run
long_text: short of a length, angled across on off, Axar shuffles across and blocks down the pitch
full and angled in, flicked to deep midwicket
just back of a length, tries to glance it fine but the ball grazes the pad on its way to Parthiv behind the stumps
back of a length outside off, flat-batted to sweeper cover
short of a length, cuts away late slightly, waits before tapping it through point for one
sprays it down the leg side
back of a length around off, punched down the ground to the left of mid-off
floats it up a little on leg, clipped off the pads to deep backward square leg
back of a length, backs away and punches it out to sweeper cover
length on middle and off, blocked off the front foot

short_text: Chahal to Axar Patel, 1 leg bye
long_text: drifts it onto the pads, tries to flick it away but gets hit on the pad. Pitching outside leg
full and sliding into the pads, clipped away through square leg
back of a length, straightening around off, backs away and cuts to point

short_text: Grandhomme to Axar Patel, no run
long_text: back of a length, tucked into the leg side

is there a touch on that? Sounded like it! Parthiv thinks it's out too as he goes down leg side to complete a take. Mayank looking to flick this. The umpire goes to the leg umpire so he thinks there's a touch on this. Asks for the third umpire with a soft signal out. This doesn't look good for Mayank. Full ball down leg side and the bat is enough of a distance away to prove there's no pads involved. Parthiv has taken it cleanly too.
short of a length outside off, front-foot pull straight to short midwicket
length ball angled in at leg stump. Looks to dab it through midwicket and only manages to chip it into that region, closes the face too early
length ball slanted down leg side. He can't get bat on that
length and in at middle stump, clipped to deep square from the crease
offcutter, short and very wide. He doesn't move his feet and can't get the middle of the bat with the cut as a result. Gets it straight to extra cover

oh what a shot! Finch has generated an unbelievable amount of power for a straight-batted shot to clear the extra cover boundary. Very full and just outside off and this is so smooth - a clean lift to clear the ground
full on off stump, driven straight to mid-off
short of a length just outside off, gets inside the line and slices to third man
full and just outside off. Front foot plant, sweetly timed drive to sweeper cover
short of a length just outside off, gets on his toes and taps it to point
beaten. Length ball skidding through outside off and is too much for the attempted drive on the up
tossed up at off stump again, driven back on the bounce to the bowler

bowled him! Good old spinner's wicket - keep the single option open to a nervous batsman and bowl at his stumps. Stoinis looks like he wants to push it through covers but has pushed his front foot too far forward in anticipation. Yorks himself and loses his off stump
dropped very short outside off but he can only get the pull straight to long-on
short of a length slider at off stump, backs away and gets the punch straight to extra cover
floated up at off stump and he gets down quickly for the reverse sweep. Siraj cleans up to his left at short third man
short and wide outside off, cut straight to deep point
length and in at off stump. Jabbed into the off side from the crease
oh lovely. Leans in as he caresses this through the covers. Length ball just outside off and the weight transfer through this is what gets him the runs
just keeps it out. Length ball speared in at off stump. No forward press as he defends this
short of a length just outside off, opens the face and chops it to third man's right

he's guided it straight to slip! Oh this is turning bad very fast for Punjab. Short of a length ball outside off and he's looking for the single to third man. It's not done too much - no crazy movement, no extra bounce. It's just a supremely placed shot to Kohli at second-ish slip
full and in at off stump, tapped straight to mid-off

at deep square again! Umesh's extended spell has yielded both openers. Short ball at off stump, he gets too far under it for the hook and it sails high. Siraj is calm under it and takes with the reverse cup. Umesh has done everything that was asked of him by his captain. Superb spell
two-handed forehand wide of mid-off. That is creamed. Short of a length and the first semblance of room Umesh has offered. Gayle backs away and slaps away
short of a length outside off, opens the face and runs it to third man

taken at deep square! Another short ball that looks to be on its way, but Colin de Grandhomme is stationed at deep square to snap this high to his right. He's five yards in from the boundary for some reason - strange on this small ground. But he's done the job. A huge wicket. Not the greatest ball - short and heading into the body
see ya! Umesh tries to become the wristspinning Yadav and fails woefully. A half-tacker, sits up nicely at off stump Rahul slogs it over midwicket
deft from Rahul. Length ball at middle stump, gets right on top of the bounce and tickles it through the open square leg region
full toss this time and Punjab have a sensational over. Gayle has his front foot out of the way as he's backing into the off side. Gets behind the line, chips it over mid-off
too short. Southee can't get that to climb at Gayle's chest and that means plenty of room for the batsman to swivel and swat this on the bounce to the midwicket boundary
short of a length on the pads. Looks to play the glance, gets it into the square leg region
back of a length on the pads, whipped away to deep square off the back foot
yorker at off stump. Deep in the crease as he punches it back at the bowler who stops it with his left boot
hammered. Poor ball. Short, very wide. Gayle pummels it well in front of cover

falls short of AB at mid-off. Rahul backs away to open up the off side. They haven't given him any room today. He's off balance as he tries to punch on the up while moving down leg side. Chips it and AB puts in a full length dive to his right and forward. Won't get there

shot! Cannot bowl short to Rahul this season! His game behind the wicket has improved dramatically. It's at his head, but slightly down leg side. He has no issues getting slightly inside the line and hooking over fine leg
guides the yorker down to third man. Almost expects this ball from fast bowlers, Gayle. Stands tall in the crease and digs it out
cramped but he gets bat on this. Short of a length ball climbing up at his ribs as he looks to cut
struck on the thigh and looking for a quick single! Yadav has Gayle rattled. Short of a length and into his body. He's very very late on the attempted pull and there's no run at short leg
beats the outside edge as Gayle is stranded. No feet as he hangs the bat out in the corridor. It fizzes past him

swiped away. Southee goes marginally short and with his stump-to-stump line, Rahul has the freedom to go behind square. He's got the ability to get on the back foot quickly too. Sends it over square leg
length ball slanted in at the stumps. Once again, can't do more than defend down the pitch
Rahul walks into the leg side to expose the stumps. Southee follows him with a length ball and forces him to defend
length ball at off stump, gets right behind it to defend into the covers
good length, some shape away in the corridor. Goes deep in the crease and defends down the pitch with soft hands
length ball just outside, defended watchfully on the front foot
ouch. Gayle doesn't know about this one either. A bouncer slanted across his stumps that he's expecting to nip away. Expect it thuds him under the left shoulder

dropped! Parthiv Patel can't hold on with a one-handed dive to his left. Gayle and he are both expecting this to swing in. It does through the air before straightening. Gayle defends inside the line to get the edge, Parthiv takes a step to his right before leaping one-handed. Can't take it
full and swinging in fast at middle stump. Gets the bat down in time to keep this out
late swing again. Length ball hooping away and Rahul stabs at it away from the body to run is uppishly towards third man
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
swing. Late away swing in the corridor. Rahul on the front foot and jabbing at this with soft hands. Gets it into his body off the inside edge
finished in style! Stunning feat of beast-mode batting, clobbered violently into the midwicket stands, and the Royals have stolen a critical march on Mumbai in the battle for the play-offs
an inside-out slap over the off side, but he hasn't got enough on this, and holes out to deep point! Comfortably snaffled by the sub Chahar
through to the keeper this time, but it's a dot ball too late
Samson has no interest in landmarks, he just wants a quick finish! Powered over cow corner, and this one is utterly cooked!
slower ball, too short, and Samson responds with arguably the most massive spank of the night! High and mighty into the floodlights and 20 rows back!
fully forward, driven into the covers
panned over long on! The beast is tearing up the Wankhede! One bounce, inches inside the rope, and he's 12 away from his hundred with 16 runs to play with
slower ball, aiming for the tramlines, and that's worked out in the end. Buttler left it alone, but was adjudged to have shuffled close enough to have a swing
short, too short! The keeper does exceptionally to take off like a jump-jet and get a glove on that to slow its path to the boundary
pounded down to long-off, clearing the front leg and connecting with power and intent once more
outside off again, back of a length and pace off the ball, inside-edged into the pads and they steal the single
very full length from round the wicket, driven with an open face and gathered in the gully. An almost Test-match flash of play there. It won't last
width outside off, attempted slap into the covers but no proper connection
eased down to long-on, calm as you like
pushed out to wide long-on. Some Mumbai fans have seen enough and are heading into the lights of Marine Drive
pumped clean down the ground. Top striking!
tossed up into the toes, tapped to the leg side
sliding down the leg side, and paddled calmly down through fine leg. Cute and effective
tucked into the leg side, to keep the strike. The Royals are ticking along nicely
pushed into the off side
banjaxed into the stands! Where do you bowl to this man? A more aggressive short ball this time, but it just brings out a more aggressive swing of the blade, over square leg!
too short for a man seeing it this well. Buttler stands firm, such a solid base, and baseball swings over the leg side
guided down to third man
sliding back into the crease to guide a length ball into the covers
pushed out to deep cover to keep the strike
spanked with more power down to long-on, and this time it's intercepted
flat, hard, frightening power! Get in the way of that if you dare. Long-on can't, he doesn't have time!
absolutely slaughtered into the stands! He's having a lot of fun out there now, head right over the ball, even at the point of contact, and slammed with Popeye forearms over cow corner!
flicked down to fine leg to get off the mark

in the slot, spanked high and hard, there's a fielder lurking at deep mid-off, and he just about clings on! Yadav over-ran that shot at first, and almost slid back into a position to catch it in his midriff. Ungainly, but timely!
slower-ball bouncer, Buttler has the big wind-up but he can't make any contact. There've been some moments in this innings where Buttler's been out-smarted, but he finds a way to hit back every time
inverts his stance, for the third time this innings. And for the third time, he makes no contact. That one's not working today Jos
mown through the covers like a combine-harvester across the outfield! Such fast hands, giving him time to angle the ball through the field
a round-house pull, out to midwicket. Not perfectly timed but gets enough bat through the ball to steal the single
through to the keeper once more, good pace and line
fizzing through to the keeper, the left-arm line taking the ball clear of an ambitious wallop
that's just power and placement! Pounded through the covers, to bring up the five in a row! Not a lot wrong with the ball, but the shot was poetry
flicked to the leg side, they scuttle the first in a jiffy, and turn sharply for the second. Excellent pressure
worked into the covers to hand over the strike
slapped in the air, and just wide of short third man! Bumrah is the man, can't quite get his feet moving quickly enough to intercept a rare chance
width this time, and cracked hard out to point
pounded down to long-on with a fierce swing through the line. A good shot for just a single
no contact this time, as this one zips through Buttler's swing and into his thigh-pad
eased down to long on

down on one knee, an ambitious sweep and a huge appeal! They are tempted to have a look, and yep, here we go, it's a review! It's Buttler, so it's worth the gamble, though it did look optimistic. Going to have to be smashing leg to be overturned  nope, it's missing leg!
pushed to the off side
flicked in the air, but one bounce, down to the sweeper at backward square
worked to the leg side, on the back foot
here we go! Tossed up, right into Buttler's slot, and he slots it with glee, high over the leg side!
flicked along the ground out to deep midwicket
swept hard down to backward square, but gathered by the sweeper
another unflustered nudge into the gap on the leg side
clipped out through midwicket, well placed into the gap
very full length, clears the front leg to ease the ball back to the bowler
punched down the ground for another single
stunning ball! Tossed up, dips late, spins and bounces, and whistles through his pushed drive and over the top of middle! Takes a good ball to get past Buttler at the moment
fenced into the covers for another single
attempted back-cut, can't get it off the square but they scamper the single, Krunal has been effective tonight
back of a length and pushed to long-on
tossed up and driven to long off
makes room, slaps through the line, straight back at the bowler, who half-stops in his followthrough as they jog the single
on the pads, no room to free the arms, and Rahane settles for a measured nudge to square leg
flicked off the legs to fine leg
shuffling feet and pushed into the covers
marching down to meet the pitch, and deposited back over the bowler's head! Such poise, power and timing
bottom-handed punch down to long on
whoops, that's ruined the effect! An attempted slower ball, but it comes out as a horrid hip-high wide full-toss. Contemptuously blatted through long-off
opens the face to glide down to third man, a good release shot but nothing wrong with the ball. Tight stuff
on the back foot, dragging the length back, and worked back to the bowler. This is a very good over so far
crunched into the covers, on the front foot
nudged into the leg side
just back of a good length, angling into the right-hander, tucked off the legs
that's a good response from Pandya, shorter and sharper, tempting Buttler into the ramp shot, but the ball is through him too quickly. Cat-and-mouse stuff in that over
another attempted scoop, another non-connection. Nothing ventured, nothing gained
blam! So much bottom hand! Over-pitched, in the arc, and utterly butchered for a one-bounce four through long-off
Buttler inverts his stance for his trademark scoop shot, the length was safe enough, but no contact as the ball hops over his stumps
more wristy flipping, from a good length on off stump out through backward square.
another intentful glide into the covers
pumped into the covers, more intent for no runs this time, but they are starting to flow now
crunched to extra cover, they decline to take the single for the slight misfield
down on one knee, and away she goes! High over backward square, just high enough to lob over the flaying fielder
makes room early, Krunal follows him, Buttler retreats some more, lofts inside out over cover, and away for four! Skill and power
nurdled out to deep midwicket, no need to rush for the Royals
swept once more, out to backward square
pounded with massive intent, front foot cleared to the leg side, but Cutting gathers in the long barrier at mid-off
punched on the up to mid-off
dinky wristwork! Played it so late it was almost into next week, and when you've got angles like those in your locker, who needs extreme power?
short and sharp, and though it's down the leg side, it's tight enough to the body to get away with it. More aggression in that delivery
sliding down the leg side
attempted ramp from Rahane, but he wears it on the glove. Leaning back, attempting to pinch a four through third man, but the slower ball did for him
whipped off the pads, that's a superb connection, timed through the 45, and away to the rope
flicked into the leg side for another single
tucked out to midwicket once more
swept hard to square leg and has that carried to Markande? No it hasn't   a flurry of excitement, but Buttler was unbothered. Good connection, if a touch early. Nope, just short
back of a length, tapped to point and a jogged single ensues
clipped with the spin out to midwicket
looped up from round the wicket, into the toes, and tucked to the leg side
back of a length, into the body, flinched to the leg side, that's a better over for Mumbai
a change of pace from Mitch, clipped off the pads but well stopped at short midwicket
chiselled off the pads, out to deep midwicket
fizzing through to the keeper, short, sharp, aggressive   and wide
that's a good length for these conditions, just back of full, skidding into the body, and duly defended to the leg side
flipped off the legs to backward square leg
on the back foot, left-arm over the wicket, Buttler slides back to meet the ball under his nose, deep in his crease
that's the way to do it! Good positive footwork, stretching to meet the half-volley and slice-driving it through the covers
edged and gone! And that had been coming all over! A bit of swing, Bumrah gets his line right, Short's feet going nowhere, and the keeper snaffles a comfortable nick!
a good zippy length, sliding into the bat, on the back foot once more
on the back foot, dragging the length back well this time
Short is creasebound, and pokes awkwardly as the ball zips through from back of a length
not such a good ball  a horrid leg-side wide  sublime to ridiculous, much like the earlier catching
Zoinks, that is a staggeringly good first ball, a massive booming inswinger, Short jabs down late and somehow digs it out through fine leg for four!
slower short ball outside off, Cutting can't manufacture his own pace. Dragged away to wide long-on. Cutting hares back for the second

Samson pulls off a blinder. He is a wicketkeeper but he tears across to his right in the outfield and plucks a diving catch at deep midwicket. He tumbles onto the ground but still holds his balance and hangs onto the ball. Full and drifting into the pads, Samson picks it up and shovels a catch. That it was a catch was down to Samson's brilliance
107.8ks slower ball outside off, Hardik goes for an encore. Hardik fails. He can't touch the ball

The man behind the stumps is a master of this shot. The man in front shows off he can do it too. Hardik jumps across off, meets a slower length ball and flips it away past the left of the diving Buttler
seam-up, short and angling into the body, beats the batsman for pace, hits the thigh and rolls away to short third man
Cutting tees off in the final over. Slower ball, 100ks, but too full on middle, Cutting clears his front leg and smites it over the long-on fence. Muscled away. Royals continue to err in lengths
seam-up, bouncer, fizzes through outside off, beats the batsman's lousy attempt to uppercut it away

Archer now drops an absolute sitter. Look at Warne in the dugout: he has his hands on his mouth. Slower offcutter outside off, Cutting is way too early into his slog-sweep and toe-ends it into the sky. It drops down and Archer drops it at backward point
lifter outside off from around the stumps, gets big on Hardik, who lines up for a hook. Top-edges over midwicket, does not carry to the man in the deep

seam-up, the yorker isn't coming out right for Unadkat. Low full-toss outside off, Hardik rocks forward, lets his hands flow through the line. Smeared up and over extra cover for another six. Last four balls 17 runs
the pressure gets to Unadkat. Full and spared wide outside off, past the marker
Unadkat goes for the wide yorker, it comes out as a low full-toss outside off, not quite the MS Dhoni slice over backward point, but still effective. Back-to-back boundaries for Hardik
timely boundary for Mumbai. This a monster six. Length ball on middle, Hardik stretches out, shows off his high elbow and smokes it straight down the ground. Into the second tier. Bam!
147ks - pace like fire - bouncer, aimed at the head, rocks his head out of the way. What a way to finish your spell. Well done, Archer
dragged off the inside half to deep midwicket
good length and outside off, squirted to deep third man for one
low full-toss, angling in at off, 144ks, pace like fire, squeezed to midwicket
rides the bounce of this short one outside off and chops a single to deep third man
back of a length on off, 143.3ks, no room at all, jabbed back to the bowler
Hardik shuffles across off and throws Archer off his line. Sprayed down leg, leg-side wide
short on middle, shimmies out and whips to deep midwicket

Gowtham nearly drops it. He hangs onto the catch on the rebound. After playing out two dots, Krunal goes for an almighty leg-side swing. He doesn't have the pace to work with. This is the offcutter from Unadkat, bounces from a length outside off, Krunal wants to drag it from there. But he can only skew a catch to long-on, where Gowtham nearly made a mess of it
another short ball, wide outside off, away from the reach of Krunal's hook. Beaten in the end
big lifter on off from over the stumps, Unadkat forces Krunal to duck under it
wide of the crease, slanting in at off stump, Hardik opens the face, tips the ball to short third man and hares across. The fielder (Kulkarni) misses a direct hit at the striker's end
Unadkat goes short and wide outside off, seam-up, as Hardik ventures down the track and cracks the ball away to Samson at sweeper cover
length ball on middle, Krunal jumps away outside leg and smears it straight to Stokes at mid-off
slower cutter outside off, 115.5ks, Hardik opens the face and secures a single to third man
Krunal rides the bounce of this 137.6ks short ball outside off and glides it down to third man
slower, short ball outside off, 110ks, heaved off the inside half through midwicket
off-stump yorker, 141ks, dragged down to long-on
short of a length on off, steered through backward point
fullish outside off, drive to long-on
back of a length, tucked off the hips to square leg
angles it in and ends up spraying it down the leg side
flicks a length ball to deep square leg
back of a length on off, opens the face to point. Hardik wants an ambitious single but is sent back by Krunal

shortish, it's slower at 113.1kmph, and that gets in the way of Kishan's timing. Skews it off a bit ofa top-edge and Samson judges a catch to perfection at deep midwicket. Moves slightly back and grabs it reverse-cupped with the floodlights in his line of vision
short of a length around off, punched to short cover
short outside off, Hardik doesn't even arch back as much as he ramps it through the third man region
back of a length around leg, flicked to the right of deep midwicket
just short of a length, not the most well-timed of pulls but enough to carry to the deep midwicket boundary
length ball on off, blocked to short cover. Rahane there sees Hardik backing up and fires a throw that hits the stumps. And they take extra runs off the deflection
good length, a bit of width, Lewis opens up and slaps but slices it in the air and Sanju Samson moves to his right and snaffles it at deep point
Kulkarni slows it up, but Lewis moves across off and mows this length ball towards the sightscreen
full outside off, driven to mid-off
length ball around off, tries to go big and mistimes it down the pitch
short of a length, angled in, tucked to deep midwicket
backs away to a shortish one and slaps it to deep point
back of a length, blocked down the pitch
length all on leg, turned away to midwicket
full toss, lots of elevation on that one and it seems as though he's mishit it. But on the Wankhade, that's a six. What's more, it's smashed into the press box. But no damage done
gets down for a sweep but the ball drifts down the leg side
sliding fuller one, driven down to long-on
good length on the stumps, blocked back
short, can't latch onto a pull as it bounces in front of long-on
shuffles across and pushes down the pitch
drifts away outside off and left alone
gets a fuller dart at 146.1 ks first-up, and he drives it out to sweeper cover

and now Unadkat grabs a chest-height catch. Rohit is out first ball, and Mumbai are losing some ground. Rohit flays a pull to this short ball but it goes straight to long leg. That was travelling and Unadkat reverse-cups and falls over as he completes the catch. That's a brilliant piece of fielding
tries to pull this short one but skews it in the air off the top part of the bat. Unadkat at long leg moves forward and takes a superb low catch. Around shin height
back of a length, misses the flick behind square as the ball goes off the hip
short outside off, Lewis punches to mid-off off the bottom of the bat. He's struggling through these middle overs here. Need to find some fluency
short of a length outside off, gets on top of it and opens the face to backward point who dives and prevents the single
slower full ball, tries to heave it away and skews it off the inside of the bat behind square on the leg side
susses out the lack of pace and punches late but finds backward point
full outside off, drilled off the inside of the bat to long-on
length on middle and off, not much feet but he punches crisply through the left of mid-off
yorker on middle, dug out to the left of long-on
back of a length, complete lack of pace messes up Lewis' timing as he feels for it and misses
shortish and some width, goes on with the arm and Lewis slaps it through the covers
short of a length, spinning away, punched down to long-on
non-turning length ball on a leg-stump line, whipped off the pads through square leg
extremely full outside off, squeezed out through the off side
now that's a more believable six. Down the ground and mowed straight over long-off with plenty of elevation
legside fuller ball, Lewis gets down for a sweep and he's timed it alright, but it's ridiculous how that's carried over the backward square leg fence. A flat six
walks down the ground and Unadkat pulls his length back, Lewis steers to third man with an open face
slower full ball on off, 123.2 kmph, driven down to long-on
length ball outside off, too close to cut and gets an inside edge that barely misses the stumps
full and angled across, Suryakumar lofts it over extra cover with a free swing
short of a length, shapes up to cut and chops it into the surface as he gets tucked up for room
run down to third man
shortish, fails to time a pull between long-on and deep midwicket
advances down the ground and gets no elevation as he chips it one-bounce to long-on off the toe-end
length ball, spins away slightly towards off, pushed back to the bowler
full and straight on middle, blocked off the front foot into the covers
googly, on a length, shuffles and works against the turn to midwicket
flat length ball, flicks to the left of midwicket
ruins a good over with a useless full toss. Seems like that slipped out of the hand and Lewis shovels it over the in-field on the off side
yorker on middle, this is good, tight bowling, drilled away to the left of mid-off where Stokes hurries across and cuts it off
dipping fuller one outside off, reaches out and squeezes it out to short third man for a quick one
picks the slower ball really early and waits before opening the face and running it through backward point. Knew his field to perfection
too full and sneaks from underneath the bat as he reaches out for it
short of a length around off, shuffles across and punches down to long-on
high full toss, backs away and fends it away awkwardly to cover. Just about gets away with a no-ball
slower one that slides into the pads, clipped away to mid-on where Unadkat shuffles to his right and makes a tumbling stop
full outside off, gets a stride across and drives it to point
angles in a full toss that's pushed down to long-on
short of a length around off, backs away and slashes it out to gully
starts off with a short delivery with loads of width and Lewis throws his hands at it and gets an outside edge through third man

almost knocks over the non-striker. A slower full ball, gets a bit of a leading edge as he closes the face and chips it in the air. Lewis just about gets under it as the ball races down the ground for four
full on middle and leg, pushed down the ground to mid-on
short of good length, jumps inside the crease to get on top of it and uses the angle to tuck it through midwicket. Good timing on that one
angles it into the batsman, Yadav goes too hard at a flick and gets hit on the pad
shin-high full toss around middle and off, Lewis goes too hard at a punch and ends up mistiming it to mid-on
extremely full outside off, Lewis squeezes it out to point
tries to open the face late for a run down to third man but manages no contact
angled too sharply down the leg side and Yadav can't put it away with the glance

in the air, stays there for like forever, and Binny can't get his hands to it at mid-on. He got in position nicely, mind you, but that took so long to come down Binny might as well have taken a power nap.  Goes reverse-cupped and the ball just about grazes the fingers before landing on the ground. Lewis gets lots of elevation but hardly much distance on this loft down the ground
short, angled into him, hits the elbow as he tries to fend it away
drifts a back of a length delivery down the legside
back of a length, tries to flick and does so early. It's the slower one and he gets hit on the back arm
short and holding its line outside off, arches back and lets it go
works away a fuller one off the inside of the bat to deep backward square leg
in the air again and once more falling short. Not as close as the previous one though. The bat turns in Lewis' hands as he tries to drill this fuller one away
fullish length, swinging away, covers for the movement and drills it to cover who gets a hand to it and takes momentum out of the ball
short of a length, nips away off the deck and makes him reach out as he gets beaten
short and wide, stands tall and cracks it through the covers
in the air and short of mid-on. Kulkarni bowls this full and Yadav flicked early to slice it in the air. Mid-on dives forward but it just drops short
shot! Timed and placed sweetly through the right of extra cover
stays back and tries to whip a length ball away but it drifts down the leg side
pitched up on middle, driven to long-on
fuller still and too much width again, drills a drive hard through the cover region
length outside off, this one comes on nicely to the bat with loads of room, and it's been crunched off the front foot over extra cover
tries to cut this one but the ball skids through at pace and beats him with pace
pitched up outside off, driven hard to point who gets down to his left and half-stops it
turns this gently into the leg side, that's that. CSK cruise home in style with an over to spare.  They're all but into the playoffs.

walks across the stumps and works this length ball to square leg.  That's Rayudu's century, what a knock!  Points to someone in the coaching staff, does a circle around his head and then walks up to Dhoni to give him a hug. Lovely knock. I haven't seen Rayudu smile like this ever before. I've only seen him angry
squeezed down to third man to bring Rayudu on strike
slams this pull to deep square leg. Neither deep midwicket nor fine leg moved. Ferocious strike
lands short of third man! Rayudu went over mid-off, ended up slicing it towards third man.
banged in short, Rayudu leaves. Umpire signals one bouncer for the over. He shaped to pull but decided to let go late
Sid Kaul keeps bowling full tosses, keeps getting whacked! Hasn't learnt, bowls a full toss on middle, Dhoni sends this deep into the deep square leg boundary. That was the  fourth full toss in a row
another full toss, another slap but straight to deep cover
another full toss, another bunt down the ground to long off, they're walking home in singles here
waist-high full toss, punched through to long off. Rayudu asked for the no-ball, Erasmus went 'no, mate. All good there.'
solid punch down the ground to long off for a single
full toss, biffs this down to deep midwicket

short_text: Rashid Khan to Dhoni, no run
long_text: can't get this past cover, Dhoni squeezed out the yorker length ball
works this flatter one down to long on
once again gets forward and eases this down to long on
gets to the pitch as he drives to long off
lunges forward and eases this behind point for a quick single

short_text: Rashid Khan to Dhoni, no run
long_text: squeezes a drive to backward point
bang! Advances and picks the length to flat-bat this one bounce into the ropes. Rayudu inches closer to a century.
friendly full toss, Rayudu gleefully accepts as he steps out and swings this straight back over Shakib's head. This shot is as easy as stepping out in Hyderabad and finding a biryani store
makes room and punches this length ball to long off
charges down, Shakib cleverly fires this full and wide, Rayudu reaches out to squeeze this away to cover

Pandey, one of the best fielders in the IPL, has dropped an absolute sitter at long-on!  Dhoni stepped out to launch this over the ropes, but didn't get the elevation as this lobbed off a thick inside edge. Oh, dear.
drifting into middle and leg, eased to deep midwicket
short-arm jab to long on
looks to nudge this leg side, the ball angles in to deflect off his pad and they take a leg bye
too short, way over Dhoni's head. Easy call for wide
full on middle, drills this down to long on as they jog a single
forces this one through point to get off the mark
slower length ball on off, punched to long on
poor shot in desperation results in Raina's fall. Was looking to muscle this over midwicket but got it high on the bat and Williamson took a tumbling catch at mid-off.
full on middle, eased down to long-on, again
leans back and punches to sweeper cover
floated full on off, bunted to long-on off the front foot
Goswami gathers the throw from Kane Williamson and catches Watson short. Rayudu pushes it to cover, and they chance a quick single. But Watson isn't quick enough. Some respite for Sunrisers
Rayudu uses his feet, speared wide, swished to extra cover
looped up on leg stump, Rayudu dashes down the track and launches it into the wind. Into the midwicket boundary
just short of a good length and outside off, Watson drags a pull between long leg and deep midwicket
slogged away again, this time to wide long-on
here comes Rayudu, charges down the track. Bhuvneshwar shortens his length on middle. Clubbed over the wide long-on fence for six
back of a length, skids in, hits Rayudu on the mid-riff as he is rushed into a pull
back of a length and angling in on off, Rayudu has an almighty leg-side swipe, and skews it to the right of Rashid at deep midwicket
back of a length on middle, hangs back and works to leg

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run
long_text: very full and attacking the stumps, defended back to the bowler
looks like another wrong'un, finishes on a fourth-stump line, fended to the leg side for one more
googly, but the length is short, picked away off the hips into the vacant spaces at midwicket

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run
long_text: fired outside off, 99ks, stretches out and drives to cover

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rayudu, SIX runs
long_text: Rayudu slices a loft and clears Hales at long-off. Tossed outside off, breaks away, drops to one knee and lifts it over for six

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run
long_text: fizzes through on a fourth-stump line, chopped behind to Goswami
really full on leg stump, tucked away to deep midwicket
overpitched on middle now, Rayudu stays leg-side of the ball and crunches a drive to the left of long-off. Skips away to the boundary
middle-stump yorker, good comeback ball, jammed back to Kaul
Rayudu brings up a fifty of his own and the side's 100 with a six over midwicket. Banged in outside off, Rayudu, having shuffled across, smokes it over midwicket. Bam!
Kaul bangs another one into the pitch, attacks the body, Watson top-edges a hook to deep square
chest-hunting short ball on middle stump, Rayudu takes it on with a pull and splices it between deep square and deep midwicket
slower again, short, Watson waits for the ball to arrive and scythes a square cut. He raises a 31-ball fifty and is embraced by Rayudu
gee, how did that miss off stump. Knuckle ball, bounces  over off. Watson swipes early and misses
low full-toss outside off, Watson stretches out and creams it to the right of sweeper cover. Excellent sliding save in the deep from Rashid
another slower one outside off, 110.7ks, flat-batted away to long-off
hip-high short ball on middle, slower one, Watson picks it up and pulls to deep midwicket
wide of the crease. Pretty full and just outside off, Watson hoists it over extra cover. Hales skips to his left and cuts it down at long-off

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run
long_text: skidder just a shade outside off, chopped to backward point

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rayudu, FOUR runs
long_text: quicker ball, thigh-high short ball outside off, this 104ks dart is swatted off the back foot to the midwicket fence
another googly, sliding into the hips, helped wide of short fine leg for one

short_text: Rashid Khan to Watson, no run
long_text: googly spins from outside off, Watson does not read it, slog-sweeps and does not make contact
straighter one on off, 97.4ks, tip and run to cover

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run
long_text: back of a length and breaks away outside off, Rayudu flashes and sends an outside edge to short third man
Rayudu ventures down the track and hits a shorter one down to long-off
slower and outside off, leans back and glides to sweeper cover
hip-high short ball outside off, right in Watson's swinging arc. Rocks back and muscles a pull against the intended break to the wide long-on fence
Shakib hits a hard length on middle, slides in, messes with Watson's sweep and hits the pad
short and angled in on middle, Rayudu flat-bats it down the ground to long-on
arm ball, ducks in on middle, stabbed to midwicket off the inside half
lifter wide outside off, Rayudu lets it fizz through to Goswami
overpitched and outside off, Rayudu, having camped back all this while, presses forward and drills it straight of mid-off
wide of the crease, chest-high short ball, slanting in, Rayudu stays back and fends it off
fuller and outside off, opens the face and dabs through point with soft hands
short and outside off, Rayudu clears his front leg and skies a pull. Hales moves in as opposed to hanging at the edge of the boundary. Rayudu clears Hales and lifts the ball into Sunrisers' dug out
back of a length on off, cramps Rayudu for room. He dares to pull and ends up splicing it over midwicket for four
flat dart on middle stump, here comes Rayudu. Down the track and clipped down the ground for one
whipped with the angle to midwicket
CSK pass fifty in the last over of the Powerplay. Tossed on middle, Rayudu forays down the track, gets close enough to the pitch, and hoists it over the bowler's head
full and sliding into leg stump, this non-turner is swept between short fine leg and square leg
Watson makes room outside leg, Shakib follows him with an arm-ball, jabbed to the covers
tripe from Shakib. Full and sliding down leg with fine leg inside the circle, nudged away fine of the diving fielder. Easy pickings
speared outside off, Watson presses forward and secures a single down to long-off
another wrong'un, back of a length and skids in, cramps Rayudu for room, worked to leg

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rayudu, FOUR runs
