long_text: full on off stump, wrong'un?  Rayudu stretches out, rolls out a sweep and hits it to the right of a sliding Hooda at deep midwicket

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run
long_text: slid through on off, hint of turn, Rayudu camps back and runs it to short third man

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run
long_text: quick fizzer outside off, no turn, Rayudu punches off the back foot to backward point
Rashid darts a full-toss on off, spliced to wide long-on
nearly chopped on! This rolls off the pad into the off side and they scamper a single
defends this incoming length ball from the crease
steps out and toe-ends a pull to wide mid-on
beaten by some late seam movement, looked to punch through cover
goes inside-out and this sails over deep cover. Full and moving away, Rayudu just cleared his front leg and biffed that away
on the backfoot as he defends this length ball
short, and this is even bigger. Muscled over deep midwicket! This is Watson unleashed. Sandeep can't afford to bowl that length, he needs to be much, much fuller.
poor. Slower ball gone wrong, slides this down leg, Watson nonchalantly gets down on one knee and sweeps him over the fine leg boundary
turns this length ball towards Shakib at short midwicket as they scamper a single
cramped for room, bunts this length delivery to cover
lunges forward and defends this full delivery with hard hnds
angles a full delivery on middle and leg, defended with soft hands
squared up by the length, gets a thick outside edge to third man
dabs this gently behind point for a quick single
punches this length delivery to cover point
nearly chopped on, excellent from Goswami, who leapt high to take that
pulled in front of square, sails over deep midwicket. Not all that bad a delivery, length and Watson got into position quickly
back of length on off stump, Watson gets on top of the bounce and defends
works this off his hip to midwicket
shows the full face of the bat as he defends to mid on
touch ahead of length on off, defended towards cover
beats point, races to the point boundary. Once again there's width from Sandeep, Watson used the pace to steer this wide
reaches out to drive, mistimes this to extra cover
floats this full on off, Watson punches this into the cover region to get off the mark with a couple
full and straight, stock pace, mis-hit tolong-on, gives Hooda enough time to come back for the second
and now the one outside off. Slower ball, offcutter, beats Shakib's attempt to cut it

yorker, under his bat, hits his pad. Might just have pitched outside leg. This is a bluff because he has three fielders in the circle behind square on the off side. Shakib is expecting something outside off but gets a straight yorker
not great bowling. On a length, on the pads, with square leg and fine leg inside the circle. Shakib plays the pick-up over square leg
down the wicket, expecting the slower one. Bravo slips in the quicker one, and follows him too. A cramped-up Hooda gets just the single to long-on
full, just outside off, Shakib drives it to long-off to hand it over to Hooda
on a length, gets away with just a single as Shakib manages to hit this only as far as point
Hooda moves across again, Thakur bowls length, and he turns this to leg for a single
wide yorker gone wrong again. Too wide outside off. There is a bit of an appeal for a catch at the wicket but the umpire's call is emphatic and early
Hooda moves across to another full and wide ball, and strikes it clean over long-off. This one is not executed well either. The two previous ones were too wide, this one too close to Hooda
and another wide. Going for those wide yorkers
full and fast, beats his drive, but it is too wide and called

knuckle ball, and Pnadey is out. He had to go really. Saw a length ball, looked to deposit it into the stands, but ended up getting too under it skied it to long-off. CSK doing well in the last two-three overs
bouncer, seems like the off-pace bouncer, Pandey through it before it arrives. A rare dot ball
short of a length, outside off, crisply driven on the up, but doesn't beat the man at deep cover. Gets a couple
slower offcutter, full, turned to leg for a single
slower offcutter, Hooda pushes it to long-on, turns for the second but slips. Everybody safe
length ball, into the pads, clipped away to leg, yet another couple
bunted into the leg side, Jadeja rushes in from deep midwicket, but they steal the second

shuffles too far across, Bravo pings him right in front with a full ball. He has kept CSK into the game with two wickets and a catch now. Oh hang on. This is interesting. Seemed like a review in hope than in conviction but the ball is shown to be missing the leg stump by the ball projection. This ball didn't have much to travel but the tech ology shows Hooda is not out
wide down the leg side, Bravo trying to go behind him but going too far with the angle
slower ball, offcutter, on a length, outside off, soft hands to push this towards long-on, which allows them to come back for the second
into the pads, takes a single to deep midwicket
mid-off is up, Hooda picks his spot, and manages to mis-hit this length ball over that man. The timing is not perfect but Hooda's idea is good: go over the man inside the circle
short of a length again, driven to deep cover for another single
driven to long-on for another single. CSK breathing easy momentarily
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover for one

sensational catch from Bravo. He has removed two set batsmen in two balls. Full and wide from Thakur, Williamson drives with an open face, over short third man, but from deep point Bravo runs to his left, goes about 20 metres, and takes this low to his left with both hands

oh, dear. He's scooped this straight to short fine. Dhawan tries to be too cute, gives away his intentions much before Bravo delivered, so he bowls a cutter at length on middle. No pace to work with and he hits it straight to Harbhajan even as thick rain clouds gather over the MCA Stadium  from the east. They look ominous too.
steps out and punches this on the up to long off
right into the blockhole, squeezed wide of cover

short_text: Bravo to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: squeezes this behind point, no third man so that's headed just one way. It's raining boundaries
belts this full toss to long-off, another half-century for Williamson. His 10th overall in the IPL
makes room and forces this length ball past extra cover, don't think Williamson realised how well he hit it till it raced away. Deep cover stood no chance

short_text: Willey to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: the bat breaks as he defends. Calls for a few spare ones from the dugout

short_text: Willey to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: hammered back over the bowler's head, one bounce to the ropes. Too full on off. Absolutely picked the bones out of that

short_text: Willey to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: Luck favours him this time!  Shaped to pull from outside off over deep midwicket, thick outside edge past the keeper to third man
goes short, this time Williamson goes back and helps it over point, good work by Jadeja
flat hit, just clears Bravo at mid-off. Too full, he got underneath the length and belted that
waits, waits and then steers this to backward point for a quick single
steps out and drills this inside out to wide long off

short_text: Harbhajan to S Dhawan, SIX runs
long_text: clobbered deep over deep midwicket! Stands his ground and simply swings through. Harbhajan dragged it down and got punished
reverse paddle, but no control, bounces in front of Watson running in from short third man
drifts into middle and leg, tucked towards midwicket
steered behind point as they scamper a single
steps out and belts this over the bowler's head. Harbhajan beat him in flight as he stepped out, but he reached out and swing this over. Delightful
too much width outside off, smeared into the gap at sweeper cover, Willey does the mopping up

short_text: Jadeja to S Dhawan, SIX runs
long_text: bowls length, gets punished. Dhawan flat-bats the pull over deep midwicket to bring up his half-century.
goes for a slog, has to fetch it from way outside off, gets a thick inside edge wide of Jadeja as they scamper a single
reverse paddles this quicker one past short third man, deft touch from Dhawan

short_text: Jadeja to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: slants one across at length, steered to point
punches this length ball to long off
drilled down the ground, long-on was too straight.

short_text: Watson to S Dhawan, 1 leg bye
long_text: thuds the thigh pad as Dhawan looks to whip this square, they scamper a leg bye
full but swinging back in down leg, Dhawan swings and misses.

short_text: Watson to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: full toss, above the waist? Not quite, punched straight to point.  Harsh call, Watson gets away with one. Above the waist
gets inside the line and helps this short ball up and over, down to third man
swung over the ropes at deep square leg. Too short, he picked the length and smeared this from outside off. Clobbered that, deep into the stands. Coach Tom Moody has a big grin
sliced over point. Length on off, he backed away and then used his wrists to hit this where he wanted, superb.

short_text: Jadeja to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: fired in outside off, Dhawan shapes to cut but is beaten

short_text: Jadeja to S Dhawan, SIX runs
long_text: oh, wallop! Right in his hitting zone. Round-arm from Jadeja but right down Dhawan's alley as he gets underneath the flight and belts this back over the sightscreen
steps out and punches this length ball to long off
pulls this short ball to wide long on

short_text: Jadeja to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: too short, put away. Dhawan waits inside the crease and then gives it a proper whack through cover when it arrives.
length on off, steered to deep point

short_text: Bravo to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: full and angling away, left alone again

short_text: Bravo to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: goes through, Harbhajan makes a mess of it at short fine leg. Short and angling down, Dhawan pulls this straight to short fine, Harbhajan loses control as he tries an unnecessary slide. Gives away four when there should have been none

short_text: Bravo to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: slants a full delivery across, Dhawan watches this through to Dhoni
thumped to sweeper cover
short and angling down leg, Williamson helps this on its way to the fine leg fence. Too easy
slapped away to sweeper cover
slips this down leg, wide and rightly so
backs away to slap this over point, ends up getting a thick inside edge back to the bowler
pulls and misses. Touch too full for him to play it
steps out and blasts this past Watson's outstretched left hand on the followthrough, long-on was pretty straight
picked away! Too short, he's cracked the cut, Jadeja hares to his left to cut that off.
straightens a length ball on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
beaten by a lovely awayswinger. Shapes to drive, minimal feet movement as Williamson looked to lace that through extra cover
uses the depth of the crease nicely as he transfers weight back and punches this length ball to deep point.
steps out to slap that but is cramped for room by the length, bunted for a quick single
looks to belt this full delivery on the leg side behind square but the ball misses the pad, swings further down
huge wide, loses direction in trying to swing the ball back in, slips it down leg in the process

short_text: Chahar to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: crunching cover drive, Harbhajan may have got a hand on it to give Willey at mid-off some hope of pulling it back in, but he had no chance. Dhawan in total control, superb balance
lovely shape away, Williamson laces this to Willey at sweeper cover
hustled for pace as he's deep inside the crease as he taps this into the off side for a quick single

short_text: Chahar to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: length on off, Dhawan shows the full face as he defends back
nice drift, touch fuller so Dhawan lunges forward and turns this gently into the leg side for a quick single
whips this shortish delivery on middle and leg to deep square
rocks back and slaps the pull to long on
he bowls this wide outside off, anticipating another chip down the track. Dhawan leaves, wide called and rightly so

short_text: Harbhajan to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: down the track, goes straight and hits it clean. Lovely swing to hit it up and over. Bounced just in front of the advertising triangle
makes room and cuts this to deep point.  Brings up 500 runs this season
drifts one in at length on middle and leg, turned to square leg
full and swinging away from off, squeezed wide of point
slashes on the bounce to third man. Had width, really went after that one

short_text: Chahar to S Dhawan, 1 leg bye
long_text: misses the flick as this swings back in late to hit the pad, rolls to the leg side as they sneak in a leg bye
gets this to come back in but beats Dhawan's attempted tickle, through to Dhoni. Wide called.

short_text: Chahar to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: full and swinging away from middle and off, Dhawan rooted to the crease as he leaves
off the flap of the pad as it rolls to Dhoni, they take a legbye
delightful shape away! Williamson is tempted to commit himself to defend but lets it go
eased late, down to square third man
full and swinging away from the fourth stump, left alone
driven but a superb one-handed stop by Rayudu at point
mistimes an attempted punch back to Shardul. Looked to flay this through point
pulled! And he's literally walloped this to the square leg boundary. Banged in short, Williamson picked the length early, swivelled back and executed the stroke superbly
length on middle and leg, tucked into the leg side for a quick single
length ball moving away from off stump, watched through to the keeper
shapes back in from outside off, Williamson plays down the wrong line. Bends back in to smack the pad. Angle would've taken it down leg
beaten! Late movement from length, looked to steer behind point. Late on the stroke

he's hit this straight to backward point, good catch because the ball was travelling. This was bowled full, it swung away late from the fourth stump and Hales only managed to slice this. Got this off the bottom, the bat face turned in his hands. Got the impression he was looking to hit it too hard. Chahar's impressive run in the IPL continues. Back from injury and among the wickets immediately.
angles one across, Dhawan isn't fully committed forward, manages to get this behind point
driven to mid off for a quick single

short_text: Willey to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: leading edge, but safe. Closed the bat face early in trying to work this to the leg side

short_text: Willey to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: width and he's thumped that on the up through extra cover. Aggression straightaway, Dhawan pounces on it

short_text: Willey to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: hoicked and he's timed this brilliantly. Not much movement so he just picked the length and walloped it to deep midwicket
goes for a big heave, gets a thick inside edge onto the pad, they scamper a run. Looked to smack this to deep midwicket, down to Balewadi, on the highway
this one is full on middle, turns this wide of mid on for a quick single

short_text: Willey to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: touch fuller and just outside off, defended from the crease
late on the forward defense, gets it high on the bat. Effort delivery from Shardul.
tucks this gently into the leg side as they scamper a run

short_text: Thakur to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: ripper of a short ball on middle, zips through as Dhawan sways out of the way. In the 140s that delivery

short_text: Thakur to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: appeal for lbw, may have been struck a tad too high as it curved in from middle. Possibly saved by an inside edge too. Dhoni wasn't too convinced, Shardul went up immediately. In the end, they don't bother going for a review.  Replays suggest no inside edge, ball would've hit leg

short_text: Thakur to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: gets a good stride forward to defend, the ball curves back in late to roll back to the bowler off the inside edge

short_text: Thakur to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: thick inside edge, races to fine leg. Late swing back in from length for Shardul, Dhawan played outside the line. Shaved past leg stump
swings back in late, yorker length. Somehow manages to keep that out. Superb start from Chahar
poke and a miss! Moved away off the seam from length, he looked to steer behind point
cuts back in from length on off, Hales is on the backfoot, hurried for pace, as he defends back
width and he's square driven this straight to Rayudu at point
touch full and moving away, defended firmly to mid off
short of length on middle and leg, tucked into the leg side for a quick single
ends it with a six! Sliced over long off. Full on off, and sent into the stands. Royal Challengers Bangalore win by five wickets! And Delhi Daredevils are now officially eliminated.
full outside off, and driven to the man at deep extra cover
slower ball! Good length on off, and just missing the bat's outside edge. Goes to Pant on the bounce
full toss on leg stump, and tapped down the ground to long on for a single
Spiderman! So quick to jump across outside off, and then slogs it - down on one knee - over deep midwicket. What quick movement. Kohli's in shock! Like Edvard Munch's Scream
full outside off, and angling away from the batsman. Driven over cover to the man in the deep
wide outside off, and driven to long off. CDG will keep strike
yorker outside leg, and Pant can't hold on either! They manage to steal two, plus the extra run

what a shot, and what a catch! It was a low full toss on off, that he does well to ramp over the keeper's head. But Iyer had kept Shaw at a very fine fine leg, and it goes straight down his throat! Daredevils piling the pressure
back of a length outside off, and the loopy bounce deceives the batsman. Tries to cut but can't connect!
good length outside off, and cut away past the fielder at point! Sarfraz backs away to make some extra room, and then simply glances it past the infield
the bowler's losing his line. Full on leg, and going down the leg side again. Sarfraz kinda walked across before the ball was bowled, and that may have distracted the bowler
lifted over cover! Pressure shot, and sent for four. Full just outside off, and he clears the infield. Good use of the bottom hand
full on leg stump, but going down leg. Sarfraz couldn't flick it away, but RCB collect the run anyway. He also has to bowl it again
full toss on leg stump, and the umpire says 'not out!' They're reviewing for the lbw. Think that would miss leg stump, and yeah, missing the stumps completely. Daredevils lose their review
yorker, and almost played on! Tries to dig it away, but the ball almost rolls on to the stumps. It doesn't, however, and that allows RCB to steal a quick run
full outside off, and another yorker that ABD can't put away. Driven to the man at deep extra cover
full on leg stump, and some late swing on offer! Sarfraz confidently clips it off his toes to deep backward square
full and wide outside off, and AB squeezes it away to deep backward point. Sarfraz gets back on strike
good length on off, and angling across Sarfraz. He sticks his bat out and cuts it late to third man
crashes into middle stump! Twist in the tale? Straight on middle stump. Mandeep misses the pull, and the ball goes through the gates
good length outside off, but angling into him. Flat-batted to wide long on this time, and the commitment in his running earns RCB the second
full just outside off, and he comes down the wicket, but bunts it to long on
full on middle, and it's the slider! Goes straight through and his attempted defense finds the bat's outside edge. Goes to point
full just outside off, and pushed to the man at cover. Sliding effort saves the run
full outside off, but he connects with the sweep. Not timed well, and that actually allows Mandeep to come back for the second. Team 150
low full toss on middle, and AB drills it down the ground to long on. They walk across for the single
full outside off, and once again forcing Mandeep to reach at it. Mistimes it to mid on
full outside off, and Mandeep's forced to reach at it. Slaps it towards point, but takes a thick outside edge to the man at third man
good length on off, and clipped off his hips to square leg
back of a length outside off, and carved off the back foot. Straight to point
good length on middle, but angling down the leg side. Mandeep, however, swivels and pulls this over deep backward square. Great rotation off his toes
full on off stump, and driven to mid off. Says no to the single
good length on off, and turning away from the batsman. Flat-bats it down the ground to long on. The final time out of the evening too
good length outside off, and carved off the back foot to deep point
full just outside off, and driven down the ground to long off
wrong'un to start off. Full on middle, but turning into his pads. Mandeep can't flick it away

feathers one to Pant! Done by the turn. Mishra's delighted, Kohli's frustrated. It was full outside off, and turning away from Kohli. He tried to play the inside out drive, but the ball takes some extra bounce and finds the outside of his bat. Credit to Pant for holding on though
whipped! What great use of the wrists. Full on middle, and he's quick to gauge the length and pounces onto it in a flash. No chance for Roy at long on
slower ball, but wide outside off. AB thumps it in front of cover, but the man in the deep does well to clean up
over long on! And that's his 26th IPL fifty. Overpitched on middle stump, and he gets his front foot out of the way to thump it over the boundary
slapped past point! Outside off, and AB cuts it furiously to the boundary. Reach in no time. AB's follow through reminded me of Dhoni's helicopter. That swirl
almost chopped on! Good length outside off, and AB tries to cut it away. Bottom-edges it, and the ball just about misses the top of off stump
slower ball, but full toss on middle. Mistimed towards the leg side

short-arm jab! And no better way to get to a hundred-run partnership. Good length on middle, and Kohli takes a few steps down the ground, then lifts his back leg, and completes the shot by whipping it over deep midwicket. Classic
full on leg stump, and turning into AB's pads. Blocks it off the front foot. End of Lamichhane's debut with the ball
flighted on off, but AB nonchalantly walks across to the off side before lifting it over deep backward square. The fielder in the deep was getting under it, but just clears the man there!
good length on leg, but it's the wrong'un this time! Creeps onto Kohli's body, and he whips it off his hips to deep square leg
full outside off, and AB goes down on one knee to sweep it from outside off stump. Not timed well though
full on leg, but spinning across AB. He taps it with soft hands towards midwicket, and they call early for the single. They want the second, but Sandeep did well to cover a lot of ground
short on middle, and turning away from AB. He goes onto the back foot and drags this towards the midwicket boundary
back of a length outside off, but he's taken the pace off this time. The batsman cuts this off the back foot to deep point
short outside off, and drilled straight down to Boult at long on. Just one
makes it look soo easy! Full on off, and AB shuffles across to the off side, gets down on one knee, and ramps it over the keeper's left! Mr. 360!

Harshal hits Kohli this time! No malice though. A soft shot towards cover had the batsmen running for a single, but Harshal ran there to try and break the stumps at the non-striker's, but the throw finds Kohli instead
Is Harshal okay? Looks alright. Full outside off and Kohli came dancing down the ground before driving it towards the bowler. Hits his palm on the full!
good length on off, but angling into Kohli. Tries to punch towards cover, but comes off the bat's inside half. Goes towards midwicket
full outside off again, and this time the drive's been crunched! But stopped by the fielder at cover
flighted outside off, but too wide. AB takes a big stride towards the pitch of the ball, and lifts it over the extra-cover boundary. The margin of error that the bowler can afford is minimal
full just outside off, and defended back to Mishra
flat on middle, and sliding through to Kohli. Punched off the back foot to the long-on boundary
wild spin, and well stopped by Pant! Full outside off, and legspin that goes further away from Kohli. Forced Pant to dive to his right
almost a yorker on middle stump, and AB bunts it away towards the vacant midwicket region. Forces the bowler to go chasing after it
flighted outside off, and driven with the spin. Smothers it to deep extra cover
back of a length outside off, and this time there's some extra bounce. Kohli works it towards square leg, and that's the time out
slower ball, outside off, and de Villiers muscles this towards the leg side. That area is packed by outfielders though
back of a length outside off, and that's been flat-batted to long on for a walking single
back of a length on middle, and that's been glanced fine down the leg side! Fifty for him, his 34th in the IPL
slower ball, but full toss on middle stump. Flicked off his pads to deep midwicket, but he calls nice and early for two. Dala took a tumble on his bowling followthrough
full on off, and Kohli chops it onto his toes! Ouch. It was almost a yorker, and Kohli inside-edges his cover drive
comes down the track to a length ball and pats it down the track
pitched up and spinning away a tad outside off, and AB carves it over long-off
pitched up on leg, clipped down to wide long-on
gets down to sweep a fuller one and finds Shaw at deep square leg
back of a length, spins away, moves across and flicks to midwicket
pitched up on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
floated up outside off, driven to long-off
back of a length ball on off, whipped between long-on and deep midwicket
length, spins away outside off, moves across and tucks to midwicket
googly, spins into him and he skews it to mid-on
length on middle and off, blocked
too full outside off, another languid drive from Kohli. Smooth swing and tremendous follow-through as he crunches through extra cover
short, angled across, AB now latches onto a pull that beats deep square leg diving to his left
angled into him, and flicked away wide of long-on
slower ball, the off-cutter, picked early and mowed it over long-off. Terrific timing
full toss, angled in, punched straight to cover
short around off, pulled to deep square leg
short of a length around middle, gets on top and opens the face to third man
short outside off, walks across and nudges to the on side
he's batting like a dream. Kohli's determined to see RCB home tonight, and he backs away to this fuller one and chips it over mid-off with the full face of the bat
full toss outside off, punched to long-on where Abhishek Sharma gets around it
short outside off, punched through the gap at cover. Elegant
short outside off, stays leg side of it and probably moved away too much as he skews it to mid-off off the toe-end while slapping it
length ball outside off, comes into him, and he drills off the inside of the bat to mid-on
short, gets inside of it and tucks it away to deep backward square and pushes the fielder for a brace
nudges this one late, gets a bit of bat but it's tickled to short fine leg
now he goes full and angles it in, and Kohli backs away and carves a drive through the covers. This is splendid batting
that's a stunning shot. You won't see too many better hits than that. Picks a length ball from outside off and wristily whips it over cow corner. Flat and hard. That's an unbelievable strike
drifts down the leg side
backs away to a short ball and the angle's helpfully coming into him as he smokes a pull to deep midwicket
short outside off, jumps up and knock it to point off the outside of the bat
pitched up outside off, drilled to mid-on
pins AB on the pad firs ball but the impact is outside off. Long stride across - that's the only thing that saved him there

that's plumb. First wicket for young Lamichhane. And it's a beautiful wicket. Nicely pitched up around middle, not giving him an inch to free his arms. Parthiv gets down to sweep and the ball spins in subtly to pin him in front of middle
tossed up but with too much room outside off, shovelled straight and flat down the ground
flat non-turning back of a length delivery, flicked to midwicket
floated up outside off, driven to cover
short around off, leans back and punches to point
short on middle and leg, pulled to deep square leg
shuffles across early and this one nips away off a back of a length and finds the outside edge of Kohli as it runs away to third man
short outside off, opens the face to third man
back of a length outside off, flicks to midwicket
back of a length, tucked up for room around off, the ball gets stuck into the pitch, and Moeen splices it to short cover
spins in from a back of a length, makes a little room and slaps it into point. Good start from the youngster

gets down for a sweep but the ball escapes from underneath the bat as it's too full and he fails to get underneath it. Runs past the keeper as well. Harshal Patel chases it down and slides in front of the boundary but he has made contact with the ropes
slid across outside off, waits for it before opening the face to the off side
googly, on a length, flicks it away to the leg side
back of a length, slides across and keeps low, tries to pull but the ball sneaks underneath
spins in slightly from a length, pulled to deep midwicket
full on off, and that's been driven over Siraj's head! It's a great shot, but long off manages to cut it off. Only a single, and Daredevils finish on 181 for 4!
yorker outside off, and smacks it to deep extra cover. He'll finish on 46 and Shankar takes strike
full on middle and leg, and this time it's been drilled straight back past the bowler. Siraj does well to get away, so does the umpire, and the ball beats both men in the deep! Moves on to 45
remember the name! Even though it's so generic. It's the offcutter on off stump, and Sharma gets his front leg out of the way before thumping it over long off
full outside leg, and Sharma's attempted ramp over fine leg doesn't come off. Not a wide because the batsman moved around so much
yorker on middle, that all Shankar can do is work it towards cow corner. Gets Sharma on strike
takes the pace completely off this, only 97.5kph. Shankar tries to slog it over cover, but inside-edges it towards square leg
appeal for caught behind, but not given! And RCB don't have a review either. It was short on middle, and he pull didn't come off. RCB believe he's top-edged it to the keeper, but replays say no
nice yorker outside off, but Sharma is up to the challenge nonetheless. Bends his knee, opens his bat's face, and squeezes it away to deep point
slower ball, but wide outside off. Shankar waits for it this time, before driving it square. Negi at deep cover though
full toss outside off, and he (almost) makes full use of that free-hit! Smacked it to the long-off boundary, but Umesh takes a catch there. They take one

it's the slower ball, and pushed full and wide outside off. Shankar is forced to check his big wind-up, and muscles this down the ground to long on. Free hit because there weren't enough people inside the circle
wide yorker outside off, but Sharma's through his attempted drive already. Slices it over point to the man at the boundary
good length on middle, and Sharma walks across to the off side to try and ramp it past fine leg, but mistimes it this time. He'll keep strike nonetheless
full just outside off, but too close to his body for the drive. Mistimes it towards cover point on this occasion
full on off, and that's been whipped! Great use of the wrists, and that's raced away to the fine-leg boundary. The man there was just too square
full on off stump, and he comes down the wicket. Effectively yorks himself, but manages to dig it away towards cover
good length on off, but Sharma's in some mood tonight! Stands tall, and ramps it over third man! Pure timing
full outside off, and drilled straight down the ground past Siraj's left. Long off's there though
full outside leg, but he's prepared for that length. Comes dancing down the wicket and plays it inside out over cover. Falls in no man's land
slower ball, but Sharma's sent that into the mid-wicket boundary for six more! Stays on the back foot, and thumps it into the stands
check drives over Southee's head! Hold that pose, son! It's the cutter on leg stump, and he simply lifts it into the stands. Oof

dropped by Siraj at third man! Good length on off, and Sharma's attempted cover-drive takes the thick outside edge. Flew straight to third man, but it goes through his hands as he tries to dive forward
short, and wide outside off. Sharma backs away, but chooses not to play at it

back of a length on middle, and he tries to muscle it straight down the ground. Slaps it over Southee, but off the bat's top half. The poor timing actually allows the batsman to come back for the second run
back of a length outside off, and he opens his bat's face to play it towards point. They scamper across quickly for the run after a slight miscommunication
good length on off, and that's been fended away from his body. But takes the bat's toe end, and comes to Siraj's left. He tries to take a diving catch, but the ball was just too low!
good length on middle stump, and tapped back to Siraj off the back foot. Sharma wants the single, but Siraj is quick to recover
back of a length on middle, and that gathers some extra bounce! Forces Sharma to sway away from the ball's line
full outside off, and that's beautifully lifted to the long-off boundary. What a start to your IPL career!
back of a length on off, and it's the offcutter. Clipped off his hips to midwicket, and that gets the debutant on strike

full on off, and angling into his pads. Iyer lifts it off his toes towards long on, but Kohli's manning the cow-corner boundary. Holds on to it despite being some ten feet inside the boundary line. Iyer's sluggish innings ends. Time out as well
back of a length on middle, and extra bounce this time! Mistimes a leg-side whip to the man at midwicket
back of a length on off, and worked off his hips to the man at deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, and it's been carved off the back foot to point
back of a length on middle, and Shankar opens the leg side and pulls it fine past short fine leg! Uses his wrists to play it well
nice shape! Good length outside off and shaping slightly inwards. He tried to glance it fine, but the ball just goes past his outside edge
good length on middle, and Iyer walks across to the off side to tap it towards midwicket
flighted on middle, and the straight drive takes a leading edge over cover! Just over the fielder, and that means more work for AB at long off
full just outside off, and Shankar drills this drive to cover
back of a length on off, but Iyer stays on his crease. Punches it to long on this time
almost a yorker on off stump. But Shankar manages to drive it to deep extra cover and gets off the mark
drifts and lands on off stump. Shankar takes a big stride forward, and defends
flat on middle, and going straight through. Shankar goes onto his back foot, and taps it towards mid on

excellent sliding catch at long on! AB the man. It was full outside off, and Pant is forced to reach at it. Manages to lift it towards the long-on boundary, but de Villiers races across to his left to complete a difficult catch
full on leg, and he's once again down on one knee. Swept over the man at square leg for four more. Honestly, it was just a one-handed flick
angles into Iyer's pads, and he smothers it with the turn to the man at deep midwicket. Another walking single for Daredevils
good length on middle, and Pant comes skipping down the ground. Taps it towards the vacant area near midwicket to collect another run
grip off the surface! Takes the outside edge of Pant's bat as he looks to defend. The ball flies away towards point
back of a length outside off, and Iyer rocks back to punch it straight past Pant. Goes to the man at long on
good length on middle, but a lot of turn across Iyer's body. Goes down the leg side
misfield from Sarfraz! Full outside leg, and swept to short fine leg. The ball slides under Sarfraz at short fine leg, which eventually allows them to take the second. Chahal's not happy at all
drift in the air, and the ball lands full outside off. It's turning further away from Pant, so he's forced to reach at it. Misses completely
full on leg stump, and would've gone down for a wide. But Iyer chases it, and flicks it to deep square leg
good length on middle, and drags his pull to deep midwicket. Man in the deep
good length on leg, and too easy for Pant. Goes deep into his crease, and pulls it over the square-leg umpire! His fifth fifty-plus score this season.
over long on! Tossed it up outside off, but Pant leans into this shot. Full power, as he slaps it over Chahal
full on middle, and straightens after pitching. Pant pushes it towards the on side, and shall keep the strike as well
full on off, and turning into Iyer's pads again. Whipped off his legs to deep backward square
back of a length on off, but spinning across the batsman's body. Iyer walks to the off side, but can't play it fine enough. Straight to short fine leg
good length on middle, and Pant shuffles across to the offside and flick it to deep midwicket
quicker ball, but the appeal is turned down. Full on middle, and hits Pant's in front of leg stump. Reckon that would've gone down leg
in his arc, and muscled! Full outside off, and turning into Pant this time. Goes down on one knee, and sent into the cow-corner boundary
deft touch! Full outside off, but Iyer loves that region. Decides to cut it late, and opens the bat's face slightly past the keeper's right, and the quick outfield does the rest
drags a length ball towards the on side. only to midwicket

AB and Kohli mess up a catch! Never thought I'd ever type this sentence. It was full on off, and Iyer slices his drive. It's in the air for ages, and AB tries to get under it from cover. Kohli's coming from long off, and the ball lands between both of them! AB went for the final attempt though
wild! Short, and outside off, but Pant flat-bats it straight back to CDG. The bowler stuck his right hand out, but the ball doesn't stick
full on off, and he's going for the slog! Swings across the line, but falls short of Mohammad Siraj's diving effort in the deep. Did he start running in too late?
starts off with a boundary! Pitches outside off, and Iyer pokes at it. Opens his bat's face while trying to carve it towards the off side. Played fine
short on off, and Iyer shuffles across to the off side. The ball's going down the leg side, but he helps it to short fine leg for a single
good length outside off, but turning away from Pant. He drags this pull towards deep midwicket for a walking single
slog swept! But lands short of deep midwicket. The delivery was full on off, and Iyer took a big stride towards the off side
full outside off, and fended with soft hands off the front foot. The keeper does really well to stop the single
pitches on off, and turns sharply into his body. Iyer misses the leg-side whip, and it hits his pad. Appeal for lbw, but would've been too high
good length outside off, and Pant rocks back to flay this cut to the man in the deep
back of a length on off, flicked towards midwicket
short again, but this time it's slower at 124.2ks, jumps and flicks to the on side
short of a length, angled across and giving him a world of room, Pant stays back and shovels it straight over long-off
that's too short. RCB keep dropping it short to Pant and he keeps walloping them. A 142.4-kmph short ball, pulled off the front foot over deep midwicket
short of a length, angled into his leg stump, flicked to deep backward square leg
length ball on off, brings down a straight bat and blocks
length, spinning in from around off, flicked to square leg
front-foot push down the pitch
sharp turn into him again, tries to flick but the ball gets down the leg side
spins in very sharply from a middle stump line, nudged away to short fine leg
length, straightens on middle, flicked to deep midwicket
short, straightening around off, cuts off the backfoot and Kohli makes a diving stop at cover
length ball that spins in, walks across and flicks with the turn to short fine leg
short of a length outside off, Shreyas slaps it and point flings himself to his right to make a brilliant stop
short ball that angles in and climbs onto him, arches out of the line
back of a length, slower at 106.8ks, flicked behind square leg
back of a length on middle and leg, flicked into the leg side
length ball on leg stump, whips it away to deep midwicket
you can't keep offering him width like that outside off. It's back of a length, and he simply stands in his crease and flays at it to smoke it over the off-side in-field
swipes across the line and shovels a length ball from outside off towards midwicket
short, angled across his off-stump, pant rocks back and flays a pull over deep midwicket
tries to jump and flick but the ball goes into the off side off the pad

short of a length around middle and leg, Pant moves across and whips it to square leg, where Mandeep Singh runs across, leaps to his left with one hand outstretched and flicks the ball back into the field. Top effort
length ball on middle and leg, punched towards mid-on
and gets hit on the pad for the third time. Length again, but no room as Pant swipes and there's a bit of an inward movement as well
slower length ball, 111.6ks, Pant tries to flick but is hit on the pad. Pitching outside leg
pins the pad with a length ball. Pant simply swipes across the line and makes no contact
short again, similar line as well, Pant pulls it out but Umesh sprints from deep midwicket and slides to make a stop
walks across to a short of a length delivery and tries to flick but the ball goes down the leg side
short around middle, that's easy for someone in the kind of form that Pant is, swivels and pulls through midwicket

short, angled across and gets over his flashing blade. There's an appeal for a caught behind and RCB review it. There never seemed to be anything on that. And replays show daylight between bat and ball. A waste of a review
back of a length that slides in, but Shreyas manufactures his own room and slaps it out to sweeper cover
fullish, spins in from outside off, flicked away to long-on

floats up a googly around off and draws him right forward. Roy falls for the flight comes forward. And he doesn't pick the variation, which means the gap is enough for the ball to sneak through and flatten the stumps. Beautifully done
short of a length, spinning away, shuffles across and whips it down the ground to long-on
backs away to a length ball on off and chops his cut towards cover
floated up around off and a bit of turn, driven out to cover
off-stump yorker, dug out to the left of the bowler
crunched off the backfoot. Back of a length and enough width on offer, didn't have to move anything other than his arms that come down in a hurry
walks down the track without sussing out the length. It's shortish and seams away from him, and nearly shaves the outside edge on its way to the keeper
drifts a back of a length delivery down the leg side
short of good length outside off, tries to get on top of the bounce and punches to point
short of a length outside off, tries to flick and gets a mild leading edge back towards the bowler
short, sitting up nicely outside off, a loosener from Umesh and it's been smoked with a pull over midwicket
straight through! It's the slider once more. Pitches on middle, and zips straight through. Shaw tries to work it towards the leg side, but he's played down the wrong line. Crashes into leg stump!
short outside off, and the punch towards cover is mistimed. Inside-edged to midwicket, and they're off in a flash to take another run
good length on middle, and this one skids straight on. Flicked off his pads to deep midwicket
full just outside off, but it's the wrong'un this time. Driven to long off again, and Roy's off as well
full outside off, and driven away down the ground. Shaw gets off the mark
back of a length outside off, and cut away hard off the back foot. Straight to point
short and keeps slanting in from over the wicket, Mohit looks to get under it and ramp it over DK. Beaten in the end
lifter, angling in from wide of the crease, Mohit ducks under it and lets it sail through to the keeper
full and wide outside off, 144.9ks, backs away and carves a drive through cover-point. Nobody in the deep to cut that off

skiddy full ball, slanting in from over the wicket, 144ks, Ashwin looks to slog over midwicket. He misses it and is hit on the unprotected knee. Trapped in front. The umpire takes his own sweet time before raising his finger
lifter on middle from round the stumps, spliced over midwicket
DK throws himself to his right to complete an excellent catch. Banged in short at the body, Tye shuffles across and gloves an attempted pull. DK does the rest behind the stumps
off-side wide
leg-stump yorker, kept out
lifter outside off, gets under it and ramps it fine of short third man
back of a length on middle, Ashwin clears his front leg again and launches it over the wide long-on boundary. Kings XI pass 200

fuller than a good length and skids in to cramp the batsman for room and ping the pad. Ashwin strays out for a single but Tye sends him back. There's a horrible mix-up, they then go for the single. Russell swoops down on the ball, turns, and aims to effect a direct hit at the non-striker's end. He, however, loses his balance and collapses. Has he hurt his hamstring again? Given as one leg bye
middle-stump yorker, jammed to cover
good length on middle, Ashwin clears his front leg and skies a loft over Russell. Six
Tye goes very deep in the crease and hoicks a length ball from outside off to the midwicket boundary. Right out of the middle of the bat
off-stump yorker, dug out
short on middle, clears his front leg and drags it to wide long-on
short and cramps the batsman for room, hauls a pull to deep midwicket
short and wide outside off, well past the marker, off-side wide
slower ball outside off, hacked down to long-on
full and skids through outside off, the batsman swishes and collects thin air
back of a length and outside off, no turn, flat-batted away to the left of long-on to back-to-back fours
flat dart outside off, Ashwin uses the pace of Narine, opens the face at the last moment and steers it fine of short third man
shorter and spins in, forced off the back foot to cover
inside-edges a back-foot punch to short fine leg
short, wide, carved to sweeper cover
The ball drops between long-off and long-on again. Tossed outside off, Tye skies it in the air and gets away

short_text: JPR Scantlebury-Searles to Ashwin, SIX runs
long_text: slower, full, ball on off, Ashwin lines it up and lifts it over long-off for his first six
full and floats a slower ball down leg for a wide

short_text: JPR Scantlebury-Searles to Ashwin, no run
long_text: leg-stump yorker, dug out to the left of the bowler
slow, short, outside off, dragged to wide long-on

short_text: JPR Scantlebury-Searles to Tye, SIX runs
long_text: back of a length on off, Tye pumps it in the air, hits it straight of Uthappa at long-on. First-ball six for him
Maiden IPL wicket for Searles.  Full on middle, Finch's strength is to muscle the ball. He, instead, searches for a paddle and picks out Kuldeep at short fine leg

short_text: JPR Scantlebury-Searles to Finch, SIX runs
long_text: errs too full on middle, overpitched and right in the slot, Finch clears his front leg and smokes it over midwicket
skidder on leg stump, backs away and jabs to the covers
fired outside off, chopped to short third man
Ashwin steps out and slices it over cover
shortish and outside off, Ashwin delays his cut and finds the gap between backward point and short third man for four
slider outside off, the extra bounce beats the cut

Finch skies it in the air, Searles (long-on) and Russell (long-off) look at each other and watch the ball drop in between them. Back of a length on middle, Finch aims for a loft and miscues it. He gets away in the end
back of a length and faster on off, 106.7ks, chopped to cover
darted on leg stump, nurdled through square leg
slider on off, Ashwin camps back and defends it back to Kuldeep
back of a length on off, punched down to long-off
Finch muscles another six, clears Searles at long-on. Googly, leaves Finch, he drags it from outside off and slog-sweeps it away. Hit against the spin this time
dropped short on off stump, Finch picks the length up so quickly. He rocks back and muscles a pull over midwicket. Hit with the spin
shorter and just a shade outside off, Finch manufactures additional room and chops it away to sweeper cover
slower legbreak, starts on off and turns a touch, driven with the spin to long-off
punched from middle stump to sweeper cover after backing away outside leg
clipped with the angle to deep midwicket as Ashwin gets off the mark
picked off the pads to deep midwicket for one
back of a length and angling in on middle, clipped to deep square leg
Axar aims to clear long-off, no dice. Searles plucks another catch. Full and spinning away outside off, lofted with the turn but the Bajan judges it well and claims an excellent overhead catch
off-side wide

short_text: Kuldeep to Axar Patel, SIX runs
long_text: tossed up and spinning away outside off, Axar goes low, meets the ball, and launches it over the bowler's head for six

short_text: Kuldeep to Axar Patel, FOUR runs
long_text: pushed through on middle from over the wicket, down the track and smashed to the right of long-on. Not even Russell can cut that off
heaved from just outside off to deep midwicket off the back foot
half-tracker on off, dragged only as far as deep midwicket
tossed on off, driven down to long-off
back of a length, starts outside off, breaks in and cramps the batsman for room. Chopped to point
short and wide outside off, punched on the up to sweeper cover

short_text: Narine to Axar Patel, no run
long_text: length-ball offbreak, punched from outside off to cover
short, width, cracked to sweeper cover off the back foot
turning offbreak, full and hits the pad, but this is heading past leg stump
short on off,pulled to deep midwicket off the back foot

short_text: JPR Scantlebury-Searles to Axar Patel, 1 run
long_text: slower, shorter outside off, flashed to sweeper again

short_text: JPR Scantlebury-Searles to Axar Patel, FOUR runs
long_text: back of a length and width outside off, Axar flat-bats it fiercely through the gap at the covers
slower one on the pads from wide of the crease, 113ks, clipped to deep square leg

short_text: JPR Scantlebury-Searles to Axar Patel, 1 run
long_text: shortish and angling across off, leans back and forces to sweeper cover

short_text: JPR Scantlebury-Searles to Axar Patel, no run
long_text: just short of a good length on middle, played back to Searles
wide of the crease, angling into the hips, tucked away to deep square leg

Narine comes from around the wicket and has Rahul chopping a sweep back onto the stumps. Rahul's wicket exposes Kings XI's lengthy lower order. Full and slid through on middle, Rahul stretches across for a sweep, the ball sneaks through the legs. Oh wait, the replays suggest the ball brushes the thigh and disturbs the stumps. Kings XI lose Rahul and with it the game? Narine says enough of the deadpan and celebrates the big wicket
Finch goes low, and deflects a sweep to short fine leg
short and sliding away outside off, would have been an off-side wide had Rahul left it. Instead, he chops to cover
dragged down outside leg, follows Rahul, who was backing away. Rahul smacks a pull over the midwicket boundary. Bam! Into the second tier
darted into the pads, swept flat and hard to short fine leg
Narine loops it up on off stump, Rahul charges down the track, meets it on a half-volley and muscles it over the long-on boundary. That's outta here

backs away, swings through but picks out the tall Prasidh, who takes it with his wrong hand at long on. He went for it with two hands, but it took a while for him to bring them together, by which time the ball had lodged in his right hand. Lucky he managed to hold on, has a sheepish smile but years later when someone sees the scorecard, all they'll know is this was Prasidh's catch. Kings XI in trouble
arches back to ramp this over the keeper but beaten by the effort ball. Climbed sharply
cuts, but straight to deep point. Couldn't generate much power because of the change in pace
right into the blockhole, squeezed to point from where there's an overthrow at the bowler's end. What should've been one is now two
they're not ready to give up, sensational way to bring up a half-century. Backed away and slashed this short ball to clear square third man.
bunts this into the off side from the crease for a quick single
an ugly pull from outside off, on the bounce to long on
chops this wide of cover

short_text: JPR Scantlebury-Searles to Rahul, SIX runs
long_text: lofted up and over, straight into the sightscreen. This was right in his swinging arc
gets away with a waist high full toss down leg from around the stumps, Rahul swings and misses.
punches this length delivery to long on for a single

short_text: JPR Scantlebury-Searles to Nair, no run
long_text: edged, but just short of Lynn at gully
pulled but not controlled, down to deep midwicket
jaffa. Yorker length, squeezed into the off side for a single

pulled straight down the throat of deep square. This is a fiery bouncer, Agarwal had decided yesterday that he'll pull this, got big on him but he went through with the stroke but showed signs of pulling out very late. But by then, the deed was done. Sensational from DreRuss. I have no reason why the onfield umpire even went upstairs to check for the no-ball. Agarwal didn't control the pull because he wasn't even looking at the delivery. His poor IPL season after a magnificent breakout domestic season continues.
the bouncer has done the trick! Pacy bouncer, Gayle is late on the pull and in doing so, feathers one to a leaping Karthik. Fist pumps. One Jamaican gets the other
swing and a miss. Looked to swipe this full toss from across the line. On the bounce to DK
right into the blockhole, squeezed back
clobbered over deep midwicket! Russell pays the price for bowling too short, Gayle didn't have room to swing his arms but went through and boy
flicked to deep fine leg where Searles slides to cut it off
Has Gayle nicked this down leg? There was a noise, given wide and Karthik has reviewed There's some pad on the way. So it shouldn't be a wide for starters. Gayle survives.
worked off his hip to deep midwicket
pulls and misses. Angled in to cramp Rahul, didn't allow him the free swing. Excellent. In the 140s again
shortens his length, on middle, defended back
sliced over third man, sails away! Looked to go inside out over cover, but he'll take the runs anyway. This was full and wide, somehow managed to get enough bat.  500 runs in the season for KL
slower length ball on middle, bunted to point
right into the blockhole, Gayle was making room to carve that over the off side, ended up having to jam his bat down to keep that out
slower length ball on off, punched to deep point

oh, no. Dinesh Karthik has dropped that!  Tough chance, did most things right, except hold on. Gayle gets a leading edge as he looks to whip this to the leg side, DK leapt high like a goalkeeper but just couldn't take it cleanly.
nearly took Russell's head with that blow! Floats this full on middle and Gayle's ready with this ammunition. Absolutely belts this flat and straight, Russell just about managed to get out of the way
short of length on middle, whips this to square leg
floats this full on off stump, defended towards cover for a quick single
whips this from outside off towards wide long on

short_text: JPR Scantlebury-Searles to Gayle, FOUR runs
long_text: no third man, so he'll get a four. Went for a big slash over point, ended up slicing it away
cuts back in to hit the pad and deflect to the off side as he looks to turn to the leg side. Replays suggest a thin inside edge

short_text: JPR Scantlebury-Searles to Rahul, FOUR runs
long_text: too much width, Rahul cuts to the point boundary. Sehwag would've been proud of that. Destroyer of the short ball through the cut. No chance for square third man
slants this length delivery down leg, wide called and it's a very eady decision for the umpire
pulls this length ball to long on. Hurried onto Gayle
hustles Gayle for pace, also targets the ribcage, turned towards fine leg.
turns this incoming length delivery towards short midwicket.  This was bowled at 144.7kph
makes room and swings this length ball to deep square leg
angles a length ball on middle and leg, whipped to deep midwicket
punched on the up to cover point, excellent stop
thick outside edge past slip, races past slip to the third man boundary. Rahul didn't have the kind of width he would've liked, slashed it away
goes back into the crease and defends with the spin
spins back in sharply, off a thick inside edge towards square leg, Rahul was looking to whip this through midwicket
this time clears cover, sails all the way. Got much closer to the pitch of the delivery this time as he stepped out and went inside out
stunning! Steps out and lofts this through the line to clear long off effortlessly.
stays inside the crease and punches this short ball to long on
drifts one in full, Rahul steps out and works this to long on to get off the mark immediately

short_text: Barinder Sran to JPR Scantlebury-Searles, SIX runs
long_text: right in his swinging arc, Searles gets under the length and slogs this to just clear wide long on. What a way to begin your IPL career
steps out and punches this to cover, Gill cramped for room as this angled back in

short_text: Barinder Sran to Gill, FOUR runs
long_text: uses his width to reach it and then slash this to beat backward point. Picked the bones out of that

short_text: Barinder Sran to Gill, FOUR runs
long_text: swung away to clear the midwicket fence, one bounce to the ropes. Slower ball again, on middle and leg. Lovely use of the crease there, stayed deep inside and swung through
walks across, slaps this length ball straight down Miller's throat at long off. Sran deliberately angled it across so that the batsman would've to fetch it. Excellent change of pace as well.
steps out and punches this length ball to long off
steps out, smashes this full toss to cover and scampers a quick single
squeezes the drive to point, DK's first fifty this season
excellent slower delivery, right into the yorker zone outside off, DK looks to carve this behind point but misses
low full toss, squeezed back to long on
looks to turn this length ball to midwicket, leading edge that rolls back to the bowler
thick outside edge as he looks to flick this, races to the third man boundary
beats short third man on the reverse pull. DK had too much time to play that. Another slower delivery, length too short
to the moon and back, Miller settles underneath to take a tumbling catch. Rana looks to hoick this short of length knuckleball from across the line, didn't get the power he would've liked.
full and wide outside off from around the stumps, Rana swings and misses
smashed back! Beats Miller, who didn't have more than a few yards to his left at long-off.
shorter, slower and DK slaps this over point, on the bounce to the sweeper
backs away and wallops this fuller delivery to wide long off
first ball, so what? Muscles it over deep midwicket. Has he been batting somewhere? Slower length ball again, he picked the length super early.
top-edges the pull because he's beaten for pace, went a mile in the air. KL called loud and clear, and ensured he didn't take his eyes off.
slower short ball but way over the batsman's head
it's the reverse pull but couldn't find the gap, straight to short third man
slower ball but slips this way outside off, left alone
backs away and drills this full delivery to long off
too full, Russell backs away and squeezes this over short third man. Just opened the bat face late to hit it up and over
cuts the slower length ball to sweeper cover
walks across the stumps and pulls this short ball over fine leg. Got under the ball nicely to help it along
pulled, beats deep backward square leg. Filth down leg, dealt with the way it had to be.
slaps this short ball to Finch a sweeper cover
down on one knee as he sweeps this short ball over deep square leg. Mujeeb has lost his lengths, not sure how much of that is because of his bowling hand
shapes to pull but top-edges it to beat short third man. Raises the 50 stand
swing and a miss. Drifts one back in full from wide of the crease, DK is hit on the back thigh.
ah, too short and walloped. Karthik stays his ground and pulls in front of square to clear deep midwicket

short_text: Axar Patel to Russell, SIX runs
long_text: slogged, that's out of here. Onto the roof. New balls, please! The cow corner region targeted again! Length, drifting in and right into Russell's swinging arc

short_text: Axar Patel to Russell, no run
long_text: fired into middle from around the stumps, defended back

short_text: Axar Patel to Russell, SIX runs
long_text: fetches the slog from outside off, clears Tye at deep square leg. That's a very short boundary
short-arm jab missed, a thin inside edge onto the pad as they scoot for a single

short_text: Axar Patel to Karthik, FOUR runs
long_text: gets outside the line of the stumps and sweeps this fiercely to deep square leg. Andrew Tye overbalances as he dishes in a dive, can't prevent a four. Made a proper mess of that
backs away and slaps this cut, halfstop by Mohit at point keeps it to a single.
pulls this slower delivery to deep midwicket, DK will keep strike
makes room and drills this full delivery to long on
backs away to swing again, done in by the change of pace. Slower and fuller, DreRuss nearly chopped on
clears his front leg and smites this full delivery over deep midwicket. Too much muscle! Beautiful swing.
gentle dab into the off side, behind point
back of length slower delivery outside off, bunted wide of point

short_text: Axar Patel to Karthik, FOUR runs
long_text: arm ball, chopped from off stump to the right of Rahul behind the stumps for a fortunate four

short_text: Axar Patel to Karthik, no run
long_text: tighter on off, dabbed to point
good length on middle, tip and run to point

short_text: Axar Patel to Russell, no run
long_text: drifts in on middle, defended back off the front foot
darted outside off, drilled through the line to sweeper cover

short_text: Axar Patel to Karthik, FOUR runs
long_text: pushed through outside off, Karthik opens the face and guides it to the right of Gayle at short third man
seam-up, back of a length and outside off, he presses forward and drives crisply to sweeper cover

Mohit pulls off a smart catch to his right. He gets into a side-on position and snags the ball. Slower one outside off, possibly a knuckle ball, Uthappa is early into his shot and ends up carving it in the air. So, Tye gets both set batsmen in the same over
full-toss, angling in on middle, punched down to long-on
Tye bangs it short and has Narine nicking behind. Banged in short and slanting away outside off from over the wicket, Narine can't get on top of it. He pulls weakly and edges it behind to Rahul
115ks, slower ball outside off, Narine gets under this full ball and lifts it over extra cover. Sliced away
112.5ks knuckle ball, holds up, finishes on off, bunted to the leg side

short_text: Barinder Sran to Narine, no run
long_text: Narine forays down the track, Sran finally gets the yorker right, darted wide outside off, away from the reach of the rampaging Narine

short_text: Barinder Sran to Narine, SIX runs
long_text: Pulled flat and hard for six. Hip-high short ball outside off, Narine sizes it up, clears his front leg, and bashes it over midwicket

short_text: Barinder Sran to Narine, no run
long_text: slower short ball on the hips, Narine is early into a hook and lucky that the ball did not roll back onto the stumps

short_text: Barinder Sran to Narine, FOUR runs
long_text: full-toss on the leg stump, clears his front leg and hoicks it away to the left of Karun Nair at deep midwicket

short_text: Barinder Sran to Narine, SIX runs
long_text: 96.8ks slower full ball on middle and leg, Narine spots the change-up. He picks this back-of-the-hand variation off the pads and toe-ends it over square leg. Mis-hit for six. That's how small the boundaries are in Indore
Mohit falls on his back at short third man after missing a run-out chance. Back of a length and angling across off, Uthappa leans back, and dabs to short third man. He sets off and Narine gets a life
short and angled in on middle, short-armed off the back foot to deep midwicket
Ashwin lobs a full-toss outside off, Narine rocks forward and drives to the right of long-off and left of sweeper
short and darted in on middle, swatted away to the leg side off the back foot
pushed through full and on middle, Uthappa slog-sweeps with the intended turn over deep midwicket for a clean six
dangled up on off, stretches out and smothers it
Gayle at short fine leg jogs and escorts the ball to the boundary. Full offbreak, Uthappa drops down to one knee and rolls out a sweep to the left of Gayle

short_text: Axar Patel to Narine, no run
long_text: Axar finishes well with a middle-stump yorker. Jammed back to him

short_text: Axar Patel to Narine, FOUR runs
long_text: hip-high short ball on leg stump, 99ks, Narine uses the pace and swats it away to the long on fence
drifts in on off, forward and driven down to long-off
tucked off the pads to wide long-on. Narine raises his bat. That's a 26-ball fifty
full on the stumps, eased down to long-on

short_text: Axar Patel to Uthappa, FOUR runs
long_text: tossed full on off stump, Uthappa collapses his back knee and hoists it to the left of the bowler
non-turner on off, front-foot defence from Uthappa
looped up on middle, sticks in the surface, Uthappa plays early and nearly spoons a leading edge back to the bowler
leg-side wide
biting offbreak, full and breaks back in to catch the pad as Uthappa plays all around it, but this may have been heading past leg stump
short, wide, smeared to sweeper cover
back of a length on middle, Narine inches forward and clubs it away to the right of mid-on for back-to-back boundaries
tossed up outside off, Narine dances down the track, does not meet the pitch, but manages to carve it in the air to the left of cover
on a length on off, Narine gets forward and bunts a single to long-off
Narine has thrown Axar off his line and length. Short and slid past the tramline, off-side wide

short_text: Axar Patel to Narine, SIX runs
long_text: 104.3ks dart outside off, but this is just too full, Narine gets under the length and carts it up and over Axar's head for a straight six
short dart on middle and leg, back-foot punch to deep midwicket
dragged shorter and sliding away outside off, Narine inside-edges a pull past leg stump
arm ball from around the stumps to Uthappa too. He hangs back and secures a single through midwicket
back of a length and angling across off, 99ks, slapped away to sweeper cover
length ball on off, looks like the knuckle ball, Narine clears his front leg. He has a big hoick and inside-edges to wide long-on
very full, starts outside off, and thuds into the pad and rolls to short third man
back of a length on the hips, Narine is airborne as he picks it up and flicks it square of short fine leg
hip-high short ball outside off, pulled stylishly to deep midwicket

Tye drags his length back, cramps the batsman for room, and bowls him. Short and angling into the body from over the wicket, Lynn swivels into a pull. The ball hits the thigh, then his arm, the ball swivels, and bounces up to trim the bails. Lucky break for Kings XI
Lynn welcomes AJ Tye, the purple cap holder, with a straight six. Pitched up on middle, right in his swinging arc, lifted over the bowler's head

short_text: Barinder Sran to Narine, FOUR runs
long_text: Narine clears his front leg and clears mid-on. Much fuller, another slower ball on middle, Narine is set to tee off. He does not have enough pace to work with. Instead, he holds his shape, manufactures his own pace, and swings it over mid-on for four

short_text: Barinder Sran to Narine, no run
long_text: Narine backs away outside leg, Sran chases him with a short ball and beats his attempt to ramp it away

short_text: Barinder Sran to Narine, FOUR runs
long_text: 149.3ks, is Sran that quick? He runs in from over the wicket and digs a chest-high short ball on off, rushes Narine into a hook. Top edge sails over short third man

short_text: Barinder Sran to Narine, no run
long_text: slower bouncer, climbs over middle as Narine ducks under it
short and plenty of width for Lynn to flash a cut to Karun at sweeper cover

short_text: Barinder Sran to Lynn, SIX runs
long_text: That's outta here! #Lynnsanity. Offcutter on a length on middle, Lynn spots it. He clears his front leg and disdainfully smites it over the wide long-on boundary. Bang!
dangled up outside off, driven through the line to mid-off. Lynn chances a single, AJ Tye nails the stumps, but the batsman has slid his bat in
much fuller on off, Narine clears his front leg and hacks a single to long-off
pushed through on a length on off, Narine presses forward and swats it over mid-on for back-to-back boundaries
back of a length and slides in on off from round the stumps, arm-ball Narine takes this thigh-high ball and pumps it over long-on

Belted back to Mujeeb, but the ball bursts out. He drops a difficult return catch. Narine runs down the track, meets a half-volley on off, and slams it back, the bowler attempts the catch and in the process hurts his bowling hand. He needs some attention from the physio. Such chances stick or they don't.  Adding injury to insult: Mujeeb has gone off the field
on a length and outside off, shuffles across and sweeps it flat and hard to short fine leg, where the big man Gayle dives to his left in instalments and somehow stops the ball
banged in short and angling in on off from around the wicket, Narine shuffles across and hauls a pull to the left of mid-on
Mohit keeps it short from round the stumps and attacks the body of Narine, he flaps a pull to mid-on
short and angling in on off from round the wicket, change-up as well, Narine arches his back, waits for the ball, then dabs to short third man
Mohit hits a hard length - neither driveable nor pullable, the line is on middle, forced down to wide long-on
105ks back-of-the-hand slower ball from Mohit, foxes Lynn, as he swishes early and misses
full-toss on off, from round the stumps, backs away and slaps to cover, where Ashwin makes a tumbling save
pushed through outside off, the new ball doesn't turn, Narine stays leg-side of the ball and scythes it over cover-point. Karn Nair chases the ball hard, slides, and hauls it into play
slider from wide of the crease, no room at all, squeezed into the leg side
tossed outside off, Narine presses forward and drives to the right of extra cover
on a length and fizzes through outside off, Narine plays for turn and is beaten on outside edge
pushed through outside off, stays leg-side of the ball and flashes to the right of backward point. Axar misses the direct hit at the bowler's end
full and slides in on middle, this non-turner is worked to mid-on
back of a length and width outside off, Lynn punches it through the line but can't piece the packed off-side infoeld
much fuller and outside off, Lynn does not meet the pitch, and lets the hands do all the work. Flayed to cover
back of a length and climbs on off, Lynn ventures deep in the crease and fends it off
Who hit the repeat button? Shorter and much closer to off, Lynn nearly chops it back onto the stumps. The result is a fortunate inside-edged four to fine leg
Mohit goes shorter and outside off, the ball does not come onto the bat, Lynn slashes hard and inside-edges it past the leg stump and left of Rahul for four
back of a length, angling in towards off, then nibbles away in the channel, Lynn watches it through to Rahul

Buttler has done it for Royals! He is mobbed by his team-mates. He is now embraced by his England team-mate Ben Stokes. Slower and fuller outside off, Buttler slices it to Watson at cover. Watson has a shy at the non-striker's end despite Buttler making his crease. He concedes an overthrow. Game, set, and match for Royals. Dhoni shakes his head. Sums up the night for CSK
length ball outside off, another slower ball, Buttler waits for it and slugs it over midwicket for six. Buttler manufactures his own pace. Gowtham lets out a cathartic roar in the dug out
slower ball outside off, Buttler goes deep in the crease and skies it to short midwicket. Bravo collapses in his followthrough and does not go for the catch. Dhoni isn't pleased
back of a length, slower ball on off, 135ks, dragged to wide long-on for two
slower one dips outside off, 116ks, Buttler slogs early to the leg side and only collects fresh air
Willey hits a hard length outside off. Gowtham throws his bat at the ball and edges it behind. Dhoni snags the catch. Gowtham walks back for 13 off 4. He has set it up for Buttler and Archer
Gowtham clears long-off. Pitched up and just a shade outside off, he gets under it and launches it straight over for six
good length and sliding into the legs, right in his swinging arc, but Buttler loses his shape and drags an inside edge onto the pad. Slower one it was
full and outside off, slower one, opens the face and glides to short third man. Harbhajan makes a diving save
short and slanted down leg, wide
Gowtham tees off with a first-ball six. Mid-off was just brought up and third man slid back. Length ball outside off, right in the slot, clears his front leg and smears it over for a six
length ball on off, hacked to long-on

Has Dhoni dropped this? Buttler shuffled across off even before the bowler delivered. He does not get enough bat on the scoop to fine leg. He tickles it away. Dhoni dives to his left and goes for the ball with one hand but it pops out. Replays suggest it carried to him. That's dropped
back of a length and angling into the hips, swatted to deep square leg for a double

DJ has Binny holing out off a knee-high full-toss. Drop, six, out. That's T20 cricket for you. Binny eyes up the leg side, instead he leading-edges it in the air. Watson settles under this skier at cover
length ball outside off, seam-up, Bravo errs in length, Binny clears his front leg and smites a six over long-on. Such a clean strike from Binny
slower, short ball outside off, 102.7ks outside off, Buttler waits and flat-bats it in the air. Bravo leaps but can only finger-tip it away
Buttler shimmies out and makes room. Bravo chases him with a short dart and pings the back thigh
good length ball on middle, Buttler shuffles across off and flips it over to fine leg
Buttler shimmies out, Willey chases him with a short ball and cramps him for room. Played back to the bowler
Buttler ventures outside leg and carves it up to Raina at backward point. Buttler strays out of the crease, undoes his steps, as Raina misses a direct hit
Buttler moves outside leg and slaps a slower ball to the right of deep point. Shortish and outside off, flayed away
full and angling into the pads, whipped to deep midwicket
back of a length and outside off, Binny steps away and flat-bats it to the right of sweeper cover

Buttler reverse-sweeps a four like a boss. Watson does a double tea pot. Very full on middle, most other batsman would have driven this through the covers. Buttler reverses it away through backward point
slower short ball, 117.9ks, dragged to the leg side

Watson drops a tough return catch. Bursts through the hands of the bowler. Back of a length and just outside off, another slower one, drilled back to the bowler, he puts his hands above his head but it does not stick
glanced off the hips to the right of Harbhajan at short fine leg. Dhoni applauds the old man's effort
slower ball on middle, skewed off the inside half to deep square leg
back of a length and attacking the stumps, Binny presses forward and clips to deep midwicket
length at off stump. Stab on the up towards mid-off. Yes-no-yes-no. Sprint. Scramble. Safe.
beaten. Length ball outside off. Plonks the front leg across and looks to swing across the line and this rolls through to Dhoni after beating the inside edge
length ball in at off stump. Looks to nudge this through cover but can't get it off the pitch
whack! Binny finds the point boundary. Thakur with a short and very wide ball and he climbs into this, on the front foot and full control
length ball into the pads. Stays tall in the crease and tickles this fine. Karn Sharma with a slide to his right at fine leg
short of a length on off stump, pushed to extra cover's left from the crease
appeal for caught-behind and stumping both turned down. A regulation spinner from Jadeja, pushed through flat outside off. Binny looks to poke through the covers and can't get bat on it
short of a length outside off, flicks it expertly between long-on and deep midwicket to come back for the second
good length outside off, steers it to short third man's right with his hands
full outside off, gets to the pitch and drives to long-off
length and in at leg stump. Tickles it wide of short fine from the crease
length on off stump, tapped to extra cover from the crease
length ball outside off, leans in and defends straight to point
length ball outside off, blocked into the off side off the front foot

chipped straight to midwicket. Fast hands too fast from Chopra. This is on the leg stump as well, but shorted than the last one. He's closed the face too early on this and it's off the inside half, straight to the fielder
poor ball, put away duly. An overpitched delivery on leg stump and he brings out quick hands to whip this to the deep backward square boundary
length ball in at middle stump. Nudges it back to the bowler from the crease
good length outside off, punched to long-off off the back foot
short of a length outside off, lifting up at him and past the outside edge as he looks to nudge this to third man
shot! Superb! Wide length ball outside off and Chopra, a specialist opener, has carved this old ball past backward point to find the boundary
good length ball slanted in at leg stump. Defended solidly into the leg side
short ball outside off, fetches it with a pull to deep midwicket

Samson run out ball watching! Plays a glorious late cut to find backward point. Looks at his partner then at the fielder. Is caught looking at the fielder when his partner responds and comes through for the run. They're both at the same end, nearly. Buttler falls to his knees - he knows what's coming. A throw on the bounce to Bravo as Samson makes a desperate attempt to run back. Bravo receives, turns and flicks it onto the stumps with an underarm throw. Raina was the man at backward point
slower ball outside off, forceful drive on the up to extra cover's right. He puts in a dive but can't stop cleanly
