chipped over the bowler. Doesn't look in control at first but this has flown off the bat as he tries to drive through the line. Bends inwards and keeps going away from long-off who has to parry it to long-on

thick outside edge and it's too fast for Harbhajan at backward point! Same strategy - backs away to try and go over extra cover. Except he makes too much room to reach this full ball outside off with the middle of the bat. Carved over the fielders behind square
full on off stump, exposes the stumps to drive to sweeper cover
slower ball at a length outside off. Backs away and looks to lift this over extra cover. Ends up slicing off the toe-end to sweeper cover
short of a length just outside off, glorious punch on the up off the front foot, straight to sweeper
offcutter. Length on off stump and he punches uppishly to long-off
slower ball, full and on middle stump. Does superbly to tap this with soft hands, well in front of long-on who has a long sprint and can't keep it to a single
slower ball floated up at off stump. Reaches the pitch and flicks through midwicket
ping-pong. Bravo fields to his left as Samson punches firmly on the up, and then attempts to chuck it back at the stumps. He's off-balance though and the throw is wayward
rolls his fingers over this short ball wide outside off. Samson through the cut too early and is beaten
length ball just outside off, driven on the up to mid-off
short of a length offcutter outside off, backs away and chops straight to backward point
back of a length and outside off, flat-batted away to the right of cover
picked off the pads between deep square leg and long leg
back of a length on middle, played back to the bowler
good length and outside off, guided through the off side
on a length and just a shade outside off, patted to the covers
half-volley on the pads, flicked away, the man in the deep isn't fine enough to cut that off
googly, knocked back to Karn from off stump
looped up and spins away outside off, Buttler flays at it and sends a thick outside edge fine of short third man

full and straight, Samson sweeps it flat and hard to the right of deep midwicket. Billings tears to his right, slides, knocks the ball away. The ball still rolls away towards the boundary. Billings then brings out another slide and swats the ball into play. Great commitment from Billings. Yes, a CSK fielder slides not once but twice
Buttler stretches out for a sweep, this ball from Karn drifts in and narrowly misses leg stump. Dhoni is beaten as well. Given as a bye
non-turner on middle, paddled to fine leg. Buttler brings up his fourth successive IPL fifty. Only Sehwag has more fifties in a row in the IPL
full on middle, swept to fine leg
back of a length and angling into middle, Samson stands tall and punches to deep midwicket
slower through the air outside off, carved off the outside half to the left of sweeper. Rayudu slides and hauls the ball into play
99ks dart on middle stump, and Buttler rolls out a reverse-sweep. He drops to one knee and drills it through point.
tossed outside off, eased down to long-off
worked to the right of the bowler for one
hint of turn outside off, dabbed to point
short and outside off, punched away, but Samson can't beat the packed off-side ring
much fuller and outside off, squeezed to the covers
back of a length and outside off, jabbed to cover
Samson presses forward to meet this length ball and drives it down to mid-off
back of a length and skidding outside leg, leg-side wide
Buttler moves away outside leg, Thakur follows him with a yorker, jabbed away to the right of the bowler
full at leg stump, bunted to mid-on
Buttler stays leg-side of this full ball on off and drives to long-off
arm ball on off, forward and pushed through the off side

Jadeja draws an outside edge, Raina snaffles it at slip. Drifts in from around the wicket, turns and bounces. Rahane simply wafts and edges it, the ball bounces out of Dhoni's gloves but into the hands of Raina. CSK's spinners hit back with two wickets in two overs
hip-high short ball on leg stump, swatted away past the right of Thakur at deep square leg
full and angling in on middle, poked back to the bowler off a leading edge
darted in on off, tapped to cover off the back foot
four, six, and out! Stokes screams in agony. He runs down the track, Harbhajan bowls a slider, angling in from around the stumps, Stokes does not meet the pitch, the spinner hits the middle stump
Stokes tees off. He nails it into the stands beyond midwicket. Floated up on middle stump, Stokes stretches out and slog-sweeps fiercely
pushed through outside off, Stokes slashes an inside edge past leg stump, fine of short fine leg

Dhoni claims a one-handed catch behind the stumps. Umpire Barde refers it to Nitin Menon, the TV umpire. The soft signal is out Skids on middle, non turner, Buttler backs away outside leg, and looks to smash it through the covers. He inside-edges the ball onto the boot, the ball touches the ground, before Dhoni grabs it with one hand
skidding into the pads from round the stumps, punched down to long-on
on a length on off, Buttler clears his front leg and whips it away to the midwicket boundary. Top timing from Buttler
short on middle, goes back and punches down to long-off
pushed though outside off, Buttler ventures outside leg and opens up the off side. He drives it inside-out over extra cover. Excellent execution
arm ball, Buttler stays leg-side of the ball and drills to cover
full on middle and leg, this non-turner is whipped to deep midwicket
Stokes now attempts a reverse-sweep and gloves it to short third man
leg-side dart from Jadeja, Dhoni collects it and breaks the bails in a flash. Appeal for stumping, shot down. Not called a leg-side wide either. Might have clipped the pad

picked off the pads to square leg. There's a mix-up between the wickets. Stokes is nearly halfway down the pitch, but Buttler sends him back. The throw is to Harbhajan, and he does not gather it cleanly. Stokes dives makes it in the end. Run-out chance missed
pretty full on off or just a shade outside off, Buttler gets under it and launches it over his England team-mate Billings at long-on
Such fast hands from Buttler. Tossed outside off, Buttler stretches out and reverse-sweeps it through point. He made it look as easy as eating a sandwich
back of a length and angled in on middle, goes back and punches to short midwicket
sliding into the pads, Buttler deftly paddles it away fine of short fine leg for four
fuller and spins in on off, played back to the bowler
tip and run to point. 13 off the first over
back of a length and skids into the thigh, beats the inside edge, and bounces to hit Buttler
good length and tighter on off, poked into the covers
Dhoni has his hands on his mouth. Back of a length and width outside off, Buttler brings his fast hands into play and smears it past Raina at backward point
similar line and length outside off, Buttler manipulates the gap between covers and mid-off now. Lovely back-foot punch again
back of a length and slanting away outside off, no swing, the new ball comes on. Buttler leans back and punches it crisply through the covers. Yes, he will go hard at the new ball
full ball on leg stump, swipes off the inside half of the bat and can only get it as far as fine leg, to his left
drags it to short fine. A slower ball, short of a length. Bravo halfway through a pull before this ball lands

direct hit from Buttler. Dhoni forgets to cross over. A stunning yorker from Stokes outside off and Billings can't get bat on it. Runs down the pitch, looks back, finds the stumps being tonked. Well outside the crease
dropped at deep square! Debutant Chopra runs in and can't hold on. Slower ball and he reaches out to drag this with a slog. Simple catch after making his ground but he doesn't complete it
drilled over mid-off! Stokes making life easy for Billings today it seems. Length ball on off stump, backs away and slams this flat
length ball on middle stump and he finally gets good bat on one. Ugly swat, effective sway. Deep square can't get it
inside edge zips past short fine. A full, straight ball and Dhoni has his front leg out of the way to get a short-arm helicopter in. Finds the boundary
yorker on middle stump, digs it past the non-striker and comes back easily for the second
for a change, a batsman is angry with a wide call. Or the lack of it in this case. Bounce lifts past his attempted hook and the leg-umpire signals first bouncer. Rightly so
and again. Full toss too quick for him. His attempted slog dribbles into the midwicket region
full toss on leg stump. Backs away and looks to slog it out the city. Gets it into the leg side off the high part of the bat
legcutter, back of a length and into the body. Looks to pull but he's cramped on it. Gets it out to deep midwicket

run-out appeal at the non-striker's end. Dhoni has taken the stumps down at the other end but the bowler hasn't got a hand on it. Billings it looking for a run though as the ball deflects towards the bowler who now has to run back at the stumps and uproot them with ball in hand. Manages it but Billings' dive saves him
offcutter outside off, tapped to long-off off the toe-end
slower ball at a length wide outside off. Reaches out and carts this off the toe-end to long-on
length ball pushed wide outside off now, left alone
boom. Everyone knows what the next ball is going to be. An offcutter outside off. Dhoni stays back in the crease and swipes from under it to clear midwicket
not a great night for this man so far. Offcutter at a length wide outside off. Shuffles to try and sweep. Gets it off the leading edge into the covers
slower ball at a length outside off, gets deep in the crease and drags it aerially to long-on
slower ball again. Length outside off. Leans in and stabs this into the covers
slower ball, full outside off. Gets low to try and scoop this. Deflected into the off side off the body
short of a length middle stump ball, pulled to deep square off the under-edge
nudged past short fine. It's a full ball on leg stump, he allows it to come on and flicks. The fielder gets a hand on it as he lunges to his left
slower ball dug in too short according to the umpire. Dhoni lets this float in the corridor. Didn't look so high to me but I was wrong. That was way over the head
yorker speared in at middle stump, backs away and jams it towards long-off
slower ball at a length on off stump. Gets deep in the crease and taps it into the leg side off the back foot
shuffles across, meets the offcutter outside off and clips to long-on
slower ball, skids away rapidly off the pitch as Billings it rooted to the crease chasing this with his hands. Doesn't get close to connection
slower ball in the corridor, back of a length. Into the pull too early and has to end up dragging this to fine leg
offcutter at a length on off stump. Steps out and flicks uppishly to long-on
short ball on off stump, pulled to deep midwicket
length at off stump, walks at it and punches to mid-off on the up
lovely bowling. Keeps putting it up there slowly. Keeps them on the back foot. Even Dhoni can only tuck it into the square leg region. What an over
short of a length and spinning away from off stump. Tapped to extra over off the back foot
length ball at off, steps out and looks to go cross-batted. Gets a deflection into the leg side off this pad
Billings tied. Another floated length ball and he's caught deep in the crease trying to flick against the turn. It runs back down the pitch
short of a length and very slow again. Slapped straight to extra cover off the back foot
nicely done. Tossed up at off stump, finds the leading edge as he looks to flick against the turn into the midwicket region
length ball slanted in at leg stump. Leans in and clips uppishly to deep square's left
yorker at off stump and he nearly gets trapped with a front foot plant across. Manages to tap it into the off side
sweeeeet. Billings meets the offcutter at the pitch outside off and laughs at his mate as he bludgeons this drive wide of mid-off
length ball on leg stump, tapped to long-on on the up
length and angled in at the body, stabbed into the midwicket region
length on off stump, punched to mid-off on the up

taken at short fine. Binny pedals backwards and falls awkwardly on his back, but he's held on with the reverse cup. Another ungainly hoick by Raina against a googly he hasn't picked. More a sweep, in fact. Regulation top-edge taken at 45
leg stump ball at a length. On the front foot this time as he taps it fine on its head. Long leg has a lot of running to his right before putting in the slide
googly, into the pads on a length. Stands tall and tucks it fine off the back foot
leading edge as Raina steps out against a googly and has no idea. Nowhere near the pitch of this leg side delivery turning away from him. It lands short of short third man
short of a length on off stump, punched to long-off off the back foot
length on off stump, leans in and tucks it through square leg
short ball, jumps awkwardly, shovels it into the leg side with a half-pull. Another Raina pull, another Raina fifty
this angle is not working at all for Jofra. Another length ball fired down leg side
short ball aimed at the ribs. Quickly gets on his toes and stabs it though the leg side
short ball in the channel. Gets on one leg and hurriedly bunts this into the square leg region
another one. Same pattern - full and down leg. Raina falling over into the off side trying to flick but that's fizzing past
goes around the wicket and fires one straight down leg side. Archer hasn't found any rhythm against Raina. Switch to over the wicket maybe?

got him! Jofra making it talk with his pace! Short of a length ball on off stump and once again he's late on the pull. This time it's angled in at his body so the swinging room is lesser. It hits the bat higher. Buttler skips to his left and tells short fine leg to stay out of his way to put his gloves to good use
clears the keeper with a top edge. Same ball that got Rayudu to chop on. Except Watson looks for the pull to this quick short ball outside off
length ball skidded in at off stump. Stays put, makes some room and guides it to third man
creamed but it's cut off by long-off on the bounce. Got nicely to the pitch of this and launched it over the bowler's head
short of a length on off stump, dabbed to short third man with the turn

nicely done. Raina has almost become a specialist at this one-legged, no-balance shot to fine leg. This time it's off the spinner of course. Length ball fired down leg and he swivels to tap it on its head
length ball pushed wide outside off and he slashes away from the body to get this to the sweeper on the bounce
back of a length on off stump, punched to long-off off the back foot
fires this into the blockhole at off stump. Can't get the bat swing through this and he slices it into the cover region
back of a length, slower one on off, swiped down to long-on
another off-side wide from Unadkat
Unadkat goes wide of the crease and darts a full ball past the tramline. Off-side wide
slower cutter outside off, toe-ended behind to the keeper
back of a length and nips back in from round the stumps to ping the thigh pad, but this heading past the leg stump
hip-high short ball outside off, slower ball, Watson waits for the ball to arrive. Then lines it up and smokes it over midwicket
Raina backs away outside leg, Unadkat takes pace off the ball, chopped to cover. Raina collides with umpire Erasmus. Ouch! Rahane, meanwhile, misses a direct hit and hands Raina a life
Raina backs away outside leg, Unadkat follows him with a seam-up ball and tucks him up for room. Fended off
tossed on middle and leg, forward and eased down to long-on
skidding into the hips, this quicker one is nudged to square leg
back of a length and outside off, forced to the leg side past the left of Sodhi
tossed up outside off, not sure if that was a googly, Raina stretches out and slugs a sweep over midwicket

tossed outside off, Watson ventures down the track, gets close to the pitch, and belts it past the left hand of Sodhi. Relays suggest Sodhi just finger-tipped it away. Only a harsh man will call it a drop. Sodhi, in fact, saved three for his side
half-tracker on middle, right in Watson's swinging arc, he sits deep in the crease and launches a pull over midwicket. First boundary for CSK after 21 balls. Watson finally connects with one
worked off the pads to long leg
Raina shuffles outside leg and hacks a single to deep square leg
full-toss outside off, Watson presses forward and slices to sweeper cover
Raina rides the bounce of this short offering outside off and glides it to deep third man
back of a length on off, 140.7ks, Watson miscues another pull to midwicket
back of a length, kicks up, and snakes past the outside edge. Encouraging carry to Buttler
shorter wrong'un, spins outside off, Raina reaches out and chops to cover
straight ball on middle, Raina stretches out and plays it right back to Sodhi
back of a length, starts on off and breaks away, Watson leans back and steers with the spin to sweeper cover
tossed on the pads, worked square on the leg side for one
dragged down on off, Watson can't put this away either. Hauls a pull to deep square leg
short and just a shade outside off, turns in slightly, Raina punches a single down to long-on
just short of a good length and outside off, Watson is early into a cut, loses his shape, and chops the ball only as far as cover
slower ball, floated on middle, Watson stays leg-side of the ball and flays to mid-off
short on middle, the ball does not come on, Watson struggling for timing. Drags a pull to short fine leg off the inside half
shuffles across off and clips a full ball away to deep square leg
back of a length on the hips, quietly tucked around the corner for one

Raina backs away outside leg, Unadkat targets his head with a lifter, Raina splices it over mid-on. Stokes tears back from mid-on, gets into a side-on position, slides to his left, and hauls the ball back into play. Great work from Stokes
full and sliding down the leg side, Raina falls over the flick, leg-side wide
Stokes spears it full and wide outside off, drags Watson forward. He drives and watches the ball run away past the outside edge
back of a length and homing in on off, Raina clips it away to the leg side for one more
hip-high short ball outside off, slower one, Raina picks it up and swats it over midwicket for his fifth boundary. Raina setting the pace for CSK
slower ball, 117ks, drifting into the pads, Watson helps it away wide of short fine leg
full and holds its line on off, patted back down the pitch to the left of mid-off
shorter and shoved down leg, Raina shuffles across and does not connect with a pull
back of a length and slanting away outside off, Raina thrashes the ball straight to backward point
back of a length and sliding in on middle, hangs back and nurdles it to the left of Gowtham
overpitched and outside off, Watson drags it across the line to long-on
back of a length on the hips, Raina stands tall and forces it down to long-on
darted full on middle, 103.4ks, backs away outside leg and hammers it through the covers for back-to-back boundaries. Laced to the boundary
shorter and outside off, 100.7ks, Raina leans back and punches it sweetly. Finds the gap between backward point and cover
full and skids on off, forward and driven to mid-off
short and slanting in at top of off, 148.2ks, pace like fire, Watson answers with an ice-cool back-foot defence
back of a length and slanting in at off, 146.6ks, Raina hops and secures a single to the leg side
short and angling into the body, 147ks, Archer has Raina hopping, skipping, and fending to leg
wide half-volley outside off, 149ks, leans into it and caresses a square-drive
Raina jumps a long way outside leg, Archer spears it outside off, away from the reach of Raina. Inside the tramline. Poor, poor call from umpire Barde
back of a length and slanted down leg from around the wicket, leg-side wide. And the umpire spots Archer overstepping
147.3ks, leg-stump half-volley, not the short one, Raina stylishly picks it off the pads and finds the square leg fence

Archer has Rayudu chopping his first ball onto the stumps. Back of a length and outside off, 142.3ks, Rayudu throws his bat at the ball and aims to chop it away through point. Instead, the ball does not come on, takes the inside edge, and leaves Rayudu's stumps in a mess
slower through the air on off stump, Rayudu waits for the ball to come on, then shovels it with the bottom hand to wide long-on for one more
straight ball on middle, Watson forces it down to long-on
half-tracker sliding into leg stump from round the stumps, Watson sizes it up and sweeps it away past short fine leg. Easy peasy
slides in on middle and leg, no turn, punched off the front foot through midwicket
back of a length on middle, Rayudu ventures down the track and belts it past the bowler. Gowtham slides to his left from long-on but can't haul the ball in
round-arm slider at the legs, worked away to square leg
Rayudu steps out again, but is nowhere close to the pitch of the ball. He still goes through with the loft and winds up slicing it over mid-off running back
wide of the crease, holds its line outside off, extra cover is up in the circle. Rayudu dashes out of the blocks and hoists it over the infield
fuller and outside off, 100.7ks, driven off the front foot to long-on
speared on the hips, whipped away in the gap at midwicket for one moe
tossed up slower and outside off, non-turner, Rayudu stretches out, meets the pitch and drags a sweep past the right of a diving Unadkat at square leg
back of a length and skids in on middle, hangs back and works it away through midwicket to get off the mark
full toss, that delivery sums up Delhi's bowling show today because Williamson steers it behind square and Sunrisers make it to the playoffs, Delhi are knocked out
gets a full delivery after a short ball and he lofts it with those powerful wrists to deep square leg

short_text: Boult to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: short, angled in, pulled in the gap and he gets four more to move into the 90s
right in the block hole outside off, he jams his bat down for a single towards backward point
bit too full and Dhawan uses his hard hands to whack it to long on
too full, driven through the covers yet again from Williamson and that's gone past a diving mid off for four. Williamson showing his authority
slams it down to long off for one

full toss above waist height and he pulls it for a single. Not given a no ball! Williamson looks at the umpire and can't believe it. That was certainly above his waist at the point of contact and he was on his toes too
full now outside off, he drives it down to long off easily
hooks the short ball away and Shaw dives to his left from long leg to keep it in
angled into the pads and steered to leg easily
much fuller but still outside off and Williamson uses his wrists to flick it to leg
slow at 118kmh, short outside off and Williamson gets a bottom edge this time on the off side
covers the stumps and wants to loft it towards square leg but gets only a single past Williamson with another edge

short_text: Patel to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: connects this time finally an he finds the gap too. Scrambled seam with a lot of room outside off, he gets to free his arms and sends it flying through the covers

short_text: Patel to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: another edge as Dhawan heaves and this one goes past the stumps to Pant

short_text: Patel to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: sends it down quick outside off, Dhawan slams it back but with a thick edge to the bowler
slow and slightly wide outside off, tapped to point for one
slow and full on the stumps, whipped with the wrists to leg
too short, he moves across a bit and hooks fine. It's gone fine enough to beat fine leg this time and lands straight on the ad ropes for a six
a good effort from Harshal to slide to his right from deep fine leg but he wasn't quick enough to throw it back qucikly and they come back for the second
goes across and gets one in the block hole too, bunts it to backward point
in the block hole outside off, he jams his bat in and gets a single behind square
into the pads from around the wicket and Williamson works it to long leg easily
he bangs it in and Dhawan pulls it away easily

almost run out! He tapped the ball to point and hesitated for a fraction of a second before responding for the single. Iyer went for a direct hit from point but missed it, Williamson had given up on the attempt to make it
that angle is not working either! Too full outside off, Williamson shows his class by driving that nice and square for four more. Spectacular batting
lofted over the covers as he gets some room, two more in the gap
angled in and Williamson helps it with the wrists off his hips to the long leg boundary and that's his fifty
lunges forward this time and helps the ball to leg, good and early call to say no for the second. Lot of things to learn for Delhi
slow and really slow outside off, Williamson sees it go outside the wide line but it's not given
dances down and lofts it to long off for one more
outside off and steered to third man. A really wide throw helps them come back

short_text: Maxwell to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: a bit short and Dhawan rocks back in the crease to pull it away to deep square leg, he's middling everything!
turning in a bit and it's tucked to leg for one

short_text: Nadeem to S Dhawan, SIX runs
long_text: he continues to bowl full to Dhawan on the stumps and Dhawan continues to smash'em! On off and middle this time, tonked over wide long on with what looks like rather ease on this small ground
drives the low full toss through the covers for one
bit outside off but it's short, he pulls it away and a fumble from Shankar at deep midwicket allows them to come back
goes back in the crease and whips it to deep midwicket, they come back quickly for two
on the stumps and drilled down to long on for one

short_text: Nadeem to S Dhawan, SIX runs
long_text: fullish on the pads and Dhawan lofts it straight down the ground. This is not great bowling and Dhawan has struck the sight screen here, looking in good touch after a while. Oh, replays show that was a wristy legbreak from Nadeem
comes down the track and slams it down the ground, it's racing away but Maxwell throws in a dive while running to his left from long on and saves two. Excellent effort
a slow bouncer gets some bounce and Williamson lets it go
shortish outside off, there's room and he scythes it to deep point

short_text: Patel to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: if you keep bowling short, he'll pull it away and he sends it between deep backward square and deep midwicket. Short ball, he stays back and pulls in style for his fifty

short_text: Patel to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: hardly bounces after he bangs it in short outside off, goes well under the bat

short_text: Patel to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: starts with a slow and short offcutter which Dhawan misjudges and takes on the waist
on the stumps this time and it's driven down easily for one more

short_text: Mishra to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: clever bowling and adjustment, the result is four! Dhawan charges down and Mishra responds by darting it down leg, it's flat and quick, and Dhawan manages to get enough bat to send it away fine for four
fullish outside off now and driven down to long off easily
into the crowd! Too full from Mishra, the batsman goes down on a knee and slog-sweeps it away from the meat of the bat
the googly outside off, Dhawan lets it turn away and taps it to off for one
reaches deep midwicket after a bounce. It kept low but Williamson managed to pull it away nicely
slow again and angling in, Williamson waits and chips it in the air with a whip for one in the vacant area
slow on the pads at 113kmh, he helps it to short fine leg
bangs it in short and he pulls it this time for one
leading edge falls safe! He wanted to tuck it to leg but played the shot early the thick outside edge went into the off side, but many yards short of mid off
and again! Slow, full and wide again, Williamson drives uppishly this time, almost chipping it in the air, and it's gone to the same place for four more
really slow and really full, mid off in the circle and Williamson drives that to perfection by piercing the gap between cover and mid off

short_text: Mishra to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: he charges down to take it on the full and drills it back along the ground, absolutely straight and gets four. That makes it eight from the over, Mishra won't be happy
similar to the first delivery, with flight and turn outside off. Williamson connects the drive this time and gets one to long off
nicely bowled - low and dipping delivery on the pads, Dhawan just about tickles it to short fine leg
on the stumps this time and Williamson kind of slog-sweeps it to leg
flighted well outside off, he drives it away from the body and misses. Beaten in the air and by turn
slow in the air around leg, swept away nicely for one
crunches it off the back foot towards sweeper cover for one
slower one on the stumps, he defends it towards silly mid on and Dhawan calls for one immediately. Good and early call
gives him the charge outside off but gets an inside edge towards short fine leg for one
he loses his line with that slower one, it's gone well outside off

short_text: Shankar to S Dhawan, SIX runs
long_text: what timing from Dhawan! Back of length on the off stump, Dhawan stays still and only flicks those wrists with the minimal movement to send that flying to square leg. Wow!

short_text: Shankar to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: just over mid off! Little full outside off, not much, and Dhawan swing like he usually does to just about clear a leaping Plunkett

short_text: Shankar to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: not much room outside off and he defends it back
fuller and turning in, he steers it with the spin to deep midwicket

short_text: Mishra to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: charges down and bunts it back to the bowler, Mishra scares KW by almost throwing it to non-striker's end
whips this one with the wrists towards mid on
waits on the back foot this time and he cuts it late, short third man puts in a dive to his right but the ball goes under him. Not a great effort
loud appeal from Mishra as Williamson misses the sweep but it was going down leg
turning into the batsman and he helps it along towards square leg
drives the low and wide full toss straight to extra cover. Not hit too hard, either, I wonder why
another slower one at 120kmh on the off stump, Dhawan defends with soft hands and takes off quickly
back of length outside off, Williamson runs it to third man again
covers his stumps a bit and steers the full delivery to leg for one

short_text: Boult to S Dhawan, SIX runs
long_text: all the way into the crowd this time over long on! Slow offcutter from Boult, well outside off and it gave Dhawan the chance to swing his arms even more for a straighter hit down the ground. Good spot of the variation

short_text: Boult to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: gets a length delivery and he whacks that from outside off to wide and over mid on for four
143.6kmh, another late dab from Williamson and this time he sends it much finer to easily beat the third man for a four
angled into Dhawan from back of length and he tucks it to leg for another single
short ball, he mistimes the pull and makes it just in time for the quick single as the throw came in from midwicket
a late dab is running away for four towards third man but Harshal sprints and dives to his left and saves two. Excellent effort
on good length just outside off, solid straight-bat defence from KW

short_text: Plunkett to S Dhawan, 1 leg bye
long_text: 135kmh and angling in, Dhawan tries to loft it on the leg side but only gets a leg bye
gives him the charge, Harshal sends it slower around 128kmh, Williamson slogs for a thick egde to deep midwicket
full on the pads, Williamson drives it nicely with the wrists but straight to short midwicket
touch closer to off, there's still room and he drives it late to deep backward point

short_text: Patel to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: too much room and Dhawan smacks that through the square region with a full swing of the arms for a cracking four
slower on the stumps at 120kmh, Williamson waits and helps it to leg for one
charges down for the 142kmh delivery but it angles into him from around the wicket and he gets an edge onto his pads
drives the low full toss down to deepish mid-on for one
hint of room and he sticks his bat out for one on the off side
flat and quick at 11kmh outside off, driven hard to cover
charges down the track and drills it down to mid off for a quick single
takes a step down this time and turns the ball to midwicket for one
targets the stumps, Williamson goes back to defend dangerously and brings his bat down just in time
runs it down to his favourite area - third man - for one

in the block hole, that's plumb! What a reply from Harshal. Hales went back and across early to cover the stumps and steer it to the leg side, and Harshal sends down a slow offcutter with some revs, Hales misjudges the pace completely and is trapped right in front
another short ball, this time towards leg and he knows fine leg is in. Waits for it and pulls it to the long leg boundary for four more
cuts in the air, it lands short and wide of a diving backward point and runs away for four. Too short, not the kind of length you can ball to Hales. Or anyone
slightly slow in the mid-120s, just around off and he blocks it back
bangs it in a bit short, Dhawan taps it to cover point for one
full again and he drills it down to mid-off
too short and pulled away! That length gave Hales ample time to stay back and hammer it wide of mid-on to the wide long on boundary
drives again for the inswinger on the off stump, but an inside edge gives him to two square leg
absolutely full and he crunches it straight to Maxwell at short cover. Pant collects the throw and screams "come on, boys!"
brings the length shorter and swings it into Hales's body this time, cramped up for room and he takes it near the abdomen
bit of inswing from well outside off, Hales drives it away to extra cover

full toss, waist-high on middle, Pant swings this cleanly to clobber this over deep midwicket. All of them in orange come up to shake hands. Stand up and applaud, this has been a majestic innings.  138 runs off the last 10 overs
one-handed six over long-on. He can walk on water tonight? Bhuvi shortens his length, Pant holds his shape and then wallops this
pulled into the fine leg boundary. Bhuvi does short, this didn't have much pace so Pant picked the length early and helped it along

another scoop, another one that beats short third man. He's toying with the bowlers now. Excellent awareness, knows exactly where Bhuvi will go. Full and wide outside off, brings out that back flick. Wow
the scoop over short third man. Gives you the impression he's going leg side but then spots the full and wide delivery and at the last moment opens the bat face to hit this up and over
slices this slog to long off. Hales makes no mistake. Wonder if this was a little too ambitious from Maxwell? Was he better off giving strike to Pant? Looked to go straight but got no timing.
belts this full toss to sweeper cover
time for Maxwell to join the show. Waist-high full toss, and he flat-bats this straight over the bowler's head. No chance for long on and long off.
drills this full delivery to long off.
shaped to paddle this fine but Kaul went full and wide, Pant looked to angle it past short third man but couldn't get any bat

muscles this full toss one bounce to the deep midwicket boundary, brings his first IPL century. He's pumped, angry gestures to the dressing room, lets out a roar and then soaks in the applause of his home fans and mates.
width outside off, drilled to the man at the edge of the ring at cover
short on middle and leg, is off balance as he pulls but just manages to beat square leg
the back flip to beat short third man. Disdainful. Shaped to play the lap shot over short fine, saw the length ball angle away and then flicked it up and over short third man
full, wide and just inside the wide line this time. Pant reaches out to beat point but can't lay bat to it
full toss, smacked towards deep cover where Shakib throws in a dive to cut that off
goes over cover, belts. Beats long-off. Once again looks to outfox him by bowling this wide and out of Pant's reach, this time he was ready for it.
angles it full and wide, Pant can't reach out. Wide called, however. Bhuvi is frustrated at that call, asks the umpire furiously why he called it a wide. Correct call, I have to say

tournament's best bowler: take that. Pant has walloped this length ball into the change rooms at deep midwicket. Clean, clean strike. Superb picking of length, hit the middle of the bat. Sailed away. Wow

short_text: Rashid Khan to Maxwell, no run
long_text: caught in a tangle as he looks to work that googly. Spun back in sharply to hit the thigh pad

short_text: Rashid Khan to Maxwell, no run
long_text: leading edge to backward point, loud call of noooooooooo from Maxwell
cleverly works this down to long on, they hare back for the second. Very risky, you have to say. Thankfully a positive response from Pant
works this with the spin to deep square leg

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pant, SIX runs
long_text: high and super handsome. Rashid goes full and Pant was waiting for it, muscled over the bowler's head, deep into the long-off boundary. This is some hitting.

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pant, FOUR runs
long_text: the reverse sweep, this is a fierce hit that beats the diving deep point fielder. Changed his stance, bat grip much before the ball was delivered. This was a wrong'un so it helped him hit with the spin
looks to wallop this over deep midwicket, gets a thick inside edge and can only get it as far as square leg
another excellent yorker-length ball angling away, Pant can't get any bat as he looks to carve this behind square
slips in a yorker-length delivery across Pant, who can't reach out to squeeze this awa
angles in a length ball on middle and leg, punched to deep midwicket
flat-bats this over the bowler's head, on the bounce to Rashid at long off. This was a slower delivery
width and Pant tees off like a golfer. Swung away wide of long-on. Another meaty blow.
belts this full toss down to Rashid at long-on
appeal for lbw as Pant misses a heave, this was sliding down leg.
in his hitting arc, Pant shimmies down the pitch and belts this to the long-on boundary. Flat hit, angry stroke. He's taking out all the anger on the ball now.
punches this length delivery to sweeper cover
pulled but straight to deep square leg
muscled deep into the stands at midwicket. Fetches the slog from way outside off, clean strike. Brings up his seventh IPL half-century

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pant, 1 run, OUT
long_text: comedy of errors.  Another mix-up with Rishabh Pant. Harshal Patel is three quarters of the way down the pitch for the second, but the throw from deep midwicket is fumbled by Shreevats, but he recovers quickly to get to the ball and then comes up with an underarm flick to beat Harshal's dive. Surely someone's got to have a word with Pant about his running, very very poor.  Fourth time now that Pant is involved in a run out this season. He's run his partner out on three of those occasions

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pant, no run
long_text: beaten! Picked the googly, looked to run it down but is beaten by sharp turn
works this with the spin to long-on, was the googly this time.

short_text: Rashid Khan to Patel, no run
long_text: beaten by a fizzing legbreak from length on off stump. Harshal played down the wrong line

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pant, 1 leg bye
long_text: shapes to sweep but the googly drifts and spins away to deflect off his back thigh to short third man
bunts this back past
belted over the bowler's head, down to long-on.
punches this to cover, a misfield gives them a run.  Brings up the half-century stand off just 31 balls
too much leg side, so Pant tickles this past short fine. Easy pickings. Today, he hasn't been about the muscle or the big hits, there's been a lot of calculative strokes.
punches this length ball to deep cover point
he's deposited this into the second tier at long-on. Too short, tripe delivery. Clean swing as Harshal muscled this away.
mistimes a slap to cover

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pant, FOUR runs
long_text: too short and down leg, Pant picks the length, rocks back and helps it along the way to the deep fine leg boundary.
shortish delivery on middle and leg, punched to deep midwicket
leading edge wide of cover, was looking to work this through midwicket

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pant, FOUR runs
long_text: this time he paddles it past short fine leg. Went across a long way, looked to hit it to square leg but got an inside edge. Result doesn't matter. Pant's back hand came off the grip as well.

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pant, FOUR runs
long_text: brings out the reverse paddle, beats short third man. Nicely executed. Rashid pushed this through so there was pace on it, Pant got on top of it nicely and used the pace.
steps out and squeezes this drive behind point for a quick single
slips in a yorker that has been flicked nicely into the gap at deep square. Big mix-up again between Pant and Harshal, but he's managed to turn back in time at the non-striker's end
dabs this gently into the off side for a quick single
short and sliding in, Pant swivels back and wallops this pull to the fine leg boundary
drills this full delivery down to long on

this is a ferocious pull. No matter how spiteful the surface is, if you bowl half-trackers like those, you will be put away. Harshal fetches this from outside off and imperiously pulls over the deep square leg fence
slower and fuller delivery that angles in, Pant dabs this into the off side for a quick single

short_text: Rashid Khan to Patel, no run
long_text: he had no clue about that, went for a drive with hard hands, beaten as this spun sway sharply.
swept from middle and leg to deep square leg
works this googly from length on middle to long on
off balance as he pulls this short ball to deep fine leg

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pant, no run
long_text: googly that rips away from off stump to beat the outside edge.
drifts in a full ball on middle and leg, eased to long on
floats this full on off stump, defended back.
goes for a big heave, gets a thick inside edge to square leg.
walks down the pitch and turns this length ball to deep midwicket
shows the full face as he defends back
squeezes the drive wide of cover for an easy single
short and sliding into middle and leg, worked behind square as they jog the single
works this from middle and leg towards midwicket
slower length ball on off, punched to cover

another ball, another inside edge  and Pant is involved in a run out again. This rolled just wide of the keeper, Iyer was more than halfway down the pitch when he had to turn back. By that time, Goswami had lobbed the ball to Sandeep, who broke the bails at the bowler's end.
knuckleball that cuts back in to take the inside edge onto the pad as Pant looks to go off side. There's plenty of grip on this surface for the slower ones
comprehensively beaten by a slower one. Committed into a forceful drive on the up, by the time he tried to pull out, this had beaten the inside edge
short of length delivery that bends back into middle, punched to midwicket
turns this gently into the leg side for an easy single
goes back and whips this indrifter to deep square leg
steps out and across to work this to the leg side but the bat gets tangled inside the pad as he tries to work to the leg side.
touch short again, whips this to deep square leg
drifts in to take the inside edge as Iyer looks to defend to the off side, they squeeze in a single
walks across and whips this length ball to deep midwicket
dabs this gently into the off side for a quick single
toe-ends a lofted it but this just eludes the two fielders running backwards from cover and mid-off. Slower delivery but Pant had to reach out to this delivery.
much fuller this time, Pant gets a good stride in and defends to cover
bottom edge, beats the keeper to the third man boundary. Looked to blast this short ball through point. Lucky runs, but he'll take those.
this time he pierces the gap between cover point and point. Once again length angling away, Pant uses the hint of width and then uses his wrists to pick the gap. Lovely.
width outside off and he slaps this length ball to extra cover. First sign of width and he walloped that away
solid punch but can't pierce the gap, straight to mid-off.
turns this length ball on middle and leg past midwicket
punched firmly to mid-off as they pinch a quick single
back of length on off stump, Iyer shows the full face as he defends back
stands tall and punches this length ball to cover
back of length delivery on off stump, defended solidly.

stunning ball, super grab. Dream ball for any left-arm spinner. Drifted in, drew the batsman forward but spun away sharply from off stump to take the nick through to the keeper. Roy didn't even wait for the umpire's decision.

the slowness of the surface has resulted in Prithvi's downfall. This is a touch short but stooped on him, Prithvi rocks back to pull and is through with the stroke early, only manages a top-edge that is gobbled up nicely by Dhawan at cover.
swept fiercely but straight to square leg
steps out, doesn't get to the pitch but goes through and manages to absolutely blast this wide of Shakib. Mid-on had no chance
backs away and slaps this indrifting length ball to long off
steps out to work this legside but the ball drifts back in to hit the pad
tremendous sound of bat on ball, punched straight to extra cover though.
another legcutter, angled into middle and leg, Roy looks to whip but gets some thigh pad on this
cuts him into half. Cramped for room as he's beaten in an attempt to play a short-arm jab
lofted over the bowler's head, couple of bounces into the ropes. Not much wrong with the delivery - length - and Roy was happy to hit through the line. Brave
leg-cutter at length on middle, worked to midwicket off the backfoot
big heave, hit on the pad. looked to step out and go over square leg, played too early
slower and fuller on middle, Roy times this down the ground, long-off cuts it off.
high backlift as he punches this length ball to long-on
cramped for room as he mistimes a short-arm jab to mid-on
shortens his length this time, Roy stands tall and punches to point
thumped on the up, to the left of extra cover. It was in the air for a while, but so well struck and just wide of the diving fielder. So good to see
floats it full outside off, Shaw mistimes an off drive to long on. Thick inside edge on that
inswinger from Bhuvneshwar, on a good length, Roy flicks and falls over. He wears it on the pad but this is heading down the leg side. Sharp first over from Bhuvneshwar
back of a length and nips back in on off, the ball does not come onto the bat and messes with Shaw's back-foot punch. The result is an inside edge to cover
short, swings away wide outside off, Shaw stays leg-side of the ball. Throws his bat at it with his back leg a fair way outside leg. Beaten emphatically
back of a length and angling in at middle stump, no swing, Shaw sits back and punches between midwicket and mid-on
shorter and angling in on middle, hangs back and turns to the leg side
fuller than a good length and swings back in sharply from over the wicket, Shaw is tucked up for room and an inside edge saves him

and Krunal seals it, but Kuldeep reviews it. A reverse sweep from Kuldeep for the ball pitching on middle and leg stump and it's going pretty straight from around the wicket, goes under the bat, hits him in front of the stumps and it's all over
leaves that alone as it turns a mile away from him
goes back to cover the stumps with his pads and blocks the googly in time
turns that one a long way outside off and Krishna can't reach it
some flight on the stumps and he blocks it back
sweeps that one away with the turn to fine leg
starts with a flighted wrong'un, he does well to cover the stumps and get a thick edge to leg
a tiny forward stride to defends and manages a bit of bat
there comes the wicket, holes out to long on. Not quite long on, actually, because Duminy had to run in and towards his right a fair bit after Curran came down and skied it high
just outside off and a thick edge goes to short fine leg, they sneak in a quick single and the fielder has a shy at non-striker's but misses
length delivery on leg, tucked away square of the wicket for one
reaches out for it this time and sweeps it away for one
tries to cut on the off side and misses

short_text: Markande to Tom Curran, FOUR runs
long_text: too wide outside off, it's even gone beyond the wide line but Curran reaches out for the full delivery and slams it flat and wide of long off for four
towards the pads and there's a shout of catch it as it goes in the air but off the pad
outside edge goes off Kishan's gloves! The wrong'un again and Kuldeep went forward to defend but the turn took an edge and deflected off the keeper's gloves on the off side
the googly around off, he waits and then helps it to backward point
takes a step down to negate the turn and turns the ball to leg for one
132kmh, pitches it short again and Kuldeep makes room to steer it to off but misses yet again
slightly shorter and close to off stump, he tries to slice it off the back foot and misses again
pokes at it outside off with a slightly tight line, misses it
hardly moves his feet and steers the ball straight to point
angles it in from back of length, Kuldeep defends it back
slightly short outside off, he taps it to third man

almost another run out! Curran helped that ball to backward point and there was another confusion - he went for the single, Kuldeep didn't want it and the ball just missed the stumps as Curran was making it back but was miles outside

slogs it straight to SKY (Suryakumar Yadav) at wide long on, his second catch to add to Lynn's run out. Looked like a slower ball again, it was fullish on leg, and Chawla slogged it high on the leg side, easy catch in the deep
short and on the leg side, Chawla tickles that absolutely fine on the leg side, past a diving Ishan Kishan for four
a little too short, pulled to deep midwicket easily for one

short_text: Cutting to Tom Curran, no run
long_text: slow and dipping yorker at 112.6kmh, very well bowled and it beats Curran and the off stump by a whisker!
a short ball on the off side, it's a cutter (from Cutting) and Chawla chops it into the off side
defends the back of length ball to leg and takes off for a single quickly
full on off, he drives it past cover and gets a single before mid off cuts it off

short_text: Bumrah to Tom Curran, no run
long_text: moves a bit too much to off to make room, Bumrah replies with a full delivery outside off and Curran swings and misses
142.8kmh and down the leg side, Chawla also backs up and then tucks it to long leg
stays in the crease this time and gets his bat down just in time to block it in front of the stumps
smashes that uppishly over the covers but Cutting chases it towards the boundary and slides to keep it to two

short_text: Cutting to Tom Curran, no run
long_text: the slower ball as Curran comes down, the pace of the ball beats him as he swings and misses and Kishan takes it after a bounce

short_text: Cutting to Tom Curran, FOUR runs
long_text: too short, too slow, and Curran rocks back and pulls that away nicely between long on and deep midwicket. Almost pin-drop silence at the ground

short_text: Cutting to Tom Curran, no run
long_text: just outside off stump, Curran swings hard at it and misses it
another short ball, Chawla ramps it late on the off side and Bumrah runs to his right from third man to get to it after a bounce
much shorter this time and nipping in a bit, Chawla defends it back after it rises
around the off stump and Chawla pushes it into the covers

short_text: Bumrah to Tom Curran, no run
long_text: pace and bounce towards the middle stump, Curran respects it by blocking it back
clipped in the air off the pads towards the square leg umpire for one, no fielder there
waits for the short of length ball and steers it from off stump to point
right on the off stump, Chawla blocks it back

edged to the keeper, KKR collapsing on their home ground against seam bowling. Bumrah leaps in celebration and why shouldn't he. That one pitched around the leg stump and Bumrah angled it nicely to absolutely stifle the batsman with the line and he only tickled it to the keeper
short ball angled across and Rinku Singh waits for it to rise and then ramps it over the slip fielder for a well-placed four

short_text: Pandya to Tom Curran, FOUR runs
long_text: inside edge runs away to the fine leg boundary. Curran pushed at it with hard hands outside off but played the wrong line and the thin edge beat Kishan to the fence

short_text: Pandya to Tom Curran, no run
long_text: stays in the crease this time and pushes it down to mid on

short_text: Pandya to Tom Curran, no run
long_text: swing and a miss outside off this time
angled across and he guides it towards third man dangerously past first slip

holes out to deep midwicket, Cutting takes a superb catch running to his right. What's happening here! A short ball from Hardik, Rana pulled and that hardly went any distance beyond the 30-yard circle, Cutting wasn't at the boundary but well inside and he did well to run a few yards to his right and slide to catch that

another run-out chance, Hardik may not have collected the ball here! Rana steered the ball to point and DK wanted the single, he hared out and turned back too. Oh hello, that's so so close. Hardik's right hand is in front of the stumps as the throw comes in and looks like the hand has broken the stumps as it comes back to collect the ball. But the ball is just touching the hand as the zing bails light up. Umpire Dharamsena gives it out!
swept against the turn from the meat of the bat and that reaches the boundary before a fielder an blink. Not that full, but DK swivels his bat with that loop and smashes it
reverse sweep this time and he gloves it fine for one
well over midwicket on this big ground! Another short ball to Rana, like the first one, and Rana went down on his knee quickly to pull that over the fielder's head in the deep
flicks it against the turn down the ground this time and it reaches long on after a bounce
chips the ball back with the turn, lands a bit short of the bowler
goes down on a knee and swat-sweeps it behind square for one

straight to cover! A slower one outside off, Russell wants to pounce on it and makes room to slap it on the off side. He does that but hands it straight to Markande who grabs it with both hands over his head
135.9kmh, ducks for the short ball and takes it on the shoulder. Hardik banged it in short and maybe Russell picked the length a bit late and ducked late and took his eyes off the ball while ducking
punches that uppishly towards mid off and that reaches the fielder after a couple of bounces
another offcutter and Russell pulls but connects well enough only for one
back of length offcutter and Rana scythes it to deep point where Lewis does well to keep it to one
fullish on the off stump and Rana drives it down to mid off
wrong'un to end the over, but it was short enough to be spotted by Rana and he pulled it to deep midwicket
off the mark straightaway by punching that through the covers
straight to deep midwicket! Suryakumar had to move only an inch to his right because Uthappa made some room, Markande pitched it on the leg stump and Uthappa slog-swept it straight to the fielder
on the leg side and Rana helps it away easily to deep square leg
this one comes in with the arm and Uthappa helps it to leg off the back foot
goes back in the crease and pushes the ball to off after it turns away
a slow offcutter at 115kmh on the stumps to end the over, Rana makes room but gets a thick edge to cover point after attempting to slice it
waits for the ball around off stump and defends to point
slightly straighter and he pushes it towards cover point

how delicate was that and so well placed. A short offcutter from Hardik, Rana spots it and lets it come to him to tap it late with short hands and places it between the keeper and the fine gully fielder
around the off stump off back of length, Rana defends it late and behind square on off
starts on the pads, Rana is strong on that side and he clips it away nicely to roll it along the ground past short fine leg
nearly plays on! Strong finish from Bumrah to end the over with one that angles in, Uthappa gets an inside edge that nearly gets the off stump
beats the outside edge! Length delivery outside off that just about holds its line after coming in with the angle, Uthappa pokes and misses
bangs it in short and Uthappa pulls that away stylishly for six! Watched the ball land well outside off, turned on the back foot and swivelled nicely to pull it square
defends the slightly shorter ball on middle towards the off side and takes off for the single quickly
length delivery on the off stump this time, Rana blocks it back
swings it across Rana on the off side who drives and misses

oh, mix up and Lynn is nowhere close! Uthappa sliced the ball to cover point and took a step or two out of the crease but Lynn reacted late and suddenly ran down the pitch but it was too late. Suryakumar swooped in and sent it a flat throw to Krunal well before Lynn could reach the crease
goes across the line with a heave and he connects enough to go over long on. It wasn't a bad ball, on length on off and he swiped it to the leg side
goes back to pivot on the back foot and tucks the ball to mid on
comes down the track this time and Krunal pulls the length back a bit, a single towards cover
makes some room this time and hits it hard to cover
right on the stumps on length, blocked back to the bowler
slightly slower than average again, on the stumps this time. No room at all so Lynn makes some and chops it with hard hands to deep point
slower delivery on back of length outside off, he waits and then steers it to backward point
fine leg is in, a short ball again and this time Lynn uses placement instead of power to pull it wide and square of short fine leg
smoked this time! Another short ball, another pull and he connects this time and how! From the meat of the bat and it sailed to the midwicket boundary
that goes a bit high and behind the stumps, Kishan runs forward and dives desperately but it falls well short of him. Took a bit of glove when Lynn tried to pull the short ball
sees a short ball outside off and slaps it to cover, lands short of the fielder
he goes back in the crease to let the ball turn and then helps it to short third man
too short outside off and he goes back to punch through cover. Rohit slides to his left and fumbles a bit
tiny forward stride and he blocks the length delivery back
goes back and tucks it to the leg side successfully this time
stays back in the crease to turn the ball from well outside off to leg, but doesn't connect
he tries to sweep across the line, takes it on the pad and the appeal is turned down. Probably going down leg
pushes this one with a straight bat straight to cover. Dot ball to end the over
short ball, it's a slower one and Lynn waits after that high back lift, and then pulls it late for it to go fine on the leg side this time, four more
big edge, flies down to third man for a one-bounce four! Sees room outside off with that fullish length and he swings hard, gets an edge thick enough fine on the off side
he angles it across from length and Lynn reaches out for it to drive but gets an inside edge to the leg side
short ball follows and mid-on takes it easily! Right on the money, Mitch! Bangs it in short, Narine opens up a bit and pulls for a top-edge that goes high and Krunal comes under it comfortably
over mid-off first ball for four! Not sure why that happened but Mitch bowled it straight and full on the off stump for Narine to loft that over a leaping mid-off for four

pulled, and pulled very very well. What a flourish, what a finish. Sitting up nicely as Krunal muscled this over deep midwicket.  KKR will have to bat out of their skins to get this.  22 off the last over, not the finish they wanted.

drags this from outside off, so there's no timing on this heave and DreRuss takes a superb catch with the boundary triangle just around the corner of his eyes. Took three steps to his right, maintained his balance and took it without much fuss.
swung through early, missed. Hit on the back
clobbered! This time on the bounce, bisects deep midwicket and long-on. He went length, got punished.
too short, vanishes over deep midwicket. Stayed firm and muscled this away. DK's a worried man already
in his hitting arc and this has vanished over wide long-on. Drifted in from wide of the crease, Cutting was waiting for it as he teed off like a golfer in style
walks across and whips this full delivery towards fine leg. Russell took a while to run in and pick up
drills this full delivery to long off
Swing and a miss. Little more effort into the delivery, bounce as well. Cutting once again looked to pull from outside off
slips this short and outside the wide line, Cutting leaves.
too much power, too much muscle. Slower length ball way outside off, Cutting picked it early, walked across, held his shape and belted this over wide long-on
toe-ends a lofted hit straight to mid-off.  First IPL wicket for Prasidh  and a slower delivery has earned him one. His one-time Karnataka team-mate takes the catch.
muscles the short ball in front of square to deep midwicket
another full toss, surely a no-ball? They've asked for the ball back. Straight to long-on. Replays suggest this was just below the waist. Hardik has to go but he's done his job.

short_text: Tom Curran to Pandya, SIX runs
long_text: carved over square third man. Too much width, another full toss and he got down on it nicely to hit this up and over. One-handed slice

short_text: Tom Curran to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
long_text: full toss, hits this high on the bat, bounces short of long on.
drills this full delivery on the bounce to long off
sees the batsman trying to back away and floats this wide, misses the wide line by a long way.

short_text: Tom Curran to Pandya, no run
long_text: toe-ends a paddle, can't get it up and over

short_text: Tom Curran to Pandya, SIX runs
long_text: walloped! Length outside off, Hardik held his shape and deposited that slower delivery over the deep midwicket boundary

short_text: Narine to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: the back cut, straight to Nitish Rana at point. Cry of anguish from Rohit, a meter to his right and it was four

short_text: Narine to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: slogged, don't worry about the line. Way over deep midwicket. Walked across the stumps to negate the width, and muscled it away
rocks back to cut, down to deep cover

short_text: Narine to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: chops a cut, DK runs across to stop. Swift work
mistimes an attempted hoick to deep square leg
swept from outside off to deep square

short_text: Tom Curran to Rohit Sharma, 1 run
long_text: back of length on middle and leg, works this to square leg.
lofted but off a thick inside edge, down to long on

short_text: Tom Curran to Rohit Sharma, (no ball) 1 run
long_text: backs away and forces this length ball wide of cover.  Oh, dear. Has he overstepped? Freehit  This is a ridiculous call for no-ball, clearly had half a foot  behind the line.  KN Ananthapadmanabhan  is the umpire. Curran and KKR have seen it on the big screen and have asked for the decision to be overturned, but the umpires can't do that according to the rule book. This is ridiculous.  Michael Clarke on air calls this a disgrace
run out missed!  Back of length on off, slaps this to cover and scampers a run. Hardik had given up, a direct hit by Chawla at the bowler's end and he would've been running back to the dugout.

short_text: Tom Curran to Pandya, no run
long_text: backs away to go over cover but Kishan slips in a yorker, squeezed back

short_text: Tom Curran to Pandya, no run
long_text: legcutter outside off, steers this straight to point. Good work by Rana at point
hops back and bunts this down to square third man, excellent running, wayward Narine throw.
too full and drifting in, eased to long on
turns this gently into the leg side

swept again but this time he's picked out Uthappa right at the ropes at deep square leg. So, so close to being a seventh six. Sensational knock, one that has given them a kick towards the death overs. Kishan is bitterly disappointed but he can be mighty proud of his efforts.

where has he hit this? Don't worry, deep into the stands at deep midwicket. Down on one knee, underneath the flight as he picks the bones out of the slog sweep. The perfect swing, a golfer's delight. This is some batting, right out of the top drawer.
swing and a miss. Narine carefully drifted this across. Kishan heaved wildly
punches this length ball to deep point

walks across the stumps and uses his wrists to whip this full delivery over deep midwicket. Stunning. Countered the drift with his wrist work and bottom handed power.  Shades of MS Dhoni and his helicopter shot
steps out and flat-bats this over long on to bring up a 17-ball fifty. Joint-fastest for Mumbai Indians. Stunning innings, the captain applauds and then gives him a bear hug
belted across the line, slogged and it clears deep midwicket with ease. This wasn't easy because he had to fetch it from way outside off. Huuuuuuuge
swept high and handsome, way over deep square leg. He saw Kishan stepping out so fired it in, he went down on his knee instead to bring out the sweep. Got it off the middle. Wow
turns back in from length on middle and leg, worked to deep square

short_text: Kuldeep to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: googly, picks it off the hand, drives inside-out to cover
slower length ball, Kishan hops across and pulls over short fine. Sweet! Excellent match awareness, signs of knowing the field inside-out
thick inside edge to deep square. Looked to flay this on the up

short_text: Prasidh to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: pulled in front of square, didn't get hold of it but there's still enough fizz to split the gap between deep square and wide long on.

short_text: Prasidh to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: bottom edge, but this races fine to the third man boundary. He was looking to cut
backs away and slaps this to point. Didn't quite get the width he would've liked.
dabs this down to third man
clean, crisp strike. Fearless, ferocious. Kishan is on a roll. Too full and angling away, he's down on one knee as he absolutely belts this inside-out to beat sweeper cover.
slower and fuller on middle and leg, worked wide of midwicket
was shaping up to heave, ends up dabbing it gently into the off side instead

Rana puts down a straightforward offering at backward point!  The timing of his jump was off. Went with his palms facing upwards, and rightly so, but fluffed it. Rohit saw the width and looked to go over cover, sliced it and survives.
squeezes this yorker-length ball back, Russell can't stop it cleanly
skiddy bouncer but way over Kishan's head as he looks to swivel back and pull. Beaten.
uses the depth of the crease to ease this down to third man
.and starts with a wayward delivery down leg. Wide
pulled but he splits deep square leg and fine leg. Got the impression that he didn't time it well, but was perfectly into the gap. Spun away on the practice turfs. Big over!
works this length ball from outside off towards square leg. The closest fielder - short fine leg - took a while to get there
swept besides short fine. Too flat, too quick and Kishan picked that away superbly.
fires this length ball at 116kph on middle, bunted to point
beaten on the pull, the short ball drifted away and would've missed off stump. KKR have reviewed! Umpire's original decision stays and  KKR lose a review  Pitched miles outside leg as well.
the reverse sweep over short third man. Picked the wrong'un so he was hitting this with the spin. Very clever
steps out and drills this down to long on
uses his feet, and sent over wide long on! Used all his muscle to tonk that. Didn't get to the pitch but that didn't matter
through his defenses! Full outside off, and it's the one that goes straight through. Kishan tried to defend it towards cover, but he played for the wrong'un

just over Kuldeep's outstretched hands! Drifted into middle stump, and Rohit drives too early. The ball holds off the pitch, and Rohit pushes it straight back. In the air, but just over the bowler's left hand. Close!
full on middle, and he's down on one knee to sweep it behind square. Deep backward square cleans up

short_text: Kuldeep to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: flighted full outside off, and driven well to cover. Straight to the man though. That could've been the breakout shot

pulled straight to Rinku at deep midwicket. He didn't have to move an inch. This isn't a magic ball. Right there for the pull but Surya didn't get any power or timing behind that. Surya has thrown away a strong start.
works this from outside off towards midwicket
goes for a mighty heave, misses. Wasn't far from off stump. Lost shape, bottom hand came off the bat handle. This was a googly too.
slow turn from length on off, dabbed towards point

short_text: Chawla to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: skids through from length, Rohit gets a thick inside edge to midwicket

short_text: Chawla to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: drifts in full from wide of the crease, turns this to midwicket
cuts again, still can't pierce the gap. Diving stop at backward point
reads the googly, cuts late but straight to point
gets across and sweeps this fiercely to the fine leg boundary. Too much flighted, drifted and spun back in to make it easy.
waits, waits and then drills this tossed up delivery to long off where Prasidh misfields to give away a second
wrong'un which Rohit lunges and dabs to the off side for a quick single
goes back and flat-bats this length ball to long on
full and wide, Surya fetches this from way outside, toe-ends the sweep to deep midwicket
works this gently towards square leg, presses for a second but Surya isn't ready

short_text: Narine to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: thick outside edge off an opened bat face, on the bounce to Lynn at short third man.
shapes to play the late cut, misses. DK fumbles and they scoot a bye
defends back. Narine took the pace off, spun back in from length as Surya played that
works this length ball from outside off towards midwicket
punches this straight to Curran at cover point
works this against the line to midwicket

what a strange way to go.  This was a loose delivery, a half-tracker on middle and leg, the ball took ages to get to Lewis, who was already through with the pull. The ball looped off the back of the bat after it hit the thigh and then to short third man. The missed opportunity doesn't cost KKR much.
inside edges a drive off the pad to cover, quick single pinched
too full outside off, Surya gets to the pitch and belts this over cover. Sparkling stuff. Enters the 400+ club this season with that
starts with a full toss and Surya says fetch that! Pulled to beat deep backward square leg. Fierce sweep

dropped by Kuldeep running back from square leg!  Prasidh beat Lewis for pace, took him on with the pull and got it high on the bat. Lucky to get away. Lewis was hustled and in no position to play that in front of square. Prasidh's first IPL wicket will have to wait
lovely shape away to beat the edge. Bounce, pace and carry. He's regularly bowling around the 140 mark
backs away and slaps this over point. Wanted to go over cover, lost his shape but ended up slicing it up and over. He'll take the runs
stubs this down to square third man where Russell puts out a superb dive to stop. Saved three runs
too close to the stumps at length, once again steers this straight to slip. Surya looking to be too cute here.
dabs this length ball to slip. Tried to pick the gap between keeper and slip. Brave

splits the gap, beats cover, beats Russell at long-off. Something about his effort suggested he didn't go full tilt, but I think even a fitter Russell would've struggled. So well timed. Too short and it was belted away.
touch short, he goes back and bunts this to cover
works this length ball down to long on
full, spins back in from off stump, defended back
short, but gets away with it as Surya thumps this straight to cover
on middle and leg, tucked towards square leg
right behind the line as he tucks this wide of midwicket for an easy single
half-volley on the pads, flicked to fine leg

short_text: Tom Curran to Yadav, FOUR runs
long_text: delicate dab wide of the slip fielder. Saw width and used it to ease this to the third man boundary.
squeezes this square drive to Narine at square third man. Just raced to him

short_text: Tom Curran to Lewis, FOUR runs
long_text: sees this in his half and belts this over cover. Almost as if Lewis had decided he'd just look to blast this. Not quite to the pitch but he swung this through nicely.

short_text: Tom Curran to Lewis, no run
long_text: squared up to beat the outside edge.  Lovely delivery first up. Moved away from length
sliced over backward point, sails over the ropes. Not much wrong with the length, quite full but Surya had enough width to throw his bat at that.
once again, good bounce off the deck. Gets bounce as Surya is hit high on the bat as he defends. Lovely from Prasidh
yorker-length on the stumps from wide of the crease, squeezed back towards the bowler.
width outside off, slashes this down to square third man
angles in a length ball, defended with soft hands
bunts it into the off side as they scamper a single. Good start, hit the deck hard at length, Surya got this high on the bat towards point
works this wide of midwicket as he jogs the single
wants the single, but is sent back. Rinku swoops in from point and stops
flayed on the up, to the right of point. Tracer bullet stuff. Picked the length, used the width and bang! Too short from DreRuss
opens the face to steer this length ball on off to Rinku at point
short of length delivery that shapes away from off, Surya is on top of the bounce as he defends
full and swinging away from outside off, beaten as he looks to squeeze behind point

Rahul ends on 95! An unbeaten, but valiant knock. It was short on off, and Rahul once again reverse paddles this over short third man. Ends the game with a 16-run over, but it was all too late. Rajasthan Royals win by 15 runs!
full outside off, and he shuffles across to the off side before reverse sweeping over short third man! Settles down on one knee, and sent over the infield

dropped by Unadkat! That's hurt his arm. It was the slower ball, on a good length, that he tried to muscle towards leg side. Took the toe end of the bat and came to Unadkat rather slowly, but he was expecting it to come quicker. Hits his wrist
full outside off, and Rahul backs away before thumping it over deep extra cover! His highest score in the IPL!
waist-high full toss way outside off, and the ball hits Rahul's shoulder. Tried to paddle it over his shoulder once again, but this time it didn't come off the bat. Ouch. Free hit as well
slower ball, full on off stump. Driven down the ground to long on

full toss outside off, and slapped over cover point. Gowtham's at deep point, and his jumping effort is good enough! The ball sticks in his hand, and that's quite an extravagant celebration. Puts his ball in the pocket and folds both arms in the deep.

deja vu! It's outside off, and Rahul once again shuffles towards that side before paddling it over short fine leg again. Does well to get his head out of the ball's way before playing it over his left shoulder. Kings XI need 32 off the final over
smart! Planned for the yorker this time, and moved to the off side even Archer bowled. It was a yorker, of course, and Rahul does a Marillier over short fine leg!

too much movement from the batsman, but still manages to clear mid off. It was slow outside off, and he walked across to the off side before checking his movement. Was in an uncomfortable position, but still manages to lift it over mid off
another yorker on leg stump, of course. Dug away towards midwicket, and no one's there in the deep. Archer has to go racing behind it, and does well to keep it down to only two
yorker just outside off, and dug away towards cover for a walking single
walks across to the off side and paddles it over short fine leg. Does well to get his head out of the ball's way
ends another over with a yorker! Just outside off, and the batsman can't put it away. Just misses the bat's under edge, and goes through to the keeper
goes for the wide yorker outside off, and the reverse sweep does not come off. He did get bat to ball, but the shot comes off the bat's back. Trickles down to point
the cutter again, and this time it's short outside off. Mistimes this slapshot to cover, and Anureet stops the ball with a one-handed slider! Excellent commitment in the field
change up, and short on off stump. Stoinis backs away to make some room, and bunts it over Unadkat's head. Some work for long off, but he does well to keep it down to two
wide outside off, and even a full toss. But Rahul misses out. His slap towards point comes off the bat's toe end. Lucky Unadkat
back of a length, but wide outside off. Rahul can't wait no more as he walks down the ground and meets this cutter from near his chest. Pulled into the gap between wide long on and deep midwicket
ends with another yorker. Straight at middle stump, and Stoinis does well to get bat to ball. Mistimed to backward point
too slow! And short as well! Stoinis has no clue when the ball would get to him. Completed deceived as he tries to swipe at it. Just 95kph
another yorker on off, and dug away to mid off. They want the quick single though, and it could be dangerous! But the fielder misses the direct hit. Rahane the man at mid off
full outside leg stump once again. Successfully pre-empts Stoinis' movement to the leg side. Can only squeeze the yorker away to mid on
full outside leg, expecting the batsman to back away. Aimed at his toes, and all he can do is clip it towards deep midwicket
back of a length on middle, but angling into the batsman. He backs away, and muscles it towards deep midwicket
change up again. On middle stump, and comfortably flicked off his pads to square leg
slower ball, but outside off stump. Big wind up from Stoinis, but he's through his cut shot too early. Mistimed to cover point. Stoinis is disappointed to have missed out
width offered outside off, and cut hard behind square. Man at deep backward point manning that region
toe-ends it! Full on off, and Stoinis comes charging down the ground. Tries to drive towards cover, but takes the edge to short third man
back of a length outside off, and tapped to cover off the back foot. Gets off strike
good length on off, and whipped off his pads to the midwicket region. Calls nice and early for the second run, and therefore completes it in a flash
slider outside off, forced down to long-on for one
legbreak, short and outside off, punched through the line to long-off
back of a length and skids through outside off, cut to sweeper cover again
