shorter and spins away outside off, chopped wide of sweeper for two
tossed up slower on middle, defended back
Stoinis shapes for the sweep, Sodhi drags this legbreak shorter and outside off, swatted away to square leg
113.4ks short ball outside off, Rahul picks the change-up and hauls a pull between deep midwicket and wide long-on. Rahul brings up his fourth fifty of the season
slower bouncer outside off, glided to third man
back of a length on top of off, punched back to Anureet

short_text: Anureet to Axar Patel, 1 run, OUT
long_text: full and wide, dragged off the inside half to wide long-on. Another slower ball, Axar can't manufacture his own pace and he risks a second. He is late, and eventually dishes out a full-length dive. Binny throws it to the keeper, who takes the bails off. Is the bat on the line? Or is there some part behind the line? No conclusive evidence. Tight call for the TV umpire. Bardue rules Axar out. Excellent throw from Binny: right on top of the stumps

short_text: Anureet to Axar Patel, FOUR runs
long_text: 110.8ks, back of a length and outside off, Axar reads the change-up and smears it away to the midwicket boundary
slower bouncer on leg stump, pulled to the left of long leg
tossed up on middle, flicked to deep midwicket
fuller on off, driven to deep midwicket off the front foot
back of a length and spins in, chopped to cover
tossed full on middle, driven down to long-on
forward and worked with the break to square leg
sharp offbreak, starts outside off and rips back in, storms through Rahul's gate but beats the off stump as well as the keeper. It raises a puff of dust from the surface

Rahane dives forward to snag the catch and send Tiwary back. 143kph, good length on off and but the ball sticks in the surface. Tiwary closes the face early and lobs a catch to cover off a leading edge
Rahul gets on top of this short ball outside off and cuts to sweeper
flicked off the pads in the gap at square leg for two
full on the pads, clipped to fine leg for one more
shorter and outside off, jabbed straight to point
full and straight, tucked away to deep backward square leg
Rahul presses forward to this full legbreak and eases it to sweeper cover
slider, Rahul falls over the flick and wears it on the pad
shimmies out, adjusts to this short googly, and nudges a singke to the leg side
quicker and flatter on off, Rahul ventures a reverse-sweep and deflects it over Rahane at slip off the forearm
loopier legbreak outside off, Tiwary collapses his back leg and drives inside-out to wide long-off
nice and full outside off, Tiwary stretches out, meets the pitch, and rolls out a sweep between deep midwicket and deep square leg
quietly turned with the incoming angle to the leg side for one
drifts in and spins away, dabbed into the covers
dangled up outside off, not much turn, driven through the line to cover
back of a length and skids in on middle and leg, Tiway hangs back and forces it down the ground
very full and outside off, squeezed away to sweeper cover's right for a double
long-hop outside off, Rahul jumps onto the back foot and nails a pull between deep midwicket and long-on. Duly put away

Sodhi has Shane Warne applauding from the Royals dug out. Tossed up and breaks away outside off, Nath clears his front leg and looks to mow it over midwicket against the turn. He can only send a leading edge to long-off. The asking rate has shot to 10.36
full, drifts in towards off and spins away, defended off the back foot
dropped short and outside off, Rahul leans back and cracks it away to sweeper cover
back of a length and turns away, Rahul punches off the back foot and finds backward point
loopier, full on off, spins away, Rahul gets forward and smothers this legbreak
googly, spins back in on a fourth-stump line, hastily chopped to backward point off the back foot
good length on off, and punched off the back foot to mid on. He'll keep strike.
full on off, but he takes a big stride forward across of stump. Shows all three stumps, but manages to sweep it to deep backward square
uses his feet, and drives inside out past cover! Wide long off racing to his left, but his diving effort just isn't good enough! Stylish stroke
full on off, and Nath takes a big stride forward to defend. Firmly played
back of a length on off, but angling into his body. Worked off his pads to wide long on, and enough time for Nath to come for the second run
full on off, and he comes down the wicket to drive through the cover region. Deep extra cover's there
tries to reverse sweep, but misses! Full outside off, and going straight through again. Low take by Buttler!
good length on middle, but the legbreaks gives the batsman the chance to free his arms. Mistimes a cut to the man in the deep
beaut! A leg spinner's dream ball. Drifts and lands on leg stump, and then turns across the batsman's bat. Taken by Buttler from outside off
too short on middle, and turning across the batsman. Goes deep into his crease and mistimes the pull to deep midwicket
good length on off, and zipping through again. Tries to defend, but taps it towards the leg side instead

bat-pad, or pad-bat?! Full on off, and zipping straight through. The batsman tries to defend, and hits his pad first, perhaps. Sodhi wants to review. Interesting. It's definitely pad first, but is it turning away too much? Yes, just too much. Missing off stump by a whisker!

low full toss outside off, mistimed to cover, and Rahul's halfway down the wicket. The fielder picks up and has a shy at the striker's end, but misses completely. Direct hit and the batsman would've been gone! Rahul choosing to live dangerously
crunched through cover! Full outside off, and what a delightful shot from KL Rahul. Shuffles onto the front foot, and simply drives through the ball;s line. Perfect placement.
full just outside off, and meets the drive on the full. Finds the man patrolling the cover region though
full on middle and leg, and Rahul tries to drive towards mid on. Takes the leading edge towards mid off instead
full, and on off stump this time. Perfectly timed straight drive from Rahul, but Stokes gets his left hand to it. Parries it towards mid off
full and wide outside off,  and Rahul reaches at it to slap it over point. The ball was past the tramlines anyway, so he had to stretch slightly more
back of a length on off, and angling across his body. Fended away from his body off the back foot towards cover. Good end to the over from Unadkat
back of a length on off, and that's been chopped to short third man for a quick single
back of a length, but slow once again. Taps it towards cover off the back foot
slower ball on middle, and he flicks it off his pads to deep midwicket. Played with soft hands
back of a length on off, and he tries to nudge it towards the leg side. Takes a leading edge, though, and files over the slip cordon to third man. Two chances in two balls!
takes the outside edge, but no slip in place! Full on off, but angling away from him. Tries to drive, and induces the edge. Races down to third man
back of a length outside off, and shaping away from the batsman. Opens his bat's face and plays it square to point
back of a length outside off, and cut smarly to cover point. Misfield, however, and that's what allows him to take the single

short on off, and Karun goes for a wild swing. Pulls it towards the leg side, but slices it instead. In the air for ages, and Unadkat at long on needs to compose himself. Takes it well before crashing to the ground!
back of a length on off, and Nair tries to work it towards the leg side. Mistimes it, and the ball ricochets onto his own pads
back of a length on middle, and he clips it off his pads to deep backward square. Enough time to walk across for the single
back of a length outside off, and he easily carves it off the back foot to cover point
full outside off, and driven off the front foot. Hit well, but finds the man at cover again
full, outside off. He checks his drive towards cover, but calls for the single anyway. Could've been close, but the fielder misfields
loose ball! Waist-high full toss outside off, and he flat bats it past the non-striker to long on. Lucky to get away with only one
back of a length outside off, and Nair whips it towards midwicket off the back foot

two-ball duck! Perfect offspin from Gowtham, and that crashes into leg stump. It was outside off, but wild turn into the batsman. Tries a big heave towards the leg side, but the ball sneaks through the big gap between bat and body
full outside off, and he takes a big stride forward. Crunched to cover

stumped! Down the leg side. It was full on leg stump, and Gayle came charging down the wicket. The ball angles down leg, and Buttler's excellent behind the stumps. Quick to remove the bails, CHG has to go!
slapped over point! Short outside off, and Rahul slashes this hard and away from his body. Top edged, but still goes to the point boundary. Archer's pace hurts his own bowling
full on off, and Rahul makes some room this time. Lifts it over the infield, and although the bat turned in his hand, the shot had enough power to clear the infield. Binny goes chasing after it
back of a length, and outside off again. Too close to Rahul for any off-side shot. Taps it towards cover point with the bat's open face
back of a length just outside off again. Rahul shuffles onto the back foot and opens his bat's face. Played to backward point
back of a length just outside off, and Rahul rides the bounce to defend it with soft hands
short outside off, and he's happy to cut it to point. Walks across to the other side to get off the mark
good length outside off, and Rahul tries to be cheeky. Backs away and attempts a late cut, but can't beat short third man
full on off again, and Rahul comfortably drives off the front foot. Stopped by cover once again
full on off, and he caresses this drive to cover. Packed infield on the off side
inside out over cover! Full outside off, and he comes dancing down the wicket before lifting it over the infield
big appeal! But turned down. Keeper says impact's outside off, so they choose not to review. It was full outside off, and Rahul tried to sweep it square. Hit his front leg
quick, and on a length outside off. Tapped to cover off the front foot
Holes out to Karun Nair at long-on. Very full on off, another knuckle ball, Unadkat ends up skewing it to Nair at long-on. Tye is now the top wicket-taker in IPL 2018 with 16 wickets
slower short ball outside off, 106.6ks, swiped away to deep square leg
Lomror jumps across off, meets a middle-stump full-toss and scoops it right over the head of short fine leg
First-ball duck for Archer. 114.3ks slower full ball on off, Archer ventures down the track and slices this knuckle ball to Tiwary at long-off
back of a length and slower outside off, flapped to long-off

loopy full-toss slanting away outside off, knuckle ball, Stokes is forced to reach out for the ball. He loses his shape and ends up toe-ending a catch to Ashwin at extra cover. Tye kisses the black band on the side of his jersey
rounds out the over with another slower one, 116.4ks outside off, Lomror swings early and misses

slogged from outside off to deep square leg. Lomror chances a second. Rahul takes it on the half-volley and whips the bails off. Lomror dishes out a full-length dive and makes his ground. The desperate dive saves him
the free-hit ball is a yorker outside off, skids past the outside edge and off stump
Stokes steps out, Mohit spears a high full-toss above the waist, spliced down to long-off. Tight call, considering Stokes was down the track
slower short ball outside off, dragged away to deep midwicket
116.4ks back-of-the-hand slower ball, beats him in the channel
slower bouncer, Lomror is early into a pull and only collects fresh air

overpitched and outside off, Stokes stays beside the line and drills it down to long-off. Stokes wants two, the throw is to Tye, who gathers it and takes the bails off. Binny stretches, but is caught short by an accurate throw from his Karnataka team-mate
Binny steps out, change-up, short and outside off, the batsman leaps and chops through covers
slower ball on middle, 112.1ks, waits for the ball to arrive, then nudges through midwicket
pitched up on off, right in the slot for Binny. He gets underneath the length and hoists it over long-on for six
short and angling across off, Stokes throws his bat at the ball and scythes it over backward point
on a good length and outside off, opens the face and glides it to point

very full and darted in from wide of the crease, Stokes hangs back to this full offering and plays around his front pad. Umpire Erasmus shoots down the lbw appeal. This seemed to be heading down leg. Ashwin decides against a review
skidding in from wide of the crease, jabbed to wide long-on
back of a length and outside off, carved to point
short legbreak, chopped to point

Buttler ventures down the track, but misses hie leg-side swipe. After seeing Buttler use his feet, Mujeeb drags his length back and gets it to slid down leg. It beats Buttler, keeps low, and Rahul takes the bails off. Buttler falls for a career-best 82. Two wickets in two overs for Mujeeb
shuffles across off, and sweeps to deep square leg
pushed through quicker, hit down to long-off

Nath runs in from long-off, dives forward, and shells it. Carrom ball, on middle, swerves away, Buttler goes for a loft, slices it and gets away. Tiwary was running back from short extra cover and perhaps thew Nath off
skidder outside off, chopped to the off side adjacent to the pitch
fuller on middle, worked to midwicket
chopped away to deep point
Stokes welcomes Ashwin with a muscular hit. Fullish and outside off, he jumps outside leg, and flat-bats it past the right of Ashwin. Bam!
dragged down outside off, Stokes rocks back and hauls a pull to wide long-on
full on middle, bunted down to long-on
slid in at off, inside-edged behind square on the leg side
Mujeeb puts Samson out of his misery. Pushed through flatter on off, Samson aims to slog it over midwicket. Instead, he drags it much straighter to long-on for 22 off 18 balls
tossed up slower and higher on off, dragged off the inside half to wide long-on
wide of the crease, skidding in at off stump, forced back past the bowler
full on middle, but legbreak again to end the over. Played with soft hands towards cover, and Samson takes off for the single. Time out as well
more air this time, but too wide. It pitches outside off, and spins further away, which Samson has no problem in putting away. Cut past the infield! Fifty partnership as well
good length on middle and leg, but spinning across Buttler. Pushed off the back foot to the mid-wicket region
good length on leg stump, and whipped off his pads to deep midwicket
good comeback! Flight and drift outside off, and as Samson tries to defend, the ball turns away from his bat
flat-batted over Ashwin! Short on off, and Samson goes deep into the crease. Opens his stance, takes his front leg out of theway, and sends it into the long-on boundary
wild swing! But misses Samson. Misses KL too. It was full outside off, and he tries to slog it over Mujeeb. Samson looked for the release shot, but played it down the wrong line
full on off, but Buttler shuffles across to the off side and smothers it to midwicket. Wants the second run, but can't
stays low! Outside off, but turning into the batsman. Hurries onto him, and does well to push it towards cover
overpitched on off, and tapped to the midwicket region off the front foot. Guides it into the gap, which allows Buttler to get back on strike
fuller outside off, and Samson displays little footwork. Simply opens the bat's face and glances it to backward point
good length on middle, and angling into his pads. Buttler goes deep inside the crease and punches it to long on
tossed up, but very wide outside off. Forces Buttler to reach at it, and all he can do is carve it to the man at point
drops the length this time. It's wide outside off, and cut furiously to the man in the deep
tries something new, but doesn't come off! It was fuller outside off, and Samson shuffled across to the off side to paddle it fine down the leg side. Doesn't come off
good length outside off again, and spinning away from Buttler once more. Opens his bat's face and plays it towards cover point. Gap there to exploit
good length outside off again, and spinning away from Samson. He stays on the back foot, and whips it off his pads to the midwicket region
good length on off, but it's the legbreak! Tentatively pushed off the back foot towards cover
another misfield! Add another free run to Royals' total. It was just outside off, and Samson played a delicate late cut to short third man. Mujeeb the guilty man
fuller outside off, and defended with soft hands towards cover. Calls early for the run, and completes it with ease

short_text: Axar Patel to Buttler, FOUR runs
long_text: poor from Tye! What should've been two, has now gone for four. It was punched hard off the back foot past cover, but Tye can't stop it at wide long off
short on middle, and going down the leg side. Buttler whips it off his pads to deep midwicket. Played gently enough, and that allows him to take the second run

short_text: Axar Patel to Buttler, no run
long_text: outside off again, and angling into Buttler. Punched to cover once again

short_text: Axar Patel to Buttler, no run
long_text: good length on off, and gripping & turning away from Buttler. Stays on the back foot and pushed to cover
wide outside off, and enough time for the batsman to back away. Cuts it late, but finds the man at point
good length outside off, and punched to cover. No run this time
loose! And punished. Good length, but outside leg stump. Buttler mistimes this fine down the leg side, while trying to drag it towards the leg side. Beats short fine leg!
good length outside off, and punched off the back foot. Deep extra cover, Mohit Sharma, puts in a sliding effort
good length outside off, but spinning into his body. Opens his bat's face and cuts it late. Enough time to sneak the single
back of a length outside off, and easily thumped down the ground to long off for a walking single. You'd think Buttler would be happy to get off strike
good length on off, and the ball comes into Buttler's body. Smacked down the ground to long off for one, and that's a very tidy over from Axar.

short_text: Axar Patel to Buttler, no run
long_text: appeal for lbw but turned down. Full outside off, and angling into him. Tries another reverse sweep, but hits his pad. Impact outside off for certain

short_text: Axar Patel to Buttler, no run
long_text: full on off, and Buttler attempts the reverse sweep. Mistimed to point. Excellent start to the second over from Axar

short_text: Axar Patel to Buttler, no run
long_text: gripping! Tossed up outside off, and turning away from Buttler's bat as he tries to work it towards cover

short_text: Axar Patel to Buttler, no run
long_text: straightens after pitching! Beautiful. Full on off, and Buttler tried to defend it straight. Played down the wrong line as the ball turns across his bat. Sharply collected by KL

short_text: Axar Patel to Buttler, no run
long_text: full just outside off, and tapped to cover off the front foot
full on middle, and going straight through. Driven past the non-striker to long on. He'll keep strike
full outside off, and pushed towards cover off the front foot. Gets off strike
it's the legbreak! Good length outside off, but turning away from Samson. He tried to defend it towards cover, but completely misread the turn. Well taken by the keeper
flighted on middle, and turning into him. Flicked off his pads to short fine leg, and there's his fifty! Third in a row for Jos
good length just outside off, and going straight through. Tapped towards cover off the back foot. Tiwary stops
just outside off, and no real spin first up. Punched towards cover off the back foot
fuller on leg stump, and Buttler gets his toes out of the way before driving to the man at long on. Moves on to 48
full on middle, and Samson easily whips it off his toes to deep backward square. Wastes no time in getting off the mark
good length outside off, and he opens his bat's face to push it towards deep point. Gets Samson on strike

muscled to long on! The experiment fails. Full outside off, and he tries to send it into orbit. Got his front leg out of the way to connect with it, but the lack of pace does Gowtham in. Played too early, and easy for Tiwary in the deep
back of a length outside off, and he tries to cut it late! Almost chops it onto his stumps, clearly deceived by the change up from Stoinis. Was too close to his body for that shot anyway
back of a length on off, and comfortably clipped off his pads to the man at deep midwicket. They jog across
back of a length on middle, punched down to long-on
slower knuckle ball on off, 117.9ks, dabbed back to the right of the bowler
middle-stump yorker, jammed down to long-on
another slower ball, but Tye overpitches it outside off again, Buttler stands still and hoists it over extra cover for a one-bounce four
very full and sliding into the pads, Buttler takes this overpitched ball and shovels it with the bottom hand between midwicket and mid-on
back of a length and outside off, slower one, the batsman delays his punch and hits it to cover
pitched up and outside off - right in Gowtham's swinging arc - he launches it right over the bowler's head. Dismissive. The ball lands in Royal's dug out. And he holds his pose like a boss
hurled short and outside off, Buttler jumps off the ground and hauls a pull to deep midwicket
banged in short and outside off, Gowtham uppercuts it down to deep third man
Buttler feigns to back away outside leg, Mohit isn't perturbed, nails an off-stump yorker, squeezed past him
back of a length and wide outside off, Buttler reaches out, opens the face and glides it away in the gap at point. Finesse from Buttler
Buttler jumps down the track and throws Mohit off his line and length. Short and sprayed wide of off, off-side wide
just short of a good length and outside off, Buttler leans back and flat-bats it away but straight to cover
dug in short and outside off, seam-up, 135ks, the batsman arches his back and lets it go
back of a length on off, jabbed to point

Tye hoodwinks Rahane with the change-up! Knuckle ball, short and sticks in the pitch, Rahane does not pick the variation. He forays down the track and looks to ping it over the leg side. Instead, he skies a leading edge to extra cover
fired full on off, pushed up to mid-off for one
hip-high short ball outside off, short-armed to deep midwicket
seam-up, nice and full on off, Rahane stretches out and defends it back to Tye
follows it with a full ball on the pads, Rahane happily tucks it away to deep square leg
shortish and just a shade outside off, Rahane angles his bat and chops it away fine of third man for his first boundary
Rahane ventures down the track, meets a short one outside off, rides it out to point
Mohit hits a hard length - neither driveable nor pullable - on off, cramps the batsman for room. Fended off to the leg side
shorter and wider outside off, chopped to point
starts off with a back-of-a-length delivery outside off, sits up to be hit. Buttler obliges, swats it off the hips over midwicket
good length on off, and angling into Buttler. He punches it to Tye at long off. Will keep strike

short_text: Axar Patel to Buttler, SIX runs
long_text: width offered again, and allows Buttler to free his arms even more. Pure timing as he thumps it over extra cover on this occasion. Goes all the way!

short_text: Axar Patel to Buttler, FOUR runs
long_text: flighted outside off, and Buttler gives it the thrashing it deserves. Big stride forward, and driven inside out over cover
short outside off, and cut off the backfoot to cover. Continues to rotate his strike
full just outside off, and all Buttler can do is push it down the ground to long off
full outside off, and Rahane smothers it off the front foot towards midwicket for a single
back of a length and outside off, punched through the line to extra cover, where Tiwary throws himself to his right to stop the ball
pitched up on middle, hangs back and taps the ball to mid-on
Buttler shimmies down the track, Stoinis drags his length back on off, Buttler carries through with his shot. Punched it right past the bowler for back-to-back fours
angling into the pads, too full, Buttler twirls his wrists and simply picks it off behind square for four
full and moves away outside off, Buttler does not middle a drive, slices it away to the right of deep third man
floated very full and outside off, hint of outswing, Rahane reaches out for the ball with his hands and toe-ends the ball down to deep third man

and their season goes out the window. RCB all but out of the tournament. De Grandhomme walks across a long way and tries to whip it but the yorkers  angles into him and sneaks from underneath the bat to smash the stumps
advances down the ground and gets hit on the pad as he tries to heave it away to the leg side. Rolls into the off side off the pad
yorker, angled into his leg-stump, and all de Grandhomme can do is squeeze it out to long-on. They can't even attempt the second. Top work all around
slower length ball outside off, Mandeep walks across and paddles but straight to short fine leg. Just a single
tries the yorker again and ends up firing a low full toss that's whipped to the right of long-on. They take on the fielder to for a brisk second
excellent delivery to start off, a yorker that's dug out to long-on
squeezes a yorker to point
looks to hoick this over midwicket but gets an inside edge that rolls to the off side. They sneak in a single
drills this straight to Williamson at the edge of the ring at cover
thick inside edge to the keeper, but de Grandhomme risks the run and hares across. Saha's underarm flick hits the striker's end direct but he's in.
shot and wide outside off, Mandeep slaps this to sweeper cover. Rashid almost over-ran the ball there, but somehow manged to recover and fire the throw
almighty heave, gets a thick inside edge towards deep midwicket. Sid Kaul got that to reverse back in
belts this full toss down to long on.
steers this length delivery to Yusuf at short third man.
beaten again. Looked to smack the cover off that delivery, another legcutter outside off.
thick outside edge, streaky but he'll take the runs. Too full on off, he looked to dive but got the edge that squeezed between keeper and short third man.
looks to flay this legcutter but is beaten. Too close for comfort
slower length ball outside off, eased to third man

short_text: Rashid Khan to Grandhomme, no run
long_text: didn't pick this properly but somehow managed to get this back to the bowler. Sharp leggie there
googly that cuts back in to beat the thigh pad. Wide called, extra run

short_text: Rashid Khan to Grandhomme, no run
long_text: sees the flight, looks to slog again but lost his shape. In doing so, the backfoot was up in the air Smart grab from Saha, and he whips the bails off, but was the foot plonked back? Difficult decision for the third umpire. Just grounded I reckon. Very close

short_text: Rashid Khan to Grandhomme, no run
long_text: swing and a miss. Looked to go over long on, missed.

short_text: Rashid Khan to Grandhomme, SIX runs
long_text: goes again, clears deep midwicket again! Didn't quite get to the pitch of the ball, picked the googly and went through with it from outside off. Dhawan was quite a long way in. May have been in a better position to catch if he was at the ropes.

short_text: Rashid Khan to Grandhomme, SIX runs
long_text: he's muscled this over deep midwicket! You beauty! Stunning stroke. Length outside off, he just thumped it. Too much muscle, hit the triangles on the full
cuts back in to take a thick inside edge to short fine leg
through with the pull too early, hit his back and deflected wide of the keeper
drills this length ball to Williamson at the edge of the ring at cover
slower length ball on middle and leg, turns this behind square
chops this down to point but a single they'll get
slower and fuller outside off, works this down to long on again
belts this down the ground, on the bounce to Pandey at long on. May have flirted with the idea of trying to take this
pulled, and pulled well. A tumble at deep midwicket but Sid Kaul can't stop that. Boundary. Should've been no more than two
leading edge but lands short of Sandeep. He looked to work this to the leg side, closed the bat face early.
toe-ends a whip to the keeper, did it take the pad? No, umpire seems to signal it was off the bat. A very thin edge if ever there was
slower and fuller on the stumps, turns this down to long on. Sensible
too short again, punched to long off
slower length ball outside off, punched into the gap at deep point. Sliding stop by Rashid
works this length ball on middle and leg to deep midwicket
drifting in, this goes through, punched back. Half-stop from Shakib but they can't sneak in a run
rocks back and toe ends a pull to deep square
driven through the line to sweeper cover
touch short and drifting in, worked towards midwicket
driven into the gap at deep point
whips this from outside off towards deep midwicket
slower length ball on off, defended from the crease
pulled but this is an excellent stop by Yusuf at midwicket.
fuller on off, defended from the crease.
whips this uppishly towards square leg, Dhawan grabs this on the bounce. De Grandhomme would've been anxious
back of length on off, defended.
turns this length ball to square leg to get off the mark

this is a sensational delivery! Tails in late to hit CDG flush on his toe. Such a comprehensive appeal resonated by 40,000 fans in the ground. But SRH don't have a review! Good call from umpire Virender Sharma, though. Missing leg stump.

he's feathered an edge and RCB are on a freefall. Not the right length to pull, looked to fetch from outside off, and just got the bottom edge. The umpire didn't give it initially but raised his finger as he saw Moeen walking. Moeen's maiden IPL outing with the bat is a forgettable one!
shapes to pull, misses. Wasn't far from his gloves. Skiddy bouncer from Kaul
solidly defended off the backfoot
nearly chopped on! This one just shaves past off stump and beats the keeper to the fine leg boundary

short_text: Rashid Khan to Mandeep, no run
long_text: right to the pitch as he smothers this googly

short_text: Rashid Khan to Mandeep, no run
long_text: fizzing legbreak that beats Mandeep's tentative forward push. It's all happening in Uppal!
back-to-back wrong'uns  and AB's gone. Picks the googly, but too close for the cut. This keeps a touch low as AB chops on! RCB in real trouble

short_text: Rashid Khan to AB, no run
long_text: cuts back in sharply, AB played for the legbreak. Somehow managed to get some bat
sharp turn back in, cuts this towards point

short_text: Rashid Khan to Ali, FOUR runs
long_text: flays this to get a thick outside edge that beats short third man. Streaky but he'll take it. Don't think he picked the wrong'un
steps out and whips this over the infield to deep midwicket, Moeen off the mark.

leading edge and the catch has been taken by Yusuf at short third man. He's taken it one-handed! For a while it looked like Yusuf lost it completely, thinks its going over, eventually sticks his right hand out to pluck that. Kohli shaped to pull but was cramped for room and the ball looped up. Big strike, the match is alive!
lunges forward and dabs this with soft hands towards point
driven through the line to sweeper cover
drifting into middle and leg, turned towards the man coming in from midwicket
cut away to sweeper cover

short_text: Rashid Khan to Kohli, no run
long_text: reached out and then drives this to cover.
chops a cut to point, quick single

there's absolutely no spike on it, but Saha's brilliance down leg has made this look ridiculously easy. AB walks across to pull this short ball sliding in, and in doing so, missed the pull. Wide called.  Not out stays that way . SRH lose a review
dabs this gently into the off side for a quick single

short_text: Rashid Khan to Kohli, no run
long_text: lunges forward and defends back

short_text: Rashid Khan to Kohli, FOUR runs
long_text: dropped at slip!  Is that the game? Williamson lets this go through his hands. This was a thick outside edge as Kohli jabbed at this. What's worse? It races away to the third man boundary

short_text: Rashid Khan to Kohli, no run
long_text: back of length on off, punched to cover

has that been dropped? Might have dropped just in front. Seems like this one just stuck into the pitch. De Villiers chips this length ball straight back, and Sandeep dives forward but there's no catch taken
slower full ball on leg stump, 114.6kmph, flicked through square leg
short of a length outside off, punched away to sweeper cover
back of a length on middle, comes down the track and pushes it to long-on
turns it away towards square leg

oh, he's chopped it on. So the drop doesn't prove as costly. A legsidish slower ball, 113ks, just back of a length. Vohra doesn't pick the drop in pace and tries to whip forcefully. Swings early and gets an inside edge to the thigh pad, before the ball clips the glove as he completes the swing and then takes the bails out

short_text: Rashid Khan to Kohli, no run
long_text: a bit of spin away from him, Kohli moves across and blocks
slides it into middle and leg, and Kohli whips it away through midwicket for a brace

short_text: Rashid Khan to Kohli, no run
long_text: short of a length, tries to whip it away and gets hit on the high part of the bat
dropped. Rashid dropped this short and it sat up for Vohra who didn't entirely get hold of his pull. Kaul at deep midwicket goes at it reverse-cupped after getting around it but lets it pop out
pitched up on middle and off, driven down to long-off
turns it away towards square leg
dipping fuller ball outside off, squeezes it out to mid-on for a quick single
short outside off, works the pace to run it down to third man
fullish around off, tails in a little and finds the inside of his bat as he drills it towards mid-on
flicks a length ball off the pads through midwicket
short of a length on off, opens the face and runs it towards point for a quick single
advances down the ground and heaves this after meeting the pitch through midwicket. Rashid sprints to his left from deep square leg but is a tad late in putting in the dive
fullish length, slid in on middle and leg, drilled away to mid-on
too close to cut, and he shuffled across as well, and that results in an outside edge that runs away to third man. Expensive over
down the track, right to the pitch, and smoked over long-on. Overcompensation from Shakib as he flights it up too much
short of a length, Kohli stays back and just jab it through deep midwicket with a full-blooded pull
full and curving in on off, driven to short cover
pitched up on off, driven to cover
fullish around off, pushed solidly towards extra cover for a single
short of good length, a bit of nip away, punched to cover
good length outside off, dabs away to third man with an open bat face
hangs back in the crease and opens the face of his bat to third man
that's a spectacular shot. Brilliantly punched through cover. That's all timing and placement and poise. Just presents the full face of his bat to a back of a length delivery
short of good length outside off, Kohli walks across and drills towards mid-on off the inside part of the bat
full, slid in on middle and leg, clipped away through midwicket

that looks close and it's been given. Parthiv looks at his partner and then walks off, so review not taken. Might have been umpire's call, so perhaps a good decision to not review. Parthiv misses the sweep as this length ball spins in and pins him dead in front of middle
fullish on middle and leg, now he clears mid-on with a simple, clean swing
leg-side fuller ball, too easy for Parthiv as he gets down on the back knee and sweeps it through deep square leg. The fielder is stationed slightly backward and he can't get around it
non-turning length ball outside off, backs away and finds cover on the ct
flights it up around middle and leg, and Parthiv gets down on one knee and sweeps uppishly towards deep midwicket
length ball, absolutely shovels it straight over, and mid-off gets around to his left and makes a sharp save
switches over to a fuller length this time, and Parthiv drills it straight down the ground. Bhuvi tries to get a hand to it, and mid-on dives to his right but to no avail
now he finds more room and absolutely belts this back of a length delivery but picks out cover
shortish, some room but not a whole lot of it on offer, slaps it hard and chops it towards extra cover
short and angled across, Parthiv flays a cut to point
length ball on leg stump, Parthiv flicks in front of square leg and there are vast gaps there on the outfield
length ball on off, solidly behind it as he blocks
short of a length outside off, covers the line and blocks to backward point
fuller ball, barely lofts it over the bowler off the toe-end of the bat, mid-on runs back to gather it
length ball on middle and leg, tucked away to the left of mid-on
short of good length around off, stands tall and punches to short cover
short of a length outside off, rides the bounce and drops it in front of backward point
length ball that drifts down the leg side and gets past the batsman's attempted tuck

tries to reverse this length ball, but misses. The ball angles in from wide of the crease to hit him on the back leg. Looks like he's hit in line. Ball tracker confirms this would've smashed into off stump. The on-field decision was not out, so the decision has now been overturned.  SRH bowled out.

pulled to deep midwicket, but no timing or power. They turned for the second blindly, Kaul seems confident of having made his ground, but Kohli thinks its out. Looks like he's comfortably gone. Good gather from Parthiv.
full and straight on the stumps, kept out.
squeezes this full delivery down to long on

short_text: Southee to Rashid Khan, 1 run, OUT
long_text: mistimes a pull to midwicket, brain fade from Bhuvi as he turned for the second, Rashid was never going to get there. Kohli coming in from deepmidwicket had to watch out for the late spin, he collected the ball on the bounce and fired an accurate throw to Parthiv who did the rest

short_text: Southee to Rashid Khan, no run
long_text: steps out to pull but is beaten
trying to be too ambitious! This is a 146kph delivery that has cleaned up Saha's stumps. Full and angling in, he tries to ramp, misses and the off and middle stump take a knock.
gets across the stumps and whips this to deep square. He was initially looking to scoop this fine
backs away to play the upper cut, but is beaten for pace
in the slot and bang! Backed away to free his arms and loft it over mid-off. Clean

short_text: Siraj to Rashid Khan, 1 leg bye
long_text: pacy delivery, swing and a miss. Deflects off the pad to the off side, leg bye
flattens leg stump. Yusuf looks for an ambitious hoick but is beaten for pace. Maybe he was expecting a slower ball.
short-arm jab, picked the bones out of that but straight to deep square leg
even finer! Goes with the pull, gets a top-edge over the keeper's head. Poor from Southee. Too short again
helped over short fine. Too short, too much down leg. Easy
through with the pull too early, hits the shoulder and rolls to the keeper, they scamper a leg bye

slower length ball, Shakib gets across and sweeps this straight to Umesh at backward square leg. Big wicket under the circumstances. Made him fetch this, because he changed the pace, this bounced that much more to hit the top part of the bat to deny him the power to clear the infield.
pulled on the bounce to deep midwicket
thick inside edge onto the pad as he shapes to drive, rolls to cover for a quick single
slower ball, Shakib steps out and slaps this to long off
this was so, so close to the base middle. Shakib exposed all three stumps as he went across and paddled it wide of short fine leg. Brave
slower length ball, slapped to cover
picks the gap. Fetches the pull from outside off, split the gap between square leg and short fine
skiddy length ball angling in, hops across to tuck this square for a single

walks across and tries to heave it over. Had to fetch it from way outside off and playing from that far outside, it's always hard to middle anything. Skews it to the man at the deep backward square leg boundary. Umesh almost oversteps
short, pitches around leg stump, swivels and pulls to deep fine leg
this time he pulls this into the leg side and they take a single
slower full ball, carved away over extra cover. Effortless
back of a length, angling across off, looks to pull away to midwicket but ends up knocking it to the right of deep third man, where Vohra makes a diving save
too close to cut as Shakib misses and the ball goes over the outside edge
back of a length, slides across with the angle, Shakib stays back and whips it to wide long-on
short and spinning away, cut to sweeper cover
flat length ball on middle and leg, swept behind square leg
pushes this fuller one out to sweeper cover. And that's a fifth half-century for Williamson this IPL
floated up outside off, meets the pitch with a big stride across and slogs it against the spin from outside off. Clean over deep midwicket. Top shot
good length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
oh, dear! Another relatively high full toss. He's just lucky that wasn't over waist-height or this over could have yet become worse. Heaved away off the hips over backward square leg
too full and drifting down the leg side
good length outside off, stands tall and punches past extra cover but mid-off, who is slightly back, gets around it
leg-side length ball, poor line, helped along with the angle to deep fine leg
back of a length outside off, stays leg side of it and shovels it to mid-off
short of good length around middle and off, pulled along the ground to deep midwicket
back of a length, angled across on a fourth-stump channel, punched into the off side
was that too high? Deemed to be fine by the umpire but very close to being a no-ball. A high full toss, nudged towards short midwicket off the inside part as it doesn't come on
advances down the ground and swipes across the line with the ball angled across him
fullish length around middle and off, punches to the left of the bowler who fumbles as he tries to stop. Shakib wants a single but is sent back
short, pitches outside leg stump, and it's way too high
short, angles away and gets big, tries to get on top and slashes at it but the bounce is too steep
short of a length, backs away as it angles into him and steers through point
length ball around off, drops it into the off side
short and wide, another cut that finds deep point
sprays it horribly down the leg side and Parthiv, standing up to him, does well to dive to his right and stop it
slower ball, just back of a length, mistimes his push back to the bowler
back of a length, angling in on off, punched to extra cover
too short and too wide, luckily for him, Shakib finds deep point with his cut
short around off, RCB keep bowling there and it's going to release a lot of the pressure they've built up, flayed through backward point
walks across and pummels this short of a length delivery straight back at Chahal, who gets a hand and half-stops it. Recovers and gets to the ball quickly to make sure it's a dot
short, wide, moves across and crunches a cut to cover. And he has overstepped
length ball, spinning in on middle and leg, helped along to fine leg
length ball, spins away on off, shuffles across and whips it to midwicket

that's much better. That's beautifully done, in fact. Draws him right forward by floating it up but makes sure to take it away from his off-stump, causing him to stretch forward and lose balance. Parthiv takes the bails off. Has Williamson slid the foot back in? Yes, he has
too short again, Chahal isn't finding the right lengths tonight, Williamson swivels and rolls his wrists over a pull through midwicket
short, spinning away outside off, chases and pokes but makes no contact
flat and short of a length, swivels and pulls to deep midwicket
full on middle and leg, clipped between midwicket and mid-on
back of a length, straightens around off, backs away and cuts to cover
advances to a length ball and chips it straight over Moeen. Crisply-struck straight boundary
short ball around off, makes himself some room and cuts through backward point
length ball, spinning in on middle, tucked to square leg
sees lots of flight and advances down the ground but ends up yorking himself as the ball dies on him, and squeezes it out back to the bowler
closes the face early and gets a bit of a leading edge back down the pitch
floated up on middle and leg, clipped away to the leg side
spins in from a back of a length, opens up and cuts to the third man region

ah, that's tame. Chips a length ball straight into the hands of short cover. They go upstairs to check the front foot, and he seems to have done alright there. Chahal gave it just about enough loop and landed it around middle, Pandey cleared the front leg and simply gave Kohli some catching practice
short, swivels and pulls to deep midwicket
uppish but just wide of square leg. Excellent running to come back for the second
too short, he pulls to deep square
spins back in to beat his tickle, rolls wide of Parthiv who hares across to stop
flatter and fuller on off stump, worked to midwicket
steps out and turns this back to the bowler
touch short, whips this to deep square
slider on off, whipped across the line to long on
punched back, Chahal misfields to concede a single
well bowled!  steps out but Chahal cleverly shortens his length, defended back
hint of width, driven through the line to deep cover
steps out and then lunges a little more to defend that back
tossed up on off, eased to long off
gets on top of the bounce and punches to point

pulled straight to Southee at fine leg!  This was an effort ball from Siraj, Dhawan picked the length early and swivelled to pull, but he was looking to clear the long boundary, didn't get it off the middle. The local boy has given RCB a reason to cheer

short_text: Siraj to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: right into the blockhole, squeezed to Moeen at cover

short_text: Siraj to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: beaten as he looks to slash this one! Too close to play that
angling a length ball into middle and leg, whipped to deep square
short of length on off, Dhawan drops it gently into the off side for a quick single
turns this off his hip to midwicket, another quick single
whips this length ball from outside off to square leg. There's a direct hit at the bowler's end from Umesh but Williamson is in
angles into middle and leg, whipped into the gap at deep midwicket. Super running
slower and fuller outside off, KW gets to the pitch of the ball and  creams this between cover and mid off.
fuller and closer to the stumps, defended into the leg side for a quick single
back of length on off, punched to mid off
looks to help it fine but misses. Wide called, on the bounce to the keeper
full and close to the stumps again, eased down to mid on
charges down the pitch but sees Umesh shorten his length, just taps it gently into the off side and scampers a run
closer to the stumps again, eased wide of point
this one keeps a touch low as he hops back to defend this length ball, rolls back
skiddy length ball on off stump, dabbed behind square on the off side
steers this length ball on off to square third man

short_text: Southee to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: driven uppishly but on the bounce to backward point.
slower length ball, punched to square third man
gift of a delivery first up. Too full, drifting into the pads. Was he searching for late swing? There was none here and Williamson tickled it to the fine leg fence to get off the mark

Cleaned up,  the middle stump has been flattened! This is a top, top delivery. Angles in a cross-seam delivery length from wide of the crease, this may have nipped away ever-so-slightly as Hales looked to play across the line. Missed it to see the stumps pegged back.
steps out but mistimes this pull from outside off to deep square

short_text: Southee to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: driven firmly but straight to extra cover
the extra ball, a cruel one too, has been lofted through the line over mid off. Length on off, Hales went through to clear the infield
drives this low full toss straight to mid off

short_text: Yadav to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: thumps this short delivery to the midwicket fence. Too short, Dhawan picked the length and pulled it in front of square
yorker-length on the pads, Dhawan overbalanced as he misses. Poor call from umpire Virender Sharma. Flicked the pad.

short_text: Yadav to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: squared up by a length ball that nips away slightly from middle, Dhawan's right shoulder is visible to the bowler as he defends

short_text: Yadav to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: driven on the up but straight to Vohra at cover point. Not much room to drive

short_text: Yadav to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: slants a length ball across Dhawan, who defends to the off side
pulled away but there's protection at deep square. Good first over from Moeen

short_text: Ali to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: slides one back in towards middle and off, defended to short cover
shaped to play a slog sweep, lobbed off the pad to short fine leg. Moeen got away with that
backs away and cuts this tossed up delivery straight to point.
drifts into middle and leg from around the stumps, worked wide of midwicket
flatter one on the stumps, punched to long on

that's the win! Low full toss and he smashes it through to the extra cover boundary and celebrates with a fist-pump! The Holkar Stadium is roaring. They've been chanting his name all through the death overs but now it's an incoherent scream of joy. The home team has won, and it's on the back of a sensational innings.
another two! Rahul expects the slower ball, he holds his shape, nudges it to the left of deep square leg and catches the fielder dozing
what a strike! He stares down a 147 kph length ball and smacks it straight down the ground. Absolute class!
targets the blockhole again, but Rahul clears his front leg and smears it to long-off. The crowd is going bonkers. They scream "Ra-hul! Ra-hul! Ra-hul!
slower ball on middle, Stoinis blocks
back of a length on off stump, Rahul comes out of his crease to try and nudge it through midwicket but ends up getting a leading edge through cover. Highest IPL score for Rahul

around the wicket and it doesn't work! It just doesn't work! Rahul is batting on another level. He sees the length earlier than he should. He can only see the gaps. And so his backing away and cutting the ball between point and short third man is academic really

shifts over the wicket and is sent over the fence at long leg! Rahul has been starving himself of runs just so that he can feast in the death! All through the middle overs he's been dabbing the ball for singles and twos. And now, at the pointy end, he's swivelling on the back foot and pulling short balls to oblivion

full and outside off, Rahul slams it to deep cover and they pinch a couple again. This is super work from Kings XI, assuming Stoinis has stretched far enough to make his ground at the non-strikers. And he has. This is a small ground, people, and these guys are absolutely stealing doubles.
backs away and carves a 118 kph back of a length delivery on off stump to the sweeper cover
works it right in between midwicket and long-on on the boundary and that placement earns him a second run.
yorker again, at 146 kph, Rahul digs it out to cover and wants a new bat. Some serious heat on these deliveries

upper cut to the fifty! Indore is screaming his name and he responds with one of the shots of the match. The pressure is mounting, he has chosen to ignore it expressly so he can bat through the innings. Now he sees a bouncer outside off, he senses a chance to get under it and ramp it over the boundary
nails the yorker this time at 145 kph, Stoinis jams a straight bat down to find a single at long-off
that's a timely strike! The bowler searches for the blockhole and overpitches. The batsman stands perfectly still and laces it through the covers.
flicks the back of a length delivery at 110 kph to deep square leg. Good hustle to get a couple
another slower ball, looping up and dipping in towards the base of off stump. Stoinis winds up but gets another inside edge to short fine leg
meets the slower ball out of his crease again and pulls it down to deep backward square leg
walks out of his crease and whips a full delivery from outside off to the right of long-on
sweet drive through point, leaning on his front leg, getting close to the good length ball outside off and treating it exactly as he would in a Test match.
looks for the blockhole at 140 kph, Stoinis clears his front leg and inside edges his slog to square leg
short ball at 114 kph, Rahul pulls it to deep square leg
full and outside off, Rahul drives to deep cover

insists he has taken the catch and Samson might just have turned the game with a one-handed stunner! The on-field officials take it to the third umpire, but the soft signal is not out. First replays indicate the ball might just have touched the turf before Samson scoops it up. So Rahul can heave a sigh of relief and think about improving on that cut shot. He did make room to try and get the gap to the left of point. And almost managed it too.
direct hit would have had Stoinis! Rahane at extra cover has one stump to aim at. And only misses it by a clump of whiskers! Another slower ball from Unadkat throws up great action
goes around the wicket for a pitched-up offcutter which Stoinis defends, careful not to be sucked into playing the angle and popping a leading edge

flies past the keeper! These offcutters are getting some purchase tonight, enough to have Stoinis playing a loose shot, the bat reaching in front of his body, the feet going nowhere. A thick edge results, Buttler dives full-length to his right, but he has no chance
back of a length on off stump, Stoinis blocks with an open face
he wants to keep from giving Stoinis room, but in that effort, he bowls short and down leg and is wided
short of a length, straightening from middle, Stoinis whips it to mid-on
that's easy. Flights up a length ball with ample room. Stoinis has his nose under it as he pummels it straight over
Stoinis sees the shorter length and tries to cut but with no room available, gets beaten
floated up and turning away slightly outside off, Stoinis shuffles and keeps the bat inside the line
takes it away from his off-stump, and Rahul reaches out to drill it towards point
pitches it up outside his off-stump, Rahul reaches out for a drive to extra cover
shuffles across to a length ball and blocks

caught at the boundary! D'Arcy Short snaffles a smart catch at deep midwicket. A length ball around middle, Axar tries to loft it over the leg side but is done in by the lack of room. Skews it off the lower part of the bat to Stoinis who jumps back and makes sure to land just inside the boundary as he grabs it reverse-cupped
full and flat on leg, driven down to long-on
advances down the ground and drills it to cover
drifts down the leg side, and Rahul clips it off the pads to deep fine leg
length ball, drifts it in towards off, drilled into the leg side off the inside of the bat
angles across a back of a length delivery, he closes the face across the line and ends up skewing it off the outside of the bat back down the pitch
short ball that cuts into him, helps it along with a pull to deep backward square leg
back of a length on off, gets on top of it and punches down to long-on
length ball, beautifully done. Draws him forward and gets it to leave him off the deck very late as Rahul walks into the shot and gets beaten
short of a length outside off, opens the face to backward point
punched to mid-on for a quick single
length ball around middle, whips it away to deep square leg
ah, bad ball to get out to. Karun tries to fetch a pull from way outside off and gets an under-edge onto the stumps. Timely strike for Royals, ends a burgeoning stand

short of a length, lets it come on before tucking it to deep square leg. The fielders in the deep are at midwicket and backward square leg, and the batsmen push back for the second as they converge on the ball
length ball, darted in on the pads, too easy for Karun, who picks it up off his pads and launches it over backward square leg
full outside off, Rahul punchily slams it over the bowler's outstretched hand towards long-off
fullish length on the fourth-stump channel, whipped away to the right of long-on
length ball that slides in with the arm around middle and leg, blocked off the backfoot to the left of the bowler

oh, shot! Just steps out of his crease and he hasn't even got right to the pitch. But what he does is make sure to give himself enough room before launching it over extra cover with a free extension of the arms. Hits the boundary cushion on the full. Or has it? The TV umpire has multiple slow-mo replays to look at it. Eventually decides it's a six. Top shot
flat, back of a length, shuffles across to meet the pitch before whipping it between long-on and deep midwicket
short of a length on middle and off, sitting up nicely for Rahul who pulls hard to deep midwicket
short of a length, comes on with the arm around off, Rahul backs away and cuts through cover
fullish length ball, sliding on leg, tucked away to midwicket
that's some pristine placement. Short of a length outside off, Rahul waits and punches really late with an open bat face to beat backward point diving to his left

slower ball, short of a length, Rahul crunches a pull to deep backward square leg where Tripathi dives and nearly fumbles to push it away towards the boundary but recovers and does well to get a hand and pull it back
short of good length on a fourth-stump channel, Rahul punches and finds cover
back of a length on off at 121.6 kmph, punched through the cover and point region
slower ball at 117.1 kmph, drops it in front of cover and takes off for a rapid single, barely manages to beat the throw
shuffles across early and chops his cut at this short delivery
stands up tall against a shortish delivery outside off and knocks it down to long-on.
full and outside off, drives to long-off
full and outside off, he drives to cover's left
another pull shot, this time to the man at deep midwicket
keeps going short - perhaps he's worried Rahul too would stride down the pitch - but the batsman is happily slinking back to pull to the square leg boundary

leading edge but it finds its way through to long-off. Karun tries to come down the track, Gopal pulls his length back, the batsman plays against the turn, and what little comes off the pitch, produces a mis-hit
hangs back against the short ball on leg stump and pats it down to long-on
full and outside off, Rahul slices it to deep third man
shortish and outside off, Nair chops it down to third man
slower ball outside off and he thwacks it to short cover. Loads of sensational hitting tonight, most yielding no runs or wickets
nails the half-volley down the ground! In the slot on middle stump and Nair keeps the front leg away and presents the full face
holds in the pitch does this 139 kph delivery and Rahul has to keep his shape a second longer so that he can crack the ball through to the sweeper cover
fullish and slow and outside off. Nair hits it to cover
slower ball, on and around off stump, Nair picks it up rather late, tries to punch it down the ground. Makes no contact as the ball flicks the top flap of the pad and goes through to the keeper
looks for the gap past short fine leg with a pull shot, but can't find it
good length on off stump, defends
blocks the shortish delivery on off stump to point
walks out to the medium-pacer and works the length ball off his pads through midwicket

fumble by Gopal at third man, and so another beautiful delivery, pitched up, outside off yields a result the Royals don't like. Nair throws his hands at this too, gets a thick edge, and Gopal, running around on the edge of the boundary makes a mess

falls short of Rahane at second slip! Lovely delivery to the new batsman, hitting a good length, probing in the off-stump corridor. Nair pokes at it, gets an outside edge, but he's played with hands just about soft enough

straight to long leg! And it's a rip-roaring shot too! Agarwal picks the short ball early, gets inside the line and tears the leather off it with a pull shot. But he forgets all about placement, which is just fine for Stokes, Tripathi and the Royals
looks for the drive through cover, but he is into the shot too early and an inside edge takes it through midwicket
shimmies over to off stump and gets a short ball at his hip. Fine leg is inside the circle, so the pull shot is on. Just doesn't connect well enough
pulls a short ball from just outside off and that lack of room means the ball ends up at mid-on
144kph, waits for the good length ball on leg stump and turns it to square leg.
gorgeous on-drive as he fronts a 149 kph delivery and hits it with a lot of class
taps it behind square leg and pinches a couple as well. Good work from Rahul. Plays with soft hands and had a partner who was willing to put in a little extra effort. Karnataka boys going well.
goes for the short one, but it goes way over Rahul's head, and down leg too.
gets up off his toes to pull the short ball away to long leg

aaarrrgghh, screams Gayle as he absolutely wallops a short and wide delivery straight to point! Kings XI have ridden on the openers' performance in this IPL. And this early wicket is going to test their middle order. Lucky breakthrough because this looked like it would have made a hole through the boundary boards and gone off to Mumbai
149 kph! And it's thrashed through extra cover! Archer slots it in the hitting arc for the big man, who clears his front leg and creams it through the gap
shapes to cut a quicker delivery outside off and hits it to point
tosses it up wide outside off and Rahul drives to cover
shuffles across on off stump and scoops it over short fine leg!

reverse sweep, and it's done effortlessly. He knows Gowtham wil lbowl on leg stump. And that gives him a leg up. He knows a general area of where the ball will be, he knows third man is up, and he takes advantage
attempts the sweep with Gowtham firing it down leg. Doesn't connect
bounces over the stumps! Rahul tries to cut a ball that's way too full and gets a bottom edge. Buttler is in agony as he watches the ball bounce over leg stump
he is ever so good! Even with the offspinner wants to cramp him for room, Rahul backs away and cuts a ball on leg stump to the point boundary

oooh, this is a battle! Archer's angle from around the wicket, and his line of attack, going short and at the body, is not fun for Gayle. He backs away and blocks this with his bottom hand flying off his bat
backs away and carves the 137 kph short ball to the point boundary. A shot that is meant to dictate terms.
147.8 kph, short, a little wide, and it bounces over Gayle's cut shot. The big man is coming off second best
beats him with a peach! At 147 kph, this good length ball holds its line from around the wicket and try as Gayle might to block it, he simply cannot touch this
another very good short ball, angling into the body and always rising up on the batsman. Rahul is in discomfort as he fends it away towards square leg.
forces Rahul back with a shortish delivery on off stump. The batsman blocks it into the off side
tries to slap a back of a length ball that affords him room through point, but the fielder dives to his right and saves a boundary
full on middle and leg, Gayle nudges it to a short leg that Royals have put in place. Rahane knows he needs wickets.
fires it through on middle and leg and strikes Gayle on the pads. Big shout for lbw but it would have gone down leg
opens the face as he guides a good length ball on off stump, with the turn, to point
cramps him with a full delivery on middle, from around the wicket, Gayle blocks it
a gentle clip to long-on against a good length ball outside off

and a wicket seals what has been a top effort from Kings XI on the field. A slower ball again, and Unadkat holds no shape as he tries to pull. They try to steal a bye but a direct hit from Rahul catches Shreyas short of his ground
extremely full on leg stump, looks to reverse it and jams it out to point
swivels and pulls a short one but deep backward square leg moves to his left and gets around it
backs away to one that comes into him and tries to go over the in-field on the off side. Skewed off the outside of the bat and the ball lands in front of point moving to his right
slower short ball, loses shape as he swings early on the pull and gets beaten
full toss again. They're getting their yorker attempts all wrong here. Slammed down to long-off
dipping full toss on the stumps, squeezed out to long-on
full toss on off, swung away to long-on
over short third man. Slower ball again, it's back of a length. Shreyas opens up and skews it over the fielder off a thick outside edge
full around the fourth-stump channel, clears the front leg and carves it over the in-field to knock it a couple of bounces over the point boundary
beaten by pace and lack of room as he stays put in the crease and swings
short and wide, doesn't manage to get on top of it entirely as he slaps it to sweeper cover
dipping slower ball, a full toss that's been punched down the ground and beats long-on sprinting and diving to his left
short of good length outside off, punched to sweeper cover for one
length ball, angled into him, backs away and tucks it through midwicket
extremely full outside off, carved over the in-field to the right of sweeper cover who gets around it
slower dipping yorker, squeezed out through midwicket
slower full ball at 116.1ks outside off, not picked by Tripathi who presents the full face and just chips it in the air to offer an easy catch to mid-off
length ball on middle, punched to long-off
full on middle and off, clipped off the pads to deep midwicket
back of a length, tucked away from middle to midwicket
plants the front foot across for a sweep to deep fine leg

short_text: Axar Patel to Gopal, no run
long_text: backs away to a short ball and cuts late to backward point
length, curving into his stumps, punched away to the right of sweeper cover
short and wide, that's too much room, and Tripathi carves it away through the vacant third man region
short outside off, gets on top of the bounce and punches it to deep point as he beats the fielder in the circle to his left
back of a length, drifts into his pads, tucked to deep fine leg
short of good length, cuts in off the deck, and he backs away and drops it in front of short third man for a quick single
short ball that bounces uncomfortably in front of him. Tries to fetch a pull and gets a top-edge that settles into the hands of midwicket

ah, bad misfield at third man boundary from young Mujeeb. Gowtham slashed at the sight of a hint of width. Still not enough and he gets an edge that eventually gets to the boundary as Mujeeb over-runs to his right
drifts it away outside off this time, and Gowtham blocks off the outside of the bat
blocks this length ball that spins in extra and takes the inside of the bat into the leg side
length, spinning in outside off, tucks it away through midwicket for a quick brace
pitched up outside off, driven down to long-on
ah, down the leg side. Just back of a length and drifts and spins past his attempted flick

oh, beauty! What a delivery from Mujeeb. Top stuff from the legspinner. A googly that lands right on a length and draws him forward. Archer is unsuspecting and the ball spins right past his inside edge and clatters into the stumps

after a hundred swings and misses, finally an outside edge has been found. A carrom ball from Mujeeb, Buttler shapes to slap it away but ends up getting severely tucked up due to the lack of room and produces an edge
another swing and a miss. Oh, jeez, he's been done in non-existent turn here. Expects it to come into him but it simply comes on with the arm outside off
no turn again on this length ball, thinks of flicking but is forced to block back
short, wide, non-turning, reaches out for a cut and misses
makes room for a short of a length delivery and punches between long-off and sweeper cover
short and wide, backs away and cuts it to short third man
fullish on middle and leg, pushed back
short and wide and Buttler wallops it to the point boundary to bring up back to back fifties

the relay catch! Mayank grabs it at long-off, but he's overbalancing, he knows he will go over the boundary, so he lobs the ball over to Tiwary at long-on and it is seamless. It is poetry. It is very very good. And so Stokes has to go, after smacking a loopy old delivery on leg stump straight down the ground. The percentages were right. But Kings XI outdid him on two counts: Mujeeb followed his moving away to leg stump. And then Mayank stayed supremely calm on the boundary, leapt up to take the catch over his head, and then relayed the ball through at the perfect height to his mate Tiwary
rocks back and punches the quick and flat delivery on off stump through cover
backs away to flat bat a quicker delivery on off stump to long-off
ooh, that's good stuff. He plays the line - which is wide outside off - and unleashes a reverse sweep. With third man up inside the circle, it's an easy boundary
draws him forward on off stump and Stokes flicks to short midwicket
shimmies down the pitch to turn the ball on middle through midwicket
superb hit! It doesn't matter that he's staying back to a ball that's fairly full. All that power he has comes into play the moment he has room to work with and he creams the ball through extra cover
good length, on off stump, punches to long-off
on the pads and it doesn't spin as Ashwin wants it to. So Buttler can clip the carrom ball out to deep square leg
offbreak, on a good length on off stump, Stokes works it through midwicket
carrom ball first up to the left-hander. It dips even as Stokes stretches forward to reach it. Misses the flick and hits the pad.
rises up with the short ball aimed at his body and deflects it to long leg

bounced out! And so simply done too! Digs it in short. Gets it to rise up towards the batsman's shoulder. Doesn't give him too much room to swing the arms, but Samson chooses to anyway. And sends the ball right down deep square leg's throat

another dipping delivery - this time at top pace - and it messes with Buttler's timing. He has his front leg cleared away. Tye does well to change his line and keep it wide of off stump. As a result, the batsman has to reach out, and ends up mistiming a bunt to long-on
stands tall against a back of a length delivery and whips it to deep midwicket
draws him outside off with a good length ball and Samson, lunging in search of the ball, is beaten. Knuckle ball, gets a little extra kick
lovely slower ball, mostly because it dips on the batsman, and Buttler is unable to cope with the sudden change in direction. Tries to flick, but it goes off the pad and barely leaves the square
shortish on off stump, knocks it down towards short cover and races across to the other end
shortish and outside off, Buttler wants a single behind point, opens the face looking for the gap, but can't find it
presents the full face and the back of a length ball pings off it to long-off
full on off stump, drives to long-off

misfield from Ashwin at cover, which means a run-out opportunity goes a-begging! He rushes in, alert to the chance of a wicket, but it spins past his right and Samson, who was ball-watching, while his partner Buttler had raced off the blocks, finally ends up able to complete the run and get an extra
great connection, as he camps on the back foot, swivels with the pull shot and places it well to the right of the deep square leg fielder
that's at top pace, at 132 kph, and it's dug into the middle of the pitch. Buttler thinks about flat-batting it, but it gains too much height. Zips past his nose
they are setting up for the slower balls. Samson waits in his power position, feet apart, bat high over his head, and then pulls the slower short ball to long-on
gets up close and personal with another slower ball, this time on middle, and pulls to deep midwicket
picks the slower ball, holds his shape, waits until it is in his hitting arc outside off and cuts it away, nearly to the boundary at point. Some good work from Stoinis keeps it to two
back of a length on middle, punches it down to long-on
gently dabs a length ball towards the right of sweeper cover for one
short, backs away and reaches out for a cut to sweeper cover
whips this length ball from around off to deep midwicket
just back of a length, straightens around off, punched to sweeper cover
short of a length, straightening around the sixth-stump channel, punched into the covers from the crease

short_text: Axar Patel to Samson, FOUR runs
long_text: full and curving in towards off, gets a good stride forward and drives through cover, beats deep point to his right comfortably
drifts in towards leg stump, clipped away through square leg
too short, and he rocks back and cuts late through backward point, beats the fielder in the deep to his left
gives him a world of room by floating it up outside off, and it spins in from a length, giving him more leverage on the shot as he swings it over wide long-on for a big six
flat length ball on middle and leg, punched down to long-on

gets down for a reverse sweep and misses to get hit on the pad. Given out almost instantly but Buttler reviews. The impact could have been outside off. Spins in a little but this could just be umpire's call on impact. Nope, it's just outside, so overturned
short around off, backs away and cuts through cover

short_text: Axar Patel to Buttler, no run
long_text: backs away and cuts to cover

short_text: Axar Patel to Samson, 1 leg bye
long_text: gets down for a sweep but the length isn't quite right, wears it on the pad as it rolls away to short fine leg

short_text: Axar Patel to Samson, no run
long_text: back of a length, stays back and whips it against the turn between midwicket and long-on

short_text: Axar Patel to Samson, no run
long_text: length, sliding in on middle, drilled down the pitch off the inside of the bat
full and flat on off, driven to long-off
takes it away from him this time, and Samson swings and misses
pitched up outside off, pushed along the ground to long-on
length ball at 87.1ks, spins in at middle, flicked through midwicket
fullish, spinning in around the pads, whipped off them between long-on and deep midwicket
sliding length ball around middle and leg, drilled down to long-on
length outside off, minimal turn, and he opens the face to short third man
punches a back of a length delivery to long-off
pushes away from the body to a length ball and gets an outside edge to short third man

has that been taken? Yes, Chris Gayle with a forward-diving catch. That's as rare a sight you'd see but it's true. Superb take as well. Rahane backed away and was looking to force a cut, but the back of room meant a thick outside edge, which is met by Gayle getting down and stooping low with both hands. They're going upstairs to check but he seems to have done alright. Yup, fingers underneath it. That should be out
length outside off, meets the line and pats it away to square leg
short of a length on a middle and leg line, mistimes a pull to short fine leg

short_text: Axar Patel to Rahane, no run
long_text: gets down to sweep a length ball and the ball shoots over the bat past the off-stump
turned away to deep midwicket
moves towards the leg stump and tries to whip it away but the ball follows him and gives him no room as he is pinned on the pad. Comfortably missing leg
backs away to give himself some room on this short of a length delivery and punches it through wide of long-off
short of good length, minimal turn, stays back and whips it to the left of deep midwicket
switches over to a good length outside off, Buttler plays a late cut to backward point and they immediately take off for the single. Rahul takes the bails off, but a dive has saved Rahane
short of a length, spins away around off, whipped between long-on and midwicket
takes out the width but offers up the same length, and angles it into him as well, which allows Buttler to simply rock back and pull through midwicket. A horrific over from Rajpoot
that's awful bowling. Short and wide, and at Rajpoot's pace, it's a gift for Buttler as he opens up for a late slap through backward point
walks across for an ill-advised paddle to a back of a length delivery that's around two sets of stumps outside off. Needless to say, gets nowhere near it
short of good length, cuts into his middle stump, Buttler backs away and haphazardly drops it into the pitch
short outside off, sits up nicely for Buttler who smokes a pull through the vacant midwicket region
short of a length around off, tucked off the pads through midwicket
shortish, tries to heave a pull and mistimes it along the ground to midwicket
back of a length, punched into the covers
short of a length, sees a little room outside off, and punches through the left of cover for four

Short has holed out third ball. That's a poor shot from the batsman. Takes no time to suss out the offspinner and simply swipes. Ashwin flattens his trajectory and slides this into middle and leg. Short expects it to come on with the arm but the ball straightens and as a result finds the outside of the bat as he looks to slog and lobs to midwicket
floats it up a little and slides it into the pads again, turned away through backward of square leg
starts off with a fullish one that curves into his pads, and Buttler tucks it away through square leg
good length outside off, and bunted to long on for a single. Cheers all around! Mumbai Indians win by 13 runs!
back of a length on middle, and DK pulls to deep midwicket. Refuses the single
low full toss, very wide outside off. DK gets down on one knee, and carves it over point. KKR need a six, but all they get is a four
good length on leg stump, and DK tries to pull it. Tries to play it on one knee, but can't connect. Krunal appeals for lbw, and then asks for a review. Nah, it's going down leg
full outside off, and angling away from Narine. Tries to lift it over cover, but slices it to the man on the circle. DK has crossed to the other side though!
full toss outside off, and that's in Narine's arc! Thumped past the non-striker to the straight boundary. Long-on just a spectator

dropped at deep backward square! And goes for four. Another low full toss on middle, and that's been whipped off his pads. Duminy got under it, but messes it all up. The ball pops out, takes a bounce, and then goes for four. Kolkata need 23 off the final over
overpitched on middle and leg, and DK gets his front leg out of the way to smash it straight! Long on had no chance. Good use of the crease's depth
short! On off stump, and soaring over his shoulders. DK tries to pull behind square, but can't connect at all
low full toss on middle, and DK swings wildly. Hits his bat's inside half and goes to fine leg. Says no to the single
