waist-high full toss, and that's been drilled over deep midwicket! The umpire at square leg says it's a legal delivery. Was close. McClenaghan tried to get his fingertips to it in the deep, but the ball sails just over
low full toss on leg stump, but Karthik can't put it away. Tried to slog it towards the leg side, but the ball hits his front leg
short and wide outside off, but takes the pace off it again. DK crunches another cut, but the fielder at deep point came in there after the last ball
slower ball, wide outside off. DK winds up to hit it straight, but the pace (or lack of it) does him in. Under edges it to Kishan. Hardik asks him to hold on to the ball
good length outside off, and cut hard! Just past point, and beats the sweeper cover fielder as well!
good length on off, and all DK can do is defend it towards the non-striker. Tight line, and the batsman gives it the respect it deserves
full on off, and Narine backs away to muscle it towards deep midwicket. Gets off the mark
slower ball full outside off, and Narine's big wind up doesn't connect. Inside edges it to the keeper

what did that come off?! Yorker outside leg, and it's a really quick delivery. DK can't connect, and the ball comes off his boot. Kishan dives to his left but can't get his hands to it either. Important runs for KKR to end the 17th
full outside off, and DK carves it over point. Bends his knee to get under the ball, and then drives over the infield

back of a length on middle, but Russell makes a lot of room on the leg side. Pulls it towards the leg side, but Krunal takes a screamer! He's at short fine leg, but needs to race towards the square-leg boundary. Dives forward, and takes an excellent catch!
full outside off, and Russell almost gets under it. Drills it past the umpire, and long on does well to cut it off
cramps Russell! Aimed at leg stump, and with the batsman backing away, it's a perfect delivery. Russell tried to pull, but in trying to protect himself, he plays it back to Bumrah
slower ball, but wide outside off. It's a length delivery, so DK cuts it square to the man in the deep. Singles are fine for Mumbai
full on middle, and no spin this time. Russell takes a big stride forward and defends it back to young Markande. Time out
too wide outside off, and then spinning sharply inwards. Russell goes deep into his crease and thumps a flat-batted shot to the wide long-on boundary
good length on off stump, and Karthik makes some room to free his arms. Cut off the backfoot to the man in the deep
backs away before the ball was bowled, and Markande goes short on middle. Turns sharply into DK's body, and forces the error from the batsman. Hits his pads
good length on leg, and Russell clips it off his toes to square leg
full on leg stump, and straightens after pitching. Russell misses the leg-side tap, and it comes off his pads
back of a length on middle, and Russell flays a cut towards backward point. All he can earn is a single
offcutter that Russell can't pitch. It was short on off, and he had walked across to the off side. Hits his body, but rather gently, as he misses the leg-side whip
full on off, and that's been defended with soft hands. Cover's too deep, so they can walk across for another run
goes short outside leg, and DK wants to pull. He can't connect, and goes through to Kishan. What's surprising is the umpire doesn't call it a wide. Karthik is bemused
good length outside off, and angling away from Dre. He stands tall and punches it towards the gap near cover
full outside off, and he can't put it away. Mistimes the cut to point, who misfields himself, which allows DK to get off strike
good length outside off, and DK chops it down to the man at third man for a walking single. He'll keep strike
back of a length, and carved towards point
full outside off, and that's been caressed towards McClenaghan at sweeper cover

back of a length on middle, and Rana goes for a pull. It's been sliced though, and Bumrah gets under it at deep square leg! The ball was swirling in the air, so extra marks for that effort. KKR losing wickets in a clump once again
back of a length on off, and DK glances it down to third man. A safe way to get off the mark
back of a length on middle, but takes the pace off it. Tiptoes, opens his bat's face, and then runs it down to third man
full on middle stump, and driven with the turn to long off. They walk across to collect a single
good length on middle, and backs away to punch it towards cover
on leg stump, and it's the wrong'un once again. Defended off the front foot with soft hands

conventional legbreak, and that earns him the wicket! Straight to long off. Full outside off, and Uthappa plays it straight down the ground. The ball spun away slightly, and induced the shot from the bat's toe end. Markande makes amends after all!
full outside leg, but turning into his body. Gets down on one knee, and sweeps it uppishly to deep backward square
full on middle, and turning away from Rana. Sticks his bat out and taps it to point
fuller, on off and that's been driven to cover. A dot to start and a dot to end for Cutting. But four boundaries in the middle. Great over for the visitors
fourth boundary in a row! Short on off, but Cutting doesn't have the pace to trouble Uthappa. Takes his backfoot deep, and swivels a pull over short fine leg

crunched over midwicket! Good length on off, but Uthappa walks across to the off side and checks a pull shot over the infield. Placed to perfection, and what a way to get to your first IPL 2018 fifty!
good length outside off, and cut away furiously past the two infielders. No one's there in the deep, and that's the team hundred!
full on off, and Uthappa was ready for the slower ball. He walked across to the off side, and paddles this behind square. Beats the man at square leg, and the sweeper fielder can't cut it off either
on a good length, and pitching on middle stump, Uthappa backs away to cut it square, but can only find the man at cover point

full and wide outside off, but takes the pace off (123.8kph). Uthappa wants to drive it towards cover, but he's played it too early. Hits the bat's toe end, and goes over the umpire's head. Lands in no man's land
good length on leg, and the punch towards the on-side takes a leading edge. Goes through towards cover
slower ball, full on middle but angling across Rana. He tried to run it down fine, but the ball sneaks past his outside edge. Taken by Kishan on the bounce
back of a length outside off, and Uthappa can't resist to pull. Mistimed over the non-striker's head to long on
full outside off, and punched to McClenaghan at sweeper cover. A wild throw that hits Rana's bat but Lewis does well to back up

appeal for caught behind! But not given. Came off something, but not the bat. Good length outside leg, but goes over the top of leg stump as Rana misses the clip off his pads. Replays show it flicked his trouser
offcutter outside off, and he opens the bat's face to run it down to third man. Uthappa wants the run, but there's none on offer
slower ball yorker, but outside leg stump. Uthappa checks his shot, and eventualy whips it off his toes. Played over square leg, and no one's there in the deep.
sticks with the slower ball. On a good length and angling away from Rana. Mistimes the cut, but finds the gap on this occasion. Deep point cleans up
short on off, and angling away from Rana. Tries to cut it square, but off the bat's toe end. Trickles away to cover point
offcutter on off stump, and Uthappa comes inside the line of the ball to clip it off his hips. Played to deep backward square
good length outside off, but he starts off with the slower ball. Opens his bat's face and waits for the delivery to come to him, before glancing it to third man
freebie! Full toss on off, and Uthappa backs away to thump it over cover! Wide long off does not bother moving an inch
good length on middle and leg, and Uthappa makes further room on the leg side to punch it straight down the ground. Krunal gets his body behind it, and saves the single
yes, no, yes, no! Uthappa's safe though! Tapped towards point, and Uthappa wants the run. Rana says no, and he's forced to turn back. Does well to slide in before Kishan can dislodge the bails
wide outside off, and Uthappa makes room to cut. But can't find the gap as point pounces onto it in a flash
good length on middle, and worked off his pads towards deep midwicket. Good use of his wrists to direct it there
almost a yorker on off, and Rana digs it away towards midwicket for a walking single
way too wide outside off, and Uthappa leans into this one. Swats it over Markande's head, and the ball lands on the sightscreen!
picks the googly beautifully! Full outside off, and slogs this with the spin over deep midwicket! Sixth IPL batsman to get to 4000 runs. What a way to reach the milestone.
good length outside off, and Uthappa chooses to play this fine. Cut straight to short third man though
googly! Good length on middle, and turns into his body. Gets big on the batsman, so he wedges it onto his thighs
good length on middle, and this one zips through. Forced to stay on the back foot, and punched to mid on
full on leg stump, and he takes a big stride forward to meet the sweep on the full. Placed well behind square, and Krunal Pandya's diving effort just ain't good enough
worked off the pads past square leg's right
dropped short and sliding away outside off, that's ripe for the cut. Rana goes on the back foot and cracks it away to the left of backward point
skids on just a shade outside off, Uthappa camps back and punches a single down to long-on
tossed liberally on middle, full, Uthappa clears his front leg and launches it over Pandya's head and the sightscreen. Terrific timing although it was in his swinging arc
non-turning back-of-a-length ball just a shade outside off, tapped to cover
back of a length and angling away outside off from around the wicket, punched wide of midwicket
looks like a knuckle ball outside off, the batsman delays his shot and dabs to point
another lifter on middle, sails past the head, too high, and that's a wide
wide of the crease, bouncer on middle, fizzes past the helmet as Uthappa is late onto a hook
hip-high short ball outside off, swatted across the line to deep midwicket
back of a length and outside off, opens the face and dabs to point

Markande backpedals and drops a sitter! Pandya is shocked. Back of a length, slower ball outside off, this is more a short-arm flap as opposed to a short-arm pull. He drags it in the air, Markande does not have a stable base, and the ball pops out
short from wide of the crease, Uthappa's weight is on the front foot, the ball gets big on him, gloves it in the air but wide of the stumps
short and outside off, Rana is airborne as he scythes an uppercut up and over third man. Sails over the deep fielder for six
lifter outside off, Rana aims cut it away but is beaten by extra bounce
back of a length and outside off, chopped in the gap at point
back of a length and angling away outside off, Uthappa uses the angle and angles it down to third man
back of a length and angling across off, patted into the covers
overpitched and outside off, Uthappa stretches out and drives sweetly straight of mid-off. Hardik throws himself to his right, half-stops the ball
pitched up and sliding away outside off, closer to off this time, left alone
back of a length and angling across off again, left alone again
just short of a good length and outside off, Rana frees his arms and chops it hard to the ground, beats point to his right
back of a length and angling across off, left alone
picked off the pads to deep midwicket

Gill caught Pandya bowled Pandya. Hardik floats a slower offcutter outside off first up. Gill does not spot it. He is early into a drive and gets more height as opposed to distance. Krunal snuffles the catch at mid-off, has his hands aloft and roars Wakanda forever. Two wickets in three balls for Mumbai
McClenaghan hits a hard length on middle and leg - neither driveable nor pullable - punched back to the bowler off the back foot
The short ball finally works for McClenaghan and Mumbai. Chest-high ball on middle, tucks Lynn up for room. He still goes for the pull, hits it well, but picks out Bumrah at short fine leg
keeps it short, angling away outside off, just over the hips. Lynn waits for this length on the back-foot and swats it away to the midwicket fence
skiddy, short ball on the hips, pulled away past square leg for another four
short on leg stump, cramps the batsman for room, dragged away square of short fine leg
Make that 16 runs off the last four balls. Floated full and wide outside off, Gill is early into a drive but flat-bats it past the left of the bowler

Bumrah nearly chops Lynn into half! 142ks, back of a length and zips back in from wide of the crease. There's that sharp angle from Bumrah. Beats the inside edge, beats off stump, and beats a diving Kishan. Two fours followed by four byes. KKR won't complain
115ks slower, back-of-a-length ball outside off, Lynn delays his punch and hits it past the left of mid-off and short cover for back-to-back fours
back of a length and outside off, Lynn flashes at it and sends a thick outside edge between wide slip and regular short third man for four
wide of the crease, 136.4ks, bouncer aimed at Lynn's head, he ducks under it and lets it sail through to Kishan behind the stumps
142.5ks back-of-a-length ball, straightening away outside off, Lynn throws his hands at the ball but only collects fresh air. Encouraging carry to Kishan
Bumrah ventures wide of the crease, but this shortish ball holds its line outside off, Gill rides it down to deep third man for one
back of a length and wide outside off, in Lynn's swinging arc, slapped away fiercely but straight to point who has moved back in from the deep
McClenaghan brings out his hit-the-deck bustle. Banged in short on middle, Lynn arches his back and lets it fly through to Kishan
much fuller and on middle stump, Lynn, however, hangs back and taps it back to the left of the bowler
beats the outside edge, and the off stump! Back of a length, skipping away with the angle from over the wicket, Lynn hangs back, has a lousy waft, and misses
back of a length and into the hips of Gill, punched past the right of mid-on for one
back of a length and angling across off from over the wicket, dabbed through point with soft hands
full and wide outside off, and this time he inside-edges the drive towards the keeper's left. They steal the single. Mumbai Indians finish on 181 for 4
full toss outside off, but Hardik can't connect. The bat's gone flying too! Goes to the keeper on the bounce, who has a shy at the stumps. Misses! Hardik would've been gone
unlucky! The pace earns Hardik another boundary. Goes for the wide yorker, and Hardik's wild slash takes the bat's toe end. Goes between third man and the keeper this time
full and wide outside off, and Hardik attempts a expansive drive. The ball goes under Hardik's bat, but on the wide-line. The umpire calls extras
full outside off, and this time the slower ball has deceived the batsman beautifully. But the game's cruel, so Hardik will earn a boundary. Slices this drive over DK's head
slower ball, and angling across Duminy. With all his might, the batsman tries to slog, but can only find the man at long on
Short, and Duminy can't pull it away! Duminy wants it to be a wide, but the ball went over leg stump. Excellent!
good length outside off, and Duminy shuffles across to that side to pull again. Not well connected this time
good length outside off, and he muscles a pull to the man at deep midwicket. Off the bat's inside half
full on off, and he gets down on one knee to slog sweep. There's a fielder in the deep for that shot
tossed up, but full outside off. Squeezed away towards wide long on, and collects a couple more
good length outside off, but Duminy walks across to the off side to meet it. Swings towards the leg side, and manages to get enough behind it to clear cow corner
wide outside off, and forces Hardik to stretch at it. Toe ends it straight down the ground to the man in the deep
full outside off, and driven straight past Johnson's right. Man at long on cleans up
slower ball to end the over. Cutter on leg stump and further angling into Duminy. Tried to slog it towards the leg side but deceived completely
short and wide outside off, but way too wide on this occasion. Duminy tried his best, however, to slap it over the infield
short! Duminy sways to get under the line of the ball. A well-directed bouncer from Johnson
sees the batsman charging down, and Johnson goes short and wide. Forces Duminy to reach at it, and he can't get bat to ball!
full on middle and leg, and Duminy clips it off his toes to the sweeper fielder on the leg side
good length outside off, and lifted over Johnson's head. Tried to swing through that arc, but comes off the bat's toe end
cutter outside off, but the umpire thinks it's too wide. Hardik had let it go anyway. Johnson's not pleased with the umpire's call. Looked like it was just inside the tramlines though!
good length outside off, and zipping further away. Tries to cut, but the ball stays low! Well taken by DK
finds Gill at long on! Tries the same shot, but Narine went shorter. The leg-side heave comes off the bat's toe end, and Krunal fails to find the distance on this occasion. He's disappointed!
good length on middle, and Krunal's big back lift comes to the party. Hits through the ball's line, and sent over the long on boundary
back of a length outside off, and turns into Hardik's pads. Works it off his hips to the man at deep midwicket
good length on middle, and Krunal flat-bats it over the non-striker. Man at long off, but it lands just in front of him
good length on leg stump, and Krunal can't paddle it away. Hits his front leg, but the appeal is turned down. Bounced just outside leg

cheeky! Good length outside off, but Hardik's done playing convention. Steps across to the off side, hides his face, and then paddles it over his shoulder! No one at fine leg, and Hardik ends the over with consecutive boundaries.
short outside off, and that's been crunched off the back foot! Cut square, and sweeper cover is too slow to react. Muscles this one
good length on middle, and lifted off the back foot! Hit over midwicket, but Chawla's manning that region in the deep. Looks like the captain is asking Chawla why he didn't attack the ball
well deceived! Slow and full outside off, and Krunal's through his slog way too early. Goes past his bat's edge, and through to DK on the bounce
full on off stump, and Hardik digs this away towards deep midwicket. Couldn't get under the ball, or as much as he'd like to
good length on leg stump, and that's been whipped off the back foot to deep backward square
back of a length on leg stump, and Krunal punches it towards midwicket. He'll keep strike

short again! And the keeper appeals for caught behind. Russell isn't convinced though. It was on leg stump, and Krunal was cramped to play that pull. Goes over his gloves. The appeal, however, may have saved KKR from getting that wide
short outside off, and Krunal goes chasing after it. Tried to slap it over third man, but can't get bat to ball
short, but that's first-ball four! Yanks a pull over the fielder at midwicket, and the shot has the legs to reach the boundary

tickles it to the keeper! Good length on the fourth-stump line, and it's too close to his body for the cut. Finds the edge and DK does the rest. The heat has played its part too. He was really late to play that shot
slower ball outside off, and that's been mistimed down the ground to long on. A gentle punch
slower offcutter, grips and bounces, poked to the covers. Well-deserved break for Suryakumar and myself
full and outside off, forward and driven through the line to cover
short, wide, stays leg-side of the ball and scythes it away to the off-side sweeper
very full and angling wide of off, dragged off the inside half to the leg side
too full and too straight, picked off to deep midwicket
back of a length and skipping away outside off, beats the outside edge near the higher part of the bat
back of a length on middle stump, whipped away to the leg side for one more
very full and skids in, turned to the leg side

One-handed six from Pandya! Tossed up and spins away, finishes on off, Pandya stretches out, yanks his bottom hand off the bat, still finds enough power and elevation to lift it over the wide long-off boundary
looks like a faster googly, swerves in, forward and blocked to the leg side
really full and outside off, Suryakumar replied with a steel-wristed flick to wide long-on
Chawla lobs up a legbreak outside off, Suryakumar ventures outside leg and drives it inside-out. Lifted up and over short extra cover
floated up on the leg stump, clipped away through backward square for a double
skidding into the pads, nearly 100ks, nudged through square leg

Rohit slog-sweeps with the break but picks out Rinku, the sub fielder, at deep midwicket. Tossed up and spins in on middle, Rohit drops down on one knee but skews it off the bottom of the bat to the man in the deep. Only the second wicket away from home for Narine in IPL 2018

short_text: Narine to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: fuller than a good length and spins back in on middle stump, defended to the leg side
Rohit stretches across off, goes low, and paddles this full ball down to fine leg
back of a length and slides on just a shade outside off, hangs back and whips through midwicket for his fourth fifty of the season. His captain Rohit embraces him

short_text: Chawla to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: Chawla slips in a googly, turns in just a touch, Rohit smothers it with a forward defence back to the bowler
back of a length and skidding into the thigh, Rohit hangs back and works the ball away to deep square leg
slower legbreak, turns away and finishes on off, tip and run to point
fired outside off, pushed to short cover, Kuldeep fumbles, allows a single

short_text: Chawla to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: overpitched and outside off, another poor ball from Chawla, Rohit simply leans into it, collapses his back leg, and drives it through the covers, beats sweeper cover to his right

short_text: Chawla to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: tossed up liberally and angled in on off, Rohit stretches out, meets the pitch, and pats it back down the pitch
back of a length just outside off, and Rohit opens his bat's face to glance it towards short third man
full on middle, and Suryakumar moves on to 48 with that nudge towards deep midwicket. They jog across for the run
yorker, but way outside leg stump. Suryakumar misses the flick, but Mumbai still earn the run
short outside off, and Rohit cuts it to the man at third man. Gets off the mark. He's been out for a duck twice this season

short_text: Russell to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: back of a length on off, and he walks inside the line of the ball, before pushing it towards the leg side
slower ball, and that does the trick! Full on off, and Lewis is tempted to go for the biggie. Tries to drive over cover, but slices it down short third man's throat. Comfortably for Lynn
full on middle, and tapped towards the vacant midwicket region. The man in the deep has to come charging in, but can't stop the second run
dropped short and sliding away outside off, Suryakumar uses the depth of the crease, use of pace and angle of Kuldeep, and chops it away past short third man for another four
really full and outside off, non-turner, drilled through the line to long-off
Kuldeep hangs it up in the air, dips, and breaks away outside off. Lewis can't connect with the sweep
back of a length on middle from round the stumps, Suryakumar stands tall and forces a single to long-on
Lewis stays leg-side of the ball and drives to wide long-off
back of a length and spins away outside off, chopped to point
loopier and fuller outside off, enough width for Suryakumar to collapse his back leg and lace a drive between sweeper cover and wide long-off. Impeccable placement again from Suryakumar

100.8ks dart on middle stump, Lewis races down the track, converts it into a full-toss, and belts it back to the left of Rana. He stretches his hands to his left but the force of the shot ensures the ball bursts out. Dropped, but that was a very difficult chance. Such ones stick or they just don't. The umpire was in the firing line too
slower through the air but heading down leg, past the sweep. Leg-side wide

speared very full just a shade outside off, Lewis jumps outside leg and looks to cart it through the covers. Instead, he toe-ends it away to the left of DK behind the stumps and right of short third man. Fortunate four
shorter and darted in on middle stump, forced off the back foot to deep midwicket for one
a bit too full on middle stump, Suryakumar concentrates on placement as opposed to power. He stretches out and flicks it with the wrists between deep midwicket and wide long-on
back of a length and skidding into the pads, punched up to long-on
very full, and very wide outside off. Tries to carve it towards point, but finds the fielder there once again.
good length on off, but he goes towards the leg side to make some room. Cut it square, but only to point
uses his feet, and sends this over wide long on! Caught on to the length early, and thumps it towards the leg side.
flighted on middle stump, but Lewis gets inside the line of the ball. Flicks it to square leg
good length on off, but doesn't spin into his pads. Pulled off the back foot towards deep midwicket on this occasion
full just outside off, and he brings out the late cut. Played delicately off DK's right, and Lynn goes chasing after it
full on leg, and Lewis' leg-side push takes the leading edge towards cover. Time out
full on off, and the drive's been sliced to point! Narine fails to get forward. Lands just in front of him
almost a yorker on middle stump, and Lewis does well to squeeze it back to Chawla
full on off stump, and he's trapped on the front foot. Tries to defend, but takes the outside edge. Oh dear, he's managed to play it fine enough!
that's the fifty partnership! Tossed up outside off, but manages to pick the googly well. Lifted inside out over cover, and some good use of the feet on show
freebie! Full toss on middle, and that's been sent into the top tier! Waist high, and tonked towards the midwicket boundary.
yorker on off! Good comeback, but well played by Lewis. Dug away towards cover for a quick run
back of a length, and in Lewis' slot! Goes onto the back foot, and pulls it over deep midwicket. Off the bat's sweet spot
full just outside off, and he carves it off the front foot towards cover point. Tried to play it straighter than where it went
good length on leg stump, and Lewis swivels to pull. Off the bat's inside half, and only to the man at short fine leg. Enough time to steal the single
full just outside off, and driven straight. Russell was lurking at mid on, so they had to run quick. Comfortably completed in the end
short outside of, and Suryakumar cuts it late. Straight to short third man though. Slightly better direction and that would've been four
shorter outside off, and this time Lewis is quick to spot the length. Goes deep, and brings out the punch past extra cover
fuller on off stump, and mistimed towards the leg side! Tried to hit straight, but comes off the bat's inside half. Beats Krishna at midwicket as well
full just outside off, and Lewis shuffles forward to tap it towards the off side
fuller outside off, and this time it's been driven past the non-striker to the man at long on
big appeal for lbw, but that's a bad shout. Full outside off, and although he missed the sweep, impact was way outside off
better line. Good length on off, and forces the batsman to play from near his body. Fended towards cover point with soft hands
wide outside off, and perfect for the batsman with the ball angling away. Cut furiously past the fielder at point for another boundary
full outside off, and he shuffles towards the ball's direction. Brings out the drive, but can't pierce the gap this time
wide outside off, and that's been drilled through the cover region! Big stride forward and timed to perfection
short on middle, but not too fast. Suryakumar pulls, and although that's taken the top edge, it manages to clear the backward square boundary. Mighty close
good length outside off, and angling across his body. Opens his bat's face and glances it towards point
good length on middle, and Lewis tucks it towards fine leg for a comfortable double. Whipped off his hips
full on off and angling into his pads. Suryakumar shuffles across to the off side and drives towards mid on. Diving effort from Russell at mid on saves the team a certain boundary
width offered again, but this time Suryakumar can't time it well. Too wide, actually, and therefore his cut finds the bat's toe end. Krishna will feel relieved
good length outside off, and he stays on the back foot to push towards the off side
short outside off, and Sky makes full use of the width. Climbs over the bounce and cuts it between backward point and point. Classy
good length outside off, and the batsman goes onto the back foot to punch towards cover. No nerves for Prasidh
ends the over with a full delivery. Straight on middle and leg, and Lewis shuffles behind to tap it back to the bowler. Tidy start for KKR
zips through! Good length on off and skids into Lewis' pads. Impact outside leg though
gives it some more air this time. Full just outside off, and Lewis fends it back to Rana
good length outside off, and Lewis punches this off the back foot towards cover. That area's packed with men in purple though
good length outside off, but angling into Lewis. Drills it straight back to Rana, who does well to get his body behind it
short on middle, and going down leg side. But Suryakumar wants to get bat on ball, and therefore muscles it towards deep midwicket
full outside off, and that's been worked towards the leg side. No one's in the deep, so SRH finish with a boundary. Sunrisers win by seven wickets!
full on leg stump, but Yusuf backs away to the leg side to drill this straight down the ground. Only a single
short on middle, and that's been pulled. Yusuf top-edges it, and that's perfectly fine, since short fine leg was inside the circle
full toss way outside off, and Yusuf leans into this loosener. Bends his knee, and pumps it over the bowler's head. Straight into the sightscreen

short and wide outside off, and that's been flat-batted towards the bowler. Christian drops the catch, but manages to go towards mid on to collect the ball. Then has a shy at the stumps, and hey, it's a direct hit! Williamson's just in. So that's two to the total.
full toss outside off, but all Yusuf can do is muscle it down the ground to long of. SRH need 14 off the final over!
low full toss on middle stump, and Williamson taps it towards cow corner
full toss on off, and it's been bunted inside out towards cover. Allows them to take the single
full and very wide outside off. He tries to drive away from his body but can't connect. Pant's not happy that's been called a wide
low full toss outside off, and that's been slapped between point and cover point! Not sure where he attempted to hit it, but the ball turned in his hand, and therefore sliced it behind square

full and straight on middle, and Yusuf misses the leg-side slog. Got his front leg out of the way to try and hit it, but hits his back leg. Huuuuge appeal, and it's been given lbw. KW asks Yusuf to review. It's pitched juuuuuust outside leg, so Yusuf survives! Oh, this was really really close.
full outside off, and that's in Yusuf's arc! Takes a step forward and thumps it over long on. Off the bat's sweet spot, and that's gone 83 metres!
good length on off, and angling into Pathan. Slogs it towards the leg side, but men there in the deep
yorker on leg stump, as Williamson comes down the wicket. Cramped for space, and all he can do is squeeze it towards the leg side
good length on middle, and it's been pulled straight to deep backward square. But dropped by Shankar! He got under it, but the ball dipped late, which forced the error from him
short outside off, and Yusuf can't connect with the pull. Not a wide, but that's one for the over
good length on off, and Williamson has all the time to choose his spot. But all he can do is pull it to deep backward square
full outside off, and he's sliced it! Shaw's getting under it from extra cover, and he holds on to a pressure catch. Iyer comes to celebrate with the youngster. Silences the crowd
slower ball on middle, and he plays the inside-out cover drive to the man in the deep. He'll have to hurry at the danger end, but he makes it with ease!
low full toss outside off, and KW had shuffled across to the off side to try and ramp it over fine leg. But all he can do is toe end it back to Boult
full toss on off stump, and Pandey gets his front foot out of the way to mistime it towards cow corner. Only a single this time
low full toss outside off, and Pandey mistimes it off his toe end towards wide long on. Hit so poorly, that it actually helps him take the second run
slower ball, full on leg stump, and all KW can do is lift it over cover to the man in the deep
full on middle stump, and it's been driven inside out to long off. Boult took the pace off the delivery this time
short outside off, and carved to the man at deep point. It's a dangerous second run, but the throw from the deep is poor. Time out as well

short_text: Avesh Khan to Williamson, SIX runs
long_text: too short outside off, and Williamson shuffles across to the off side to meet it on the up. Ramps it over backward point, and hey, it's gone all the way!
waist-high full toss on middle stump. Pandey uncomfortably whips it off his hips behind square. Looked like it was going for four, but backward square does well to keep it down to one

short_text: Avesh Khan to Pandey, no run
long_text: very short outside off, and had the width to be sent over point. But just the extra pace does Manish in. Can't get bat to ball
short outside off, and he's quick to swivel and pull. Dragged from way outside off, sent to the deep midwicket boundary

short_text: Avesh Khan to Williamson, no run
long_text: good length outside off, but slightly slower. Mistimes his backfoot punch towards cover
width offered, and slapped past point! Just that extra pace from Christian, and Pandey makes full use. Cuts it square to the end over in a strong manner

Long off asks long on to field it, and long on asks long off to collect! It was a low full toss on middle stump, that Pandey hit over the bowler's head. Both pull out off the dive and they can't believe it's gone for four. Boult and Roy the guilty men
good length on middle, but he's done well to take the pace off. Williamson attempts a leg-side drag, but the ball hits his helmet and goes to square leg
good length on off, and Pandey comes shimmying down the wicket. Muscles this pull, but it only goes to the man at long on
slower ball yorker on leg stump. Williamson backed away towards the leg side, and eventually manages to squeeze it towards square leg. An excellent delivery
full just outside off stump. He walks across to the off side, and flicks it off his toes to the deep midwicket boundary. Man in the deep does well to intercept
offcutter, full outside off. Forces Pandey to get onto the front foot, but all he can do is defend it back to Plunkett
short outside off, and that's been pulled over square leg. Almost a boundary, but Vijay Shankar cleans up
good length on middle stump, and Williamson comes down the wicket to tap it towards cover point (Boult). The throw from there is awry at the non-striker's, and that allows SRH to steal another run.
almost chopped on! Back of a leg outside off, and he tried to push at it away from his body. The ball jags in, and takes the inside of his blade. Goes to fine leg eventually
super slow, but short outside off. KW has to wait ages, before swiping it from over his head and to the man at deep midwicket
good length outside off, and punched off the back foot to the man at extra cover
good length on middle, and straightens after pitching. Slight adjustment from Pandey, as he gets inside the line of the ball, and then simply nudges it towards square leg
flatter on off stump. It zips straight through, but he's quick to gauge the length. Goes deep into his crease and flat-bats it to long on
tossed up, wide outside off. He takes a big stride and drives it square. Maxwell in the deep cleans up
full on middle, and that's been swept! Down on one knee, and sent to the man at the fine-leg boundary
full on middle, and the straight drive almost goes into Mishra's hands. Hit very straight and the bowler did well to get his body behind the ball's line
good length on leg stump, and Williamson smothers this off the back foot. Played to square leg
short outside off, but not fast enough. Chops it down to third man
slower ball, wide outside off. Slightly short, so the batsman has to ride the bounce. Mistimes a cut towards cover point on this occasion
good length on off stump, and Pandey taps it to the area near mid on. No one there, so that's a comfortable double

in the air, but just short of the bower! Back of a length outside off, and it hurries onto the batsman. Tries to defend, but comes off the bat's top half. Pandey stays alive because he played at it with soft hands
short on off, and sends Pandey ducking for cover. Does well to get away from the ball's line, but it's way too high
good length outside off, and angling into KW's body. Opens his bat's face and runs it down to third man
good length but wide outside off. Williamson's gonna be disappointed not to put it away. Cut straight to point

The extra ball fetches him the wicket! How rare is that. Flighted on middle, and Dhawan tried to slog sweep. It's the one that goes straight through and crashes into middle stump. Mishy-bhai is pumped!
good length on middle, and turning into Dhawan. Misses the leg-side flick
full on leg stump, and that's been nudged to the vacant mid-wicket region. Allows them an easy single
flighted full outside off. Slight legspin, and Williamson defends towards cover
good length just outside off, stays on the back foot and slaps it to the man at deep extra cover
good length outside off, and plays this legspin down the ground. Punched past the non-striker this time
good length outside off, and zips straight through. Forces KW to get onto the back foot, and tap it back to Mishra
good length on middle stump, and the ball stays low! He drags a pull along the ground to deep backward square. They walk across for the run
full outside off, and pushed past the cover fielder to Maxwell in the deep

short_text: Christian to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: full just outside off and that's been tapped off the front foot to cover. Man there
slower ball, on middle stump. Waits for it, before working it off his pads to square leg. Gets off the mark
back of a length, but wide outside off. Allows Dhawan to free his arms, and he cuts it to Avesh at deep point
back of a length outside off, but angling into his body. Drags it behind square on the leg side, and some more work for Shaw in the deep

a beauty! Ball of the tournament. Good length on leg stump, and spins across Hales' body as he tries to defend. He's on the back foot, and the ball whooshes past his outside edge, and crashes into off stump. A legspinner's dream ball. Time out
good length on middle, and spinning into Dhawan. He shuffles across to the leg side and pushes towards long off

short_text: Mishra to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: full toss on leg stump, and that's been put away! Quick bat speed, and swept towards the backward square boundary
full just outside off, and that's been smashed past Mishra's left. Long off patrolling the boundary
short on middle, and no real spin this time. Allows Dhawan to stay on the back foot and pull towards deep midwicket
full just outside off, and he takes a big stride forward to paddle this fine down the leg side

short_text: Christian to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: snakes back in full from wide of the crease, Dhawan defends.
slower length ball that he punches down to long on
chops this attempted cut into the off side, Christian hares across to stop that
slides a length ball into middle and leg, worked off his hip to deep square leg
pulled but gets this high on the bat, so no timing or power. Down to deep midwicket
swats this short delivery to deep midwicket
beaten by a tossed up googly that spins back in to beat the inside edge and hit the flap of the pad.
slows it down nicely, Hales lunges forward and blocks
drifts in from wide of the crease, defended to the leg side
too short, he rocks back and pulls to deep square leg
gets some bounce from length on middle, Hales on top of the bounce as he works this past midwicket
shortish on middle, punched to long on

short_text: Avesh Khan to Hales, SIX runs
long_text: backs away and upper cuts this to clear square third man. Fourth six off the over, Hales on beast mode

short_text: Avesh Khan to Hales, no run
long_text: mistimes a forceful hit down the ground, straight to mid on

short_text: Avesh Khan to Hales, SIX runs
long_text: this is terrific! Inside-out over long off. Not too full but he lofted it through the line. Sunrisers raise the half-century stand. Super expensive over and we still have two deliveries. This is Hales unleashed

short_text: Avesh Khan to Hales, SIX runs
long_text: stunning! How quickly did he pick the length there? Fetched it from outside off and pull it imperiously in front of square. Bowled at 144kph, went to the ropes at 200. Delightful

short_text: Avesh Khan to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: another pull, this time he gets it high on the bat but manages to hit this wide of short fine leg

short_text: Avesh Khan to S Dhawan, SIX runs
long_text: this has been clobbered deep into the stands at backward square leg. Sat up nicely, Dhawan swivelled back and allowed his wrists to create magic! The release shot. Will we see a different Dhawan from now?

short_text: Avesh Khan to Hales, (no ball) 1 run
long_text: oh, dear. Oversteps as he bowls this full delivery that is defended back. Huge roar around the ground as the umpire calls it a  freehit

short_text: Plunkett to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: very poor from Plunkett. Too short and angling down, Dhawan helps this down past short fine leg. He'll put those away in his sleep. Not the kind of ball you want to be bowling to someone who has a highest of 11 in his last five innings!
controls the pull to keep this all along the ground, down to deep square
drags this pull from way outside off to square leg, no timing again.
backs away but Plunkett follows him by bowling one fuller, worked to midwicket
helped over short fine leg. Too short and angling in, Hales walked across and picked his spot. Too easy
lucky to get away with that! Too short and outside off, Hales thumps this straight to point
makes room but the bowler follows him, worked to square leg.
shapes to paddle, gets it high on the bat, bounces short of short fine but they scamper a single nonetheless
flatter one on middle and leg, punched to deep midwicket
short and wide outside off, Hales slaps this straight to cover point
too short and angling down, Dhawan swivels back and helps the pull on the bounce to fine leg

short_text: Maxwell to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: slides one back in from length, defended
works this full delivery on middle to mid on for a quick single
flies down leg, Pant fumbles and they'll get an extra run apart from the wide. Wrong line from Boult
slower and fuller outside off, he leans into the drive and gets this behind point. Square third man comes around to cut that off
slower and fuller outside off, driven firmly but only as far as mid off

short_text: Boult to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: deflects off the thigh to slip. Cramped for room by a length ball as he tried to work it to the legside
squeezes this drive to mid off for a quick single
angles in a length ball on middle and leg, tucked to square leg

short_text: Avesh Khan to S Dhawan, 1 run
long_text: makes room and flays this away-going length ball to deep point

short_text: Avesh Khan to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: back of length angling away, plays inside the line as this whizzes past.

Oh, dear. Maxwell! What have you done?  Will that prove to be the difference? Straight in, straight out at deep square leg. Avesh hits the deck hard again with this short ball, rushed onto Hales as he pulled from outside off, got more elevation than distance. Maxwell came running in, trembled and never looked like taking it as it descended. Gosh!

short_text: Avesh Khan to Hales, FOUR runs
long_text: clever, very clever. Made room to slap this over point but Avesh cramped him for room. Hales now changes his stroke and uses the pace to help this wide of short third man.

short_text: Avesh Khan to Hales, no run
long_text: beaten for pace! Shapes to pull from outside off but played too late.

short_text: Avesh Khan to Hales, FOUR runs
long_text: helps the pull over Mishra at short fine. Too short and angling in from wide of the crease and he was ready for this.

short_text: Boult to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: no room to play a full-blooded cut, bunts this to point

short_text: Boult to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: banged in short outside off, Dhawan looks to ramp this over the keeper but misses.

short_text: Boult to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: nice little drive. Just a gentle push off the frontfoot to extra cover
driven on the up to mid off, Hales is off the mark
bends back in from length on middle, Hales plays outside the line to get a thick inside edge onto the boot
sliddy length ball that curves back in slightly, Hales is besides the line as he defends
hip-high full toss on leg stump, band that's been flicked off his pads to the backward square boundary. Not a no ball, but they still manage to take three. Delhi Daredevils finish on 163!
offcutter outside off, but just too wide this time. He shuffles across to the off side, and cuts it in the gap. Deep point does well to get to the ball, but just can't parry it back
short outside off, and Bhuvi's also taken the pace off this. Christian flat-bats it over Shankar, but lands well short of long on
follows that up with a yorker! Right on off stump, and all Shankar can do is dig it away towards point
down on one knee, and over long on! Overpitched outside off, and Shankar shanks it into the stands. Perfect spot for him to free his arms
back of a length outside off, and that's been worked off his hips to Dhawan at deep midwicket. Gently played by Shankar, which allows them to return for the second
full and wide outside off, but Shankar gets his bat to ball and taps this towards point. Would've gone for four if it wasn't for Sandeep's diving effort near the 15-year circle
muscled to long off! But men patrolling the deep. Full outside off,and that was mistimed over Kaul's head

full just outside off, and that's been driven to Williamson at cover. The non-striker is stranded midway, and KW aims at the stumps. He misses the wicket, and Kaul - in front of the stumps - can't grab it either
slower ball, and short outside off. Checks his pull, but still manages to hit it well to the cow-corner boundary. Rashid is excellent in the deep
full outside off, and the pace is taken off. Driven towards cover, but with no real timing
late inswing into his toes, as the yorker is flicked to the backward square boundary
full just outside off, and nudged off the front foot towards cow corner. Hit gently enough, and that allows them the second run
arm ball on off, and zipping straight through. He came down the ground to try and slog it, but the ball stayed low and crept under his bat. Hits his back leg
full just outside off, and Shankar's drive takes a thick edge. Chipped over Shakib to long off
good length on off, and worked towards the leg side. They walk across for the run

fair play! Full on off, and that was drilled straight into the non-striker's stumps. The umpire wants a replay in case the non-striker is run out, but Shakib says he hasn't touched the ball. Good to see
outside off and angling into the batsman. Mistimed towards cover
overpitched on leg stump, and Christian pushes it into the gap in front of midwicket. He'll keep strike

big appeal! And that's the slow finger of death. He's reviewing, but looks half-hearted. Was short on middle, and Pant just couldn't connect with the pull. The ball snuck under his bat, and hit his back leg. Looks kinda high though. Could miss the stumps, but alas! Would've clipped top of middle stump.
wrong'un! Outside off, and spinning into his pads. Flicked to the midwicket boundary

short_text: Rashid Khan to Shankar, no run
long_text: good length, just outside off. Spinning away from Shankar, and he fends it away towards point

short_text: Rashid Khan to Shankar, no run
long_text: good length outside off, and sharp spin away from his body. Tapped off the back foot to point, and gets off the mark as well

yes, no, yes, no, out! Full just on off, and he pushes the wrong'un towards the non-striker. Ojha wants to get off strike, but Pant chooses not to carry on after starting off. Ojha's stranded, and Rashid collects and throws at the batsman's end. Saha does the rest
knuckle ball just outside off, and not too wide this time. Pant manageds to reach at it, and bunts it over Kaul's head. Not him well enough, but still sent the umpire scampering for cover
yorker on middle and leg, and the batsman does well to get his toes out of the way. Late inswing, and that hits his boot
back of a length on off, and Pant winds up to flat-bat it down the ground. Mistimes it to long off though
back of a length outside off, and forces Pant to reach at it. It's been a strategy against Pant, but this is too wide
short on middle, but Ojha backs away to make that extra room. Sticks his bat out and runs it down to third man
back of a length on middle, and aimed at the batsman's body. Cramped for space, and can only tap it away towards the leg side
full on the pads and he's flicked this straight to Dhawan at deep midwicket. Out comes the Kabaddi thump. Oh, dear. Iyer has thrown it away.
pulled from outside off to deep midwicket

Dhawan has made a right royal mess at long off.  The harbour bridge as they'd call it in Australia. Iyer belted this full toss down to long off, Dhawan failed to bend down properly. What should've been a single is now four.
rolls his wrists nicely to play this half pull from outside off to deep square leg
slogs and misses. Through the stroke early, beaten completely by this slower delivery.
loses his timing. Tries to whack this length ball across the line, gets an inside edge back to the bowler.
lucky to get away with a juicy full toss, punched to long on
belts this full delivery to Pandey at long off, this time they hare back for the second. Almost as if Iyer said "don't care what you do, just get back."
punches this length ball on the up to long off. Iyer wanted the second, Pant didn't. Cry of anguish from the skipper. Remember the run out from the other night?
knuckleball that he lands at length on middle, lofted down to long on. Hit him high on the bat
chops this into the square third man region. Iyer backed away to slap this through point
stands tall and works this short of length delivery off his hip to deep square
wallops this length ball into the gap at wide long off, nice sliding stop by Manish Pandey
punches this googly towards deep midwicket
dabs this gently into the off side for a quick single

short_text: Rashid Khan to Iyer, SIX runs
long_text: now he adds insult to injury. This is a magnificent loft over extra cover. Picked the legbreak off the hand, wasn't underneath the flight but hit this on the up and this sailed away. Wow

short_text: Rashid Khan to Iyer, no run
long_text: through with this short-arm jab early, may have got a thin edge that Saha muffed
rocks back and slaps this short ball to deep cover

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pant, no run
long_text: drills this back to Rashid, who is hit on the right ankle as he tries to put his foot out and stop
yorker-length outside off, squeezed to point
angles a length ball across, steered behind point
back of length angling into middle and leg, worked off his hip to deep midwicket
looks to arch back and upper cut this short delivery, beaten by the zip
has he gloved this? Big appeal but the umpire is unmoved. Iyer looks to hop across and whip this but misses. The ball may have brushed his thigh pad on the way
back of length outside off, he stands tall and punches to deep cover
uppish but safe! This stopped on Pant as he looked to punch towards midwicket

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pant, no run
long_text: right behind the line of this length delivery as he defends back
spins away to roll to point off a leading edge. Iyer was looking to work this to the leg side
googly but the length is on the shorter side, forced to deep point

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pant, no run
long_text: sweeps and misses. This was pushed through quicker, drifted away as well. Pant was too early into the stroke.
tame end to a super knock! Looked to fetch this sweep from outside off, but this spin away sharply to take the top edge as short third man took a dolly.
on the bounce to Dhawan at deep midwicket!  Made an awesome sound off the bat as he flat-batted this pull, but that's as much as there was to it. Completely mistimed.
whips this full toss into the gap at wide long-on.
whips this length ball from outside off towards deep midwicket
short of length on middle and leg, works this to square leg
gentle little tap into the off side as they scamper a quick single
lucky to get away with that short delivery. Too much width but this kept low to beat the underedge
swept from outside off toward deep midwicket where Rashid pulls off a sliding stop. Back for the second comfortably
flatter on middle and leg, worked to square leg
Now off the backfoot!  Splits backward point and short third man. Picked the length early - mind you, this wasn't all that short - he rocked back and cracked that away.
slow turn from length on middle, defended back
delightful skip down the pitch to get under the flight as he hammers this over long on. Iyer is in total control
works this wide of midwicket
waits for the turn and then bunts this past midwicket
makes room and punches this short delivery to deep point
drifts in a full ball on the stumps, eased to long on

short_text: Rashid Khan to Shaw, FOUR runs
long_text: too short and Prithvi has clobbered that. Rocks back and flat-bats this to the deep square leg boundary.
bounce from length on off stump, worked against the line to square leg
touch short and drifting in, helped to short fine, where there's a good stop
fetches this sweep from outside off to deep midwicket
taps this gently into the off side as they take a quick single
this one drifts in, keeps a touch low as well. Shaw punches this to deep midwicket to bring up his second half-century
mistimes a lofted hit down to wide long on. Just dragged this a little
drifts in a full delivery on middle from around the stumps, squeezed past the bowler
thumped inside out to deep extra cover.
back of a length outside off, and he punches it off the back foot. Beats the man at cover, and Rashid's dive at the boundary is futile. Big finish to the Powerplay
quicker, on middle stump. It's angling down the leg side however, and all Shaw has to do is drag it fine. Flicked very fine, and between the keeper and short third man. Hat-trick of boundaries
good length on middle stump, and this time Shaw pulls it over midwicket! Swivels well, and then his bat speed does the rest. Picking the length early
knuckle ball outside off, but easily picked by Shaw. Takes a big stride forward and muscles it beyond the long-off boundary
good length on leg, and that's been whipped off his hips to deep backward square
good length on off, and swaying into his pads. Flicked towards midwicket
good length just outside off, and fended back to Bhuvi to see the over off
knuckle ball on off, and Iyer's through his straight drive way too early. Mistimes it between Bhuvi and the non-striker, but reaches the long-on boundary
on middle stump, and Iyer uses the angle to nudge it towards square leg
good length on off, and Iyer glances it towards point. He's halfway down the wicket but Shaw isn't interested in the run. Point collects and throws but Iyer managed to get back in time
full on leg, and that's been drilled to midwicket. A diving effort from the fielder there saves the single
good length on off, and angling into his pads. Tapped towards deep midwicket on this occasion
slower ball on leg stump, and he knew where the fielders were! Shuffles across to the off side, and drags a safe pull along the ground. Beats short third man, and that's four to end the over
overpitched outside off, and that's been mistimed over the infield. Enough behind that shot to take it beyond cover. Off the bat's outside half
good length just outside off, but Iyer opens his bat's face to run it down to third man
good length on off, and that's been worked off his hips towards the midwicket region
in the air, but just short of Hales! Full just outside off, and he tries another cover drive. Through his shot too early, and he's lucky the ball fell just short
good length just outside off, and Iyer chooses to fend it away. Tiptoes and pushes it towards cover
full on middle stump, and the mistimed on-drive beats the fielder at midwicket. Wide long on cleans up
full on middle, but Shaw backs away to the leg side to make some room. Carves it away, but only to point
full just outside off, and Shreyas gets off the mark straight away. Driven past Shakib's left to long off
good length on middle stump, flicked towards midwicket
good length outside off and Shaw tries to drive, but chooses to defend
tossed up first, and that's been lifted inside out! Pitches outside off, and Shaw makes full use of the first loose ball. Enough time to wind up, and then his bat speed does the rest
back of a length on middle, and once again taking the pace off. Shaw flicks it off the backfoot towards square leg for a single
slapped square! Outside off, and Shaw rides the bounce to cut it off the back foot. Between backward point and point
full on middle and leg, but it's the slower ball. Goes down the leg side

Is Maxwell out? Yes!  How unlucky would he have to be? It was full on middle stump, and Shaw drove it straight to Sandeep. The bowler managed to get fingertips to it, and it ricocheted onto his boots and then onto the stumps. Maxwell's too slow to react, and he's inches short of the ground.
over long on! What a talent. Good length outside off, and in Shaw's arc to smack this straight. Hits it through the ball's line, and thumps it over the bowler's head
good length outside off but angling further away. Maxwell slashes it square, but takes the top edge. Straight to third man
good length outside off, and takes the extra bounce! Maxwell's a tall man, though, so he comfortably fends it away with soft hands
good length outside off, and the batsman gets onto the back foot to caress it towards cover. Firmly hit, but only to the fielder
knuckle ball, but short on of stump. Shaw stays on the back foot and blocks it back to Bhuvi

back of a length on off. Seams slightly away from Maxwell, so he pushes it off the back foot to mid off. Calls early for the single, and they've scampered across easily. But Maxwell tripped while completing the run. He looks slightly hurt
full on off, and swinging into Shaw. Mistimes an on drive to the midwicket region. They're off the mark
full and wide outside off. He wants Shaw to reach at it, but the batsman pulls out of the shot midway. Lets it go through to the keeper
good length outside off, but nice swing into Shaw. Defends it off the front foot to cover
Chahal tosses a legbreak outside off, Bravo reaches out and drives it to sweeper cover for a single. Bravo punches his fist, Dhoni keeps a poker face as usual. CSK go top
short on middle, stands tall and forces it down to long-on
floated up on off, Thala Dhoni stretches out and smokes another slog-sweep over the midwicket boundary. Three sixes in four balls.
Dhoni clears long-off. Free-hit ball: back of a length legbreak outside off. Dhoni stretches out and launches it for another six
100.9ks dart, fizzes off the pitch, beats the inside edge and hits the back pad. Might have headed past leg stump. Front-foot no-ball from Chahal. He's feeling the pressure
tossed up wide outside off, Dhoni reaches out, and slog-sweeps it against the break over the midwicket fence. Clobbered into the stands
back of a length and skids in on middle, cramps Dhoni for room. Inside-edged to midwicket
fired wide outside off, off-side wide
fuller and outside off, eased to sweeper cover for one
clipped off the pads to fine leg
back of a length on off, punched past the right of short cover to long-off
back of a length on the hips, glanced behind square on the leg side
very full on middle, nurdled down to long-on
pitched up and outside off, Bravo presses forward and drives with the wrists to wide long-on
tossed up and spins away outside off, Dhoni reaches out for a drive, Parthiv takes the bails off, but Dhoni's back leg went nowhere
back of a length and spins away outside off, Dhoni delays his punch and finds the gap to the right of sweeper cover
back of a length, hint of spin, but plenty of bounce outside off, beaten
wide legbreak outside off, scythed away to sweeper cover. Stylish from DJ
dragged down outside off, Bravo ventures deep in the crease and clubs a pull over the midwicket boundary. Pinged off the middle of the bat
full and slides on off stump, no turn, Bravo hangs back and pokes the ball to point
fuller on middle, bunted down to long-on for one
stump-to-stump line again, chipped in the air, but does not carry to midwicket
back of a length on the hips, punched straight to midwicket
short on off, punched to mid-on inside the circle
much fuller but similar line, Dhoni presses forward and drives down to long-off
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, punched through the line to long-off for a jogged single
back of a length and outside off, slashed to short third man
short, wide, bounces, beats the outside edge

Chahal drops a regulation catch at the sweeper cover boundary. Tossed up and spins away outside off, Bravo drives it inside-out. Hoisted in the air with a high elbow, Chahal makes a royal mess of it and gives Bravo another life
Bravo reads this googly off the pitch and plays it to the leg side
short legbreak, chopped square through the off side off the back foot
looped up outside off, driven through the line to the left of wide long-off. Kohli throws himself to his left, rolls along the ground, then jumps up for the throw
good length outside off, forced down to long-on for one
full and outside off, forward and pushed into the covers

really full and wide outside off, Bravo has a crack at it, not sure if the batsman had edged it. Parthiv can't close his gloves around the ball. Ultra Edge detects a spike, and that will go down as a dropped chance. Very difficult one, though
back of a length and angled in on middle, nudged to midwicket
short, wide, slapped into the lap of backward point. Shorey cuts it in the air and hands Mandeep a simple catch. RCB were 80 for 4 at a similar stage of their innings
back of a length on middle, punched to short midwicket off the back foot
full and slides on just outside off, jabbed to point to close out the over
back of a length and spins away, chopped to backward point
short, wide, turns away, slapped to point
back of a length and breaking down the leg side for another wide. The wrong'un goes horribly wrong
tossed outside off, stretches out and jabs it to the covers
shortish and spins away outside off, chopped away to backward point
leg-side wide
First-ball wicket for M Ashwin. Short legbreak, spins away outside off, Rayudu throws his bat at the ball and loses his shape. Slices it off the outside half to short third man
full and outside off, driven to point
back of a length and outside off, Shorey reaches out for the ball and edges it onto the ground. The ball hits Parthiv's foot
deflected off the pads to square leg
hip-high short ball on leg stump, swatted away to the long leg fence
back of a length and skids in, inside-edged to midwicket
back of a length and outside off, flashed to backward point
dug in short and outside off, Shorey shuffles across off, and unleashes a pull. Sails over the fine leg fielder
extra bounce from a back of a length, fended off
back of a length and outside off, slashed to backward point
good length and outside off, pushed to cover
really full and outside off, skewed drive to mid-on off the inside half
full-toss on off, heaved to deep square off the inside half
good length and jags back in on off, played back to the bowler
pitched up on off, presses forward and drives to cover

Southee pulls off an incredible hokey-pokey catch at the edge of the long-on boundary. He leaps back, catches the ball, goes past the boundary. But then drops the ball into play before going beyond the fence. Then comes back and pouches it with both hands. Raina hangs at the edge of the straight boundary, but he has to go. The TV umpire confirms that's a clean catch. Well done, Southee. Umesh banged it short and outside off, Raina, having backed away outside leg, attempts a pull and ends up dragging a catch. That it was a catch was down to Southee's brilliance. What a play
short, wide, 141.3ks again, Raina reaches out and punches to point with an open face
shorter on leg, 141.5ks, Raina shuffles across off, misses, and watches the ball bounce over leg stump
back of a length on middle, Raina ventures across off, gets inside the line, and helps it away fine on the leg side for four
slow turn for Chahal, as he tosses it outside off, Rayudu opens the face and guides this legbreak to short third man
tucked off the hips to deep square leg off the back foot
on a length and outside off, presses forward and drives to long-off
flat, quick on middle, pushed past the left of Chahal
half-tracker on the leg stump, Raina lines it up and pulls it away to the square leg boundary, to the left of deep midwicket
full and sliding across off from over the wicket, off the outside half to point
pitched up on off, tapped down to long-on for one

Raina uses his feet, meets a full-toss, slices it down to deep third man. Raina hurtles back for the second, Parthiv takes the bails off without gathering Ashwin's throw from the deep. Raina dives and makes it
hip-high short ball outside off, you've got to get it up higher. After playing three dots, Raina jumps outside leg and hacks it over the long-on fielder for six
full on off, presses forward and bunts it to mid-off
Raina shuffles outside leg, reaches out for this short ball outside off, and ends up missing it wildly
full and angling across off, Raina pokes it back to the bowler
overpitched and outside off, Rayudu hangs back but lets his hands flow through the line. Crunched away wide of mid-off. 16 off the over
seam-up, full and outside off, driven through the line to the covers
yet another slower ball, Rayudu picks the offcutter, jumps across off and bludgeons it over midwicket. Muscled away. Raina manufactures his own pace again
114.7ks slower ball on of, Rayudu forces the pace. He bends his back knee and swats it across to the midwicket fence
Raina jumps outside leg, slower cutter, toe-ended to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, flat-batted away to wide mid-off, where Siraj lets it burst through his hands. Rayudu stepped out and swatted it away
very full on off, Raina hangs back again, played back to the bowler
shorter and outside off, Raina rides the bounce and simply helps it away between deep square leg and deep midwicket. Baz chases hard, slides and parries the ball to Siraj
there comes the sucker ball - full and wide outside off - Raina hangs back, waiting for the bouncer. He jabs to cover
chest-high ball on middle, tucks up Raina for room, he wears it on the body
rides the bounce of this back-of-a-length ball and steers a single to third man. 400 runs this season for Rayudu
full and outside off, skips away in the channel, 143.6ks, Rayudu is late onto a drive and is beaten for pace and late swing
Rayudu comes down the pitch but has to adjust to this short ball outside off. He delays his shot and swats it with a flat bat to wide mid-off
short on off, Raina hops and shovels a pull to fine leg
full and sliding into the pads, chipped over midwicket off the front foot for a couple of runs
short, wide, carved down to third man
Rayudu steps out even before Southee delivers. The bowler spots the movement, drags his length back and shifts his line wider of off. Left alone in the end
full and outside off, skewed off the inside half to mid-on

Umesh floors the off stump with a 141.1kph rocket. Follows the short ball with a full one. Watson hangs back, then ventures outside the leg stump and searches for a drive. Umesh goes very full - not quite a yorker - Watson reaches out for the ball but is beaten by late outswing. Cracking first over from Umesh. He thrives bowling in the Powerplay
short, Umesh hits the middle of the pitch, Watson is now beaten for pace and bounce. Top-edges a hook into the breeze to the left of deep square leg
short and Umesh hits the splice as opposed to bat hitting ball. Rolls away to short cover
Umesh beats Rayudu for pace, again. Back of a length and skids back in, cramps the batsman for room, deflected to the leg side
short on middle, Rayudu is a bit late onto the hook. He top-edges it into the CSK dugout beyond the fine leg boundary
back of a length and angling in on off, Rayudu opens the face and dabs to point
back of a length and fizzes in at off, Watson jumps back and punches straight to cover. Chahal rounds out a maiden
short and slides in on middle and leg, 99ks, hangs back and defends to the leg side
Chahal throws himself to his left to stop this front-foot drive from Watson
tossed on off, no turn again, Watson stretches out and drives it back
back of a length and skids in on off, Watson moves back and punches it to Chahal
very full on off, presses forward and drives to mid-on
length ball that pins him on the pad, wears it on the pad after getting tucked up for room. Heading down leg
short of a length, comes on with the arm around leg stump, and Watson stands tall and tucks into the leg side
very full outside off, leans into a drive and guides it to the right of sweeper cover
short of a length, shapes away a tad, and Watson blocks from the crease
a tad fuller  from Southee this time, and Watson carefully defends to backward point off the front foot
short, wide and cuts away from the deck. To sum it up in one word, that was tripe. Watson slaps it out to sweeper cover

Siraj run out off the last ball? Indeed. Such fast hands from Dhoni, again. Full-toss on off, Siraj loses his shape and splices it down to long-on. It's the last ball, and he has to come back for the second. He finishes second to Dhoni in that race
Southee runs down the track for a leg-side yahoo, instead he inside-edges to short fine leg. Siraj drags himself for a single
off-stump yorker, dug back to the bowler
length ball on middle and leg, whipped away through square leg. Southee hurtles back for the second. Dhoni fumbles the take

Chaos in Pune. Siraj is in pain. Man down. This was an accurate yorker on middle from DJ, Southee jabs his bat down hurriedly and inside-edges it behind to Ngidi at short fine leg. Siraj hares across for a single, Southee sends him back as he wants to keep strike. Siraj turns and that's when he collapses. The throw from Ngidi is awry again. Soars over Bravo, and Siraj comes across to the non-striker's end
Southee backs away outside leg and does not make contact with a slower ball
back of a length and outside off, scooped to third man. Southee denies the single
full and outside off, not quite a yorker, scythed to deep point
Thakur nails a wide yorker outside off, beats Southee

Southee jumps across off, meets a low full-toss, and looks to scoop it away over fine leg. Instead, he leading-edges it to the left of deep third man. Ngidi dives to his left but the ball pops out and sneaks away to the boundary
back of a length on the hips, Southee picks it up and launches it over the square leg fence. Such a clean strike from Sixer Southee
full-toss outside off, Southee, having shuffled across, swats it away to long-on and refuses the single
full and sliding in on middle, Southee plays around his front pad and deflects it to short fine leg, where Ngidi picks up the ball and fires a wide throw, the ball runs away to the boundary
really full on off, forward and driven down to long-off
off-stump yorker, jammed out to point
another slower ball outside off, the batsman plays early and chips it over the covers
slower ball outside off, offcutter, sliced in the air. Willey hangs back near the boundary as opposed to running in and attacking the ball. Willey takes it on the bounce
and Southee welcomes him with four. Overpitched and outside off, clears his front leg and thrashes it through the covers
full and outside off, dragged down to wide long-on
another off-stump yorker, jammed back to the bowler
Southee becomes the second RCB batsman - after Parthiv - to move into double figures. He shuffles across off, meets a full-toss, and inside-edges it between his legs to the fine leg boundary
really full and outside off, squeezed into the covers
full and wide outside off, flayed wide of sweeper cover for two
off-stump yorker, slanting in, jabbed back to the bowler
full and just a shade outside off, slower ball, poked back down the pitch
short and angling into the hips, deflected to fine leg
slower offcutter outside off, Siraj hangs his bat out and is beaten on the outside edge yet again
back of a length, angling in, straightening away to beat the outside edge near the higher part of the bat
back of a length on middle, glanced away behind square for one

Willey throws the stumps down at the non-striker's end. The TV umpire has been called in, and Umesh is caught well short. Ngidi ventures wide of the crease, back of a length and angling in, pushed towards mid-off. Umesh sets off, as does Willey. The fielder swoops down on the ball, has three stumps to aim, and goes bang
fullish length on middle, pushed back
full outside off, tries to flick into the leg side but it's so much across the line and the ball shoots past the edge
short of a length around off, drilled with absolutely no timing into the off side
full, right on the money around the fourth-stump channel, squeezed out back to the bowler
shuffles across to a fuller one and pierces short cover diving forward with a smooth drive

and some more tripe RCB. These are woeful shots that they're playing. The surface really isn't as hard as they're making it seem. Short outside off, tries to fetch a pull and slices it in the air off the toe-end. Simple catch to extra cover
punched down to long-off
another leading edge that lands just short of short third man. Advanced down the ground and heaved with a mighty swing but is done in by turn
back of a length, backs away and punches down to long-off
closes the face and again there's no turn and he gets a leading edge towards short third man
shuffles across and blocks watchfully towards mid-on

plays for non-existing turn and the ball shoots past the outside edge. But, hang on, has there been a stumping? Dhoni whipped the bails off, sure, and the backfoot has slid out. Ashwin tries planting the foot down, but only lands it on the line. Done in by pace, no turn and lack of bounce
curves in a back of a length delivery from wide of the crease, and Ashwin backs away and punches through the covers
oh, dear! That's been chipped straight back. Jadeja rushes him with a quick fuller one and Parthiv's bat turns towards the outside in his hands as he knocks it straight into the hands of the bowler
backfoot punch down to long-off
short of a length, flat, backs away and tries to force a cut but doesn't find the middle
length ball, flat and curving in from a roundish arm action, punched towards wide long-off
back of a length and spinning in, whipped away wide of long-on
advances down the ground and meets the pitch before lofting this fuller one straight over
sweeps extremely fine. Gets his front leg across and just about gets and that takes it very fine
full outside off, clipped away through midwicket
just back of a length, minimal turn into him, and he punches back
back of a length, sliding on middle and leg, backs away and whips to midwicket. A 37-ball fifty for Parthiv
full and sliding into off, drilled off the outside of the bat
picks out deep backward square leg. Fullish but not quite full enough, Mandeep Singh gets down to sweep and crunches it off the middle but straight into the hands of the fielder
short of a length, sliding in, backs away to give himself some room before slapping it wide of sweeper cover
fullish, sliding in, tucked to short fine leg
similar length, just backs away and chops his punch back to the bowler as he's cramped for room
back of a length, sliding in, tucked to backward square leg
flat length ball, punched to long-on for one
lobbed up on middle, spins in, nurdled off the pads to Watson at short fine leg
darted on a back of a length and outside off, jabbed back to the bowler
floated up outside off, Parthiv sweeps to short fine leg for one
Mandeep hangs back and works with the spin to midwicket
good length and slides back in, goes back and chops through point
dropped shorter and outside off, Parthiv rides the bounce and chops it away between backward point and short third man for four
back of a length on off, 103ks, swatted down to long-on
good length on middle, patted down to long-on
arm ball, fizzes in, 102ks, Mandeep nearly drags it back onto the stumps. The ball sneaks away past leg stump
back of a length and skids in on middle, defended back to the bowler
dragged down outside off, Parthiv goes deep in the crease and slaps it away to sweeper cover
very full and slides in on middle, clipped through midwicket
full on middle, driven down to long-on for one

Is Parthiv run out? Tossed up on middle, Mandeep camps back and plays it back to the bowler. Harbhajan collects the ball cleanly, sees Parthiv straying out of the crease and taps it back onto the stumps. Parthiv, however, has enough time to slide his bat in
fuller than a good length and spins in, hangs back and played back to the bowler

Such fast hands from Dhoni. Kohli and AB gone in two overs. Harbhajan tosses up an offbreak on middle, turns in, AB stretches out for a reverse-sweep but still can't meet the pitch of the ball. He sweeps and misses. Dhoni doesn't miss the ball, rides the bounce, and flips the bails off in a flash

Harbhajan drops a return catch! Tossed outside off, hint of turn, Parthiv does not meet the pitch and drives. Instead, he chips it in the air to the right of the bowler. Harbhajan is late to react in his followthrough. The ball bursts through
very full on middle stump, Parthiv unleashes the flat, hard, reverse-sweep and hits it to the right of backward point for four
flatter and quicker just outside off, AB stretches out for the sweep and collects thin air. But the impact is outside the line of off
tossed up on off, the ball isn't coming onto the bat, defended back
back of a length on middle, punched down the ground
