dropped! Almost stuck. 135 kph, low full toss is belted back at Dhawal. Fight or flight kicks in because it's aimed at his head. He gets his hands up and catches the ball, but it pops out slyly and lies on the ground, grinning back at Dhawal.
swatted away into the gap at extra cover. It's another short, slower delivery. Shaw picks the variation early enough and thrashes the ball into the gap at cover
a good yorker on middle and leg, jammed back towards mid-off

goes again, six more. He's just picking length very quickly. Once he does that, it's all a bit too easy for class batsmen, like de Villiers. Shaw shows some of his skill with a bottom-handed loft over mid-on.
shorter, back of a length outside off. Shaw gets over the bounce, watches the ball down and guides to short third man
a pick-flick for six. Back of a length, down leg, Shaw gets underneath the length and chips the ball elegantly over midwicket for six. Massive hit.
the second bouncer? No, says the square leg umpire. How do bowlers keep getting away with this? Dug in very short, Iyer ducks and looks at the umpire immediately.
back of a length around off, defended away to mid-off
too straight again and picked away. Not been a great over, 135 kph, on the pads. Iyer just gets a bit of bat on that and tickles the ball fine, to the fine leg boundary.
back of a length, down leg though. Nudged down to fine leg for one.
dug in short again, Shaw gets underneath. The one for the over, well used again
short and wide from Archer, not the best start. Slashed away to backward point.
a short delivery outside off, a very clever change in length to earn himself a dot ball. Banged in and Iyer ducks. One over, one for one.
a good length delivery on middle to start to Iyer. Pushed to mid-on

edged and gone! An inside edge is taken by Buttler. A golden duck for Munro. It's nice and full again, inviting a drive. The ball moves back in, in the air. Munro goes driving, but he's played slightly outside the line. A thick inside edge is found, Buttler dives to his right and takes an easy catch. Excellent bowling to persist with that full length in swinging conditions.
Delhi's first runs. On middle and leg, flicked away easily through deep square leg for a single.
a bit of width! Full and wide, the ball moving further away. Shaw mis-times a drive towards extra cover.
a nice and full start. Full and moving away, on middle and off, punched away to mid-off from the crease
ends with a sixer! But it doesn't matter for RCB. Full outside off, and Cutting slogs this over long off to finish the game on a semi-high. Royal Challengers Bangalore win by 14 runs!
excellent yorker! Ricochets it onto his toes while trying to squeeze this out
back of a length outside off, but Southee takes the pace off it. Pulled to cow corner, but these are consolation runs
full outside off, and the expansive drive takes the inside edge. Goes to square leg
full outside off, and Cutting drags the slog towards the leg side. Deceived by the slower ball, but enough power behind that shot to beat deep midwicket

Is that the game?! Full on off, and Hardik drills it straight to long on. Dives forward and takes an excellent tumbling catch. What a change in attitude though. Kohli took a similar catch two nights ago, but didn't show any emotion that evening. Today he's ecstatic
knee-high full toss outside off, and Cutting muscles a pull to cow corner. De Grandhomme saves some more runs in the deep with a sliding effort
full outside off, and all Hardik can do is muscle a drive to wide long off. His 2nd IPL fifty
full and wide outside off, and Hardik can't connect with the drive. Through to QDK on the full. Excellent ball given the game situation
that defied the laws of Physics! Full on leg stump, and Krunal got down on one knee to ramp it over fine leg. Takes the leading edge, and goes to wait for it point.
yorker just outside off, and Hardik does well to squeeze it past Krunal. But where's his bat?! It flew off his gloves and landed near the keeper. Sweaty evening

full toss on leg stump, and Krunal can't put it away. Hits his front leg as they scamper across for the run. Another run added to the extras. They're reviewing . Where's the impact?! Oh wow, it's an inside edge. Excellent from umpire Erasmus, who had given it a run in the first place anyway
slower ball outside off, and Krunal lifts this inside out over cover. Deep extra cover does well to race across and intercept
experience showing here! Yorker on middle stump, and all Krunal can do is dig it back to the bowler
yorker on middle stump, and Hardik does well to squeeze it down the ground. Kohli at long on
slower ball, on a good length on off stump. Mistimes his pull down the ground to long on
de Grandhomme saves a certain four! Great sliding effort at long off. The full ball was crunched past Southee, but his fellow New Zealander saves RCB three
slower ball, on off stump. It's angling across his body, but Krunal's leg-side heave is mistimed. Goes to long off instead
sliced inside out! Full outside off, and that's been muscled over the infield. Too much for wide long off to do
full toss on middle stump, and Krunal's leg-side push doesn't come off. Appeal for lbw by Siraj, but Erasmus thinks that was bat first. Yep, he's spot on
almost a yorker outside off, and Hardik does well to dig it out. The ball's going towards Krunal, and Siraj can't field it despite the effort
offcutter on leg stump, and Krunal comfortably flicks it to short fine leg. Calls early for the single
full outside off, and driven down the ground to long on. It's mistimed from Hardik
Siraj and wides. What a love story. Good length, but way outside off. Goes to QDK on the bounce
good length on off stump, and Krunal's leg-side pull takes a leading edge towards long off!
good length on middle stump, and Hardik flicks it fine with the ball going down the leg side. Short fine leg is too square!
good length outside off, and Hardik smothers it to cow corner. Calls nice and early for the second run
Lucky! Hardik'll take it. Good length on off, and his punch towards mid off takes the bat's inside edge. Short fine leg has no chance
slower ball, but overpitched on off. Drills it to cover and gives Hardik the strike
tries to be too cute! Good length on off, and the attempted late cut doesn't come off. Well taken by QDK
into the second tier! Full on leg stump, and Krunal takes a big step forward and muscles it over deep midwicket. It was the offcutter, and the batsman pounced onto that in a flash!
good length on leg stump, and Krunal backs away towards the leg side. Tries to fend it but takes the inside edge towards deep midwicket

full outside off, and that's been lifted over cover! In the air for a while, and drops between the three people in the deep. The ball changes direction after pitching, so Vohra's on all fours trying to stop the ball. Comedy of errors. Kohli won't find it funny though
good length outside off, but it's the offcutter. Cramped for room, and manages to only muscle it towards cover. The mistimed shot actually allows them to take the single with ease
misses the cut! Was wide outside off, and Hardik will be disappointed on missing out. Could've placed that anywhere behind square on the off side
back of a length on middle stump. Krunal stays on the back foot and punches it past the bowler's left. Man at long on though
full on middle stump, and that's been clipped off his toes to deep backward square. Only a single
good length outside off, and wide enough to cut it off the front foot. Man at deep extra cover though. Time out
offcutter on leg stump, and Krunal's deceived for the pace. Tried to pull but through his shot too early. De Kock can't grab onto it either, so Krunal manages to steal a run
full outside off stump, and that's been driven away from his body. Excellent work from Mccullum at cover
good length on middle, and that's been mistimed to square leg
good length on middle, and Pandya misses on drive. Inside edge onto his pads, and that's why the umpire says no to the lbw appeal
more extras! Good length on middle stump but swings down the leg side. QDK can't hold on to it, and that goes to the fine-leg boundary
short on off, but that's taken Hardik by surprise. Tried to pull, but it hits him hard on his right shoulder. That's gonna hurt. The physio's out and his brother comes to check on him as well
good length on leg, and Krunal shuffles across to the off side and paddles this fine. Virat was lurking at leg slip but just past his outstretched right hand. He's not happy
big appeal! But not given. Full on off, but Hardik misses the sweep. Would've missed off stump, reckons umpire Erasmus
beaut! Good length on middle, and spins across the batsman's body. Tried to defend off the front foot, but he's no where near the ball
full outside off, and Hardik judges this well. Spinning away from him, and too wide reckons the umpire. Shoulders his arms to the spiner
good length on off, and turning into Krunal's pads. Nudged off his pads to square leg
good length on off, and wild spin once again off the surface. Cuts this legspinner to deep extra cover. Gives his brother the strike
good length on middle, and it's the wrong'un! Comes sharply into his body and Hardik uncomfortably defends off the back foot

offcutter on middle stump. It's angling across his body, and Duminy cuts to deep point. He wants the second run, but that could be dangerous! QDK quickly takes the bails off, and we need the third umpire. He's gone! Bat on the line, but you know what they say, that crease belongs to the umpire. (adds a dollar to the cliche jar)
full on off, and that's been driven off the front foot. Straight to CDG though
good length outside off, and angling into Hardik. That allows him to pull to deep midwicket
back of a length on off, and too close to Hardik for the cut. Played straight to Kohli at cover point
full on off, and delivers the cutter this time. Duminy does well to judge the pace and pushes it past Hardik to long off
good length on off, and driven past the non-striker to long on for a walking single
good length on off, and cut off the back foot with the ball turning away from him. He'll keep strike
peach! Full on off and Pandya tries to defend off the front foot. But the ball grips the pitch and spins across his blade. Could've easily taken the outside edge
full outside off, and Duminy sweeps it to the man in the deep. Hands the strike back to Hardik
full on off, and Duminy comes dancing down the wicket. Drives to midwicket, but the fielder slides across the surface to stop it from going past him
full on off stump and Duminy carefully defends off the front foot
full on leg stump, and that's been driven past midwicket to the man in the deep. Nice crunching sound off the bat
good length on off and turning into his body. Worked off his hips to square leg for a walking single
full outside off, and that's in Hardik's arc. Gets down on one knee, and slogs it over deep midwicket. Sweeeet!
full just outside off, and that's been driven firmly off the front foot. Chase for de Grandhomme at deep point, but he does well to clean up
full on middle, and that's just a bit too full for Hardik. Clears his front leg and muscles it over midwicket. Two men in the deep, but bisects both of them
good length on off stump, and pushed off the back foot towards point. Dangerous single, but Hardik does well to scamper across to the other end
full on off, and spinning into Hardik. He gets down on one knee, and slog sweeps. Takes the top edge, but lands safe behind square
good length on off, and spinning away. Pandya gets onto the back foot and cuts to the man in the deep
full on middle, and Duminy takes a big stride forward to drive towards mid on
full on leg stump, and Pandya misses the on-drive. Hits his back leg and dribbles away towards short fine leg
drilled by Pandya. Full on off, and he gets his front foot out of the way before tonking this past Chahal. The bowler does well not to get his hands to it
good length on off, and once again spinning wildly after hitting the surface. Hardik's in no place to punch it towards cover
good length on leg stump, and that's been fended off the back foot towards midwicket
good length on middle stump, and Duminy's quick to gauge the length. Swivels and pulls this along the carpet to the deep backward-square boundary. The extra ball hurts Siraj
good length outside off, and that's been punched off the front foot to cover. Plays that while shuffling down the ground
full, and very wide outside off. Attempts a front-foot drive but can't connect. The ball's just inside the tramlines
good length on leg stump, and Duminy's leg-side flick comes off his bat's shoulder. The ball runs down to fine leg
tries the offcutter, but misses the line. Full on leg stump, and going past Duminy's pads
good length outside off, and angling into Hardik. Cut off the back foot to point for a quick run. Off the mark

soft dismissal! Edged to QDK. Good length outside off, and Pollard tries to play the late cut. The ball just about seams away after pitching and that induces the edge. Comfortably taken by the keeper and Siraj is ecstatic!
good length on off, and the batsman shuffles across to his left before blocking it towards the leg side. Sees the over out with caution
full on off stump, and Duminy's on the back foot. Fended with soft hands
fixes his line. Full on off, and Duminy's forced to defend off the front foot
good length on leg again, and once again spinning too much. More extras
goes between keeper and leg slip! Full on leg stump, but the legspin takes it down the leg side. QDK can't grab onto it either, and leg slip is too far away
good length on off, and Pollard shuffles across to the off side and works it off his pads to backward square leg
good length on off, and once again spinning away from Pollard. Tries to play a late cut, but takes the edge. QDK can't hold on! Dropped
crazy spin! Good length outside off, but sharp legspin after hitting the surface. Pollard just stayed on the back foot and let it go

overpitched outside off, and that's been drilled to McCullum at mid off. Could be a run out, but it's not a direct hit! Oh dear, no one's backing up either. Chahal and Siraj try hard to stop the ball near the boundary, but it's a futile attempt by both men. Free runs for Mumbai to end the Powerplay
back of a length outside off, and seaming slightly away after pitching. Pollard tries to pull again, but that shot's been eluding him all evening. Goes over his bat and through to QDK
back of a length on off, and punched off the back foot. Thick outside edge and dribbles away to point
good length outside off, and enough width for Pollard to chop this cut to third man. The fielder's pretty square in the deep
back of a length outside off, and Pollard tries to pull this over to the leg side. The ball stays slightly low and goes under his bat
lifted over mid off! Full just outside off, and that's pure muscle. Checks his drive, but hit off his bat's sweet spot
full on leg stump, and Duminy's on drive takes a leading edge! Falls short of cover though
back of a length outside off, and Pollard comes prancing down the wicket before flicking it off his pads to midwicket. No one there, so Siraj is forced to go chasing behind it
slower ball, but short outside off. Pollard thinks about pulling but chooses not to go through with the shot. Good choice. Earns him an extra run
good length on off, and Duminy stays on the back foot and cuts it behind square to the man in the deep
good length outside off stump, and that's been pulled along the ground to deep midwicket. Umesh Yadav's sliding effort helps RCB clean up well
good length just outside off, and Siraj takes the pace off this time. Duminy rides the bounce and fends it towards the leg side
good length on leg stump, and seam movement for Siraj. Angling across Duminy, and he defends it with soft hands off the back foot
good length outside off, and Pollard tentatively pokes at it. Tapped towards point and the fielders come swooping in
goes short again to finish the over, but wait, he's got to bowl that again. Too short on off stump, and it's too high even for the tall West Indian
good length on off, and angling sharply into his body. Tries to flick it towards short fine leg, but can't get bat on ball. Hits his thigh pad instead
good length on middle stump, and that's been worked off his hips to backward square leg

hits him just under his throat! Pollard doesn't react. Short on off, and Pollard takes a step forward before choosing not to duck. The ball's well directed and I can't believe Pollard shows no emotion

back of a length on off and that's nipped in sharply! Cuts the batsman in half, and the ball goes between bat and elbow. QDK dives to his left and takes a one hander and appeals for caught behind. The umpire says not out. QDK wants to review and yes! That's come off the inside shoulder of the bat. Big deflection

given lbw! Suryakumar's reviewing. Full just outside off, and he tries to paddle it towards the leg side. But he got his front leg across the stumps, and that's plumb if you miss the shot. The ball stayed slightly low, and replays say 'umpire's call'
full on middle stump, and that's been pushed off the front foot towards cover. Sky doesn't want the run
good length on off, and Duminy misses again! If this were baseball, he'd be struck out. Tried to defend it towards cover off the back foot
full on off and angling across Duminy's body. Tries to drive but goes across his bat's blade and through to the keeper
good length on off stump, and Duminy tries to chop it down fine to third man. Hurries onto him and he's too slow to get his bat to ball. Through to keeper
crunched! Full on off, Duminy gets onto the front foot, and drives it through cover. Full followthrough of the bat, and once the ball clears the infield, it's only has one place to go
full on middle stump, and Southee's still getting that beautiful shape into the left-hander. Driven off the front foot to mid off. Says no to the run
full outside leg stump, and it's the offcutter on this occasion. Goes down Duminy's leg side though
whipped! Full on middle stump, and Suryakumar uses his wrists to flick it over square leg. No one square in the deep either
good length on off, and Duminy taps it off the back foot with soft hands. It's going to point, but enough time to scamper across for the run
good length outside off, and enough width to free his arms. Stands tall and cuts it hard past the infield. No stopping that!
good length outside off, and once again shaping away. Tries to punch it off the back foot but it goes past his outside edge
full outside off, and angling further away. Duminy's happy to shoulder his arms and collect the extra run
good length on middle stump, and cramps Sky for room. Mistimes a shot off the back foot to short fine leg. Looked rather uncofrtable
good length on middle, but going down the leg side. Clipped off his hips to square leg

another duck for Kishan! Third duck in four innings. Full on off stump, and swings into Kishan's pads. He tries to drive towards mid on, but there's a big gap between bat and pad. The ball sneaks through and crashes into off middle stump. Perfect start for Bangalore
dropped at first slip! Tough chance. Good length on off, and that's squared the batsman. Tried to defend towards the leg side but takes the leading edge to slip. Vohra the guilty man
lovely! On a good length outside off, and just about shaping away from Yadav. He tried to defend off the back foot but didn't account for the swing. Just past his outside edge
too wide, and Suryakumar's seen enough! Big stride towards the off side, and thumps this drive between cover and extra cover. Glorious
full outside off again, and driven by Suryakumar off the front foot. The ball was swinging away, and the batsman did well to reach at it. Finds Kohli at cover though
full outside off, and shaping away from the batsman. Tries an expansive drive, but struck straight to point
The free-hit ball has also been sent to the boundary. Slower offcutter outside off, Colin reads it, winds up, and hoists it over the long-off boundary

short_text: McClenaghan to Grandhomme, (no ball) SIX runs
long_text: full-toss above the waist, Colin sizes it up and smacks it over square leg for another six
short and angling across off, toe-ended away to wide long-off
slower offcutter on of, Colin waits on it and then launches it hiiiiiiigh over midwicket. Huge six
short and angling across off, a mighty swing meets thin air. They sneak across for a bye
back of a length and angling across off, chopped to third man
back of a length and angling away outside off, run away through point
wide yorker, sneaks under the bat. De Grandhomme searches for a quick single but he has been sent back. Kishan can't throw down the stumps

Southee tees off but he can't clear the short boundaries at the Chinnaswamy either. Back of a length and outside off, Southee drags this slower ball to Cutting at long-on. Fine overhead catch from the Australian
full-toss on the hips, swatted away to deep midwicket
wide of the crease, another slower cutter, another swing and a miss. The crowd has been hushed into silence
slower cutter outside off, he swings early and does not connect
off-stump yorker, jammed out to short fine leg
Sundar is the third batsman holing out in the 18th over. Back of a length and outside off, Sundar swings across the line but can't clear deep midwicket. He picks out Rohit
slower offcutter, nips away outside off, Sundar hangs his bat out and is beaten by the change-up
back of a length and outside off, shuffles across and hoists it to deep square leg
back of a length on middle, kicks up, Sundar hangs back and pokes to the covers
Kohli holes out off the next ball, to wide long-on. Pandya hits a back of a length outside off, Kohli does not get on top of the bounce ends up splicing a catch to Pollard
Mandeep holes out to deep midwicket and slaps his bat on his helmet. Slower ball outside off, Mandeep goes low for a slog-sweep but ends up miscuing it to Suryakumar
off-stump yorker, squeezed to deep midwicket
really full and outside off, not quite a yorker, jammed back to Bumrah
slower ball outside off, Mandeep picks it up and smites it into the stands beyond midwicket. Nice, clean swing of the arms
back of a length and outside off, muscled away to deep midwicket
Mandeep rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and glides it down to deep third man
good length and holds its line outside off from wide of the crease, shovelled with the bottom hand to long-on
slower offcutter outside off, back of a length, kicks up, the batsman checks his punch and pushes to the covers. Only 25 runs off the last four overs
back of a length and angling in at off stump, Mandeep rolls his wrists, and pulls it away in the gap at square leg. First boundary after 21 balls for RCB
back of a length and wide outside off, Mandeep slashes and misses
slower one outside off, offcutter, bounces, spooned into the covers
Kohli forays down the track, knuckle ball, bounces and beats Kohli outside off
back of a length and just a shade outside off, helped off the face to third man
back of a length, slower ball outside off, Kohli delays his punch and finds cover. McClenaghan's offcutters are sticking in the pitch
slower cutter outside off, glided away to third man
short and outside off, guided to backward point

Hardik Pandya nails the stumps at the non-striker's end with an excellent direct hit. Back of a length and outside off, Baz jumps away outside leg and flat-bats to mid-off inside the circle. Baz and Kohli chance a single. Pandya gathers the ball quickly and hits the stumps to catch Baz short. He did not even ground his bat. Flat and accurate throw from Pandya
slower offcutter, bounces over middle, Baz does not read the change-up. He slogs early and misses
short and angling across off from over the wicket, flayed away to deep third man
Kohli steps out even before the bowler delivers, Bumrah drags his length back further, spliced over the bowler's head
back of a length and outside off, Kohli shovels it away to wide long-on

this a gem of a delivery from Bumrah! Back of a length, angling in from wide of the crease, sharp angle from Bumrah. Then straightens away outside off, past the outside edge. Ultra Edge detects a nick. Mumbai, however, did not go for a review. How costly will that turn out to be?
Baz backs away outside leg, Bumrah follows him, guided down to third man again
chest-high short ball on off or just a shade outside, Kohli is rushed for pace. He splices a pull over midwicket. Pandya runs in from the deep but the ball drops in front of him
back of a length and angling in from wide of the crease, Baz rides the bounce and guides it to deep third man
full on middle, spins away, dabbed into the covers
back of a length on off, fizzes off the pitch, and beats Baz's pull
back of a length and breaks away outside off, Baz, having pressed forward, goes back and dabs to cover
low-arm slider on the pads, 97ks, worked away through backward square leg
tossed up on the leg stump, Kohli flies down the track and sends the white ball flying into the stands beyond midwicket. Muscled away
full and slides in on middle, Kohli pokes the ball to cover
tossed up on the leg stump, full again, Baz stretches out, uses his reach to meet the pitch and sweep it flat and hard between deep backward square leg and deep midwicket
another half-tracker on middle, Baz sizes it up and thumps a pull to the left of the leg umpire
half-tracker on off stump, keeps low, Kohli adjusts and swats it away to wide long-on
too full on leg stump, Kohli stretches out but misses the sweep
back of a length and skids back in, cramps the batsman for room, turned away to the leg side
floated up outside off, Kohli comes down the track, nay runs down the track and belts it straight past the bowler and the umpire
good length, drifts in on middle, sticks in the pitch, Kohli spoons it in the air but to the right of short cover
tossed up and drifting down the leg side, Baz goes low and paddles it away, Bumrah at short fine leg bends to his right to stop the ball
skidding in on middle, inside-edged away behind square
opens the face and dabs it straight to short third man
low-arm slider, clipped away through backward square leg
full on off stump, this is a Kohli special. He backs away outside leg, collapses his back leg and drives it inside out over extra cover
wide of the crease, chest-hunting ball, angling in, Kohli rides the bounce and works the ball away through square leg
slower one, again, short, wide, flat-batted to the off-side sweeper now
Mid-off had just dropped back to the boundary before this ball, and Baz swats this knuckle ball away to the left of Suryakumar. He waits for the slower ball and forces it away
back of a length on middle, climbs over the stumps, as Baz swings hard, loses his shape, and misses
full-toss on middle stump, Baz ventures across off stump, goes low, and scoops the free-hit ball over the keeper's head like a boss for six. 13 runs off one legal ball

short_text: Pandya to McCullum, (no ball) SIX runs
long_text: Baz charges down the track, Hardik darts a chest-high full-toss, spliced up and over the keeper. Hits the ad boards on the flush. That's six. The crowd finds its voice again
short and on off, Kohli drops the ball to backward point and sets off for a risky single. Baz jams his bat into the ground and loses his bat. A direct hit from Duminy could have had McCullum
Markande tosses it up on middle, full, played back to the bowler
full legbreak, spins away outside off, driven down to wide long-off

a bit too full for the sweep, Vohra is beaten and has been given out lbw by umpire Erasmus. Did that pitch in line? Vohra chats with Baz and calls for a review. Think it pitched just outside leg and pinned the front pad. Ultra Edge does not detect an inside snick. The tracker suggests it pitched on leg stump and would have clipped the outside of the leg stump. Vohra has to go. Over to Kohli to rescue RCB again
nice and full outside off, Vohra stretches out, uses his reach and nails a slog-sweep over the short leg-side boundary. Launches it over midwicket
pushed through on leg stump, Baz rolls his wrists and reverse-sweeps it away to the off-side sweeper
very full and outside off, shovelled with the bottom hand to long-on
good length and rips away outside off, beats the outside edge again
full, drifts in at off, then spins away sharply to leave Baz overbalanced. Kishan whips the bails off but Baz drags his back foot in time
very full on middle, rolls his wrists and sweeps to deep square leg
dragged down outside off, goes on the back foot and chops to sweeper cover
full and on off, played back to the bowler
flighted on the leg stump, hint of extra bounce, beats the sweep and rolls away to short fine leg off the thigh pad
googly? Good length, spins in, bounces, lobs it to the leg side
good length outside off and breaks away, big-turning legbreak, beaten past the outside edge
looks like a googly, comes in to catch the pad and roll away fine on the leg side
back of a length on off, spins away, defended
fired on a back of a length and just a shade outside off, Baz brings out the reverse-swat right away and finds the gap between slip and short third man. What a way to get off the mark
back of a length and spins away outside off, skewed off to the leg side
back of a length and skidding into the pads, picked off through midwicket
full and spins away outside off, dragged across the line and against the turn to wide long-on
pushed through on off, presses forward and bunts to point
slower through the air and breaks away outside off, big swing and a miss
full and drifts in on middle, nurdled to square leg
flighted on middle, full, backs away and drives it to sweeper cover, where Pollard puts in a sliding save to his left

back of a length and outside off, offcutter it is, swatted away away in the air, did that carry to short midwicket? The soft signal is out. TV umpire called in. Rohit bends low at short midwicket and wraps his fingers around the ball. Excellent low catch from the Mumbai captain. De Kock just could not time the ball tonight. He simply dragged it away
slower cutter, 119.8ks, slides down leg. Re-set the radar, Mitch

short_text: McClenaghan to de Kock, no run
long_text: De Kock makes room again. McClenaghan hits the blockhole and keeps de Kock quiet

short_text: McClenaghan to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: De Kock manufactures swinging room by backing away outside leg again. Banged in short and outside off, he stretches out and carves it up and over backward point

short_text: McClenaghan to de Kock, no run
long_text: another slower offcutter outside off, 127ks, de Kock does not read it. He slogs waaaay too early and is beaten lavishly

short_text: McClenaghan to de Kock, no run
long_text: De Kock makes room and steps out, McClenaghan chases him, cramps him for room, and hits the thigh pad

short_text: McClenaghan to de Kock, no run
long_text: slower offcutter outside off, back of a length, steps away and flat-bats it down to long-off
back of a length and breaks away outside off, de Kock ventures deep in the crease and chops it away to sweeper cover
shorter and spins back in on off, Vohra stands tall and punches it down the ground to long-on. Vohra has hit 27 off 11 balls from Duminy
Make that four boundaries in four balls. Tossed up wide outside off, this was pushed away from his swinging arc, but Vohra collapses his back leg and laces it inside-out over extra cover
Vohra hits a hat-trick of boundaries. Duminy loses his line, length, and his head. Back of a length and sprayed wide outside off, swatted across the line to the midwicket boundary
fuller and just a shade outside off, Vohra aims for another loft again, this time he slices it over mid-off. This goes all the way
tossed on off stump, Vohra ventures down the track, manufactures a half-volley and lofts it straight of mid-on. Lovely swing of the arms

short_text: Bumrah to de Kock, no run
long_text: slower ball, back of a length, climbs over middle stump as De Kock swings early and misses again

short_text: Bumrah to de Kock, no run
long_text: De Kock clears his front leg, backs away outside leg, this is fuller and nipping away outside off. De Kock throws his bat at the ball but does not make contact
keeps it on a back of a length, the line is outside off, Vohra rides it down to deep third man
back of a length and angling away just a shade outside off, possibly a slower ball, de Kock waits on it before dabbing it to the leg side with soft hands
back of a length on middle, nearly 145ks, Vohra dares to step down the track and only drags it off the inside half past the right of mid-on
back of a length and outside off from wide of the crease, punched through the line to extra cover

short_text: McClenaghan to de Kock, no run
long_text: McClenaghan hits a hard length on off - neither driveable nor pullable - patted to the off side

short_text: McClenaghan to de Kock, no run
long_text: full nip-backer from McClenaghan, de Kock is late onto it as the ball skids off the pitch. He squirts an inside edge onto the pad and weathers an lbw appeal
full and veering into the pads, picked up and lifted over midwicket
back of a length, slower offcutter, sticks in the pitch, bounces, Vohra closes the face early and pops a leading edge to cover
back of a length and angling across off stump, Vohra has a mighty whoosh at it  and only collects fresh air. He attempts a leg-side slog and loses his shape
back of a length and angled in on middle, punched off the back foot to midwicket
79ks, tossed up and spins back in sharply with extra bounce. Cramps the batsman for room. Awkwardly fended off to the leg side
very full and darted onto the pads, picked off to short fine leg
shorter and sliding away outside off, jabbed to the covers off the back foot
back of a length, Duminy finds turn again and catches the batsman on the crease. Hits the thigh and would have missed the leg stump
quicker, faster, and sliding into the pads, Vohra drops down to one knee and smokes a slog-sweep over the square-leg boundary. Bam!
loopy on the middle and leg, spins in, catches the pad and rolls away behind square on the leg side
almost in the blockhole again, this one's angled into the pads, and it's squeezed out through midwicket
wide yorker, very good from Ngidi, squeezed out to cover
backs away again but this time it's a fuller ball and his attempt to drill it through the off side results in an inside edge to short midwicket. Game over if the next two balls are legal
backs away again to a short of a length delivery and just chips it over the in-field to scamper back for two
length ball, angled down the leg side as the batsman backs away. Pressure getting on to Ngidi

is that a six? Yes, it is. Shankar with some timely blows here but have they come too late? Short of a length, he backs away to give himself room and heaves it over cow corner. DD need at least three more of these
short of a length outside off, punched to extra cover who moves to the right and cuts it off
short of a length, drifts it too far across as he sees the batsman back away
slower length ball again from Bravo. Shankar is ready for it, and pounces on it as he carts it over long-on
full toss, angled in, and he fails to whip it away as he wears it on the pad
now he switches over to a short length and Shankar crunches a pull over deep midwicket. Bravo getting his lengths all wrong at the death  but CSK still well ahead
full outside off, slower ball as he rolls his fingers over it, and Shankar lofts it clean and straight over long-on
sprayed down the leg side
short of a length, angled across, drags a pull off the toe-end to long-on
back of a length, backs away and slaps down the ground
short ball, backs away and swings, and makes no contact
Dhoni runs back and fails to get his hands on it. Just brushes the glove as he's backtracking after Shankar gets a top-edge on the pull after getting tucked up on the pull

has he picked out the fielder here? Yes, he has. Short and angled across, Pant tries to slap it and ends up skewing it off the lower part of the bat as Jadeja runs forward from sweeper cover and snaffles it
fullish, angled across, Pant stays stapled to the crease and swings and misses
short and angled across, Pant fetches a pull from outside off and ends up dragging it to long-on
leg-side length ball, Shankar backs away and cops it on the pad as he misses his flick
low full toss on middle, Pant smokes it past long-on. One-bounce over the boundary. But is it a boundary too late?
tries a reverse paddle, and gets it well past Dhoni despite not middling it too well
extremely full outside off, Pant drills it out to mid-off
back of a length on leg stump, that's a poor line again, and Pant just helps it along through fine leg as he swivels through
short ball, gets a little big on Pant as he sways away and tries to pull, makes no decent contact
Shankar slaps at the sight of width but it only goes so far as sweeper cover on the bounce
can't bowl there at this stage of the innings. A fuller ball on the pads, and Pant whips it off them over deep midwicket
oh, shot. Falls over as he shuffles across and paddles it away. Off the inside part of the bat, and that actually works to his favour as he gets it finer of short fine leg
full and angled across, hammered away wide of long-off

sloppy effort from Rayudu gives Pant his fifty. Launches this fuller one without much timing straight over. Rayudu runs across from long-off and slides across and sticks one hand out and lets it go through
short ball, Shankar can't get on top of that as he pulls away to midwicket
full toss, whips powerfully to long-on and Jadeja runs to his left and makes a brilliant stop sliding across
full on the pads, clipped away to backward square leg
length ball, drags a pull with no timing to long-on
length ball, flicked to midwicket
fullish length, angled in towards middle and off, drilled to long-on
length ball, no room as it angles into him, but he makes use of the inward curve to launch it over long-on
yorker outside off, clipped off the pads through the gap between midwicket and mid-on
length, flicked from outside off to midwicket
in the air and just short. Miscues a pull off the bottom part of the bat and it lobs in the air. Karn Sharma at short third man sprints forward but it drops just short of him
sprays it on a leg-stump line and Shankar whips it off the inner part of the bat past Dhoni to fine leg
unleashes a late cut at this short and wide delivery and Raina at point half-stops it with a big dive to his left
that's as flat a six as you'll ever see. Floated up outside off, Pant gets down for a slog, fetches it from outside off and it sails flat over long-on
advances down the ground and the bowler shortens his length, pats it out to point
throws hard hands at a wide back of a length delivery and slaps it to cover
gets down for a big slog and gets an inside-edge to the back thigh
short of a length, leg-sidish, tries to tuck and gets hit on the pad as the ball trickles away to short fine
length on middle and leg, flicked to midwicket
very full on the stumps, Pant drills it straight to long-on with force
back of a length, slid across too much and goes away outside off
length ball outside off, opens the face and drops to point
full and outside off, laced down to long-on
short and outside off, scythed away to point, the ball bursts through his hands
tossed up outside off, skies a slog-sweep over midwicket
worked to midwicket
flighted and spins away outside off, flat-batted down to wide long-off
back of a length offbreak outside off, slugged away to midwicket
101.5ks, fired outside off, Pant charges down the track, gets under it and smokes it over midwicket for a mighty six
slides on outside off, opens the face and dabs to short third man
back of a length and skids in to hit the thigh
103ks, short dart outside off, Pant shuffles across off, falls on the floor but still muscles it over midwicket
flighted and outside off, driven down to long-off
steps out and whips it away to deep midwicket
tossed up on off, presses forward and bunts it to cover
leg-side wide
shortish and outside off, chopped hard but straight to point
slides on outside off, whipped away to midwicket
back of a length and spins in on off, punched back to the bowler
pushed through outside off, keeps low, Shankar goes low with it to keep it out
looped up full and wide outside off, presses out and drives it down to long-off
good length and just a shade outside off, inches forward and pats it to cover
Jadeja rattles Maxwell's stumps with a 100.3ks dart. Good length and slides in from around the wicket, Maxwell swings down the wrong line and only collects fresh air
Jadeja ventures short and wide outside off, Maxwell frees his arms and laces a cut to the left of short cover
sliding away outside off from round the wicket, punched down to wide long-on
round-arm slider, finishes on the pads, clipped through square leg
pushed through on off, Maxwell presses forward and taps it back to the bowler
back of a length on top of off, Maxwell sits back and punches it down to long-off
shortish and outside off, chopped away to backward point
dropped short and outside off, Pant slashes at it and under-edges it behind
shorter and outside off, swatted through the line to cover
full on middle, tipped to the leg side. Pant attempts a non-existent single now but is sent back
tossed up outside off, Pant reaches out for a drive and inside-edges it back onto the pads

Awful mix-up between the wickets, and Iyer has been dismissed. This was on a length and outside off, hint of turn, Iyer stretches out and pushes it to the right of Watson at short cover. He goes for an non-existent single, he is halfway down the pitch, Pant sends him back. Not enough time to undo his steps. Dhoni delays taking the bails off. Bring on Thanos, please
dragged short and outside off, Pant uses his feet and forces it down to long-on
fired outside off, 100ks, hint of turn, driven with the spin to sweeper cover off the front foot
good length and outside off, tapped down to long-on
back of a length again, slides in on middle, Iyer punches a single down to long-on
back of a length and skidding into the pads, Pant hangs back and clips the ball through square leg
another slower ball on middle, Pant reads it, drops it to the off side and scampers across for a single
back of a length on off, Iyer allows the ball to come onto him, then lets it slide off the face to Rayudu at short third man
kicks up from a back of a length outside off, Iyer has a loose waft at it and is beaten on the outside edge
slower cutter on middle, tip and run to point
back of a length and outside off, slower one, Pant delays his cut and carves it between slip and backward point. Ten off two balls
whoa, what a way to get off the mark. Length ball outside off, Pant plants his front leg, extends his hands, and punches it up and over the wide long-on boundary

The back-of-a-length ball works for Asif and CSK again. That's the right length to bowl here in Pune. Munro shimmies out again, Asif pulls his length back and attacks the body of Munro. He aims to slog it away but only toe-ends it to Karn at deep midwicket
banged in short and angling away outside off, Munro was waiting for this length. He upper-cuts it over Watson at slip for a flat six. The ball hits the ad boards on the flush
half-volley outside off, Munro clears his front leg and simply blasts it past the bowler with immense bottom-hand power
slower, short ball outside off, 111.5ks, Munro shapes for the cut. He waits for the ball to arrive then scythes it up and over backward point
short on off, tucks the batsman for room, played back to the bowler
back of a length on the hips, 140.3ks, clipped away to long leg

Munro shimmies out again, this time he clears mid-on. He manufactures a half-volley by venturing out of the crease. Dragged from outside off over mid-on. Munro did not middle it but he will not complain
back of a length and outside off, Munro throws his bat at the ball  and misses
Watson errs too full and outside off, Munro shimmies out, picks it up and swats it across the line over midwicket. He watches the ball sail over the short leg-side boundary
straying into the pads, tucked away to fine leg
Watson bangs it short and outside off, Iyer can't get on top of it. Splices a pull over midwicket
back of a length and angling across off, quietly dabbed to point
Iyer backs away again, Ngidi follows him and cramps him for room. Played back to the bowler
Iyer backs away outside leg and manufactures swinging room. Ngidi goes shorter and wider outside off. Iyer still reaches out and slaps it through the covers like a boss
117ks slower ball kicks up outside off and foxes Iyer
short, wide, flayed down to deep third man
back of a length and just a shade outside off, nearly 140ks, cramps the batsman for room, chopped to cover
picked off the pads to fine leg
full and skidding in on off, 142ks, tip and run to point
very full and attacking the stumps, 141.6ks, defended back

Asif bounces out Shaw. He runs in hard and hits the pitch harder. Dug in short on off stump, 141.9ks, rushes Shaw into a pull. He is late onto it and splices an overhead catch to Jadeja, who runs to his right from mid-off and pouches it safely. CSK's gun fielder. CSK's specialist fielder? Asif soaks in his maiden IPL wicket
overpitched on middle at 140.7ks, Shaw stays still and belts it right over Munro's head for an authoritative four
bouncer, angled in on middle, 138.6ks, forces Shaw to duck under it
on a length and outside off, 139.7ks, Shaw lines up for a loft but miscues it off the toe end to the right of mid-off
back of a length at 140ks but he slides it down the leg side for wide
back of a length, slanted across, another swing and a miss. Good start on his debut for Ngidi
short of a length on middle and off, punched back from the crease
short outside off, beaten for pace and late on the pull
advances down the ground and swings wildly with the ball slanted across him, nowhere near it as he misses
shortish, angled across off, Munro jumps and blocks
gets on top of a shortish delivery and nudges to the point region
full outside off, Dhoni slaps it to the left of long-off to finish the innings and a 22-ball half-century

has that been dropped? Ok, wait, is that a runout? Yes, it is. Lots of things happened there. Dhoni got a glove as he tried to pull this short ball and Pant drops it after diving to his left. Rayudu, in the meantime, has crossed over to the other end enthusiastically looking for a single only to find that Dhoni hasn't so much as moved a toe. All he can do then is sprint back to his end but then Boult nails a direct hit
slapped right past the bowler. Boult, predictably, shortens his length, and Dhoni steps down the track and hammers it past the bowler's left

full toss again. These are all attempts at yorkers that are going horribly wrong. Daredevils having a tough time against the best death-overs batting unit this season. Dhoni swipes and pummels it over deep midwicket
low full toss outside off, drilled to long-off
walks across outside off and tries to sweep but the ball sneaks past, just past the leg stump

short_text: Avesh Khan to Dhoni, SIX runs
long_text: that's perhaps the biggest of the night. A full toss outside off, Dhoni whips it with powerful wrists and sends it soaring over backward square leg. Way, way back into the stands. Also ruins what had been a good over for Daredevils

short_text: Avesh Khan to Dhoni, no run
long_text: left alone outside off but that's perfectly legal. Well inside the line
full outside off, carved away over the in-field to sweeper cover
full outside off, bottom-handed shovel to long-off
low full toss outside off, walks across and mistimes an attempt at a heave to send it along the ground to wide long-on
sees the batsman walk across and bowls it too wide outside his off-stump

dropped. Colin Munro puts down a straightforward catch. He had to move a little to his left alright, but he did well to get behind it and then just lets it pop out. A mistimed pull from Dhoni that led to all of that drama
now he swings blindly at a delivery outside off that's just short of a good length and gets an outside edge that flies between the keeper and a short third man that's more fine than usual
huge strike. Too full, too straight, Rayudu advances and gets right underneath it before shovelling it straight over
short on off, whips it away with a flat bat to backward square leg. Straight to the fielder but there aren't too many that can get one over on Dhoni when he decides to take off for a run
slower length ball at 123.1ks, Rayudu makes a little room and slaps it through cover
another early shuffle, and Daredevils honestly aren't doing enough to make late adjustments. It's a short of a length delivery that's just too straight, and Rayudu pulls to deep fine leg
shortish outside off, gets on top of it and dabs it away towards short third man
gets down to a reverse sweep but to the wrong length. It's a length ball outside off and the ball sneaks past

Rayudu takes a leaf out of Dhoni's book and walks across too. It's an attempted yorker gone wrong as it ends up being a low full toss. Rayudu doesn't quite muster up the same power as Dhoni but it's enough, nevertheless, to carry the ball to long-on
again walks across even before Boult takes his jump. It's a length ball around middle and leg, and Dhoni flicks it away to the fine leg region
shuffles across early to a short ball and gets tucked up for room as a result as he gets a top-edge. Pulled through deep square leg
more brawn from Dhoni. Another bottom-handed jab as the bowler overcompensates and bowls it fuller outside his off-stump. Smashed over long-on
that's just been jabbed with brute force. A short delivery sitting up nicely around the sixth-stump channel, and Dhoni shovels a pull with terrific bottom-handed power
really full on off stump, clipped through midwicket
tossed up and spins away outside off, Dhoni races down the track, meets the pitch of this legbreak and launches it over the long-off boundary
half-tracker outside off, Rayudu pulls against the break and ends up dragging it away to wide long-on
low full-toss on middle, Dhoni hangs back and simply bunts it down to long-on
fired on a back of a length on middle, Dhoni steps out and hacks it to midwicket off the inside half. He tears back for the second
full legbreak, driven with the spin from outside off to sweeper cover

short_text: Avesh Khan to Dhoni, no run
long_text: very full and outside off, 143.1ks, Dhoni opens the face and searches for the gap but drives the ball straight to backward point
137.8ks full-toss on off, above the waist? Tight call. Spliced towards midwicket
low full-toss outside off, forced away to the left of long-off

short_text: Avesh Khan to Dhoni, 1 leg bye
long_text: dug in short and skidding into the body, Dhoni aims a pull and is caught in a tangle. He misses the ball but hares across for the leg bye even as Avesh runs in and swoops down on the ball. The throw from Avesh is so very wide of the stumps at the non-striker's end
wide yorker, squeezed through the covers for one
Dhoni gets on top of a short ball outside off and punches through the line to the man on the sweeper boundary
full and flat on middle, driven along to long-off

Mishra does well to float this up to Watson and entice him. But he's taken this away from him with some drift in the air, and it results in Watson skewing a lofted strike off the outside part of the bat. Into the hands of long-off
advances down the ground to a length ball and punches to long-on
full on leg stump, clipped away behind square for one
short of a length, no turn as it comes on with the arm, pulled away to deep midwicket
full and sliding towards leg, Rayudu gets down and crunches a sweep through fine leg
another wide half-volley, Watson simply opens up his arms and smashes it through extra cover on the up
full and shaping away, again too much drift away from the right-hander. Boundaries can do that to you
full toss that slips out of the hand, chases it and ekes out an outside edge that runs away to third man, beating deep backward point running to his left
Rayudu tries to slog from outside off and ends up dragging it down to long-on off the inside of the bat
sees the batsman advancing and takes it away from him but drifts away too much outside off
full with enough room outside off, Rayudu steps down the track and shovels this over extra cover
same delivery this time, beaten for pace and room as he swings and misses
short, bounces over his bat as he slashes outside off
length ball on off, punched down to long-on
back of a length, minimal turn this time, worked away into the leg side
back of a length, spins in slightly, flicked through midwicket
fullish length around off, Watson nudges into the leg side
full outside off, driven down to long-on

an ugly swipe across the line sees the back of Raina. Nicely floated up around his off-stump, and Raina is expecting it to turn away. But it simply slides in with the arm and beats the inside edge before clattering into off-stump

du Plessis holes out to long-off. Not his most fluent inning, a run-a-ball 33 when the team's going nearly at 10 an over. Lofts this fuller one but the bat turns in his hands as long-off grabs it reverse-cupped
another fuller ball, du Plessis heaves it over the extra cover region and it lands between that fielder running back and long-off running to his left

short_text: Shankar to du Plessis, no run
long_text: full, a little too wide of him, and he slashes and misses
another full toss but he can't maximise the free-hit. Shovels at it but without a lot of timing it only goes on the bounce to long-off

short_text: Shankar to du Plessis, (no ball) 1 run
long_text: that's going to be a no-ball. Du Plessis pulls this high full toss into the hands of deep midwicket who doesn't have to move an inch. But that's well over waist height
throws his hands at a fuller one outside off and drives uppishly to sweeper cover
back of a length on off, leans back and punches down to wide long-on
darted full on off, smeared away past the non-striker to wide long-on
fired outside off, 103ks, hit down to long-on

short_text: Mishra to du Plessis, no run
long_text: off-stump yorker, surprises Faf, jammed out
skids on middle, full, tapped down to long-on

short_text: Tewatia to du Plessis, no run
long_text: looks like a googly, Faf steps out and wears it on the pad
backs away and punches down to long-off
fuller and on middle, Watson stretches out, meets the pitch and nails another slog-sweep, this sails waaaaay over midwicket. He has hit seven sixes already
slides in, Faf sweeps and misses
quicker one, hit down to long-on

half-tracker on leg stump, feeds Watson's strength again. Watson drops down to one knee and smokes a slog-sweep over square leg. Raina stands up and applauds from the dug out. Watson raises a 25-ball fifty
quick wrong'un, following Faf who was jumping outside leg, cramps him for room, jabbed to mid-off

short_text: Mishra to du Plessis, no run
long_text: loopy legbreak outside off, spins away sharply, drags out Faf into a sweep and beats him
tossed up slower and higher outside off, Watson stretches out and drives a single to wide long-off
another slider just outside off, Watson pushes it back to Mishra
tossed on middle, no turn again, driven with the wrists to wide long-on
length ball, slides in on middle from over the wicket, worked into the leg side off the back foot

short_text: Plunkett to du Plessis, no run
long_text: slower cutter outside off, grips in the surface, Faf throws his bat at the ball and does not make contact
back of a length and outside off, Watson runs it down to third man
half-volley on the pads, Watson loves it there, he picks it up and flicks it up and over backward square for a flat six
overpitched and outside off, looks like a cross-seamer, Watson lunges forward, gets under the length and launches it over Plunkett's head. Watson holds his shape like a boss
Faf ventures outside leg, slogs to leg, ends up toe-ending a single to mid-off
full and wide outside off, Watson stretches out and slices a single down to third man

short_text: Avesh Khan to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: 140.5ks, short and angled into the body, Faf is tucked up for room. He miscues a pull but does it fine of short fine leg to close out the Powerplay with four. Just like that CSK have taken 31 off the last two overs

short_text: Avesh Khan to du Plessis, no run
long_text: overpitched and outside off, Faf backs away and belts it straight to the covers
good length and angling into the pads, twirled away through square leg

short_text: Avesh Khan to Watson, no run
long_text: follows the short ball with a full inswinger, jammed out

short_text: Avesh Khan to Watson, SIX runs
long_text: Watson has top-edged it and fetches a six. Chest-high short ball outside off, Watson can't get on top of the bounce. He swings his hands at a pull anyway and skies it to Mars. It drops down beyond the wide long-on boundary

short_text: Avesh Khan to Watson, no run
long_text: on a length and outside off, sticks in the pitch, dabbed to point

short_text: Plunkett to du Plessis, SIX runs
long_text: on a length and outside off, but Faf had jumped across off even before Plunkett had delivered. Merrily scooped away fine of short fine leg.
good length on off, tip and run to mid-off
very full and veering into the pads, Watson picks it up, twirls his wrists and lifts it over midwicket. He exploits the short leg-side boundary, again
hip-high short ball outside off, you've got to get it up higher, Mr. Plunkett. Watson lines it up and pulls it disdainfully over the midwicket boundary. Bam!
on a length and just a shade outside off, tapped back to the bowler
short and skidding into the leg stump, turned to square leg for one
Faf moves away outside leg again, Tewatia now follows him with a 90kph dart, which is dragged away to wide long-on

short_text: Tewatia to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: Tewatia goes short on middle, Faf jumps away outside leg, collapses his back leg and laces it inside-out over extra cover
tossed on middle and leg, non-turner, nurdled through the gap at midwicket
really full on middle and leg, driven down to long-on
floats a legbreak outside off, dabbed with the break to backward point
sliding into the pads, worked off the back foot wide of square leg
141ks full-toss wide outside off, Watson reaches out for the ball but misses again. Dhoni slapped a similar full-toss over the point boundary the other night at the Chinnaswamy
pretty full and zipping through outside off at nearly 143ks, Watson has a big drive at it and only collects fresh air
deft touch from Watson. 142.7ks, back of a length and outside off, Watson uses the pace of Boult to his advantage and glides it to the left of backward point for four

short_text: Boult to du Plessis, 1 leg bye
long_text: good length and zipping into the pads from around the stumps, the ball is skipping off the pitch, deflected away to fine leg

short_text: Boult to du Plessis, no run
long_text: pitched up and slanting away outside off, lovely flow of the hands through the line but Faf's drive finds cover

short_text: Boult to du Plessis, FOUR runs
long_text: full and angling away wide outside off, Faf reaches out for the ball with his hands and carves it away fine of deep third man. Beats Avesh to his left in the deep

short_text: Avesh Khan to du Plessis, 1 run
long_text: pretty full on middle, tapped down to mid-on for one more

short_text: Avesh Khan to du Plessis, no run
long_text: short and width outside off, Faf crunches it into the ground, bounces over to cover-point

short_text: Avesh Khan to du Plessis, no run
long_text: Faf marches down the track even before the bowler delivers, short and wide, flat-batted away only as far as the covers

short_text: Avesh Khan to du Plessis, no run
long_text: hustled for pace. This cut back in from length to beat the inside edge and hit him high on the thigh pad. There was a stifled appeal but this was going over.

short_text: Avesh Khan to du Plessis, no run
long_text: beaten by a fiery back of length delivery outside off, superb carry. He's hitting 140kph plus already

short_text: Avesh Khan to du Plessis, no run
long_text: back of length on a fourth-stump line, defended
very full and swinging into the pads, flicked to deep midwicket

short_text: Boult to du Plessis, no run
long_text: good length and sliding away outside off, no shot
fullish and angling across off, squirted down to third man
pitched up at off, presses forward and pushes to cover
lbw appeal followed by a four. Another inswinger, veers onto the pads, picked off to the square leg boundary

all action first-up. Inswinger from Trent Boult. Not given. Iyer reviews. Good length and snakes back in, Watson plays around his front pad - like he has done for the most of his career - and is pinned below the knee-roll. Pitching in line: check. Hitting the stumps: check. The tracker returns three reds. There was an inside edge but bat first or pad first? There is no conclusive evidence to overturn the on-field not-out call. This was really tight but Watson survives in the end

Gill hits the winning runs, takes his helmet off immediately and swings his bat in the air with his right arm, such passion! Gets a hug from Lynn. Short and wide, he stays on top the ball and cuts it square and fast
little full towards the pads and it's worked to leg for one

what a catch by Kohli! DK lofted it straight down yet again, Kohli's eyes spot it and he sprints across full speed in front and to his left from long on. Puts in a full-length dive just in time and gets both his hands under the ball
he's hitting those drives and pulls so well, tries a reverse paddle now and misses
lands it short this time, and DK pulls it square for two more
oh my, how did he hit that! It was a short of length ball, mid off was in and DK lofted it straight over his head for a six!
slices that one high on the off side and it lands beyond backward point, wide of sweeper cover for two
low full toss lofted down the ground, long off runs to his right and they come back for the second easily
chips the fullish ball down to long on
it's a slow and short cutter, short enough for DK to pivot on the back foot and pull it fine behind square. It's beaten depe fine leg too. The captain is not wasting any time here

We have a direct hit and the third umpire comes into play, but he's safe. DK closed the face of the bat to tuck the ball to leg with soft hands and said "two" repeatedly as Vohra rain in from the leg side, they can back just in time
full and wide, drives that away to deep cover for one
the big back lift sees the low full toss with a wobbly seam outside off and he whacks it straight down to beat long on. Strong arms and shoulders coming into play
two full to DK, he brings out the cover drive and drills that along the ground, just wide of deep cover. Four!

Southee has a shy at the stumps from point, he can see only one of them and he misses as Lynn is miles away, he finally makes it and then even comes back for the overthrow. DK drove that straight to point and took off, Lynn wasn't sure and was nearly stuck on the pitch but DK was a long way down before Southee misses. No back up, little more mix up and that's two runs
gets the wide yorker right this time and Lynn jams his bat in for a single to deep point
sends a wide on the off side, outside the tramlines

gone first ball on his 30th birthday! The crowd has come alive, I tell you. Siraj banged it in and Russell went hard at it with a swing of the arms, got only a top edge and de Kock ran a long way back to complete a superb catch

Chahal gets to the ball but it's gone for four! It was full outside off, Rana jammed his bat in to steer it just behind square to make Chahal run to his left from third man. He rolled to get his hands on the ball, but it went through
uses a strong bottom hand to drill that through the covers. Have to settle for one
tries the wide yorker and it's gone a bit too wide
goes down on a knee as the ball turns in and he paddle-scoops that fine and high to the fine-leg boundary
tries to sweep that one from waaayy outside off against th turn and QdK can't hold on to it, bye

excellent running effort to catch that at deep cover but it's jut out of his reach! Rana didn't pick that googly, he miscued that with a leading edge and it went very high, Umesh ran a long way to his left, put in a dive but can't blame him for not taking that
sweeps that to chip it in the air towards the vacant area in square leg
superb wrong'un, Lynn sweeps as usual and that turns in dangerously to just miss the off stump
chops the ball off the back foot to point and say "no"
tucks the ball with the angle to leg for one
pivots on the back foot to pull, it's a slow bouncer and Rana mistimes it completely, it hits his arm and they run across for one
big heave for the fullish ball around off, doesn't middle but sends it to long on
short enough for Rana to stay back and punch it square for one
looked like an offcutter outside off, Rana gets a thick inside edge to cover
too short, Rana rocks back and pulls it to deep midwicket
sweeps away to bring up his fifty with that single

excellent effort from Umesh at deep fine leg. The flat delivery on middle and leg was swept again and past short fine leg, Umesh ran across from deep backward square and rolled along to get both hands on it
reverse-sweeps this time from middle and leg, straight to short third man
full delivery just outside off, misses the sweep this time, good reply from Chahal
a bit too short and Lynn puts his knee down and sweeps that with some power, from outside off and it's raced to the square-leg boundary. Wasn't too far from the umpire
he is sweeping everything. Pitched up outside off but Lynn plants his long leg across and sweeps
much flatter and quicker, Lynn tries to sweep again and misses!
sweeps it in the air  but it lands safely beyond square leg as Lynn went a fair bit across to off
a wrong'un around off and he goes back to push it into the covers for one

the flight has worked, he holes out to long on! It was pitched up with a lot of revs, Uthappa got near the ball nicely, struck it hard and straight but Southee was waiting there at long on with his long arms. Ashwin is pumped!
too much flight, too wide outside off with the turn and it's a wide
nicely flighted outside off, Lynn moves towards the ball and bunts it down to long on

two from five balls and a short ball to end the over. That's sailed over square leg into the crowd! Uthappa did a little pivot on the back foot for the short one, and opened himself up to pull-swat that away
nice and straight towards the off stump, Uthappa says 'wait' after steering that to midwicket
short and wide at 113kmh, thrashed to deep point with those strong arms
that's a mean bouncer towards Lynn and he just about sways his head out of the line of the ball. One for the over
runs the short of length ball down to third man nicely
starts with a full delivery and Uthappa drives it back
brings it shorter and he goes back in the crease to whip it to leg for one
beaten outside off! Beautiful leg break from Chahal around middle and off, tempting Uthappa to lean forward and defend, and then it turns away past the outside edge
takes a step towards the off side and sweeps it hard against the spin to deep midwicket
pushes this one with the turn to off for one
what a beauty! You pitch it up to Uthappa and he will swing that bat absolutely straight and with such elegance. It goes straight and high for six
sweeps that one from outside leg to deep fine leg right from the middle of the bat
shortish again, pulled again but to deep midwicket this time
too short, pulled in the gap, not with much power and four more! Lynn went down on a knee when he saw the short ball and hit that one right between long leg and deep midwicket
leans into the legbreak and pushes it to cover for one
Ashwin pitches this one shorter and Uthappa reverse-sweeps this one in the air and wide of Kohli to the third man area. Four more for the placement
what timing and wrist work! Bit too full on the pads and he used those supple wrists so, so nicely to flick it and that bisected long on and deep midwicket. Rolled all along the ground
reverse sweeps it straight to Kohli at slip after it was pitched up on off by Ashwin
slower one bordering on the wide line, not called a wide and Siraj must be relieved
taps this one square on the off side for a quick single
short fine leg dives but it goes through him! Siraj angled it a bit too much into the batsman and Uthappa did well to glance it fine, although it should have been stopped
looked like he rolled his fingers over that one, on length around off and Uthappa finds Umesh at cover
back of length and angling into him, Uthappa defends it back
pulls the short ball but doesn't get hold of it and gets a single to long on
bangs in a bouncer at 143, too high and called wide
beats him on the last ball with a beautiful leg break from length on middle and leg and there's good turn to take the ball past the outside edge

de Grandhomme at the same position, long on for right-hander, he jumps with a big stretch near the rope and just gets a hand to it. Was really really tough after Uthappa lofted it straight almost effortlessly
turns it a mile outside off! Uthappa went back in the crease to asses the turn and couldn't get close to it eventually
bit of flight outside off and Lynn paddles it away to long leg
the ball turns into him and he tucks it off the back foot to leg to get off the mark

strikes first ball, Narine holes out to long off! Tall man de Grandhomme takes a couple steps back at long off and raises his arms over his head to grab the ball and just keeps his feet inside the boundary. It was pitched up, Narine went straight down the ground but didn't get enough for this small ground
full on middle and leg now and worked to midwicket. He sends Narine back
shot ball outside off and Lynn scythes it mercilessly behind square on the off side. That raced to the boundary in no time!
angles it in nicely towards the stumps, Lynn blocks it back
neatly in the block hole, driven down with hard hands to long on
148kmh, short ball to Lynn, he pulls a bit swkwardly to long leg
full and straight at 145kmh now, Narine drives it uppishly down to long off
starts the over with a bouncer on the leg side
oh so close! What a delivery. Drift, flight, dip at off stump. Lynn backs into the off side and looks to swipe over the infield. It fizzes past off stump as he misses
short of a length outside off, punched to extra cover
slaughtered. Lynn slowly getting back to his best. Length ball on off stump, backs away into the leg side this time. Exposes the stumps and drives over extra cover on the up
length ball at off. Very slow. Look to sweep and cops this on the back the thigh
length ball at leg stump, exposes the stumps and sweeps as this spins towards him. Gets it straight to short fine
beaten. Nicely bowled. Length ball turning away from outside off. He's not to the pitch as he looks to drive
bouncer at leg stump. Awkwardly defended
slower ball, length and width on it outside off. Slapped straight to cover point who misfields

shot! Lynn with the quality! Predicts the line and length again, has his front leg out of the way, a strong base as he waits like a boxer. Umesh delivers, full at off stump, and he bludgeons this straight and flats
bouncer outside off. Looks to climb into the pull but it's an inside edge to short midwicket
yorker outside off. Backs away but can't get this drive away. Jammed back down the pitch
looks to go straight, looks to go full. Lynn knows and is backing away. Makes room and clubs it wide of mid-off after taking it on the full
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot and a single stolen past the bowler
length ball on middle stump, looks to slog, thick inside edge to deep midwicket

dropped! Kohli has his face covered at slip as M Ashwin puts down a sitter at extra cover. Chahal has done superbly to induce a leading edge from Lynn -  a dipping legbreak at off stump that he looks to lift over midwicket. There was no pressure on Ashwin, apart from anything he put on himself. He got under it, couldn't complete it
length ball outside off, looks to sweep and gets an inside edge onto pad. Loud appeal for lbw from the bowler, turned down
inside edge onto pad. He hasn't picked the flipper. No forward press as he punches late at this length ball on off
nicely placed. Length ball outside off. A legbreak. Not too full. And there's bounce on it. But Lynn shuffles and sweeps from under it to get four at long leg
slower ball at a length. Back down the pitch off the inside edge as he looks to heave

lifts it just over the infield on the off side. No, we have not switched to permanent bold tags to start commentary lines. Narine living on the edge but doing a great job. Couldn't quite get under this overpitched bal and got it over cover off the toe-end
beaten outside off as he slashes on the up against an offcutter. It's on a length and lifting past the outside edge rapidly
bouncer. Too short, too high, and a touch down leg side. The perfect wide?
fends aerially but there's no short leg. Of course. Another well-directed bouncer

clears mid-on! Will Royal Challenges ever figure this guy out? Even when they have a plan, it isn't working. Short of a length ball, he backs away and swings it over the diving McCullum off the toe-end
top edge over short fine. Goes down leg side along with the bouncer, swings from under it. Clears the infield

slices it but no one to take it as it lands near short midwicket! Narine can't get the hook away against a quick bouncer. It looks like Umesh has pulled something in his leg, because this wasn't too far from him for the catch. He couldn't get anywhere near it
changes it up. Low full toss outside off and Narine looks to run it past point with an open face. It lands in front of him on the bounce
full. Angled in at leg stump. Backs away and taps it to mid-off
short of a length at off stump, dabs it into the covers with soft hands and steals a single
using that pace again. Short of a length again. Time for him to get leg side of this and lift it over short third man off the thick outside edge
shot! What a shot! Umesh offers a length ball in the corridor, with all his pace. Narine is grateful for it on this slow pitch. Stands tall, merely taps from under this and sends it over long-off
skies a slower ball but it clears mid-on and lands wide of long-off. Another offuctter but this one is back of a length. Narine wants to swat over midwicket but this goes away from him
another bouncer. Giving nothing to Narine today. He's hurried as he backs away to try and pull. Beaten but that's given wide on height
falls short of Kohli who runs to his left and in front after Narine awkwardly fends this short ball uppishly. Another slower short ball. Kohli runs from slip but this sneaks through from under
finds some swing this time, but he can't get this to pitch. A floaty full toss outside off and he crunches it on the bounce to long-off
slower short ball in the corridor. Climbs on top of it and dabs to backward poit
full and straight. Lynn gets his legs out of the way and jams it to mid-on. Siraj fires a low-arm throw and the ball rolls through to the keeper who is backing up
full ball at middle stump. Looking for the shape away from there, but there's none on that first ball. Lynn taps it back to the bowler

anticipates the slower ball going across him and shuffles right into the off side. Mitch drops this cutter shorter than the others. This means Kohli's momentum moving backwards can be used to spring at the ball as it climbs up at his hips. He duly lofts it over deep backward square
beaten again with the offcutter. Hits back of a length, finds grip and climb as Kohli brings out a square drive on the up
beaten by the offcutter this time. At a length, not the worst ball to play that same shot again. But he looks to club this over midwicket this time

carved over sweeper cover! Poor length from Mitch, but it's an offcutter so this is not an easy shot. CDG gets leg side of it, uses his reach to get under and puts in a lot of core strength to clear the fielder
sweetly timed but Karthik has the field set for the full wide ball. Gets on his knee for this square drive and finds deep backward point
overpitched outside off, looks to pummel this down the ground but as he's done all evening, he goes too hard at it and it trickles past the non-striker off the toe-end
short ball outside off, cuts to sweeper cover off the bottom of the bat
beaten outside off by a nicely done legcutter. But it has just gone wide of the marker. They sneak a run
short ball at off stump. Gets deep in the crease and pulls it to deep midwicket's right . Rinku Singh puts in the slide, keeps it to two
sliced to long-off's left. Another full toss. The old low full toss. Can't get a swing under this
sweetly timed, but not adequately placed. Overpitched ball just outside off and he gets it along the floor to long-off
yorker. Nicely done. No room at all this time and he jams it out to sweeper cover

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Grandhomme, no run
long_text: misses a full toss. So much for my build up, Mr. CDG. It's juciy, knee-height, with plenty of room outside off and he completely misses it

yes. Yes, yes, yes. That bottom-handed whip again. Wide of long-on. Russell misses his length yet again and despite this being a slower ball, he is punished. Kohli barely moves his feet to get this right off the middle
short of a length and up at middle stump. Mistimed pulled again. Off the high part of the bat and to Mavi's left at deep midwicket. That's fifty
Kohli shuffles because there's a chance behind square on the leg side. But this yorker is perfectly done. Gets him at off stump. He jams it wide of long-on to come back for the second
Mavi keeps his cool at deep midwicket, and takes this with a reverse cup right at the edge. Mandeep hits the pull nicely, to be fair. But the elevation is missing and it's a smart catch
short ball outside off, looks to clobber this cut, but loses shape and timing because of it. Gets it straight to extra cover

lovely! Mandeep hasn't had too much of the strike but he's been very productive with it in this over. Skidder at a length outside off, with some swing in. Stays deep in the crease and gets his bottom hand under this to whip it over long-on
short ball at middle stump, pulled to deep midwicket
short and turning into the body. Punches to long-on off the back footsh
swatted over deep midwicket. Mandeep has nailed this slog sweep against the offbreak. Good stride, clean hit. That's the fifty partnership
very short ball on the stumps, mistimes the pull shot and it lands short of deep midwicket. Not done very well against half trackers this season
short of a length outside off, punched straight to cover point
full outside off, gets the front foot stride out and drives to sweeper cover

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Kohli, no run
long_text: short of a length and wide outside off. Slaps it on the up, straight to extra cover

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Kohli, FOUR runs
long_text: shot. Pace, width. Everything you need on this pitch. Waits for it to arrive again and guides it over point

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Kohli, no run
long_text: length ball lifting up as he looks to punch to long-on. Can't get it off the pitch
