short_text: Shivam Mavi to Kohli, no run
long_text: short ball going away wide outside off, beaten as he looks to open the face and get this square

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Kohli, FOUR runs
long_text: superb. It's a different game when the pacers are one. Even though they're bowling cutters. It's a length ball wide outside off. He waits for it to arrive and chops it between backward point and short third man
length and coming in again. Taps through square leg off the back foot
length ball spinning into middle. Gets an inside edge onto pad as he looks to flick
cramped as this length ball spins into him. Can't get bat on the whip
length ball whipped in front of deep midwicke from the stumps

sensational fielding by Russell at long-on to stop a typical Kohli whip down the ground. He sprints to his left, rotates anticlockwise and stops this ball behind him, one yard in front of the boundary

sliced over extra cover. Not timed well at all from Kohli. It's a length ball going away off the pitch. He wants to go in that direction, but the poor connection means it's one bounce and into the boundary
slower ball at a length on off stump. Steps out and drives to long-off
sliced uppishly to sweeper cover. Length ball slanted across him and he meets it on the up
bouncer at his helmet. Doesn't come on smoothly. Hooks to deep square off the inside half of the bat
leading edge but safe. Short of a length at middle stump and he closes the face too early on the flick. Sweeper cover cleans up
another offcutter. At a length and across the corridor. Steers it to third man off the front foot
oh yeah! Gimme that, he says. It's an offcutter, but the pace is enough. Waits for this length ball outside off, leans in to meet it on the up and punch it past extra cover
beaten. Unplayable right now. Googly goes high enough in the air before landing that Mandeep expects it to bounce as it goes past him. Brings out the late cut but is well beaten
length outside off, steered to point
slugs it off the inside half of the bat. Kuldeep has Kohli in some bother tonight. Another loopy one has Kohli excited, but the slog sweep is not timed well at all. Trickles out to deep midwicket
tossed up at off stump, gets on the front foot and drives to long-off
beaten by big turn again. A googly, pitched short and outside off. Turns even further away as Mandeep shapes to pull
big turn into the pads. Kohli can't get bat as he looks to flick off the back foot
length ball outside off, opens the face and runs it to third man
glorious from Kohli. Leans into this full ball outside off, makes use of the allowance - mid-off is in - and makes him fetch it. Hobbles immediately after. Looks like an ankle thing.

dropped! Mandeep's attempted ramp is poorly timed. It looks like Russell's getting bouncers to stick in the pitch. It's a lob that goes behind Rana who is at fly slip and he can't hold on after pedalling backwards and tumbling
slower ball, back of a length outside off. Punched to long-on off the back foot
short of a length at off stump, nudged through square leg off the back foot
swing in at off stump from back of a length. Mandeep looks to steer it to third man but can't get it past the keeper
full and very wide outside off. Russell got some swing on that one too
googly, back of a length at middle stump. Tapped to midwicket off the back foot
half-tracker and he gets an inside edge after getting on the back foot for a pull. Was really looking to launch this. Ended up getting two runs down at fine leg
leading edge. This is why Kohli is tentative against Kuldeep. Hasn't picked this googly as he looks to flick through midwicket
googly, short of a length and going away from off stump. Gets on the back foot and tickles it through square leg
full on middle stump, and yet another watchful drive from Kohli. This one to long-on
good length ball turning in at the stumps. Tapped to midwicket

gone! A full toss! Vohra skips down the pitch and gets a shin height full toss tailing in at him that is ripe for a drilling through midwicket. It's what he was looking to do as well. Except, there's a gap between bat and pad and the inside edge sneaks through to smash the stumps oh it takes his back boot on the way too
another bouncer. Slower ball too, it appears. But it's too high for him to connect

got him! Through the hook shot too early, is McCullum, and he ends up getting a feather off the toe of the bat which carries comfortably to the keeper. A short ball and he made plenty of room for the swing, but the timing is just off
short of a length in the corridor, allows it to come on and guides towards third man off the face of the bat
falls short of long-off. Length ball just outside off. He can't get elevation as he looks to loft this straight
short of a length and some shape way off the pitch. Follows with his hands and jabs it past point
steps out and creams a square drive straight to sweeper cover. A full ball wide outside off and he steps out to get this out there
length ball tossed up at off stump and nervous flick straight to short midwicket
length ball at the stumps, dragged into the leg side with a heave
googly, pushed at a length and wide outside off. Looks to slog sweep, misses
loses control against this loopy ball from Kuldeep. Looks like a googly. Kohli has to wait a long time after shaping to flick and ends up chipping to long-off
length ball on middle stump, presses well froward and gets deflects this into the leg side with a bat-pad

aesthetically beauty is where de Kock's inside-out loft over extra cover stops. He's not fully to the pitch and as a result, he's ended up slicing a very good looking shot to sweeper's left. The fielder runs a few yards to his left and watches carefully before completing the catch
short again, not sure what Chawla is trying here! Forget the off side, McCullum rocks back this time and pulls it high and wide over long-on
tries to find the gap again with a back-foot cut and finds point this time
shorter and quicker, and it's short enough to give McCullum the time to go back and chop it between point and short third man
beaten but he gets four! Flatter one on the middle stump and it turned just enough to deceive McCullum, but he made a late adjustment and got it fine on the off side
tries to loft it with the turn this time, doesn't quite middle it but gets one to deep midwicket

short_text: Chawla to de Kock, no run
long_text: hardly turns around the leg stump, de Kock tries the reverse sweep but doesn't connect at all
spoils the over for Kuldeep! It was pitched up a bit and McCullum slog-swept that one with the turn over the fielder at deep midwicket!
Kuldeep bowls this one much slower as de Kock comes down, he waits and cuts yet again
a fumble at deep midwicket, KKR's fielding still a beat wobbly. McCullum had swept this one with the turn to the leg side
a touch fuller and he goes back in the crease again to cut it square
slow and on length outside off, de Kock waits for it to turn and then cuts it past point for one
pitches the first one short and McCullum pulls it to deep midwicket
low full toss at 146kmh, driven hard and fast to mid off where birthday boy Russell dives and saves a few

short_text: Shivam Mavi to McCullum, no run
long_text: away-swinging bouncer outside off, he tries to reach out for it but misses. That's the first bouncer for the over

short_text: Shivam Mavi to de Kock, 1 run
long_text: tries the same delivery but it's a low full toss this time and de Kock slices it to deep point

short_text: Shivam Mavi to de Kock, no run
long_text: 145kmh, a wide yorker outside off, de Kock stretches out and only gets a bottom edge
shares down to make it a half volley on the off stump and smashes it along the ground to deep point

short_text: Shivam Mavi to de Kock, 1 leg bye
long_text: tries to loft the ball off his pads, it was fullish, but he can't get bat on it
top edge as he sweeps, goes right behind DK on the leg side and they take one

short_text: Narine to de Kock, no run
long_text: extra bounce as he goes back to cut on off, DK also can't collect it

short_text: Narine to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: pitched up, he heaves to the leg side and doesn't quite middle it but gets enough to make it past midwicket and deep square leg

short_text: Narine to de Kock, no run
long_text: flat bats the short ball back to Narine
much slower than what McCullum expected, he's through with this sweep when the ball reaches him and takes it on the pad outside off
offbreak outside off, slices it to backward point and they sprint across for a quick one
reverse sweeps it straight to short third man, quiet end to the over with three dots
usual leg break, which hardly spins, much slower on the off stump and he defends again
darts in one at 122.4kmh according to the TV, it was on off stump and McCullum did well to get his bat down in time
short outside off, he cuts off the back foot and gets one as Kuldeep misfields at point. Looked like a wrong'un
on middle and leg now, he pushes it towards mid on for one
nobody on the leg side in the deep and McCullum reaches out from outside off to sweep the googly to deep midwicket for a one-bounce four

short_text: Johnson to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: makes width because the ball doesn't have any, he lofts the full delivery from the stumps, up and over the off side to the square boundary all the way

short_text: Johnson to de Kock, no run
long_text: pretty full on the off stump, de Kock closes the face of the bat to drive it straght to mid on
length delivery on the stumps, McCullum makes some room and pushes into the covers
comes down again and Mitch tries a slower one this time but down leg for a wide
dances down the tack, Mitch bangs it in short and McCullum smacks it with a full swing on the off side for a cracking four
tries to slog the incoming delivery towards his legs and he only gets an inside edge to leg
innocuous looking ball on the pads, McCullum tucks it carefully to leg for one

short_text: Narine to de Kock, no run
long_text: some width on the off side, he pushes it to cover point and comes back in time

short_text: Narine to de Kock, no run
long_text: tries to sweep again but gets an edge back to the bowler

short_text: Narine to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: same shot but on the other side and same result. Shuffled a bit towards off and this time he swept it much finer for four

short_text: Narine to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: sweeps it well this time from well outside off, he had to reach for it a fair bit and slapped it away. Uthappa ran across to his left, put in a dive, got a hand and slid the ball in but it went for four

short_text: Narine to de Kock, no run
long_text: outside the leg stump now and he tries to sweep but misses

short_text: Narine to de Kock, no run
long_text: length delivery towards the off side, de Kock defends it carefully off the back foot
presses forward and blocks the length delivery into the covers. What a start from Chawla
quicker, flatter and closer to off, defends off the back foot this time
length delivery well outside off, he leans forward and pushes it to point
tossed up on the leg stump, de Kock drives it down to mid off

short_text: Chawla to de Kock, no run
long_text: bit more flight and bit fuller, de Kock tucks it to leg

short_text: Chawla to de Kock, no run
long_text: right on the stumps, the first ball, and the goes on the back foot to defend it
all over. A fuller one that curves in and Archer whips it away off the pads to deep midwicket

gone. Gowtham has picked out long-off and that's the game. Fails to get hold of this fullish ball. Doesn't help that it's curving into him and he doesn't get the room he's looking for as a result. Chips it straight into the hands of long-off
low dipping full toss on middle, Gowtham shovels it straight back and long-on ad long-off converge. The latter slides across and stretches full tilt to pull it back
low full toss outside off, Rahane mistimes his punch straight back at the bowler who gets a hand to it
extremely full outside off again, and Gowtham can only squeeze it out to extra cover. They take the single

good delivery but an equally good shot from Gowtham. A full one, tailing in late into Gowtham. Nearly a yorker but not quite. Gowtham manages to get underneath it and whips it off the toes through square leg
slower length ball, keeps a little low outside off and Rahane pulls and the ball sneaks from underneath the bat
walks across early for a paddle and sees this length ball outside off and slaps it through point instead. Shakib runs to his left and sticks the boot out to stop it before the boundary
just back of a length, Gowtham walks across and whips it through backward square leg

brilliant catch by Saha! Another wide fuller one, slanted a long way across the left-hander Lomror and he throws his hands at it without moving his feet. Gets a thick outside edge and Saha flings himself to his left to take a superb, leaping catch

Manish Pandey with a brilliant effort to save a six. A wide fuller one that Lomror lofts over the in-field. Pandey at long-off snaffles it reverse-cupped, leans back as he does so, and is right in front of the boundary. He's falling over with the momentum and releases the ball as he's falling away. Top effort. Just about lets the ball go as he falls over the boundary line
backs away to a short one and picks backward point as he slaps it. Straight to the fielder but they do well take the run
short and turning away, pulled extremely hard to deep midwicket

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rahane, no run
long_text: gets down for a reverse sweep but it's a full one outside off and he can't make contact as the ball sneaks from underneath
advances down the ground and whips a full toss to deep square leg

short_text: Rashid Khan to Lomror, no run
long_text: backs away and tries to cut a shortish one and loses shape as it spins away and bounces extra
gets down for another sweep, has to fetch it from outside off, so he doesn't time it too well as he works it to deep midwicket

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rahane, SIX runs
long_text: Rahane finally with the big hit. Whew! That was a long time coming. Rashid nicely floats this up outside Rahane's off-stump and he gets down on a knee to slog it over square leg for a massive six
length ball that cuts in from outside off, shuffles across and flicks to midwicket
full, angled across at a fifth-stump channel, drilled down to long-on
back of a length, cuts in, flicks to deep midwicket
full, angled across, driven to the left of sweeper cover
short of a length, cuts in, opens the face and runs it down to short third man
full outside off, flicks it from there to wide long-on where Pandey fumbles and allows Rahane to get back on strike
length ball that spins away, reaches for it and opens the face late to short third man where Yusuf makes a diving stop
short of a length, drifts across and he punches off the backfoot through cover
gets down for a reverse sweep and crunches it out to sweeper cover for a brace
flicks a length ball against the turn through midwicket

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rahane, no run
long_text: does him in with drift and flight that draws him forward, and turn as it spins away and beats him with the backfoot coming off. Slides it back in
very wristy from Rahane, whips a length ball from way outside off through the gap at midwicket
back of a length outside off, shuffles across and flicks to midwicket
slower length ball, a legcutter, picked early by Rahane who times a flick and places it wide of the deep midwicket fielder
slower full ball, pushed out to sweeper cover

is that a run out chance? Nah, the dive has saved him there. Lomror advances down the ground to a shortish delivery and slashes it away to sweeper cover. They take on the fielder for a second and the dive ended up being timely
shortish around off, tries to flick and the ball goes off the outside of the bat down the pitch

off the outside part of the bat. A legbreak that turns minimally and Buttler slices it in the air as he fails to get entirely underneath the stroke. Simple catch for Dhawan at long-off. Sunrisers right back into this
closes the face to a legbreak and gets a leading edge to backward point
advances down the ground and drills a very full one to long-on
full and flat on middle, flicked to square leg
length ball, sliding on leg, gets down for a reverse sweep and crunches it to sweeper cover
flicks the fuller one into the leg side
full, leg-side line, flicked to square leg
punched down the ground for one
drifts it down again but this time it spins further in and gets away from him as he's down and across, and he mistimes the sweep to short fine leg
leg-side fuller ball, gets down to sweep and works it away to deep fine leg
back of a length, rocks back and heaves a pull in the air as it lands short of long-on
advances down the ground and the bowler shortens his length, punched away to long-on
turned away against the spin to midwicket and they take on the fielder in the deep for a quick second
pitched up on middle and off, driven down to long-on
tossed up, drifts in and turns away, Buttler jumps down the pitch and is beaten in flight, taps it to extra cover
fullish length, driven away to cover
length, spinning away, whips against the turn to long-on
tucked off the pads through square leg
sliding into leg stump, tickled off an inside edge to short fine leg
full on middle, forward and driven down to long-on
Yusuf hits a hard length on middle, goes back and punches down the ground

and Sunrisers' sixth bowler knocks out Stokes' leg stump. Flat dart, fizzes in from around the wicket, not as short as Stokes anticipated. He swings his hands at a pull and only collects fresh air. Yusuf roars. No Nabi? no problem. It wasn't a great ball but Yusuf will take this wicket
back of a length on off, stands tall and forces a single down to long-on
shortish, backs away and slaps it to cover. Rahane sets off for a single and has to be sent back
shuffles across and blocks a length ball

straight to midwicket. These are the kind of wickets you don't want to be giving away against an attack like the Sunrisers. A short of a length delivery, slower one that stops on him - it's the knuckle ball - and messes up his timing as he pulls off the lower part of the bat straight to the fielder
short, climbs onto him outside his off-stump, and Rahane rolls his wrists over a pull to midwicket
short of a length, angled in at middle and leg, punched to long-on
cuts in from a shortish length, Rahane gets Rahane on the hip as he tries to work it away with a cross-batted whip
shuffles across to get behind the line and punches a back of a length delivery to long-on
full on middle and off, driven away to cover for a quick single. Beats the throw with ease
full outside off, gets the front foot across and pats it away to square leg
back of a length, flat trajectory, whips across the line between midwicket and long-on
short, straightening at off again, backs away and punches to sweeper cover
short of a length, straightens around off, backs away and punches to point
fuller, pushed past the bowler off the front foot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rahane, FOUR runs
long_text: full and sliding into middle and leg, Rahane gets down and sweeps through midwicket
punched away to long-off
pitched up outside off, pushes away from the body and gets it away off the outside part of the bat to backward point
back of a length outside off, shuffles across and whips against the turn to midwicket
short, rocks back and pulls against the turn without much control, on the bounce to deep midwicket
sliding length ball, turns it away wide of long-on for one
short of a length, backs away and cuts to point
gets down on one knee to a length ball and whips it away to fine leg with a flat bat
full and flat on middle and off, driven down to long-on
length, spinning in, shifts back and tucks it away to fine leg
slightly back of a length, waits for it to spin away before opening the face late for a dab through the short third man region
good length on off, punched down the track between long-on and long-off
short of a length outside off, opens the face and plays late to backward point
back of a length, just punches from the crease and picks the gap nicely at cover
that's some pretty amazing work again through the leg side. Shortish from the bowler and there's not much pace. Samson gets in position and rocks a pull through midwicket. Great timing
short of a length, whipped away from outside off towards midwicket
short of a length, keeps low outside off, adjusts and fends it away towards mid-on
full and nice on leg, driven to long-on
length ball, gently dabs it to midwicket and takes off for a single
full and slow, flicks early and lobs it slightly towards midwicket
length, leg-side line, tucked to short fine leg
short of a length, slower at 105.4ks, flicked behind square
fullish, angled in, pats it away towards midwicket
short of a length, angled in at leg, tucked to the on side

is that four again? No, no quite. This time the fielder gets around it. An attempted yorker gone wrong, it's a low full toss that's been whipped between midwicket and long-on, and the latter gets around it
there's a deep midwicket but no way he was going to get there in time. Another short delivery, and a powerful pull from Samson through square leg
slower ball, that's just 94.7ks, and Samson has to reach out as it nips away off the seam, skews it off the inside of the bat down the pitch
short and angled into him at pace. What more does a batsman need? Samson swivels and flays a pull over deep midwicket
shortish, he makes a bit of width for himself and then punches through cover and point with superb balance and power
back of a length, angled in, flicked away to deep square leg
back of a length on off, cuts away slightly and finds the outside part of Samson's bat as he blocks
short of a length on off, punched to cover
fullish length outside off, gets forward and pats it down the pitch to the bowler

pre-meditated from Tripathi, and he pays the price. Doesn't make an effort to suss out the length and just charges down the track. It's a little too shortish for his comfort and skids on at pace along a leg-sidish line before clattering into the stumps
short and wide, slapped away to point
oh, shot. That's pristine timing and placement. Shifts back and whips this back of a length delivery against the turn through midwicket. Top stuff
fullish length outside off, strides across and nudges towards mid-on
waits for this length ball before opening the face towards point for a quick one
backs away and slaps it away through extra cover, Rashid at long-off sprints to his left and cuts it off at the boundary
length ball around off, good tight lines, Rahane drops it into cover. Good over apart from the boundary
fullish, movement into him in the air, punched off the front foot to cover
inswinging fuller one again, Rahane watchfully blocks off the front foot
full, swinging in, clipped off the pads through midwicket, neatly timed through the gap
sharply cuts in from a back of a length outside off and he punches it away to point
looks to back away and scoop but misses. They scamper a bye even as Buttler misses an underarm flick at the striker's end.
opens up the leg side and pulls this short ball from outside off, but can only hit it as far as Stokes at deep midwicket. No timing whatsoever on that.
thick inside edge to a low full toss which he looks to whip through midwicket, down to fine leg instead.
squeezes this yorker-length delivery to long-on
full toss angling into middle and leg, squeezed towards Stokes at deep midwicket
clean lofted hit over extra cover, welcome boundary to begin the final over.

short_text: Unadkat to Rashid Khan, no run
long_text: big across-the-line mow, beaten. Played too early.

another painstaking Pandey innings comes to an end. Was in no control of this lofted hit. Sliced this slower delivery to point, where Rahane moved a couple of steps back to complete the catch. Royals continue to surge.
looks to scoop but Unadkat bowls this full and wide outside off, squeezed wide of point
slower and fuller on off, eased down to long of. There's a misfield from a limping Gowtham, who gives away the extra run. Cramps or something more? He's limping Seems fine.
slower and fuller outside off, eased down to third man to get off the mark. There's an overthrow as well from Archer, so they get the extra run
flat-bats a pull down to long on
slashes this straight down the throat of third man. Yusuf looked to upper cut, this one didn't bounce as much as he would've liked. Easy catch, Archer continues to impress with every outing.
right into the blockhole again, squeezed to point
whips this full delivery to deep midwicket. Bowled at 141.9kph
short on middle, pulled all along the ground to deep midwicket where two fielders converge. Pandey wanted the second, Yusuf wasn't ken
bunts this length ball to point as they scamper a single.

the inswinging yorker has done the trick. Gets this to bend back in a long way from outside off from around the stumps, Shakib jams his bat down late as the ball bounces into the stumps. 'Should I, should I not?' the ball thought to itself before disturbing the bails
slash and a miss. Tried to smack the cover off the ball, beaten. Into the stroke too early.
slower length ball outside off, he backs away and punches this to cover.
clears his front leg, gets down on one knee and lofts this over extra cover. Mid-off was inside the ring so it was a safe stroke.
touch short, he rocks back and cuts this into the gap at sweeper cover
length ball, stops on him a touch as he looks to slap this cover, but hits it straight to the fielder and hustles a single
back of length outside off, slaps this length ball straight to cover.
looks to mow this across the line but gets a thick inside edge towards deep midwicket
full on the pads, worked to midwicket
punched into the gap at wide long off. Back comfortably for the second.
steps out and drives firmly, Gowtham half-stops so can't prevent the single
defends this with the spin to cover point
sharp turn from length outside off, punched to long on.
uses the pace to paddle this to the fine leg boundary. Nicely done by Shakib.

shapes to cut but this one spins back in the other way, keeps low and kisses the inside half of the bat as Buttler pouches a superb catch.  Staying low was the key. Williamson asked if this was an appeal for lbw or caught behind. Umpire Nanda Kishore signalled that it was for caught behind and he's made the right decision.  Sodhi gets his New Zealand captain. . First wicket in the IPL for him.
another half-tracker outside off, pulled towards deep midwicket.
half-tracker down leg, saved by Unadkat's fielding effort at deep square. Williamson cleared his front leg and absolutely walloped this pull. Should've been four, it's one instead.
slow turn from length on off stump, dabbed towards point
looks to go over the bowler's head but toe ends this back
works this from outside off towards wide long on. Archer had some work to do, excellent running.
clean strike over cover, down to Unadkat in the deep. Back for the second.
squeezes out this full deli very back to the bowler.

slices this to point. Gowtham has beaten him in flight. Hales backed away to go inside-out but Gowtham slowed this down nicely to have him reach out, Hales didn't get much bat on it. Easily taken by Samson at point.
backs away to go over cover, but is made to reach out for this as Gowtham fires this wide, hit down to long off
toe-ends a sweep to square leg, they scamper a single
pacy bouncer on middle, Williamson ducks under it
yorker length outside off, Williamson beaten for pace as he looks to squeeze this behind square
he's in complete control. Touch full, Williamson swings through the line to clear long off with ease. Not by any means a half-volley, but the balance and poise all in sync as he put that away
looks to mow this across the line but swung through early and missed. Rolls to the keeper. Brushed the flap of the pad, I think.
dabs this gently into the off side for a quick single.
angles in a length ball from wide of the crease, worked to midwicket
works this slower length ball from outside off towards deep midwicket.  Excellent half-century
looks to swing over long off, gets a thick outside edge that flies to the third man boundary. Streaky but it doesn't matter
works this length ball on middle and leg towards the man coming in from deep midwicket
change of angle, no problem. Slaps this length ball over extra cover, raced to the boundary in a jiffy.
steps out, opens up the off side and lofts through the line to clear long off. As stylish as it gets. Superb balance
paddled wide of the keeper. Slower length ball on middle, he got outside the line and helped it along the way.
pulled, on the bounce to deep midwicket. Too short, asking to be hit and Hales did the rest.
drifting down leg, paddled fine but straight to short fine leg
backs away to go over cover but is cramped for room, bunts this back down the pitch
slider into middle and leg, worked wide of square leg
drifts this into middle and leg, turned wide of midwicket
eases this down to long on for an easy single
gets on top of the bounce and defends this length ball to the leg side
punches this length ball down to mid off for a quick single
drilled but can't split the gap. Straight to extra cover
mistimes a drive to mid on
whips this down to fine leg where Sodhi dishes out a sliding stop to save a couple of runs
hammers the pull, splits the gap at deep square. Good control, got on top of the bounce and rolled his wrists nicely.
this is too full and it has been smoked away into the gap between deep cover and long off. Got right to the pitch to belt that away.
eased to point when Tripathi dives to his right to stop that
beaten by the dip and turn, slices the drive on the bounce to point

just short of Archer at long on.  Mishit again as Hales looks to step out and hit against the turn over long on. Didn't get to the pitch but went through. Archer made the mistake of running around initially when he could've come in straightaway
works this shortish delivery towards midwicket

outstanding effort by Stokes to run in from deep midwicket, but takes this on the half-volley. The crowd went up to applaud, but Stokes immediately said no. The ball bobbled out as soon as his elbows hit the ground. This was full and flat on middle, Hales at the risk of being lbw hit that flat and hard. Full marks for the effort
slower delivery down leg, eased to fine leg.
excellent wrist work to flick this from outside off but Tripathi throws himself to his right to effect a one-handed stop. Saved a couple of runs.
slower and fuller delivery that angles in from wide of the crease, defended towards midwicket
driven hard to sweeper cover

drilled back past the bowler, no chance for mid off. K Gowtham hared around the ropes from long on to put out a diving stop. Super stuff. Saved three runs. I just think both batsmen assumed that will be a boundary.
angles in a short ball, pulled down to fine leg
driven hard, a half-stop at cover keeps it down to a single.
rocks back and pulls. This was begging to be hit and Williamson said 'no fret, mate. I'll put that where it should be put.' No one at deep midwicket to protect that
spins away but keeps a touch low, punched down to long on.
plenty of revs on this one, driven with the spin to deep cover as they jog the single
eased with the spin to long off
nice flight, lands this at length on off stump, eased wide of cover
pulled again, down towards Tripathi at deep midwicket
fetches this short of length ball from outside off, pulled into the gap at deep square leg.
short of length on off stump, pulled to deep square leg.
looks to get on top of the bounce and work to the leg side but this climbs on him, rolls off the top part to the bowler
gives him the charge but the bowler alters his length nicely, bunted to mid off
punches this length ball to cover
gets a good stride forward and defends.
whips this length ball to deep square leg
gets on top of the bounce and turns this square on the leg side

Tripathi drops a straightforward offering at slip!  He squared him up with a length ball that climbed on him, nipped away a touch to take the edge as well, Tripathi juggled on the second attempt and muffed it in the end. Oh, dear. How costly will that be? Archer is annoyed.
lovely straight drive this. Not much of a flourish, all hands and the timing is delightful as he beats mid on.
hurries Hales for pace as he gets a thick inside edge on the drive to mid on, quick single scampered
leans into the drive, eases this straight to extra cover
forces this length ball wide of mid off, good work by Unadkat
lands the offcutter at length on middle and off, punched to midwicket
gets this to bounce from length on off stump, dabbed behind the stumps as they scamper through
shapes away late. This is much fuller and starts off from middle, KW is squared up a touch as he defends.
too much width, Williamson stands still and slaps this through point when it finally arrives.
slow turn back in from off stump, punched to long on.
works this shortish delivery to square leg, cramped for room once again.
works this gently with the spin to the leg side
eases this full delivery down to long on
works this with the spin to deep midwicket

chopped on! Shortened his length, got this to drift in from around the stumps, Dhawan looks to steer this past slip after first looking to sweep, but didn't have the room and ends up hitting it onto his stumps off an inside edge. His third failure in a row now.
straying onto the pads, tucked away wide of short fine leg.

short_text: Kulkarni to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: full on middle and leg, Dhawan is off balance as he squeezes the flick but somehow has managed to hit it well. Trickles into the short square leg boundary.
much better. Touch ahead of length on off, driven on the up to mid off
pulled handsomely in front of square, into the gap between midwicket and mid-on. Too short from Kulkarni, can't bowl there at 125kph. Hales picked the length very early.
length on off stump, defended back with soft hands
width and Hales has flayed that behind point. Cracking stroke! Opened his wrists up nicely to pick the gap.
short and flat on middle and leg, punched to midwicket
turns this straight to square leg. Tight bowling so far from KG
sweeps and misses. No turn, looked to fetch it from outside off as well.
fired full and flat on the stumps, defended back
works this from length on middle towards midwicket
fired full on off stump, worked with the spin past midwicket

second win of the season for Mumbai Indians!  They're still alive in the competition. The scorecard may suggest a last-over win but this has been a very comprehensive one. Uses the pace to steer this past short third man. Too easy.  Just the second loss for CSK
through with the pull too early, toe-ends his past midwicket.  Scores level
steps out and works this with the angle towards deep midwicket. Thakur caught napping, they're back for the second easily.
punches this length delivery to long on

short_text: Thakur to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: swept from outside off, picks the gap at deep square leg.  Half-century for the captain and what a time to do so.  Brave. Shardul went full, Rohit could've used the pace to go behind point but preferred the leg side because he was well aware

short_text: Thakur to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: beaten for pace. Rohit stayed back to steer this behind point

short_text: Thakur to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: slower length ball, Rohit holds his shape and plays the dab really late to bisect backward point and short third man.

short_text: Thakur to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: full on middle, Rohit walks across - at the risk of missing it and being lbw - and flicks this to the fine leg boundary

short_text: Thakur to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: sliced over point. Too full, too wide. Rohit sliced this full toss over Harbhajan. No chance for third man. That should ease some pressure in the Mumbai dug out
yorker length just outside off, squeezed to deep cover. Good ball first up.
sees the batsman stepping out and bowls this full and wide, Rohit reaches out to squeeze this to deep cover where M Vijay cuts this off.
into the blockhole, squeezes this to deep midwicket
holds his shape, swings through the line and clears long on effortlessly. Beautiful swing of the bat, poor from Watson. Can't bowl length.
works this from length outside off to wide long on

short_text: Watson to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: length ball outside off, Rohit lofts through the line. Tahir can't bend low to cut that off at sweeper cover. Poor effort.
fires this full and just outside the wide line. Rohit left this, quite a brave call.

short_text: Watson to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: width outside off, flayed on the up but can't beat mid off.
looks to turn this slower delivery to long on but this one gripped the surface and bounced more to hit the top part of the bat. Defended back. Top over from Bravo
back of length outside off, he punches this into the gap at sweeper cover. Good work by Shardul
length ball outside off, eased wide of point
cramped for room as this length ball cuts back in, bunted down to long on to get off the mark
gloves this pull down to fine leg

is that an opening? Surely has to be. The first ball after the break has fetched a wicket. Slower length ball angling away, Lewis slogs across the line, only to slice this to Shardul, who judges this to perfection at long off.
saved by the lack of timing! Looked to pull this off-cutter but the bat face turned in his hand, on the bounce to long on.
drills this to mid-off, Rohit wanted the single but was sent back
flicked up and over, down to deep midwicket
works this full delivery from outside off towards wide long on

short_text: Thakur to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: steps out and slaps this to Raina at cover. He fires a throw at the bowler's end but Lewis reacts quickly to plonk his bat back in
skiddy length ball, bunted to cover
works this slower length ball to deep square
backs away and forces this length delivery to deep point
slower delivery on leg stump, turned towards square leg
thick inside edge, the ball deflects to point. Bravo angles one in from wide of the crease, Rohit looked to whip this over midwicket

short_text: Bravo to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: defended back but Bravo moves quickly to his left and fires the throw back at the striker's end. Rohit reacted quickly to get back

short_text: Bravo to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: short, he lines himself up to pull, executes it with precision. Into the deep backward square leg boundary
slower length ball but errs in direction. Way down leg.
mistimes a drive to long off. Three dots and a single, yet 13 came off that over. Mumbai well on track

short_text: Watson to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: back to bowling length on off, punched to the diving Raina at cover

short_text: Watson to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: uses the pace to sweep him for six. Got outside the line of the stumps, picked this full delivery and cleared short fine leg effortlessly. I think he also surprised himself with how well he hit it. Thing of beauty

short_text: Watson to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: this one hits one spot and takes off from length outside off, Rohit jabs this to point. The bottom hand came off the grip as he played that.

short_text: Watson to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: crunching drive but a super stop by Raina at cover. May have saved at least two runs

short_text: Watson to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: one-handed six, would you believe it? Went downtown to a length ball but in doing so, the bottom hand came off the grip. Chance for long off? No chance in hell. He was a mere spectator. The bats these days, I tell you
full toss that has been belted to beat cover and wide long-off. Easy pickings. Was a good over until then, but now the pressure has been released.

short_text: Bravo to Rohit Sharma, 1 leg bye
long_text: overbalanced as he looks to flick, the ball snakes back in to deflect off the pad to the leg side. Leg bye it is
floated full on middle, tails away just a touch, driven to long off
cut away down to square third man
belts this full toss to Billings at sweeper cover
steers this away-going delivery to Raina at backward point
dabs this gently into the off side for a quick single.
works this full delivery down to long on
eases this full and straight delivery to long off
the straighter one from Bhajji, just a touch short though, worked behind square on the leg side for a single
punches this length ball to deep cover
flatter one on middle, punched to long on
beaten by a googly, looked to dab this past short third with an angled bat
for most parts, this was a mistimed pull, but well, it still cleared long on by a distance. I was looking mid on, but it just kept going, going ..
eases this full delivery down to long off
shortish delivery, pulled to Jadeja on the bounce at deep midwicket
fires this across the left-hander but just outside the wide line
walks across the stumps and lofts this to clear deep cover. This was a googly, he lined himself up perfectly and hit that super clean
quick googly, Rohit picks this from length and turns this to the leg side to get off the mark
works this indrifter on the pad towards deep square. Billings took a while to run in, by which time they'd scampered the second.

Jadeja's brilliance has made this catch possible at deep midwicket. Surya picked the length early, rocked back and pulled this ferociously. Jadeja covered plenty of ground to his left and then put in the slide to complete the catch even as the ball was dying on him.
slider that drifts back in to keep a touch low, Lewis eases this down to deep point
this time the doosra, the length is too short though, punched to long on
skids one through on off stump, punched to Jadeja at deep point
flatter length ball on middle, punched to long on
juicy full toss and Lewis belts this back over Tahir's head. A good over has just been spoilt by that hit-me delivery. They'll take the time-out as well with that.
rare miss from Dhoni. Once again beaten in flight, deceived by the googly as he looked to swing. Dhoni switched off for a split-second, beats short third man to the boundary.
fires this full on off, squeezes the drive to cover
slog and a miss.  Deceived in flight as he looked to swing across the line to long on.
beaten by a flipper. Didn't pick this, late on the defence as he moved back into the crease
fired full on the stumps from wide of the crease, eased to long on
punched off the backfoot back to the bowler. Top over from Harbhajan; just two off it
and again. Fuller this time, and Lewis drives but Raina tumbles to his left again to stop it
brilliant stop by Raina at mid-off as Lewis slaps this off the backfoot and Raina dives to his left to intercept it
short of a length around off, punched from the crease
length, spinning in, tucked away to square leg
shuffles across and punches out to sweeper cover
throws his hands at a wide one and gets a thick outside edge towards third man
length, angled across, shuffles across and blocks back
short of a length outside off, punched through the covers
full, angled across, driven to sweeper cover
fullish outside off, drilled away to sweeper cover
short of a length outside off, punched away but can't get it past extra cover
length, angled in, turned away to square leg off the inside of the bat
length ball outside off, mistimes a punch towards the bowler, who lets it go through him but mid-off tidies up
leg-side fuller ball, and he gets maximum reward for it. Just times a flick off his pads and heaves it right over backward square leg. Top timing
flicks a length ball through square leg
run out chance but he's made it> Drills a fuller one from outside off towards mid-on and sets off straight away. Could a direct hit have had him in some trouble?
short of a length around off, blocked from the crease
length, spinning in, waits for it before punching it down to long-on
shortish around off, minimal turn, Yadav stands tall and carves out a punch through the gap between cover and point
short of a length, stands tall and punches to cover
shortish, Lewis swivels and pulls it away through square leg. Rayudu sprints to his left from deep midwicket and sticks the left hand out to make a one-handed stop in front of the boundary
slider on middle, drilled off the inside part of the bat to the left of the bowler
length ball, angled in towards leg, flicked away to square leg
flicks off the pads with the angle to deep square leg
length ball, angled in towards middle and leg, whipped away through midwicket
short of a length on off, stands tall and punches towards mid-on
opens the face pretty late again as he works it away through point
not much room to work with there but Yadav makes up for it by shifting back and subtly opening the face of his bat to knock it through backward of point
gets slightly squared up by this back of a length delivery and ends up dropping it just in front of the bowler
fullish around leg, turns it away behind square leg for a quick brace
back of a length, angled in towards middle, flicked away to deep backward square leg
this is not the ideal length to be bowling at all. Too short, and so much width on offer. Yadav waits and then jumps before slashing a late uppercut through third man
short ball, Yadav mistimes his pull and swings early to get hit around the rib cage area on his right side
that's much tighter. A short of a length delivery around off, Suryakumar jabs it back to the bowler from the crease
another leg-sidish delivery. CSK can ill-afford this. Angled into his pads and Suryakumar gets on his toes before tucking it off the pads behind square
ah, throws water on a good, tight over with this legside back of a length delivery that Lewis swivels and helps along to the fine leg boundary
flashes hard at the sight of width but it's pacy and he isn't entirely behind the line as the ball shoots past the outside edge
short of good length, angled across around the fifth-stump line, Lewis stands tall and punches to point who moves to his right and stops it
left alone outside off
fullish length, flicked off the pads through midwicket
much better. A length ball that's angled across and straightens around the fourth or fifth-stump channel, left alone
short of a length, down the leg side as it gets past Lewis' attempted flick. CSK can't afford loose deliveries like this
short ball, can't negotiate the bounce well as he fails to connect with a pull and wears it on the upper body instead
length ball, sprayed down the leg side
short of a length, shuffles across and punches firmly to cover where Billings moves to his left and makes a tumbling stop
short and wide, slapped to point who half-stops it
short of a length, whipped off the hips to the gap at deep midwicket
short and wide, gets on top of the bounce and slaps past the left of point who dives but can't get his hands to it
short of a length around off, shuffles across and blocks
right into Raina's swinging arc and he's walloped this over deep midwicket. Saw Raina backing away, and tried to cramp him but ended up straying on the pads. Raina didn't miss out.
just about eludes Cutting at wide long off. Saw the ball dying on him but went for the catch even at the risk of this bouncing and hitting his face.
steps out and heaves this straight down Cutting's throat at long-on. Hardik's slower deliveries are yielding returns for Mumbai at the death.
whips this full toss from outside off towards deep midwicket
backs away, so Hardik goes full and wide, Billings toe-ends this swing across the line to long on
full on middle, whipped to deep midwicket
beaten! Swung through early to mow over deep midwicket, didn't account for the change in pace. Well-executed slower one
once again cramped for room as he jabs this towards midwicket. Got it on the top part of the bat
pulled, one bounce to deep square leg
lofted through the line, one bounce to sweeper cover

wallops this length ball to clear deep midwicket.  Bumrah shortened his length so Raina didn't get underneath it, but didn't matter. Not much of a backswing but he still managed to generate enough power to clear the ropes.
not on control of this lofted hit down to long-off but he'll hare back for the second. Slower delivery from Bumrah, Raina looked to thump down the ground but didn't have the pace he would've liked.
backs away to go over the off side, McClenaghan angles it in to cramp him. Raina goes through and just manages to hit it past cover point
slower length ball outside off, steered straight to point but he's off the mark
cramped for room, plays the short-arm jab to deep midwicket

no room to swing, so he ends up slicing this pull to Markande at point. This is very good from McClenaghan, hit the deck hard to extract bounce. The effort ball has done the trick. Well held by the 20-year old. Mumbai are roaring back at the death.
works this half-pull from outside off to deep backward square leg

full toss outside off, Dhoni reaches out to hit this well but picks out deep cover where Evin Lewis takes a dolly. Was McClenaghan looking to bowl a wide yorker? Doesn't matter, he's got the wicket somehow.
snakes back in from length to thud into his thigh pad and deflect to short third man
shapes to whip over midwicket, gets a thick inside edge to fine leg
flicks this full toss, fine leg need not bother getting around because he'll never get there.  Half-century for Raina
backs away to go over cover, beaten by an offcutter that keeps low, just misses the stumps
too short, Raina gets across and pulls to clear short fine leg. Poor from Bumrah, his death bowling this IPL has been far from ideal.
pulled into the gap, Duminy runs around from deep midwicket to cut that off.
full toss angling down, Dhoni swings and misses. His protege Kishan does well to dive to his left and stop.
makes room and punch this wide of point for a quick single
looks to sweep, ball rolls off his pad to short fine as they scamper a single
backs away and slaps this length ball to deep cover

the bottom-handed drill is sent soaring into the stands at long-on. Too full from Markande, just a little skip down the pitch from Dhoni as he tees off in style. So close he got to the pitch that he negated the turn superbly.
beaten by the googly, but is safe!  Steps out to swing, misses but has the presence of mind to quickly plonk his bat back in.  Only Dhoni could've stumped Dhoni there
sees Dhoni stepping out and fires this wide. No problem, Dhoni does well to reach out and then slam this inside-out over cover. Foxed him but he still had enough to use his reach to pick this.
drifts in and spins away from middle, turned to the leg side
slapped to point, where there's a misfield by Suryakumar. Dhoni pinches a single to keep strike
pulled! Almost like he knew what was coming. Hardik drops short, Dhoni stands his ground and pulls handsomely in front of square, one bounce into the ropes.
drills this, one bounce to long-off. Saw this in his swinging arc, brought out his powerful bottom-handed whip to belt this. Typical Dhoni shot
squeezes this leg-stump yorker to fine leg
looks to hop across and whip it square but is cramped for room as this hits him near the box
thumps this short of length delivery to sweeper cover. Good work by Mitch
was looking to heave but Krunal drifted this in short on middle and leg, turned behind square
squeezes this low full toss wide of Rohit at cover
steps out and whips this towards square leg.
fired into the stumps, squeezed to long on
mistimes this cut, but McClengaghan fumbles at point to give away two
thumps the full toss back to Krunal
short of a length on off, Dhoni again shifts back and punches to extra cover
back of a length around off, punched from the crease
short of a length, walks across and drops it to mid-on
short ball, holds its line outside off, and left alone
shuffles across to a short of a length delivery and tucks it late behind square for a single
short of a length, angled across, gets on top and flicks into midwicket
short of a length, rides the bounce from the crease and whips it into the on side
too full outside off, Dhoni carves it away to deep point
no feet from the CSK captain as he stays in the crease and defends this length ball
fullish length, curves in towards off, Dhoni pushes it out off the front foot

has he picked the fielder there? Yes, he has. Comes slightly forward and then slogs this Pandya delivery but it sails right into the waiting hands of deep midwicket as he doesn't find the power he's looking for. Cutting didn't have to move an inch. Surely, that counts as a failure for Rayudu going by his ridiculous form this season?
too full and a bit of width as he floats it up outside off, Rayudu jams the bat down and hits the turf
shortish, curving into him, tries to tuck it off the hips and misses. But he just about missed making contact there, and the delivery's well within to be legal
short, lets it go outside off as it holds its line
full, angled across around off, makes sure to give himself enough room and drives to long-off
works it with the inward angle to deep backward square leg
walks across towards off and tries to flick across the line, wears it on the pad as it drops into the covers. Impact outside off
short of a length, angled into the leg side, and Raina tucks off the pads past Ishan Kishan diving to his right
works it away into the leg side for one
that's even better. Steps down the track and mows this over long-on. A typical Raina strike, just giving the impression that it may not be clean, and then sailing well over
flat and powerful. Pitched right up to Raina with the gift of room, and he shovels it straight over the bowler's head after freeing his arms
slides in with the arm from a length, punched down to long-on
floats up a full toss outside off that's been punched down to long-off
full and flat on middle and leg, flicked between long-on and deep midwicket
shortish on middle, angled in, and he pulls with the angle to deep square leg
back of a length, outside off, drops it into the cover and point region with a half-angled bat
fullish at just under 135ks this time, flicked over the midwicket region
slow again, this is too predictable, can't be repeating the same thing over and over. A length ball that's been punched over extra cover
back of a length, slower again, 106.6ks this time, and Rayudu flicks it between midwicket and mid-on
full on middle, slower ball at 114.4 ks, but Rayudu picks it and holds his shape as he carts it over long-on. This man is in some form
short ball, gets up too much and angles down leg as well, called a wide
shortish, stands tall in the crease and punches away to cover
tries to force a cut with minimal room, and though he backs away, it isn't enough as he's beaten
full and sliding into middle and leg, flicked to midwicket
similar length and trajectory, Rayudu defends back from the crease
back of a length, flat and spinning in, tucked to midwicket
floated up on middle and leg, driven down to long-on
works this into the gap, excellent work by Ben Cutting, who ran around a good 20 yards from long-on and then threw in a full-length dive to cut that off (no pun intended). Top stuff!
punches this length ball down to long on
gets to the pitch and eases this down to long off
stretches out to reach the delivery as he tries to loft over cover, beaten. Wide signalled as this drifted away a little too much.
skids through from length on middle, defended back
drifts away again, Raina is beaten on the dab
drifts away a short delivery, Raina stays inside the crease, reaches out and thumps this to the point boundary
makes room, steps out and swings through to hit this length ball over long off. He's in some nick is this Rayudu.

thick outside edge and just outside the reach of Ishan Kishan. Short third man was a mere spectator. This knuckleball bounced much more than Rayudu anticipated as he shaped to cut, the end result: streaky four
nearly a return catch, and nearly a run-out at the bowler's end too  Rayudu toe-ends a low full toss as he shapes to drive back
not much feet movement, driven straight to cover
attacks his ribcage with a short of length ball, Raina hops across to work this to the leg side, gets some thigh pad on the way to short fine
pulls from outside off to deep square
the good old Raina mow, and he's cleared deep midwicket effortlessly. Just a touch full and in his swinging arc. Easy for Raina
skids through from length on leg stump, Raina hit on the thigh pad as he looks to whip this square
works this indrifter wide of midwicket as he jogs the single
super flick, terrific wrist work to get power. Stepped out to hit leg side but didn't get to the pitch, went through with the stroke and got this to clear the ropes easily. Superb balance and shape
top-edges a sweep, Markande trembles at square leg. Moves a step forward, then back but eventually settles underneath it to complete the catch.
rocks back and pulls, doesn't quite get hold of it but he'll have enough legs to hare back for the second
gets a thick outside edge, straight to Krunal at short third man.
proper cross-batted heave! Opens up the leg side to pull but was beaten by the slower delivery that angled in to hit him on the right thigh.
just over gully!  Hint of width, Rayudu slashes over the fielder to beat third man
tucks this short of length delivery on the stumps to the leg side.
works this full delivery from outside off to wide mid-on
full toss on middle, flicked to deep midwicket
gets a faint tickle, Bumrah comes around at fine leg to cut that off. Didn't get enough bat on it.
squeezes this drive to mid-off as they scamper a quick single
gets on top of the bounce and turns this towards square leg
helps this short ball on leg stump to Bumrah at short fine leg.
hint of width as it angles away, Watson leans forward and drills this drive past the diving Rohit at mid-off.
shapes to pull but this length delivery keeps low to hit him on the right thigh.
right back into the crease as he works this into the leg side
hint of width outside off, steered to square third man
squared up by the length as he defends to the man coming in from cover
leading edge, but just short!  This bounced much more as Rayudu was looking to nudge this to the leg side. Was in the air for a while, Bumrah didn't dive though as he tried to catch that.
hustles him for pace with a short of length ball on the stumps, Rayudu is on the move as he defends back with soft hands
excellent short of length ball that zips through from outside off, Rayudu plays inside the line and lets this go
not much room but he drives anyway, hit straight to cover
stays back inside the crease and pulls this down to deep fine leg
gets across the stumps and dabs this away-going length delivery

steps out and flat-bats this into the sightscreen. What confidence, there's something about Rayudu's batting that has become eye-catching this season. Terrific followthrough as he hit this straight back over.
pokes an away-going delivery, but did so with soft hands. Lands short of the diving Ishan Kishan
full and wide delivery angling away, Watson slashes this down to square third man
full on off stump, and the ball's in Johnson's slot. Slogs towards the leg side, and thumps it into the cow-corner boundary. Delhi Daredevils win by 55 runs!
full outside off, and the drive's been pinged across the surface to the extra-cover boundary. Off the bat's sweet spot
full on leg stump, and the leg-side slog finds the inside edge again. Through to fine leg
yorker on leg stump, and Boult can't believe it's not hit leg stump. Kuldeep backed away towards the leg side and the ball went between him and the stumps
short outside off, and the slower ball takes some extra bounce off the surface. The umpire thinks its a legal delivery
full and wide outside leg stump. Good commitment from Pant to slide across his right and stop the ball
full on middle stump, and his straight drive takes the inside edge. Through to fine leg
full outside off, and the drive takes the inside edge. Goes to fine leg, where there are two men giving it a chase
full on off stump, and the sweep takes a top edge. Falls in front of Kuldeep even before Pant could think about taking the catch
swept fine! Full on off stump, but he does well to get his front foot out of the way and whip it between keeper and short fine leg
flighted wide outside off, the ball's spinning into MJ, and he lifts it over midwicket. Man in the deep though
swept, but straight to Munro in the deep! Full on off, and Chawla doesn't have the power to take it for six. Munro does well to gauge the height, stick his hand out, and then complete the catch
full on off, an that's been clipped off his pads to midwicket
low full toss on middle stump, but Johnson backed away a lot. Slaps it past Pant's left to third man

yorked! Full and straight, and hey, Avesh has some words for Russell after getting him out. Dre Russ couldn't care less. Turns around and walks back like the cool guy he is. Excellent death-bowling from Avesh. Earns him a big scalp

short_text: Avesh Khan to Russell, no run
long_text: excellent delivery! Short on leg stump, and going away from Russell. The angle's difficult for Russell, and he misses the pull again

short_text: Avesh Khan to Russell, no run
long_text: good length on leg, and Russell's pull doesn't connect. The bat turned in his hand, and it comes off the edge. Lands just short of Avesh

short_text: Avesh Khan to Russell, no run
long_text: waist-high full toss on leg stump, and Russell uses the all the power he has to bunt it towards cow corner. Protection there though
good length on off, chops his cut between point and short third man. But there's protection behind square in the deep
back of a length on middle stump, and Russell tries to slog it towards the leg side, but can't connect. Deceived by the slower ball
short on middle, and angling down the leg side. Russell pulls his buttocks in so that he can collect the wide, but my oh my, the umpire says nothing. Russell's jaw is on the floor
excellent ball on leg stump that cramps Russell. All he can do is hit it straight down the ground to long off
slower ball, short ball outside off. Tries to work it towards the leg side, but takes a leading edge towards cover point
short on off and goes with the slower ball to Chawla. He's in two minds, and eventually wants to ramp it past the keeper, but misses completely
knee-high full toss on middle stump. Russell clips it off his pads to the man in the deep on the leg side
the googly does him! Good length on off and simply coming into Mavi's body. He tries to cut thinking it'll spin away from him, but Amit Mishra's a wily ol' fox. Wicket maiden

short_text: Mishra to Shivam Mavi, no run
long_text: full outside off, and spinning away from Mavi. He tries another extravagant sweep, but nowhere near the ball

short_text: Mishra to Shivam Mavi, no run
long_text: full outside off, and he goes for an expansive sweep. Takes his front foot across, but can't get bat to ball. Hits his pad outside off stump and goes through to Pant

flighted outside off, and it's cut straight to Iyer at point. Gill wants the run, and he's at the danger end. Pant's quick to whip the bails off and Gill's dive is just not good enough. A well-constructed innings comes to a halt. Time out

quicker ball! Full just outside off, but zips straight through. Defended down the wrong line, and lucky that doesn't find the outside edge. Pant removes the bails and the umpire wants to go to the TV umpire. Nope, Russell's safe. His back foot came down in time
good length outside off, and it's the googly to start off. He tries to reverse sweep, but hits his pad. Impact outside off
good length outside off, and spinning away from Russell. Tries to slog-sweep but can't connect. The umpire doesn't think it's a wide either
good length outside off, and it's the one that goes straight through. The cut goes over his blade and into Pant's gloves
good length outside off, and too close to his body for the cut. Slapped to point
full on off stump, and this time Russell drills this straight. Big backlift, and thumped over Tewatia's head
flighted outside off, and that's been delightfully lifted inside-out over cover. Off the bat's sweet spot, and the ball soars into the night sky. Over extra cover
good length outside off stump, and that's been furiously cut to the off side. Misfield in the infield
good length on off. It's the googly that angles into Gill's body. Does well to punch it down the ground to long off
good length outside off, and spins further away. Does well to cut it square past point to the man in the deep
low full toss on leg stump, and that's comfortably clipped off his boot to deep backward square
through Pant's legs! Good length outside off, and the cut shot takes the bottom edge. Pant can't close his legs in time, and it's a chase for short third man
full outside off, and the legspin is driven inside-out to deep extra cover
uses his feet! Full on off, and picks the googly. Comes down the ground and lifts it into the wide long-on boundary
full on off, and too close for the cut, but Gill goes through with the shot anyway. Hit hard to point, but they take the fielder's arm on
full on off, and the cut shot it slapped away to point. Stopped by the infield

slower ball, on a good length. Cut off the back foot to point, but there's no single on offer. Point takes a throw at the stumps anyway, and misses, which allows them to complete the run at the end. Tewatia the guilty man
deft! Short on off, and Russell tiptoes before guiding it over point's head. Sticks his bat out and Boult's pace does the rest
in Russell's arc! Full on middle stump, and gets his front foot out of the way before muscling this over Boult. Lands over the sightscreen. Just misses the press box
full and wide outside off. Well deceived by the slower ball, but the umpire thinks it's gone beyond the tram-lines. Adds another run to KKR's total
slower ball to start off. Good-length on leg stump, and played inside out towards cover. Off the back foot on this occasion

short_text: Avesh Khan to Russell, SIX runs
long_text: the extra ball goes for half-a-dozen! Short on leg stump, but Russell was prepared for that. Backs away to the leg side, and powers this over cow corner
losing his line here, Avesh. Good length on leg stump, and going down. Russell's happy to collect the extra run for his team

short_text: Avesh Khan to Russell, SIX runs
long_text: second tier! Short on off, and that's a very powerful pull. Swats it away towards the leg side, and what speed off the bat. A full 90 metres, this maximum

short_text: Avesh Khan to Russell, no run
long_text: back of a length on middle and following Russell. He does well to get under the ball and duck out of its way
good length just outside off. Makes some room, and mistimes a cut past point to deep backward point. Gets Russell back on strike
back of a length on off stump, and Russell makes room before thumping this down the ground. Long on does well to slide across the ground and intercept

short_text: Avesh Khan to Russell, no run
long_text: short on off, and Russell's wild leg-side slog doesn't come off. The pull is played through early and the ball sneaks under his bat
full and slanting in towards off stump, Gill eyes up the leg side. Instead, he squirts a leading edge to the left of the bowler
really full on middle and leg, worked away to deep midwicket. A double is just too much for that dodgy hamstring
another slower short ball outside off, Russell does not spot the change-up and misses again
hip-high short ball outside off, back-of-the-hand slower ball, Russell waits for it to arrive and swats it away to the wide long-on boundary. Fetch that
Russell backs away outside leg, swings hard and is beaten by a slower ball from Plunkett
back of a length and angling into the thigh, nurdled to midwicket
wide legbreak, chopped wide of point

short, flat, quick, but does not bounce as much as the batsman expected it to. Gill shapes for the pull but adjusts superbly to the lack of bounce. He shovels it with the bottom hand and summons enough power. What was more remarkable was that he found the gap between deep midwicket and wide long-on
flat and quick, slides into the pads, tucked away to deep square leg

Mishra lobs it up outside off and gets it to break away further. He forces Karthik to reach out for the ball. Karthik tries to do so but loses his shape. He aims to go over the covers, but instead carves it squarer to Boult at backward point. Over to you, Russell
just too full for the sweep, DK. He still goes through with the shot and under-edges it. The ball drops in front of Pant
wide legbreak, the batsman reaches out for the ball and carves it to backward point
short, ducks in at off, cramps Gill for room, chopped away to backward point
straying into the pads, flicked crisply to deep square leg
full again on off, presses forward and drives it straighter to long-off
shot, Shubman! This was pitched up and outside off, right in his arc, Gill collapses his back leg and drives it up and over extra cover. Goes all the way for six
really full on middle, 139.7ks, Karthik ventures down the track and drills a single down to long-on
back of a length on off, punched on the up but straight to cover

short outside off, and once again spinning away from the batsman. Stretches out, and connects with the cut. In the air for a while, but falls just beyond cover point. Boult does well in the deep to parry it back. Time out
good length outside off, and it's the googly! Forces the batsman to go onto the back foot, and defend it towards the leg side
full outside off, and driven with the legspin to wide long off. In the air for a while, but it was pretty safe
good length outside off, but turning further away from DK. Forced to reach at it, and mistimes his cut to point
drifted into middle stump, and Gill punches it down the ground off the front foot
flat to start off. It's the half-tracker, that DK comfortably flat-bats down the ground to long on
full on off stump. Very accurate, and Gill gives the delivery the respect it deserves. Defended off the front foot
fuller on off stump, and Karthik turns it off his pads to the leg side. Hit well, but man at deep midwicket for this shot
pulled over backward square! Back of a length on middle, and DK simply uses his wrists to flick-pull over square leg. Lands just beyond the boundary
good length outside off, but angling into Gill. He tiptoes and glances it towards point. Nice, early call for the single
back of a length outside off, but too slow. DK has all the time to cut it exactly where he wants. Hit to the man in the deep though
full just outside off, and that's a controlled drive past Plunkett's left. The Powerplay's over so there are men in the deep now
good length outside off, and this time Gill waits for the slower ball. Sticks his bat out and pokes it down to third man

short_text: Avesh Khan to Gill, FOUR runs
long_text: lifted over mid off! Oh, delightful. Full on off, and big back lift before drilling it over the infield. Show me the replay!

short_text: Avesh Khan to Gill, no run
long_text: short outside off, and Gill goes chasing after it. Tries to slash a cut over slip, but misses

short_text: Avesh Khan to Gill, no run
long_text: back of a lent outside off, and Gill tries to flat-bat it down the ground. Hit straight to mid off

short_text: Avesh Khan to Gill, no run
long_text: full on off stump, and that's a beautiful drive down the ground. Played off the front foot, but intercepted by mid on

the short ball does the trick again! Almost 142kph this time, and Rana took his eyes off while trying to pull. Mistimes the shot, and it's the easiest of catches for Avesh. Cups his hands and collects his wicket
offcutter on leg stump, and the ball spins into Rana. Tries to work it towards the leg side, but takes a leading edge towards cover
back of a length outside off, and too close to DK's body for the cut. Chooses to chop it down to third man
slower ball, full on leg stump. But Rana keeps his eyes on the ball and smothers it with soft hands towards square leg
full just outside off, and DK's front-foot drive takes the outside edge. Runs down to third man this time
full outside off, and Karthik's more than happy to drive it uppishly. Hit well, but falls just short of point
full on middle, and that's been whipped beautifully over midwicket. Chase for deep backward square, who eventually manages to cut it off. Good use of the wrists

short_text: Avesh Khan to Rana, FOUR runs
long_text: good length on off but it's angling across Rana, and gives him that extra width to free his arms. Brings out the square drive, and times it to perfection. Races across the outfield
back of a length outside off. Angling into Karthik, and he pushes it off the back foot to cover. They jog across for a run

short_text: Avesh Khan to Karthik, no run
long_text: short but too wide outside off. DK chooses not to play it, and the ball goes through to Pant
good length on middle. Angling across Rana as he sticks his bat. Outside edge takes it past the slip cordon and to the man at third man

short_text: Avesh Khan to Rana, no run
long_text: full on middle and leg, Rana shuffles onto the back foot, and taps it back to the bowler
full just outside off, and that's been driven off the front foot. Sliding dive at cover stops it from going for four

extra bounce does the trick! Short on off, and Narine backed away again to flat-bat it over point. Comes off the bat's top half, and Iyer - at cover - calls early for the catch. Slides across the surface to complete it
good length outside off, but extra bounce on this occasion. Narine backed away towards the leg side too much, and can't ramp it over the keeper
full on leg stump, but Narine drills this over the non-striker! Straight as an arrow. Too full, in fact, and Narine simple bunts this straight
over long off! Thumps this over Boult's head. Good length outside off, makes some extra room, and then sends this over the boundary
back of a length outside off, and Rana waits for this to come at him. Opens his bat's face and taps it to point
mistimes his pull! Straight to midwicket. Short on leg stump, and Uthappa was cramped for space. Tried to go through the shot nonetheless, but comes off the bat's top half
picked off the pads to deep square leg for one

Bowled'em. First ball to Lynn, Maxwell has him chopping on. Narine is strong v spin, but Lynn isn't as strong. This was a low-arm slider from Maxwell, wide of the crease, slides in at off, cramps the batsman for room. He hastily jabs his bat down and drags an inside edge back onto the stumps
back of a length and outside off, backs away and slaps it hard to Iyer. The new captain throws himself to his right to stop the ball
back of a length on middle stump, no turn, slides on, Narine backs away outside leg and crunches it over the covers again
dropped shorter and outside off, forced off the back foot through the covers
tossed outside off, full, Narine stays still, gets under it and clouts it over the long-off boundary
back of a length and outside off, Narine steps away outside leg and flat-bats the ball to the right of mid-off
back of a length and outside off, flat-batted down to mid-off
Boult responds with an inswinging yorker that finishes outside off, inside-edged onto the pad
back of a length on middle and leg, cramps the batsman for room, punched to midwicket
short on middle, just over the waist, swivels on the back foot and thumps a pull to the backward square leg boundary
short and angling away outside off, Lynn leans back and punches it crisply into the covers

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Iyer, SIX runs
long_text: Fittingly, Iyer finishes the innings with a six. Banged in short and outside off, Iyer holds a stable base and muscles it to the right of long-off again

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Iyer, FOUR runs
long_text: pitched up and angling across off, Iyer anticipates it. He jumps across off and swats it away to the right of long-off with the bottom hand
Mavi has lost his head and line. Iyer jumps across off, Mavi sprays it past the marker. Off-side wide

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Iyer, SIX runs
long_text: banged in short and outside off, Iyer hangs deep in the crease and pulls it flat and hard over midwicket for yet another six

101ks slower ball, dips outside off, Iyer does not pick the change-up. He swishes so hard that he loses his shape and under-edges it back to DK behind the stumps. They search for a single but Maxwell is sent back. The keeper passes the ball to Mavi, who clips the top of the bails with an over-arm throw

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Iyer, SIX runs
long_text: Change of angle? It does not matter. Full and angling away outside off. Iyer anticipates it. Shuffles across off, like Dhoni did the other night in Bengaluru, and smokes it over the wide long-on boundary

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Iyer, SIX runs
long_text: Mavi ventures wide of the crease, bowls a full one outside off, Iyer backs away outside leg. He manufactures more swinging room and lifts it inside-out over extra cover for another six
pitched up and outside off, Maxwell stays still, gets underneath the length and golf-swings it over the bowler's head. Delhi surge to 190. 47 runs off the last three overs
slower ball, dips just a shade outside off, offcutter it is, Maxwell is way too early into his leg-side slog and only collects fresh air
full and wide outside off, past Maxwell's swinging arc, he reaches out, loses his shape, swings and misses
full and slower outside off, Maxwell aims for a reverse sweep but is beaten
chest-high short ball on the leg stump, Maxwell does not have room to free his arms but still manages to pull it flat and hard over long leg
fuller than a good length on off, Iyer picks it up and whips it over square leg
Maxwell finally middles one and launches it over the boundary. Tossed up outside off, he golf-swings it across the line and puts the ball over wide long-on. 36 off the last two overs
there comes the big reverse-swat from Maxwell, but he finds cover point
the batsman backs away outside leg, the bowler follows him and hits the pad
Rana at the edge of the boundary now parries it over for a six. Tossed up on middle, presses forward, and miscues a loft. Raina at long on puts his hands above his head but lets it burst through
dragged away to the leg side
Rana runs in from wide long-on, dives forward, but the ball drops in front of him. Hits a hard length on middle, spliced in the air
full-toss outside off, Maxwell stays deep in the crease and swats it down to long-on. He lost his shape and miscued it down the ground

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Iyer, (no ball) 1 run
long_text: full-toss above the waist, spliced over the off-side infield

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Iyer, SIX runs
long_text: Iyer now goes over wide long-off for a six. Back of a length on the stumps, he backs away, manufactures swinging room and lifts it over the boundary

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Iyer, SIX runs
long_text: Uthappa drops the catch, parries it over the boundary, and costs KKR six runs. Back of a length and outside off, Iyer flat-bats it to the right of long-on. Uthappa moves swiftly to his right but lets the ball burst through his hands. Brings up a fine fifty
slower, short ball outside off, Maxwell waits for this 112.5ks and swats it across the line to deep midwicket
