off-stump yorker, 143ks, Iyer jabs his bat down and secures a single to short third man
short and outside off, slower ball, Maxwell delays his cut and sends the ball to sweeper cover
Maxwell ventures outside leg, Chawla fires it at 103ks outside off, flat-batted to long-off
95ks, darted in from wide of the crease, cramps the batsman and pings the thigh pad
flat and heading into the pads, picked off to deep square leg
really full on middle, driven down to long-on for one
front-of-the-hand slider, chopped to short third man
back of a length and fizzes through outside off, goes back and punches to cover
dug in short and outside off, Iyer gives himself some room and merrily frees his arms. Fiercely flat-batted away over long-off. Bam
bouncer on middle, 138ks, Iyer shapes for the ramp but pulls out at the last moment
back of a length and outside off, Iyer leans back, lets the ball come onto the bat, opens the face and punches it to the right of backward point
full and outside off, shuffles across and slices wide of point

Banged in short at off stump, Pant drops his gloves, expecting the ball to climb further. Instead the ball flies off the glove to Karthik behind the stumps. Just a waist-high ball. Inconsistent bounce has brought KKR two wickets in two overs
shorter and outside off, slapped away to wide long-on
full-toss heading down leg, wide

flat, quick, sneaks under the bat and hits the middle stump. This does not bounce at all. End of a sparkling fifty from Shaw. Another slider from Chawla, skids low, Shaw swings across the line and watches the ball shoot under his bat and rattle the stumps
Shaw uses his feet, Chawla goes short and cramps him for room. Played back to the bowler in the end
dropped short and wide outside off, slapped away to backward point. Russell lets it burst through his hands and allows a single
another slider from Chawla, he's firing 'em in, whipped with the angle through midwicket
95ks skidder, angled in, defended off the back foot
Chawla loops it up on off, too full, Iyer stretches out, meets the pitch and launches it right over the bowler's head. Hoisted into the top tier
short and veering into the hips, you've got to got it up higher, Johnson. Shaw sizes it up and short-arms it away over square leg. Sweet swing of the bat
back of a length and angling across off, dabbed down to square-ish third man
Iyer now succeeds in ramping it away fine of deep third man. Banged in short just a shade outside off, Iyer arches his back and finds the boundary
more bounce for Johnson. Dug in outside off and angling away, Iyer arches his back but can't connect with the ramp to third man
back of a length and angling away outside off, Iyer seeks to run it down to third man. No dice. Beaten
short on off, Shaw stands up tall and punches it past the bowler
dragged down on off stump, Iyer rocks back but loses his shape. He winds up dragging a pull between wide long-on and deep midwicket
full and attacking the stumps, worked away through midwicket off the back foot
tossed outside off and spins away, forward and driven to cover
Iyer uses his feet, the bowler pulls his length back on middle, dragged away to long-on
flatter and shorter outside off, chopped away to point
floated up outside off, Iyer drops down to one knee and smokes a slog-sweep over midwicket
142.3ks swinging full-toss on off stump, Russell searches for the yorker but overpitches it. Shaw stays still and belts it past the left of the bowler and right of mid-off. So easy on the eye
really full on middle and leg, tapped away to wide long-on
Shaw brings up a 38-ball fifty! His captain embraces him. Rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and secures a single to third man
dug in short on off, Shaw takes it on with a pull and flat-bats it up and over midwicket to skip away to 49
142.7ks wide yorker outside off, Shaw shows his ace early and backs away. Dre Russ spears it past the reach of the batsman
splice-jarring length on off, the ball hits the bat as opposed to bat hitting ball. Trickles away to cover
dropped short and wide outside off, Shaw makes additional room by backing away. Slapped away to the off-side sweeper
Shaw steps down the track, does not allow the ball to turn, he meets it on the half-volley and shovels with the bottom hand to wide long-on
Iyer rides the bounce of this back of a length ball outside off and steers to short third man
tossed up and spins in, tickled away with the break wide of Dre Russ at short fine leg. He tests out his right hamstring
really full on off stump, smoothly driven down to wide long-on
on a length and swerves away outside off as opposed to turning in, Shaw reaches out for the ball with his hands and carves a single to deep point
short on leg stump, and Shaw's cramped for space. Somehow manages to play it towards the leg side
oh, ho, ho, delightful! Full on middle stump, and that's been whipped over deep midwicket. Excellent pick-up from Shaw, and sent into the stands
good length on off stump, but angling into Shaw's body. Shuffles across to the off side, and flicks it off his pads behind square. Great timing, and the shot beats the man in the deep to the boundary
good length on off and angling across his body. Opens his bat's face and runs it down to third man for a walking single
good length on middle and leg, that's too close to Iyer's body for a square cut. Chooses to open the face of the bat and glance it to point
full and just outside off. Enough width for Shaw to free his arms, and that's been driven to long off
short to end the over! On middle stump, and Iyer's happy to duck under this. Collected by DK from near his face
offcutter on middle stump, smothers this towards the leg side off his pads, and played gently enough to take the second run
full on of stump, and that's a crunching drive off the front foot. Excellent sound of the bat, but straight to cover
short and wide outside off. He gets on top of the bounce, and slashes a cut to deep backward point
back of a length on the fourth-stump line. Forces Iyer to tiptoe, and defended off the back foot
good length on off, and Shaw mistimes a punch to long on. Gets his captain on strike

yorked! 143 kph. Full and straight, and Munro's been done in by the pace. Tried to drive, but too close to his body, and that's been inside-edged onto his middle stump. Mavi not afraid to give Munro a send-off
good length on off, and Shaw's in no shape to slog it towards the leg side. A wild shot, really, and it's been mistimed into his left leg. Shaw's hobbling.

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Shaw, no run
long_text: rolls his fingers over this one. Back of a length, and very wide outside off. But Shaw's deceived by the pace, and all he can do is mistime a flat-batted shot to mid off

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Shaw, no run
long_text: full on off stump, and Shaw shaped up well to drive this past cover. Can't find the gap, however
short! Good length on middle, and Munro's too slow to pull. Hits his bat's edge, and then ricochets onto his knee. That must've stung

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Munro, no run
long_text: good length on off and enough space for Munro to cut it square. But misses it completely, and the ball goes through to DK
full on middle stump, and slight swing away from his body. Drives it straight to cover, however
it's the offcutter this time. On a good length on leg stump, and flicked off his pads to fine leg
slapped over cover! Full outside off, and just enough width for him to free his arms. Bends his knee, and crackles this over the infield. Delightful
What a take! Short on middle, and Shaw's in to position to deal with this. Flies off the surface and Shaw misses the pull. DK, however, displays some great hang time
good length on leg stump, and he tries to work it towards square leg. Takes a thick outside edge, but falls short of Gill at short third man. Living dangerously here .
leading edge! But just short of cover. Good length on middle stump, and Shaw's through with his leg-side flick too early. Almost carried to cover though
overpitched on off stump, and Munro's leg-side slog doesn't connect. Inside-edge takes it to mid on instead
good length on off, and spinning away from Munro. Tries to cut but the ball zips under his bat
Biggie! Good length on middle, and Munro goes down on one knee, and swats this away over deep midwicket! Hit so well that it lands 10 rows back
full on middle, and Munro allows the body to go away from him. Mistimes his drive towards the off-side, but manages to find the gap between cover and cover point
good length outside leg, and spinning across Munro's body. Worked off the back foot to midwicket
good length on leg stump, and spinning into his body. Tapped off the back foot towards the non-striker

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Munro, no run
long_text: good length on middle, and Munro's trapped in his crease. Does well to defend it off the back foot

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Munro, FOUR runs
long_text: back of a length on middle, and Munro comes dancing down the wicket!  Mistimes his flat-batted shot over Mavi, but enough muscle behind it to clear mid on. Daredevils race away to forty
good length outside off, and once again punched off the back foot. Hit behind square this time, and there's a man positioned in the deep

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Shaw, no run
long_text: good length outside off, and Shaw's in position early to cut. Slaps it well, but excellent stop from Rana at point

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Shaw, FOUR runs
long_text: good length outside off, and Shaw rides the bounce to punch this past point. Kept his bat's face open, and lets the pace of Mavi do the rest

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Shaw, no run
long_text: back of a length outside off, and Shaw misses the ramp. Tried to glance it over short third man, but just timed his shot too late
good length outside off, and sharp spin into Shaw's body. Too close to his body for the cut, and that's been bottom edged
short on middle, and angling into Shaw's body. He allows it to come to his body, and then muscles a pull square to the leg side. Deep midwicket can't cut it off
full outside off, and Shaw tries to play inside out over cover. Lifts it easily over cover, and there's nobody in the deep either. Expensive second over from Chawla so far
good length on middle, and zipping straight through. Quicker one this time, and Munro can only tap it down the ground to mid on
oh he's feeling it! Full outside off, and forces Munro to reach at it. But he still manages to carve it over point, and once that crosses the infield, there's no stopping that
drilled down the ground! Full outside off, and smacked straight past the non-striker. Took one big stride forward and then went through with the full followthrough of the bat
good length on middle, and it's the wrong'un to end the over. Angling into Munro, who is forced to go towards the leg side, and punches to cover
short outside off, and that was aching to be punished. Munro goes deep into his crease and flat-bats it over Kuldeep's head! That sounded sweet
good length outside off, and spinning further away. Tapped off the back foot to mid on
tossed up on off, and that's been swept well! Drilled straight to the man at deep backward square. Shaw was quick to gauge the length there
good length outside off, but slow in the air. Punched off the back foot to long on for a walking single
good length on middle and angling away from Shaw. Goes onto the back foot, and whips this down the ground to long on. Gets Munro on strike for the first time
full outside off, and the wrong'un is picked up early by Shaw. Goes down on one knee, and slogs this towards deep midwicket. Man there though
good length outside off, but slightly low this time. Shaw tries to cut, but mistimed to point
full on middle and leg, and going down the leg side. Shaw tries to work it towards square leg, but misses. Appeal for lbw but the umpire isn't interested
good length outside off, and legspin this time. Shaw walks to the pitch of the ball and smothers it towards midwicket. Calls early for the second run
full outside off, and zipping into Shaw's body once again. Tries an expansive drive but checks his shot at the last moment. Tapped towards cover
full outside off, and that's sliding into Shaw. He does well to defend the first ball back to Chawla off the front foot

Base of middle Thampi seals the game! The simplest way to knock over the tailender. Go full, go straight, watch him flop around like mad and knock the stumps over. Rajpoot goes for the scoop, so he probably expected the fuller ball, just couldn't come out the right side of the gamble
goes for the inswinging yorker at 141 kph, Mujeeb clears the front leg to heave it through midwicket. Gets struck on the back pad and pinches a run to point
knuckle ball misses off stump by a whisker! Rajpoot goes for the six over long-on and for all the good it does, he may as well been a card board cut out of himself
inside edge! This game has had everything, and now this too. A trusty slog that becomes a sneaky boundary, beating Thampi
stands still and tall at the crease, no sign of nerves and cuts the short ball to long-off. Gee, this is a special kid.
slower ball, hiding it outside off, and Rajpoot only just catches up with it as he slashes it to long-off
he walks right across his stumps to heave the full delivery from the wide line out to deep midwicket. These nine runs, by the way, are Mujeeb's first in all T20 cricket
swings hard, swings blind, to be completely beaten. Saha fumbles behind the stumps and they sneak the bye

short_text: Rashid Khan to Mujeeb, FOUR runs
long_text: another reverse sweep, another boundary, this time over short fine leg! This game's alive and kicking again. Rashid tries to keep it away from the batsman's hitting arc, bowling wide outside off. But Mujeeb's the wunderkind. So obviously he pulls off this outrageous shot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Mujeeb, FOUR runs
long_text: whoa! Reverse sweeps his countryman to the backward point boundary, taking a quick delivery on leg stump out for a night on the town!
comes down the track and swings a long hop (yep, he seems capable of bowling those too) to short fine leg

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rajpoot, no run
long_text: almost finishes it as a quick leg break beats Rajpoot's swing and somehow takes pity on off stump. Allows it to stay standing

backs away and toe-ends the slash meant to go over the cover and watches his opposite number settle under a simple catch on the edge of the 30-yard circle. Rashid spreads his arms and soaks in the moment. Either that, or he's saying, "yeah, this is me. Deal with it"
slogs again, but this time, his mis-hit saves him so much that the ball lands short of midwicket running in off the boundary

dropped by Nabi at long-on! The man with a five-for wants to finish it in a blaze of glory. Takes on a hard length with a big ole slog. The ball soars up, swirls in the air, comes down into a pair of waiting hands and then pops  right back out.

and now the wicketkeeper runs out the batsman! Kings XI are pulling off a spectacular collapse. And Sran's little contribution is a toe-end slog that goes into the slips, making him believe there is a single. Ashwin knows there isn't and sends the batsman back. Meanwhile, Saha runs across, grabs the ball, takes aim and topples the stumps.

short_text: Kaul to Barinder Sran, no run
long_text: clears the front leg to swing hard and swing free. But the change of pace - knuckle ball - does not allow him to make contact
backs away and slaps a shortish delivery to the sweeper cover, where Rashid keeps it to only one.
flat-bats a short ball to long-off

short_text: Kaul to Barinder Sran, no run
long_text: back of a length, giving him absolutely no room. Sran plays half a cut shot and the ball skews out towards cover
fullish and outside off, he blocks to point and says no for the run, but Ashwin pulls him through

traps him in front, but Tye has reviewed! It's the knuckle ball - now that's a story to tell, Tye's a legend with that variation but he doesn't pick it. Swings all across the line, feet planted in the crease. Replays says there is no bat, HawkEye says it is clipping just enough of leg stump to make it umpire's call.

dropped by Shakib, but this is a seriously tough chance, with the ball going a mile high, swirling in the air, coming down perfectly straight, bisecting long-on (Shakib) and long-off. Big effort from the Bangladeshi, but it's in vain

slower ball, it loops off the bat and settles in the SRH captain's hands at short midwicket. Sunrisers are breaking out of jail again. Should Bhuvneshwar Kumar worry about his place in the XI now? They're making mincemeat of a top batting line-up without him. Case in point, this special little variation, having Tiwary reach in front of him for a flick shot and making the ball kick up off the pitch to ping off the high part of the bat and into safe hands
slower ball - the legcutter. Tiwary slices it to point and looks for a quick single. Ashwin says no
walks at the bowler and taps a back of a length delivery to long-on
turns a good length ball on middle through midwicket

comes down the track to try and nudge it to midwicket. But the ball drifts in a little too much for him to make contact. Big shout for lbw, but that's shot down. Then there's indecision between the batsman over taking a single. Nerves jangling everywhere!
full and outside off, Tiwary drives to long-off
presses forward to block a fuller delivery to the left of cover

taken at long-on, right on the edge of the boundary, with less than an inch leg! Pandey, you legend! Hyderabad is awake. The Kings XI are slowly falling asleep at the wheel. Finch wants another six to his name, wants to finish this off quickly, but that is a long straight boundary and even with perfect connection in the last ball, he only just cleared it
sees some flight and decides it has to go. Violent swing over long-on

short_text: Rashid Khan to Tiwary, no run
long_text: loads up the sweep, but he's through the shot - Rassshiiiid . his ability to change the pace in accordance to the desperation of the batsman is just unreal. The ball jumps over the top edge, lobs off the shoulder and then to slip

short_text: Rashid Khan to Tiwary, no run
long_text: huge appeal, Rashid wants the review, Saha says high and there's a mini conference, in the end there is no review. What a beauty though. He angles the leg break into the right-hander, but doesn't let him reach the pitch. Tiwary is lunging forward, he's off balance, he's closing the bat face and is beaten on the inside edge. The ball strikes his back thigh, in line with off stump. But is it high?

doesn't read the googly! Ignorance is clearly not bliss, at least if you're Karun Nair and Kings XI. The poor guy gets forward to block what he thinks is a leg break and is comfortably beaten on the inside edge. Great control of length from Rashid, suddenly pushing this one fuller, and slowing the pace too.
goes for the sweep before the ball even comes down the pitch. Rashid adjusts by pulling his length back and offers only a single to square leg.
a touch shorter than he likes to be and that allows Nair to tap it down to long-on

short_text: Rashid Khan to Nair, no run
long_text: beaten by the legbreak as Rashid pitches it on a good length and gets the ball to hurry off the pitch. That quick arm action again
premeditates a sweep and only just pulls it off, with the bat hacking down on the ball like an axe
full and outside off, drives to cover, where Williamson doesn't let it through
full on middle, Finch knocks it down to long-on
sweeps a tossed up delivery from outside off to deep square leg
he drives the flighted ball on off stump back to the bowler

long straight boundaries here, and Agarwal chooses to take them on despite not being to the pitch of this Shakib special. There's enough flight to draw the batsman forward, even out of his crease, and yet he still can't get near the ball. That little distance he has to reach forward to make contact ruins his timing. Fiftieth IPL wicket for Shakib

short_text: Rashid Khan to Nair, no run
long_text: stays back and blocks the flatter delivery on middle
pitches it up and gets it to skid into the right-hander as Agarwal plays a leg glance to short fine leg

short_text: Rashid Khan to Agarwal, no run
long_text: loops it up, and keeps it outside off. Agarwal looks for the slap through cover and is beaten
pulls to deep square leg; a rare slower, short ball from Rashid
looks for the pull, but the ball skids off the pitch and does not give him enough time to hit properly. Single to long-on
goes back, thinking this short ball is a legbreak, but it nips back in and messes with his cut shot
full on middle and leg, clips it through square leg

top-edges the pull but he manages to evade the bowler's reach and the ball plops somewhere in front of the imaginary mid-on. Another good short ball from Kaul, rising up to the chest and giving no room to swing
lifts the short of a good length ball off his hips to deep square leg
opens the face and slices the back of a length delivery outside off to deep third man
blocks a shortish delivery angled into the right-hander. He did this to Hardik Pandya and kept him quiet, refusing him any hitting room
works it off his hips to long leg, and Rashid hits the turf after being off-balance in trying to throw the ball in quickly
leans into this tossed up ball on leg stump, turns it to deep square leg and pinches a couple of runs before the fielder knows what's up
clears the front leg and whips a quick, flat delivery on leg stump to wide long-on
winds up for an inside-out cover drive. But he mis-hits back to the bowler
closes the face to nudge a tossed up delivery on off stump to deep midwicket
covers the line of this fuller - but flatter - delivery on middle and keeps it out
full toss wide outside off and Nair laces it through the covers
dabs a back of a length delivery down to deep third man
smacks a shortish delivery outside off to deep third man
back of a length and outside off, slices it to backward point
works it between fine leg and long leg. And oh, there's a collision between Rashid and Kaul! And the legspinner is gingerly feeling his bowling shoulder. Oh dear

can you hear the noise?! The screams of the Sunrisers. The absolute joy in the crowd. Basil Thampi is responsible for all of it. Started the season on the bench. But here he is, taking out the Bradman of T20 cricket, with an honest to goodness super dooper bouncer. It's quick. Its from around the wicket. It comes at his chest. The pull shot malfunctions. Top edge straight up and Thampi takes the catch himself somewhere around short leg
glides a shortish delivery outside off to deep third man
slices a tossed up delivery on off stump to deep point

how  what . just  why. That just should not happen! Rahul covers the stumps. He gets a good stride forward. He looks all set to defend this good-length legbreak on off stump. Except, it finds a way past the outside edge and then clatter into sticks like it was always destined to. Plays for the googly. Done in by the legbreak. Unreal bowling from the best in the business
goes for the big wind up and slogs a fuller delivery on off stump to deep midwicket. Mistimes it though

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gayle, no run
long_text: all of Hyderabad roars for an lbw appeal. But this good length ball, skidding through to beat Gayle's flick originally pitched outside leg
hangs back and punches the googly down the ground to long-on

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rahul, no run
long_text: b-e-a-uty! He has an in-form batsman lunging forward, reaching for the ball, unsure of how it turns. That bat may as well have been a chop stick
full on leg stump, Gayle taps it to midwicket
a gentle little nudge to deep square leg
bisects the fielders with a mis-hit! Luck be with Gayle-y to-niiiiight. Also, that slice off the outside edge, landing between point and deep third man brings up the fifty partnership as well.
there it goes! High into the night sky. Up into the second tier above long-on. And all Gayle does is clear the front leg and give it the full swing. Jeez, how much power does he have?
squares him up - if only a tiny bit - with a shortish delivery on off stump from around the wicket. Gayle blocks to point
stands nice and tall over this delivery on his pads and clips it to deep midwicket. Very slick.
full on off stump, Gayle looks to go big down the ground - that's more like it - but he gets an inside edge to short fine leg

spears it between short third man and point. These are not shots normally associated with Gayle. Just like he was never meant to get a century with a quick single. So you can understand Kaul going wide yorker. And then going wide-eyed
full on middle, he drills it to long-on

falls short of short third man as Rahul attempts another unreal shot - the late cut to a short ball angled into him. And on this occasion, even the batsman mistiming a shot doesn't help Sunrisers as Sandeep dives forward but can't get there

outrageous! He walks down the pitch, the bowler tops him by shortening his length, but Rahul says I'm good enough to still hit down the ground. Stands up taller, that bottom hand grips the bat tighter and he somehow gets on top of the bounce to clear mid-on
tucks a fuller delivery on leg stump to midwicket
picks the change of pace and defends the 119 kph delivery in front of off stump
comes down the track to a slower ball and clips it through square leg
full on middle and leg, he keeps it out
buh-rilllllllliant cover drive! It's up there for the shot, but the put away is pure no-nonsense awesomeness. Lovely stride forward, perfectly straight bat, gorgeous timing
shortish on and around middle, Rahul knocks it down to midwicket
knuckle ball? In any case, it deviates away from the right-hander, and rather late too. Rahul is playing in front of his body, with a closed bat face, and gets a leading edge
full on middle stump. Rahul goes back and pushes it to mid on. Enough time to take another single

short_text: M Nabi to Rahul, FOUR runs
long_text: full on off, but Rahul walks across to the off side and sweeps this over short fine leg! Some form he's in. Got inside the line of the ball and punished it once again

short_text: M Nabi to Rahul, FOUR runs
long_text: good length outside off, and enough width for Rahul to cut it square. Takes a step towards the leg side to make extra room, and crunches this past point thereafter

short_text: M Nabi to Rahul, SIX runs
long_text: short on off stump, and Rahul's waiting to pounce on that length. Rocks back onto the back foot and pulls over deep midwicket!
good length outside off, and the bounce gets big on Gayle. Still manages to turn it towards mid on for a quick run

short_text: M Nabi to Gayle, no run
long_text: back of a length on off and cramping Gayle for room. Defended to mid on
full on middle stump, and Gayle check-drives to mid on. He wants the single though, and sprints across to the non-striker's end. Williamson's throw can't get the direct hit
slower ball, full on middle and leg. Rahul keeps his eyes on the ball and judges the pace early. Whips it towards deep midwicket with the use of his wrists thereafter
full on leg stump, and easy clipped off his pads to deep midwicket. Gayle is more than happy to walk across to the other end for a single
good length on the fourth-stump line, and Rahul taps it down the ground to mid off. Forced to call for the quick single, and they eventually scamper through comfortably
good length on off stump, and slightly shaping into Rahul's body. Fended off the back foot with soft hands
good length outside off, and that back-foot punch is timed well. But straight to cover

short_text: M Nabi to Gayle, no run
long_text: appeal for stumped! It was wide outside off, and Gayle lets it go thinking it'll go for a wide but knows fully well where his popping crease is. Slides his back leg inside the line before Saha whips the bails off
good length on off and Rahul goes onto the back foot. Punches it straight, and off the bat's top half. Falls just in front of Nabi and then sneaks under his body to long on
falls just short of long off! Fast and flat outside off, and Gayle crunches it down the ground. Was in the air for a bit. Pandey the man there

short_text: M Nabi to Gayle, no run
long_text: full on middle stump, but going down the leg side. Gayle tries to whip it behind square but it hits his pads

short_text: M Nabi to Gayle, SIX runs
long_text: over long off Full on off, and Gayle comes shimmying down the ground before lifting it over Nabi. Checks his shot, but still enough to clear the boundary

short_text: M Nabi to Gayle, no run
long_text: full on off stump, but no real spin this time. Defended off the front foot
good length on leg stump, but Gayle waits for the ball to go across his body. Opens his bat's face and glanced it towards point
full on middle stump but tailing across Gayle's body again. Takes a big stride forward and taps it towards cover
full on middle and swinging across Gayle's bat. He tried to defend off the front foot after covering his off stump. Through to Saha
good length outside off, but tailing into Rahul's pads again. Flicked off his pads to square leg and loud cheers as Gayle gets on strike
full outside off but swinging into his pads late. Rahul shuffles across to the off side, and pushes towards midwicket
full on off stump. Rahul takes a stride forward and fends it back to Sandeep

five-for, that's his career-best figures, and the best this season as well. Great work from Rajpoot, going full, going straight, giving very little leverage for the batsman. Nabi tries his best to launch it down the ground, but it only carries to long-off

short_text: Rajpoot to M Nabi, FOUR runs
long_text: sets up deep in his crease and slashes a short and wide delivery point point's head. No one in the deep to stop that.

the perfect yorker! It starts from wide of the crease, hones in on middle and leg, takes a detour off the front pad and knocks over middle. Top stuff from the uncapped fast bowler, who now has four wickets in the game
goes for the bouncer as Yusuf starts to duck, then pokes the bat up like a periscope, and eventually accepts Pandey's call to get off strike so balls aren't wasted
goes wide of the crease looking for the wide yorker. It results in a full toss and Yusuf only manages an outside edge, on the bounce, to the wicketkeeper
back of a length and outside off, Pandey inside edges the cut into where silly point would be
full and outside off, Yusuf clatters it back into the bowler's hands
straying on the pads and Yusuf deflects it away to the fine leg boundary. Rare bad ball from the death-overs specialist
bouncer - at top pace - and Yusuf is comfortably beaten on the hook shot
clears his front leg to take care of a near-yorker on middle and leg. Single to deep midwicket
opens the face and launches the intended wide yorker over extra cover. That's fifty, off 48 balls.
misses a leg-stump full toss and is struck on the pad. Late inswing for Tye
carrom ball that skirts the wide line. Yusuf wants to pulverise it. He ends up being beaten by it. #Irony

short and outside off, wallops it to sweeper cover . and do we have a run-out?. Miller subbing for Mujeeb sends in a lovely throw - flat and hard and right over the stumps - but Yusuf's dive saves him
nudges a full delivery on off stump through to long-on

dropped at deep midwicket, this time it's Tiwary, waiting on the edge of the boundary, having very little room to manoeuvre. That makes him nervous and that makes him lose it. Yusuf lives to swing across the line again
backs away and cuts the legbreak to point. The throw comes in, and it's three or four feet away from the wicketkeeper and nearly results in four overthrows
starts with a carrom ball on middle and off, Pandey works it to long-on

dropped! Again! That's Pandey's third life of the game as he takes on a slower ball, on a length on middle, and tries to launch it over midwicket. The lack of pace messes with his timing. The height the ball goes messes with the fielder Agarwal
misfield from Ashwin, but it costs only one extra run with deep point still on the boundary. Pandey doing all he can to get a decent score on the board, this time with a late cut to a knuckle ball
belts the length ball outside off to long-off
oooh, that's the length he wants, right in his hitting arc on middle stump. But Tye saves himself some punishment with his change of pace. Pandey swings hard and gets an inside edge onto pad
wide yorker to follow the mean bouncer. Pandey is not ready for this one either.
shapes to cut a short ball that is loath to give him any room. Even though Pandey makes a lot of his own, he doesn't get the result he wants. Beaten

does him again! He has Yusuf reaching outside the off stump, the flight is just so darn delectable. But he just can't reach the pitch of the ball. Ends up driving with an angled face and is beaten on the outside edge
full and outside off, he lunges forward and is beaten on the outside edge. Yusuf is clearly not reading Mujeeb's variations
stays back to a flatter delivery on off stump and taps it down the pitch
full and on leg stump, sweeps it to long leg
traps him in the crease with a good length ball on off stump
right in the slot outside off and Pandey monsters it over midwicket. A-grade hitting
comes in with his legbreak action, like Anil Kumble, and bowls the offbreak instead. Pandey jams his bat down on the near yorker-length ball
spins past the long leg fielder! That's lucky for Sunrisers and Pandey's hogging it all tonight. Sweeps hard. The ball bounces right in front of the fielder and spins past his left hand
lobs it up tastily above Yusuf's eyeline. The batsman isn't sucked into a big shot and instead hits along the ground to long-off
another carrom ball, against which Pandey comes down the track and pops out to long-off
carrom ball, but it's gone short and allows Pandey the room he needs to smack it to the left of long-off. The lack of pace off the pitch, however, means he has no timing
drives to long-off
goes for the late cut, and ends up taking the ball right off off stump. Clooooose
shifts back, gets low, and scoop-pulls to fine leg. The umpire, however, says there is no bat involved and signals wide down leg

caught at deep midwicket! Mujeeb, who took a cricket ball to his eye, is bowling like a champion. Taking pace off the ball and preying on the pressure piling on the batsman. Shakib goes for the slog. Mistimes it badly and has to walk back
pops up but it's too far away from Mujeeb, on his right, to be a chance. Beautiful bowling from the young offspinner, holding the ball back, deceiving Pandey in flight and dip.

oooh, that cuts back in sharply off the pitch. The length is such that the left-hander thinks it is ripe to cut. But with the ball spinning the wrong way, Shakib has to work overtime in pulling the shot off
follows the batsman as he makes room and as a result, Pandey can only push it to long-off for a single
fuil and outside off, smears it to long-on

moves back and across again, but this time, Tye does better, pitching the ball up, but not so far that it is a half-volley. With nothing to get under, and no room to work with, he mis-hits to short fine leg
back to top pace, and it's a yorker too, on leg stump. Basically the worst ball to deal with as a batsman. And Shakib works it to deep square leg
misses a full toss. Well, if there was any doubt over how hard it is to pick an Andrew Tye slower ball

yep, have to go, have to do something. And so Shakib walks across and pulls a slow, short ball away to the long leg boundary. Really good batting. Targeted the vacant area, so reduced the risk involved

full and outside off - but it's slow. So very slow. Pandey is preparing to paste it through the covers and has to adjust his shot considering the lack of pace. Single to long-off as the bat turns in his hand while making contact
leans forward and flicks a slow, tossed up delivery on off stump through straight midwicket
another late cut, this time Pandey making sound connection as he beats the diving Sran to his left
beaten as the offspinner gets more bounce than turn and Pandey is looking for the non-existent turn with a late cut
makes him reach - an instinctive change in line as he sees Shakib backing away - and produces a miscued cut to third man
adjusts better to the pace of Mujeeb and plants the ball in the gap at cover

the batsmen must feel like this pitch can't make up its mind. To the quicks, it's fast and bounce. To the spinners, it keeps stopping. Pandey, here, all set to punch through cover, gets an inside edge back to the bowler
overpitched wide outside off, and it's an attempted drive from Pandey. Comes off the bat's toe end but sneaks through between the umpire and non-striker. Man at long on, however
back of a length outside off, and Manish makes some extra way. Opens his bat's face and slices a cut to short third man
slower ball, on a good length. Wide outside off, and Pandey's been deceived by the pace once again. Tries to cut but the ball goes over his blade

slower ball again. Back of a length outside off, and mistimes the pull again. Comes off the bat's bottom-half and trickles away towards midwicket. The lack of pace behind that shot allows him to come back for another run
short on middle, and Shakib's quick to swivel and pull. But mistimed towards midwicket, which allows them to scamper across for one
good length outside off, and starts off with the cutter. Pandey's through his drive too early, and takes a thick-ish edge. Falls just short of point though. Well deceived!
full just outside off, but spinning sharply into the right-hander's pads. Big stride forward and whipped towards midwicket
good length outside off, and Shakib goes deep inside the crease. Taps it towards mid on for a walking single
back of a length on off but angling into Shakib. Goes onto the back foot and fends it back to the bowler
good length outside off, and extra bounce this time. Misses the cut
good length outside off, and no spin this time. Cut off the back foot, but straight to point
full on middle stump, and easily worked off his pads towards the vacant square-leg region
backs away and taps the shortish delivery to long-off
keeps it wicket to wicket and Pandey, without any room, can only block
fuller little carrom ball outside off, drives into the covers, where Mujeeb misfields rather badly
holds the offbreak back, and Pandey is sucked in by the flight on this, goes through with the sweep shot way too early and misses altogether
whips a flat delivery on off stump down to long-on
blocks the fuller delivery on off stump
good length on middle stump from around the wicket, with the normal action. Shakib knocks it to long-off
that's the high-arm action and Pandey drills the half-volley to deep cover
goes back and slaps a shortish delivery on off stump through to long-off
slow through the air, barely wanting the ball to bounce with that side-arm action. It goes down leg and Rahul fumbles.
full and outside off, drives smoothly through to the sweeper cover
the ball comes out of his hand at around stump-high, as he bends his front knee and crouches in his action! Pandey stays still and works it through midwicket
around the wicket to bowl side-arm offbreaks, like Kedar Jadhav. Shakib works it behind square leg
is that a run-out. Ah, no. Ashwin loses the ball as he tries to guide it onto the stumps. So Shakib survives after a nudge into the covers and running a tad bit lazily
backs away as the good length offbreak comes in with the angle. Shakib punches it to cover
hangs back and works a good length ball (still offbreak) on middle to deep square leg
knocks it down to long-on
inside edge as Ashwin catches Shakib in the crease with a lovely length, just around the 4 m mark. The ball comes in with the angle and messes up the batsman's timing further
cuts the shortish delivery outside off from around the wicket to point.

short_text: Barinder Sran to Pandey, no run
long_text: pokes it into the covers and looks for a single off the misfield. Shakib says no.
top effort at short cover, Tiwary diving to his left to stop a scorching drive

short_text: Barinder Sran to Shakib, FOUR runs
long_text: blistering hit! He is such a clean striker, especially with the cut shot. And he will have plenty of opportunity to play that on this bouncy pitch. Third man and point may as well be doing the crossword

short_text: Barinder Sran to Shakib, no run
long_text: back of a length on off stump, blocks it

short_text: Barinder Sran to Shakib, FOUR runs
long_text: dude should have been out last ball, instead he gets a hip-high full toss as a free hit and launches it to the square leg boundary. This is the craziest Powerplay ever!

picks out third man! What is happening?! Shakib takes aim at a short and wide delivery and top-edges it straight down to third man. Oh, but wait! It's a no-ball! Shakib gets a life now! That's three wickets mucked up by Kings XI within the first 32 deliveries of the game.

short_text: Barinder Sran to Shakib, no run
long_text: goes for the drive on the up - a dangerous shot on a bouncy pitch. Finds cover

dropped by the same man who gobbled up the last catch! Tye is in the firing line of a fierce pull shot from Pandey (loads of power, poor placement) and he fumbles an absolute dolly. Pandey gets a second life in the Powerplay

taken at midwicket! Rajpoot is winning this on his own!  Meanwhile, Saha, the experienced Saha, the man who should have dropped anchor after the openers fell, goes for an ugly slog and gets a top edge. Sunrisers fans, look away.
shortish on off stump, steers it towards point
slots it between extra cover and mid-off, Ashwin catches up with it, puts in a dive and saves a few runs.
opens the face and runs the short delivery to third man
full and swinging away on off stump, Saha pushes to cover

dropped by Ashwin running back from mid-off! He moves a little slowly, perhaps because he has to keep track of the ball over his shoulder. Reaches out in desperation and ends up fluffing a mostly straightforward chance. And so Pandey gets a reprieve. Dude plays sweet shots, and then loses his head straight after. Like here, when he looks to take on a good length ball on off stump and lift it over mid-on. Not the shot to play on this pacy pitch

short_text: Barinder Sran to Pandey, no run
long_text: shortens his length immediately and pushes the ball further across the right-hander. Pandey leaves

short_text: Barinder Sran to Pandey, FOUR runs
long_text: magics it to midwicket! This is Virat Kohli territory, taking a good length ball on middle and off and ushering it to a legside boundary with great poise
some cut back in off the pitch surprises Saha as he blocks the ball with soft hands and trots across to the other end

short_text: Barinder Sran to Saha, no run
long_text: rides the bounce on this short of a length delivery outside off and guides it to point

short_text: Barinder Sran to Saha, no run
long_text: leans into a lovely cover drive, but that off side field is better packed than a jam jar
good length on middle, pushes it down the pitch. Pandey is a senior player in bad form. If ever there was a time to come good
forces the batsman off his feet to deal with this short ball angled in at middle. Oof, this is top-class new-ball bowling
he's probing away, just outside off, generating steep bounce. Pandey chooses to leave again
good length, outside off, Pandey ignores it like the due date on a phone bill

special bowling! It's bounce again, only this time it happens with the ball moving away from the batsman. Dhawan is squared up. He needs to play, but he's not sure how to. Ends up poking the bat out and offers the outside edge. Karun Nair at slip dives forward and takes a lovely catch.

short_text: Rajpoot to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: that's supreme skill. He reads the length of this short ball so early. He doesn't mind that the ball is decking into him, not giving him too much room. But the left-hander still goes for the late cut and gets it away to the third man boundary

short_text: Barinder Sran to Saha, FOUR runs
long_text: the right-left combo spawning a few mistakes. Sran strays on Saha's pads, who deftly turns it to the fine leg boundary. That ball would've been perfect for Dhawan

short_text: Barinder Sran to S Dhawan, 1 leg bye
long_text: flicks off the pad to the right of the wicketkeeper. Dhawan's little leg glance doesn't quite have the, um, legs

short_text: Barinder Sran to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: ooh, that's crunched. He sees width, He throws his hands at it. And then watches the ball skip away to the cover point boundary.

short_text: Barinder Sran to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: beaten with a bouncer! Oooh, this is a ripper of a start. On a true pitch with plenty of kick for the quicks, Sran hits the deck and gets the ball to rise up to Dhawan's neck. He goes for the hook and comes up a distant second

short_text: Barinder Sran to S Dhawan, 2 runs
long_text: sweetly hit as he waits for the full delivery on the pads and whips it through square leg

short_text: Barinder Sran to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: cramps Dhawan for room and the batsman can only chop it down by his feet
covers the line of this back of a length delivery, just outside off, at 137 kph
gets forward for a Test-match block

bounced out! Because Williamson isn't prepared for it to kick up off the pitch as it does. He sees the ball pitching short, believes there is enough room on offer for the pull, goes through with the shot, but only splices it to mid-off. Ashwin takes a simple catch. Kings XI draw first blood.
glorious strike, standing up on those tippy-toes to crunch a shortish delivery to point. That lovely vertical bat. That sexy high elbow. Excuse me for a moment
back of a length and outside off, Williamson lets it through

carves it away  third man's lining it up . but it falls short! Whoa. Talk about anti-climax! And to make it worse, Mujeeb, the fielder, gets struck in the eye as the ball bounces up at him. He's going off the field

crackalicious! How's that to win the match - a six over wide long-on with so much strength it's landed into the crowd. Dhoni absolutely bludgeoned that by going across and swinging it over the cow corner like that night at Wankhede in April 2011. Bravo lifts his arms and goes across to embrace MS Dhoni, who's cool as ever. Harbhajan comes out and lifts Dhoni!
another shortish ball outside off, Bravo stays back and cuts it over point for one
it's that trademark Bravo loft over the covers. Short ball on off, enough room for Bravo to throw everything at it, big and hard hit and it's sailed over the off side
edged and just past the keeper for four! He rolled his fingers over that short ball, it bounced well and Bravo hooked, got an edge and it went just over de Kock's leap
too full, driven straight back and it hits the stumps. Oh, it's deflected to the leg side and they come back for the second
short and wide, Dhoni swings and that moves away further for another wide
one more wide, this one's gone far down the off side. Pressure goes back to the bowler after a really good start
slow bouncer, it bounces so much that Dhoni lets it go over him for a wide
have you seen that before?! Low full toss and Dhoni slices it for six over point! Not a bad ball, only slightly inaccurate but these get punished in the death
full toss, slightly high, and Bravo can't middle it as he sends it down to long off. It dipped a bit and Bravo came down the track so not a no ball
good, wide yorker from Siraj. Dhoni jams his bat into the ground to send it to point
almost gets the block hole again, Bravo slams it down to long off
low yorker outside off, almost a low full toss and Bravo gets a tiny edge to the keeper
goes or a biggish swing first ball outside off, into the covers for one

Rayudu can't make it despite the dive! He steered it to short third man where Umesh dived to his right but the ball deflected away, making the batsmen think of two. But it wasn't too far and Umesh qickly got back and, guess what, direct hit at the keeper's end
too much room to free the arms, too short to give the batsman enough time and Rayudu gets on top of that to slap it between point and cover
wider from the batsman and Dhoni pushes it into off for one
over the sightscreen to bring up his half-century! Too full and straight after that wide, Dhoni's high back lift was waiting and he didn't even have to finish the follow through to hammer that
tries to bowl it well away and ends up giving a wide on off
short and wide going across, slapped over the covers for one
he has found the gap and the boundary we didn't see! In the channel outside off, Dhoni hung back and cut it late enough to bisect backward point and short third man. They didn't even move
short and slow outside off, Rayudu goes on his toes and lofts it over the covers for two more
good line just outside off, helps it to short third man for one

pitched up with some room and Dhoni has cleverly driven that square, almost beating the fielder. De Grandhomme runs across to his left behind square and slides to just keep the ball in. The third umpire is checking and looks fine
almost in the block hole, Rayudu slams it down to long off
short of length outside off, dabbed to third man for one
that's better from Rayudu, that's a six on any ground! Walked across for the length ball and clubbed it away into the cheering crowd over deep midwicket for his eighth six
these boundaries are so short, that's another six over the covers! Short again outside off and Rayudu stayed still until slapping that flat and well over the covers
short and wide outside off as Rayudu swings, misses and it's called a wide even though Anderson thinks it's not
short outside off, upper cut to third man after a bounce

dropped! Leading edge and Umesh has put it down. Rayudu went for the big shot from outside off, he didn't get close to it and that went so high Umesh had all the time in the world to get under it. He got under it in the cricle on the off side but it popped out
slightly slower and angled across from well outside off, he swings and misses
smashes the full delivery down the ground, Kohli sprints across to his right from long off and sends back a powerful throw to keep it to one. Both captains giving it their everything
good delivery on the off stump, Dhoni pushes for a single as soon as he helps it to mid off
length delivery just outside off, Dhoni waits and then defends
stays back in the crease and bunts it down to long on
over the covers and six, Rayudu's sixth six! He charged down the track and didn't look like he middled it, but he got enough to send it flat and over
slower short ball well outside off, Rayudu lets it go but it's not a wide
shot and wide outside off, he reaches out and tucks it over point
better line from Negi - wider outside off as Rayudu tries to sweep but it's out of his reach outside off
it's Rayudu's turn, he's sent that over the cow corner! Short enough from Negi for Rayudu to go back quickly and pull that to the leg side. It's a short boundary and they're making full use of it
looks to come forward but then goes back and cuts with a thick outside edge after the turn to short third man
changes the line to pitch it outside off, brings it shorter too and it turns to beat Dhoni
one more, not a drop of sweat and that's gone over long on! Another fullish delivery from Negi, on the stumps and right in the zone for Dhoni to hit it straight
here comes the golf swing! Pitched up on off and Dhoni is not going to leave those, quick hands, strong bottom hand and all the power from those arms and shoulders launches that over the sight screen
better line from Chahal as Dhoni drives that with turn into the covers
this one is a wide was it turns and goes wider than the line
flatter one on the pads, gets one to the leg side with a thick inside edge
slow and well outside off, turns away further and Rayudu leaves, thinking it's a wide. But it's not
lofts it down the ground and reaches long on after a bounce. Risky shot for a single
slightly slower and full on middle and leg, chips it bit in the air and down to long on
towards the pads and it's worked fine for a single
pitched up slightly and he helps it down to long off
into the open sky and into the stands! Pitched up slightly in Dhoni's arc, he picked the length and smoked it over long on. Hit it so hard, I wouldn't have tried to catch it

Anderson appeals loudly for lbw as Rayudu goes down on a knee to sweep that to the leg side but misses it. Not given as runs and Kohli reviews it. It hit Rayudu around his waist but height may not be a problem, did it pitch in line? Pitches in line, and that has actually gone past and over stump so RCB lose a review.
not too far from the off stump, Dhoni stays back and punches it to long off
a cutter at 120kmh on leg stump, Rayudu guides it into the off side
enough room outside off for Dhoni to drive it away to deep point
goes for a big sweep but Chahal has smartly bowled it slow and Rayudu is through with the shot already, goes on to hit the stumps but doesn't matter
flat googly towards the stumps and Rayudu defends it back. Oh, no ball for overstepping. Ouch, harsh call from the umpire, Long
touch fuller and towards leg, helped towards square leg for one
nicely flighted on middle and leg, Dhoni waits and helps it straight to midwicket
soft hands from Dhoni to work that to the leg side from leg stump, they run hard and make it back for two
towards the leg side and Dhoni covers his stumps to paddle that down and fine on the leg side before the fielder there dives to his right to save two
turning towards off from middle, Rayudu goes back and turns it to leg
nicely bowled on the stumps, around middle and leg and it turned enough to make Dhoni defend it back. No room whatsoever
takes a step down and pushes the ball with the turn to long off
charges down again to take it on the full and slams it to long on
launches it over the leg side, he's not wasting time today! Took a step down as soon as he saw the ball was on leg, reached the pitch of the ball and sent it over deep midwicket
targets the stumps with the angle, Dhoni pushes it straight back
towards the pads from Negi and Rayudu works it against the spin to leg
so much turn, he's got the off stump! After that wide, Chahal goes wide outside off, wide enough to tempt Jadeja into a cut and he tries that but it turns in viciously to knock the stumps over!
turns from middle and leg and goes down leg for a wide
pitched up this time so he drives it down to long off easily
beaten! Rayudu stays back to let the ball turn and it turns so much that beats his outside edge
goes inside out again with the turn, and this time he has middled it with the turn. It's gone high and over deep cover all the way
goes for the drive but it's a touch slower and doesn't turn that much, inside edge back to the bowler
keeps low, loud appeal turned down quickly! It was short and quick, Rayudu pulled and missed but was struck outside leg
stifling line around off again, he goes across a bit on his toes and helps it to leg for one
short and towards Jadeja's waist, works it away easily or one more
back of length and coming in again, tucked to leg off his toes
dances down and smacks the ball from outside off to deep point. A fielder is stationed there
swings it into him from middle stump, no room for Jadeja to put it away
pretty straight and coming into the batsman, he defends to leg for one
brings the length shorter and the ball doesn't bounce much but Rayudu stays back to whip it to leg
flatter on the pads, Rayudu pushes it to the right of Chahal and the bowler sprints across quickly
lunges forward a bit for the length ball on the stumps, blocks it
turns into him a fair bit from outside off, Jadeja tucks it to leg off the back foot

lots of turn and he's stumped! Billings came down the track, Chahal bowls it slower through the air and shorter on the stumps, Billings looks to flick it with the wrists but the ball turns so much that it's gone past him and into the keeper's gloves
plants his foot across and paddles it fine against the turn and it's gone really fine to beat the fielder
just outside the off stump, he steers it down to third man
straighter on the off stump, solid defence from Billings this time
wow! Goes through Billings, just misses off stump and de Kock takes it near his shoulders. That swung in late from back of length around off, Billins presented the staright bat but on the wrong line
on the pads again, his time Billings flicks it properly and over midwicket to clear the fielders for four
loud appeal  first ball for Billings, but it's going down leg, the excitement for RCB makes it a loud appeal. It was angling in and going down for sure

the persistence with pace pays off, Raina miscues it to backward point! Raina strayed from his stumps again and Umesh pitched it up with some swing towards his legs, Raina flicked but mistimed it horrible and the edge went the other way, easy peasy for Mandeep
the umpire ducks as Rayudu charges down and slaps the short of length ball over the bowler's head with sheer disdain. He's looking in ominuous form
angled into him this time, worked to the leg side more easily for one
in the air and right in the gap on the off side, he gets four too! Raina backed away again for the short ball and slayed that ball right between extra cover and cover point
goes towards the off stump and Siraj strays down leg for a wide
quick and nipping into Rayudu, just about gets his bat down for one towards point. Think he got glove actually
pulled to midwicket for a one-bounce four! He went to the off stump early to predict the slightly short ball and then swivelled on the back foot to pull it in the vacant area
starts with a short ball outside off, Rayudu gets over the ball in the nick of time to defend
goes through him! Umesh cranking it up and bowling short to Raina even as he's making room to target the off side. This time the ball swings into him and he can't get any bat on that
short ball for Raina, he makes plenty of room and pulls that just wide of mid on and in the gap for four
hint of swing away from outside off, he dabs it late to third man for one
cramps him for room with a short ball towards the ribs, good comeback from Umesh. Made Rayudu uncomfortable as he brought his bat down just in time
short, wide and swinging away, he cuts and misses
strays towards the pads and Rayudu won't let that go. Uses his wrists and flicks it off the middle to the long leg boundary. Goes all the way!
quick again aorund off, worked to the leg side and he keeps strike
flat and quick outside off, he pushes it back to the bowler
more elegant this time, pitched up and Rayudu stays still to drive that nicely down the ground with a big swing. Pressure on bowler now
flat and short at 99.6 kmh, Rayudu dances down and clobbers that over deep midwicket. He's broken the shackles
pretty straight outside off, Rayudu dabs it to cover point
around length outside off, tickled to the leg side with the angle
here comes the short ball, not a bouncer, and Raina taps it with a horizontal bat to midwicket
138kmh and Raina had no clue about that! What a beautiful length delivery from Umesh, in the channel outside off, Raina doesn't know whether to go back or forward, drives and misses
it's angled away outside off and Raina dabs it tentatively to point
risky single the one as Umesh's short of length ball squared up Rayudu a bit, he defended it off the back foot towards cover and Raina made it just in time
taps the back of length delivery from outside off to Negi at point again, the crowd showes how much they love him
swings it away from length as Rayudu helps it towards backward point where Negi puts in a dive
caught at mid-on, Negi has struck! Wasn't the short on the stumps but Watson went back to pull and miscued it, easy catch for mid-on
high and long! Lunges forward for the length delivery and gets under the ball really well to send that flying over long on. Negi shut his eyes as soon as Watson launched it
bit too short and Watson pulls but miscues it to backward square leg
comes down now and pushes the ball down the ground with the spin to mid off
leans forward for the length delivery and defends solidly
starts with a full delivery and Watson drives it down to long off

you beauty. Sundar with some aggressive sensibility! Shows the older boys how it's done. Stands his ground once again, allows the bowler to bowl to him and reacts to find a boundary through point. It's a poor ball - short and wide, and he carves it expertly
shot. That'll bring up 200. It's a full toss on off stump and he gets under it to punch straight over the umpire

smash. Sundar with a reminder that there's some batting left. Hangs deep in the crease, gets a short ball that is also a slower ball. Plenty of time to swing and he manages to lift it over deep midwicket. That's a Chinnaswamy sixer
bye bye. Bizarre over. Bizarre cricket. A slower ball at length outside off. Umesh looks to slug it to Commercial Street. He can only find Billings, 20 yards in from the boundary at deep midwicket

almost another run-out. Royal Challengers trying hard to get bowled out. A full toss - wide down leg side. He's got a free run but he's skipping outside the crease for some reason. Dhoni misses both the stumps and the batsman narrowly with his throw

and another! Well, scratch that about momentum. Three wickets in three balls. Two run outs. Quite appalling. It's a full toss and he lifts it inside-out to long-off's right. Jadeja picks up on the bounce. Sundar has settled into the crease at the non-striker's end. Negi is running down frantically though for some reason. Turns, slips, can't make his ground at the striker's end

Dhoni hits and that's Colin de Grandhomme. And the associated runs. Too simple for him - he chucks it overarm with his glove one. Negi was looking to dab this slower ball past him with a late cut and missed

taken at deep midwicket. Mandeep picks the knuckle ball, but this length ball is too far outside off for the slog sweep he plays eventually. Ends up slicing it and Jadeja has an easy one. This is a good innings from Mandeep, he has put the momentum back in RCB's favour
full and very very wide outside off. No chance he'll hit that

shot! This is Mandeep's arrival. It's taken some time. Stunning hit. A knuckle ball dug in short outside off. No pace off the pitch but somehow he has pummelled this, one the up, with a flat bat over long-off
he shapes to jump into the leg side for a ramp and withdraws late. The bowler is forced to bowl wide outside off and he leaves to get the extra run
slower ball dropped short outside off, reaches out and flat-bats it past the non-striker. Calls for two immediately and they do well to get back
yorker outside off, jams it to long-off off the toe-end
dabbed between the two sweepers on the off side. He was looking to get down for the ramp over short fine, but it's a slower ball short and wide outside off. Stabs it out there.

sweetly timed! Mandeep Singh with a top-class shot. It's a length ball wide outside off and he gets his weight down on his back thigh as he reaches out and uses his wrists nicely to slice it over point
in the block hole but de Grandhomme lofts it back over the fielder and even beats long off for a four. What a shot!
moves across and whips the slow and low full toss to long leg. Chahar is stationed there but de Grandhomme comes back and throws in a dive as the throw comes wide
smacks it back to Bravo who sticks his left hand out couldn't hold on to it. It will count as a drop but was struck really hard
length delivery this time at 135kmh, it doesn't bounce much and Mandeep slogs but misses again
slow bouncer, it beats Mandeep completely. Can't get close
slow yorker outside off, gets some bat and Dhoni dives to stop, he has a shy at the stumps closer to him and the batsman is nowhere close, he misses and then they take one on overthrow too
yorks de Grandhomme, who bunts the ball to the right of long on where Bravo chases and throws it back and Mandeep makes it with a dive just in time
pitched up and Mandeep uses his wrists to whip it to long on
drives it with the turn into the covers where a fumble allows one
quick and flat outside off, he taps it late and calls for the single quickly
some flight there outside off, de Grandhomme waits and drives to sweeper cover
short ball on leg and it's pulled to deep midwicket
beaten first ball outside off, he tried to defend the length ball but it turned again and missed the bat and off stump, both
lots of turn outside off, Mandeep stretches out to tap it through the covers
he takes out the reverse sweep now for the ball on off stump. Fine leg was in and all he had to do was clear that fielder
sweeps it with some power against the turn, Billings throws himself to his right with a giant leap at deep midwicket and just misses it
beats him outside off with the turn again, turns him square

that turn beats the batsman and Dhoni! It pitched on leg stump, maybe even outside, Mandeep looked to work it to leg and that turned a mile to miss the off stump while Mandeep came out of the crease and Dhoni missed the ball too

two in two, Tahir is running again! Anderson got strike because they crossed over on the previous delivery, Tahir sent down a wrong'un outside off and Anderson poked tentatively to slip where Harbhajan pouched it

AB holes out, another great over for CSK. Not a great delivery, it was a short legbreak well outside off and turned away further but AB swung away from the body and the leading edge went high enough for Billings to run in from sweeper cover. He doesn't drop those
takes a step down to make it a full delivery and drives it hard to long on
sweeps against the turn and along the ground to long leg
pretty short and Anderson miscues it down the ground, lands short of long on
enough room outside off to drive that powerfully along the ground through the covers
he charges a bit after those five dot balls, Bravo is smart enough to land that wide and away from him, another dot
outside off, yorker again and Anderson chops it to backward point
big lbw appeal from Bravo, it was a really really slow yorker and beat Anderson completely, hitting him near the knee on the back foot. Looks like Dhoni didn't want to review
nearly a yorker outside off and it's steered to point where Raina puts in a dive
starts with a bouncer to Anderson and he lets it go outside off

oh, he's broken this stand with a good return catch! It was a typical Bravo slower ball, back of length on the stumps and de Kock pulled but a bit too early and handed it back to the bowler, who brings out his dance celebration and the crowd loves it
really slow bouncer on middle and it's angled it, AB sways his head out of the line and tries a kind of ramp but misses
gets room to free his arms and he does, along the ground to deep point
goes back and across, good reply from Thakur with a yorker outside off near the feet and AB drives it bit wide of long on
three in a row! Outside off now, bit too full and big swing of the arms to send that flying over the covers. The fielders can call for chairs now
here comes the knuckleball, here comes another six! It was too full, that's what was wrong with it, AB spotted the speed variation and tonked it straight down the ground
launched into the sky and that's fifty for him too! It lands in the crowd beyond the midwicket fence. It wans't full or too short, but those things don't matter to AB

short_text: Watson to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: not that short, but what a shot! Just a tad short, de Kock stays back and still and then smokes it over the midwicket boundary. That's gone a long, long way!

short_text: Watson to de Kock, no run
long_text: wide yorker to de Kock as he makes room and then stretches to reach out for it, can't get there
top edge, where does it land? Just before long on who runs in a long way from the boundary. What luck for AB. He pulled the short ball and didn't get enough
makes room and it's slower again, heaves it to the leg side for one
tries the wide yorker and de Kock paddles it from so far to the leg side
length delivery at 123kmh outside off, big swing and AB gets it to long on for one
wide signalled by Nigel Long as this one is full and wide outside off. Watson lets out a smile
slower through the air on leg, de Kock works it with the spin to leg with soft hands so that they take two even though Dhoni chases it all the way
stays back and across in the crease and works that after it turns to leg

that's out of the stadium! He walks across to expose his stumps, it's a length delivery, although it doesn't matter to this man, and he clobbers that over long on, over the stands and over everything. Someone fetch that as AB grabs a drink
goes the other side this time, six more! Plants his front foot across and sweeps that against the turn from length over long leg into the crowd
poor delivery - short and turning away, AB makes room and misses it
just outside off and AB gets a reverse sweep on that one, no power only guides it fine and gets four
goes across early and scoops it over the in-field behind square. Didn't get much distance but got two
in the block hole yet again, what accuracy. De Kock bunts it a bit wide of point and takes off, Raina has a shy at the stumps and misses while AB makes it
in the block hole on the of stump, de Kock does well to steer it to deep point and they get two for that. The stand reaches 50

short_text: Bravo to de Kock, no run
long_text: yorks him for the second time in three balls, got it across with the angle too and de Kock misses again. Bravo thought he got some bat

short_text: Bravo to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: slower ball at 101kph, but it's too full and de Kock slams it straight and over the bowler's head for a clean six! Big stride and big bat swing

short_text: Bravo to de Kock, no run
long_text: starts with a wide yorker which de Kock can't get bat on
on the middle stump, AB plonks his front foot across and goes for the big sweep. Thakur runs to his right at long leg and just about keeps it in, almost over-running in the deep
goes for the big slog sweep, it was slightly full, but he gets an inside edge to the leg side

short_text: Tahir to de Kock, no run
long_text: makes room and charges, Tahir yorks him and de Kock bunts it to cover point
little full and AB drives it down to long off for one
bit more orthodox this time, worked with the spin to the leg side

short_text: Tahir to de Kock, no run
long_text: pitches this one leg stump, de Kock tries the reverse sweep and misses it completely. That wasn't far from the leg stump
tried the yorker but de Kock came down and turned it into a low full toss to work it down to long on for one
offcutter at 123kmh, he spots it and cuts off the back foot to deep point for one
at 122.2 kmh this time and de Kock comes down to slam it to sweeper cover for one

short_text: Watson to de Kock, no run
long_text: slower at 128.4kmh, the speed variation beats the batsman outside off as he cuts again and misses

short_text: Watson to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: angles it across, there's not much room but de Kock cuts that nicely off the back foot and bisects the gap between point and short third man. Not a bad ball, but really good shot

starts with a slow off cutter on middle and leg, de Kock nudges it to leg and they took a single at normal pace and realised no fielder was sprinting in on the ball so take one more. Plenty of 30-plus players in CSK
swept yet again, Tahir has to run to his left from long leg and keeps it inside the boundary
works it with the spin from around off, it's between two fielders and they get two quick runs
stays still, it's outside off and drives it along the ground to sweeper cover for one
plants his front foot across and he sweeps that behind square for a six once again, the bowler doens't matter to this man
sweeps successfully this time to fine leg

short_text: Jadeja to de Kock, no run
long_text: takes a step down and tries to work it with the spin, stifled appeal for lbw
makes room, Harbhajan sends it slower and AB waits to defend it back. Loud cheers for that too
makes room yet again and gets enough of it to free his arms again to slam that square of the wicket for four this time. The length is not that bad, but this batsman isn't bad either
woah, a flat six over the covers! It was pitched up, no doubt and AB smoked that over the covers like he knew where that was coming and at what speed. What a shot!
tickles it with the turn to the midwicket fielder
he comes down and that lands into the crowd over long on! A bit of light, he absolutely middled that fearliesslly because long on was there and it sailed over him
some flight outside off and de Kock wants to whack it, but only gets a single down to long off
on the off side this time, AB steers it late to short third man
heaves and misses! Short of length and swinging in a bit late, he goes for the mighty pull and the ball goes just under the bat
another good delivery, straight and on length. AB stays still and punches it back, just evading the bowler but they decide against the single because Jadeja is there
straight delivery served first up to ABD, he pushes it back

Jadeja dives and takes it at mid-on. Kohli walked down this time, it was a length delivery on the stumps and Kohli wanted to loft it over the fielder but didn't quite middle it. Jadeja was slightly wide at mid-on and he quicklt went to his left for a dive and grabbed it with both hands. Thakur is thrilled!
angles this length delivery into the pads, no swing and Kohli works it to midwicket

short_text: Harbhajan to de Kock, no run
long_text: little flatter, de Kock goes hard at it outside off but doesn't quite middle it

short_text: Harbhajan to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: dances down this time and doesn't let the ball turn from off stump. Middles that and hits it against the turn with a big follow through over long on

short_text: Harbhajan to de Kock, no run
long_text: flight and room again, he frees his arms to cut this time, there's some bounce too and he finds the fielder again

short_text: Harbhajan to de Kock, no run
long_text: some room outside off, he goes after it and drives it along the ground to cover
bit of flight and it's pitched up a bit, Kohli helps it down to long on this time
pitched up around off, Kohli comes forward and drives it back
walks down the pitch and Chahar bowls it short outside off, not much room so Kohli dabs it square for a single

another slower ball, it's full and Kohli picks it to flick it with those mighty wrists, it's going fast towards the midwicket boundary where Billing dives to keep it in, but the ball is rolling towards the boundary again and we have the third umpire looking at it. Looks like Billings' fingers touched the boundary when he tried to keep it in for the second time
makes some room this time, it's a slower ball and he patiently pushes it into off for one

short_text: Chahar to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: smokes it for six this time! Bit fuller, de Kock leans into it and slams that over the long-on boundary with the inswing

top edge, it goes really really high and just avoids Dhoni who runs back all the way and then flicks the ball inside the boundary to save two. De Kock pulled the short ball and his heart must have been in his mouth after that went high, but it went back over the keeper
back of length again and tapped to point by Kohli again for one more single
taps the back of length ball outside off nicely and steals a single to keep strike
he pitches it a touch shorter, Kohli waits and steers to cover point patiently
still too full, Kohli drives along the ground this time through the covers and gets two
the crowd loves it! Because this is pitched up, there's some outswing and there's Kohli driving that over mid off beautifully from the middle of the bat
walks down the track this time, Thakur sends it down towards the pads and he gets an inside edge behind square on the leg side

short_text: Thakur to de Kock, no run
long_text: too full outside off and some swing for him too, de Kock reaches out to drive but doesn't middle it
back of length outside off, Kohli hangs back and punches it to cover
brings it touch shorter now and much straighter with that outswing, Kohli defends it back
bit too full on middle and leg and Kohli flicks it away almost nonchalantly over midwicket for a cracking four. Excellent timing
pitches it short to Kohli and gets some away movement, Kohli stays back and defends it to the leg side
nice inswing this time from outside off and on good length, de Lock punches it towards mid off and gets off the mark

short_text: Chahar to de Kock, no run
long_text: slightly full outside off and not much swing, QdK reaches out and steers it to cover point

is that it? Yes it is! Deepak Hooda not in the XI today, but he has the opportunity to be on the field for a very, very famous moment. Gets under it at midwicket and completes a catch. Mustafiz looks to pull and gets it off the high part of the bat. A slice - no danger. Mumbai's innings was no danger, to be fair. A feeble end but a fitting one
bunts one over the non-striker as he backs away to slog. Thampi just too quick off the surface for these two
short of a length ball in the corridor. Swipes from under it and can't connect
chipped wide of midwicket as he looks to pull. Length ball is too quick as it angles into him
length ball in the corridor. He backs away to try and lift it over extra cover. Beaten
inside edge it appears. Length ball outside off. Gets on his back knee and looks to drive but this ends up with the keeper
oh there's life here still. Just about. Short of a length ball in at the hips. Bumrah swings cleanly and connects to drag this to fine leg's left. The slide won't help, it's four

aims midwicket again and that's curtains! Hardik Pandya has sliced one to third man! Same line and length three balls in a row, same shot offered with no result. You've got to question that strategy. But it's also superb bowling from Kaul. He has now picked up three wickets in under two overs. 3 off 19 balls for Pandya. This will be tough to get over. Mumbai on the verge of a stunning defeat.
misses again! Looks to go leg side again. Short of a length ball outside off and it's too quick again. There are gaps over extra cover and mid-off, but he's aiming midwicket right now
looks to swat it away but he's beaten by pace. You won't spot any faces at Wankhede, they are all covered with nervous palms. Short of a length "heavy ball" outside off shoots past the attempted slog

Dhawan flies to his right and can't hold on! Oh what a catch that would have been! Kaul gets it to rise in the corridor and Bumrah fends at it with hard hands. It is sailing high and very wide of Dhawan at wide slip. He does superbly to even reach it. But can only parry it to third man

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pandya, no run
long_text: maiden. Hardik fails to get off strike. It's a length ball outside off. Looks like he wanted to tickle this through square leg but it spins away.

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pandya, no run
long_text: length ball at off stump, pushes it to point off the front foot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pandya, no run
long_text: length on leg stump, flicked straight to short fine. Refuses the run again

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pandya, no run
long_text: googly. Length ball outside off. Blocked solidly on the front foot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pandya, no run
