long_text: length ball outside off, stabs at it outside off and is beaten. Revs. Such revs.

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pandya, no run
long_text: length ball outside off. Leans in to a drive to long-off. Refuses the run

plumb! Markande is gone! Kaul has put the fear truly into Wankhede now! It's a full ball on middle. Markande plants the front leg across and tries to flick behind square. He's not good enough to do that. There is no doubt in this one
length on leg stump. Looks to flick but cops it on the thigh guard. Steals a single pitch side on the leg side
length just outside off, a tentative push to extra cover from the crease
length ball just outside off, steered to third man from the crease

he's given him! Mitch falls over as he tries to flick and is trapped right in front. Consults and reviews. Has that pitched outside leg? Looks like it's pitched in line yes it has! Dead. Right in front of middle. Mumbai are folding quickly now! They have lost their review.
short and in the corridor. Gets behind and dabs it to third man's left
length ball just outside off. Tempts him to have a poke. He leaves it alone

picks out deep square! This is disastrous for Mumbai! It was an incredible shot -  a short arm whip off his hips at this length ball on leg stump. But he's launched it straight to the fielder there! Oh dear, this is getting tense Suryakumar has done superbly to keep reaasuring Mumbai so far. Now he's gone.
run out chance missed. Shakib fails to pick up the ball at extra cover after running in. The batsmen are only just crossing over halfway down the pitch. Hardik dropped this pitch side with soft hands
length on off stump, defended from the crease
length on leg stump, leans in and flicks straight to short midwicket
full on middle stump, sweetly timed drive to long-on

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pandya, no run
long_text: bounces past off stump! Rashid rips a googly in and Hardik is caught on the move as he looks to make room for a punch through cover. He can't do it. Under-edges int the turf and just survives

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pandya, no run
long_text: googly just outside off, defended on the front foot
full outside off. Goes too hard on the cover drive, gets it out to long-on off the inside half of the bat
ah, poor. Drops it very very short. Hardik taps to sweeper cover

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pandya, no run
long_text: length ball outside off. Zips off the surface as Pandya leaves. Saha does well to hold on

guides it to slip! Second batsman tonight to attempt a late cut with a slip in place. First to make connection. He's gone. Got to question that shot. It was a short slider outside off and he can't get it wide of Dhawan. That was travelling quickly, he did well to keep his balance

nicely played but some quality fielding out at long-on. Full ball on leg stump is drilled between long-on and deep midwicket. A slide to the right from long-on and a quick pick up and throw from deep midwicket, both of whom had to be inch perfect to avoid a collision
length on leg stump, gets on the back foot and tickles it to long leg
full on leg stump, clips to deep midwicket from the crease
arm ball. Pushed through flat and Pollard has no clue about this. Looking to punch through cover, gets an inside edge to fine leg
see ya! Pollard's brief evident. Shakib goes loopy, he goes full, he goes leg stump. Pollard goes smash to send it over long-on
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
Pandey leaps to his right at long-on after completely misjudging this. Pollard splices this off the inside half of the bat as he looks to slog the full one on leg stump

review. Lbw review. This back of a length ball rips into Krunal and beats him on the back foot punch. Hit him on the back leg. It's given not out. He's on the back foot, very deep in the crease it looks very out right now as we wait for the tracker. There's no edge on it .it's out! Decision will be overtuned. S Ravi gets a fairly straightforward one wrong. Krunal is gone, that's hitting middle and off.

short_text: Rashid Khan to Krunal, no run
long_text: good length on off stump, defended on the front foot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Krunal, FOUR runs
long_text: poor ball. Googly, short and wide outside off. Chopped away to the backward point boundary. Too easy
dropped. Rashid's movement in his follow through has completely blinded him it seems. Length ball driven back at him and his hands are barely in place as it fizzes past him and goes to long-off
juicy full toss on the pads. Punches it straight to deep midwicket
length ball pushed flat outside off. Flicked to long-on
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
beaten in flight more by himself than the bowler. Steps out way too early and just manages to stab this length ball away outside off
tossed up on middle stump, flicked to long-on's right
misses the arm ball and is struck on the back thigh as he looks to pull. Was very deep in the crease at the point of contact, but this was going down
floated full on leg stump, leans in and flicks to deep midwicket
googly, back of a length outside off. Punched to long-on off the back foot
quicker one dropped very short. Gets away. Suryakumar hurried on the pull and can't get power to beat deep midwicket to his right

short_text: Rashid Khan to Yadav, no run
long_text: googly. Tossed up outside off on a length. Defended off the under-edge

short_text: Rashid Khan to Yadav, no run
long_text: beaten. Another googly. This one spinning into the corridor from back of a length. He goes for the late cut - even though a slip is there - and misses

short_text: Rashid Khan to Yadav, no run
long_text: googly not picked. Suryakumar scythes at this length ball outside off, expecting it to turn away. Ends up chopping it past leg stump and straight to short fine

short_text: Rashid Khan to Yadav, no run
long_text: length ball pushed through just outside off, defended solidly on the front foot
the batsman wins this battle. Kaul offers a full toss on off stump, Krunal probably smirks internally as he bludgeons this straight down the ground
oh yes. What a contest this is. Krunal with the rebuttal so to speak. This is short of a length across the corridor and he gets on the back foot to swat this wide of mid-on
who needs swing? Kaul consigns Krunal to his backside. A sharp bouncer as he shuffles back and across. It's climbing up at his helmet and he quickly gets under it and can't hold his balance
length on off stump, punched to mid-on on the up
well bowled. Bangs it into the corridor at a length and gets it to jag away. Krunal hangs the bat out and is beaten

glorious! Krunal with the shot of the evening. I said it might look different when Kaul bowls. Length ball skids on nicely outside off, no movement. He leans in, full balance and crunches a drive past mid-off

so he whips one through midwicket. Nabi goes around the wicket and slants one across again but Suryakumar leans in and gets this between long-on and deep midwicket. Bit of a fumble out there as the two fielders converge

short_text: M Nabi to Yadav, FOUR runs
long_text: shot! He's bringing out the class now. Makes room this time. He's greeted with a slider and he has plenty of pace as he shifts the weight back and punches it to the extra cover boundary

short_text: M Nabi to Yadav, FOUR runs
long_text: nice. Very very nice. Hangs deep in the crease, anticipates the angle across him from around the wicket and waits before running this past short third man off the face
length on leg stump, nudged into the open midwicket region off the front foot
short of a length outside off, gets on the back foot and punches to sweeper cover

short_text: M Nabi to Yadav, no run
long_text: floated up at leg stump, drives towards long-on but can't get past midwicket
good length outside off, looks to drive on the up but is beaten. Bat was well inside the line of that one
well played, but Williamson gets across quickly at mid-off to keep it to a single. It's a length ball and he drives handsomely on the up
full and a hint of late swing away. But he's behind this as he drives to mid-on
length outside off, uses the angle to jab towards third man
short of a length just outside off, whips to deep square off the back foot
short of a length in the corridor, gets on top of the bounce and steers it to third man
another arm ball that is just kept out. Sliding in at off stump and he just manages to block it, from very deep in the crease
arm ball nearly sneaks past the inside edge. Suryakumar solid on the front foot though as he defends this
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
floated up at middle stump, leans in and flicks to deep midwicket

it's worked! Shakib lobs one up for Rohit and gets him to try and drive through cover. No feet whatsoever. It pitches and spins away, a hint of climb, and he's nowhere near the pitch of this. Easy one for Dhawan at slip
floated up at middle stump and drilled off the front foot. Thampi tumbles to his left at mid-on to stop

short_text: Sandeep to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: full on middle stump, pushed to mid-on off the front foot
shot. But intercepted by a couple of the cover fielder's fingers. It's a flowy back foot punch, chasing one outside off. Right off the middle but point chases it down and keeps it to two

short_text: Sandeep to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: full at middle stump, defended into the leg side

short_text: Sandeep to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: length outside off, leans into a drive but can't beat mid-off to his left

short_text: Sandeep to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: good length just outside off, defended to point from the crease
short of a length and shaping into the corridor. Drags it to midwicket's right with a closed face

taken at long-off! Oh boy, is there a match here? Mumbai are trying hard to make one! Poor shot from Kishan. This is floated up at off stump, and he gets down the track. Beaten in flight and he ends up chipping and easy one for the fielder there as he tries to go inside-out

short_text: M Nabi to Ishan, no run
long_text: tossed up at off stump, defended into the covers off the front foot
length on leg stump, nudged to deep square off the front foot

short_text: M Nabi to Yadav, FOUR runs
long_text: through mid-off. Makes room this time and pummels this short of a length ball past the non-striker. Thampi is very late on his slide to the right and despite making his ground, allows this to pass

short_text: M Nabi to Yadav, no run
long_text: short of a length on middle stump. He shapes to punch through cover but has to adjust for the turn. Gets it to mid-on at the last moment

short_text: M Nabi to Yadav, no run
long_text: short of a length on middle stump, punched to mid-off off the back foot
good length outswinger in the channel. Blocked solidly on the front foot

leading edge lobs up for point. This seems to be the worst delivery of the over on first glance. Full ball outside leg stump, not a lot of swing on it. Surely going wide if he doesn't attempt a shot, surely there for a tickle if he stays in the crease. But Lewis decides to walk down the pitch to cut out all the swing he's been seeing. Reaches out for it outside leg and is through the shot early. Easy take for Pandey
full awayswinger in the corridor, defended to point off the outside half
beats the outside edge and gets him on the back leg. Squares him up once again. This is not easy living for Lewis. Looking to tap that through midwicket and he's struck outside off on the back thigh
good length outswinger, draws him forward - only half a stride complete - and forces him to feel for it. Beaten on the outside edge
short of a length outside off, more confidence than he's shown all innings on this occasion. Gets nicely behind and drills this through cover off the back foot

short_text: M Nabi to Yadav, no run
long_text: short of a length on middle stump, punched off the back foot, straight to mid-on

short_text: M Nabi to Yadav, no run
long_text: good length on middle stump, defended on the front foot

short_text: M Nabi to Yadav, no run
long_text: short of a length just outside off, punched to mid-off off the back foot
length ball fired in at the pads. Taps it wide of mid-on
short of a length at leg stump, climbs on him as he dabs this uppishly into the leg side

short_text: M Nabi to Yadav, FOUR runs
long_text: and he slants it across him, good length. Suryakumar doesn't have to do much. Stays tall in the crease and punches through cover

struck on the pad as he gets squared up. This looks very good actually, but no one interested. Did that pitch outside? He was looking to defend on the leg stump line and was completely lost as it hooped away
beaten by the awayswinger. Lewis looks to defend from the crease and it nowhere near this

falls short of cover. Lewis gets in a weird position there. Almost like it's the first time he's encountering a swinging ball. This goes away outside off and he hangs his bat out at it, no control at all
some late swing in again. Plonks the front leg across and whips it to deep square. Risky shot, had to get bat on it
good length, swung in at middle stump. Gets behind the line and defends from the crease
inswinger rises from a good length at off stump. He fends it away as he trues to defend
inswinger on a good length. But it starts on middle and slides down

smashed to deep midwicket! Picks out the fielder. A short delivery on off, swatted away to Hardik, who keeps his eyes on it and takes a good reverse-cupped catch. It's Sunrisers' second-lowest IPL total ever.

he finally gets one away! A smile on Williamson's face. Another cutter, right in the slot, around off. Yusuf clears his front leg and smashes the length over long-on. A boundary after 35 balls, first six of the innings.
a low full toss outside off, smashed to deep cover. No run again. He just can't hit a boundary.
an offcutter outside off, Yusuf tries to sweep the ball but he isn't close to the ball. He's now 23 off 30.
a good length delivery outside off, guided away to backward point for a quick run
141 kph, a low full toss outside off, sliced to short third man. Markande goes flying to his left and stops the ball, to the awe of the crowd.
smashed down to long-off. A slower ball is hammered back past the bowler. Bumrah sticks out his right hand, but the ball flies past. Pollard throws to the batsman's end, but he's fine
a shortish delivery around off, pulled down to long-on. Still no run. Sunrisers going nowhere.
full and quick, around off, 142 kph, guided to point
a shorter and wide slower delivery is slashed to the sweeper cover. Yusuf declines the run.
a full delivery on off, nicely blocked back.

run-out! Terrible from Sunrisers. They've had a shocking evening. A slower ball outside off, Kaul finally gets bat on it. Slices a drive to point. Hardik Pandya misfields, which makes Kaul think there is a single. Pathan comes running down, sees Pandya's throw is coming and returns back to his crease, allowing Kaul to sacrifice himself. The ball pops out of Kishan's gloves, just as he made contact with the stumps
a hat-trick of slower balls that beat Kaul's outside edge. Full and moving away, beats a drive rather easily.
another one! Yet another offcutter and the ball beats the bat.
a full offcutter outside off, eliciting a drive but not an edge as the ball flies past the outside edge.
a full delivery outside off, slashed to deep point for a run
excellently bowled, very slow through the air outside off, loads of flight. The ball leaves Sid Kaul on the outside edge.
the legbreak outside off, played to backward point with the angle and a slightly-open face.
yet another googly, shortish and wide, carved to backward point. Played off the back foot.
it's another googly, drifts down leg, nudged away to fine leg for a couple.
slow down leg, worked into the leg side.

gone through Thampi and Markande strikes! It's a flatter delivery, quick through the air and short. Yet, Thampi misreads the length, goes back and looks to cut, he fails to connect, but the ball hits off stump.
beaten on the outside edge. Yet another offcutter, it grips and moves to beat the bat.
a big shot but he somehow finds a gap behind point. Another cutter outside off, Thampi looks for a big hit, but the ball skews off the outside half and over the infield.
nicely guided with the angle but he picks out backward point. A short cutter from Mustafizur.
124 kph, short and wide outside off, slashed away to deep point for one.
back of a length outside off, an offcutter, chopped down to third man for one.
a length offcutter outside off, punched to the sweeper cover for one.
a full delivery outside off is guided away to backward point.
back of a length outside off, chopped down to third man for one.
a short delivery outside off is ramped over the infield for one to third man

outside edge and gone! Good captaincy from Rohit. That's exactly how Rashid was caught in the reverse fixture earlier this season. Back of a length delivery outside off, Rashid plays slightly inside the line, a thick edge is elicited and comfortably taken.
a slower delivery outside off, Yusuf taps a length delivery to backward point. There is no run there. Lewis runs in, picks up but misses at the batsman's end.
a good length delivery outside off, a thick outside edge flies down to third man for one
flat and quick, on leg, inside-edged away behind square for a run.
flat and straight, nudged to short fine leg for one.
that's short and wide, right where Yusuf was waiting for that. Waits and waits and then laces a cut behind point for four.
nicely bowled, flat and straight, pushed away to long-off, one more.
strays down leg again, swept away behind square. Another misfield from Mustafizur.
strays down leg, swept away towards short fine leg
starts with a leg side delivery that drifts down leg, wide called.
slightly shorter and wider, cut away to backward point for a run.
the sweep, the googly outside off. Rashid gets some bat on his sweep, one to deep square leg.

short_text: Markande to Rashid Khan, no run
long_text: nicely bowled, slower around off, tapped away towards backward point

short_text: Markande to Rashid Khan, no run
long_text: out comes the sweep, a cross-batted shot is always an indicator the batsman isn't sure. The legbreak outside off, Rashid misses the sweep.

short_text: Markande to Rashid Khan, no run
long_text: the legbreak this time. Flat outside off, there is some zip and some turn as the ball beats the bat

the googly goes through Nabi's wild heave. It pitched outside off, and turned back in. Nabi clears a front leg and swings, looking to clear midwicket, an indicator he read the variation. But the ball finds a massive gap between bat and pad to hit the stumps. Sunrisers now struggling.
quick and straight, defended back. Yusuf now 8 off 13.
nice, more slowness and extracts some turn. Outside off, Yusuf gets forward and blocks
flat and straight, a thick inside edge towards midwicket

short_text: Krunal to M Nabi, no run
long_text: another leading edge. Slow on middle and leg, gets some turn too. Off the top edge towards midwicket
a dart, 95 kph, on the pads. Yusuf closes his bat face too early, a thick leading edge lobs over midwicket, one to long-on
a slower delivery outside off, drilled down to long-off for one.

a big appeal, pad first, think Mumbai. But it's a legbreak that may have struck Yusuf outside the line. With the spin, that's missing off stump too. But Mumbai want to review. It is pad first, but that needed to be a googly. Yusuf got forward and looked to defend, the ball struck him outside the line and the spin is also taking that away from the stumps, says HawkEye.
flat outside off, 84 kph, pushed to the sweeper cover for one with the spin
flat on middle and leg, 80 kph, nudged to deep midwicket again. The runs have come this over.
the googly. But he drifts down leg. Yusuf stays low and just paddles his fine sweep to the fine leg boundary. Well played.
flatter, on middle and leg, worked to midwicket

short_text: Markande to M Nabi, FOUR runs
long_text: a short delivery outside off, Nabi rocks back and pulls the ball into the gap at midwicket. Too short, too slow. An easy put-away.
132 kph, sticks with the shorter length. A decent bouncer. Pathan gets underneath that.
strays down leg this time, another extra delivery
back of a length outside off, Nabi opens the bat face and guides that down to third man

short_text: Pandya to M Nabi, FOUR runs
long_text: ooh yeah, that's glorious. Regal some may say. An overpitched half volley outside off and Williamson leans into a delectable drive through cover, gets four.
a length delivery outside off, 135 kph. Dabbed away down to third man for a run.
a full delivery outside off, 139 kph, a thick inside edge through wide mid-on for a run.

inside edge? Yes. Williamson is walking. And Sunrisers sink further. There';s some seam movement for Hardik, a length delivery seams back in after pitching. Williamson plays close to his body, but the ball still moves back in enough to take the inside edge. An easy take for the keeper.
short of a length outside off, stabbed through cover off the back foot
slower ball at a length on leg stump. Gets deep in the crease and dabs it behind square with soft hands
slower ball, back of a length and just outside off. Defended into the covers off the back foot

another perfect pull. This one a little higher - lifting up at his face - but he manages to keep it down. McClenaghan dives early this time -  a bit too early. Ends up pushing it away from his face as he's on the floor
short of a length just outside off, defended to point off the back foot

hammered. Superb pull shot from Williamson - technical perfection. Mustafiz drops it short of a length at his hips and he swivels, gets the bat parallel to the ground, watches the ball come on and keeps it down to beat deep square to his right
slower ball at a yorker length. Pathan clears his leg and jams it out towards short extra cover
slower ball, short of a length outside off. Pulls to deep square
good length and just outside off. Tapped back to the bowler off the front foot
short of a length and in at off stump. Defended to point off the back foot

short of a length outside off. He gets his weight on the back foot and slices between point and gully. Third man sprints to his right and manages to get a hand on it with a slide, but that was travelling too fast
beaten on the outside edge. Length ball banged into the corridor, moving away off the seam. Williamson looks to run it to third man but can't connect
Kishan's horror day behind the stumps continues. Predictably, Pathan gets a bouncer. It's well directed and has him ducking, but Kishan parries it over
falls short of mid-off. Length ball outside off and Pathan pummels it on the up towards mid-off. It dips on him and he might have dived if it weren't for Pathan's power behind it
length on off stump, goes deep in the crease and nudges it through point off the outside half

mix-up and Shakib will be shown the way eventually. Got none of that from his partner. It's an offcutter that Williamson taps in front of short midwicket with soft hands. Takes the instinctive two steps forward but without a call. No call from Shakib either - they're both looking at the ball. There's no run there. Shakib is halfway down. Midwicket swivels and takes the non-striker's stumps down on the bounce .ah hang on. We've looked at the replays and it sounds like Williamson said yes first and then no.
length ball angled in at off stump. Closes the face and drags it to mid-on's left off the front foot
short ball coming in at the corridor. Chops it straight to point
short of a length outside off. Punches neatly to cover point's left but Krunal dives one-handed to get in the way of at least another run, if not three more
length on off stump. Defended back to the bowler

straight to extra cover! Pandey's daredevilry comes to a close. An aesthetically pleasing innings ends in a tame, throwaway manner. Length ball wide outside off. He gives it the charge and can't get elevation on the drive to clear the fielder
beaten. A jab with an open face. Length ball outside off with some climb. He can't get bat as he tries to find the third man boundary
length and just outside off. Drops it into the off side with soft hands
short of a length and down leg side, left alone
inside edge zips past short fine. Pandya starts in a nice area - length on off stump. Williamson brings an angled bat down on it as he pushes on the front foot. Tentative. Effective.
he's come out with a plan. Pandey walks down the track a touch, uses the shuffle across again and gets close to this length ball pushed wide. Thumps it on the up over mid-off
nicely timed, but Krunal keeps it to one. Uses the angle across him to open the face and chop this behind point. Krunal gets his full body behind it with a slide at deep backward point
length and slanted across off. Shuffles to try and tickle one behind square. Can't get it off the pitch
offcutter, back of a length and just outside off. Gets on top of the bounce and dabs it straight to short third man
sweeet. Pandey stands tall and slaps one over the non-striker. Length ball wide outside off but he shuffles and closes the face as he lifts this on the up
short of a length and cutting away outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off, drives on the up to deep point
good length on off stump. Allows it to come on again and drops it into the point region with soft hands
length outside off, driven on the up to sweeper point
shot. Back of a length with width from Bumrah and he eases into this, without any feet movement. Just opens the face and steers it through point
good length and just outside off. Allows it to come on and steers it to third man with an open face
full and in at off stump. Driven firmly, straight to mid-off

got him! Saha chases again and isn't as lucky as before! McClenaghan, not a public favourite in Mumbai these days, has brought two wickets in his first over. Another length ball pushed across him and this time he's looking to drive away from the body. A thin edge and Kishan holds on
beaten on the outside edge. Saha gets one slanted across his corridor and he jabs at it on the front foot

bowled him! Same ball, same shot, inside edge again. Dhawan driving with a gap between bat and pad again. This time the stride is even shorter, possibly because of the bump he got last ball. It hits that back leg again, but this time on the thigh, before taking out the stumps

short_text: McClenaghan to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: Dhawan gets one on the knee cap. Can't catch a break! Length ball slanting in from outside off. Gets on the front foot and looks to drive and gets an inside edge that misses the flap on the lunged back knee. Treatment time ice treatment. Followed by some mobility exercises.

short_text: McClenaghan to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: one bounce and four. Third man would've taken that but there isn't one. It's a length ball wide outside off. He slashes on the up and deliberately opens the face
oh dear. Kishan misses a straightforward take. Mitch attempts a yorker that goes down leg side. Kishan makes the ground but can't hold on
length ball wide outside off, goes on the up and can't get on top of the bounce. Ends up slicing on the up to sweeper

short_text: Bumrah to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: misses a full toss. That couldn't have been different from the throwdowns he was taking earlier. Shin height full toss outside off but he can't get any bat on it whatsoever as he looks to drive
short of a length and in at middle. Stands tall and nudges it to mid-on with soft hands

surreal. He threads one through point and cover again, this time off the front foot. No one quite as gorgeous as Williamson on the square drive these days. This is a full ball swinging well away from him but he gets there with a big stride and caresses it

here we go. Can't have a Williamson innings without him getting on his toes, getting the elbow high and punching one between point and cover. That's exactly what he's done to this length ball in the corridor
short of a length this time. Rising up at his thigh guard and he can't get bat on the attempted glance. Gets a single behind square

short_text: Bumrah to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: starts short. A touch down leg side. 50-50 wide ball. The umpire says it's okay after Dhawan lets it go

taken at long-off and Kings XI win by four runs. Gambhir has his head in his hands. Iyer looks up. A flatter trajectory delivery outside off is chipped away to long-off. Finch takes the reverse-cupped catch and Kings XI begin their celebrations.
and he gets four. Flat down leg, helped along past short fine leg. He dives in vain. Big play because it's four. FOUR
slogged away with bad timing to deep midwicket. A misfield allows two. Struggled for timing. Iyer initially didn't want even one.
refuses the single. Flat outside off, powered to long-off. Says no. I'll take this over.
six! NOT OVER YET. It's flat and wide, Iyer stands back and slaps a swat straight back over the bowler's head for six. sensational timing. Delhi are dancing again.
good length, flat down leg. Iyer can't connect. The ball hits the pad to fine leg.

short_text: Barinder Sran to Mishra, no run
long_text: it's in the slot for that shot. Full and wide, Mishra comes down and misses a swing. DOT!
that was in the slot, right in the slot. Full on off, Iyer cleared his front leg too and slogged to long-on
he walks right across and connects neatly with the lap scoop but he finds the keeper. It's a slower delivery well outside off. That missed off stump by not much. Iyer forces him to complete the run.
a shortish delivery on middle and leg, swatted away to long-on, on the bounce.

a golden duck for Plunkett. A slower delivery down leg from Sran. Excellent variation, because Plunkett meets the ball much earlier than he intended. As a result, a whip intended for midwicket goes aerially to deep square leg, where Nair takes a comfortable catch.
a length delivery outside off, pulled away to deep midwicket for one. Not quite timed.

edged and gone. A slower ball from Tye, the knuckle ball outside off. Tewatia slogs but all he manages is a thick leading edge, which is easily taken by Rahul. A timely strike because it also gets a new batsman in.
well bowled, a yorker outside off, jammed away for one.

well bowled. A low full toss outside off, guided to Yuvraj at backward point who unnecessarily throws at the bowler's end to concede an overthrow. Poor game awareness from the experienced man. Iyer was well in anyway.
full on middle and leg, heaved away to deep midwicket.
a slower ball, too wide outside off though. And called.
falls short of Finch at long-off. Full outside off, looking to use the bottom hand to lift the ball through midwicket. Chipped to long-off instead. Think Iyer has played this very smartly
short and wide outside off, slashed to third man for a run.
a good yorker to finish. On leg, jammed out for one.

that's another mistake from Sran. He's having a shocker. Short and wide outside off, slapped to wide long-off. Finch returns the throw at the bowler's end, at an awkward height. He misses the collection with Iyer well outside his crease. Big error.

short_text: Barinder Sran to Tewatia, FOUR runs
long_text: finds the gap for four. Full outside off, Tewatia feigns one shot, then the other. Eventually, he walks across and sweeps the fast bowler behind square leg for four. When did No. 7 start sweeping fast bowlers for fun?
a short, slower ball around off, punched to long-on for one. He's biding his time well
a low full toss down leg, swiped away to deep midwicket

short_text: Barinder Sran to Tewatia, SIX runs
long_text: smashed for six. Tewatia backs away, makes room and Sran follows him. But what he does badly is bowl it on a full length, right in the slot. And slammed back over his head for six.
a shorter, slower delivery outside off. Carved away to the sweeper cover for one.
a shorter delivery outside off, slashed away to backward point. Trying to create some room.
a slower delivery around off, worked away to deep square leg for one.
strays on the pads but it also cramps Tewatia for room. Struck on the pad, one leg bye to short fine leg.
a short slower delivery around off, nudged away to deep square leg for a run
one bounce to deep midwicket. A slower delivery around off, a muscled swat to deep midwicket.
short and wide outside off, carved away through backward point for a couple. Superb batting.
hammered for four. A tad too full this time from Mujeeb, Iyer stays balanced as he drills an on-drive past his partner.
a thick inside edge onto the pad. Flat on off, the inside edge takes the ball to square leg.
the one that moves the other way. Flat and wide, the ball moves away and beats the bat. Lovely bowling.
the slider. Quick down leg, Tewatia misses a flick. Struck on the thigh pad as he misses that.
overpitched on off, whipped to long-on for a run.
another carrom ball, on middle and off. Punched to long-off.
a carrom ball, on middle. Tewatia comes down, but is sent back. Tiwary misses at the bowler's end.
flat outside off, Tewatia goes back and punches one to long-off for one.
another dot. Flat around off, pushed to cover.
the carrom ball around off, punched to long-on
flat on middle and leg, worked to midwicket for a run.

short_text: Barinder Sran to Iyer, no run
long_text: Iyer reviews immediately! Full and wide outside off, Iyer goes after a drive and misses. The bat hits the ground as it passes. The ball misses. Umpire Nanda Kishore has got that one wrong. The match would have been very different without DRS. At least, the right decision made.
strays down leg for the third wide of the over. Sloppy.

short_text: Barinder Sran to Iyer, no run
long_text: much better from Sran. Stick to the basics. Good length on middle and leg, defended back.
guided past backward point for two. Full and wide, dabbed past point for two.
back of a length on off, pulled to long-on for a run. Hurried for pace.

called a wide! Was that over the head? A short delivery outside off, a knuckle ball bouncer that is indeed over the head. This is not very good bowling, why vary to a No. 7 when he isn't trying too much.

short_text: Barinder Sran to Tewatia, no run
long_text: full and straight, pushed back to the bowler. That's a better delivery, why vary unnecessarily?
a slower ball goes very wrong. Back of the hand outside off, outside the tramline and called
goes short first up, helped along behind square for a couple. Not quite in control.

too straight and worked into the gap at midwicket. The throw back to Ashwin is good, he takes the bails off in a hurry and he thinks he has Christian. And he does. Christian is short of his crease. Sensational work from Agarwal at long-on. First, to run to his right and pick up with one hand, then releasing so quickly. And then, throwing the ball well despite being off balance. Ashwin does the easier job of taking the bails off, but he did that very quickly too.
the carrom again. Out the front of the hand. Tidy line, just around off, pushed to point
a carrom ball outside off, pushed into the gap at midwicket for one.
shortish and wide, carved to backward point
that's a filthy delivery, drops short outside off. Iyer rocks back and pummels the long-hop of a legbreak to the deep cover fence
the legbreak, flat and wide, slashed to deep point for a run.
just three off the over. Very full, met by a crisp drive from Christian. A misfield from Ashwin lets the ball go through.
very full outside off, Iyer opens the bat face and carves a ball to deep cover for one
another dot, quick and straight, finds midwicket again
nudged to midwicket from the back foot

Mujeeb thinks he has got bat on it. Iyer thinks he's fine. But the third umpire is called on. Full outside off, christian belts a drive right back at the bowler, who sticks out his right hand. The ball bursts through the fingers and hits the stump at the bowler's end, but Iyer's bat is in.
inside edge onto the pad. It's flat and quick on off. Christian tries to finds one through square leg.
back to his flatter trajectory, on middle and off, worked to midwicket. The tidy overs are racking up.
a massive appeal, no, says umpire CK Nandan. Slow outside off, the ball pitches outside off and spins back in to hit Iyer in front of off. Replays say missing leg.
very quick and full outside off, driven to long-off
the carrom ball, full outside off, pushed to cover.
a flat start, on middle, clipped to deep midwicket
flat and quick outside off, no flight, no room. Iyer goes back and pushes the ball in front of point for one.
drifts down leg this time, clipped down to fine leg for one.
four dot balls! flat outside off, punched back to the bowler
another carrom ball-type delivery, on middle and leg, nudged to midwicket
flat on middle and leg, worked to midwicket from the back foot.

Mujeeb strikes first ball! Kings XI continue to fight. His first ball is a flick out of the front of the hand, it pitches outside off and spins back in with the angle and the direction of release. It finds a massive gap between bat and pad and knocks into off stump. Daredevils are in some trouble.
drifts in, pitches and spins away from middle, defended with soft hands
short and spinning down leg, works to deep square leg
whips this from outside off to deep square leg
lunges forward and smothers this
works this skiddy delivery to midwicket. Went across a long way, would've been a dead duck had he missed it
works this indrifter towards midwicket

cut away past the diving point fielder. Mujeeb does all the hard work in getting to the ball from square third man but can't collect it cleanly and ends up pushing it into the advertising triangles as he tries to pull it back in. For someone that young, you have to say Mujeeb's fielding is quite ordinary.
short-arm jab but the timing is magnificent. Bisects midwicket and mid on. Lovely from Iyer
gets on top of the bounce and wrists this short of length delivery to mid on
gets a good stride forward and defends this solidly to the off side
hit high on the thigh pad as he hops back to defend. Stifled appeal but too high
squirts this to point. Closed the bat face early in trying to nudge this into the leg side.

turns this slower delivery from outside off towards midwicket. Oh, dear. Four overthrows, so make that five. Miller throws to the bowler's end, but Tye misses. Finch, backing up, also misses as this squeezes below him
looked to sway out of the way but somehow didn't get his bat away in time, deflects to third man.
gets well forward and defends solidly

gets a leading edge straight to mid-off. Gambhir was woefully out of form, was failing to hit anything off the middle and has now paid the price. Looked to hop across and work to the leg side but closed the bat face too early. Are Kings XI fighting back?
slower length ball across Gambhir, who defends to cover
slower length ball on middle, Gambhir waits, waits and then defends
hops across and whips to deep square

this went really, really high in the air. Maxwell has ended up mistiming this pull and Tye takes a superbly judged catch at deep square leg. Looked to fetch it from outside off, this was an effort delivery from Rajpoot. Maxwell got this high on the bat.
whups this from outside off to Yuvraj at midwicket
works this off his hip to deep square leg
shapes to pull but this got big on him, umpire thinks way over Gambhir's head. Wide called
right behind the line of this length ball as he defends. Off-cutter from Rajpoot, kept just a touch low.
shows the full face of the bat to ease this back
played three shots in one! First looks to pull, then realises this bouncer is on off and tries to ramp, misses. Beaten
is there an edge there? Thought I heard something. Maxwell looks to run this off the bat face wide of the keeper.
steps out to whack this slower ball into the neighbouring football stadium, but misses. Swung through too early. Head all over the place
ah, super strike that! Walloped into the deep backward square leg fence. Too full, too straight and down leg, Maxwell just walloped it away. Bread and butter stroke for him
hint of curve back in to hit the pad as Gambhir looks to flick. He was slightly off balance. Big appeal, but no review. Replays confirm this pitched outside leg.
slower one down leg. Rolled through to the keeper as Gambhir looked to tickle it fine
squeezes the drive to mid off for a quick single
works this length ball into the leg side for an easy single
crunching drive, super stop at point by Yuvraj. Threw himself to his left to effect a one-handed stop
works this from middle to beat midwicket. Short leg side boundaries makes it tougher to stop once it cross the 30-yard circle. Lovely timing, good wrist work

knocked him over! Played one shot too many. Shaped to pull but the length wasn't there for the stroke, beat the inside edge and crashed into the off stump. Completely missed the line, made matters tougher by trying to play across the line. He's given them a good start though.
dabs this gently into the off side as they scamper a single.  An under-arm flick from Agarwal at point and Shaw may have been gone
solid forward defence to a length ball angling away.
swivel-pull but just about clears wide mid-on. Expensive, expensive over. Shaw didn't get hold of this pull as well as he would've liked.

short_text: Barinder Sran to Shaw, FOUR runs
long_text: slashes and gets a thick outside edge that flies over the slip fielder.
slants this into the pads, worked to deep fine leg. Gambhir is off the mark
this time he pulls, doesn't get hold of it as well as he would've liked but will take three as Finch gives it a laboured chase from mid on

short_text: Barinder Sran to Shaw, FOUR runs
long_text: races away to the boundary like a?    .. TRACER BULLET!  Short of length and angling away, Shaw stood tall and slapped that behind point. Woah, delightful timing and placement

short_text: Barinder Sran to Shaw, FOUR runs
long_text: nearly chopped on! Looked to flay this on the up through point but got a thick inside edge that beat the keeper to the boundary

big appeal for lbw. Gambhir was on his toes when he was struck. Height was surely in question there, but no. Ashwin thinks otherwise and has asked for a review.. Pitch map shows this hit the turf outside leg,  so nothing else matters.
nervous little poke to an away-going delivery, didn't miss the edge by much
slides one down leg, excellent stop by Rahul. The ball bounced before him as well.
whips this length ball from outside off to wide mid-on
up and away, although he would've had a brief flutter. Lofts this length ball through the line, just managed to clear Ashwin at mid-off
no feet movement, feels for the length ball outside off, defended back.
short of length delivery that jags away off the seam from outside off, defended back as he gets onto his toes
132 kph, Tye chops on! Wow, that was a struggle from Tye, 3 off 9. Full and wide, Tye unwinds and swings, but all he manages is a thick inside edge which hits middle and leg stump.
yikes, he isn't even close to the ball. A short slower cutter outside off. Tye is beaten as he swings.
full on leg, flicked away wide of long-on for a couple. Maxwell can't prevent two
another slower ball. Cutter. Tye swings and misses again. The ball clips the pad and then bounces over the leg stump

short_text: Boult to Barinder Sran, 1 leg bye
long_text: think the wide yorker would have been a better option to earn a dot ball. But Boult goes full and straight, Sran misses, struck on the pad, but it's sliding down
taken. Ashwin picks out backward point. Another wide yorker, Ashwin gets underneath the length but all he successfully does is chip a slice to the fielder. A comfortable reverse-cupped catch.
starts with a wide. Full and very wide, looking for the tramline but just errs.
swing and miss. What a debut for Plunkett. So many cutters, finishes with 3 for 17. A slower ball outside off, Tye swings too early.
114 kph, a slower bouncer. Ashwin walks across but can't connect. The ball bounces in front of Pant, ricochets off the hand to short fine leg
a slower delivery outside off, punched away to deep cover for a couple. Shaw again takes a fraction of a second longer to release, he has to develop a quicker release in time.
strays down leg, extra run, extra ball.
finally bat meets ball. A slower cutter around off, heaved away to deep midwicket for one run.
nicely bowled. Goes wide of the crease, full outside off. Tye still can't get bat on ball, misses his third slog.
follows Ashwin as he backs away. A low full toss is bunted down to long-on
a length delivery on leg, pushed to long-on for a run. Tidy 18th for Delhi
a short slower ball. Tye is through his big hoick again, off the body to third man for a leg bye.
115 kph, four leg byes, those are bad runs for Daredevils. A slower ball down leg, Tye slogs and misses. The ball takes the pad and flies away past Pant for four to fine leg

Miller finds Plunkett! And Kings XI are struggling now. It's yet another cutter outside off. Miller brings out all his power and brute force to smash a lofted drive over cover. But that fielder has been pushed back because Miller is very good with that shot. Plunkett gets low and takes an excellent catch.
another slower delivery, on middle and leg. Slogged away into the gap in front of square for a couple.
a thick outside edge races away through third man! Another cutter, it actually cuts off the pitch. Takes the outside edge and flies to the third man boundary
a good length delivery, 119 kph, another cutter, chopped into the pad and then point. Another tidy over, just five runs from it.
a very short, slower delivery around off is dragged down to fine leg, 116 kph.
a full and quick delivery down leg, Miller is hurried for pace as he misses a flick, struck on the pad.
another cutter, outside off, chopped down to third man for a run.
a slower delivery outside off, guided to point for a tight single

a slower delivery on middle and leg, and Nair picks out long-on! And it's taken! Juust. Plunkett is having a terrific debut. Nair looked to whip that slower cutter through midwicket but got that too straight. Iyer runs across from his right and pouches the catch after juggling.
driven through the line to wide long-off. Expensive over.
drifting into the pads, this time he's swept him to the left of short fine leg. Too easy for Nair. Gift of a delivery
flatter one on middle and leg, worked with the spin to deep square leg
short and spinning away, far too wide on the googly. Left alone
take that! Fetch that! He's hit that into the top tier over long-on. In his swinging arc, too full from Mishra. Whack. Remember that old quote? If it's in the arc, i'll hit you out of the park
fired down leg, Nair misses the fine paddle, they scamper a leg bye as the ball rolls to short fine leg
eases this down to long off with the spin

Prithvi Shaw has put down a sitter at point!  Miller is living a charmed life here. Shaped to cut but checked his stroke, this lobbed up. He got his hands on it, juggled and put it down on the second attempt. What's happening?
chops this cut to short third man.
flat-bats this to long-off where Iyer slides around to stop this, can't stop the second though
top-edges a sweep but safe, down to fine leg

dropped by Maxwell at cover!  What's worse is they concede an overthrow. Miller rocks back and slaps this straight. Both feet were in the air as he went for the catch sideways and it popped out. Reprieves his old mate
goes back into the crease and defends this skiddy delivery
eased with the spin to sweeper cover
powers this sweep behind square, down to the boundary rider. Prithvi Shaw it is
full toss that he bunts down to wide long-on, superbly stopped by a slide by Dan Christian
gets down to paddle, may have got bat but it's well stopped, even if unintentionally,  by Pant, who offers his pad. He was moving to his left when the ball thudded into it. Lucky for Mishra
leading edge but safe, rolls to long-off. Was looking to work this through midwicket but didn't pick the googly
touch short again, he makes room and punches this into the gap at deep cover
uses the depth of the crease to punch this to sweeper cover
pushed through the line to mid-off for a quick single. Avesh bowls out and he's had a superb debut with Daredevils

short_text: Avesh Khan to Miller, no run
long_text: this is a stunning delivery. Bowled at 145 clicks, whizzes across and beats Miller's push. Pant collected that over his head.

out to the pull, out to the pace! Yuvraj's struggle is over. This is a skiddy length ball angling way, Yuvraj had already decided he'll fetch the pull from outside off. The length wasn't quite there and so he gets an under-edge that is gleefully accepted by Pant.

short_text: Avesh Khan to Yuvraj, FOUR runs
long_text: saved by an inside-edge that flies past Pant, who went the wrong way. This was a very thin one. Yuvraj is beaten for pace as he shapes to pull from outside off. Didn't miss the off stump by much.
works this low full toss down to long on

short_text: Avesh Khan to Nair, FOUR runs
long_text: clean strike, solid strike. Uses the pace superbly as he backs away and lofts the length ball through the line over extra cover.
uppish, but lands short of short fine.This was fired in, Yuvraj toe-ended the paddle.
drifts in a full delivery on the stumps from wide of the crease, eased to long on
digs this yorker length ball back towards long off. Looked to biff this up and over
fizzes past Yuvraj's tentative forward push. Don't think he read the googly again. Lovely from Mishra
beaten by the googly. Shaped to steer this past the keeper but pulled out
turns this gently with the spin towards deep fine leg, lazy effort in the deep. Should've just been one
mistimes the reverse sweep to short third man
looks to go big over cover, but toe ends this back towards the bowler
straightens from length on middle, Yuvraj looks to work to the leg side, but gets a leading edge that rolls wide of cover
steps out but Maxwell shortens his length, worked towards deep midwicket
drilled through to deep cover
floats this full on off, worked across the line towards deep midwicket
pushed through quicker outside off, punched but Iyer does well to sprint to his right and stop that with a dive. Some confusion with the running but they eventually complete the run
drifts into the pads, worked with the spin to long on
width outside off, punched straight to extra cover
crashes this short delivery to deep point. This was short and sliding away, Yuvraj picked the length early and made room to play the stroke
short and sliding down, pulled to deep square leg. Lucky to get away with that
lovely start. Drifts one in from wide of the crease, Nair gets forward and defends back
a slower delivery on off, punched to long-on for a run.
a short delivery outside off, Nair tries to scoop the ball over short third man but makes no connection. Clever change in length.
back of a length outside off, Yuvraj finds short third man. Only because there is a misfield, there is one
back of a length on leg, 129 kph, worked to midwicket
a cutter, offcutter outside off, 122 kph. Yuvraj misses an attempted drive, beats the outside edge
back of a length outside off, 130 kph. Yuvraj finds point with a dab
135 kph, shorter and wider outside off, chopped away to cover.
good length, around off, pushed back to the bowler. Very tidy bowling.
full around off, driven to mid-on for a single. Full face of the bat.

gone through! 146 kph, Agarwal beaten for pace. A good length delivery, Agarwal anticipates another cutter, but it's quick. He tries a short-arm jab, but the ball isn't even short enough to play that stroke. He is far too late on the shot, the ball clips the thigh pad and then uproots off stump! A timely strike for Daredevils.
a shorter, slower delivery on middle. Nair helps that along towards fine leg. Avesh runs to his right and keeps the batsmen down to one, fine effort.
good length on off, the ball stays down a touch, worked to midwicket
a slower ball on middle, clipped to deep midwicket for one. Decent over from Christian
just tapped into the gap between short third man and backward point. It's dug in short, and a tad wide outside off. Nair just bunts that chopped cut into the gap, to third man's right.
short and wide outside off, slashed away to the sweeper cover. Too much width there.
back of a length around off, pushed away towards long-on for a run
another cutter, slightly shorter around off, pushed back to the bowler
a slower ball on middle and leg, nudged away to deep square leg for a run.
back of a length outside off, badly timed towards mid-on. A 51-run Powerplay.
shorter and wide outside off, a flat-batted swat through cover for two. Kings XI's 50 is up.

short_text: Avesh Khan to Agarwal, no run
long_text: slightly shorter and wide, but the pace was taken off. Chopped down to backward point,
back of a length outside off, chopped away towards backward point. A good single

short_text: Avesh Khan to Nair, no run
long_text: full again, slightly closer to off stump though. Driven to short cover.

short_text: Avesh Khan to Nair, FOUR runs
long_text: lovely shot. A tad overpitched from Avesh with some width. Nair strides forward and caresses a drive through cover with immaculate timing.
full and wide outside off, driven away towards cover with the full face.
a slower cutter again outside off, carved away to backward point.

right in between the gap at third slip and gully in Test cricket. But no one there in T20s. Full and wide outside off, Nair drives, gets a thick outside edge which flies to Mishra at third man. He fumbles, but no damage done.

did he misjudge that? He did, but he still took the catch at short fine leg. Plunkett has his maiden IPL wicket. An offcutter around off, Rahul tries to scoop the ball over short fine leg, but the ball hits the top third of the bat, more towards the splice. The ball carries low to Avesh at short fine leg, he dives in front and takes a good, low catch.
mis-timed but still four. A slower delivery around off, Rahul mis-times an attempted lofted drive, the ball skews off the inside half, plonks over mid-on and races away.
full, on middle and leg, worked away to midwicket

short_text: Avesh Khan to Rahul, no run
long_text: yikes, Rahul will be unhappy with the execution. A slower delivery, back of a length and wide outside off. Rahul tries to ramp the ball over short third man, but cannot connect.

short_text: Avesh Khan to Rahul, no run
long_text: a good length delivery on middle and leg, punched back towards mid-off
back of a length outside off, guided away to deep point

short_text: Avesh Khan to Agarwal, FOUR runs
long_text: gives himself some room and crashes a punchy drive through cover. Not a bad delivery, good length on middle and leg, smashed on the up
a slower delivery this time, but still a touch short. Rahul nails his pull to deep square leg, on the bounce.

short_text: Avesh Khan to Rahul, SIX runs
long_text: flies for six! A short delivery down leg, plenty of pace on that, but all Rahul needs to do is use that pace. He gets inside the line and helps the errant delivery over fine leg for six. A flat six.
134 kph, back of a length outside off, Boult's angle brings that back to off. Chopped to the keeper, cramped for room
139 kph, a low full toss on leg, worked down to fine leg for a run.
a very wide slower offcutter is bunted over cover point. Would have been wide had Rahul let that go, but he goes after it and toe-ends the ball over the infield.
full and swinging in, pushed to mid-off with the full face for a run

oh yes, that's a much better shot. Good length outside off, Agarwal knows there's pace, there's width and there's an opportunity. All he does is open the bat face and guide the ball to the left of backward point
flayed away for four through point. Full and wide, the ball is too wide, allows Agarwal to throw his hands at that, sliced away.

short_text: Avesh Khan to Rahul, FOUR runs
long_text: no one there at fine leg. The first boundary of the night. Full around middle and leg, there may have been some seam movement back in. A thick inside edge flies down to the fine leg fence. The fielder was more towards square leg, flies away.

short_text: Avesh Khan to Rahul, no run
long_text: more pace, more bounce, skiddy. 143 kph, back of a length outside off, Rahul misses an open-faced dab
full, on the pads, nudged away to deep backward square leg for a single.

another one that hurries the batsman! This is a batsman brought up in Victoria. A 148.7kph short delivery outside off, Finch this time, looks for the pull through midwicket, but he is too late on the shot. Takes the splice of the bat and lobs to cover. Clearly, harried for pace and Avesh strikes. Some pace and bounce in this surface.
that's well played. Back of a length outside off, chopped away down to third man for a run.

short_text: Avesh Khan to Rahul, no run
long_text: hurried for pace? 142 kph, back of a length outside off. Rahul wants to pull but is nowhere near the shot. The ball splices to mid-on, doesn't carry
well bowled. Back of a length, moves back in after pitching. Finch, like you do in backyard cricket, intentionally avoids the ball by arching his body. But the ball goes over leg stump.
into the gap at cover for two! Full outside off, Finch pushes a drive through cover for a couple. Gambhir again races after it. Not great timing.
nicely bowled again. Full and moving back in, pushed to mid-on with the angle. Calls for, and makes the single, easily.
some swing there! Back of a length on middle and leg, the ball moving back in. Pings off the thigh pad down to fine leg
Gambhir with the dive! A fullish delivery slightly wide outside off is pushed away towards cover point. Gambhir dives to his right and stops the ball from going through, but Kings XI are off

Gowtham conquers Jaipur! Short outside off, and the batsman stays on the back foot to pull it towards the leg side. Off the bat's sweet spot and the ball soars over the mid-wicket boundary. Royals win by three wickets
overpitched on off stump, and that's been drilled to cover. Unadkat's halfway down the wicket, but Gowtham sends him back. Will this hurt Royals?
ramped over short third man! It's full outside off, and Gowtham gets down on one knee, opens the bat's face, and sends it over the infield. The Royals camp erupts!
goes short outside off, and Archer's pull takes the top edge! Hardik gets under it, and manages to keep his composure

full on off stump, and Gowtham's leg-side heave comes off the bat's inside edge. That means the shot goes behind square, and that means into the gap. Finds the backward square boundary. Eighteen off the over
takes the pace off! Full, and super slow outside off. Gowtham tries to slog this over Bumrah's head, and ends up missing completely
slapped with disdain! Good length, but wide enough outside off to cut it furiously hard. Gowtham winds up and then pumps this past backward point
full toss on leg stump, and he's cramped for room. Hits his bat and trickles away towards mid-wicket. No one there, so that means Archer asks Gowtham to come for the second
slower ball full outside off, and that's been crunched over the non-striker's head. Pollard's there in the deep, but oh dear, it's a no-ball!
full on off stump, and that's been smothered off his pads to wide long on. Chase for Pollard in the deep
good length outside off, and Archer has the power to slap this very square! Played wide enough of deep extra cover, and the outfielder can't pull it back
full outside off, and the drive finds the bat's toe end. Flies past Kishan's right and through to the third-man boundary. The equation: 28 runs off 12 balls
good length on middle stump, and in his arc. Backs away and muscles this towards the leg side. Enough behind that shot to take it beyond long on. Rohit's not happy
good length on off, and angling away from Gowtham. He tries to slog it over cover, but sliced over the infield. Lands in no man's land
holes out and long on, but it's a free hit. Full toss on leg stump, and thumped over Fizz's head
awry! Super-high full toss outside off, and goes to Kishan on the full! Passed Archer from over his head. Fizz apologises right away
good length on middle stump, but the extra bounce doesn't bother the tall Gowtham. Flat-batted over Fizz's head to Pollard at long on

diving catch from Kishan! Angling away from Klaasen, and he tries to punch away from his body. The offcutter goees across Klaasen, and therefore takes the outside edge. Kishan's forced to dive diagonally forward but he's safe with the gloves. Three wickets in six balls
yorker on off stump, and that's been dug back to Bumrah. He's forced to stick his hand up and the ball sticks! Excellent over
yorker just outside off stump, and Archer can't carve this away. Bounces behind the stumps and goes through to Kishan's gloves. This is classic Bumrah
no he won't. Full on off stump, but Archer does well to get behind the line of the ball, and defend with soft hands
The zing bails light up! Super fast (144kph) on off stump and angling right into Buttler. He tries to defend it straight, but the ball goes between bat and pad. Crashes into middle stump

holes out to deep midwicket! Is that the end for Royals? Full on off, and to be honest, in Samson's arc. The slower delivery does the trick though, and finds the toe end of Samson's bat. In the air for ages, but too simple for Hardik
short and wide outside off, and Buttler can free his arms. Slaps this past the infield to the man in the deep
quick ball! Full on off stump, and that's been dug away down the ground. Hardik's at long on
good length on leg stump, and angling into Buttler. He tries to back away to make some extra room, but Krunal follows him. Can't cut it away
good length outside off, and it's been driven away from his body. Man at deep extra cover though
good length on middle stump, and punched to wide long on
full on off, but turned off his pads towards midwicket. They collect the single on offer
good length on off, and spinning across Samson. Pushed to long off with soft hands, and that's fifty for Samson!
full outside off, and enough width to drive past extra cover. Chase for Duminy in the deep, and his throw is not good. Allows Samson to steal a second run
full just outside off, and Buttler's through with his drive too early. Slices it, but just short of Markande at point
good length just outside off, but Hardik takes the pace off. Tries to drive towards cover, but takes the inside edge towards midwicket

there's the orange cap! Good length on off, and angling into Samson's body. Waits on the backfoot, and pulls this - along the ground - to wide long on. Man there in the deep, but he's just a spectator
full outside off, and comfortably driven to deep extra cover. He'll get off the mark

yorker on leg stump! Stokes shuffled across to the off side to try and clip it off his toes, but misses. Tried to take advantage of short fine-leg being inside the circle, but Hardik went wicket-to-wicket
full toss outside off, but Samson can't put it away. Drives it off the bat's top-half, and goes only to cover
low full toss on middle stump, Stokes thumps it down the ground - past the non-striker - to long on
back of a length on middle, and that's been beautifully pulled off the back foot. Will only early him a single
Stokes comes down the wicket, and therefore it's a low full toss on off. Driven towards wide long off
connects this time! Short and wide outside off, and that allows Stokes to free his arms. Shifts his body-weight towards the front foot, and then thumps it - flat-batted, really - over cover

just over Markande at point! Was that the wicket Mumbai needed? Back of a length outside off, and just some extra bounce this time. He tried to crunch this over cover, but eventually slices it over the infield. Lucky
low full toss on middle stump, and that's been blocked back to Bumrah. Straight back to the bowler, who thinks about having a shy at the stumps. Surprised Samson there
good length on middle stump, and angling into Samson. He punches it off the back foot past midwicket to the man in the deep. Two more. Also the team hundred
slower ball, full on off stump. Drilled to Hardik at mid off
good length on middle and going across Stokes. He tries to ramp it over short fine leg, but then tries to ramp it over short third man. Eventually connects with neither
good length just outside off, and Samson rides the bounce to punch it past cover to the man in the deep
good length on leg stump, and cramping Stokes for room. Pushed down the ground to long off for a quick single
good length on off, and slightly turning away from Stokes. He punches it towards wide long on, and pushes Samson to complete the second
full on off stump, and smothered with the spin towards the leg side. Calls early for the second, and they manage to complete it. Just about
full and wide outside off, and the batsman takes a step towards the off-side and slaps it to the man in the deep
loopy, but outside off stump. Stokes is happy to let it go for more extras
overpitched just outside off, and Stokes digs it away towards cover. Man there
good length outside off, but too wide. Slides across Stokes
good length on middle, and worked off his hips to square leg
full on middle and leg, and tapped to wide long on. Misfielded in the deep, which allows them to take the second
drilled past extra cover! Goes full and wide outside off, but Stokes kinda expected it. Backs away to make some extra room and slaps it past the cover-region
super slow mo! very short, but it's 92kph! Stokes swivels, winds up, and thumps it over short fine leg
good length on middle and leg, and flicked off his pads towards the leg side. Sweeper in the deep
drilled towards the leg side, but played softly enough to come back for the second
half-tracker on off, but Stokes can't punish it. Pulled, along the ground, to deep midwicket
full, but outside leg stump. Stokes was already down the ground, so all he needs to do is clip it off his toes. Played to fine leg
full on middle and off, but angling across Stokes. Thumped off the backfoot, past the non-striker, to long off
full on off, and whipped off his pads to deep backward square. They're happy to deal in singles for now
goes full and wide outside off. Samson shuffles across to the off side but chooses not to play at it. The ump calls it as extras
good length on middle stump, and slower on this occasion. Pushed to wide long-on, and Stokes calls nice and early for the run
good length just outside off, and angling into Samson. Punched off the backfoot to deep extra cover. These two doing well to rotate the strike
back of a length, but on leg stump. Clipped off Stokes' hips to McClenaghan at deep backward point
short on off, and Samson rides the bounce to pull square. Top-edged to fine leg
full, and drifting into his pads. Clipped off his legs to deep midwicket. He'll keep strike
good length outside off, and spinning away from Samson. Stays on the back foot and taps it back to Mayank
half-tracker on off, and it's the wrong'un this time. Stokes says on the backfoot and punches to long off
flighted wide outside off and Samson comes down the wicket to drive away from his body. Work for the man at long off
good length outside off, and spinning away from Samson. Carved off the front foot towards deep point
tossed up on middle, and it's the topspinner this time. Goes straight through, and fended off the front foot
a slower ball outside off, Samson opens the bat face and guides the ball to backward point for a run.
on a length, down leg, worked to deep midwicket for one.
back of a length, but sliding down leg. Worked away into the gap at backward square leg. Fine leg cleans up.
full outside off, Stokes walks down and pushes to mid-off for a quick single. Almost in sync. Rohit can't prevent one.

Stokes walks right across this too. But misses. A good length delivery outside off, Stokes walks across, misses and is struck on the pad! A massive appeal is quickly struck down, but Mumbai want to review. Stokes is well down the pitch, there isn't any bat. Two reds, but the ball is bouncing over the top of off stump. So Mumbai lose their review.
another cutter, full and wide outside off. Driven to deep point for a single
a googly down leg, would have been wide had he left the ball but he tickles that down to fine leg.
some flight outside off, Samson drives the ball with the spin to wide long-off, immediately calling for two. Nicely into the gap and two easy
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off

another cross-batted stroke, the reverse sweep, it's the legbreak on middle and off. Stokes places this nicely through point, all along the ground. A good diving stop from Hardik, running to his right
slog-swept! The googly outside off, but it doesn't matter because Stokes opts for a cross-batted stroke. A hard sweep past midwicket's right
flat start, on off. No flight. Worked to midwicket with the spin.
finds the gap! Another cutter outside off, Samson opens the bat face and guides the ball into the gap between third man and point. Lovely.
walks right across, worked away to deep square leg for a run.

finds midwicket! The pressure was building and the fielder was pushed to the edge of the circle to protect the over. It's another cutter, around middle and leg. Rahane gets enough bat on a wristy whip, but he picks out midwicket at a comfortable height too. The reverse-cupped hands over his head does the job for Krunal. Rahane gestures that he wanted to hit the ball wider of the fielder, like all batsmen try to do.
a length delivery on middle and leg, nudged to midwicket. Another cutter.
another slower cutter, 119 kph, carved to backward point. That's quite predictable with third man up

a slower delivery outside off, Rahane opens the bat face and guides the ball to short third man. Bumrah picks up and throws the stumps down at the striker's end, conceding an extra run in the process.
flat on the pads, nudged to square leg for a run. At least a single off every ball, very well played by these two.
loses patience with those singles and changes the line, goes much fuller and much wider outside off. Rahane crashes a drive through cover for four.
short, straighter though. Clipped to deep midwicket
flicked against the spin again. Flat and wide outside off, drag-flicked to mid-on
flat and straight, nudged to deep midwicket for one
slow outside off, some flight, but it isn't full. Very clever delivery. Worked against the spin, to midwicket.
a good length delivery outside off, pushed to mid-off for a single. A good call from Rahane.
another cutter, 125 kph, on middle and leg, worked to midwicket. Tidy over so far.
another cutter, 129 kph, full and wide outside off. Samson strides forward and slices a drive to deep cover
slightly wider outside off, allowing Samson to throw his hands at the ball. Finds the timing and the placement, into the gap at cover.
another cutter, 125 kph, the ball skews off the outside half of the bat to backward point
a good length delivery on off, Samson opens the bat face and finds short third man.
flat on middle and leg, pushed to mid-on. Krunal cuts off that angle by running to his right.
he's timed this one! Flat and wide outside off, pushed away through cover for three. Pulled back just inside the boundary.
edged through the vacant slip region for four. A bit of width, flat and wider. A thick edge goes flying away for four. Krunal got some turn on that.
a yorker on off, jammed back to the bowler.

picks out mid-on! I'm not sure what kind of a shot that was. Flat and straight, Tripathi just chips a drive to mid-on, did he try to go over? Or past him? That does not seem like a very clever shot, did it hold up? Something definitely did happen that resulted in a tame bunt to the fielder. Krunal doesn't care.
starts with a full delivery on middle, driven to mid-on for a quick single.
good stop from McClenaghan. Back of a length outside off, Rahane opens the bat face and guides a dab down to third man for a run.
strays on the pads, worked away to deep square leg for a single.
skiddy. Good length on middle and leg, Tripathi gets behind the line to block.
slightly shorter, Rahane opens the bat face and guides that down to third man for one.
140 kph, on a length, looking for the top of off. Pushed to mid-on
lovely start. A good length delivery on off, the ball pitches and straightens even with his angle. Tripathi is squared up, a thick outside edge goes down to third man.

nicely played and stopped. A full delivery on middle and leg, Tripathi drives with the full face, towards mid-off's right. The fielder gets across and cuts the ball off. A slightly sloppy start from Mumbai.
too straight again. A slower one on the pads and Tripathi works the ball through backward square leg for a couple.
not been a great start in terms of line. This one drifts down leg for a wide.
good length delivery around middle and off, tapped towards point. Tripathi hares down, Rahane sends him back in time.
it's too straight. Full and drifting down leg. All Tripathi needs is a bit of bat, a thick inside edge and the ball flies down to the fine leg fence.
132 kph, back of a length down leg. Clips the pad down towards short fine leg.
nicely bowled. Full and attacking the stumps, Rahane is aware of that wicket-taking option, so a broad bat comes down to defend.
full outside leg, and Pollard whips it fine down the leg side. Misfield in the deep, and that allows them to take the second. Rajasthan Royals need 168 to win
full outside leg stump, but Pollard expected that. Backs away further towards the leg side and thumps it towards deep midwicket
yorker on middle stump, and that's been drilled past the non-striker to long on. Gowtham's dive ends up in vain!
slipped out of his hand! Eye-line level full toss, but wide outside off. Pollard lets it go. Free hit
too slow! Pollard winds up for a biggie, but sends it nowhere. Full outside off, but through his shot way too early
falls just short of cow corner! Short on off, and Pollard mistimed the pull. Was in the air for ages, but Unadkat can't get to it
yorker on off stump, and that's been dug down the ground. A single's available, but Pollard asks Markande to get back
full on leg stump, and that's been clipped off his toes to deep backward square. Single for the taking, but Pollard refuses. The big man wants the strike for the final over
and McClenaghan's out! Comes from around the wicket and this is full on off stump. Almost a yorker, and the batsman can't connect. On a hat-trick
crashes into middle stump! Full on leg stump, and Hardik tries a leg-side slog. Misses, and the ball hits his pad and then cannons into his stumps
the umpire's on the floor! Full on off, and that's been thumped down the ground. As straight as you can imagine, and I'm glad Rod Tucker ducked. Goes to the boundary in no time

dropped by Archer! Was hit really hard though, but he doesn't show the pain. Smiles it off. Full on off, and Pollard drills it straight to Archer. He managed to get it with both hands, but the ball just pops out. Difficult chance
full on off, and lifted off his pads towards the leg side. Not hit well enough, and Klaasen - at wide long on - takes an easy catch. Looks like it's the knuckleball that earns Archer the wicket

excellent ball to end the over. Gives everything to this delivery and Unadkat takes a tumble on his followthrough. It's full and wide outside off, but inside the tram-lines. A much better spell from Unadkat tonight
another slower ball, it's the offcutter this time. Krunal wants to work it towards the leg side, but takes the leading edge. Falls near short extra cover
back of a length on off, and Pollard comfortably pulls it over short fine-leg's head
good length on middle, and angling across Pollard. Just enough width to free his arms, and he smacks it over the non-striker's head. Hit well enough!
slower ball, and full on off. Tapped off his pads towards the vacant mid-wicket region. They want the second, but Samson's quick to get his throw right in
good length outside off, and angling into Krunal. Stays on the back foot, and glances this past short third man. Beats the infield, and no stopping that thereafter!
goes back of a length, and takes the pace off it once again. Whipped off his waist to deep square leg
back of a length outside off, and Krunal opens his bat's face to glance it towards short third man
full on leg stump, and that's been well bowled! Angling into his toes, and it can't be put away
back of a length on off stump, and it's another loopy slower ball. Pollard wants to pull but he's through his shot too early. Hits his arm
goes short! On off stump, and soars over Pollard's head as he's forced to duck
back of a length on off, and Pollard's been deceived by the pace. Defended off the back foot
short outside off, and forces Krunal to tip-toe. Chopped towards the keeper
good length on off, and he opens his bat's face to carve it towards backward point. Calls nice and early this time

first-ball duck! Full on off, and pushed to cover for a quick single. Rohit calls early, but that's super dangerous. Rahane collects, dives forward, and then throws under-hand. Off go to zing bails, and out goes Rohit!
slower ball again. Full on middle stump, and driven to long off
slow again, and this time the slog is played way too early. Slices the shot, and it's another skyer. Swirls in the air, but Buttler's very safe
starts off with the slower ball. Full outside off, and angling across Yadav. Tries to drive towards cover, but misses
full toss, wide outside off again. Sky thumps it past the non-striker to long on for a single
well, we'll find out in a bit. Because it's full and wide outside of again. Forces Suryakumar to reach at it, and he misses, but the umpire stretches his arms out again
too wide. Overpitched and Suryakumar lets it go through to Buttler
full toss, but wide outside off. Sticks his bat out and drills it to deep extra cover. He's off the mark. Kulkarni ensuring the ball's not in Pollard's arc
good length just outside off on the fourth-stump line. Pollard takes a step forward and taps it back to the bowler
good length on middle stump, and that's been pulled along the ground to deep midwicket

too cheeky, and Kishan pays the price. Full toss outside off, and Kishan opens his bat's face to ramp it over the keeper. Doesn't manage to get the angle he wants, and therefore in the air for ages. Buttler collects and finally the partnership ends after almost 14 overs
full and wide outside off, but that's premeditated by Suryakumar. Gets his front leg across to the off side and then paddles this sweep shot very square on the man in the deep
slower ball outside off, but Kishan was waiting for it. Slog-swept to Stokes at wide long on
good length outside off, and going straight through. Enough width for Kishan to cut square, but plays under that ball. Through to Buttler
full just outside off, and he backs away once again. Drills this drive to cover thereafter

drops just in front of short fine leg! And then goes through Gopal's hands. Full on off, and he shuffled across to the off side to try and ramp it over the leg side. Mistimes it behind square but earns a boundary anyway
deceived by the slower ball! Only 120 kph this time, and Kishan misses the leg-side slog. Full outside off, and through to the keeper on the bounce
backs away to the leg side, and cuts this good-length ball over point. Excellent from Archer in the deep, who races across the boundary line and collects from deep point
