good length on off, and extra bounce! Hits the batsman's gloves, as he tries to defend. That must've stung
full toss on off stump, and mistimed off the back foot to mid on. Calls early for the single, and that's his fifty!
full on middle stump, and drilled down the ground to long on
deft! Good length outside off, and Sky opens his bat's face to ramp it between the keeper and short third man. Chase for the infielder
full toss on middle stump again, and this time it's been bunted towards the leg side. Only to square leg, though
full toss on off, but Kishan backs away towards the leg side and check-drives over cover! Off the bat's sweet spot and one-bounce and into the extra-cover boundary
full and wide outside off. Kishan chooses to reverse sweep, but Stokes is there at deep point
full on off, and that's been whipped down the ground to long on. They easily walk across for the run
good length outside off, and Yadav takes a step towards the leg side and cuts it past point. Beats the infielders and there's no stopping that thereafter
full on middle stump, and Kishan muscles this drive past the non-striker. Man at long on, though
good length, just outside off. Stays on the back foot and punches to long off for an easy run
full on off, and he tries to drive towards cover. Takes the inside edge and trickles down to short fine leg. Darting throw from the fielder to the non-striker's, but Kishan's safe
full on off, and Kishan tries another leg-side slog. Inside-edged onto his pads, and goes towards midwicket. No one there, so Stokes has to run across to the leg side. Allows them to take the run
good length but just outside off. Punched off the back foot past Stokes' left to long off
good length outside off, and angling into Yadav. Flat-batted down the ground to long on. Also the hundred partnership

slower ball, and short on off stump. He's through his pull-shot early, and that's in the air. Straight to Gowtham at long on, but it's been dropped! He's one of the better fielders, but drops it after what looked like a clean catch
clipped behind square! Full on middle, and aimed at Sky's pads. Uses his wrists to whip it over the square-leg umpire's head, and beats both men in the deep
high full toss, but wide outside off. Suryakumar can slap this anywhere he wants, but drills it straight to cover. Was above the waist, mind you, but called a dot
goes beyond cow corner! Nicely flighted on leg stump, and Kishan uses his feet to get to the pitch of the ball. Proper slog towards the leg side thereafter
good length on middle, and gets big onto Kishan. Muscled off the back foot towards cover. Not hit into the gap
good length outside off, and it's the wrong'un to end the over. Comes into Suryakumar's body, and punches it down the ground to long on
tossed up outside off, and that's a beautiful shot from Sky. Takes one step forward and lifts it over cover. Stylish way to get to fifty
full on leg stump, and Kishan uses his feet to come down the wicket. Driven to long on
uses the depth of his crease! Good length on leg stump, and Kishan goes deep into his crease to open the gap behind square on the leg side. Swivels and pulls along the ground to deep backward square
slower ball to end the over. Good length outside off, and Kishan mistimes his cut
good length outside off, but angling into the right-hander. Punched off the front foot to long on for a walking single
full just outside off, opens his bat's face and carves it to deep point. Calls early for the second, and they comfortably jog back in
full on off, and Kishan comes down the wicket. Effectively yorks himself, so all he can do is bunt it down the ground to long off
nataraja pull! Good length on middle, and he's quick to swivel, get his front leg up, and then muscled over square leg
good length on middle and angling into Kishan. Tries to whip it off his pads, but hits his thigh guard
aargh, it's short again. That's a poor over. Googly outside off, Kishan rocks back and nails his pull to wide long-on for a run.
it's a googly, on middle and leg, pulled to deep square leg. Two more.
pulled away to deep square leg, it's short again.
it's too short again. A long hop, Suryakumar Yadav hurries back and swats a pull into the gap at midwicket for four. Archer gets across to his left, but allows the ball to go through. Naughtily
looking for the seam-up one, 115 kph. Waaaay down leg. Buttler does well to prevent five wides.
a tad short, Suryakumar Yadav picks the length early, hurries back and swats a pull into the gap at midwicket for two.
a bit of flight on leg, Kishan stays low and nails his sweep to deep midwicket for one, all along the ground.
connects this time. It's the same trajectory - flat and quick - and Suryakumar Yadav sweeps that easily through  backward square leg for four. Just had to get some bat on that.
101 kph, a flat and quick dart. Suryakumar looks to drag a sweep but it's too full. Struck on the pad, well outside the line of off stump!
flat on middle and leg, flicked away towards square leg for a run.
flat on middle and leg, punched to long-on for a single.
flat on off, but he gets some turn. That's why an attempted drive results in a thick inside edge through square leg. Two runs
flat on middle and leg, punched to long-on from the back foot.
a good length delivery on off, pushed to long-on for a single. A good comeback from Mumbai after a slow start.
a full delivery outside off, driven to mid-off for a run. They've got the boundary so the singles make it a productive over.
a slower cutter on off, 119 kph, sliced in front of point for one. Wanted one all along
good length on middle and leg, jammed out back towards the bowler.

a slower ball on middle and leg, pushed to mid-on. Suryakumar called for one immediately (it was his call). Kishan doesn't completely trust the call, there's some hesitation but even with a direct hit at the batsman's end, all good.
all wrists again! What batting. Back of a length on the fourth-stump channel. Suryakumar stays low and whips this elegantly through midwicket. Beautiful
that's not great bowling. It's short and wide with third man in. Kishan slices a cut between short third man and backward point. Too easy. Poor over that one. One too many from Rahane.
full on middle and leg, driven to long-on for a run.
what a shot! All wrists. Full and straight, Suryakumar brings out the wrists, stays besides the ball and flicks, the ball then flies away over backward square leg. Lovely batting.
full and wide outside off, hammered to the sweeper cover for a single. Quick hands through the line of the ball.
that's smashed! 116 kph offcutter on middle and leg. Kishan comes charging and swipes a heave into the stands over long-on. The bat turned in his hands, but still plenty of power.
a full delivery outside off, nicely driven with the full face to mid-off. Decent timing too.
full delivery outside off, 145 kph. Skewed away to mid-on. Another good over for Rajasthan.
145 kph, doesn't miss out this time. Back of a length on middle and leg, makes contact with his flick this time and the ball goes flying past short fine leg's left.
looking to drag a flick, but the ball has smashed Suryakumar on the box! That's going to hurt for a little bit. Back of a length on middle and off, 142 kph. Suryakumar misses and wears the blow.
nicely done. Good length delivery in the fourth-stump channel, tapped towards point for a run. A direct hit from Gowtham at the bowler's end, but he's well in. Good cricket
141 kph. Again, hurried on the pull. Short of a length outside off, Kishan drags a mis-timed pull to midwicket.
a good length delivery, straying down leg. Off the thigh pad down to short fine leg.
looking for the gap either side of short third man, but he finds the fielder! Full and wide, dabbed away towards short third man.
a slower ball outside off, good change in pace, and angle (the ball going away instead of coming in). Pushed to cover point.
just short of midwicket! It's 138 kph, hurrying Kishan for pace. He looks to pull, but all he can manage is to splice it away.
full on off, 135 kph, blocked to mid-off. The little bit of swing we saw in the first over isn't there anymore.
the line isn't great, drifts down leg, worked to deep square leg for one.
a clean swing into the stands! Full, on middle and leg. Suryakumar showed the strength of his wrists in the previous one. Now, he lifts the ball cleanly over mid-on for six. Shot.
flat and quick on middle and leg, pushed to long-on for one. Another tidy over.
flat outside off, a big extravagant swing, but the drift takes the ball past the outside edge.
it's flat and quick outside off, pushed to mid-off, not much power or timing with that
flat on middle and leg, nudged into the gap at midwicket for a run. Nicely played, soft hands, off the mark.
short and quick outside off, punched away to cover where there is another misfield. Another single.
it's short and quick down leg, flicked away with strong wrists to square leg. Finds the fielder
full outside off, pushed to cover. A lovely start from Dhawal.
140 kph, full and swinging back in, Kishan gets forward and somehow defends. It's a similar delivery to what Umesh bowled to him at the Wankhede.

a golden duck for Lewis this time! It's an overpitched half-volley outside off and Lewis wants to flay that through cover. It's the right stroke and the right plan, but downright awful execution. His feet are rooted to the crease, he doesn't account for the little bit of inswing, despite watching it from the other end. A thick inside edge clatters into the stumps.
off the mark via a misfield. Back of a length on middle and leg, swivel-pulled away towards square leg. Gowtham can't field cleanly, allowing the first run of the night.
more swing. Not too much, not too troubling. Good length delivery outside off, sixth-stump line. Defended into the off side, towards cover.
tidy start from Dhawal. On a length, around middle, some away shape. Defended to mid-on. No golden duck this time.
oh, he's done it! Bravo's done it. A yorker outside off that Rashid can only drill down to long-on. Bravo takes flight. So close yet so far for Sunrisers

short_text: Bravo to Rashid Khan, FOUR runs
long_text: slashes blindly at a wide fuller one and gets an outside edge that gets well past the left of short third man. Six off one!

short_text: Bravo to Rashid Khan, SIX runs
long_text: oh, yes! Another big hit. Bravo sprays a short ball that's angled into him, and Rashid swivels and heaves a pull over deep backward square leg. What a strike! What drama!
full toss on middle, turned away to deep fine leg where there's  a fielder guarding the boundary
low full toss, driven to extra cover, where Shardul Thakur lets it go through the legs. What a time for a misfield. Two extra runs!
that's the class and experience of Bravo at this stage of the innings. A wide yorker, sneaks under the bat. CSK need five more of these from him

short_text: Thakur to Rashid Khan, SIX runs
long_text: Rashid Khan reminding people that he's still here, and as long as he is, write off SRH at your own peril. This one's a fuller one outside off, right in the slot, and just what the newcomer wanted. Frees up his arms and shellacks it straight over
slower length ball, flays a pull straight to deep midwicket

gone, Yusuf's gone! The task was just too much. He had to go for it, and he's picked out extra cover. The knuckle ball. CSK's variations at the death have been nothing short of remarkable here. Yusuf slashes and gets the leading edge as Raina settles under it
full toss again, wants the wide yorker, fortunately for him, this is drilled straight back at him
full toss, the yorker gone wrong. You can't get an inch wrong here or you'll be punished. Yusuf whips it over deep midwicket. Oh, how the scales have tilted back and forth!
another slower ball, full, drilled away to long-off. Hands the strike back to Yusuf

in the air and taken! Is that the match? Jadeja with a brilliant catch. Bravo slows it up, rolls his fingers on this back of a length delivery, and miscues the pull in the air. Jadeja charges forward and puts in a perfectly-timed dive forward to complete an amazing catch. CSK back in this. Remember, Yusuf is not at 100 percent
yorker on middle, flicked out to the square leg region. Well-bowled
short outside off, tries to fetch a pull and drags it down the ground between long-on and long-off

another yorker, this one's angled into him, and Yusuf trickles it away to short fine who dives and can't stop it. Man in the deep throws it to Dhoni who flicks it back onto the stumps without even looking at them. But Yusuf desperately puts in a dive to save his wicket. Has he done damage to his back in doing that, however? He's down in significant pain again
wide yorker outside off, dug out back to the bowler
short, banged into him, that's tripe from Bravo. Yusuf swivels and helps this pull along to deep fine leg
beautifully bowled! Top stuff under pressure from the young quick. A very wide yorker again, and Williamson can do nothing about it apart from jamming the bat down and hitting the ground
very full outside off, Williamson walks across early and then ends up wearing it on the pad as the ball rolls away to short fine leg
there you go, that's what CSK need. A yorker outside off, squeezed away through point
gets the yorker wrong and fires a full toss on Yusuf's off-stump, and he's whacked that out of here. Miles past long-on

is that a high full toss? No, umpires seem to think it's fine but that was definitely a no-ball. Williamson can't believe it. Vineet Kulkarni at square leg. Williamson works it away to backward square leg without control
walks across but it's a yorker outside off that's been dug out to deep point
six more! Another big over, and the Hyderabad crowd has found its voice again. A shortish delivery again, and Yusuf hammers a pull over deep midwicket. Another clean strike
length ball, slid across, Yusuf swings and misses as it's the slower one. Well-concealed
not the best timing but he has enough power to make up for it. A wide fuller one, smoked over long-off. CSK feeling the heat now
short ball, goes over leg stump as the batsman ducks, deemed alright by the umpire
slower ball with ample width, slapped away to point
short of a length, slower, flays a pull one-bounce to deep square leg

that's another gift from the bowler. Changes the line and takes it away from the batsman's off-stump, but the length is the same. Williamson easily comes forward to get his weight behind that shot, and deposits it over long-off with minimal effort. Massive over; 22 off it. Game on in Hyderabad
that's six more! This is an unbelievable innings from the SRH captain. A poor delivery - leg-side fuller one from the leggie, and Williamson gets down on one knee and carts it over deep square leg
short, wide, and flat, slapped over the in-field, on the bounce to sweeper cover
short and wide, reaches out for a cut to deep point
that's an even better shot. Williamson's turning it around here. Still giving SRH some hope. Gets on top of this fuller one and mows it over cow corner
in the air as he tries to loft this fuller one and lands safely in front of long-off
heaved away! That's a top shot. Jadeja flattens his trajectory and takes this away from Williamson, but the batsman swings cleanly and with loads of timing to eaisly clear long-off
length outside off, stays in the crease and punches to extra cover
fullish, sliding into middle and leg, pushed down the ground to long-on
flat and quick and well outside off, Yusuf can't reach out
short and wide, cut to deep point again
short of a length, sliding into him, backs away and cuts to deep point
nudges this length ball into the leg side and Yusuf is struggling with his back as he limps the single
he's not able to deal with the spin again, and throws hard hands at this fuller one, off the outside of the bat, but lands past the point fielder running back
covers for the turn and pushes into the off side
in the air and Bravo makes no attempt. Another top-edge on the sweep and Bravo runs forward before bailing off in the last minute. Misjudgement
gets down for a sweep and skews it in the air as it deflects off the edge onto his arm before lobbing into the air in the off side
advances down the ground and drives to long-off for his sixth IPL fifty
slides into him and finds the inside part of the bat as he pushes back
short of a length, straightening on middle, backs away and punches through cover
gently pushes a fullish delivery into the off side for one
whipped against the turn between midwicket and mid-on
pushes forward early into a length ball and chips a punch in the air, towards long-on
short and wide, and some turn away again, cut away to deep point
floated up outside off, clipped to midwicket
non-turning legbreak on middle, trickles it away into the leg side

big swing and a miss from Yusuf. Zero feet, and against the turn and angle. Dhoni whips the bails off in a flash, and wait, has the backfoot been planted back? Yusuf just dragged it out but he's managed to ground his foot just in time
there's the error from the batsman. Pressure building up, and he's forced into a poor shot - a sweep with no room, and he gets a glove to short fine leg
floated up on middle, driven straight back
backs away dangerously to one that spins in and gets an outside edge to short third man
slower full ball at 129.7ks on leg stump, pushed away between mid-on and midwicket
good fielding again. Full and wide, and Shakib drove it to the right of extra cover, where DJ bravo dives and half-stops it
short outside off, pulled to deep midwicket

Jadeja with a brilliant save but have theu run four? Yes, they have. Williamson whipped this uppishly through deep midwicket. Jadeja ran across a long way from deep square leg and did well to get down to it but ended up pulling it away too forcefully. He then has to chase it a second time as it goes towards the boundary again. And Faf du Plessis, backing up, had to pick it up in the end
full on the pads, flicked away to deep midwicket
short and pushed a long way across, slapped away to sweeper cover
short of a length, spinning away towards off, whipped down to long-on
cut off the backfoot through backward point. Intercepted by the man at the deep
pushed back to the bowler

a pristine late cut from Williamson. He's played some delightful strokes today, and that's as good as any. Short of a length from Jadeja, straightens around off, and Williamson stays back and cuts late through backward point
gets down for a big crunching sweep and mistimes it to deep midwicket
short of a length, flicked with the angle to midwicket
shot! This one was short and came with a bit too much width. Shakib jumps and flays an upper cut over backward point
flays a drive to a fuller ball but cover dives to his left and makes a brilliant stop
slower fullish ball, punched to sweeper cover
shortish outside off, whacks it away to deep backward point
a beautiful drive for one as extra cover dives and gets a hand to it, and long-off mops up
a bit of width, opens up and drops it to point
lower-arm slider this time, worked with the angle to the region between midwicket and mid-on
pitched up this time, and he presses forward and drives to cover
back of a length, stands tall and punches to cover
spins into him, and he backs away and cuts to sweeper cover
length ball, little turn, shifts back and across and whips against the turn to midwicket
short, pitching outside leg, that's a gift, and Shakib treats it as one as he swivels around and pulls it over fine leg
full and wide, Shakib reaches out for a drive that's intercepted by Billings diving to his left at point
gets on top of a shortish delivery and whips it to midwicket
back of a length, pulls it away towards midwicket and sets off for a quick single. Direct hit at the striker's end but Williamson has dragged his bat well inside
slower short ball, Shakib doesn't get hold of it but finds the gap at midwicket
back of a length on middle and off, punched to mid-off
short of a length, gets on top and drops it in front of cover. Wants a single but is sent back
mistimes his pull this time, an inside edge as it drops into the off side off the lower part of the bat
short, angled into Williamson, and he's waiting for it right back in the crease before flaying a pull flat over deep square leg
slow and dipping full toss, Williamson leans into a punch and Billings flings himself across at cover to make a brilliant save

easy catch at extra cover. Hooda pre-meditates and shuffles too early. It's the slower ball again and he goes through with the flick early to get a leading edge that Jadeja runs back a few inches to take
short of a length outside off, whips it towards midwicket who dives forward and stops it
back of a length, sitting up nicely outside off. Was the slower one from the bowler, and Williamson rocks back and crunches a pull over midwicket
short of a length, sways out of the line outside off
splits the gap at midwicket as he pulls this back of a length delivery. DJ Bravo sprints behind it but the ball's too quick for him
short of a length, slower in pace, left alone outside off

what an effort! That's a sensational effort! Karn Sharma at the third man boundary with a super piece of fielding. Leaps right up in the air after Williamson upper-cut this, and stretches out his right hand. Sees his left foot landing outside the boundary, and just as he's landing down, he releases it after completing the catch. Would have probably been on par with Boult's catch last night had he got that but top effort
tails away down the leg side
short outside off, Hooda was walking towards it and is then forced to sway out of the line late
short of a length outside off, rides the bounce and drops it in front of backward point
shuffles across early and tries to tuck this back of a length delivery but gets an inside edge into the pad before it rolls away into the off side
full, wide, holding its line this time, and Hooda walks across and lets it go
full, curving away, worked away to third man

Deepak Chahar, what a star! Again some very sharp movement outside off, the away-swinger. Pandey, no feet, throws his hands at it, and gets a healthy outside edge that third man runs forward to grab. Poor shot, and Sunrisers in big trouble
short of a length outside off, Williamson cuts crisply off the backfoot past point
full and shaping away, Williamson drives back with some tight footwork back to the bowler
short, wide, through cover and point this time as he gets on top of the bounce and slaps it away

short and wide, Williamson dares to go over the in-field and just about clears the point fielder. And, oh, that's some great teamwork at the boundary. Two fielders - Rayudu and Karn Sharma converging - Rayudu slides forward and Karn, running across, gets the boot across to push it back and Rayudu does well to avoid contact as he completes the slide
short of a length, shapes away outside off, rides the bounce and drops it to point
sharp inswinger! Curves in significantly and raps the pad but would have headed down leg with that angle. Wicket maiden from the young fast bowler. What a start!

edged and taken! This is lovely bowling. Set him up perfectly for this dismissal. First there was the awayswinger, then the inswinger, and then the one that swings away again. Bhui pushes forward with hard hands and gets a thick edge to Watson at first slip. Terrific start for CSK
now he gets it to cut in from a back of a length, and Bhui defends from the crease. Four dots. Pressure on already.
some shape away outside off, left alone
in the air, and almost a duck for the debutant. Bhui can't get entirely on top of this short ball and skews it in the air as point runs forward and slides but the ball drops short
short of a length on off, extra bounce, Bhui keeps it out from the crease
really full on off stump, not quite a yorker, Dhoni clears his front leg and belts it ram-rod straight, so much so it hits the stumps at the other end. They get a single and finish with 182 for 3
sliding into the pads, swatted away to deep square leg
Raina shuffles across off, yorker just outside leg, Raina does not make contact. Not called a wide. Did that flick the pad?
full-toss outside off, Dhoni backs away and splices it over the covers. Two fielders circle around it but both miss it

back of a length and outside off, 129kph, slower one from Stanlake. Dhoni picks the legcutter, stands still, and short-arms it over the midwicket boundary. That back is fine. If it isn't, then the hands are great
short and angling across off, slogs and top-edges it to deep third man
Dhoni venturing a sweep? Interesting. Near yorker outside off, Dhoni shuffles across off, and wears it on the pad
full-toss outside off, Dhoni uses the pace of the bowler and deftly carves it away just wide of short third man for four
Raina shuffles away outside leg, Kaul follows him with a very full ball and attacks the pads. Deflected away to midwicket

116.4ks, short and wide outside off, Raina, having stepped away outside leg, tests out his calf, reaches out for the ball. Delays his shot and scythes it away to the left of backward point. Mr.IPL brings up his first fifty of the season
Dhoni forays down the track, meets a full-toss outside off, and hits it down to long-on
banged in short and aimed at the head of Dhoni, he top-edges a hook fine of short fine leg. Fortunate runs for CSK and Dhoni

short_text: Rashid Khan to Raina, FOUR runs
long_text: dragged into the hips, Raina swivels and short-arms it away past short fine leg for another four. Another bad day for the best T20 bowler. He ends with 1 for 49
another short dart outside off, nearly 100ks, pulled away to deep midwicket off the back foot
picked off the pads through square leg
short, skids on outside off, chopped to backward point

short_text: Rashid Khan to Dhoni, FOUR runs
long_text: dragged short and outside off, Dhoni sizes it up and shovels it away with great power over Raina's head. First boundary for Dhoni v Rashid

short_text: Rashid Khan to Dhoni, no run
long_text: back of a length and skids on off, jabbed back to Rashid
short on off, Dhoni steps out and skews it to the covers
backs away and carves to backward point

What a horrible mix-up between the wickets. Farcical running. But Rayudu and Raina laugh it off. Rayudu raises his bat and walks off. This was short and wide outside off, flat-batted away to wide long-off, where Pandey, one of India's best fielders, fumbles. Rayudu senses an opportunity for an extra run. Raina also (seemingly) calls for the second. Pandey throws the ball to Kaul, who fumbles too. He then runs after the ball, tags it to Williamson, who takes the bails off to catch Rayudu short at the non-striker's end. Rayudu can't undo his steps in time
slower knuckle ball, dips on off, or just a shade outside off, Rayudu stretches out and reverse-paddles it fine of short third man
fullish and outside off, whipped across the line to deep midwicket
back of a length and outside off, Rayudu shimmies out and slices to short third man
and just to prove that he and the coaching manual are still good buds, he essays a picture perfect cover drive to finish the game off.
he goes around the wicket for the bouncer, all with the aim of cramping AB up. But the genius that he is, AB sways away, makes his own room and lifts it over short third man's head
fullish on leg stump, turns it through midwicket
short and outside off, AB chops it to point
drops and runs to cover
taps a full toss down the ground and pinches a second run as well. RCB need 10 runs to win now. AB needs 19 for a century
slow, dipping full toss. Mandeep flicks through square leg and steals the strike

wallops the back of a length ball outside off over mid-off. Roy is the man haring after it, hoping to drag it back, throwing himself head-first at the ball. It's travelled too far, and he might have hurt himself from the effort. He's on his haunches with a crowd around him, talking to Chris Morris and the physio. Roy has gone off the field
nudges the length ball to short midwicket
slower ball becomes a full toss on leg stump. AB taps it down to long leg
drops the leg cutter at third man
full, slow and sliding down leg.  Mandeep tries a flick. Doesn't come off
top-edge sails away to the boundary behind him. Well, that's one way to do it.
shortish and outside off, taps it down to third man
144. 8 kph. And it's good enough to beat Anderson, who is swinging for the fences. Done by pure pace. This is what the non-millenials say you miss, I hit.

both batsmen are at the same end! Anderson races through the moment AB glides the short ball to point. But AB himself is not terribly keen. Then he changes his mind and goes for the run. But wait, by that point Anderson realises he should get back to the non-strikers' end and all of that culminates with both he, AB and the bowler Boult waiting on the fielder. The throw is poor, even Boult can't save its blushes. And so, Anderson has the chance to complete the single he so dearly wanted
low full toss on leg stump, heaves it out to long-on
the perfect wide yorker, with a tinge of away swing to beat Anderson's reach
Anderson's decided I want a slice of this pie. Takes a full toss around waist high and nails it over deep midwicket
he's blocking a full toss - while his partner is belting yorkers. This is just bonkers
top edge but with the ball going only as far as the 30 yard circle, and everyone on the leg side in the deep, AB's very very safe
goes for a bouncer, from around the wicket, but it goes too high. In looking to escape AB's punishment, he runs into the umpire's wrath
slower ball, sliding down leg, AB swipes it to the left of short fine leg. He's GPSing the ball into the gaps now. Simple as that.
he's not targeting the boundary - HE'S TARGETING THE BLEEPIN ROOF! Length ball. The absolute last thing you bowl to AB. And he clatters it straight down the ground.
tries to cramp AB with a back of a length ball on leg stump, the batsman swings it away to short fine leg
short of a length and outside off, punches to deep point
googly - pitches it short though and Anderson pulls to long-on
sets up for a heave again, but seeing the leg break turn a slight bit more than he budgets for, hits it along the ground to deep cover
length ball, giving him the freedom to swing through the line. AB accepts it and politely slog sweeps the ball over long-on
tosses it up on leg stump, Anderson flicks to deep square leg
full and outside off, down comes that blade, full of vengeance, to bludgeon the ball to deep cover.
shortish and outside off, chops it to deep point

sweeps the fast bowler over square leg! Pure audaciousness from the very best in the world. He could block a million balls with a Test on the line. He could get a fifty off 20 odd in a T20, skipping outside off and screwing up the opposition's plans. No country for near yorkers
bounces him this time, de Villiers is prepared for it, sways back to ramp the ball over short third man. He misses it. Miracles do happen
thick outside edge as he looks to go big over cover. Third man is stuck on the boundary, perhaps not picking that the ball is coming towards him. Eventually comes up to take the ball on the bounce
hits the yorker length, AB knocks it down to long-on

dismisses it to the boundary - he was eyeing midwicket, but he'll settle for extra cover. Mr 360 at his very best, starting things off by moving across outside off to open up the leg side. But Harshal one-ups him by bowling wide, as far wide as he dares. But AB raises the game with a blistering lofted drive for his fifty, off only 24 balls
who cares if the opposition just sparked to life? I'ma see this length ball and pulverise it over long-on. Thank you very much. That's what's going on in AB's head. I'm paraphrasing, of course.
full on off stump, driven to extra cover where Boult - believe it or not - allows it to come on, puts a barrier behind it and fields one with his body completely aligned.
oh stop it, Trent Boult! You show off! Short ball on middle stump, gets back in the crease and pummels this pull shot. Boult leaps to his right at deep midwicket to stop this on the bounce
spits off the pitch as Anderson looks to defend on the back foot. Gets him on the glove and lobs safely into the leg side
full on leg stump, jams it out to long-on
short and wide outside off, backs away and cuts to long-off
short of a length outside off, punched to long-off off the back foot

get out of here Trent Boult! Someone check if that isn't a robot there! This is sensational. A one-handed leap to his right at deep square after being wrong-footed to his left, then a landing backwards and a cobra pose to keep his chest from touching the rope! Soft signal out. Replays say - OUT. Wow. Unbelievable. It's a full toss on the pads and it's flying, flat over Boult's head because Kohli has got good power on that flick. It's a stunning recovery from Boult. A leap backwards, holding on with the right hand, landing on his stomach and then stopping all that momentum to complete it. Gets back on his feet and even he's in shock.
he's in some trouble, but they've turned it into two runs. It's a slower bouncer and he picks it very late. Bunts it in front of long-on with soft hands and AB comes back for the second
short ball wide outside off, scythes it to sweeper cover
length ball on leg stump, clipped off his pads to deep square's left
full toss on the pads. Go pick it up from the boundary.  AB doesn't have to move. Deep midwicket is powerless to his right
length ball outside off, punched on the up to mid-off
slow and short. Kohli nearly misses this one as he tries to go too square with the pull. But he manages to stay on his feet and get bat for a single at deep square
short of a length on leg stump, shovelled to deep midwicket off the back foot
length ball on off, driven to extra cover

drops it short and doesn't bother to look! Tewatia has been slapped to the edge of the Chinnaswamy's roof, and for effect, AB makes sure it bounces back into the ground from there so that the game can move on. Proper pull shot over deep midwicket
length ball on leg stump, nudged to deep square off the back foot
short of a length, pushed through flat and skidding into him as he gets on the back foot. Punches it to long-on
full toss on leg stump, flicked straight to deep midwicket
slower ball dug in short outside off. Hangs back in the crease and slaps it towards long-on
yorker on leg stump. Nicely bowled. De Villiers can't get this flick away. Cops it on the pad and it deflects into the off side
offcutter, short of a length and wide outside off. Slices straight to short third man
short of a length and wide outside off, a nicely timed square drive finds sweeper cover
length ball just outside off. Shuffles and taps to deep midwicket
yorker on leg stump, jammed out to deep midwicket
leading edge goes over Morris. It's a back-of-the-hand slower ball that loops in at middle stump. De Villiers gets it on the full but he hasn't picked it. His flick ends up at mid-off
short ball angled in at the corridor. Mistimed pull, this time. But it's not aerial. Single at deep midwicket
short ball outside off, mistimed hook into the turf. Gets it out to deep midwicket
length ball angled into the stumps. Walks down the pitch and nudges to long-on on the up

can't stop the bleeding! Overpitched ball on the pads and Kohli merely leans into this, gets his body weight into the bat and closes the wrists at the last moment to caress this between deep square and deep midwicket
and now the sweep again! Nadeem tosses this right up, full and wide outside off. No sweeping from there, right? Wrong. AB shuffles and swats it even harder this time to beat deep midwicket

stunning! A back foot punch after forcing the bowler to bowl short with the sweep last ball. It's on middle stump and he's promptly back in the crease - right back - to get this between deep midwicket and long-on
length ball outside off, gets a big stride in and sweeps against the turn to bisect deep square and deep midwicket
short of a length outside off, driven uppishly to sweeper cover off the back foot
hits Pant's right knee and is nearly run out. Kohli looking to run this late cut fine, is already running down the pitch. But Pant has stuck a leg out and nearly gets this to deflect onto the stumps
length ball angled in at leg stump, gets on the back foot and taps it to deep midwicket
short and wide outside off. Steps out and swats at it but can't make connection
length ball on middle stump, flicked on the up to midwicket's left but can't beat his dive

just clears Vijay Shankar at deep square leg! Oh that's really close. Length ball lifting up at him as he walks into it. Whips his wrists at this to pick it up. Shankar sprints to his left and puts in a big leap to his left - and he's a tall man - but he can't get a hand on this
bouncer dug in very shot. Gets big on Kohli and he ducks under it
beats the outside edge. Back of a length ball outside off and he jabs at it on the angle. But it holds itself in the pitch and jags away
length ball outside off, driven firmly on the up to mid-off
oh what a shot! Length ball curving in at leg stump and he opens up his body and wrists so nicely to make room and go over extra cover with the turn
shot. Length ball on middle and he gets down nice and early to swat this behind square with a nicely connected sweep
length outside off, cut straight to cover

horrendous running and De Kock has ended up sacrificing his wicket. There is no run there. De Kock thinks so, but his no either isn't accepted or isn't heard, as Kohli keeps taking strides down the pitch as he watches the ball roll towards backward point. In the end, Kohli is halfway down, De Kock is stranded and he crosses over to give his wicket away

outside edge past slip! Oh Nadeem will think about this all night if Kohli makes runs today! He's beaten him in flight, got the ball to turn away from length outside off and induced an edge.  Slip is very very wide and that's four
short of a length and in at middle stump, gets on the back foot and punches to deep midwicket
length on off stump, steps out and jams it out to mid-on

short_text: Maxwell to de Kock, no run
long_text: short of a length outside off, cut to point

short_text: Maxwell to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: nailed it. Length ball fired into the pads and De Kock is down on it quickly for a clean swing from under. Sends it over the long leg boundary with this sweep
length on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket off the front foot
short of a length and slow outside off. Steps out and drops it in front of point with soft hands

short_text: Maxwell to de Kock, no run
long_text: length ball floated in at off stump, defended towards point off the outside half
length ball in at leg stump. Leans in and taps to mid-on on the up
length on leg stump, tapped to deep square's left off the back foot
full and in at leg stump. Walks down and clips it to deep square
short of a length just outside off, walks into it and runs it down to third man
length ball swinging away wide outside off, taps on the up to sweeper cover
good length outside off with some late swing inwards. No feet as Kohli looks to drive through the cover, well away from the body. Gets an inside edge onto pad

nervous Roy at deep backward square. Looks like he's held on! Vohra stops halfway through a sweep against a leg side ball. It's a top edge that hangs up teasingly for Roy who might have lost it early on in the air because he looked very nervous as he ran in. But he manages to get down quickly and he has his fingers around the ball
short of a length at leg stump, glanced uppishly to short fine
length ball spins down leg side and past his attempted flick
back of a length just outside off, defended towards midwicket off the back foot
length ball on middle stump, shuffles and nudges it uppishly towards deep backward square
length on off stump, pushed in front of cover point with soft hands

short_text: Maxwell to de Kock, no run
long_text: short and wide outside off. Comes on slowly and he can't get power on the cut. It's a tap to point in the end

huuuuuuge appeal for lbw but the umpire isn't swayed by it. Beautiful bowling from Boult, pitching up to the new batsman, getting the ball to curl into him late. Vohra is not at all ready for the fiendish delivery. He tries to play a shot into the leg side and possibly gets an inside edge? Cause otherwise that kinda looks plumb
full on leg stump, de Kock takes care not to hit across the line and finds a single at mid-on

short_text: Boult to de Kock, no run
Boult to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: pristine hit! The on the up drive works perfectly, showing how well this new ball is coming onto the bat. All de Kock does is open the face to beat cover on his right

short_text: Boult to de Kock, no run
long_text: back of a length on off stump, punches it into the covers

short_text: Boult to de Kock, no run
long_text: full on middle, with a hint of away swing. De Kock does well to present a straight bat
full and outside off, looks for a slash, only gets a bottom edge to the wicketkeeper

pretends to make room outside leg. The bowler lands it around the yorker outside off. Tewatia jumps in line with it, gets low, and scoops it over fine leg. Also, while running down the pitch, trying to take a single. he collides with Anderson

taken at long-on. Pant has produced some sensational shots. He looks for another, against a slower ball outside off, but this time it comes right off the bottom of the bat. Goes high instead of long and AB de Villiers takes a striaghtforward catch
spots the left-hander switching his stance for a reverse scoop and so plants the ball over the wide line to keep it out of Pant's reach
runs down the pitch and decimates a length ball over long-on. That's travelled!
slow, full, on leg stump. Tewatia looks for the sweep, makes no contact, has to settle for a leg bye

now the other side, walking across his stumps to make sure he can scoop a slower short ball outside off over short fine leg's head. Pant is giving the Daredevils a total well beyond their wildest dreams when they were 28 for 2 after the Powerplay

what the weirdness  Woakes is looking for the wide yorker. Misses his mark by about two inches. And Pant is waiting, crouched in his stance, the bat face open, and at the perfect time, unleashes a scoop over third man

walks across and swipes at a short ball, looking for the long leg boundary. Ends up with a miscue over the wicketkeeper. Comes off the thigh pad. Fifty partnership in 20 balls. Pant has made 41 of those
the perfect wide yorker. Inside the line, but too far from the reach of the batsman
looks to carve the short ball over point, but there isn't quite enough room for him to do so.
full and outside off stump, Pant monsters it over cover. It's bat speed again. He sees the chance to free the arms and he holds absolutely nothing back. RCB leaking runs in the death again
half-volley on leg stump, Pant flicks it handsomely to deep midwicket

pumps it down the ground! This is a back of a length ball. And he unleashes a front foot lofted drive. That's tough to pull off. His bottom-hand strength and bat swing must be insane; has to be to get under the ball, and make contact with the middle of the bat and not the high part of it.
goes short on middle, Pant lets it go and then goes around yelling at himself.
slower ball and a premeditating Pant, looking to slog sweep the ball, is beaten soundly. Only problem is the umpire decides he's strayed too far outside off
full and outside off, he bangs it back down the ground and Siraj is in the way
low full toss in line with the stumps, but Pant somehow flicks it over the square leg boundary, despite there being a man positioned to take a catch
looks for the yorker on leg stump and refuses Pant the room to get under the ball. Ends up having to settle for a leg bye

fifty! And it comes off a very good shot - largely because he picks the slower ball, then the most vulnerable part of the field and exploits both. Pull shot past short fine leg. Oh wait, maybe I am overselling it. The shot comes off an inside edge. Sorry!
falls short of cover - which is where Siraj is at now. The ball has it in for him. Tewatia goes gung ho again at a full delivery
runs back, leaps up, sticks a hand out, but the ball evades mid-off! Tough break for Siraj, and even worse, it runs away to the boundary. Mis-hit loft from Tewatia
shortish, cramping him on leg stump. Pant, even as he tries to make room, ends up pushing to cover
beats him with a length ball outside off. Looks like he gets just enough away movement off it.
he's aiming for third man, gets a thick outside edge to a good length ball outside off, and it works in his favour as the ball scurries away to the boundary

lbw appeal is turned down. Looking to ramp it fine this time as Chahal fires in what looks like a seam-up ball on leg stump. It's full and fast and catches him on the leg, but the umpire says no. Probably pitching outside
reverse-swat clears the third man boundary! It's a short of a length ball and Pant swivels quickly before having to really drag this using his forearms. Manages it somehow and clears the line

beats him in flight and is probably excited for a while before he remembers which ground this is. Pant with a big heave at this loopy length ball googly outside off. Miscues it completely but that's sailed over long-off

Siraj runs to his right and lunges to hold on at short third man. Maxwell is done by Chahal's slowness. It's tossed right up at a length outside off, and he looks to go over square on the off side with a reverse sweep. Ends up slicing it because he's through the shot too early. An indifferent season continues to go badly for Maxwell. Royal Challengers, like most teams, will be happy to see him gone in the 16th over
good length outside off, deep in the crease as he taps this to long-off
back of a length and pushed through. Leg stump line and he gets on the back foot to punch to deep midwicket

Pant is struck above his back knee as this tails away from him when he tries to slog it. He's on the floor. In the mean time, RCB are reviewing for lbw. It was given not out. Possibly pitching outside leg. No doubt with line otherwise I'd say yes, pitching well outside leg. Woeful review. Pant's back on his feet. On we go.
full toss on off stump, shovels it straight to midwicket. Missed out
attempted slower ball is pushed very wide. It's also quite short
length ball just outside off. A short-arm pull as this skids on. Febbly rolls out to long-on
length ball just outside off, defended into the covers off the back foot

just misses the stumps as Maxwell goes on the back foot again. It's an inside edge that trickles past the stumps. De Kock then runs in and takes aim at the non-striker's stumps. Hits the stumps too but Maxwell is safe, as the replays confirm. He's also come back for a second
length ball on leg stump, stays tall in the crease and chips this to deep square's right
length ball on off stump, gets on the back foot and tickles it to short fine off the inside edge. That came on quicker than he anticipated

thick outside edge to short third man. It's almost like he's a fast bowler. Fires it full and wide outside off - almost past the wide marker. Iyer reaches out again but this one is drifting away and he won't be able to get it into the leg side. It lobs straight to the fielder there
length ball floated up at middle, sweeps along the floor to long leg
full toss on middle stump, flicks to deep midwicket
fifty for Iyer, and this one is fetched from wide outside off. Length and across him. He reaches a long way and drags it wide of deep midwicket as he clears the boundary to his left

see ya! Sundar skids a short of a length ball at the pads from around the wickets and Iyer drops all the technique training he's done through his life and swings wildly to send it a long way over deep midwicket
launches it down the ground! He spots a half-volley, and this time takes great pains to get under the ball and secure the elevation needed to clear the boundary
shortish on off stump, knocks it down to point
clears the front leg and laces the length ball on middle stump over extra cover. Amazing shot
back of a length and outside off, he looks to power it away square on the off side. No contact
is he trying to leave or ramp or pull? Ends up doing half of each shot and sends the short ball to midwicket
carves the back of a length delivery down to deep third man
pushes it through on leg stump, Pant looks to pull it away but makes contact with only thigh pad
another simple flick to long-on. Looks like Daredevils have instructions not to over-extend themselves
full on leg stump, he shimmies down the pitch and clips through midwicket
works a shortish delivery from outside off to the right of long-on
gets forward to block behind third man
knocks a back of a length delivery on off stump to long-on
mid-off is up and Pant drills the wide half-volley down the ground like a pro
full and wide, he nails it through the covers. Chahal does well sweeping that boundary
chops the back of a length ball down to deep third man
now he has room and he slashes the short ball away to deep point
tries to make room, but Woakes doesn't allow such shenanigans. Pant only ends up cutting the ball to point
slashes as hard as he can through the line of a good length ball outside off. No connection
gets down the track, to the pitch of a good length ball on leg stump, and works it to long-on
another block into the off side for a single
blocks to cover point and jogs across to the other end
gets across on off stump and sends a good length ball away to deep square leg
lets the ball come to him, meeting it under his eyes for a flick to the left of midwicket
tosses it up from around the wicket on middle stump. Pant tucks it to midwicket

jeez, that's outrageous! it's a half-volley on leg stump and Iyer treats it fairly kindly. All he does is flick the ball. Some other-worldly force takes it over the boundary at midwicket. And we have a time out to figure out just what happened there
top work from Mandeep at point, diving to his left to stop a cut shot that might rival a bazooka for power
not quite enough room so Iyer plays within himself, gliding the short ball down to third man
superb timing! He stands up tall against the short and wide delivery and slaps it to the left of the fielder in the deep.
hammers the short and wide delivery as ferociously as he could to deep point
effortlessly flicks a length ball on off stump to deep midwicket. Touch of class in that.
full on middle and off, Pant shuffles across his stumps and turns it to midwicket
full and outside off, blocks through cover point
he's very wary of slow deliveries in line with the stumps. Waits until it gets to him, uses soft hands, angles the face and taps the ball gently to point
gets down low and muscles the full ball on middle stump to the point boundary - with a reverse sweep. Very tough shot to pull off but he does it so very well
goes around the wicket to the left-hander and even Sundar - who rarely gets the ball to move sideways - is beating the edge with turn.
good length on off stump, he dabs it behind point
flicks a very full ball on leg stump to deep square leg
fullish on off stump, he smashes it back to the bowler
it's all about ticking the singles over now as Pant too glides a back of a length delivery behind point
short and outside off, Iyer slices it to deep third man
opens the face and makes sure the short ball outside off is run past point's right
shortish and outside off, he glides it to point
turns a good length ball - which turns sharply again - to short fine leg
makes room and cuts the short ball away to the cover boundary. Super shot. Plenty of bottom hand power

knocks over leg stump! Sensational bowling from Chahal. After sowing doubts with big turning legbreaks, he sends down the flipper. Very quick, a shade short, on leg stump, tempting the batsman to back away and cut and beating him for pace. So Chahal is not just turning the ball off the pitch, but skid on too.
third time beaten! And this is huge turn! Chahal pitches it on middle. Roy is uncertain as he pushes forward. He could have had a bat as broad as five feet and he would still have missed it
neatly nudges a good length ball off middle stump to deep midwicket
it's a short ball, giving him the room to free his arms, but Iyer finds short midwicket with a mistimed pull
drives on the up and gets an outside edge away to third man
back of a length and outside off, slaps it through point. No boundaries for four overs and suddenly two in the space of three balls
stands up tall again and nudges the short ball to midwicket
gets up with the short ball on middle and deftly turns it around the corner to fine leg. Simple

opens the face to try and find some runs behind point. There are none and so Roy is sent back. Mandeep hits the stumps direct and they pinch a single off the overthrow. Then the man backing up hits the stumps direct at the non-strikers now. Two perfect throws, no wickets
full and outside off, drives to mid-off
panics and goes for a reverse sweep, even those last-ditch measures don't work. Chahal reads the batsman perfectly, bowls on middle and leg, not allowing Roy the room he needs to work the ball

rips it past the outside edge again! Beautiful bowling from the leggie. He loops it up on middle, draws Roy forward, gets pretty decent purchase off the pitch and leaves Roy looking utterly bewildered
hangs back and whips a shortish delivery through midwicket
shimmies down the track, but Chahal spots it early, pulls his length back, and doesn't give any room. Roy tries a flick and is hit on the pads. All he can get is a leg bye
shifts himself leg side of a tossed up ball on middle and drives into the covers
slows it down this time, letting the ball drift into the pads. This time the ball slides through without turning to the wicketkeeper

massive turn and is it enough to stump him?. He pushes it through on leg stump, demanding Roy to hit against the turn. The batsman tries, he's beaten all ends up, but the good thing is, his back leg did not lift up off the crease.
changes tactics and uses soft hands to bunt the back of a length ball towards point for a single
slower ball, in line with the stumps, Roy tries to force it through midwicket. No luck
nails the backfoot cover drive, but finds the fielder again.
full on middle and leg, he flicks to midwicket

top-edges the pull and Umesh strikes early again! It's a short ball, Gambhir tries to drag it from outside off. It gets a bit big on him. The bat face turns in his hand. The ball has no timing on it as it goes up and Chahal jogs back at square leg to take an easy catch
full and outside off, spears it to mid-off
spears in a yorker, at the base of middle stump. Gambhir does well to yank his feet out of the way and bring a vertical bat down to find a single through square leg
swats a back of a length delivery outside off down to long-on

slower bouncer - and it's very well executed too. Gambhir spots the length early but not the change in pace. He's into the pull shot and though he tries to adjust his bat swing, he misses the ball and it goes off his body towards point
lovely work from the captain, waiting that little bit extra to turn a ball that is on his pads far enough behind square leg for a couple of runs
good length ball outside off, Gambhir goes for an on-the-up drive over mid-off. No connection

flattens the stumps with a blistering straight drive. He sees the ball in his half, lunges forward gleefully and presents the full face of the bat. Woakes would be thrilled those wooden things were stuck where they were
gets off his toes to nudge the shortish delivery off middle stump to midwicket
rippah! Umesh hits the deck and makes the new ball jag away past the outside edge. Gambhir is stuck in his crease, he's pushing at the ball nervously, he's easily beaten
nice and tight on middle, Gambhir works it off his knees to midwicket
good length, outside off, Gambhir looks to slash it through the off side, can't make contact

inside edge as Roy attempts to punch through the covers. His front foot moving so little hampers those plans and the ball ends up wandering away to square leg. On another day, he might even have been bowled
back of a length and outside off, Roy lets it go. There is some outswing which gives merit to the one slip in place

short_text: Tom Curran to Gayle, SIX runs
long_text: It's all over! Full on off, and that's been mistimed over the bowler's head. Backed away to smack this straight, but came off the blade's toe end. Doesn't matter though, as it has enough to clear the long-on boundary. Kings XI Punjab win by nine wickets
low full toss on leg stump. Gayle taps it down the ground to long on. He'll keep strike. Kings XI need five off 12 balls

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Gayle, no run
long_text: quick! Good length on off and angling across Gayle. He tries to slap this over cover, but misses completely. Wild, wild shot

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Gayle, no run
long_text: slower ball on middle stump. Stays on the back foot, and defends it back to Mavi

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Gayle, no run
long_text: almost chops on! Good length on off, and Gayle tries to punch it past cover. Takes an inside edge and almost onto his stumps
yorker outside leg stump, and Gayle does well to shuffle across to the off side. Extras

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Gayle, no run
long_text: toe crusher on leg stump, but Gayle does well to get his feet out of the ball's way, and defends with soft hands
full outside off, and driven with the bat's open face to the man in the deep
good length on middle stump, and spinning across Gayle. Defended off the back foot to the bowler. Kings XI need 9 off 18 balls
good length on middle stump, taps it to square leg for a walking single
holes out to deep midwicket! Short on middle, and Rahul top-edges the pull! Curran gets under it, and dives forward to take the catch
good length, and wide outside of again. Rahul goes deep into the crease and crunches this boundary behind point
good length, but wide outside off. Rahul comes dancing down the wicket and slaps it past extra cover on this occasion. Delightful
fifty for Rahul too! Back of a length on off stump, and Rahul opens his stance to swing towards the leg side. Flat pull over deep midwicket
full and wide outside leg stump. Gayle tries to slog-sweep, but misses. Hits his front leg, but impact's outside leg
good length on leg stump. He stays on the back foot, and fends it back to Chawla
quicker ball! Good length on middle and zipping right through to the keeper
low full toss on off, and he wastes no time to get to his fifty! Smacks this over Rahul's head, and the ball lands in the crowd
full on off stump, and Gayle's slog sweeps this over Rahul's head. Looked like he sliced it, and that's flying over long on. Pure muscle
full just outside off. Turns into Rahul, and he opens his bat's face to drive towards point
full on off and coming into Rahul's pads. Whipped off his toes to cow corner for a single
full outside off, and driven well to cover. A shame that shot earned no run
good length on leg stump, and spinning into Gayle's body. Punched to long on for a walking single
good length on off, and spinning into the batsman. Turned off his pads to square leg
good length, just outside off. Rahul tries to cut but misses completely. Extra bounce takes it to the keeper
good length outside off, and that's cut off the back foot to point
good length outside off, and spinning away from Gayle. Punched uppishly, but falls short of cover
full on middle, and he walks across to the off side to sweep. Played to fine leg
almost a yorker on the fourth-stump line. Gayle muscles this down the ground to long on
overpitched wide outside off, and that's just too easy for CHG. Gets down on one knee, and swats this over long-on
good length on middle stump, and spinning away from Rahul. Turned off his pads to square leg
starts off with a half-tracker on middle, and Rahul sends that into the deep midwicket boundary. Pulled off the back foot with disdain
advances down the ground and punches to long-on
that's four more. A leg-side back of a length ball and Rahul just turns around and places it through fine leg
short of a length, not much turn away from him, and Rahul directs a pull to deep fine leg as he shifts across and moves languidly
slapped away towards cover-point where Uthappa moves to his left to make a diving stop
blindly swipes across the angle as Chawla slides this googly across him and gets him beaten
advances down the ground and flicks this flatter delivery through midwicket
ruins a good over with a leg-side fuller delivery that Gayle gets down and sweeps through backward square leg
good length outside off, jams the bat down and blocks into the off side
back of a length, spinning away, punched to point off the backfoot
shifts back to a length ball and punches to cover
length, spins away, punched to cover
length ball, waits on the backfoot to long-on

ah, how rushed was Gayle there? Rana just fires this in at pace on Gayle's off-stump and the batsman backs away and just about manages to bring the bat down. A fraction of a second late, and he would have been gone. Imagine if the wicket had fallen that delivery! What a strange combination of circumstances that would have been to help KKR
this one's shorter still and Gayle backs away even further.. Doesn't manage to get on top of it entirely, but manages to cart it over deep backward point
teases Russell by foxing him into thinking he may come down the track but in reality just backs away to a slower delivery and slaps it away through point
full around off, clipped to mid-on
flicked off the hips to deep midwicket
full on middle and off, right within his swinging arc, and Gayle deposits it over cow corner with a clean swing of the arms. Off the inside part of the bat but he has so much power in those arms

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Rahul, SIX runs
long_text: short, outside off, Rahul gets on top of the bounce and hammers a pull over deep backward square leg
short ball, forces him to arch back with pace and no room,Gayle does well to control his shot through midwicket

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Gayle, FOUR runs
long_text: a healthy inside edge. This one again tails away after pitching around middle and off, and Gayle drills it away through midwicket

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Gayle, no run
long_text: length ball, angled across, stays rooted to the crease as he swings and misses

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Gayle, FOUR runs
long_text: smokes it over the in-field after getting the front leg out of the way. Lifted from front of off over extra cover
back of a length, cuts into him,tucked behind square
back of a length, drifts down the leg side
short, pitches down the leg side, and Gayle gets over it
full, angled across, Gayle jams the bat down and gets beaten

ah, shot! Not often do you see Gayle collect boundaries with just timing and placement but this is one of those rare moments. Not a whole lot of movement of the feet but he has gorgeously placed thus fuller one through cover and point
length ball, tucked through square leg
short of a length on off, gets a little big on him as he shifts back in his crease and then opens the face of the bat a tad to place it through third man
sharp swing away from the right-hander, but look at that for a shot. Rahul gets a long stride across to cover for all the movement and then leans into a drive as he caresses it through covers

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Gayle, no run
long_text: that's the best of the lot. On a length and subtle movement off the deck as he nearly shaves Gayle's outside edge

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Gayle, no run
long_text: short of a length, drifts away a long way and has him beaten

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Gayle, no run
long_text: top stuff! Pitches it right up to Gayle and then gets it to swing away. Luckily for Gayle, he had his bat well inside the line
short of a length, cutting in, off the inside of the bat to square leg

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Rahul, FOUR runs
long_text: beautiful shot! Width on offer, and Rahul meets the pitch with half a stride forward and then uses his arms to punch it through cover and point

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Rahul, FOUR runs
long_text: ah, streaky! Curves in a long way from a length and finds the inside edge of Rahul as he strides forward and screams away to the fine leg boundary
drops the length this time. Good length on off stump, and Gill comes dancing down the wicket. Tapped towards cover, and they complete the single. Knight Riders finish on 191 for 7
yes, they can! Full on off stump, and Chawla drives it over the non-striker's head to long off. What an excellent final over from Tye. Can he finish off well?
full just outside off, and Gill drills this down the ground to long on. They can't take the second, so Chawla's back on strike
poor from Mujeeb! Drops this at short third man. It was slow and short outside off, and Chawla tried to ramp it over short third man. Slices it, but a lazy effort from Mujeeb
full and wide outside off, and takes the pace off the delivery. He's forced to reach at it, but can't get bat to ball. The umpire, however, thinks it's a wide
Yorker outside off stump, and Curran sticks his bat out. Takes a thick outside edge, and goes straight and flat to short third man. Even the fielder is surprised, by the looks of it

short_text: Tye to Tom Curran, no run
long_text: slower ball to start the over. Full outside off, and Curran's slog towards the leg side doesn't come off. Through to Rahul on the bounce

short_text: Barinder Sran to Tom Curran, 1 run
long_text: good length on middle, but angling across Curran. Carves it off the back foot to Mujeeb at deep point
rolls his fingers over this one again, and this time DK's leg-side heave has been taken in the deep. Deceived by the (lack of) pace, and Tye at deep backward square does the rest
goes full and wide but it's way too wide, actually. DK pulls out of the shot and earns a free run

full on off and slightly swinging away. Gill drives to short extra cover but DK's halfway down the wicket! Ashwin has a shy at the stumps, but misses, which therefore allows them to take the single anyway
rolls his fingers over this one, and that's been flat-batted over the bowler's head. In fact, it comes off the toe end of the bat, and that perhaps, saves him. Lands well short of Finch at long on
slower ball, and full outside leg stump. Gill tries to play it fine, but can only clip it to the man inside the circle
slower ball on leg stump, and angling across the batsman. Tapped with soft hands to point for a walking single. Gets Gill back on strike
full and wide outside off, and Gill's showing his class tonight. Slaps this off the front foot, and drills it to the extra-cover boundary
rolls his fingers over the ball, so takes the pace off. Good length outside off, and comfortably punched to wide long off for a couple
awry delivery! Waist-high on middle stump and goes down the leg side. More extras
short and wide outside off, but way too wide reckons the umpire
late inswing, and yorks the batsman on off stump. Does well to dig it back to the bowler
good length, and outside off again. Carved off the back foot to Mujeeb at short third man
sliced like butter! Good length, and slow outside off. DK once again stays late on the back foot and simply opens his bat's face to this offcutter. Played between the keeper and short third man

deft! Good length, and just outside off. DK stays on the back foot and opens his bat's face. Glanced to short third-man, but the fielder's dive is poor. Hits his hand, but races away for a boundary thereafter

short_text: Barinder Sran to Gill, FOUR runs
long_text: first-ball four! Delightful shot to get off the mark. Good length outside off, and he rides the bounce to cut it past point. Just as it happens oh-so-often, the extra ball hurts the bowling team

drilled to long off, but taken! Big wicket for Sran. Full on off, and Russell tries to slog it down the ground. It's hit very hard, but too flat. Karun Nair - at long off - runs to his right and sticks his hands out
good length outside leg stump, and Russell does well to shuffle across to the off side. Shoulders his arms but earns an extra run

short_text: Barinder Sran to Russell, FOUR runs
long_text: slower ball, and wide outside leg stump. Allows Russell to actually adjust, swivel, and then smash this pull fine behind square

short_text: Barinder Sran to Russell, FOUR runs
long_text: low full toss on leg stump, but all Russell has to do is get bat to ball. He simply check-drives down the ground and that's good enough for the ball to beat long off to the boundary. Sheer power
good length on middle stump, DK stays on the back foot. Punches it down the ground to long on
excellent yorker to start the over. Aimed at his toes, and all Russell can do is nudge it to Mayank at deep midwicket
slow and short again. On the fourth-stump line, and DK misses the pull shot. The ball, once again, goes over his blade and through to Rahul on the bounce
low full toss on off stump, and Russell taps it with hard hands towards cow corner. He's off the mark
slower ball, short outside off. Russell has to wait ages before the ball comes to him, and he misses the cut completely. Bounces over Russell's blade, and through to Rahul on the bounce
short ball on off stump, but stays terribly low! Defended off the back foot

bottom-edged to the keeper! The knuckle ball earns him the wicket. Full and wide outside off, and Lynn actually followed him to the off side, but the ball's too low and it takes a feather edge. An excellent innings comes to an end
back of a length on off, and DK opens his bat's face to run it down to short third man. Lynn scampers across to the danger end
good length on off, but once again legspin from Ashwin. Lynn stays on the back foot and drags a shot towards cow corner. Two men in the deep, and one of them cut it off
good length, but wide outside off. Lynn goes deep and cuts this square to Sran in the deep. Good effort by him, but did his boot - while sliding - touch the rope? Yes, it did
full on off, and it's the legspinner. Turns away from the batsman, who nudges it to midwicket with soft hands
full on off stump, and that's been thumped down the ground to long off
full outside off, and that front-foot drive has been drilled to deep extra cover
full and wide outside off, stays slightly low but DK chooses to cut again. Hit well, but straight to point
full and wide outside off. Tried the legspinner but it didn't come off. Too wide, reckons the ump
good length just outside off, and drilled off the back foot to deep extra cover. Enough time to jog back for the second run. They'll get some time to recover as well. It's the time out
drilled in full and fast on leg stump. Lynn tries to slog-sweep but misses. Hits his front leg, but impact's outside the stumps. First dot ball in 21 deliveries!
good length outside off, and DK cuts this hard to Ashwin at point. The fielder dives to his right and stops with one hand
good length on off, but spins sharply inwards. Lynn opens his bat's face and runs it fine. Stopped by Rajpoot, but wait, it slips through his hands. The misfield allows them to steal the run
good length just outside off, and he punches down the ground to long off
excellently played! Good length on off, but angling into DK. He gets down on one knee, and muscles this pull behind square leg. Hit fine enough to beat deep square leg

dropped at deep extra cover! Short outside off, and this time Lynn's luck almost ran out. Cut it over the infield, but top-edged to the man in the deep. His diving effort just isn't good enough as the ball pops out of his hand. Barinder Sran the guilty party there
sticking with the short ball, and it's wide outside off again. DK taps it to point, but the throw has no one backing up. Allows them to collect the extra run
goes short again, and Lynn goes chasing after it. Too wide, and this time his slap-shot takes the bottom edge towards short third man
short and wide outside off, and Lynn's forced to reach at it. Cuts it anyway, and manages to get it over the infield. Beats the man at deep extra cover too!
knuckle ball on middle, but it's on a good length. Comes into Lynn's body, and he simply gets his front foot out of the way to tonk it over long on! 103 metres
full on off stump, and tapped comfortably towards wide long on for a walking single
short and wide outside off, but Lynn can't put it away. Bottom-edges this flat-batted shot to long off. Fifty for Lynn!
good length just outside off, and he backs away to carve it towards deep extra cover
good length on off, and allows Lynn to free his arms again. Bunts it down the ground to the man at long off

half-tracker outside off, and Lynn flat-bats it straight past Yuvraj! He tried to get his hands to it, but did well to not get his fingertips to it. That would've stung. Crashes into the long-off boundary
tossed up, and wide outside off. Big stride in from DK and driven past extra cover to the man in the deep
good length, but wide outside off. DK simply sticks his bat out and ramps it just past the keeper's gloves. Minimal contact, and that helps him play it fine again
flatter ball on off stump, but DK simply drives it past Ashwin's left to long off. He'll keep strike
full on leg stump, and worked off his pads to the area near square leg once again. No one there, and Nair has a lot of ground to make up from the deep
full just outside off, and that's been clipped off his pads to square leg. Vacant area there so that allows DK to take the second

full on off, and the offspinner has been turned off his pads to midwicket. Just a simple flick, and the power behind his wrists come into play this time. Caressed towards cow corner, and beats both men in the deep
tossed up outside off, and that's put away by DK! Takes a big stride forward and heaves this over midwicket. Slog swept despite the man in the deep
full just outside off, Karthik opens his bat's face and glances it towards backward point
good length outside off, and he rocks back to punch towards deep extra cover
flighted full outside off, and Karthik defends off the front foot towards the off side

miscommunication! Good-length on off stump, and Rana's cramped for space. Still tries to cut, but straight to backward point. Rajpoot collects and throws at the keeper's end, but Rana's halfway down the track. Lynn took a few steps forward but quickly said no to the single, but it was all too late
overpitched on middle and leg, and Rana chooses to defend off the front foot. Proper stride from the batsman before fending it back
good length, and just outside off stump. Spins away from Lynn on this occasion, and it's been fended past the non-striker
full, and very wide outside off. Forces Rana to reach at it, but still chooses to sweep it to deep midwicket
carrom ball! Half-tracker on off, but gets big on Lynn. Forced to defend off the back foot, but played rather uncomfortably. Was slightly in the air, but dropped well short of Ashwin
full on middle and leg, and Rana clips it off his toes to square leg. Easily negated
good length on off, and punched down the ground to long on for a single. The field's spread out now
good length on off, but this is the legspinner. Lynn shuffles across to the off side and flicks it to square leg
full on off, and he comes down the wicket. Tapped to long off for a walking single

, and the time-out comes with a break in concentration! Good length on middle, and Uthappa goes for the big one first up. Rocks back and tries to pull, but has no elevation behind that shot. Straight to deep midwicket. Fifth time Ashwin gets Uthappa in ten T20 matches

short_text: Barinder Sran to Lynn, SIX runs
long_text: slower ball from Sran, picked up way too early. It's a leg side line, and Lynn gets the front leg out of the way and mows it over backward square leg. The most expensive KXIP over this season

short_text: Barinder Sran to Lynn, no run
long_text: slower length ball, opens the face to backward point

short_text: Barinder Sran to Lynn, SIX runs
long_text: that's another huge shot. A front-foot pull from Lynn to a length ball, and it's deposited well over midwicket. A 97-meter six

short_text: Barinder Sran to Lynn, FOUR runs
long_text: off the low part of the bat. Those are the perils you make yourself vulnerable to when you stay away from the line so much. But he has enough power to make up for it as he slaps it hard through cover and point
short of a length outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man

short_text: Barinder Sran to Uthappa, SIX runs
long_text: shot! Too short from Sran, and angled across Uthappa just enough to give him the room to free his arms. Gets on top of the bounce around off, and shovels a pull over backward square leg
short of a length and spinning in, flicked to square leg
floated up outside off, Lynn whips it from outside off through backward of square leg
fullish length, spins in from outside off, and Uthappa flicks to midwicket
flat and on a length, flicked out to deep midwicket
stays back to a length ball and tucks it to midwicket
short of a length, outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man for one
slower, short, and angled into him, Uthappa pulls it through backward of square leg with a well-controlled shot. That was the knuckle ball
fullish length outside off, slashes at it and drills it to cover
strides forward to a fullish length ball outside off, and Uthappa defends back with a neat stride forward
short, extra bounce outside off as he slashes and misses
well-done on the free-hit. In the blockhole and angled into Lynn as he whips it down to the cow corner region
begins with a no-ball, on a length that's tucked towards mid-on. Hang on, he's got his foot well inside the line. That's a horrid call from the umpire. Tye jokingly asks if he can review it

short_text: Barinder Sran to Lynn, no run
long_text: short ball, lots of width, Lynn can't capitalise because he's standing miles away from it, somewhere outside the leg-stump. Reaches out for a slap and barely knocks it to the cover and point reigon

short_text: Barinder Sran to Lynn, no run
long_text: slower ball, angled well across off, no feet from Lynn as he swings early and misses

short_text: Barinder Sran to Lynn, no run
long_text: short ball that gets up sharply and quickly, Lynn tries to pull but it's just too quick for him

short_text: Barinder Sran to Lynn, FOUR runs
long_text: short ball, slower that pitches outside leg, Lynn backs away and heaves it over the backward square leg region

short_text: Barinder Sran to Lynn, no run
long_text: fullish length, angled across off, drilled hard into the covers
short of a length, pitches outside leg, flicked behind square leg
flat and full around off, turns it away to midwicket
full on the pads, flicked through midwicket
tries to bowl it quicker on the pads and slides it down the leg side
goes for the same variation but this time it's on a length, and Uthappa is able to shift back and comfortably tuck through backward square leg
now the conventional sweep. The back-of-the-hand that spins in actually, and Uthappa sweeps through the fine leg boundary
length ball outside off, not much spin into hhim, and Uthappa gets down to split the short third man region with a reverse sweep
sliding into middle and leg, and brushes the pad as he tries to flick
