in lot more control this time around. Back of a length, angled into his leg stump, and all Lynn has to do is turn around and help it with a pull over backward square leg
short ball that completely tucks him up, Uthappa tries to force a pull and gets a top-edge that drops at the vacant spaces at the midwicket region
short ball, gets over a ducking Uthappa
ah, lovely! Got everything there apart from the edge. Invites him forward with a fullish one and gets it to curve away significantly to beat Uthappa pushing forward
short outside off, slapped to backward point
gets past Gayle at slip. Short of a length, shapes away, and Uthappa hangs his bat out to send an edge flying past Gayle, who doesn't quite leap as much. But it looked like a tough chance anyway
darts in a length ball at pace on middle, and Lynn defends back
short, flat, and spinning in, Lynn backs away and slaps it through point for four

in the air, and brilliant catch by Karun Nair. Looked for a moment as though this was the usual Narine, making merry against spin early on. It was a back-of-the-hand variant from Mujeeb, not quite the flipper, but it slides into Narine's pads, and he steps down the track and mows this over long-on. Nair moves to his right and slides in front to complete a brilliant catch
back of a length, slight turn away, Narine slaps it to point
back of a length, not much turn outside off, Lynn punches through mid-off without feet
back of a length, angled in at middle and leg, tucked to midwicket
length ball that tails away a tad late outside off, Lynn is a long way away from the line, and swings and misses
fullish, angled in at the pads, clipped to square leg
short of good length, gets on top of the bounce to flick to deep backward square leg
bangs in a back of a length delivery at middle and leg, and Narine flicks off the pads to deep backward square leg
back of a length, shaping away outside off, Lynn reaches out and pats it to deep backward point

it's all over! Karn finishes with two wickets to his name. Good length outside off, and once again zipping straight through. The No. 11 tries to cut, but all he can get is a feather edge. Comfortably done by thala Dhoni as Chennai Super Kings win by 64 runs!
crashes into middle stump! Tossed up on middle, and this is the topspin from Karn. Unadkat misses the slog, and the ball sneaks under his bat. Nine down now
swatted away to the mid-wicket boundary! Half-tracker on middle, and that's been pulled to the leg-side boundary
overpitched on off stump, and all the batsman can do is squeeze it away towards cover point
full on middle, and Gopal tries to whip this over cow corner. The bat turns in his hand, so the shot goes towards deep backward square instead
full on off, and angling into the right-hander. He backs away and carves it towards cover for a run
on off stump, and that's been comfortably flicked off the front foot to the gap on the leg side
good length just outside off, and Unadkat's cut comes off the bat's bottom. Trickles away towards short third man
full on off, and drilled down the ground to long off. No spin first ball
inside out over cover! Slightly extra air given this time, and the ball is lifted over the infield with disdain. Get Unadkat up the order!
half-tracker on off stump, and once again heaved towards the leg side off the back foot. Billings is positioned there at cow corner
good length on middle, and he swivels to whip it towards square leg
full on off stump, and Gopal comes walking down the wicket to tap it towards midwicket
good length outside off, and sharp legspin. Tries to slog-sweep, but top-edges it towards the leg side. Falls short of deep midwicket
good length on off, and that's been pulled along the ground to deep midwicket
extra short on off stump, and too easy for the tall Unadkat. Swats this pull, and the ball races away to the cow-corner boundary
good length on off, and Unadkat's in no position to pull. Misses the shot, and the ball hits his gut. Looks like it's taken the wind out of his system. Unadkat needs a moment to recover
full on middle stump, and he check drives over the bowler's head. Lands just short of mid off
Godly catch from Thakur! Short on off, and he tries to pull. The ball takes the top edge, and it's in the air for just a bit, as Thakur sprints, dives forward and then takes a one-handed stunner
good length on off stump. The batsman goes deep into his crease before defending off the back foot
full on off stump, and Binny muscles this past the non-striker to long on. CSK more than happy to give these singles
good length outside off, and Gopal opens his bat's face this time. Played to short third man
good length outside off, and Gopal's cut can only find the man at point
top edged to Dhoni! Short on off, and Gowtham tries to pull this over midwicket, but can only find the bat's edge. Great day for Watson
back of a length on off, but sticks with the slower ball again. Mistimes his pull to the man in the deep this time
deceived by the slower ball! Good length on the fourth-stump line, but Binny's through his cut shot too early
back of a length on middle stump. Backs away and cuts to backward point to get off strike
full on off, and that's been carved towards backward point. Chase for the fielder in the deep, which allows Binny to come back for the second

Tahir has the last laugh! Tossed up on middle, and Stokes has no option but to slog sweep. Connected well, but doesn't have the distance. It's the longer part of the boundary on the leg-side, and therefore perishes for 45
full outside off, and spinning further away. They're trying to push it wider for Stokes, but he's up to the challenge tonight. Lifted inside out over cover
good length on middle stump, rocks back and punches towards cover
full on off stump, and lifted over the non-striker. But man's there at long on
full on off, and spinning away from Stokes. Drilled down the ground to long off
the extra ball gets punished! Overpitched on leg stump, and Binny does well to clip if fine off his toes. Races away to the fine-leg boundary. Time out as well
overpitched on middle and leg, and Stokes comfortably flicks it off his pads to midwicket. Bravo keeping it tight
low full toss on off, but once again takes the pace off. Clipped off Binny's pads to deep midwicket for a walking single. CSK won't mid these
low full toss just outside off. Stokes simply pushes it towards wide long off for a single. Wants two, but sent back by Binny

full on off, and Tripathi goes for a wild leg-side heave. Tries to send it over deep midwicket, but comes off the bat's toe end. Billings, at cow corner, takes a few steps in front and completes the catch
goes short and fast, but misses his line. Pitches on leg stump, but down the leg side. Another run added to the extras column
back of a length on off stump. Stokes stays on his crease and punches off the back foot to cover
good length on off stump, and slapped past point to deep point. They're finding the men in the deep every time
full on middle and leg stump, and Tripathi comfortably taps it past the non-striker to Jadeja at long on
good length on leg stump, and spinning into Stokes. Worked off the back foot to midwicket on this occasion
full on middle stump, and this time Stokes thumps it past Tahir's left to long on. Two more runs collected

Tahir lets it go, and Rayudu misfields as well! Tossed up on middle, and Stokes smacks it straight past Tahir. He chooses not to get his hand behind it, but Rayudu - at long off - can't intercept either
good length on off, and spinning further away. Carved off the back foot to cover. Almost lost his balance there
full and wide outside off, trying to entice Stokes to go over the off side. He lets it go
slower ball, full on middle stump. All Tripathi can do is drive towards long on for a single

full on leg stump, and Tripathi misses the leg-side whip. The ball goes down the leg side for extras. Tripathi was out of his crease for a moment, and Dhoni took aim at the stumps. But Tripathi was in when the wickets were dislodged
slower ball, full outside off. Pushed by Stokes towards cover for just a single
full and wide outside off, but that's another slower ball from Bravo. Driven firmly, and with the bat's open face, to deep point again
full and straight on middle, Stokes takes a step forward and clips it off his toes to deep midwicket
another slower ball, full and wide outside off. Tripathi sticks his bat out and taps towards deep point

The DJ starts the party first ball! Offcutter, and short outside off. Buttler doesn't pick the pace up and tries to drag his pull. Takes the bat's toe end, goes in the air, and taken easily by first slip in the end. Royals spiraling downhill fast
tries to reverse sweep, but checks his shot. Full on leg stump, forcing Buttler to pull out of the shot. Still manages to play it towards the right-hander's cover area
half-tracker on off, and allows Stokes to flat-bat it past Tahir to long on. A loose delivery, that in all honestly, should've been deposited over cow corner
full and wide outside off, and Buttler bunts this down the ground to long off
flighted full and wide outside off. Stokes tries to drive away from his body and carves it to cover
gives it some air, and pitches full outside off. But Stokes backs away towards the leg side, and crunches this drive past extra cover!
full on middle stump, and that's been pushed to wide long on. Stokes wants two, but chooses not to eventually
low full toss wide outside off, driven straight to sweeper cover
inside edge dribbles out to fine leg. Offcutter coming in at the stumps from back of a length. He looks to cut through point
full and past the wide marker. Buttler was backing away to make room and let it go
short offcutter on leg stump again. Thigh-high. Pulled straight to square leg
poor ball, easy runs. Looks for the bouncer but he seems to be stuck halfway in an offcutter too. In the end it's a harmless ball on the hips and he swivels to drag this past short fine
short of a length outside off, slapped on the up to find sweeper cover
full outside off, leans in for a drive to long-off
nice. Classy from Buttler. To the pitch again. It's pushed flat at a leg stump line and he gets under it to launch it straight towards the sight screen
length on leg stump, steps out and shovels this on the up to deep midwicket's left. Stokes calls for a risky second and dives to make his ground
get out of the way, Stokes! Buttler steps out to meet this length ball on leg stump and thumps it back towards his partner who does superbly to get out of the way. Long-on won't get to it
length on off stump, tapped to deep midwicket off the back foot
floated up on a length at off stump. Clears the front leg and drags it out to deep midwicket off the inside half
full on off stump. Drilled back to the bowler on the bounce
beaten by an inswinger. This is a full toss swinging into the corridor. He looks to whip it but the ball has changed trajectory and beaten the inside edge

legcutter, back of a length outside off. Slapped powerfully towards extra cover where Rayudu is slow getting the barrier down and cops it right on the knee cap. You don't want a swelling there, it's awful he's going to limp off for some treatment oh no. He walks till the boundary line with the physio and changes his mind. Goes into deep midwicket
short of a length outside off, spanked on the up to sweeper cover
full on off stump, flicked to deep midwicket's right
length ball outside off, shuffles and flicks it between long-on and deep midwicket
bouncer. Dug in too short. He allows it to pass over his shoulder
knuckle ball. Fired down leg side. Buttler was exposing the stumps in readiness for the ramp, but this was far too wide to make a connection
slower ball on a length, just outside off. Shuffles and clips on the up to long-on
beaten. Some natural variation from the surface. Watson's offcutter holds it's line outside off and goes past the bat as Buttler looks to slap this over midwicket
length ball wide outside off. Dips in a touch, very late, as he lets this go
short of a length and wide outside off. Wafts at it and is beaten
short of a length on off stump. Steps out and cramps himself. Drives straight to extra cover
overpitched and slanted wide outside off. Leans in and drives off the toe-end to extra cover
slower ball, back of a length on leg stump and tapped on the up to mid-on
looks like another knuckle ball. At a length and slanted in at middle stump. Tapped wide of mid-on
slower offcutter, dropped short and moving past the back shoulder. Stokes lets it go
short of a length just outside off. Shuffles across and whips it to deep square

knuckle ball to the top of middle! Rahane stepping out, getting outside the line of the stumps on the leg side, and swiping aimlessly while swivelling as he's beaten by pace by this short of a length ball. An ugly hoick would be describing it accurately, but it's been induced by a superbly disguised ball
short and in the corridor. Not enough room on the cut. Rayudu fumbles at backward point and they sneak in a run
length ball slanted across off stump. Looks to bludgeon it through cover on the up but he's gone too hard at it. Splices along the floor into the infield
slower on a length outside off, taps it on the up to extra cover who is right back on the circle

short of a length on leg stump, walks at it and looks to whip it through the leg side. Cops it on the thigh guard ad is forced to quickly return to the crease as Thakur puts in a diving under-arm throw to hit the stumps
short of deep square. Well directed bouncer. Rahane picks it up in front of his helmet, with his weight going forward. Ends up slicing it, one bounce
good length just outside off, walks into it as it slants across the corridor and clips it through midwicket off the inside half of the bat. Rahane calls confidently for the third
good length wide outside off, left alone
short ball just outside off, taps it on the up to cover point. Raina there. Has a shy at the non-striker's stumps, hits it too, and allows them a run off the deflection

picks out deep square! Once again, Samson struggles to get on top of a short ball. He's shadow-practicing rolling the bat over it as he walks off, but was nowhere near in position to do that as this short one skidded in towards his underarm. Got it off the high part of the bat and Karn Sharma snaps up a simple one
chips it wide of midwicket and deep square leg cleans up to his left. It's a bouncer at chest height and he gets under it on the hook
length on leg stump, early on the flick and he ends up chipping it past the square leg umpire
length on middle stump, shuffles and nudges it between the big space between long-on and deep square

there is a review this time from CSK. Knuckle ball cuts in and hits Rahane on the back flap after appearing to beat the inside edge as he looks to flick. It's pitched outside off and come in not too bad on line. But it won't matter - it has got a bit of the inside edge. The review is lost.
a bit of wobble in the corridor. He gets nicely behind the line and taps on the up to mid-off

full on middle and leg, and Samson misses the straight drive. Hits his front leg, and that's a big appeal for lbw! Turned down by the umpire, and CSK choose not to review. May have gone down the leg side .
Thakur outclasses Klaasen! Good length on middle, and that's dead centre. He tries to defend this straight back to Shardul, but played down the wrong line. Crashes straight into middle stump
follows the batsman on the leg side. Full outside leg after seeing Klaasen walk across to the leg side. Cramped for space, but manages to squeeze it towards midwicket
full on leg stump again, and Klaasen almost punishes this once more. Clipped off his toes, but straight to square leg
good length just outside off, and gets big on Klaasen. Defended off the backfoot to the bowler
full on middle, and angling into his toes. Too easy for Klaasen to simply flick it off his legs and past midwicket. Sloppy effort from Karn
almost chops on again! Tight line on a good length, and Rahane tries punching towards cover again. The ball zips inwards and takes the inside edge. Through to the fine-leg boundary to end the over
check punched over long on! Full on off, and Rahane comes dancing down the wicket before smacking it over Chahar's head. Terrific shot
good length on leg stump, but goes down the leg side with Rahane shuffling across to the off side
almost chopped on! Good length just outside off, and Rahane tries to punch towards cover. The ball comes just into him, and takes the inside of his bat. Lucky he didn't play that on
good length on off and angling into him. Turned off his pads to deep midwicket on this occasion
dropped at first slip! Good length on off and shapes away after pitching. Klaasen tries to defend off the back foot but takes the outside edge of his bat. Straight to Watson, but he can't hold on
back of a length on middle stump, which forces Rahane to tap it with soft hands towards the off side. Calls nice and early for the single
short and wide outside off. Rahane goes chasing after it, but can't cut it away. Through to the keeper, but the umpire reckons its too wide

yorker outside off, can't get under this for the slog. It dribbles wide of long-on who puts in a good throw on the bounce, but Laughlin can't collect this one-handed to effect the run out. Bravo would have been short

taken. Watson gets the front leg into the leg side to set up for the slog. Never a good strategy against Laughlin's away drifters. It's going too far away and he gets a thin edge that carries to Buttler. A sensational innings from Watson ends
yorker outside off, jams it into the covers from deep in the crease
slower ball pushed too far wide. It bends away and past the wide marker
length ball outside off, looks to pummel it inside-out over extra cover. Gets a thick inside edge to deep midwicket
bouncer dug in too short. He half-jabs at it. It's too high
outside edge falls short of the keeper. Bravo going across the line after stepping out as Laughlin floats this one away from off
full slower ball outside off. Gets into the off side and tries to paddle it after meeting it on the full. Can only tap it straight to short fine
shot! Steps out and scythes it on the up over extra cover. Length ball fired in at off stump and he does stunningly to make so much room on this
falls short of long-on. Watson not as fluent this over. It's a length ball on middle and it gets too big on him as he looks to slog. A feeble chip towards Gowtham who doesn't run in quickly enough
length ball angled in at middle stump. Slogs at it and gets it between deep square and deep midwicket off the inside half of the bat
beaten. A full pace bouncer and he's too late on the hook
length on middle stump, walks down the pitch and chips it towards long-on
drags it one-handed to deep square's right. He's done by the slower short ball, but the typical elongated hands as he looks to pull means he has a chance yet. Uses that left hand to place this

lands in front of third man where Gopal goes brilliantly to get his palm behind it as it lands to his right. An offcutter outside off that Watson tries to lift on the up over extra cover. Ends up slicing it high and Gopal puts in the dive but can't get his hand under that
dropped by Sanju Samson at backward point. Jumping up with two hands but he can't hold on. This one flies off the face of the bat and it's a difficult one after Bravo's energetic swing for the cut
lifts it over backward point. Offcutter dug in short of a length. He waits for it to come close and goes late at it and uses his wrists to lift this over
beaten. Well bowled by Unadkat. Offcutter, back of a length on off stump. He shapes to slog but this skids through from under his shot
century! Stays deep in the crease, allows the offcutter to come on and gently nudges it through cover to get his fourth T20 century. Fully in control tonight, the allrounder
length and angled in at leg stump. Flicked uppishly towards deep square
good length ball floating away from off stump. Leans in and flicks it on the up towards deep midwicket
short and wide outside off. Steps out and wafts. Can't make connection
bouncer at an off stump line. Normal pace this time, he's forced to get his head out of the way

tickled past short fine. Superb stuff. He's expecting a short ball. It's also a slower ball though, so he's forced to adjust after leaping to get behind it. Still has the skill to get his hands in front of the body and run it fine
length on middle stump, driven on the up to long-on
past backward point! Laughlin with the trademark floater outside off. It's dropped short though. Watson is pristine tonight. Perfect weight transfer and timing on the back foot
short of a length on off stump, punched to long-off off the back foot
googly, spinning into the corridor. He makes room to try and cut but this spins to take the under-edge and roll into the point region
short ball on middle, backs away and punches to deep midwicket off the back foot
slider, back of a length outside off. Gets on the back foot and taps to long-on
good length ball outside off, blocked solidly on the front foot

picks out deep midwicket. CSK are having something of a slide on the end opposite to Watson's. It's a half-tracker from Gopal. Which is smart of him, because that's how you get wickets in the IPL if you're a spinner now. Sits up nicely on middle stump and he slaps it, flat, to Stokes in the deep
slower ball on a length on off stump. Backs away and has to adjust to tap this straight to mid-off. Wanted to drive that
dropped short again. Another offcutter. Outside off and he gets down to steer this to deep square
length ball wide outside off, lifts it on the up to extra cover on the bounce
length outside off, walks into the shot and steers it straight to point
cutter dropped short on middle stump. Drags the pull to deep square on the bounce
nicely played. Watson expertly finds the third man boundary. It's a cutter angled in at him. Not a lot of room there but he manages to arch backwards and chop it between keeper and short third
googly, back of a length and in at leg stump. Goes deep in the crease and flicks towards deep square
googly, back of a length just outside off. Stays put and chops it to sweeper cover
back of a length ball on middle. Steps out and looks to shovel it through square leg but cops it on the thigh
length on off stump, steps out and stabs it to extra cover

he's taken at long-on! K Gowtham assists Gopal again. Just about. Dhoni steps out against the googly and is too close to it despite getting to the pitch of it at a good length in front of off. No room to swing and his attempted slog comes off the inside half and goes straight to Gowtham. He looks to take with a reverse-cup but eventually completes the catch after stretching to his right on the second attempt
a googly, dropped short and coming in at leg stump. Gets low and drags it out to long leg with a pull
good length outside off, and once again played delicately! Stays on the back foot and opens his bat's face to play the cut between backward point and short third man. Deft from Dhoni.
full on leg stump, and Watson's forced to wait for the ball to get to him. It's the slower one, and he flicks it off his toes to deep backward square
half-tracker on off, and that's just way too easy for Watto. Rides the bounce and smacks this pull as square as one can imagine. Neither deep midwicket nor deep backward square can intercept
on leg stump, goes to pull this hard, but deceived by the pace. The ball goes down the leg side to the keeper
good length just outside off, but Watson waits on the back foot. Cuts it late, and threads the gap between backward point and short third man
good length on middle stump, and just too easy for Watson who moves on to 70. Going down the leg side, and he just glances this with soft hands down the leg side. Delicately played on this occasion
overpitched on leg stump, and that's been flicked to fine leg to get off the mark
tossed up outside off, and it's the wrong'un. Spinning into Watson's body, but defended back to Gowtham

excellent diving effort at deep midwicket! Gopal's gonna feel lucky here. It was overpitched on leg stump, and Raina's slog sweep is just mistimed. In the air for a while, before Gowtham runs forward and completes the catch. An all-Karnataka wicket there

Nifty footwork from Raina! Half-tracker on leg  stump and Raina misses the pull. Hits the keeper, and falls back into Raina's pads. He isn't sure where the ball is, so chooses to wriggle the ball out of his body
quick! Half-tracker on off, and zipping straight across Raina. Tries to cut, but misses. 115 kph
tossed up outside off, and spinning further away from Raina. Enough width to free his arms, and he leans into this uppish drive over cover. No one at deep extra cover either
full on leg stump, gets down on one knee to slog sweep, but misses out. Hits his leg, but impact's outside leg stump
full on middle stump, and Raina gets down on one knee to lift it over cover. But, it's been sliced, and over point. No one in the deep there
full on middle stump, and Raina's smart to simply play it down the ground for a single. It's already been an expensive over, and all they need to do is see the over out
good length, just outside off. Worked towards the off side, and played off the back foot
pulled flat over midwicket! What a screamer this was. Short outside off, and he swivels quickly to get in position. Simply goes through with the shot, and that lands beyond the mid-wicket boundary
full on leg, and Raina comfortably glances this fine down the leg side. Man in the deep though
misses his line completely. Slower ball, but short and outside leg stump, Raina tries to whip this fine behind leg but can't get bat to ball
classic Raina! Good length on off, and he simply backs away before crunching this away from his body and past cover. Oof
full outside off and shaping away from Watson. Driven straight down the ground to long off for a walking single
good length on middle stump, but Raina is quick to walk across to the off side, before whipping this over square leg! Unadkat expensive again
back of a length on middle, but Raina's prepared for the length. Backs away towards the leg side, and simply cuts it over point's head. Safe shot, and also the fifty partnership
around the wicket to Watson. Good length on off, and angling into him. Defended off the back foot towards the off side with ease
goes back of a length again, and Raina taps it down the ground to long on. No real power, which perhaps, allows them to take the run in the end
almost caught and bowled! But drops just short of Unadkat. It's back of a length on off, and the ball comes off the bat's top half. Lobs into the air, but falls before Unadkat could recover
good length on off and forces Raina to tiptoe. Defended with soft hands towards the leg side
good length on middle stump, and Raina comfortably taps it towards square leg for a quick run. Expensive over
good length just outside off, and Watson cuts it hard to the man in the deep
slog sweep! Full on off, and Watson takes a big stride forward to get down on one knee. Simply swings through the legside thereafter
good length, and wide outside off. Fodder for Watson, who rocks back and crunches this past cover!
gets fifty with a six! Half-tracker on off, and Watson muscles this over long on. Stokes was getting under it, but the ball was simply too high

back of a length on off stump. Tapped to mid on for a quick run, but it could've been a run out! Gowtham ran towards the ball, and then throws it towards the non-striker's end, but the ball slips out of his hand. Oh dear
full on leg once again, but this time Raina connects with the sweep. Hit straight to deep backward square. He'll keep strike
overpitched outside leg stump, and he's down on one knee to slog sweep. Misses it completely
good length on off, and Watson goes deep onto the backfoot to flat-bat it to long on. Solid start from Gopal
good length on middle stump, and Raina shuffles across to the off side and flicks it towards the leg side
full on middle stump, but defended off the front foot to Gowtham
full on off, and that's been struck down the ground hard to long on
tossed up, just outside off, and Watson's tempted to hit it straight. Played on the up, but lands just short of long off!
short on middle, and Raina simply clips it off his pads to deep midwicket. They walk across for the run
good length on off and angling into his pads. Tries to play it towards the leg side, but hits high thigh pad instead
half-tracker on off stump, and Watson pulls this along the ground to deep backward square
full on middle tump, and Watson whips it off his pads towards the leg side
full on off from Gowtham, and Watson goes down on one knee to paddle this over the keeper's head. Calls for two, and comfortably comes back
four in a row! Good length on off, and Raina simply sticks his bat out. Gets a thick outside edge as the ball flies past the keeper's left. Time out as well
low full toss outside leg stump, and this is just too easy for Raina. Simply gets his bat to ball, and clips it off his toes fine down the leg side
flicked fine down the leg side! Back-of-a-length on leg stump, and Raina walks across to the off side, before whipping this fine past short fine leg
full on off, and the angle going away from Raina allows him to free his arms. Takes a step towards the leg side to make some extra room, and then lifts it inside out over cover
overpitched on middle stump, but Raina defends it straight back to Stokes
appeal for lbw, but turned down! Good length on middle stump and Raina tries to defend off the back foot. Takes the inside edge and ricochets onto his pads
short on off, tried to pull but lobbed wide of mid on. Slightly in the air, but no fielder there for any trouble.
good length on middle stump, and turned off the backfoot to deep midwicket. They walk across for the single
good length on leg stump, and tapped off his pads to midwicket. Gets off the mark
too close for the cut, and Rayudu pays the price! Good-length on the fourth-stump line, and his shot takes a thick outside edge. Too easy for Joseph Buttler
good length on off stump, and that's been turned off his pads to midwicket. Calls early for the single
full on middle stump, and slight outswing first up. Driven down the ground to mid on for a quick single
full ball, but on leg stump. Too easy for Watson, who simply clips it off his toes fine down the leg side. Eleven off Stokes' first over
good length just outside off. Rayudu opens his bat's face and carves towards point. Not hit well enough, but still allows them to take the run
good length, but wide outside off. Rayudu sticks his bat out - to try and play this fine - but can't connect
back of a length on middle stump. Clipped off the backfoot to midwicket for a quick run. Could be dangerous, but Tripathi can't connect with a direct-hit
back of a length on middle and cramps Rayudu for space. Forced to tap back towards the non-striker for a quick run
back of a length on off, and Rayudu pulls this fine! Shuffles across to the off side, and whips this behind square
pulled over cow corner! Short on middle, and Watto is quick to get in position. Swivels, and then smacks this over midwicket. Flat six to end the over
full on off, and takes the pace off this time (119 kph). It's the cutter, in fact, and Watson defends with soft hands. Carefully played
good length on off stump, and Watson misses out on the cut. Mistimed towards the off side
overpitched outside off, and the angle allows Watson to free his arms. Just takes a step forward and lifts it over cover
good length on off but too close to his body for the cut. Comes off the bat's top half and towards point
full on off stump, and angling across the batsman. Driven expansively, but stopped by Samson at cover. Good energy on display from the Royals fielders
was that dropped? Excellent effort by Tripathi at point, but the ball may just have dropped short. It was short outside off, and Watson tried to muscle a cut towards the off side
tossed up outside off, and enough width for the big man. Big wind up of the bat, and thumped over Gowtham's head. Off the bat's toe end, but enough muscle behind that shot
full on middle, and Watson takes a big stride forward. Gets to the pitch of the ball and slog-sweeps to Stokes at deep midwicket. A good, sliding effort from Stokesy
good length on of and middle. It's that half-way length that Watson chooses to respect. Defended off the front foot
half-tracker on off stump, but coming into Rayudu's body. Tapped off the back foot to long on for a walking single
full on off stump, and spinning into Watson. Flicked off his pads to deep midwicket to give Rayudu the strike
crunched over cover! Overpitched outside off, and just a full followthrough of the bat from Rayudu. Played on the up, and comfortably lifted over the infield

dropped at first slip! Tripathi the guilty party. Good length on off, and just shaping away. Watson tried to drive to cover but he plays it with hard hands, and the ball takes a thick outside edge. Tripathi was quick to move to his right, but the ball just pops out
half-tracker outside off, but angling away once again. Watson's happy to tap it off the backfoot to point
good length just outside off. Watson shuffles onto his backfoot and defends
back of a length outside off, and angling away from Watson. Enough room for him to free his arms, and it's been caressed past cover off the back foot. The diving effort from cover not good enough
slower ball, half-tracker outside off, and all the time for Watson to thump it over Binny. Gets his front leg out of the way and flat-bats it to the long-on boundary
full just outside off, and Watson defends towards cover. Oh dear, he's overstepped. Free hit coming up!
steps out and punches this to deep cover.  Third win in four games for Kings XI.  This is also the first time they've won in Mohali. Emphatic win.
has he cleared the ropes, no. Put down by Mujeeb at deep midwicket. This was a dolly.
another monstrous hit! Right in the slot, this time he fetches this from well outside off and swings this over the ropes at long on.
punished! Right in the slot, Shakib belts this to clear long on. Crrrrrraaack
bowls a Kedar Jadhav style round-armish down leg. Loses direction, way down leg.
steps out and whips this carrom delivery to long on
flatter and fuller outside off, swung away towards long on
steps out and slaps this slower ball towards wide long off again, Finch comes around to put up a sliding stop
steps out and forces this fuller delivery into the gap at wide long off
gets hold of the pull but straight to the man at deep square
steps out but Mohit sees him coming and bangs this short, Shakib sways out of the way. Harsh call from Llong. Mohit shocked this was given wide too
excellent change of pace, slower and fuller outside off, Pandey looks to flat bat this over cover but gets a thick inside edge towards the keeper.
he connects one, finally. In the slot and Pandey drills this to clear long-on. Half-century goes unnoticed
short on middle and leg, pulled to deep midwicket
slower delivery outside off, he mistimes this back past the bowler, they scamper a run
squeezes this yorker-length delivery to extra cover
sprays this full and wide, he backs away to go over the off side but can't reach this one.
right into the blockhole, squeezed down to long off.
punched down to long on, a direct hit at the bowler's end and Pandey was gone, again.

short_text: Barinder Sran to Shakib, no run
long_text: excellent yorker that tails back in to hit him on the toe as Shakib looks to clip this fine
slower and fuller delivery but way outside off, Shakib backed away to carve over point but couldn't reach

short_text: Barinder Sran to Shakib, (no ball) FOUR runs
long_text: high full toss, a dangerous one at shoulder height, Shakib sways inside the line and helps this past short third man
low full toss on middle and leg, flicked to deep midwicket
angles a slower length ball across, Shakib beaten as he swung through early.
steps out and slaps this length delivery to the edge of the ring at cover

how high? Very, very high but he's only hoicked this as far as deep midwicket, who was at least 20 yards in. Hooda had to go from ball one, can't blame him there. Another knuckleball has given Tye a wicket.
steps out and belts this length ball to long on
steps out and reaches out to slap this length ball to sweeper cover
yorker-length on middle, squeezed back. Pandey struggling to bring the big hits
nudged behind square on the leg side, to Gayle at short fine.
slides this down leg, beaten. Rahul fumbles.
turned gently towards midwicket, no one there. Easy two
delicate little dab to beat short third man. Nicely done, he waited and waited before using the pace to ease the deflection
steps out to work leg side but gets a leading edge towards short third man
steps out and punches this length ball to sweeper cover
drifts in a full delivery towards the pads, tucked towards deep square
through with the pull early, beaten by the slower delivery.
drilled back over the bowler's head, down to long on
walks across the stumps and punches this slower delivery towards Mohit coming in from sweeper cover
steps out and mistimes this flat-batted hit down to long on

holes out to long off. Stepped out and looked to loft over long off but ended up slicing it, which meant there was no timing. Skewed it high in the air, Finch took a comfortable catch. The knuckleball meant Williamson didn't have any pace to work with.
short, angling down and Williamson just helps this over short fine leg. Too easy
punched back, cramped for room. Can't do much.
drifts this down leg, Pandey looks to paddle but misses
rocks back and cuts to sweeper cover, brings up his half-century to muted applause from the dressing room.  Fifth IPL fifty
half-tracker and punished. Opened up the leg side as he rocked back and pulled it away over deep midwicket
just short of Tiwary  coming in from long on. Almost made a difficult catch possible. Outstanding effort, came in quickly and dived full length forward to take it on the half volley
anticipates the batsman stepping out and bowls this short and wide.
steps out and nudges this towards Mohit coming in from deep square. A fumble there helped them to complete it easily
steps out and swings this down to long on
slices this length ball between cover point and short third man. Wonderfully done. Steps out and then opened the bat face slightly to pick the gap.

flat-bats this over the bowler's head, excellent work by Agarwal at long-on. Pandey was more than halfway down the pitch as he turned, Rahul was late in coming up to the stumps. Some angry words from Agarwal, Rahul says he didn't hear much.
slower length ball, he backs away and slaps this to deep cover
gets across and wrists this length ball towards deep square, purposeful running
swung away leg side. This was a knee-high full toss and he clobbered that to the square leg boundary. Suspect Mohit was looking to bowl a yorker.
crunched to sweeper cover, lazy effort in the deep by Tiwary. Looped in a throw, they came back for the second easily
drifts in a slider towards middle and leg, worked towards deep square leg
steps out and forces this to Yuvraj at cover, no room to work with, was cramped.
backs away and mistimes a cut straight to cover
backs away, Mujeeb follows him. Bunted towards deep midwicket. A direct hit at the bowler's end from Finch would've spelt trouble for Pandey
tossed up outside off, Pandey is made to stretch as he drives wide of cover
looks to play a half-sweep to a shortish delivery that drifts in, beaten. Hit on the pad
steps out and drills this slower delivery to long off
bunts this towards cover, they scamper a single
gets a little too far across to paddle, can't get much bat on it. Straight to the keeper
slower length ball n off stump, defended from the crease
dropped  by substitute David Miller at long-on!  He stepped out to loft over long-on but didn't get the elevation. Miller ran in quickly, dived low but couldn't get under it properly.
length outside off, punched to extra cover
cuts back in from length outside off, punched to cover.
driven towards cover, Tiwary dives to his left but can't stop it cleanly
lunges forward and bunts this full delivery to cover
steps out and works this low full toss down to long on
works this from outside off towards the man coming in from deep midwicket. A better throw from Mayank Agarwal at the bowler's end and it could've been close.

comes a long way down the track in trying to work this flatter delivery to the leg side as he swings across the line, is struck on the pad. There was a stifled appeal, but Ashwin went up for a review immediately. Ball tracker says this would have clipped the outside of leg stump.  On-field decision of NOT OUT stays
punches this down to long of as he jogs the single
hoicked acoss the line, one bounce to deep midwicket
too short again, slapped to deep cover
turns this with the spin to long on
drops short with the carrom ball, Williamson rocks back and cuts to sweeper cover
beauty! Excellent use of the feet as he gets underneath the flight and swings this over long on
good length outside off, and spinning sharply into him. Tries to work it towards the leg side but played down the wrong line. Goes straight through to the keeper
good length outside off, and angling into Mujeeb. Nudged to midwicket off the back foot again, and once again forces Mujeeb to go running after it
full on off, and spins sharply inwards. Worked off his legs to deep midwicket
quicker ball. Good length on middle, but KW comes down the wicket to work it towards midwicket. No one there, while means Mujeeb has to go chasing behind it
full on off again. Drives it down the ground - against the spin - to long off
good length on off, and spinning into his body. Punched off the back foot to long on for a walking single
good length, but wide outside off. Cuts it off the back foot to the man in the deep. He'll keep strike
full on middle and leg, and he comes down the wicket almost like a ballet dancer. Simple skip, and then lifted inside out over extra cover. Can watch that all day
good length on off, but KW backs away towards the leg side. Carves it square with soft hands, which allows them to come back for the second
and the first legbreak doesn't turn the way he wants to. Full outside leg and going down the leg side. Rahul can't hold on to it either
good length on off stump, and no spin on offer for now. He comes down the wicket and bunts it towards midwicket
tossed up on leg stump. Pandey backs away and drives inside out to long off. Dealing in ones and twos for now
good length on off, and zips straight through. Punched off the back foot to long on

short_text: Barinder Sran to Pandey, no run
long_text: good length on off, and angling across Pandey again. Tries to open his bat's face but can't connect. Through to Rahul, who can't hold onto it in his first attempt

short_text: Barinder Sran to Pandey, no run
long_text: full and wide outside off. Forces Pandey to reach at it, and all he can do is drive it back to Sran
good length on middle and leg, and worked off his pads to square leg for a quick single
good length on off, and cut fine! Races away to the fielder at third man. Excellent spell from Sran so far
good length on leg stump, and that's been flicked off his pads to deep backward square

short_text: Barinder Sran to Williamson, no run
long_text: good length on off stump. KW stays on the back foot and firmly defends towards cover
back of the hand slower ball! Chopped on this time. Good length on off, and he tries to muscle this towards cover. Takes the inside edge, and ricochets into his leg stump. Mohit's second wicket
short outside off, and once again jagging away from Yusuf. He flat-bats it over mid on, and it's a chase for the fielder towards the long-on boundary. Eventually comfortably pulled back
short, but jags away from Yusuf after pitching. He contemplates pulling but pulls out in the end. The ball ends up just inside the tramlines
full on leg stump, and he can't flick it fine. Tries to work it to the leg side but hits his pad instead. Impact outside leg stump, however
too short. Outside off, and Pathan drags his pull to cow corner
slapped past cover! Good length outside off, and just enough room for Yusuf to free his arms. Muscles this past the two infielders on the off side on this occasion
good length just outside off. Stands tall and punches straight to cover. Ends with a dot
overpitched on off stump, and that's been drilled to mid off. Quick run collected
slower ball, but overpitched on leg stump. Too easy for Pathan who uses his long levers to whip this over midwicket. No one in the deep there
good length outside off, and KW opens his bat's face to run it down to short third man
good length on middle stump, stays on the back foot and tapped to mid on for a single

good length on off, and starts with the slower one. Tries to punch this back but he's through his shot too early. Forced to check his shot, and that probably saves him. The ball drops just short of Tye

short_text: Barinder Sran to Williamson, no run
long_text: good length on middle and angling away once again. Crunches this drive square, but Yuvraj - yes that man - dives to his right and stops
back of a length on off and angling away from Yusuf. Tries to cut hard at it, but straight to Yuvraj at cover point. But it pops straight out. What a rare drop from Yuvraj
good length on leg stump, and that's been whipped off his pads to deep backward square
slower ball, full on leg stump. Tapped with soft hands towards the vacant mid-wicket region. They scamper across for the run

short_text: Barinder Sran to Pathan, no run
long_text: full on off stump, and he takes a big stride forward to defend. Tapped back firmly
good length on middle, and he gets into position early. Pulled along the ground to deep midwicket
just over Ashwin! Full on off, and he tries to lift it over mid off. Not hit well at all, but the tall Ashwin can't get his fingertips to it either. Reprieve for Yusuf

clips off stump! Sharma has the final laugh. Good length on off stump, and straight as an arrow. Saha tried the pull this square, but the ball stays low, and the delivery crashes into side of off stump
slower ball, but a half-tracker on middle. He has all the time in the world to swivel and paddle this fine past short fine leg! Good use of the wrists from Saha to play this finer than usual
good length on middle stump, and KW easily whips it off his pads to deep midwicket. The man there has to race across the boundary to intercept. Good work from Mujeeb
good length just outside off, and KW rides the bounce! Stands tall and punches this past cover. What a glorious shot
good length on middle stump. Comfortably flicked off his pads to square leg for a single

short_text: Barinder Sran to Williamson, no run
long_text: good length on off stump. Williamson makes a customary off-side shuffle and fends towards the leg side

short_text: Barinder Sran to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: good length on off, and gets big on Dhawan. He tries to cut but the ball came in sharply. Cramped for space, and the ball hits his left elbow. That hurt! Physio time. The way Dhawan reacted, looked pretty painful. He's retiring hurt.
good length on middle stump, and that's been pulled square. Not him well enough though

short_text: Barinder Sran to Saha, no run
long_text: good length on middle, and that's been driven uppishly. Through his shot too early and hits the bat's top half. In the air as well, but just short of cover point. Three men inside the circle on the off side, but falls short of all three of them

short_text: Barinder Sran to Saha, no run
long_text: good length on leg stump, and shapes into his pads. Tries to flick towards the leg side but misses. Hits his front leg, but the lbw appeal is turned down. They're reviewing anyway Is it too high, that's the only question  and yes! Slightly too high. Would've clipped the stumps, but that's umpire's call

short_text: Barinder Sran to Saha, no run
long_text: good length on off and angling away from Saha. Sticks his bat out and cuts to point. Diving effort from Agarwal stops the single
awry start. Good length outside leg and shaping further away

looks to go over long-on, gets a thick inside edge onto the pad. Saha fires a wayward throw at the bowler's end and they get a single.  Gayle is applauded by the opponents as he walks off.  What entertainment.
pulled away, not in control. Deep square does well to come around.

short_text: Rashid Khan to Finch, SIX runs
long_text: right underneath the flight and bang! Straight into the sightscreen. The power of his bottomhand. Proper smash

short_text: Rashid Khan to Finch, FOUR runs
long_text: muscled! One bounce and this bisects deep midwicket and long on. Proper baseball slog. Cleared the front leg and boom!
slaps this length ball to long off. For a second, Gayle didn't want a single but trudged along

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gayle, no run
long_text: has he got him? Gayle looks to biff this over midwicket, misses. Struck on the pad
whips this full toss down to deep midwicket. Walks across for a single
right into the blockhole, squeezed down to long on
high full toss, Gayle looks to go over cover but is hit high on the bat, they scamper a run. Gayle had given up. A direct hit and he was gone
slaps this length delivery down to long on

slower length ball outside off, Gayle bunts this behind point to scamper a single.  This is his sixth IPL century, his 21st in T20s overall.  Brings out the cradle celebration, probably for his daughter who is here in India.  First century of the season
slower and fuller outside off, Finch belts this to long-off.  He's off the mark and there's an arm raise  even as the crowd gives him a big cheer. Finch sees the funny side of it
gets underneath the length and hammers this into the top tier at long-off.  This is the first time Bhuvi has finished a four-over spell before the 19th over.
helps this trash ball down leg on the bounce to short fine leg. Missed out

think I jinxed him, Nair has hoicked this straight to deep midwicket, but this has been a good support hand. Bhuvi bowled this knuckleball at length outside off, Nair fetched it and tried to clear the longest boundary, picked out Dhawan.
full and wide again, squeezed to cover
backs away, so Bhuvi goes full and wide, Gayle can't reach it but this is outside the wide line. Has to rebowl that
sliced over the infield, down to Rashid at sweeper cover
driven wide of extra cover for a quick single
looks to walk across and whip this over square leg, played too early. Flicked the back pad on the way to the keeper
excellent wide yorker, Nair looks to carve this behind point but is late on the stroke
mid-off is inside the ring, so Nair has the license to go over the top and he does full justice to it. Jordan goes length, Nair makes room and goes inside-out. Lovely
driven to long-off

this is Gayle unleashed. Waited, held his shape and belted this short ball over the deep square leg fence. This one not as big as some of the others, but doesn't matter.  This is his 10th six this season. Only Russell has more sixes in an innings this season
right into the blockhole, just a touch outside off, Nair walks across and squeezes the drive past mid off
length ball but way outside the wide line, easy call
opens the bat face slightly to drive this towards cover point
squeezes this length ball towards point, Gayle is on a mission to not just hit boundaries but pinch ones and twos as well
walks across the stumps to help this over short fine, gets some glove on it as he looks to play this slower legcutter, didn't have pace to work with
punches this down to long on for an easy single
length ball on leg stump, dabbed past a laboured Rashid at midwicket. Lazy, lazy effort. Nothing lazy about the running from Gayle
length delivery angling away, steered behind point, down to square third man
superb yorker length ball on leg stump, Gayle squeezes this towards deep midwicket
squeezes this full-length delivery to point
slower and fuller on the pads, worked past midwicket

backs away, Kaul drops this just a touch short but the result is the same as Nair flat-bats this over mid-off. The angle brought it in, Nair, it appeared was cramped for room, but he manufactured the stroke by opening his wrists to get this up and over.
clean strike, one bounce to the long off boundary. Made room and lofted through the line. Mid off was up, decided to clear him and did so superbly
length ball back in, Nair mistimes this hoick over midwicket. This raises the half-century stand off just 23 balls
punched back, Rashid parries this deflection towards midwicket. I haven't seen Gayle hare like this in a long long time, how did he complete the second? Woah!

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gayle, SIX runs
long_text: this has been muscled over cow corner. He's well and truly back. This is some assault. Rashid drifted this in full from wide of the crease, Gayle got right to the pitch on the sweep as he made clean connection!

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gayle, SIX runs
long_text: goes full, but it doesn't matter. Lofted through the line, stunning use of the bottom hand, clean striking. Just above the sightscreen this time. Some attack this against the top dog in T20 cricket

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gayle, SIX runs
long_text: drops short, Gayle responds by using the depth of the crease to clobber this back over his head, smashes into the sightscreen

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gayle, SIX runs
long_text: he's now in his big-hitting zone. Too full and right into his swinging arc, Gayle hammers this with the turn over long off.
works this from length towards deep midwicket
knee-high full toss on middle stump, and it's been flicked off his pads to fine leg. Could've sent that anywhere on the leg side, but could only find the man in the deep
quicker ball! Back of a length on middle and cramps Karun for space. Tries to flick it towards midwicket, but can't connect. Hits his gut region
back of a length outside off, and coming into Karun Nair. Stays on the backfoot and carves it towards point. Man there
good length on off and angling away from Gayle. Slapped off the back foot to the man in the deep
good length just outside off. Karun Nair opens the bat's face and pushes it towards deep extra cover. Happy to give the strike back to Gayle
yorker on leg stump, and Gayle just taps it to midwicket for a single. Second fifty in a row!
full and wide outside off. Gayle's forced to reach at it, and drags the shot to midwicket
good length on leg, but in Gayle's arc! Takes a big stride forward and thumps it over Manish Pandey at long on.
good length on leg stump, and it's been paddled behind square. Straight to short third man
full on off, and bunted back to Shakib off the back foot
full on off stump, and drilled down the ground to long on

chance goes down! Difficult but Manish Pandey's effort goes for a six. Full on off, and he lifts it over mid on. Pandey - at long on - gets under it, and even sticks his hand out. The ball stays in his palm, but his momentum's taking him over the boundary. Still manages to throw the ball in the air, but his inertia forces the ball to land beyond the boundary anyway
good length on off and angling into Karun. Flicked off his pads to deep midwicket for a comfortable run
half-tracker on off and angling further away. Gayle stands tall and flat-bats it hard to long off. They walk across for the run
back of a length outside off. Gayle tries to slap it square past point, but the bounce stays low! Under-edges it towards the off side
good length, just outside off. Punched off the front foot to deep extra cover. Dhawan the man there
soft! Back of a length outside off, and enough width to free his arms. But Mayank tries to play a deft shot, and cuts it straight to point. He'll be disappointed
slower ball, wide outside off. Gayle is forced to reach at it, and bunts it to deep extra cover
and that's the quickest I've seen Gayle run in a while. Good length on leg, and he clips it to square leg for a quick single. Giant steps across the 22 years means he completes it with ease
tries to repeat it, but can only mistime it down the ground to long on. Full on off, and played down the ground again
slogged over long on! Slower ball, gives it just a bit more air, and the full ball is in Agarwal's arc. Gets down on one knee, and smacks this over the non-striker's head
back of a length on leg stump, and aimed at Gayle's legs. Punched off the back foot to cow corner for a walking single
good length on off stump. Mayank goes onto the back foot and punches it past Shakib's left to long off
welcomed with a boundary! Full just outside off, and Mayank takes a big step forward before lifting this inside out over cover. A well-executed shot that's played wide of long off
full on off, and swept square. Spinning into Agarwal's pads, and comfortably gets down on one knee to play it to the man in the deep. Time out
full on off, and Gayle tries to launch off again. Only this time he mis-hits it to cow corner, trying to slog through the ball's line
good length on off, and Agarwal muscles this off the back foot to midwicket. Mistimed

tossed up on off, and Agarwal tries an extravagant drive. Takes a thick outside edge, and loops over to short third man. Yusuf attempts a dive to his right, but the ball bounces in front of him and then races away to the boundary
good length on middle stump, and Gayle shuffles across to the off side. Tries to flick it behind square but misses. Hits his thigh pad, and allows them to rotate the strike
tossed up on off, and too easy for Gayle! One big step forward and then comfortably lifted over the bowler's head. Lands beyond the long-on boundary
overpitched and wide outside off. Just inside the tramlines as Gayle chooses not to play at it. Smart bowling

short_text: Rashid Khan to Agarwal, no run
long_text: full outside off, but spins sharply into Agarwal. Blocked off the back foot with the bat's open face. Excellent over from Rashid

trapped in front of middle and off! Half-tracker outside off and holds its line. Too quick for Rahul, and the ball stays low too, as the batsman misses the leg-side whip. Goes under his bat, and hits his front leg. An easy call for the umpire

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rahul, no run
long_text: good length, just outside off. Spins slightly away from Rahul, and he's forced to go deep onto the back foot and defend
not afraid to flight it, and lucky Gayle mistimes it. Landed full outside off, and he tries to slog towards the leg side, but off the bat's toe end. Goes to cow corner

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gayle, no run
long_text: good length on off, but spins sharply into Gayle. Cramped for room, and forced to flat-bat it back to Rashid
flighted on off stump, and Rahul takes a step forward to nudge it towards midwicket for a quick run

full outside off, and angling into Gayle's pads. He takes a big step forward and tries to flick it towards the leg side, but the ball straightens slightly and hits his front leg. Appeal turned down. Impact outside off, perhaps
full and fast outside off, and Gayle thumps this to cover. Straight to the man there
good length on middle, and angling into his pads. Tries to paddle it fine behind square, but he's though the shot too early. Hits his front leg, and Hooda appeals too, but it would've gone down leg
half-tracker wide outside off. Rahul walks down the wicket to generate some extra pace, and slaps it to deep extra cover
back of a length outside off, Gayle comes walking down the wicket and flat-bats it to mid on
around the wicket, and on a good length. Pushed towards cover
lofted  beautifully over mid-off. Impeccable balance and timing. Great to watch. How he can't be a regular for India across format continues to baffle me
this is a crunching cover drive. Pierced the gap to perfection. Not a half-volley by any means and he hit through the line without a trace of worry.
mistimes an attempted punch down to mid-off, Gayle is on the ball today, gets across for a single
the knuckleball that he lands at length on off, punched to mid off for a quick single
slides this length ball back in from wide of the crease, turned to midwicke
bunts this short of length delivery to cover
looks to go over cover, gets a thick inside edge down to long-on. This time, he was made to really stretch, didn't get to the pitch either.

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gayle, SIX runs
long_text: gets to the pitch of the ball and clobbers this over wide long-on. Got so close, so it didn't matter if the delivery was a legspinner or a googly. Stunning blow, pure muscle.

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gayle, no run
long_text: punches this shortish wrong'un to cover

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gayle, no run
long_text: excellent comeback! Gayle didn't pick that googly at all, beaten.

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gayle, SIX runs
long_text: juicy full toss and Gayle wallops this into the stands beyond deep midwicket. Too easy.

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gayle, no run
long_text: dropped by Saha!  Right off the toe end, tough chance. Gayle looked to cut but this kept a touch low.
squirts this drive to Rashid at cover point
that old-school Natraja shot that Kapil Dev mastered. Right leg in the air as he hops back and works this to deep square leg
slaps this over cover point. Too short and angling away, Gayle cleared his front leg to wallop this.
he was waiting for that, deposits this pull in front of square. Sails over deep midwicket. Was Jordan testing the bounce of the surface? Gayle got into position very quickly.
slower length ball on off stump, Rahul check-drives to mid-off. Shaped to hit through the line but changed his stroke as the ball held up on the surface
shapes to drive but this ball veers back in to roll back off the inside edge.
plays inside the line as this length ball nips away to whizz past the outside edge. Top stuff from Bhuvi
mistimes a big booming drive towards mid off as they scamper a single
skiddy length ball on the stumps, Rahul shows the full face of the bat as he defends.
angles this full delivery into middle and leg, Rahul works this gently towards midwicket

length ball angling in, there's a gentle little nip back in off the pitch to kiss the inside edge as it hit the pad.  A very thin inside edge!  Decision overturned. As an umpire, it's really, really hard to spot such minute deviation off the bat. Correct decision in the end.
drifting into the pads, Rahul flicks this past an ageing Yusuf, who fails to get there running back from midwicket. A slightly-more agile fielder would've stopped it on the dive
gets on top of the bounce and punches this short of length delivery to mid-off
just eludes Kaul at mid-on! This got big on Gayle as he shaped to fetch this pull from outside off, got this on the top part of the bat. Ah, so near, yet so far.
beaten for pace! Looks to slap this length delivery through extra cover but is late on the stroke
angles a zippy short of length delivery across Gayle, who drops his wrists and lets this go
brushes the thigh pad and beats the diving Saha down leg. A short of length delivery but pitched way down leg. Gayle looked to work it fine, but will take runs however they come.
length ball angling away, Gayle punches this to mid-off
gentle little tuck to square leg, Gayle hares across to get off the mark.
leading edge, squirts down to square third man. Rahul looked to work this full delivery to the leg side but didn't account for the late away movement.
excellent take down leg by Saha. Bhuvi gets the direction wrong. Sprays this length ball down leg, brushed the thigh pad on the way to the keeper
gets a good stride forward and defends this away-swinger to cover
uppish, but on the bounce to mid-off. Nice curve again on the knuckleball. Stopped on Rahul and hit the top part of the bat as he looked to drive.
curves away from off stump, driven firmly. Good stop at extra cover
and that is that. Gets a full ball from Laughlin, just outside off, and he clears his front leg and launches the winning hit high into the Jaipur sky, well beyond the long-on boundary
slower short ball outside off. Makes a bit too much room, ends up having to reach for it, at shoulder height that too, and chops it down towards point
slower ball, full outside off, whipped wristily down to long-on
slower ball on leg stump. Was he looking to chip that towards long-off? Maybe. Ends up miscuing it, driving it on the bounce to long-on instead
full, well down the leg side, Rana misses the attempted swipe over short fine
full on middle stump, makes room to drive to the right of long-off. KKR have picked up a million twos today
back of a length on off stump, Rana dabs it down to third man. He moved away from his stumps initially, then shuffled across them again to get close to the line
goes wide of the crease and angles a bouncer into the stumps. Carries at shoulder height to Buttler after Rana makes room and fails to connect with his uppercut
back of a length close to off stump, opens his bat face and dabs gently towards short third man
and he sends down a stump-high full-toss outside off stump. A misdirected yorker. Karthik carves it away square, a long way to the left of the only man on the off-side boundary
back of a length, angling into the body, whipped away to the left of deep backward square leg
short, angling into off stump. Rana moves across to play a short-arm jab out to deep square leg
slower ball on middle and off, fairly full. Lets it come and opens his bat face to steer to deep point

shot. Unadkat looks for the off-stump yorker this time and doesn't miss his length by much. But Rana takes a big step back into his crease to create some swinging room, and simply lifts it over mid-off
back of a length, angled across to off stump, punched to deep point

short on middle and leg, and Karthik steps across and pulls it over the backward square leg boundary - picks out the short boundary on that side, and clears it despite only managing a 64m hit. Didn't look to hit it too hard, just helped it and found the gap to the right of deep square leg
in the blockhole close to off stump, looks to make room to drive through the covers, ends up squeezing it down to long-on instead, off the inside half of the bat
down the track to the ball angled across to off stump, and clips it deliberately in the air, one bounce to Stokes at deep midwicket
shortish outside off, slapped away to third man
full, slanting away from the left-hander's off stump, a bit of swing away too, jabbed firmly to the left of deep point
fullish on middle stump, makes a bit of room and punches to short extra
length ball on off stump, clipped down to long-on
full outside off, Karthik drives hard, extra-cover dives left to stop it

back of a length on off stump, Karthik tucks it smartly into the vacant midwicket area. Laughlin gives chase, with the fielder on the boundary, and they scamper two more. From this end, the leg-side boundary is quite long, so Karthik played the field cleverly
another slower one, on middle stump this time, and Karthik steps across to flick. Short fine leg dives left to make a good stop
slower ball, back of a length on off stump, defended back down the pitch
short now, gets off his toes to slap it on the bounce to sweeper cover

length ball on off stump, a bit of nip back in to tuck up Rana. He dabs it gently to the off side of the pitch and takes off looking for the quick single. Unadkat moves quickly in his follow-through, picks up and throws at the batsman's end and misses. Would have been comfortably out if he had hit, despite the desperate dive. Really didn't judge that at all
short again, not so much width this time, pulled to deep midwicket
shortish, slanting across to off stump, punched to the right of deep point, and he picks up another two
flat googly, mostly just goes with the angle into the pads, clipped to deep midwicket
googly turning towards off stump, goes back to punch to long-on
googly, quite short, cramps him a little and he opens up to pull to deep backward square leg
tossed up outside off, comes forward for a defensive push towards point

back of a length, sliding on towards middle stump. Karthik goes deep in his crease and tucks it away towards fine leg, to the right of the man on the boundary - picks up his third double in four balls
long-hop on off stump, pulled hard and flat, on the bounce to Stokes at deep midwicket
shot! That's speared in very full, outside off, and he opens his bat face deftly to pick up a boundary to fine third man
shortish again, this time he slaps it to the right of the man at deep point
shortish outside off, slapped away to the left of deep point

has Stokes caught that cleanly? The umpires are going to have a look. In Uthappa's slot for the lofted drive, which he hits hard and flat, but Stokes is on the boundary at long-on. He was stepping backwards as he took the catch over his head, about to tumble past the boundary, so he flicked it in the air, then stepped on the rope, and managed to return to the field of play and complete the catch comfortably enough in the end. Perhaps unwise of Uthappa to take on the deep fielder in this situation, but he's played an excellent hand for KKR
angled into the pads again, and this time he sweeps it out to deep backward square leg
flat length ball angling into the pads, and Rana tucks it away neatly, nice and fine and the man at deep backward square leg is too far from the ball to even be in the frame
yorker on middle and off, shuffles across to clip to deep square leg
low full-toss outside off, a bit of outswing on that, flicked deliberately in the air, without too much weight on the stroke, so it drops well short of deep midwicket
slower ball on off stump, defended back to the bowler

back of a length on off stump, punched towards extra-cover, and then takes off for the quick single. Rahane moved quickly to the ball, but he took a touch too long to turn and aim at the bowler's end, and Rana would have made it home even if he had hit the stumps
slower length ball on off stump, presses forward and defends studiously
low full-toss close to off stump, and that's beautifully timed by Rana. Just opens his face slightly and sends it racing away to the left of the man sprinting from deep point
appeal for stumping here. Fired in quick outside off, and Uthappa misses the sweep having stretched out quite far. He lifted his foot momentarily, but grounded it well in time
ooh, good ball. Flat length ball and Uthappa jabs at it in front of his body, nearly pops back a return catch. Doesn't carry, though
fullish on middle stump, gets forward to clip it away through square leg
length ball on middle stump, whipped to long-on
goes on the back foot to punch it, but it keeps low and he jabs it back to the bowler instead
Another misfield. Down the track and he bowls it quick and angling into the batsman. Drives it back towards him, and he lets it slip through his fingers and roll towards long-off
short, a bit of width, but there's a man at deep point to stop Rana's cut
full on leg stump, clipped to long-on

oh my god. Is that the widest leg-side wide in the history of the universe? Thankfully for the keeper, it was a slower ball gone wrong, and it gave him plenty of time to move to his left and stop it running away for more runs
in the blockhole on off and middle, clipped down to long-on
length ball on the stumps, clipped away through midwicket

oh no, poor fielding on the rope from Unadkat. Length ball attacking the top of off stump and Uthappa slaps it in the air, on the bounce, towards deep point. Unadkat falls to his right to try and stop it, and doesn't cover for the ball spinning away from him - should have known because Uthappa sliced it
back of a length, angling into off stump, waits on it and stabs firmly towards backward point, who makes a diving stop but lets the ball roll away to allow the single
tossed up on middle stump, and it's right in Uthappa's arc as he stretches out and slog-sweeps it waaay over cow corner
back of a length, wrong'un, turning towards off stump. Goes on the back foot to work it through forward square leg

run-out ends the partnership! Another skiddy slider. Narine misses the reverse-sweep, gets hit on the pad, and he ambles out of his crease looking for a leg-bye as the ball rolls towards short third man and Buttler goes up in appeal for lbw. He realises too late that the single isn't on, and by the time he turns around the throw from Jaydev Unadkat is nearly in Buttler's gloves
down the track and Shreyas bowls it slightly shorter, a slider going across him towards off stump. Pushed gently to mid-off
flatter length ball close to off stump, presses forward, opens his bat face, and dabs to short third man
slow legbreak on leg stump. Looks to stretch out and flick, misses it, and it rolls off his pad into the square leg region
beaten as he looks to steer this behind point. Bounce nearly did him in.
late on the stroke, looked to angle this behind point. Length was too full. Beaten
full outside off, dug out to beat a diving Rahane at cover
looks to back away and slap this over cover, but gets a thick outside edge past the keeper, no chance for third man. More frustration for the Royals
squeezes this flick towards deep midwicket
beaten for pace. 146kph. This length ball angles back in to hit him on the back thigh as he tries to work this to the leg side.
floats this wide, in the swinging arc, Narine lofts this over cover. Stokes with a sliding stop at wide long-off
spins away from length on middle, defended back
worked with the spin towards deep midwicket. This was a googly
half-tracker that Uthappa pulls way over the deep midwicket fence. Too easy, pie that was asking to be hit
goes back into the crease and defends this length ball
touch short, this spins away sharply from outside off though, bunted to the off side
follows an outstanding yorker with a half-tracker. Narine uses the depth of the crease to muscle this pull over deep midwicket.
backs away to go over cover but the bowler does well to bowl this full and straight towards his toe, squeezed to the leg side
floats this full outside off, defended wide of mid-off as they scamper a quick single
gets on top of the bounce and tucks this towards square leg
punches this length ball down to long on
short and angling down, Uthappa helps this down to beat short fine leg. Too easy. Not an ideal start from Laughlin
sumptuous straight drive, but this is an outstanding stop by Laughlin at mid-off. Ran quickly towards his right and then put out a full-length dive to cut that off
deliberately done! Very clever from Uthappa. Opens the bat face at the last moment to use the pace and angle to tickle this past the keeper to the third man boundary.
belted back over the bowler's head. Length ball and Uthappa slapped this away with disdain. That raced to the fence even before Unadkat could turn back on his followthrough
looks to run this down but is beaten by the away-going length ball
imperiously pulled, one bounce to the midwicket boundary. Slower delivery, the off-cutter but too short. Uthappa had enough time in the world to line himself for that before giving it a proper whack
oh, and guess what? It's not a cutter! Length ball angling away, defended back.
superb yorker-length delivery that beats Narine for pace as he looks to squeeze this behind point

slower length ball on middle and leg, this time Narine cleverly waited for the ball to arrive before unfurling a flat-batted pull to the midwicket fence. Dhawal assumed he'd look to cut again and bowled it closer to the stumps. Didn't matter.
cracked! There's cover and cover point but each one only saw the other's face. No one moved. Length ball, Narine cleared his front leg and walloped that through the line
slower delivery but the length is too short, Narine backs away and slaps this one bounce to the point boundary. Held his shape nicely
cracked away but can't pierce the off side ring, hit straight to cover point
looks to carve this behind point, but is beaten. Too full again from Dhawal
steps out and works this indrifter down to deep midwicket
makes a bit of room and punches this length ball straight to cover point.
hint of width again, punches this straight to the edge of the ring at cover
not quite timed well enough, mistimes this attempted pull on the bounce to Stokes at long on
drops short again, this time he punches this straight to cover
drops short and Uthappa dispatches that. Rocked back, opened up the off side and cut this through wide mid-off. Solid power
works this length ball towards midwicket. Planted his front leg across a long way as he played that
slower length ball on middle, punched to mid-off for an easy single
thick outside edge as he attempts to slash over point, but this one flies over Buttler's outstretched hands behind the stumps. Streaky boundary
looks to slap this over point, toe-ends it to cover instead

just chips this over extra cover. Narine wasn't to the pitch of the ball but looked to hit through the line. The ball stopped on him just a touch. Narine turned blindly for the third, but saw Uthappa put his hand out in the nick of time.
starts off with a full delivery outside off, Narine looks to squeeze this behind point but is beaten
goes back into the crease and steers this shortish delivery to point. Top first over from KG
punches this straight to mid-off
slides back in to hit him on the thigh pad, Uthappa was looking to whip this off his hip
tries to cut but this spins back in sharply from length to cramp him for room and sees the off and leg  stump flattened. The skid has done the trick.
flatter length ball on middle, defended back
drifts in from wide of the crease, Narine lunges forward to defend, get a thick inside edge past midwicket

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Buttler, no run
long_text: slower ball, full and wide outside off, and Buttler swings and misses, looking for the long-off boundary. Looked tight, but the umpire decides not to signal wide. Good last over from Mavi, stuck to his plan despite bowling all those wides, and found his rhythm in the end

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Buttler, 1 run, OUT
long_text: slants it away from Buttler's off stump again - not a yorker this time but quite full again. Flat-batted down to long-off and they chance the second just to keep Buttler on strike. Mavi fails to collect the throw cleanly, but he still collects it in time to catch Kulkarni short of his crease
gets the wide yorker right this time. Buttler reaches out and slaps it to deep point. Just about manages to turn around and hurry back for a second
oh no. Another wide full one - a slower one too - and it ends up waaaaay wide of off stump

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Buttler, no run
long_text: bangs it in short now, and gets the angle right on this occasion. Within reach of Buttler to play a shot, but perhaps not the pull he was looking for. Plays and misses
and again. A misdirected wide yorker from round the wicket, ends up bowling it too wide. Karthik had been gesturing to him to bowl a wide yorker, with his right arm extended outwards
looks for the wide yorker, and from that round-the-wicket angle, there's a big danger of slanting it too wide. That's what he ends up doing. Buttler doesn't even try to go after it
shortish, slanting away into a fifth-stump line, pulls it along the ground to the left of deep midwicket, and they hurry through for two
