full outside off, Kulkarni had made himself room and threw his hands at the ball, ended up slicing it chest-high to Lynn at backward point, and he drops it. Allows Buttler to come on strike too

short_text: Tom Curran to Buttler, FOUR runs
long_text: low full-toss outside off, and that brings Buttler's incredible bottom wrist into play. A table-tennis-style whip enables him to pick up a flat one-bounce four to the left of long-on
wide slower one, fairly full. I think Buttler was looking to stab that through point, but ended up playing too early and ended up flat-batting it to long-off instead
low full-toss angling into middle and leg, cramps him for room and all he can do is stay leg-side of the ball and jab to the left of cover

short_text: Tom Curran to Buttler, (no ball) 1 run
long_text: full on middle and off, jabbed down to long-off, and guess what, Curran's overstepped. But Kulkarni will be on strike for the free hit.
back of a length outside off, this is a better ball to play that late dab against, and Kulkarni gets off the mark with a single to third man

bowled him! Curran follows the slower one with a fast length ball, angling into off stump. Shreyas' feet are stuck, going neither forward nor back, and he plays with half a bat, opening the face to try and dab it fine. He misses, and Curran knocks out his off stump
slower ball, full outside off, and Gowtham departs. Looks to hit it over cover, maybe, ends up slicing a simple catch to backward point
drops it short now and Buttler punishes him, makes a bit of room to flat-bat this extremely hard, into the gap to the left of long-off
big offbreak now, looks to hoick into the leg side and gets an inside edge down into the fine leg region
dangled up slow outside off, turns away from Gowtham again. Slogs across the line and fails to connect

some release for Royals, finally. Down the track, not quite to the pitch of Narine's carrom ball. Goes through with the straight loft nonetheless, and slices it a little, but that helps get it wider of long-off, Gill, who dives left at the rope, gets his hands to it, but can't hold on or flick it back into the field of play
shortish on off stump, chopped away through point
fired in full at the pads. Probably knew he wanted to try and make room. Tries to flick, can't connect, the ball hits his pad instead
back of a length on off stump, punched to sweeper cover
mishit. Wanted to drive this flighted off-stump ball through the covers, was a touch early on it and ended up dragging it out to deep midwicket
tossed up fuller now, outside off, driven to long-off
not short enough to cut, chops it straight to backward point
back of a length, punched to sweeper cover

Another dismissal against wristspin for Stokes. Excellent bowling from Chawla, saw Stokes coming early and tossed it wider and slower. He ended up too much under the ball and not enough behind it, and it was the googly too, spinning away from him and causing him to skew his attempted slog over mid-on to the man at cover, who moved backwards and to his left to get under the skier
flatter and fuller on middle stump, pushed down to long-off

bang, Stokes is away. Tossed up on off stump, right in his arc, and even though he's hitting against the turn, and the ball has a certain distance to turn before it hits his bat, he still swings cleanly and clears long-on
googly, but it's also a long-hop, but it doesn't get the punishment it probably deserves because there's a man back at deep forward square leg to keep it down to one
back of a length on off stump, punched to long-off
back of a length, slightly quicker. Another wrong'un hurrying on towards middle stump, punched to long-off
wrong'un, pitching outside leg. Buttler picks it and reverse-sweeps, but straight to backward point
shortish on off stump, flat-batted to the left of long-on and they sprint another couple
full now, on middle and off, jabbed to long-off
offbreak turning towards middle stump, clipped gently to the left of deep midwicket. He has to come in a fair distance off the rope, and they use that time to sprint two
down the track again, this time gets closer to the ball to drive to long-on
looks to step out but Narine holds his length back slightly while hurrying him with his pace. Can only defend it back towards the bowler
flat offbreak turning towards off stump, jabbed to midwicket

taken! Andre Russell, at short extra-cover, jumps and is at full stretch to grab this overhead chance two-handed, after Tripathi skips inside the line to try and loft this flighted wrong'un, pitching on leg stump, over the fielder
flatter and fuller on middle and leg, pushed into the vacant midwicket region but Kuldeep sprints across to save the single
short again, on off stump, and that's brilliantly done, super quick feet to jump right back and then swivel through the hips to pull into the gap between deep midwicket and long-on
back of a length skidder, going with the angle towards off stump, punched down to long-on
short ball, and Tripathi's eyes must have lit up for a second, because it looked eminently pullable, but it kept low. Kept his eyes on it and shovelled it down to long-on instead
tossed up on middle stump, driven quietly down to long-off for one
works this off a thick inside edge to Curran at deep midwicket
he's done him with a slider again. There's some drift back in. Short goes back to pull but is beaten by this 90kph delivery that goes straight on to beat his attempted whip and crash into the stumps.
slides back in and skids on, Short shapes to cut but ends up hitting it off the inside edge back to the bowler
whips this down to deep midwicket as they jog the single
forces this length ball from the crease to deep cover again
driven towards Chawla at sweeper cover
slaps this short of length delivery, Kuldeep at wide mid-off does well to pull off a sliding stop.

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Short, FOUR runs
long_text: pure timing, pure pace. There's width on this short delivery, Short stays back inside the crease and then steers this behind point.

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Short, SIX runs
long_text: deep into the stands at deep square!  Backed away to slash but saw the bowler dish in a short ball on middle and leg, Short picked the length, swiveled back and hammered this. The bat speed was tremendous!
glorious drive on the up but straight to sweeper cover
works this behind square, towards Shubman Gill at dreep square leg

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Short, no run
long_text: slaps this away-going length ball back to the bowler
tripe! Punished as Tripathi swivels back and slaps this to bisect long on and deep midwicket. Half-trackers too eas
works this full delivery on the pads to Curran at deep midwicket
gets a good stride in as he defends to short cover
defended back to the bowler, played this after it spun away.
too short and he's walloped this one bounce to the deep square leg boundary. Picked the length early. Key to the timing was he didn't look to smack this. All timing.
driven down to wide long off

short_text: Tom Curran to Short, FOUR runs
long_text: this is a lovely whip. Too short on middle and leg, uses his wrists to play this behind square and beat deep square leg. The best shot Short has played this season!
pulled away but not entirely in control, Kuldeep comes around to cut that off at deep backward square leg.
squared up by the length, but Tripathi readjusts as he angles this down to third man

whips this full delivery to deep midwicket. Another mix-up, Tripathi had to dive full stretch to get back after Short said no quite late for the second. Correct call in the end, there was no second run there.

short_text: Tom Curran to Short, no run
long_text: defends this full delivery from the crease to midwicket
slants in a full delivery on the stumps from wide of the crease, eased down to long on

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Short, no run
long_text: once again late on the forward defence. Gets a thick inside edge as he pushes outside the line of this delivery.

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Short, no run
long_text: Short was having a stroll like he'd do along the Yarra river back home. Saved because there's no direct hit at the striker's end from short midwicket. Just defended the ball and was casually wandering around the crease.

he's played the short-arm jab straight to Kuldeep at deep midwicket. Samson was cramped for room, hustled for pace as this angled back in to hit him high on the bat. Impressive effort delivery, the young man is elated. The dangerous Samson is gone.

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Samson, FOUR runs
long_text: ah, lovely. Square third man was no more than 10 yards away from the ball but couldn't get around. Just a hint of width, Samson opens the bat face to steer this behind point. Lovely timing.

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Samson, no run
long_text: skiddy back of length ball on off from wide of the crease, Samson punches back. Good one-handed stop by Mavi on his followthrough

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Samson, no run
long_text: late on the stroke. Looked to use the pace and steer this behind point but is beaten.
gets a good stride and smothers this.
too full on the stumps, worked to long on
has he got him? Foxed him with this googly. Samson played for the one that spins back in and was struck on the back pad. May have pitched outside leg.
the wrong'un this time, the length just a touch short, punched to long on
shapes to cut but this skids through to cramp him for room, chopped into the off side.
worked with the spin wide of midwicket
flatter and fuller on the stumps, eased to long on

some DK brilliance there to convert that into a wicket. Magnificent back-handed flick onto the stumps off his right hand. Smart bowling from Rana too. Saw Rahane step out, so he shortened his length and fired this in, Rahane looks to turn this to the leg side but ends up getting little bat on it. Karthik moves swiftly to his left, picks the ball up and flicks it back. I suspect Rahane took it easy and was done in by DK's speed. Stunning work.
goes back and across as he punches this down to long on

shapes to play a full-blooded drive but is drawn well forward, still can't get to the pitch of the ball. Gets a thick inside edge onto the ground. Was very close to the boot even as Karthik took the catch and asked for the umpires to check upstairs. The soft signal was not-out. Replays confirm the ball clearly hit the pad-boot and bounced before Karthik grabbed that. Straightforward decision for the TV umpire.
drifts in a shortish delivery into middle and leg, and Short tickles this past short fine leg. Easy pickings.
too full on off, eased down to long on
googly, shortish and turning in towards off stump, waits on it and dabs to short third man for one
floated up slow and overpitched outside off, driven down the ground nicely, but long-off is in place to keep it down to one
back of a length on off stump, stabbed to cover
a bit straighter now, the line, and he clips it down to long-on

tossed up wide of off, overpitched, and Rahane doesn't need to manufacture anything to put this away to the boundary. Just a nice stride forward and leans his weight into a drive to beat extra-cover to his right
tossed up, across the left-hander and drops onto off stump. Clipped to deep midwicket

back of a length, skiddy pace undoes Short's attempt to flick it off his legs. Hits him on the thigh pad and drops down by his feet, and Rahane calls early and is out of the blocks in a flash to steal a leg bye. Or did he get an inside edge on it?

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Short, FOUR runs
long_text: in the slot, and Short finally hits one out of the middle. Slower ball, nice and full, just outside off. Just extends his arms through it to clear mid-off
short now, and it skids on with pretty decent bounce to cramp Rahane who was looking to cut. Chops it down late into the backward point region

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Rahane, SIX runs
long_text: Rahane keeps playing his shots. He's probably read (and been angered by) our article questioning his place in the side. Down the track, and a shortish length on off stump ends up as a length he can lift over the bowler's head, to mid-off's right
back of a length again, on middle stump, whip-pulled to deep square leg

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Short, no run
long_text: back of a length close to off stump, angling across the left-hander, whipped to mid-on with a turn of his wrists
flat and quick length ball on middle and off, and he goes on the back foot to clip towards mid-on
a bit of flight now and he skips out to clip this to long-on
four in a row. Almost a replay of the previous ball. Drags it down short on off stump, and he skips away to make room and cut it away into that gap between backward point and cover point
this one's just a bad ball. Short, outside off, and he slaps it away between backward point and cover point
bam, two fours in a row. Jumps out of his crease early, slightly premeditated, to reach the pitch of this flat one outside off, and frees his arms to beat mid-off to his right
slowish length ball on off stump and Rahane gets down low and sweeps hard and fine, beats short fine leg to his left
another googly, outside off, another attempted cut, another play and miss. Watching this, a lot of teams are going to throw their wristspinners at Short.
back of a length legbreak, turns into his pads, clipped to square leg
another googly. Back of a length outside off, goes back to cut and the ball beats his outside edge
down the track and Chawla dangles it up wider and slower. Has to wait for it to land, brings his bottom hand into play to drag it down to long-on
tossed up outside off, Rahane goes for the reverse-sweep and misses

so many wrong'uns already. This is a length ball turning towards Short's off stump. Goes on the back foot to push gently into the midwicket region - the bowler has to chase with the fielder back on the boundary
slower now, another wrong'un. Turning down the leg side, but he doesn't pick it and the ball turns past his inside edge and hits pad as he looks to flick. Rolls away to short fine leg again
back of a length, slides on straight just outside off. Goes back and punches to extra-cover
down the track to a flighted ball outside off, drives hard to mid-off, just far enough to his right to pick up one
another inside-edge onto pad. This time he comes forward for a gentle push into the covers and fails to read the wrong'un again. Rolls away into the short fine leg region
nicely bowled, wrong'un. Pitching on a good length outside off. Short goes hard at it, looking for the big drive down the ground, gets a thick inside edge onto pad
flighted ball on off stump, swept along the ground to deep square leg
another shortish googly, spins in towards middle and leg. Deep square leg is back on the fence to keep Rahane's whippy pull down to one
third googly in a row. Starts very wide of off stump and Rahane looks to cut, but the ball spins in, cramps him, and skids through low to sneak under his bat
another googly, shorter this time. Short has plenty of time to wait on the back foot and punch to long-off
lovely. Back of a length, googly, starts by angling across and turns further away from the left-hander. No feet as he looks to punch into the off side, beaten on the outside edge
very full on off stump, almost a yorker, jabbed to extra-cover
starts with a full-toss on off stump. Whipped down to long-on to bring Short on strike
good length on leg stump, and Kohli can't flick it towards the leg side. Hits his thigh pad, and he whimpers in pain. Mumbai Indians win by 46 runs.
excellent ball from Bumrah. Extra short on middle stump, and Kohli flat-bats it over the non-striker's head. Through to long on, but says no to the run
moves on to 92! Full on off, and Kohli's down on one knee, and smacks this over the non-striker's head. What a shot
good length on off, and Kohli tries to slap this over the bowler's head. Played down the wrong line, and the delivery's through to Tare
good length outside off, and Kohli's back-foot punch takes a thick outside edge! Flies over backward point for a boundary. Can he get to hundred?
length ball outside off, drilled uppishly past extra cover. Only a couple
good length on leg stump, clipped off his pads to deep backward square. Keeps strike
overpitched on off stump, and tapped down the ground to long off
Super Siraj! Short on middle, and he gets his front leg out of the way before swinging through the ball's line. Tonks it over cow corner for half-a-dozen
yorker on middle stump, and Virat does well to dig it towards cover. Only a single
good length on middle, and Siraj slogs towards the leg side. Mistimed to cow corner
good length on leg, and that cramps him for room. Flicked off his pads to deep backward square but looks like he's overstepped. Free hit
full on leg stump, and in Kohli's slot. Big wind up, and then swings with the bat's full followthrough. Smacked into the long-on boundary

back of a length outside off, and Umesh tries to heave it over the off side. Slices it eventually, and the ball's in the air once again. Cover takes his time to get under it, and captain cool completes the catch. His hundredth wicket for Mumbai Indians
short outside off, and that's been defended off the back foot towards cover
good length on middle stump, tapped off the back foot to mid on
overpitched full outside off, and Woakes sticks his bat out. It takes the toe end of the bat, and then lobs into the air. Straight to short third man and Bumrah finally gets a wicket
slower ball, back of a length outside off. Woakes hasn't picked this up at all, and the ball goes under his attempted leg-side slog
good length outside off, and Kohli muscles this down the ground past Bumrah's left. He's disappointed with that shot
low full toss, but wide outside off. Caresses this drive to Krunal at deep extra cover
very short on leg stump, and enough time for Kohli to get in position. Goes deep onto the back foot and thumps this down the ground to wide long on
back of a length on middle, and going across Woakes' body. He flat-bats it to cover for a quick single
full on off, and Woakes gives it a wild leg-side heave. Mistimed to deep backward square this time
offcutter on leg stump, and Kohli can't flick this away. Hits his pad, and trickles away to the off side. They sneak through for a run
short arm jab over midwicket! Back of a length on leg, and Kohli comes dancing down the wicket. Gets in position early, and then swings through to the leg side
back of a length on middle, but Woakes misses the pull! The ball goes over his bat, and through to Tare
golf swing! Full on middle, and Woakes goes through with the bat's full swing. Comes off the bat's sweet spot, and it soars over the long-on boundary
back of a length on leg stump. Kohli stays on the back foot and whips it over midwicket to the man in the deep
classic Kohli! Good length on middle, and Kohli flat-bats it over Fizz's head with ease. Proper swing of the bat, and the shot is too well hit for Pollard to intercept
good length on leg stump, and Woakes does well to open his bat's face. Runs it down to third man once again. That's all Woakes is playing tonight
full on off stump, and Kohli whips this off his pads to long on
good length, just outside off. Woakes tries to run it fine past short third man, but can't thread the gap

waist-high full toss on middle stump with Kohli coming down the wicket. The ball slipped from his hand, I suspect, but the no-ball's not given. Kohli's not happy one bit. Just one of those days for the RCB captain
full on off stump. Woakes stays on the back foot and pushes to cover
back of a length outside off. Quite short, in fact, and Kohli comfortably punches down the ground to long on. Back to back fifties for Kohli
back of a length outside off. Woakes opens his bat's face and runs it down to third man. Sliding effort from Fizz in the deep saves some runs
short first ball! Tries to pull, but played under the ball. Through to Tare
good length on middle stump, worked off his legs to deep midwicket. Another excellent evening for Markande
purple cap for Markande! Full outside off, and spinning further away. Sarfraz came dancing down the wicket and attempts a big slog, but he's nowhere near the ball, and Tare does the rest.
full outside leg stump again, smothered with the spin and pushed down the ground to long on

overpitched, but outside leg stump. Clipped off his pads to cow corner, and Kohli wants the second. Sarfraz needs to hurry, and the throw from Pollard is good. Markande collects and whips the bails off, but Sarfraz just got back in time. Phew
good length on middle stump, but spins away from the batsman. Punched off the back foot to cover
lands the padding on the full! Excellent shot from Kohli this time. Flighted outside off, and he hits an exquisite inside-out drive over cover. Textbook stuff
slower ball, full outside off. Just sticks his bat out and meets it on the volley. Slapped past backward point for a useful boundary. Another time out
full outside off, and Sarfraz tries to paddle this over fine leg. Except, he plays it down the middle stump's line, while the ball was bowled outside off

short outside off, and he pulls this along the ground. Falls just short of midwicket and the throw hits Kishan's eyes on the bounce! This looks bad. He's on the ground, whimpering in pain. Hardik Pandya's hands on his head, he was the man who threw the ball. Kishan's still on the floor, and the team management look worried. His right eye looks very swollen. The physio is still working on him and I think he's being taken off. A big lump near his eye as he walks out of the ground. Who will keep now?
back of a length outside off, and all Sarfraz can do is chop it down to backward point. Scampers across for the single
good length outside off again. Opens his bat's face and taps it to backward point for a single
on the money first ball. Good length on off, and angling into the batsman. Fended off the back foot
flat, and full on middle stump. Tapped down the ground, but Krunal dives to his right and intercepts
beauty first ball to Sarfraz! What shape. Full on off, and turning across Sarfraz's bat as he tries to work it towards the leg side. Through to Kishan
waist-high full toss on leg stump. Misses the leg-side whip behind square. Mistimed to square leg
full outside off, and forces Sundar to reach at it. Tries to smack it over the bowler's head, but off the bat's toe end. In the air for ages, and easily taken by long off
extra bounce! Good length on off, and takes off after pitching. Sundar tries to cut, but he's nowhere near that shot
good length on middle stump. Washington stays on the back foot, and works it to deep midwicket for a couple
full outside off, and spins sharply into the left-hander. Tries to cut but too close to his body. The ball goes under his bat, and Kishan can't hold onto it either
full on middle stump, and Kohl tries to whip this over midwicket. Takes the leading edge and goes to cover instead. Lucky
full on off, and pushed away from his body. Played to point
full on off, and Washington uses his wrists to lift this over cover. Played inside out, and picked the googly well
good length wide outside off. Sticks his hands out, and taps towards point
tossed up on leg stump, and spinning across Kohli. Driven down the ground, off the front foot, to long off. Singles won't cut it now
full on middle and zips straight through to Sundar's pads. Forced to go deep onto the back foot, and defended back to Krunal
full on leg stump, and Kohli drives to long on for a walking single

holes out to cow corner first ball! Tossed up on off, and Anderson is already to hit the big shot. Slogs this across the line, but off the bat's toe end. Straight down the fielder's throat. Krunal Pandya is on cloud nine

this time Kishan stumps! Krunal goes wide outside off again, and Mandeep's stranded once more. Kishan collects it well this time, and easily removes Mandeep's stumps. Rohit looks impressed with Kishan's glovework. The batsman came down the ground way too early
good length on middle stump, no real pace on this delivery, forcing Kohli to create his own. Muscled towards cow corner
tossed up on leg stump, cramping Mandeep for space. Squeezed down the ground to long off for only a single
flat on leg stump, and Mandeep's quick to come down the ground. Muscles this straight-drive past Kohli to long on, but Suryakumar's diving effort in the deep stops the boundary
quicker ball, full on middle and leg. It's the googly too, so cramps Mandeep for room. Does well to flick it to midwicket
back of a length outside off, stays on the back foot and flat-bats it down to long off
good length on middle stump, worked towards the leg side
Markande's foxed him, but Kishan can't hold on! Overpitched very wide outside off, having seen Mandeep come down the wicket, misses the shot, but the ball pops out of Kishan's hands. Lucky
half-tracker on middle stump, but spinning into Kohli. Whipped off his pads to short fine leg
good length on off, and going straight through this time. Punched off the back foot to Markande
full on middle stump, and Kohli tries to drive straight. Takes the bat's outside edge, and goes towards point instead
good length on middle stump, and the ball takes some extra bounce after pitching. Gets big on Mandeep, but still manages to work this towards square leg
full on leg stump, and that's been swept! Only to Fizz at short fine leg, though
back of a length on middle stump, flicked off his pads to midwicket. Mistimed, but they'll still collect the single
low full toss on middle, because Mandeep comes charging down the wicket. Whipped off his pads to cow corner
good length outside off, and grips away from Kohli after pitching. Opens the bat's face and guides it to short third man

direct hit! Quicker ball, flat on off, and that's been pushed to mid off for a quick run. The throw is flat, and Mandeep, totally outstretched, is on the crease. Does he have any part of the bat over the line? This is too tough to call. Not out.
full on leg stump, and Mandeep comes charging down the wicket. Tries to flick it towards the leg side, but takes his pads instead. Mandeep will scamper across for the run nonetheless
full outside off, and sharply spins away from him. Driven away from his body to long off once again
not afraid to flight it at all. Tossed up on off, but comfortably driven to long off for a walking single
full on off, and turning away from Kohli. Pushed to long off for a walking single
googly! Good length outside off, and spins into Kohli's pads. Punched towards midwicket
full outside off, and spinning away from him. Defended towards cover
full outside leg, and clipped off his pads to deep midwicket. Comfortably played to the man in the deep. Also the time out
full outside leg, and enough time for Mandeep to smother this over square leg. Whipped to the man at deep backward square

just past the bat's outside edge! Full on off, and angling across Mandeep. Tried to open the bat's face and run it fine, but the ball zipped past his blade and through to Kishan. Could've easily taken the outside edge
full on off, and that's beautifully driven past cover! Takes a big stride forward and taps this half-volley with the bat's full followthrough. Excellent shot to the extra-cover boundary
full on middle stump, and angling across Kohli. Caresses this front-foot drive to mid off
just past the keeper's right! Yorker just outside off, and Kohli got his bat down to defend. Takes the outside edge, but goes past Kishan's dive. A valiant effort, but Kohli will collect the boundary
full on middle stump, but takes the pace off the ball. Defended towards cover with soft hands for a quick run. He'll keep strike
good length on middle stump, and Mandeep whips it off his pads to deep midwicket. Gets off the mark first ball

holes out to deep midwicket! That's two for the over. Short on middle, and AB pulls it hard. Hit well, but doesn't have the distance nor the elevation. Easy catch for Hardik, who takes a few steps forward, and completes the catch. Somebody stop McClenaghan!
rolls his fingers over this one. Good length on leg stump, and angling across Kohli. Tapped towards cover with soft hands
full on middle stump, and driven towards the on side. Beats the diving midwicket fielder, but intercepted by mid on

Crashes into off stump! McClenaghan removes de Kock for the third time in five games! Good length outside off, but always angling into de Kock. He came charging down the wicket to slap it past cover, but the ball goes under his bat and straight into the top of off stump. McClenaghan's pumped!
overpitched on off stump, and he manages to defend it into the ground. The ball bounces off the pitch, and over Fizz's head, to mid off

short_text: Mustafizur to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: full on leg, and in de Kock's range once again. Full swing of the bat, and it's come off the blade's sweet spot. Soars over long on!
back of a length on middle, and hits the upper-half of Kohli's bat. Defended towards cover - off the front foot - for a quick single
slower ball, on off stump. Kohli's forced to check his attempted drive, and taps it with soft hands to point instead. Wants the single, but eventually chooses not to. Smart choice
back of a length outside off, and rolls his fingers over this delivery. Cut square off the back foot to the man in the deep for a walking single

short_text: Mustafizur to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: full on off, and it's in de Kock's arc! It's a slower ball too, and he simply adjusts for the pace and then lifts it over midwicket. Falls just short of the cow-corner boundary
full outside off, and Kohli leans into the drive in a flash. Full followthrough of the bat, and creams it to the extra cover boundary. Can watch that shot all day long
full and wide outside off again, and this time de Kock slaps it behind square to deep point. They walk across for the single

short_text: McClenaghan to de Kock, no run
long_text: legcutter, wide outside off. Takes the pace off the delivery and QDK can't connect with the leg-side slap towards midwicket. Through to Kishan on the bounce
good length on leg stump, and clipped towards the leg side. Man there at deep midwicket

appeal for caught behind, but not given! What did that touch, the Mumbai players wonder, but they choose not to review. Good length on middle and zipping straight through. Kohli tried to flick it square off his pads, but the ball missed his bat and took the top of his pads
overpitched on off stump, and driven straight back to the bowler off the front foot
full on off stump, and Kohli drives down the ground to mid on. Stopped by the fielder there and that's thirteen off the over
good length, but wide outside of. Allows Kohli to stand tall and caress this drive past cover. No one in the deep
good length outside leg, but spins into Kohli's body thereafter. He tries to shoulder his arms, but the ball hits his body instead
full outside leg, and Kohli brings out that classical leg-side whip. Lifts his back leg before hitting this over Pollard at midwicket
good length on middle, and de Kock turns it towards the leg side with soft hands. Calls early for the single

short_text: Krunal to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: tossed up on off stump, and QDK sweeps this over square leg. Top edges it, but does enough to take it over the infield. Fine leg's inside the circle, so it's a relatively safe shot

pays the price with the extra ball! Full on off stump, and Kohli shuffles towards the off side. Gets behind the line of the ball, and plays a glorious straight drive past the non-striker to end the over
good length, just outside off. Kohli takes a step forward and fends it back to Bumrah

short_text: Bumrah to de Kock, 1 leg bye
long_text: slower ball, good length on leg stump. Cramps de Kock for space, who misses the whip towards the leg side. Hits his thigh pad
full outside leg, and de Kock misses the whip off his pads again. Lucky for him, it went down the leg side once again

short_text: Bumrah to de Kock, no run
long_text: full on leg stump, and de Kock misses the leg-side swipe. Hits his front pad, and big appeal from Bumrah, but the ball would've gone down leg stump
short and wide outside off again, but once more angling into Kohli's body. Opens his bat's face and runs it down to third man. First runs
back of a length outside off, gets big on Kohli, as he chops it down to third man
drilled down the ground, long-off was no more than five metres away from the ball but he had no chance. What a flourish, what a finish.
sees the batsman making room, bowls this full and wide. Umpire calls this wide, but Hardik has the presence of mind to scamper through.

he's hit this straight to Woakes at long on this time. Rohit won't get the hundred but what an innings he's played. For a while, it looked like he'd hit this well but Rohit knew there wasn't much power.

short_text: Anderson to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: flat bats this full toss back over the bowler's head, long on comes around but Woakes can't get there. The season's highest individual score

short_text: Anderson to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: this has been smacked over deep extra cover. Is that a no-ball? Thought I saw the umpire's right hand go out as he bowled the delivery. Missed his length completely, looking for a wide yorker, and Rohit picked that away. Okay, so this isn't a no-ball.

short_text: Anderson to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: lofted over the bowler's head, one bounce into the ropes. Clean strike down the ground

short_text: Anderson to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: looks to play a premeditated sweep but misses. Gave away his intentions too early
fires this full but way outside off. Given wide
lofted over the infield, down to deep cover.
drills this drive to sweeper cover
slaps this length ball, just clears long-off. This is back of length outside off, Pandya held his shape and waited for the ball before swinging through cleanly.
belted into the stands! This is a poor ball, tripe ball. This is too short., freebie for Pandya as he mucles this behind square

beauty first up. Snakes back in from length to kiss the outside edge?  Hardik reviews immediately.  Woakes the only one to appeal for this one.  There's a small little disturbance, can't really call it a spike.  Nothing conclusive, so the decision has been overturned. Kohli has a word with umpire Nitin Menon, more like letting out his frustration.

has hit this straight to long-on. Dragged this from outside, bat face turned in his hand which meant there was no power and AB took this nicely running around the ropes. Clever from Woakes as well, didn't give Pollard much pace to work with as he rolled his fingers over the ball.
rubbish ball. Full but way outside off, trying to bowl at that wide line to not allow Pollard a swing through the arc
squeezes out this yorker towards square leg.
excellent yorker, towards the base of middle, dug out.
full but veering in from wide of the crease, Rohit is off balance as he looks to ramp this towards short fine. There's an appeal, but Rohit got some bat on it.

short_text: Siraj to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: this is sitting up nicely for Rohit to belt this out of the ground at wide long-on. Third tier. Massive, massive hit. He just hasn't learnt. Keeps bowling length and keeps getting punished.
full and straight on off stump, drilled to long on
skiddy length ball on middle and leg, whipped towards deep midwicket
low full toss on the pads, flicked towards deep midwicket where Chahal and Woakes come up with a tag-team effort
steps out and slaps this length ball to Chahal at the edge of the ring at extra cover, he got some hand on the dive to take pace off. Siraj mops it up in the deep
slower ball at length but way outside off. Lost control on release, left alone. Wide

short_text: Yadav to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: reaches out to squeeze this full delivery to backward point. Saw Rohit backing away and bowled this wide. Nice from Umesh
thick outside edge to third man as he looks to slice this towards point
right into the blockhole, squeezed back past Umesh

short_text: Yadav to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: has that been picked up at the Marine Lines station? Full toss on his hips from wide of the crease, Rohit simply lends direction to this and deposits this deep into the stands at fine leg.
gets right forward and defends this full ball on off stump
chips this down towards long-off

short_text: Anderson to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: buffet ball. Short, wide outside off and Rohit belted this through point. No chance for square third man. Pretty similar to the first delivery. Very poor from Corey Anderson

short_text: Anderson to Rohit Sharma, 1 run, OUT
long_text: steps out and swings this length ball back towards long-on. Anderson put his left hand out but couldn't stop. The throw from Woakes was flat, Anderson collected the ball cleanly and removed the bails. Remains to be seen if the dive saved Krunal. No. He's short by a long way.

short_text: Anderson to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: right into the blockhole, dug out to the off side, nearly a collision with the bowler at the non-striker's end. Krunal receives some treatment and water. Small break in play.

short_text: Anderson to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: width and he's hammered this to the point boundary like a - insert your favourite word -  tracer bullet
pulled behind square to beat Washington at fine leg. Too much pace to work with, easy pickings.
dug in short but this is just outside leg. Not called though. That's one bouncer for the over.
drills this drive to sweeper cover

short_text: Yadav to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: flicks this low full toss to midwicket. Looks at the bat immediately

short_text: Yadav to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: short, wide and he's slashed this to the third man boundary. 32-ball half-century  for the skipper. He's back and how

short_text: Yadav to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: hasn't started well. This has been pulled into the deep square leg boundary with some style and nonchalance. Rohit picked the length early and allowed his timing to do the rest.
just lands short of a diving Kohli at cover. Nicely tossed up wide outside off, Krunal looked to reach out and go over cover but there was no timing on this one.
shortish delivery angling in towards leg stump, whipped towards deep midwicket
goes across again and fetches this slog sweep, on the bounce to deep midwicket

he's not only picked the googly but also gotten himself right towards the delivery and hoicked it across the line to clear long-on. Chahal specifically drifted this across, Krunal ended up dragging it but he got plenty of wood on that
touch short, spinning away from outside off, Rohit slaps this to sweeper cover
toe-ends a lofted hit to long-on
short, slow and very wide outside off. Forces Krunal to reach at it, but he's through his shot too early. Drags the shot towards mid on, but with no power
soft appeal for lbw, but turned down. Good length on leg stump, and Krunal can't connect with the leg-side swipe. Takes the top of his pad and the ball trickles away towards cover
too short! Pitches on middle, and soars over Pandya's head. He didn't even bother playing a shot. Kohli, however, is not pleased, but replays suggest that the umpire got it spot on

half-tracker on middle stump, but bowls very straight. Krunal rocks back and check-drives back to Siraj. Aggression from the bowler, who takes a aim at Krunal's stumps  but doesn't throw it in the end
on middle stump, and Krunal muscles this towards the leg side. Mistimes a slog over midwicket to the man in the deep. Not hit well at all
almost chopped on! Good length on off, and Krunal's cut shot is too close to his body. Takes the toe end of the bat, and goes to the keeper on the bounce
starts off with the ball that zips through the surface. Good length on off and Krunal's forced to defend off the back foot

short_text: Anderson to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: miscommunication, but safe! Good length on middle, and Rohit opens his bat's face to run it down to third man. No run on offer, but krunal's halfway down the wicket anyway. Does well to turn and run back

short_text: Anderson to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: short on leg stump, and this is cattle fodder for Rohit. Rides the bounce and pulls over the square-leg umpire with ease. No chance for fine leg either

full on off and driven away from his body. Takes a thick outside edge, and flies over point to third man. Slight misfield from Sarfraz there, but manages to recover quickly enough. Virat ain't pleased though

short_text: Anderson to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: full on off stump, and going across Rohit. Punched off the back foot to cover point

top edged, and taken! De Kock gets under it and completes a swirling catch. Tried to flat-bat this over mid on, with the ball angling into Lewis' body, but he's through his shot too early, and comes off the toe end. It was in the air for a long time, and QDK had to run backwards for a while before the ball came back to Earth
good length on middle stump, attempted pull off the back foot only goes to mid off

short_text: Chahal to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: full on leg stump, and Rohit tries to defend inside out. Pushed past the bowler's left to mid off
good length outside off, and Lewis pokes at it off the back foot. Played to short third man
second tier! Full on middle, and slog-swept over deep midwicket this time. Once again quick to get down on one knee, and then Lewis' bat speed does the rest

releases the pressure! Two dot balls, but Lewis ain't wasting the third. Tossed up on off, and Lewis comes down the wicket to lift it over long off. Not even the best of shots, with the bat turning while hitting the shot, but enough power to clear the boundary
short and wide outside off, and forces Lewis to reach at it. The ball stays low and he misses the cut once again. He's surprised that it's not a wide, but the ball was inside the tram-lines
full outside off, and zipping straight across Lewis' body. Tries to punch towards cover, but misses competely

good length just outside off and another slower ball to end the over. Opens his bat's face and taps it to point, but Lewis once again wants a risky run. Rohit needs to put in a dive at the batsman's end to be assured of his safety. The ball eventually hits his elbow
full and wide outside off, Rohit sticks his bat out and jams this shot to backward point. He wants a risky single, and Lewis would've been gone if Mandeep had connected with the direct hit!

short_text: Anderson to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: slower ball, on a good length. Punched down the ground - past the bowler - to mid on

short_text: Anderson to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: lifted over cover this time! This one's much stylish. Slightly fuller on off, and Rohit drives this through the ball's line. Hit over the man at cover, and just beyond mid off too. Races away to the boundary in no time

short_text: Anderson to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: slapped past cover! Half-tracker on off and angling across Rohit. He comes dancing down the wicket and hits this through the ball's line. Goes through cover and mid off

short_text: Anderson to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: on off stump, and defended off the front foot. Tapped to cover
good length outside off, and sliding straight through. Tries to cut, but the ball creeps under his bat. Sharply taken by the keeper
down on one knee, and sent over midwicket! Tossed up on middle, and Lewis was quick to gauge the ball's length. Slog-sweeps it over the leg side and what a way to get to your first IPL fifty
wild! Short way outside off, but spins sharply inwards thereafter to eventually finish inside the tram-lines. Lewis left it alone, thinking it'll be a wide, but the umpire disagreed
good length outside off, and despite the ball staying low, Lewis manages to cut off the back foot to deep point. The throw from the deep is awry, but there was someone backing up
tossed up full on middle and leg. Rohit comes down the wicket and drives past the non-striker. Almost a caught-and-bowled chance for Chahal first up
half-tracker, and Lewis swivels to pulls this square! Rocked back onto his backfoot, and slapped this off his pads. Deep midwicket's sliding effort goes in vain. Another expensive Washington over

turn and bounce! Good length on off and once again spinning into Rohit's body. Cramped for room as he tries to punch to long off, but the extra bounce makes it come off the bat's top half. Played in the air, but eventually safe
full on off, and angling into the left-hander. Driven down the ground off the front foot to long on for a walking single
good length on off, and spinning inwards again. Tapped off the back foot to the man at third man. They scamper across for the run

short_text: Sundar to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: great use of his feet! Good length on middle, and Rohit comes dancing down the wicket to whip it over midwicket. Into the stands at cow corner

short_text: Sundar to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: good length on off, and turns sharply into Rohit. Extra bounce too, and the batsman defends towards the leg side
overpitched on off, and Lewis crunches this drive to Kohli at cover. Well stopped by the fielder there and has an aim at the stumps. Good comeback from Siraj. Only three of the over
short on off, and enough room for Lewis to cut. But he tries to play this with hands that were too hard, and can only bottom-edge it towards the keeper
good length outside off, and Rohit punches off the back foot. Hit with the bat's open face, and comfortably played to third man

short_text: Siraj to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: good length on off, but much quicker (142 kph) this time. Rohit shuffles across to the off side and defends with soft hands
short on middle, and angling across Lewis. Tries to muscle this cut behind square, but mistimes it instead. Through to the man in the deep
goes back of a length, and pitches on off stump. Rohit stands tall and opens his bat's face, and comfortably runs it down fine to third man. Carefully sees the ball onto his bat
sees the batsman trying to move across and bowls this wide, left alone in anticipation of this being called wide, but this isn't.
can't split the gap at cover. Timed superbly but straight to cover.
stands tall and bunts this short of length delivery to backward point
slower and fuller outside off, hint of drift in, this is dabbed straight to short third man
beaten off a full toss. Went to blast this through cover, played too early
beats short third man. Poor from Siraj. This is full outside off, Lewis uses the pace to run it down. So, so clever.
toe-ends a lofted hit to mid-on, they scamper a run even as AB's throw misses the stumps at the bowler's end
slower ball outside off, but this nicely comes on as Lewis splits the gap between backward point and short third man. Siraj's bleeding runs already.
slower length ball outside off, left alone but guess what? De Kock has let this through his legs. Four byes. Very poor.  Kohli fumes
excellent yorker, right towards the base of leg stump, Lewis jammed his bat down quickly to keep that out. A single may have been on, but Rohit lost his balance at the bowler's end
belted but on the bounce to Kohli at extra cover
floats this full and slants this across, defended from the crease towards cover point
what a welcome! This is too short and down leg, this is like a scoop of ice cream for Lewis. Swivels back and helps him along the way to clear deep backward square leg.
just in!  Saved by a centimeter or so, I'd say. This was a direct hit at the bowler's end from short third man. Lewis jabbed at this and was late to react to Rohit's call. Somehow made it in the end.
poor from Washington. Drifts this down leg, Lewis paddles this fine to beat the man at 45. Easy pickings
fired down leg, Lewis shapes to sweep but misses. de Kock may have been blinded by the drift. Useful runs
too much width and he's slashed this to beat point. Used the depth of the crease superbly
gentle little dab towards extra cover for a quick single

short_text: Sundar to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: skids through from length on off, defended back

short_text: Sundar to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: pushed through quicker at length outside off, Rohit punches this between cover and point. Sublime timing
opens the bat face late to steer this down to third man

short_text: Yadav to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: stands tall and bunts this length delivery towards cover
overpitches, this has bee belted to wide long-off. Siraj was sent to the ropes prior to this delivery precisely for this
drills this drive, but can't beat mid-off.
too short down leg, Lewis swivels back and helps this along to beat short fine leg. Easy pickings
drives this low full toss to mid-off.
pushes outside the line, gets a thick inside edge towards fine leg
pulled and this is into the second tier at deep square leg. Picked the length early, swivelled back and smacked that away.
stays right behind the line of this length ball as he defends
too full, this is driven down but straight to AB at mid-off

short_text: Woakes to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: driven imperiously through extra cover. This is a touch ahead of length and Rohit leans forward to ease that between cover and mid-off. Pure timing, pure gold.

short_text: Woakes to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: full on off, Rohit drives straight to mid-on
short of length ball slanting away, Lewis gets on top of the bounce and blocks
steps out and punches this on the up, but Siraj throws himself to his right to put out a superb stop at mid-off. Saved three runs
shapes back in late, driven to mid-on as they scamper a quick single

short_text: Yadav to Rohit Sharma, 1 leg bye
long_text: hat-trick averted!  This drifted into the pads, Rohit late on the flick, hits the pad and deflects to the off side.

what is happening here? This is sensational from Umesh. Fast, furious and straight. Right through Kishan's drive. Clean bowled, dream ball. Rohit is scampering to get his pads on and rush out. This is full outside off, the ball curves back in and then beats a loose drive to crash itno the off stump. Stunning from Umesh
goes through his defence!  What a ball first up. This moves holds its line from length on off and beats Surya's loose drive. Golden duck, dream start.
chips it back at the bowler. And that's the game for KKR. A googly, lobbed up nicely on middle stump. Boult wants to flick through midwicket but he's done by the turn and finds the bowler
full ball floated wide outside off. Lifts it inside-out to sweeper cover
length ball outside off, shuffles across and blocks on the front foot. A gorgeous forward block from Boult, as always.
taken at midwicket. Length ball at off stump, turning away from him. Steps out as it climbs on him. Looks to go over the leg side but ends up slicing it high into the air
length on middle stump, leans in and flicks to deep midwicket
short of a length outside off, steps out and jabs it through point
short of a length just outside off, nudged past cover off the back foot
good length on middle stump. Spins into the pads as he looks to flick
sails over first slip. A googly, full outside off. Once again, he's looking to go midwicket. It's a top edge
googly. Short of a length outside off. Sets up for the slog, adjusts for the cut. Doesn't get bat on it in the end
short googly outside off, under-edge on the cut through cover
length on off, pushed to extra cover off the front foot

high in the air before it plonks some five yards inside the circle. Too far from long-on. The bowler should have gone for that, really. It's a googly, and he gets a top edge as he looks to clobber it over midwicket
full toss on leg stump, laboured drive to long-on
full floater outside off, guided straight to deep point

loud appeal for lbw. It's given. Shankar will review this. He's caught on the back foot trying to flick. He's shuffled too. Middle and leg stump visible. This will be plumb if he hasn't got bat on it. Pitching outside off, spinning back in and hitting off stump.
length ball on middle stump. Dabbed through square leg off the back foot

bowled him. Narine with a nice loopy offbreak on length, not a harmful delivery. The kind you block with a smile in a Test match. Morris has a mission though, and a steep target. Makes room and tries to go over extra cover. Misses it completely. That's his 100th IPL wicket
short of a length and turning away outside off. Nudges to deep midwicket off the back foot
length on middle stump, stays still and taps it to deep midwicket
tossed up outside off, leans in and drives to long-on

short ball, downfall. Another batsman finds the fielder off a half-tracker. It's the pace that's doing it. So slow from Kuldeep, halfway down the pitch. It's a googly but at that length it doesn't matter. Maxwell just has to generate too much power on this occasion. Mis-times and finds deep midwicket
huge! Gigantic. What power from Mawell. Length ball pushed through flat at leg stump and he slogs it what must, surely, be at least a 100 metres over the midwicket region

Mavi lobs it over the boundary! Oh so close. Kuldeep tosses this right up and Maxwell has to think twice before pulling out the slog. Doesn't get a lot of bat on it. Mavi is behind it at long-on but looks like he's panicked right at the end
length ball outside off, spins in sharply and beats him as he looks to play the reverse sweep
googly, pushed flat and across off stump. Maxwell gets behind it and thumps it hard to long-on's right. Mavi does superbly to get down and behind that

short_text: Tom Curran to Shankar, no run
long_text: good length outside off, defends towards point off the front foot
legcutter, length and just outside off. Slices on the up towards sweeper cover
short of a length and in at leg stump. Gets deep in the crease and nudges it towards fine leg

straight toe extra cover. The Tewatia experiment ends quickly. It's a length ball outside off and he can get neither power, or elevation as he tries to clear the fielder there. Russell, the man, slightly wrongfooted - moving to his left - but holds on above his right shoulder
another slower ball. Short and wide outside off, cut straight to sweeper cover

short_text: Tom Curran to Maxwell, SIX runs
long_text: that's a woeful ball. Dropped short, a slower ball, on leg stump. Maxwell swivels and sends this flying over the fine leg region with a hoick
length ball outside off, looks to drive with no feet. Thick outside edge between backward point and short third
googly outside off. Shuffles right across to get behind it and pull wide of long-on
googly. Length and spinnning in from off stump. Tewatia watchful as he taps it through midwicket

finds deep midwicket! It's a short ball. Very short. Turning away from off. Pant gets behind and wallops this flat to find Chawla out there. He is not happy getting out like that. Could have hit it wide of the fielder without too much effort. A good innings ends
googly, short and wide outside off. Cut straight to sweeper cover
slow length ball pushed across off stump. Swivels to get in position for the reverse sweep and just manages to get bat on it to get it past short third

short_text: Tom Curran to Pant, no run
long_text: slower short ball. Makes up his mind early to leave this and it loops over him as he adjusts to get out of the way after ducking
length on off stump, stays in the crease and nudges to long-on

short_text: Tom Curran to Maxwell, no run
long_text: good length and in at off stump. Tapped to extra cover from the crease

short_text: Tom Curran to Maxwell, SIX runs
long_text: top edge flies fine. It's a short ball angled down leg. He's cramped on the pull but fine leg is in and he makes no effort to try and control this
short of a length outside off, chops it to point's left

short_text: Tom Curran to Pant, FOUR runs
long_text: overpitched with a lot of room outside off. Pant lives for this. Stays tall and drills it past extra cover
length ball outside leg, a googly. Looks to sweep but gets it towards short fine off the thigh guard
short ball outside off, looks to slice it past short third man but Lynn gets down quickly to his right, making extra sure he doesn't land on his problematic shoulder
slider, back of a length on middle stump. Drags it to deep square's left with a pull off the inside half
googly at a good length outside off. Leaves it alone and half-apologises to himself
well played. It's a quicker one from Chawla and he's a little late getting back on this. Chops it very very late to get it past backward point
full ball floated up with a lot of room outside off. Reaches out and slices it over extra cover to find the boundary
length ball spinning away from off and he does well not to let it go past him. He's beaten in flight as he steps out but manages to tuck it into the midwicket region
length ball floated up at off stump, defended down the pitch
length ball on middle stump, gets down and sweeps between short fine and square leg
oh good shot. Mid-on is in, strangely. Pant meets this length ball on the pitch outside off and drills it wide of him
short of a length outside off. Gets deep in the crease and wants to punch through midwicket. Gets it to short fine off the inside edge
full on middle stump, gets down and drags a sweep to deep midwicket's left

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Maxwell, no run
long_text: slower bouncer foxes Maxwell. He wants to leave it, just outside off. But he realises it's a slower one and thinks momentarily about trying to jab it over the keeper. It's too late and he's unhappy:  "oh nooooooo"

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Maxwell, FOUR runs
long_text: short and wide outside off. Small step back aaaaaand chop. Through point
slower ball. Floated full on leg stump and clipped to deep square leg

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Maxwell, 1 leg bye
long_text: short of a length and in at off stump. Looks to flick but he misses too. Deflected into the off side off the thigh guard

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Pant, 1 leg bye
long_text: length on leg stump, looks to flick but it pings off the thigh guard through the open square leg region

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Pant, no run
long_text: length ball slanted wide outside off, slashes and misses
just clears cover. Maxwell backing away at this short ball, has got this cut off the toe-end. It loops over the infield. Lucky
good length outside off, tapped straight to mid-off on the up
length on off stump, taps it in front of cover point and steals a quick single
full outside off, front foot pointed into the leg side and head falling away as he tries to cream this over cover. Get it off the outside half and finds the boundary anyway
bouncer lifting sharply just outside leg stump. Late on the hook. Karthik (and me) think there's a sound there. Umpire has his arms spread to signal wide
nicely done. Full ball on off stump, drilled straight past the non-striker and there's no stopping that
bizzare shot. Length ball on off. He looks to reverse-ramp this. Awfuly position for the shot and he cops it on the back thigh

chops it on! Mavi has Gambhir, Delhi has panic! 144kph hour, short and just outside off, in the corridor. Gambhir leaps off the ground to try and cut, but it's too close and too quick. He's cramped and he's out.
bouncer at his front shoulder. Falls away into the leg side awkwardly and gets cramped on the hook. Takes one hand off as well as this rolls into the square leg area

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Pant, FOUR runs
long_text: drops it too short and is punished. Attempted offcutter but there's a lot of time to adjust. Reaches out and steers it wide of short fine
top edge on the pull. He's hurried on that shot. Short one at the hips. Luckily for him, he gets it well in front of square
bouncer. Too short. Well down leg side. He looks to whip this away but it's too wide

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Pant, no run
long_text: good length just outside off, tapped towards mid-off on the up
short of a length on leg stump, allows it to come on and whips to fine leg
full on middle stump, stays still in the crease and drills this straight to mid-on
attempted bouncer. Too far down leg side again. Pant ducks it
full ball fired down leg side. Lets it go

Rana leaps to his left and holds on. Iyer stuck in a strange position for the late cut. It's a short ball just outside off. It looks like he changes his mind on the late cut very late and wants to just defend it. In the end, hangs the bat out and it's a sharp catch
short and wide outside off. Sits up perfectly with a lot of width and he slaps it through cover point
falls short of fine leg. Hit that better than he expected. Short ball on the hips and he whips it uppishly towards Mavi
overpitched ball just outside off. Front leg out of the way and carved through cover. No fuss, too simple.
length ball on middle stump, stands tall in the crease and punches straight to mid-off
googly, spinning in towards middle stump from a good length. Stays in the crease and taps it into the leg side

leg-side stumping! Roy loses his balance completely. It's a slider down leg side that keeps going away from him as he walks down the pitch for some reason. Has to reach out a long way for the flick and he won't get there. Karthik's toughest task there is gathering the ball. He does that properly and then the stumping is relatively easy
slider, short of a length outside off. Looks to cut and under-edges into the pitch
googly, floated full on middle stump. Gets the front leg out of the way and drives to Russell's left at mid-off
slider, full and in at leg stump. Leans in and flicks to deep midiwicket
full ball outside off, plants the front leg out and yorks himself. Looks to flick and gets it into his toe
full on leg stump, flicked straight to deep midwicket
and another wicket. What a last over this has been Curran steps down the track and chips this in the air, straight into the hands of long-on

Chawla comes down the track for a big hit. A non-turner again, pretty wide of Chawla, and he was probably expecting it to turn into him, but as he doesn't, he skews it in the air off the outside of the bat and the keeper settles under it
really slows it up and gets it to skid across without turn, Chawla swings and misses
gets down for a big sweep to a completely wrong length and line. Not full by any means and slanted a long way across
tame! Very soft dismissal. A bit of room outside off and he flays this with a flat bat, but picks out point. Gill having a tough start to his IPL career
short of a length, spinning in, punched away through the covers
full toss, he stays really back in the crease and just makes use of the angle to help it along to fine leg
full and angling in towards off, jabbed too straight down the ground as it crashes into the stumps at the non-striker's end
full, drifts into the pads, clipped through backward square leg
slower ball, miscues as he tries to loft it over the off side and sends it soaring into the sky. Gambhir settles under it at cover. End of a top innings
goes deep in his crease and tries to jab it through point but gets the bottom edge and rolls down the pitch
that's amazing: power, wristwork and bat speed. Had everything. Full and wide from Morris and he carts it through backward point as it breezes past the sweeper running to his right at the boundary
full, drifts it a long way across, and called a wide
full, angled into him and dips on him, flicked through square leg
that's a stunning shot. Beautifully done, backs away to a middle-stump yorker and jams the bat down before opening the face to glide it smartly through third man
fullish around off, drilled extremely hard one-bounce to long-off
oh, shot. Terrific strike from Gill first ball as he pulls it with lots of bottom hand power through midwicket

bowled him! Very good delivery from Boult, almost the perfect delivery to Russell. Fires it in around leg stump and rolls his fingers over it to slow it up. It then dips really late with Russell swinging for the fences, and takes out leg stump
extremely full, straightish around off, and he gets a leading edge as he closes his face. Fifty for Rana
clears long-off off the toe-end! Bouncer just outside off, backs away and looks to go over the leg side. He's cramped and gets it right off the bottom but it clears the fielder easily
pumped deep into the stands. Shami feeds the swing outside off with a slower ball on a good length. Russell pummels it 102 metres, far behind deep midwicket
full ball outside off, gets low and lofts a drive uppishly towards sweeper cover
slower ball, back of a length on off stump. Backs away and pushes straight to extra cover
yorker on off stump, backs away and jams it to long-off
carves it over sweeper cover! There's no pace on that. It's a knuckle ball floating away. But he makes room, gets under it on one knee and lifts it cleanly over the fielder there
goes too hard at this fullish length ball and loses shape as he swings, skewed off the toe-end into the off side
makes some room to a back of a length delivery and deftly opens the face to drop it to short third man
yorker outside off, backs away and ekes out an inside edge into the leg side
slower short ball, Rana does superbly to hold his shape. Front foot out of the way and a gentle glide over backward point. Picks the gap nicely
short of a length, backs away and tries to ramp it over and the ball shoots over the bat
short ball, angled across him, and Rana flays a pull over midwicket. Another massive hit
oh, that's huge! That's a massive strike. So much power in those arms as he backs away to a short one and lofts it over deep midwicket with the angle. Miles into the stands
full on off-stump, gives himself a little room, and he lifts it straight over long-off with a straight bat
dropped. Roy gets around it but does not time his dive well. Russell gets a top-edge on this slow short delivery and with no room, he skewed it off the toe-end
shot! A short one that climbs into him hurriedly, and Russell jumps and flays it over the third man region with a well-timed ramp
slower ball again, finds the inside edge of Rana's bat as he tries to drill it through the off side
back of a length, nips away outside off, dropped into cover for one
tapped to point and he is sent back

that's another poor delivery. Morris is nicely feeding to the batsmen's strengths here. Lots of room outside off, and all he swings across without moving his feet but still manages good meat to clear long-on by a distance
and attempts a third hit through the same region, but Gambhir had Boult from square leg after those two boundaries, and Karthik knocks it straight into the hands of the fielder there
one ball after being dispatched for four, Morris offers the same delivery again, and Karthik responds with the same shot. Through midwicket
fullish length, flicked off the pads, just a pick-up shot over midwicket
slower length ball around middle and leg, drops it into the off side for a quick one
hangs back to a length ball and opens the face to third man
has that swung away? Karthik throws his hands hard at a length ball, it's a swipe across the line. It's a kuckle ball and lobs in the air off the outside edge
back of a length around off, waits and opens the face to third man
good length around off, lets it come on before opening the face to run it down to third man
plays across another skiddy fullish length ball and gets a leading edge through the covers. Boult fires in a quick throw running in from the sweeper boundary

given! Shami hits the pad of Karthik and it seemed pretty plumb. But Karthik has no hesitation in going for the review. Could he have got an inside edge? This may be too high. Shami gets this to skid in off a length and Karthik has indeed got an inside edge on the flick. And it seems as though the ball may have gone over as well
moves across and tries to clip a leg-stump fuller one, gets hit on the pad as it rolls to the keeper. Appeal for leg before withheld
length ball around off, punched into the covers for one
shortish, angled in and tucked up for room, and Karthik gets the top-edge on the pull as he steps down, and sends it soaring over deep backward square leg
on the pads this time as Rana flicks to backward square leg and slips in his hurry to get back for the second. Has to settle for one
short of a length, no pace, and again stops on him a little as he swivels and pulls to deep square leg
starts off neatly with a fuller one on the stumps, clipped into the leg side
short of a length, stops on him a little as he closes the face early and gets an inside edge into the pad
slower short ball, gets up too much, and called a wide

good catch from Jason Roy at long-on. Again no room for Lynn as Shami angles in a knuckle ball to his middle and leg stumps. Lynn miscues it, gets no power behind it, and Roy dives in front to snaffle a smart catch
back of a length, angled into him, backs away and swings across the line to get beaten
short of a length, backs away and absolutely shovels it, reaches Boult in seconds and he does well to stop it at deep point
short and angled across, a bit of extra bounce as he slaps it off the upper portion of the bat to deep backward point
short of good length, angled into the body, turned away into the leg side

Nadeem belts out an appeal for a leg before as Rana gets down to sweep and is hit on the pad. Not out is the on-field call, and it seems as though the impact may be outside off, but Nadeem convinces Gambhir to go for the review. Oops, seems like it may be well outside off. Also got to rule out the under-edge on the sweep. That seems alright, and the impact is miles outside off. Horrific review
short of a length, straightening around middle, Lynn backs away and slaps it to sweeper cover
advances down the ground and drills this to long-on
floats this up around the fourth-stump channel and Rana sweeps with the turn to backward square leg
Nadeem fires this one a length, and Rana advances down the ground and launches this over long-on
short, and though it spins into him, there's enough room to open up for a hard slap to the right of sweeper cover
good length on leg stump, big stride and he tickles it to short fine
length ball outside off. Gets down and looks for the reverse-whip. But he's through it early and cops it on the body
this is high and it's far enough. Length ball on middle and he gets down for the slog sweep. Appears to have got too far under it, but he has hit it cleanly
length on off stump, pushed to extra cover off the front foot
thick outside edge against the googly. Looks to drive this length ball through cover and is reaching out a long way with his hands in the end
short of a length just outside off, opens the face and runs it straight to short third man
short of a length and spinning in at off stump. Gets deep in the crease and pushes through midwicket
arm ball hurries him as he backs into the leg side. Just manages to chop this to sweeper cover
short of a length on off stump, backs away and taps to extra cover on the up
top edge is taken this time. Looks like Uthappa was late on the slog sweep this time. Nadeem gets some grip from a good length and marginal turn away from off stump. He completes a simple catch too
short ball outside off, backs away and cuts to sweeper cover
short of a length outside off, low skidder. Gets on the back foot and drags this to long-on's right
googly on a middle stump line, pushed anxiously back down the pitch
short of a length, bowled with the front of the hand. Gets on the back foot and punches to long-on
length on middle, flicked to deep midwicket

top edge lands between short third and short fine. Lucky. It's a very slow short ball and he's through the pull too early. Keeper doesn't know where it is as this lifts over his head and the fielders can't reach it
he isn't taking kindly to the demotion! In the mood today, Uthappa. No nudging around - puts a big front foot stride out and meets it as it lands on the pitch to send the slog sweep into orbit
tossed up at middle stump, allows it to come on and nudges it to deep midwicket from the crease
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
deft. Nadeem in panic mode. Looks for the arm ball but drops it very short and very wide. Uthappa lets it come on and caresses it past cover point

hammers it straight over the bowler's head off the back foot. Incredible shot. Not a lot of pace from the spinner but he gets it to clear the fence easily as he gets behind the line in front of off stump
short of a length on leg stump, gets behind the line and taps it to deep midwicket's right. Works hard to come back for the second
oh yes. Right off the middle. Nadeem goes flat and on a length at leg stump. It skids through unlike the previous ball and Uthappa hits cleanly through the line to send this far over deep midwicket
beats the outside edge with a nicely landed length ball, drifting in at off stump and spinning sharply away
mis-hit. Again.. It's a full toss on middle and he goes across the line and lifts this in long-on's direction but Morris, running in, can't get there or get his body behind to stop it
inside half but hit well enough to find the long-off boundary. Length ball coming in at off stump. He backs away and hammers it past the bowler
short of a length just outside off, drops it into the off side with soft hands and steals a run
shot. Classic Uthappa. Length ball on middle stump, half a stride across off stump and a clean punch straight over the bowler on the up
beaten as he looks to run this past slip. Length ball in the corridor
good length on leg stump, tapped straight to short midwicket
grip off the pitch and a leading edge as Lynn tries to flick through midwicket. Loopy length ball on off stump and he closes the face too early
short of a length on leg stump, tapped to deep midwicket off the back foot
slider at leg stump. Skidding in from a length and gets the inside half of the bat and dribbles past non-striker. He was looking to punch through the off side
dropped marginally short on a leg stump line. He backs away and slaps it through cover
length and skidding in at middle stump. Backs away and pushes to mid-off
length ball pushed in at middle stump from around the wicket. Plants the front leg across and taps it through the open midwicket region
slap. Lynn gets room outside off and he duly sends it flying over point. Right off the middle this time. Short from Boult but not climbing up enough to cause trouble
short of a length in the corridor, watchfully poked on the up and he gets it out to third man off the thick outside edge
good length and past the outside edge. Uthappa late on the forward push as this slants away

Pant lobs it up, slip completes the catch. Is it the second bouncer? The umpires are checking .it's just under the shoulder. We all know the theory. Short ball to Narine. Boult goes with that, cramps him on the hook and gets it to tickle the top edge. Pant leaps up, one-handed, but he can't hold on. Slip has a few yards to cover behind and completes a simple catch
nicely done. Bouncer at an off stump line. Narine backs away again to try and slice over slip. Well beaten
yorker speared in at middle stump. Narine backs away and tries to squeeze it behind point, but he can only jam it into the leg side
short of a length just outside off, mistimed punch on the up, straight to mid-off
beaten again. Length ball jags away from off stump. Lynn gets too far leg side of it and is swishing aimlessly in the end
off the mark with a six, but it's not well-timed. Length ball at leg stump and that's what he needs to bring in the slog. Drags it over the midwicket boundary
short of a length again, cramped at chest height this time. Swats and makes connection this time, but it's straight to midwicket off the inside half of the bat
beaten on the inside edge. Morris bangs it in again, gets it to nip back off the seam. It's waist height as Lynn backs away to try and swat this behind square.
short of a length in the corridor. More lift off the surface than he anticipates as he tries to stab it through the off side. Gets a thick inside edge to dribble through square leg
full toss outside off, drilled straight to cover. That's a maiden, against Lynn. The first one of the season.

beats the off stump! Lynn exposes the stumps and it looks like he's anticipating the ball to swing into him from an off stump line. Wants to drill it through cover, but this ball goes straight through with the angle
short of a length just outside off, wafts at it on the up but misses
good length on off stump, punched on the up to cover
short ball climbing up and into the corridor. Leaps off the ground and runs it straight to short third man
full inswinger coming towards leg stump. Lynn shuffles around a little before managing to get the bat down to block it

oh, he's finished it off with a six! A six! If only this had come a ball earlier. Things could have been so different. Ah, the hurt of it all if you're Dhoni. An extremely full delivery on middle, Dhoni sends it soaring into the sky and straight over for a monstrous six
is that four, is that four? No. Deep point cuts it off. Dhoni steps down the track and squeezes this out through the covers. Deep point gets around to his right. Dhoni does not take the single
excellent! Wide yorker, bang on the line. An inch here or there and it was a wide. But it's right inside. Top stuff from Mohit. Dhoni brings the bat down and just hits the ground
beautiful shot! They needed four fours in four balls, and that's the first of 'em. Superb placement as he squeezes out a wide fuller one between point and backward point

tries an encore and it's drifted away too much. Tension building. Mohit needs to hold his own here. Dhoni has loads of experience in these situations. Injured back or not, you don't want to be bowling to him in these situations
great delivery. A wide yorker, making Dhoni reach. With that sore back, it's asking him to do the impossible. Beaten
good yorker, angled into Bravo's pads as he clips to deep midwicket

six more! MS Dhoni is doing the unthinkable here! And he's down on one knee after that shot. A full toss that angles into him and that angle makes up for the lack of power because of the injury. Swung away over square leg
in the air, and a moment of excitement as the ball lobs in the air. Not very well-timed and it lands short of long-off
overcompensates with a short ball and with the line too which is well outside off, and Dhoni ramps it over short third man! Oh the drama!
that's a bad ball. You don't bowl a wide length ball like that to a batsman on fifty-odd in the penultimate over. A free swing of the arms as he smokes it way over long-on
and there ends Jadeja's underwhelming stay. Full and angled across, and that drift does him in as he skews it in the air off the outside of the bat with Ashwin is waiting under it at extra cover
full around off, drilled very hard down to long-on
six! Another huge hit. Jadeja gets into the act. And it was about time he did so! A length ball that Jadeja gets on top of from the crease and hammers over long-on
short, wide, makes Dhoni reach out and he can't because of the injury, chops it into the surface. And that's fifty for Dhoni
humongous hit from Dhoni! A juicy half-volley, right in the slot for Dhoni to get underneath it and bludgeon it miles in the air and over cow corner
Jadeja drills a fuller one very hard back at the bowler and Mohit bumps into Dhoni as he moves to his right to try and stop it
