steps down the track to meet a low full toss and hammers it to long-off. Just one. Back giving lots of trouble

in the air and missed chance. Mayank Dagar dives forward but the ball dips horribly on him and ends up sneaking from underneath to the boundary. A full toss that Dhoni shovelled to the deep midwicket region
Jadeja still can't get hold of his shots but he'll get four for this. A slow short of a length delivery that he backs away to and manages to chip over the in-field at the cover and point region
full outside off, driven to long-off
shoveled! Tremendous back-hand power as Dhoni slams this slower back of a length delivery through long-off. Wouldn't have mattered if you had all your fielders there
full, drifts away too far outside off. Not bothered with by Dhoni
shortish, and Jadeja gently pulls it through square leg
lots of bottom hand power as he flays a full one outside off past Jadeja who is forced to arch his back. Dhoni limps the single
full and wide, Dhoni brings the bat down to drive and makes no contact. Not much feet

full toss, booming drive through the covers by Jadeja. Sweeper moves across to his left and they take him on for the second. Sran slips on the follow through and get behind the stumps to gather the throw as Dhoni comes rushing back

short_text: Barinder Sran to Jadeja, no run
long_text: this is brilliant death bowling. A wide yorker and all Jadeja can do is dig it out to point
short ball, Jadeja doesn't get hold of it again as he mistimes a pull to backward square leg
was that a wide? Touch and go. Very full and out of Jadeja's reach. Seemed like it was probably just within the line but the umpire thinks otherwise

short, cuts into Jadeja and gives him no pace, pulled away backward of square leg and this time they charge back for the second. Rahul takes the bails off after gathering the throw but Jadeja's well inside
slower ball, dips late and sneaks down the leg side

short_text: Barinder Sran to Jadeja, no run
long_text: full, wide, in the blockhole, Jadeja jams the bat down and makes no contact
shortish, some width, slapped away to the sweeper at the cover boundary
slides into Dhoni's pads and it trickles into the leg side off the pads
flat back of a length delivery, almost a seam-up as he fires it in at pace, turned away to backward square leg
short and some width, Dhoni slaps it through the covers off the backfoot
there's the biggie. Much-needed six from Dhoni. He's struggling with a sore back and it's slowed him down. But the power's still there as he slogs this over deep square leg
shortish, some width, Dhoni chops a cut to cover
a length ball that slides in and hits Dhoni in front of leg as he misses the flick

short_text: Barinder Sran to Jadeja, no run
long_text: another yes and no. Dhoni sends Jadeja back but he manages to get back in comfortably after tapping a slower one to midwicket

short_text: Barinder Sran to Jadeja, no run
long_text: short of a length, opens the face to point

Ashwin with a direct hit. And look at him take off. And look at the Kings XI dugout. A lightning quick piece of fielding from Ashwin. Rayudu drills it to extra cover and Ashwin just swoops down in a flash and nails a direct hit at the striker's end after Dhoni sends Rayudu back

short_text: Barinder Sran to Rayudu, no run
long_text: back-of-the-hand slower delivery, Rayudu backs away and leaves it hoping for a wide. But well inside

short_text: Barinder Sran to Rayudu, SIX runs
long_text: a timely six from Rayudu breaks the shackles. Shuffles across to a shortish delivery and heaves a pull over backward square leg

short_text: Barinder Sran to Rayudu, no run
long_text: Rayudu skips down the track but Sran shortens the length and Rayudu slightly chips it in the air. Well short of the bowler
comes down the track and drills to long-off
short and spinning away, cut away to sweeper cover
tries to flick and the ball slides in to lob off the pad into the off side. Missing leg
meets the pitch with a good stride forward and drills it away to the left of sweeper cover
minimal turn around off, backs away and carves a cut through backward point
short of a length, gets down on one knee and pulls to deep midwicket
low full toss, driven out to sweeper cover
tries to force a cut with little room and misses
short of a length, flattens the trajectory and drifts it in, and Dhoni whips it away to deep fine leg. And Dhoni breezes back for the second
this one spins in from a length and Rayudu punches to long-off
legbreak, short of a length, stays back and makes room to punch through cover
full, driven through cover for one
slower full one, driven to long-off
short and wide, slapped away to deep point
gets on top of a short one and taps it to backward point
short of a length, opens the face to point
full on the pads, flicked to deep square leg
shuffles across early and then awkwardly flicks it away to square leg for one
flat, back of a length, pulled away to deep backward square leg
quicker one on the pads, worked away to square leg
shifts back and hurriedly punches it into the off side as it bounces extra
length ball on off, Dhoni punches from the crease
flat length ball, punched down to long-on

oh, that's a stunning shot! Came out of nowhere. You didn't actually realise it was a four until you saw how well he had placed that. A length ball that turns away and he simply waits and waits before punching it through backward point
drifts it in down the leg side again
finds the outside edge with turn ad bounce from middle and leg as the ball trickles away into the off side
sprayed down the leg side
floats it up too much and offers up a full toss, a rare legbreak that Ashwin isn't in control of, and it's whipped away to deep square leg
turning away outside off, cut away to sweeper cover
floats up a legbreak on middle and leg, clipped through midwicket
back of a length, punched down to long-on
stays back to a length ball and uses the angle to flick to deep square leg
slides down the leg side and sneaks past Dhoni's attempt to clip it
short, offers up width, that's not where you bowl at a new batsman, Dhoni cuts hard and cuts late through backward point
boy did he slam that! A savage Dhoni strike, all timing, but the placement's not so great as long-on gets around it comfortably despite how quickly that left the bat
floated up outside off, driven to sweeper cover
back of a length, Rayudu gets behind the line and flicks to midwicket
another legbreak, make that three in a row, Dhoni reaches out and drives to long-off

will Ashwin review that? Appeals for the leg before but the signal is four off the bat. Yes, he goes for it. Another legbreak from Ashwin. Floats it up just enough to entice Billings to get down and sweep. There is absolutely no bat involved, which seemed pretty obvious to start off. UltraEdge confirms it, and three reds on Hawkeye as ball crashes into off-stump. Good review. Ashwin was super-confident of that and you could see why. That seemed pretty plumb from the outset
there's the legbreak. Sussed out by Billings who cuts to cover
comes down the track and works this length ball with the turn to midwicket
back of a length, minimal turn, punched to long-off
turned away with the spin to backward square leg
shortish, gets a little big on him as he shifts back to pull and gets hit high on the front pad. Easily missing leg
fullish length outside off, driven into cover
shifts back and punches this past mid-on diving to his left
just helped along. A googly that pitches around leg and spins away further down that line and all Billings has to do is put bat to ball to work it away through fine leg
there's that deceptive trajectory right away, Rayudu reaches out and gets an outside edge to third man
full on the pads flicked off them to the left of deep square leg
rides the bounce of a shortish one and opens the face to point
length on off, 130.5ks, flicked to midwicket
back of a length, runs down to third man with an open face
leg-side length ball, flicked off the hips to deep fine leg

Sran with another catch and he's too chuffed again as he hurls the ball in the air. Vijay steps down the track, completely foxed by the slower one from Tye, and chips it in the air. Sran snaffles it at extra cover
flicked to square leg
slower back of a length delivery, opens the face to point
down the ground and through the vacant long-on region as Rayudu smokes it with the inward angle
back of a length at 129.9ks, chips a punch in the air but lands short of mid-off
length ball on off, punched to mid-off for a quick one
full on middle and off, drilled down to mid-on

short_text: Barinder Sran to Vijay, SIX runs
long_text: that's too short. Ruins what was a good over as Vijay deposits it well over midwicket with a ferocious pull
a length ball with some room, opens the face real late to stab it to third man
full, angled in, flicked to midwicket

short_text: Barinder Sran to Rayudu, FOUR runs
long_text: that's sublime timing! A length ball that pitches on middle and is slanted across, Rayudu drives past Ashwin diving to his right at mid-off
slower length ball at leg-stump, 100.6ks - could it get any slower? - as Vijay knocks it to point

short_text: Barinder Sran to Vijay, no run
long_text: tries to flick a leg-side fuller one and wears it on the pad

there's the early wicket that Kings XI were looking for as Watson's caught at short fine leg. A back-of-the-hand slower ball from Mohit and Watson tries to whip it through the leg side. Gets the timing all wrong and skews it in the air off the leading edge
back of a length on off, punched with an open face to Agarwal at backward point
opens the face very late to punch a length ball to backward point
deft! Hangs back in the crease and opens the face of his bat to a short of a length delivery and beats short third man diving to his left
full, shapes away to find the outside of his bat as he throws his hands at it and clears the in-field over point
fullish on off, punched to cover
too straight again, nudged down to short fine leg for a run. Nine off the opening over.
too straight, on the hips and worked to square leg for a run
good stop from Mujeeb. Short and wide outside off, carved away over backward point. Third man gets across to his right, and does a good job to stop the ball.

short_text: Barinder Sran to Vijay, 1 leg bye
long_text: a full delivery, on middle and leg, off the pad to square leg. An optimistic appeal.

short_text: Barinder Sran to Vijay, no run
long_text: a good length delivery outside off, some inward shape. Carved away to extra cover.
starts the inswinger too straight again. Strays down leg, wide!
back of a length outside off, chopped to backward point. A good call from Vijay
a sloppy start. Full and swinging down leg, a wide. Rahul dives to his left, but can only half-stop it. So three free runs for CSK.
low full toss, punched to the left of deep midwicket, and they push back for the second
shifts down the leg side and it's another slower one as Tye swings without a clue about what he's doing. Beaten

goes for a big heave over the leg side and he's picked out Jadeja at deep midwicket who takes it reverse-cupped. Slower ball from Bravo does the trick as he messes up the timing by rolling his fingers over this delivery
wide yorker, pushed across from around the stumps, squeezed out to cover
advances looking for a slog and ends up swinging early due to the lack of pace
full ball from around the wicket, knocked to deep midwicket
length ball outside off, flayed through the gap at extra cover. Long-off runs to his left and slides across. Gets a hand and seems to have done alright as they go upstairs to check
no room on the pull as Ashwin shifts right back and gets a top-edge that Dhoni runs to his left to catch
length ball on the pads, Ashwin carts it off the pads over deep fine leg as the ball sails over Vijay leaping up. Could he have caught it if he was further back at the boundary?
short of a length, sitting up nicely, pulled one-bounce to deep midwicket
length ball outside off, Ashwin jabs it to mid-off who loses the ball as he tries to stop it
makes room and slams to the right of sweeper cover
slower full ball, punched down to long-on
full, flicked powerfully off the pads to deep midwicket
good length, drilled wide of midwicket
another poor delivery. A length ball, angled into the pads, and Nair flicks to fine leg

has that been dropped?. Jadeja has hurt his hand quite badly, seems like. And it's his bowling hand. Karun whacked this full toss over deep midwicket and Jadeja leaps and the ball flicks his thumb before continuing on its path over the boundary
slower length ball, drops to point with an open face
flicks a length ball to deep midwicket. Just five off the 17th
full and accurate on middle, defended back. Dots at the slog worth gold
fullish length on middle and leg, pushed back
floats up a fuller one outside off and he drives down to long-off
back of a length, backs away and punches through the cover
flat fuller one, clipped to deep midwicket
short outside off, not entirely on top of it as he pulls to cow corner
hangs the bat out to a wide back of a length delivery and gets beaten
angles in a length ball and Ashwin drills it off the inside of the bat to deep backward square leg

is that an edge? Oh, yeah! Tucked up for room and some extra bounce too that does him in. Yuvraj is trying to slap this over but gets a feather to the keeper. Gone for 20 but he Kings XI will be pleased he didn't scratch around
short, wide, slapped past point diving to his left
short of a length, jumps and opens the face to third man
leg-stump fuller one, flicked to short fine leg
full on middle and leg, flicked away off the pads and beats deep midwicket to his left
pitched up around off, blocked into the off side
googly, spins in from a back of a length, and Nair punches to cover

Tahir strikes again, and it's another golden duck for Finch! Or is it? Finch reviews. But this was a poor shot from Finch. Pays the price for playing against the turn. A length ball and Finch clumsily steps forward and looks to close the face. The ball spins past it to hit the pad. A waste of a review, really, as the screen shows three reds

Agarwal miscues one to long-on. Tahir floats up a length ball and Agarwal's bat turned in his hands as he tried to loft it. Doesn't get the distance desired as a result, and Jadeja completes a simple catch

yorker from Bravo, and it goes away for four. Didn't really deserve a boundary. Bravo belts out an appeal for the lbw, but it's withheld. The ball, in the meanwhile, trickles away past a diving Harbhajan at short third man
short, sitting up outside off, and Yuvraj gets on his toes inside the crease and pulls to the right of deep midwicket
slower full toss, teasing the line with the height here, Yuvraj flicks it to deep midwicket
full, wide, flayed over point by Agarwal as Vijay runs to his left from sweeper cover to field it
shortish outside off, backs away and slaps it out to sweeper cover
full toss that slips out of the hand, whipped away between deep midwicket and long-on
slants across a length ball outside off and Yuvraj punches down the pitch
shortish, a googly that spins away, Yuvraj knocks it to point
that's an easy one, just the kind of delivery you want as a batsman when you're out of form. A clean swing of the arms to dispatch a full, flighted one over long-on
fullish on middle, driven straight back
floats up a length ball around off, solidly blocked off the front foot
length ball, spinning away, leans early into a punch to long-off
back of a length on middle, flicked into the on side
shortish, a little width, hangs back and runs it down to third man
short of a length, angled across, jumps up and flicks to midwicket

a rather underwhelming end to a superb innings. He was kept quiet for the last couple of overs or so, and now he's offered a simple catch to short fine leg. Watson tucks him up for room and bangs it in, Gayle gets an edge as he tries to pull it away
shortish, some width, slapped to the sweeper at the cover boundary
Watson offers up a dolly, a really full one at 129.2 clicks on middle and off, Agarwal clears the front leg and sends it soaring straight over
walks forward to a slower length ball and taps it through midwicket
full, outside off, carved out to backward point
misfield at mid-off as Agarwal watchfully blocks towards the fielder and sends back Gayle looking for one. The fielder lets it slip through the legs and they take the one anyway
low full toss, slanted across, pushed down to long-off
full, wide, reaches out and stabs it to sweeper cover
length ball that spins away, Gayle watchfully blocks in the direction of point
leg-side fuller one, swept on the bounce to deep backward square leg
brilliant from Agarwal. Uses the width to open the face really late and squeezes it out through backward point
Agarwal invites himself to the party with a straight six. Just how many have travelled that way tonight? A skip down the track and a neatly-timed punch over long-on
leg-stump length ball, tucked to square leg
floated up on middle and leg, chipped down to long-on
back of a length on off, opens the face for a single behind point
quietly pushes out a fullish one to cover
off the middle this time as he pulls it out to deep midwicket. 100 up in the ninth over. Shades of the Mumbai-DD game yesterday
short, too close to Agarwal as he miscues a pull off the lower part of the bat
length ball, gets away from him late as he chips it in the air. Lands safely around the sweeper cover region
length, angled across, Gayle opens the face to point

after all the bad balls they have punished, Kings XI end up losing a wicket to a full toss. Wicket or boundary, it's almost as if CSK can't manage a delivery that doesn't make you flinch. Rahul punches it uppishly as he throws his weight behind the shot and finds DJ Bravo who leaps at cover to hold on to a sharp catch
full on the stumps, quietly pushed down to long-on
slides it into the pads, and Rahul uses the angle and spin to tuck behind square
flattens the trajectory and fires a length ball around off, pushed back
non-turning length ball, pretty wide outside off, Gayle punches it through point
length, spinning into middle, punched down to long-on
straight down the ground again. Tahir slides this into Gayle's leg stump, and he gets the front leg out and pummels it for six more
stays in the crease and opens the face, gets beaten
brute force! And a fifty for Gayle, off 22 balls. That's as emphatic a franchise debut as there can be. A flighted fuller one on the stumps, and Gayle hammers it straight over
pitched up on middle and leg, driven down to long-on
short, wide, rocks back and cuts through point. Pulled back in front of the boundary
Tahir continues the trend of horrible deliveries, a full toss on leg stump, and Rahul flicks it to deep midwicket
there, much better! More of that. A yorker to end the over, and Gayle digs it out to cover
length ball, as harmless as they come, well outside off, carted over long-off
some more short stuff, this one's too high for the batsman to be able to punish it, and that means he gets to face another delivery
another shortish one, and ample of room. Jeez, when will they start bowling closer at the stumps. Gayle barely has to get the front foot away to slap it through long-off
slower short ball, Gayle swivels and helps it along to square leg. He jogs the first as two fielders converge, and that's fine because neither man can get to it
a length ball that nicely sits up for him outside off, around the fifth or sixth-stump line, and Gayle mows it over long-on with a clean swing of the arms
full on middle and leg, flicked to midwicket

that's some more tripe. Another shortish delivery, they aren't learning anything from their mistakes, Gayle doesn't entirely time it but the big swing is enough to carry it just past the mid-on fielder running back and sliding in front of the boundary
short of a length, punched through the covers

CSK are putting on an exhibition of everything you shouldn't bowl in a T20 game. After a full one on the pads, he drops short to Rahul, at a gentle pace, as he shifts back and swivels into a powerful pull through midwicket
sprays one into the pads of Gayle who flicks to midwicket
full and wide, big swing and a miss as he is stapled to the crease

edged and through the gap between keeper and wide slip. That's an unusually wide slip, probably even wider of where second slip would have been. That means Gayle can take liberties at throwing his hands at deliveries that are well outside his reach
now he finds the gap past that fielder. This is terrific batting. Steps down the track and gets right to the pitch before lacing a drive through the left of the extra cover fielder. Top shot
steps out to one that drifts into him and goes slightly inside-out to extra cover
this is some tripe! No control from Harbhajan, he's spraying it all around. This one's a full toss around off and Rahul punches it through the covers with ease
leg-side line again, he needs to settle into something here, Gayle waits and tucks it behind square for one
now he overcompensates with the line and floats up a fuller one that spins away to give Gayle all the room he wants to shovel it over long-off
shortish, slower through the air and zero turn outside off, Gayle rocks back and flays a cut to the left of point
switches over to an off-stump line for this back of a length delivery, Rahul chops a punch towards extra cover
short and banged into his leg stump, and all that leaves Rahul to do is to help it along to deep backward square leg
short of a length on off, and a rare quick single from Gayle as he drops it to the left of point and takes off
full, angled across, a wide yorker, but this time it curves in slightly and pretty late too to have Gayle hitting the ground as he brings the bat down
extremely full outside off, shapes away and sneaks underneath as Gayle jams the bat down
ah, has he got away with that? Seemed to drift a long way from the left-hander, nowhere near Gayle's reach, but for some reason, the umpire thought that was fine
steps down the track but it's a shorter length and that forces Rahul to resort to a mild push back to the bowler
back of a length, turns away from middle and off, Gayle waits on the backfoot before turning it away to midwicket
length ball outside off, lets it turn before gently tapping it to point
comes down the track and pats it away against the turn towards mid-on
fullish length, looped up around off, defended back
a nice flighted delivery outside off, and Gayle responds with a languid drive through the covers. Good stride forward and neatly splits the field

ah, shot! The aesthetic value of that is just unbelievable. Rahul simply leans into a punch through the covers, in the process covering for the late movement and using the pace to his advantage as he throws his weight behind it
ah, jeez, Rahul's been hit on the box attempting a pull. Gets really cramped up for room and the ball bounces off after hitting him there to graze the midriff. Painful
full and shaping away late outside off, Rahul swings and the ball sneaks past the inside edge
fullish, angled in at middle and leg and straightening, Rahul drills off the inside of the bat to backward square leg
now that swing works to Rahul's favour as it gives him the room he needs to open up his arms, an imperious punch over the extra cover region
some shape right away. A length ball, angled in and straightening on off, defended
swing and a miss. Beaten by this slower delivery that drifted away.  Rajasthan have defended a score for a second time this season.
makes room and drives inside out to deep extra cover, Mandeep scampers back. Can Mandeep get to his half-century? He's played beautifully.
stunning straight drive. Too full, he backed away and hammered this. Straight as an arrow. Long-on and long-off came around but had no chance.
thick outside edge that beats short third man. Looks to slice this behind point but the ball dips and takes the edge.
walks across the stumps and simply helps this slower bouncer over short fine leg. Easily done
drilled down the ground, Gowtham comes around to stop that at long-off.
plays and misses a full toss outside off.
paddles this full toss onto the middle stump. Went far too across and deflected it back. Wanted to go over the keeper's head. He's played a lovely innings though.
full and straight on middle, he backs away and drills this between long-on and long-off
angles this short of length delivery across, Washington looks to back away and slash but is beaten
lofted cleanly over extra cover. Slower and fuller outside off, he backed away and belted this without a trace of worry.

carved away over backward point. Lovely from Washington, making a case as a batsman too. Amidst his new ball ability, it's conveniently forgotten that he plays in the top order for his state side Tamil Nadu
slower bouncer, pulled over square leg, lands short of the man coming in from the deep.
backs away and belts this full delivery to Stokes at wide long-off. A misfield gives them an opportunity to take the second
tipped over the long-on boundary by Gowtham. This was a short-arm jab and the ball flew off the blade. Had he been right at the ropes, this could've been an easier catch
right into the blockhole, squeezed to point. Superb from Laughlin
goes over cover, gets this into the gap. Wide long-off and deep cover converge to cut that off
slower and fuller outside off, squeezed to deep cover
walks across to flick, ends up yorking himself.
this one's lofted over cover, down to the boundary rider. Gowtham had 10 yards or so to move to his left, back comfortably for the second
reaches out to carve this yorker-length delivery outside off to beat square third man. Handy runs these for RCB, all it's doing is reducing the margin of defeat though
backs away and slices this cut to pick the gap behind point. Lovely timing.
plays a short-arm jab towards deep midwicket
this is too short and angling in, Washington stays inside the crease and slaps this over long-on. That should give him some batting confidence

mistimed hoick from way outside off towards deep midwicket. Short lost control of the ball as he turned to throw, and ended up kicking it towards long-on. Then, he had to run around to pick the ball and throw.
through with the swing again, failed to account for the slower delivery
another swing, another miss. This time Stokes angled it full from around the stumps, Washington looked to hit this over long-on
swing and a miss. Slower length ball outside off, beaten.
swung through way too early, this ball angled back in to deflect off the pad and roll towards short third man
makes room and punches this to wide mid-off, good stop.
slants this way outside off. Saw the batsman making room but bowled it really wide
looks to work this against the line, gets a thick inside edge onto the boot, ball deflects to the off side for a single
slower length ball that hits a patch and just takes off, Washington knocked on the glove as he defends
gets the line wrong, way down leg. Good take by Buttler
pulled on the bounce to Samson at deep square leg
full and wide outside off, Mandeep carves this behind point. Nice hands, nice reach, sublime timing
chips this drive down to sweeper cover to get off the mark

strikes, Buttler has finally taken a catch. This is slower and fuller outside off, Negi looks to work this to the leg side, but gets a thick edge as it cuts away late and this is well taken by Buttler diving to his left.
shapes to pull but the ball skids back in to hit the flap of the pad as Mandeep is through with the stroke early. That was bowled at 103kph
goes back deep into the crease and whips this down to deep midwicket
pushed through quicker at length outside off, dabbed towards point
skids back in from around the stumps, pulls towards deep square
too short, he rocks back and slashes to deep point
he's clobbered this way over long-on. Is there life in the game? Too much flight, got underneath it and gave it some muscle
mistimes the pull that he looks to fetch from way outside off, lands between deep midwicket and wide long-on
beaten by sharp turn. Looks to lunge forward and jab. Lovely from Shreyas
squeezes this flick to square leg, off the mark
first he takes out Kohli and now has AB. Absolute half-tracker down leg, AB rocks back and pulls this straight to deep square leg. Unadkat takes an excellent low catch.
this one keeps low to beat the underedge as he looked to punch
slow turn from length on off stump, AB defends. Took his bottom hand off the grip
steps out and lofts this over the infield, down to long-on. Far from off the middle. AB's struggling for timing just a touch tonight again
slices this into the gap between backward point and short third man. Not much pace on this, AB went hard at it, just about managed to find the gap.
skiddy length ball on middle and off, he wrists this down towards deep midwicket
makes room and punches this down to long-off. Can't get the kind of room he would've liked. That's three good deliveries so far from Unadkat
slower length ball outside off, eased down to third man
makes room and punches this length delivery to deep cover
works this against the line to Stokes coming in from wide long on
punches this length delivery into the deep extra cover region
fired full on the pads, worked down to long on
eased with the spin to long-off
pulled to Short who times his jump to perfection to take this leaping catch at deep midwicket. Is this the catch that turns it? Local boy Shreyas has silenced the Bengaluru crowd as he does a lap.
shapes to sweep but Shreyas bowls this full and way outside off, eased to long-off
walks across the stumps and wrists this full delivery down to long on
he's sliced this over deep extra cover, seemed a mishit but boy, this has carried all the way.
squeezes out this yorker to cover, superb bowling this. Excellent execution
walks across and whips this on the bounce to deep midwicket
steps out but gets yorked nearly as this tails in a long way. AB was more than halfway down the pitch when he was sent back but Buttler doesn't pick up the ball cleanly. Run-out chance missed.
walks across the stumps and whips this cutter towards deep midwicket
short and put away. Kohli rocks back and muscles this pull over deep midwicket. That's adding insult to injury.

stumping chance missed!  Oh, dear. Is that the turning point? AB is foxed by a googly that spins back in to beat the inside edge as he stepped out to go over the top. What's worse is the slip fielder's throw at the stumps resulted in an overthrow.
turns this back to the bowler, cramped for room.
walks across the stumps and sweeps this firmly into the gap at deep square. Short does well to get to the ball and cut that off, saved two runs
spins back in, defended to the leg side. Sharp turn
works this down to long-on to bring up his 26-ball 50.  This is his fastest in IPL history

he's pulled this straight to Unadkat at deep backward square leg. This kept a touch low but was asking to be hit, De Kock did just that but didn't hit this off the middle. As easy as catches come. So a half-tracker has fetched a wicket. Incredibly, a wicket has fallen and Chinnaswamy roars because AB de Villiers is striding out to the middle.
spins back in from leg stump, worked to deep square leg
eased with the spin to sweeper cover
pulled from outside off towards deep midwicket
the bottom hand comes off the blade as he goes down on one knee to slog, still clears long-on. Wow, this is a very cruel game to the bowlers, especially here at the Chinnaswamy
sliding down leg, he rocks back and pulls to deep backward square leg
lucky to get away with that tripe delivery. De Kock rocks back and pulls this to deep midwicket
works this from length outside off towards deep midwicket
deceived by the googly, Kohli plays for the legspin but this one hits him on the pad. Caught on the crease, but this was sliding down
pulled to bisect deep midwicket and deep square. Too easy, can't bowl there. Asking for trouble
has he put that down? Surely, yes.  Dropped by Buttler.  Shaped to cut but got a thick outside edge, deflects to short third man. Given as a bye, so doesn't go down as a dropped chance

short_text: Gopal to de Kock, no run
long_text: slides one across De Kock, who flat-bats this back to the bowler
walks out and steers this low full toss into the gap at deep point
slower ball gone wrong, slides this down leg even as Kohli walks out to flick. Pressure on Stokes
full toss outside off, Kohli opens the bat face to slice this drive on the bounce over point.
chips this flick shot into the gap at midwicket, down towards Gowtham. Can't prevent the second though
slower and fuller outside off, squeezed to extra cover
walks across the stumps and flicks this full delivery to deep square leg
he's welcomed with a fierce pull that leaves midwicket with no chance. Kohli wallops that a couple of bounces into the ropes.

short_text: Gowtham to de Kock, no run
long_text: makes room and hits this length ball straight to extra cover

short_text: Gowtham to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: swept fiercely, beats square leg. Fetched this from off stump. This wasn't all that bad a delivery from Gowtham, take your hat off to de Kock for being brave and risking being lbw to play that

short_text: Gowtham to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: clean strike. Stepped out, moved to the leg side and lofted this inside-out one bounce to the wide long-off fence
whips this length ball to deep midwicket. This skid through and cramped him for room
grip and turn from middle, de Kock gets a leading edge towards point
whips this down to long on
defends this length ball into the off side towards cover for a quick single
bunts this length ball towards point as they scamper a run. De Kock looked to go over cover but the bowler cramped him for room and so he had to readjust

short_text: Unadkat to de Kock, no run
long_text: makes room and squeezes out this yorker-length delivery to mid-off

short_text: Unadkat to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: drilled down the ground past the diving mid-on fielder. Too full and QDK was waiting for it
on the pads and he's clipped that into the gap at deep midwicket. Short comes around to cut that off
slower and fuller on off, eased towards point

short_text: Gowtham to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: makes room and punches this length ball through extra cover, Stokes was after it but the ball kept gathering pace as it raced off the turf.

short_text: Gowtham to de Kock, no run
long_text: drift and turn from middle, defended gently into the leg side
works this with the spin to long on
works this flatter length ball to midwicket
slaps this through cover. Too short, he rocked back and used the width to crash that into the gap.
drifts in a low full toss, driven to wide mid-off
tucks this slower delivery to short fine leg where Unadkat dives to keep it to a single
slower and fuller on off, turned towards mid-on for a quick single
this is magnificent! This time, the same length ball on off but goes over midwicket. Walked across the stumps and allowed those wrists to take over as he whipped this away.
slapped disdainfully over cover. Just made a hint of room and put that away without much fuss. Nothing wrong with the delivery, really.
walks outside the crease and bunts this length delivery to cover again
crunching cover drive. Length outside off, Kohli walks into the stroke and bisects cover and mid-off. All class and quality
works this from outside off towards wide long on
spins back in to strike the pad, but this was sliding down leg. Kohli was looking to work this to the leg side

rocks back and hammers this pull straight to Stokes at deep midwicket. This was hammered but it was almost as if McCullum didn't know there was a man there. Stokes made it look ridiculously easy. Timed his jump superbly and was airborne when it lodged in his bucket hands.
flatter one at length on middle, turned to square leg again
turns this gently with the spin to square leg
slapped away, a misfield at cover means there's a boundary. Should've been a dot. Oh, dear. The fielder? Sanju Samson
low full toss outside off, squeezes this to cover. Samson walks off to applause and appreciation from RCB. Stunning knock.
he's hitting them on demand. Samson has picked this full delivery outside off over long-off. Just made a bit of room and laced this over.
clean strike over the bowler's head, just eludes a leaping McCullum at long-off. Can't go length at this stage of the innings.
slower length ball on middle, Tripathi backs away and pulls to deep midwicket.  Oh, dear. Umesh has overstepped.  Samson on strike. Kohli is furious. That was a massive no-ball too
too short and he's pulled this into the deep midwicket boundary. Tripe bowling from Umesh. Superb the other night, very ordinary here
he's picked the bones out of that. Slower and fuller on middle, he backed away and belted that to the second tier in the member's stand. Wow, massive hit
muscles this length delivery into the gap at midwicket, down to Negi who comes around from deep square
goes over cover, beats the sweeper Negi. Bounces into the ropes. Don't think he would've been too disappointed by a single either.
deflected past the keeper. That's his first boundary, would you believe it? Yorker length outside off, he brings his bat down at an angle to run it down.
at the moment, he's dealing in just sixes. This slower ball is bowled at length, Samson backs away and lofts this through the line to clear long on
squeezes this yorker into the off side for a quick single

right into the blockhole, he's toe-ended a lofted hit straight to mid-off. The muted celebrations in the RCB camp tell you a story. When was the last time you saw Kohli take a catch and quietly and lob the ball back to the umpire?
slices this full toss towards deep point
another one, a similar result. This one's even bigger, into the second tier. Khejroliya delivers another half-volley and Samson had the room to loft this cleanly.

excellent from Samson. He backs away and lofts this full delivery cleanly over long-off. The left foot went towards mid-on to create room. Khejroliya went for a yorker, missed his length and got punished
backs away and drills this low full toss to sweeper cover
nice and full on the stumps, squeezed to long on
heaves and gets a thick inside edge towards deep midwicket
backs away to slap this over point but misses this high full toss. Keeper put his gloves out to stop that. Wasn't far from being over the waist
backs away and deposits this length ball into the second tier at midwicket. Very predictable there from Woakes
right into the blockhole, dug out in time, the ball rolls towards point.  First half-century in three games for Samson
backs away and squeezes this yorker to deep cover where Negi comes around to cut that off
full outside off, squeezes this with an angled bat to third man
backs away and swings this length ball over deep midwicket. Great power from the forearms
right into the blockhole, kept out. Superb start
slants this one into middle and leg, tucked to square leg. A direct hit at the bowler's end from Chahal and Samson would've been gone.
stands tall and punches this to cover as they scamper a single
slants this full delivery into the pads, flicked into the gap between deep midwicket and wide long-on
width outside off and he stands tall to steer this down to square third man
lovely little flick with the angle towards square leg
whips thsi full toss over deep midwicket. Enough wood to just clear Mandeep there. Not sure he got this off the middle
now a beamer, down leg. Surely a warning. Yes, called no-ball and a free-hit
slips this full ball way down leg, good take by QdK
goes back and across as he punches this short ball to sweeper cover
slow turn from length outside off, steered to sweeper cover
reverse-swept to point, played a touch too early and gave away his intentions
fired wide, way outside off. Easy call
flatter and fuller on middle, driven to cover
shapes to drive but misses. Beaten by extra turn
makes room and punches this to Umesh at point
dropped by de Kock!  Went for a drive but got a thick edge that deflected off the keeeper's gloves and beat short third man to the boundary
slow turn from length on outside off, turned back to the bowler
eased with the spin to long off
rocks back and hammers the pull deep into the stands at deep square. Picked the length early, did Samson
drifts in to squeeze off an inside edge back to Negi
clean inside-out strike over the infield, down to sweeper cover. Got more elevation this time, safe however.
goes outside off to paddle, but the ball spins away to beat the edge, keeper and sip fielder too were fooled by that. Perhaps they didn't pick this at all. Four byes it is
thick outside edge to short third man as he shapes to cut
drifting into middle and leg, tucked to square leg
begins with a reverse sweep for four. Fired in but outside off, he changed his bat grip quickly to put that low full toss away past the diving backward point fielder
he's dragged this back onto the stumps. Went for a big mow over deep square, had to fetch it from way outside off. Ended up getting a thick inside edge onto the stumps.
works this indrifter into the leg side for a single
full toss sliding down leg, tickled down to fine leg where Woakes covers good ground to effect a tumbling stop, saved two runs for the side
slants this full delivery down leg, will have to rebowl that
Works this length ball from outside off towards midwicket, a direct hit at the bowler's end and  Samson would've been gone
skiddy length ball on middle, tucked to square leg
helped into the stands at fine leg. Too short and angling in, Stokes was waiting for it as he swiveled back and used the pace to wallop that deep
splits the gap between short third man and point. Used the width to good effect. Opened the bat face slightly to pick the gap. Lovely.
nearly chopped on! Stepped out to slap this over cover but this length ball angled back in to cramp him for room.
drifting into middle and leg, tucked with the angle to deep square. End of a neat, little spell from Washington.
another flatter one on off, pushed past the bowler as they jog the single
once again makes room to go over the off side, but Washington fires this in. Punched down towards mid-off. Superb bowling this.
steps out but Washington fires this in, defended back
flatter on off, turned with the spin to long on again
clears long on effortlessly. Just hit that length ball through the line, so much power off the bottomhand. Stunning from Samson
whips this from outside off towards midwicket, and boy, he's picked the gap. Sensational. So much punch in the stroke. Deep square leg had no chance
walks across the stumps and caresses this drive to wide long-off, back comfortably for the second
steps out to belt this over mid-off but ends up hitting it flat and off the-end on the bounce to Kohli there
pace length ball on off stump, Stokes stands tall and bunts this to midwicket
uppish as he hops back and punches down to long on
shapes to drive but gets a thick inside edge towards deep square leg
works this with the angle towards deep midwicket.  Time for a strategy break
worked off his hip to deep square leg
backs away to go over cover but Chahal follows him, punched down to long on
flatter once again, this one touch on off, steered wide of short third man
flatter length ball on the stumps, defended to Kohli at short midwicket
eased with the spin to long off
shapes this back in from length on off stump, punched down to midwicket
length on middle and leg, turned to fine leg
stunning short-arm jab over deep square. Samson has too much time when he places such strokes, so stylish. Picked the length early and allowed his wrists to do the rest.
slants this nice and full on off, driven firmly to mid-off
short of length on off, Stokes through the short-arm jab too early, gets some bat off the edge as this rolls wide of the keeper on the off side
full delivery angling into middle and leg, struck on the pad as he shapes to work this across the line
turns this towards short fine leg, off the mark? Not yet, given as leg bye

Guess what? He's not run out, but has to go. Chahal pushes this through, gets this to drift away, there's a hint of sidespin as well. Short shapes to cut but has no room and gets the toe end of the bat as de Kock takes an excellent catch.
too much width, Short gets right to the pitch and belts this straight to cover
flatter one on middle, punched to long on
defended with an angled bat, towards short third man. Nice flight again from Chahal
nice flight, lands this on middle, eased with the spin to short cover
length on off, punched to deep cover to get off the mark
punched on the up to sweeper cover
floats this full but down leg, Short looks to flick but misses.

he's not hit this well and has paid the price, straight to mid-on. This was another slower delivery from Woakes, full but way outside off, Rahane looked to hit this straight but ended up dragging it off the toe end. He's done his job though.  There was intent right from the outset.
this is just helped on its way over deep backward square. Stunning shot. Too slow and drifting down, this was almost as if Rahane was waiting for it as he swung through with the angle.
pulled away towards deep square where  Mandeep Singh  puts off a stunning dive to save three runs. Covered ground quickly and then dived full stretch to effect a one-handed stop.
slaps this short of length delivery to sweeper cover
clean strike over the bowler's head. Too full and Short's eyes lit up as he belted this away
drifts away a flatter delivery, pushed to cover. Can't pierce the gap
works this against the line towards square leg
swept uppishly, beats deep square leg coming around. One bounce to the fence.
hint of turn from length on off, Rahane steers this towards point
worked with the spin to deep midwicket
hoicked away again, the midwicket boundary has been peppered again. Take that, he says. Rahane has come out looking to play a different game
backs away, so Umesh tries to cleverly bowl a wide yorker, the execution came a cropper though. Good thinking though.
turns this length ball from outside off to midwicket
makes room, Umesh follows him but it doesn't matter as Rahane hoicks this over midwicket. Races away to the fence off a mishit
mistimes a pull towards Mandeep at deep midwicket. Had to fetch it from outside off
length on middle and leg, Short hops back into the crease and defends into the leg side
steers this length ball down to third man
works this length ball into the midwicket region
he's belted this up and over the long-on boundary. Was always looking to hit straight and made clean connection
swept fiercely, one bounce to the deep square leg fence. This was drifting in, Rahane was down on one knee as he executed that superbly.
full and flat on middle and leg, turned to deep midwicket
steps out and laces this full toss straight to mid-off, they take a quick single though
slides one into the pads, turned towards midwicket
slices this slower delivery down to short third man, brief mix-up, again! They don't take the run. D'Arcy Short can breathe a sign of relief
slower delivery that he bunts into the off side towards point for a quick single
slash and a miss. Went for an expansive cut, without any feet movement. Woakes lucky to get away with that
stifled appeal, Rahane went across the line to flick it fine but the ball angled in and deflected off the thigh pad to the leg side
picks the length early and slaps this over midwicket, one bounce to the ropes. Just a touch too short from Woakes
looks to work this off his hip but is beaten as this thuds into his thigh pad
starts with a wayward delivery down leg, some stretching exercise for the umpire
cramped for room with a skiddy delivery, defended towards cover. Fine first over
pushed through quicker on middle, punched to mid-on
nice and full on the stumps, defended back with soft hands
drifts in a quicker delivery on the pads, turned to short fine leg
steps out and swats this length delivery across the line towards a sliding ABD at wide long-on. Saved a run quite easily there
fastish delivery at length outside off, Rahane mistimes this reverse sweep into the off side

ends with a six! Short on off, and Yusuf pulls it away. Top-edged, but enough power behind the big man to take it over the boundary behind square. Sunrisers Hyderabad win in Kolkata for the first time ever!
good length just outside off. Hooda walks across to the off side, and flicks to midwicket. Calls for the run early
yorker just outside off. Dug away towards the leg side for a quick single. Sunrisers need seven off eight
good length on off, and that's been punched off the back foot. Lynn's at cover, but the ball just goes over his head. Pathan's lucky but he'll take the boundary
overpitched wide outside off, and that's been slashed hard to deep point. Only a single
good length outside off, and Hooda misses the pull shot. The ball sneaks under his bat and through to DK
good length on off Yusuf punches it past cover for a couple. Sunrisers need 13 off 12 balls
full on off, and Yusuf takes a step forward and bangs this through the cover-region. Wide long off tries chasing behind it, but it's just too well hit
short on leg stump, and Yusuf chooses to let it go through. Good call, as the umpire calls it a wide
back of a length on leg stump. Tapped off the back foot to midwicket and Russell collects
full on off stump, and Yusuf brings out the front-foot defense
full on leg stump, and KW clips it off his pads, but straight to Russell at square leg. Soft dismissal! Big groan from Williamson as he sees Russell complete the catch
full on off, and he mistimes a leg-side slog to deep backward square
full on off, but Hooda comes dancing down the wicket. Pushes to wide long on to see Narine's spell off
good length just outside off. Spins away from KW, but manages to punch to long off. His fifty as well!
good length outside off, and Hooda cuts it square to the man in the deep
full on off, and fended back to Narine
good length outside off, but spinning away from him. Opens his bat's face and turns it down to third man
good length, just outside off. Punched off the back foot to long off

overpitched outside off, and the new man fails to squeeze it away. Hits his back leg, but where did it hit his leg? Impact outside off, so the batsman should be safe. Apparently, there was an inside edge as well

breaks leg stump! Good length on leg, but Shakib's caught in two minds. Chooses to defend eventually, but the ball sneaks through between bat and pad. This game's not over yet, folks! But for now it's the time out
good length on off, but spinning away from Shakib. Tries to cut but the extra bounce takes it over his bat
full on off stump, and Shakib fends it off the front foot
full on off stump, and Williamson bunts it to long on for another run
full on leg stump. Shakib shimmies down the wicket and drives it down to long on
good length on middle stump, and he helps the pull to fine leg to keep the strike
good length outside off, and KW's cut takes the inside edge. Almost chopped on, but hits his pads. They take off for the single, and Mavi hits the stumps at the striker's end. Shakib's safe, though

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Williamson, no run
long_text: good length, but wide outside off. Tries to cut but misses

short_text: Shivam Mavi to Williamson, SIX runs
long_text: good length on middle, and KW uses the pace to help this over fine leg! Gets his front leg out of the way and then pulls it over the square-leg umpire's head
good length on middle, and angling into his body. Mistimes the pull, and trickles down to fine leg
back of a length on off, and that's 143.2kph first up. Pulled to the man in the deep
good length outside off. Goes deep into the crease and cuts to deep extra cover
full on leg, and Shakib backs away before driving to long off. Easy single collected
full on leg, and that's been comfortably swept to deep backward square
full, but very wide outside leg stump. Shakib, however, backed away a lot towards the leg side. Bunted down the ground to long on
good length on off, and that's been uncomfortably pulled to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, and then spinning into KW. Fended off the back foot
full on off, and pushed to long off for a walking single. Sees another Narine over out
full just outside off stump. Pushed square off the front foot to the man in the deep
good length outside off, and spinning further away from the right-handed batsman. Cut off the back foot to deep extra cover
good length on off, but spinning further away. Cut off the back foot to the fielder in the deep
good length just outside off, and Shakib cuts it hard past the man at point. Work for the man in the deep, but he manages to pull it back
back of a length, on the fourth-stump line. Punched off the back foot to long on

slapped over point! First six of this innings. Short on off, and that's been cut very hard. Looked like third man could, perhaps, take a catch, but he eventually was also just a spectator. Fourteen runs off the last three balls
mistimed, but over mid off! Full on off, and Shakib lifts this over Uthappa at mid off. Not hit well, but enough behind that shot to take in beyond the infield
top edged over the keeper! Short on leg, and Shakib's pull takes the top edge. Karthik's not a tall man, and he's got no chance in stopping that
low full toss on off stump. Almost a yorker, and he taps it back to Russell. Fielded off the followthrough but the spectators celebrate the crowd catch instead
full just outside off stump. Opens the bat's face and runs it down fine to third man
short on off, and cut hard to point. The fielder manages to get his body behind that, and takes the pace off the ball
tossed up on leg stump, but Shakib's up to the challenge. Swept behind square to the fielder in the deep
good length outside off, and this time the cut shot is hit well. Chawla's the man in the deep
good length outside off, and he almost chops onto his stumps! Too close to his body for the cut
leaking runs! Good length on leg, and KW pulls this behind square. The man had just moved straighter after the previous shot, and Williamson chose that new vacant spot to perfection
half-tracker on middle, and Williamson goes deep into the crease. Plenty of time to pull this along the ground. Crashes into the cow-corner boundary
full on middle stump. Williamson almost yorks himself, and squeezes towards the legside
full on leg stump, but the wrong'un to end the over. Shakib does well to fend it off the back foot
good length on off, and spinning into KW. Punched to Russell at mid on, but misfield!
full on middle stump, spins into Shakib this time. He flicks it off his pads to midwicket
full on off, and spinning away from Shakib. Defended towards cover
tossed up, but wide outside off. Stays on the backfoot and slashes it square to the man in the deep
full on off, and spinning away from Shakib. Pushed down the ground to long off
full on middle stump, and flicked to fine leg. Williamson calls early for the second run
tossed up on off stump. Shakib takes a big stride forward and sweeps it square to the man in the deep

slow finger of death! Full on leg stump, and Pandey defends it down the wrong line. He tried to play in front of middle stump, but the ball didn't spin at all. Hits his front leg, and the umpire agrees to Kuldeep's appeal. The former KKR player has to go back. Time out as well
flighted on leg stump. Williamson pushes at it, inside out, to long off
good length on off stump, but spinning into Williamson. Turned off his pads to square leg

flighted on middle stump, and Pandey comes down the wicket. Almost yorks himself,  but manages to lift it over Kuldeep eventually. The umpire goes on the floor - trying to duck - as the shot trickles down to long on
tossed up outside off, and driven away from his body to cover. Russell picks it up in a flash and has a shy at the stumps. Direct hit, but Williamson is safe
flatter ball on middle stump, worked to midwicket off the back foot and they're off for the quick single. Chance of a run-out at the non-striker's, but it's not a direct hit
good length on middle, and KW goes deep into his crease. Punches to midwicket, but Lynn does well to get his body behind it
full just outside off, and tapped down the ground to long on
full on off, and KW tries to paddle this fine. Bottom-edges it because of the full-ish nature of the delivery and goes to the leg side. They want to appeal for the lbw, but eventually choose not to
full outside off, but it zips straight through off the surface. Williamson tried to defend for the spin, but can't connect
full on middle stump, and his leg-side push takes a leading edge. The ball goes towards cover instead, and enough time to take the single
full on off, and that's hit back hard to Kuldeep. He can't get his fingertips to it, and the ball runs down to long on
tossed up on middle stump, and Pandey takes a big wind up, but eventually checks his shot. Defended back to Kuldeep
good length on leg and spinning across Williamson. Tries to pull square but is through his shot way too early. Comes off the bat's toe end, and goes past Kuldeep's right
good length on middle, and spinning away. Cut off the back foot to cover again
tossed up full outside off, and Williamson drives with the spin. Excellent stop by Russell at cover though, diving forward
good length outside off, and poked off the back foot. Takes the outside edge, but only to Lynn at short third man. No runs off the bat in the over
good length outside off, but sharply spins inwards. Pandey mistimes his punch back to the bowler
good length on off, and spinning away from Pandey. Cut off the back foot to the man at point
full on off this time. Defended, once again, with soft hands. The ball is tapped back to Narine
full outside off, and defended with soft hands towards the off side. Slight hesitation from the batsmen, and Pandey chooses not to run

the zing bails have lit up! Overpitched on leg stump, and almost a yorker from Narine. Dhawan tries to defend but the ball sneaks under his bat. Hits his back leg, and then crashes into the base of off stump. Sunrisers lose their openers
full outside leg stump. Dhawan tries to sweep, but can't connect
full, and just outside off. Big stride forward and defended towards the on side
good length outside off, and he tries to carve it to point. Takes the bat's inside edge and ricochets onto his pads
punched through the infield! Textbook stuff from Williamson. Good length on off, and punched off the back foot between cover and cover point
full just outside off, and driven with the legspin past cover. Long off tries to run to his left, but can't stop it from finding the boundary
back of a length on leg stump, worked off his pads to the man in the deep on the leg side
short on off stump, but zipping into his pads. Whipped off his pads to short fine leg
good length just outside off. Punched off the back foot to long on. Successful over from Narine
good length on leg stump. No spin this time, and Dhawan pulls to deep midwicket for a walking run
good length on off and angling into KW. Turned off his pads to deep midwicket. Gets off the mark
arm ball on middle stump. Pitches full, and Williamson blocks off the back foot
tossed up on off, and spinning into his pads. Tries to defend, but hits his pad. In the air for a bit, which forces DK to try and catch it. Falls just short of him
out first ball! Full on leg, and spinning further away from Saha. Tries to flick it fine, but takes a feather edge off his bat. Excellent take from DK and that's got Narine grinning!
back of a length on leg stump. Cramps Saha for room, but still manages to flick it behind square off the back foot
full on off, and Saha crunches this over mid on! In Saha's arc, and he check-drives it to the on side. Enough behind it to beat the infield
another slower ball wide outside off. Saha's in position to lean into that shot, and times it extremely well past cover. Silences the Kolkata crowd again
overpitched, slower ball outside off. Saha tries to drive away from his body but is foxed by the pace. The umpire feels it's a wide
too short on middle, and Saha is quick to swivel and pull. Hit very square and there's no one there in the boundary. Collects another four
good length on off, and shaping away from Saha. Pokes at it, and tapped to Gill at point
full on off, and Saha lifts this over midwicket. Off the bat's toe end, so it doesn't have the legs to go the boundary

short_text: Russell to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: goes short again! Pitches on leg stump, and Dhawan misses the pull this time. He's lucky that didn't take a bit of glove on the way to the keeper

short_text: Russell to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: short on off again, but Dhawan's quick to pounce on that length. Pulls it along the ground and beats midwicket on its way to the boundary

short_text: Russell to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: short on off and going away from Dhawan. Tries to play the uppercut, but misses. Collected by DK from in front of his pace
good length just outside off. Rides the bounce and taps it to point. Calls early for the single
good length on off, and Saha pulls it square. Hit off the bat's middle, and manages to clear midwicket by a few feet. No one in the deep
back of a length on leg stump, and Dhawan dabs it down to third man. Gets off the mark
full on off, and checks his drive at the last second. Pushed to mid off
full on leg, and Saha uses his wrists to whip it off his pads to deep backward square. Fine leg can't intercept either
good length on off, and jagging into Saha again. Fended off the back foot with soft hands this time
back of a length on middle and hits Saha's gloves. Fended towards point
awry from Johnson. Full, but pitched wide outside leg stump
full on off, and swinging into Saha. Tries to slog towards the leg side but the ball goes between bat and pad. How did that miss the top of off stump?
good length on off stump, defended
good length on off, and angling across Saha. Left alone by the batsman, and slightly unlucky that the umpire calls it a wide. It was well inside the tramlines

overpitched, but wide outside off. Too far for Mavi, but he manages to stick his bat out. Takes the toe end, and top-edges it behind the keeper. Bhuvneshwar and Stanlake both try to take the catch, and the Indian gets there first. Does well to ensure he doesn't crash into big Billy S. KKR finish on 138 for 8

short_text: Kaul to Shivam Mavi, no run
long_text: good length on off, and angling into Mavi. Tries to play the uppercut but nowhere near that shot
full on middle and Johnson manages to bunt it to long off
full outside off, and Johnson's wild swing doesn't connect. Goes under his bat and through to the keeper
full on middle stump and Mavi backs away. Carves it off the back foot to point on this occasion
full on off, and muscled inside out over cover. Dhawan at wide long off has to run to his left, but manages to parry this back into play
good length on off, and Johnson tries to pull towards cow corner. Takes the top edge, but lands just short of Stanlake at third man. Finishes with 3 for 26
full on off, and Mavi drags this towards the leg side. Manages to muscle this towards long on

caught, but no ball! Full on off, and Johnson backed away to free his arms. Hit it towards cover, but slices it into the air. KW takes the catch, and even starts celebrating, before Bhuvi tells him about the no ball. Free hit
good length on off stump, but angling across the batsman. Tries to carve it towards point, but goes past the outside edge and through to the keeper. Bhuvi wants to review, but they're out of reviews.
edged! Full outside off, and Karthik's drive away from his body takes the outside edge. Pocketed by Saha moving to his right
slower ball that DK can't connect with. Good length on off but takes ages to get to the batsman. Misses the late cut
knuckle ball on off, but Karthik's spotted the length early. Big stride forward and muscled over the bowler's head. Lands beyond the sightscreen. Full use of the free hit!
full outside off, and DK hits it over Bhuvneshwar's head. Off the bat's toe end and falls in front of long off. Oh dear, front-foot no-ball too. Free hit

short_text: Rashid Khan to Shivam Mavi, 2 runs
long_text: full on middle stump, and Mavi's sweep goes to short fine leg. Rashid appeals for the lbw, but the umpire thinks it's bat first. Williamson reviews.. Replays show glove first
full on off, and he sweeps behind square to fine leg. Had to drag it from outside off eventually

short_text: Rashid Khan to Karthik, FOUR runs
long_text: delicately played! Good length on off, and DK sticks his bat out to cut it super late. Beats short third man and races away for four

short_text: Rashid Khan to Karthik, no run
long_text: misses the outside edge! Full on off stump, but it's the flipper this time. Zips on after pitching, and DK defends down the wrong line. Smartly taken by the keeper

short_text: Rashid Khan to Shivam Mavi, 1 run
long_text: full on leg stump, and going straight through. Takes the batsman's pads, and trickles down to short fine leg
delicate, but only a single. Full on off, and he reverse paddles it to short third man

short_text: Bhuvneshwar to Shivam Mavi, no run
long_text: good length on off stump, and too close to Mavi for the cut. Almost takes the bat's edge but eventually safe through to the keeper
short outside off, and chopped on to third man for a walking single

soft dismissal! Good length outside off, and swinging away from Gill. He tries to muscle this over the infield, but takes the top edge. Shakib - at cover - takes a few steps back and completes the catch from near his face. Bhuvi's knuckleball earns him a wicket
full, but wide outside off. Gill tries to drive towards the off side again, but comes off the bat's inside half. Hit to midwicket
full outside off, and driven away from his body. Not timed well, and easily stopped by cover
starts off with the slower ball. Short on middle, and DK flicks it fine off his pads. Goes to fine leg this time
good length on middle, and it's pulled off the back foot to deep midwicket. He'll keep strike
good length on middle stump, and Gill turns it off his pads to fine leg

short_text: Rashid Khan to Gill, no run
long_text: full just outside off. Defended off the front foot towards cover. Slightly slower this time, meaning more revs on that delivery
full on leg stump, and DK misses the defense. Hits his pad, and the ball goes to the leg side for a run. The umpire says bat first
flighted outside off, and Gill check-drives. Hits it well, but Dhawan at wide long off cleans up
full on off, and spinning away from DK. Driven down the ground to long on
good length on middle, and misses the leg-side flick. Hits his pad and dribbles away to square leg
full on off, and he slices it this time. The ball goes to mid-off, allowing them to take the single
full on off stump, and his drive takes the outside edge. Goes to third man, where Stanlake is positioned
full just outside off. Driven down the ground to mid off
good length outside off, but DK rides the bounce to punch this with the bat's open face. Beats point, and third man can't cut it off either
good length outside off, and DK walks down the wicket. Punches to deep extra cover thereafter
short outside off, and Gill tries to cut it over the slip cordon. Too high and through to Saha. Time out again
good length on off stump, and blocked off the back foot. Played to point
overpitched on off stump. Almost a yorker, but DK does well to push it towards cover
back of a length and just outside off. Fended off the back foot with soft hands

Poor from Russell. Full outside off, and Dre Russ slaps this over point once again. Slices it this time, and Pandey - at point - runs towards the boundary to complete an excellent diving catch! Slides across the ground after pocketing that. Pandey's been electric today
Full outside off, and Russell slaps this over point. Hooda races to his left and sticks his hand out, and even throws the ball in, but his back leg is hitting the boundary
good length on middle, and angling into his pads. Tries to flick square, but hits his pad instead
full on off, and driven with the turn down to wide long on
tossed up on off stump, but Russell's not biting the apple. Defended off the front foot
darts it into Russell's pads, and he flicks towards deep backward square. Could've easily gone to the man at short leg too
falls for 49! Good length on middle, and Lynn punches this too soon. The ball stuck up after pitching, forcing the error from Lynn, and Shakib dives to his left to take a one-handed stunner
full on leg stump, and turned off his pads to short fine leg
good length, just outside off. Turns it towards the leg side with soft hands. Played in the gap, which allows DK to take the single. Rashid has to go chasing after it

short_text: Rashid Khan to Karthik, no run
long_text: tossed up on middle and leg. DK chooses to defend off the front foot
back of a length on middle stump. Lynn goes deep onto the back foot and muscles it to midwicket
quicker one, and on a good length. Angling into Karthik, who clips it off his pads to square leg
good length on off, and spinning into Lynn. Whipped off his pads to square leg
back of a length on middle stump. No spin this time, and DK flicks it off his pads to midwicket
low full toss outside off, and Karthik attempts to drive over cover. Takes the bat's toe end, but falls just over cover. The man in the deep cleans up
tossed up on off stump, and driven down the ground past Shakib. Straight to long off

KW to the rescue! Good length outside off, and the arm ball does the trick. Narine swings through the line of the ball, but not off the meat of the bat. In the air for ages, and Williamson runs back from midwicket to complete the catch

good length outside off, and the ball spins away from Narine again. He tries to hit it over cover, but Narine manages to slice this over point! Kaul chases after it, but the ball picks up pace after hitting the practice pitches. Can't pull it back

stumped? The umpire's going upstairs. Good-length ball outside off, and the ball spins away from Narine this time. Tries to smash this over the bowler's head, but misses it completely. Replays suggest that Narine got his backfoot down in time though. Not out
full toss outside leg stump, and Narine misses the pull. But the keeper can't hold onto it either, which forces Stanlake - at short fine leg - to go chasing behind it
full outside off, and Narine dances down the wicket. Crunches a drive past cover, but Yusuf Pathan's full-stretched dive at long off saves the boundary
short on off, and Lynn tries to flat-bat this towards the off side. Comes off the bat's top half, and in the air. Lands just short of cover!
Kaul unlucky again! Overpitched on off stump, and Lynn's drive takes the inside edge. Misses leg stump and runs away to the fine-leg boundary
yorker on leg stump and Lynn does well to squeeze this away towards the off side

full outside off, and Lynn's done waiting. Makes room to the leg side and muscles this over the bowler's head. Rashid Khan - at long on - runs to his left and tries to take a diving catch. Manages to get his left hand to it, but the ball pops out, then hits his shoulder, and then finally falls beyond the boundary
back of a length outside leg, and Narine makes room on the leg side. Pulled, but mistimed, over square leg to the man in the deep
full outside leg, and Narine tries to swing towards the leg side. Inside edge, but falls short of the keeper diving to his right

Pandey again, but this time he drops it! Full on off, and Narine went through with the golf swing. Hit it well, and looked like it was gonna go over long on, but Pandey jumped, took the catch, and then threw it back in since he was falling over. Tried to return and complete the catch, but the ball falls short. He threw the ball back in with just a bit too much power. Saves five runs nonetheless. Time out
full on middle, and Lynn backs away. Tries to smack this down the ground but mistimed to long off
good length on off, and Narine tries to work it on the leg side. Takes the leading edge towards cover instead
good length outside off, and cut square to the man in the deep. They walk across for the single
good length just outside off, and Lynn cuts this square. Played off the front foot, but stopped by Bhuvi at point
full outside off, and Lynn drives away from his body. Straight to cover
back of a length on middle, and angling away from Narine. My, my, he shoulders his arms in a T20
welcomes him with a short ball on leg stump. Narine goes deep into his crease, and defends off the back foot

Pandey takes a screamer! Stanlake celebrates but the wicket's all Pandey's. Cuts this ball super hard, but Pandey - at point - dives to his right and sticks both hands out. The ball popped out of his hand, but managed to take the catch eventually as Pandey returned back to Earth. Excellent!
short on leg stump, and the ball soars over Rana's head. He happily gets under the line of this delivery
good length on middle, and fended off the front foot. Lynn went to the leg side but Stanlake's delivery angle followed him. Rana wanted the single, but Lynn wasn't sure. They complete it eventually
goes short first up. Tapped off the back foot to third man, and Yusuf misfields! The ball slips through his hands and almost goes to the boundary. Does well to pull it back
full on off stump, and bunted down the ground to long on
full just outside off, Lynn backs away and carves it towards point
good length outside off again, and Rana cuts it square to the man in the deep
good length outside off, and zipping straight through. Tries to cut but misses
full on off, and Lynn tries to crunch this past cover again. Mistimed towards the off side, but manages to take the single
good length on off, and spinning into Lynn. Punched to cover

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rana, FOUR runs
long_text: half-tracker on middle, and spinning away from Rana. He backs away, and cuts this hard past point. No stopping that!

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rana, no run
long_text: full on leg stump, and spinning across Rana's body. Defends the wrong'un off the front foot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rana, SIX runs
long_text: flighted on middle stump, and Rana's picked this length early! Down on one knee, and slog swept over cow corner. Not timed extremely well, but enough behind Rana's swing to take it into the stands. First six off Rashid this season
full on off, and spins away from Lynn. He walks across to the off side and nudges towards midwicket
tossed up on middle, and Rana attempts a wide leg-side heave. Hit towards midwicket, but was in the air for a while

short_text: Rashid Khan to Rana, no run
long_text: good length on middle and spins into Lynn! Cramped for space, and manages to push it towards cover
crunched through the covers! Raw power on display here. Pitched up on off, and Lynn swings his bat with all the force of this world. Smacked to the wide long-off boundary
full and wide outside off again! Lynn backs away and therefore can't reach at it. Through to the keeper
overpitched wide outside off. Lynn sticks his bat out, and cuts this past point. Backward point dives to his right and manages to get fingertips to it

Lynn's lucky this time! Full on off, and he tries to smack this over the bowler's head. Except, this time Lynn finds the bat's inside edge and sends it fine down the leg side. Another knuckleball this time, but much better execution

good length, but wide outside off. Lynn backs away and then slashes this over point. Three men in the infield, but clears all of them. The chase from the fielders are futile. Replays suggest it's the knuckleball
starts off with the slower ball. Did that slip out of his hand? It's short on middle, and Lynn tries to pull. But he's through his shot too early. Mistimed towards short fine leg

another excellent ball! Four dots to end the over. Similar ball to the one previously in the over. Good length on middle, and beautifully angling away from Rana as he tries to defend. He's lucky that didn't fine the outside edge
good length on leg and Rana's cramped for room this time. Tapped to cover off the back foot, but rather unconvincingly
beauty! Nice shape, and the ball just misses Rana's outside edge. Good length on middle stump and angling tantalisingly away from Rana. He tried to defend, but played it down the wrong line
good length on middle stump, but angling across Rana. Shoulders his arms this time
back of a length outside off and Lynn backs away. Chops it down to third man this time
short ball first up, and Rana gets his eyes off the ball! Gets big on him, and hits his handle as Rana tries to look away. Lands safe, just in front of point. Quick!
good length, and outside off. Rana sticks his bat out and pokes it towards point. Calls early for the single
good length outside off, and angling further away. Perfect ball to the new man to get his eye in. Slaps this square, and beats both point and third man

appeal for caught behind! But not given. Williamson reviews straightaway. Sunrisers look convinced. It was a good length ball outside off, and jagging just into Uthappa. He tried to run it fine, but the ball took the outside edge. UltraEdge shows a big spike, and the umpire has to reverse his decision
good length on middle, and heaved towards midwicket. Mistimed once again, but gets off strike

back of a length outside off, and Lynn gives it a big heave. Hits it over the non-striker, but bounces just in front of mid on. The fielder jumps over the ball, and it races away to the boundary thereafter. Mistimed shot but gets four
short outside off, and fended off the back foot towards the off side. They jog across for the single
good length on middle and angling sharply into Lynn. The batsman had made some room on the leg side, so Stanlake did well to follow him. Lynn taps it towards point
back of a length outside off. Angling into Lynn, and defended off the back foot

full on middle, and driven inside out over Stanlake. Williamson, at mid off, goes running backwards, and even sticks his hand out, but the ball drops out of his right hand. Terrific effort, but just too difficult. Another boundary
short outside off, and Lynn crunches this off the back foot. Slapped past backward point as the ball races away for a boundary. Manish Pandey groans 'nooo' as Lynn leans into that shot
big swing of the bat from Lynn, but misses completely. Good length outside off, and just about enough room to free his arms

back of a length on off, and angling into Uthappa. Worked off his body to square leg, and they take off for the run. Shakib's throw at the striker's end isn't a direct hit, or else Lynn would've been in trouble
back of a length first up to Lynn. Superb accuracy from Bhuvneshwar, which forces Lynn to defend off the back foot
full outside off, and tapped with soft hands to point. Slight hesitation, but they scamper across for the single eventually
stays back of a length again. Uthappa walks across to the off side and blocks off the back foot. Four dots to start the match. Can he finish well?
short on off, and cramping into his body. Tries to work it towards the leg side, but hits his body
back of a length, but just outside off. Fended off the back foot towards cover
good length outside off, and Uthappa defends it away. Bhuvi starts off with two slips
