it clears cover, and they complete the run. Delhi celebrate. Yes yes, it's another cutter outside off. Roy swings again, like he has been doing and the ball lobs off the outside half, but because every one is in, the ball clears the infield. And Delhi Daredevils complete a thrilling seven-wicket win against Mumbai.
125 kph, shortish delivery outside off, Roy misses another dab and it's another dot. Mumbai want to review. No bat. It's a dot.
a slower cutter again, outside off, the ball cuts nicely off the pitch and Roy misses a swing.
a slower ball outside off, that's the length that will cut off the pitch. Roy makes no contact.

and that's the game! Gambhir is pumped. Mumbai are despondent. What an inning sfrom Roy, it's the same shot that Jadhav played to get six in game 1. A full delivery on middle and leg, flicked away over fine leg for six. Such power in those wrists.
smashed for four! Full and wide from Mustafizur, it's not a bad option but it's slow because he's looking for the cutter. With that length, it won't cut. Drilled over cover for four.
another wide yorker, another offcutter! Inside the tramline. Sensational bowling. Iyer is beaten again as he tries to dab the ball. That is predictable, but still so hard to get bat on that.
DOT BALL! 122 kph, another cutter, it's just inside the tramline too. Iyer misses a dab.
a full wide delivery outside off, driven to long-off for one. Could not get under the length of that.
a slower ball outside off, Roy is completely deceived, the ball lobs over the bowler, a chip for a couple. Did not pick that cutter.
a low full toss on middle, hoicked away to deep midwicket, on the bounce. Not a bad result for Mumbai.
a slower ball outside off, guided to deep point for one. Just one. Roy wants two.
it's too predictable, the length that is. Short around middle and leg, pulled away into the gap between square leg and midwicket. The ball lands just inside the boundary, four.
dot ball! Another cutter outside off, another swat, another swing and miss.
full and wide, carved over backward point. By the time deep point gets across to his left, two easy runs.
a predictable cutter, around off. Iyer misses a swat, dot

and they concede the leg bye eventually! A full delivery down leg, Roy looks for the paddle scoop. The ball hits the pad to fine leg. Roy sends Iyer back, the throw is to the non-striker's end. Mustafizur doesn't bother colecting the throw and so concedes an extra
a cutter on middle, pushed to cover for one. Roy and Mustafizur collide. But the run is easily done.
a low full toss outside off, looking for the reverse paddle scoop but he hits the ball back into hos body.
that should be the match! A short delivery outside off, Iyer goes back and goes slashing. Straight to Mustafizur at a good height too, at short third man. The ball bursts out, a big, big drop
another boundary! Another short, slower ball outside off. Slashed away in front of point for four. The fielder patrolling the sweeper cover area has no chance.
a yorker outside off, jammed into the pitch and then over mid-off for a run.
a slower delivery, a cutter, swatted away through midwicket for four. Smashed away.
Mustafizur drops that! A slower delivery outside off, a thick leading edge just about carries to short third man. Mustafizur dives in front, but the ball pops out.
short and slow down leg, worked to wide long-on for one.
slow down leg, Iyer misses a big slog, struck on the pad.
short and wide outside off, carved away towards point. Rahul Chahar, the sub fielder, dives away to his left, but the ball trickles into the boundary. Sloppy.
slow on leg, pushed to long-off
sightscreen! Very well bowled, a slower delivery outside off, and wide too. Roy comes down and just chips the ball straight, still so much timing that it hits the sighscreen
a low full toss outside off, 109 kph, swatted to cover.
92 kph, bottom hand. Slow outside off, driven back to the bowler.
the googly around middle and leg, in the hitting arc and he goes smash, over midwicket. Massssive hit.
slightly shorter on middle and leg, pushed away to midwicket
driven away to long-on for a run.
flat and wide outside off, outside the tramline
bottom hand, all of it. How else was it possible for him to get under such a full delivery and hit it in the air? Slogged away to deep midwicket, the fielder runs in, the ball is just short.
89 kph, slow down leg, nudged to short fine leg for one.
83 kph, flat down leg, some spin too. Roy misses a hard sweep, struck on the body.
flat outside off, driven to long-off for on, hit with the spin
slow on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
driven to long-on for a run.

sensational catch by Hardik Pandya, off his bro's bowling. A slower delivery outside off, the ball is flighted and loopy. The ball spins away but Maxwell can't back down from his hit over cover. But because of that spin, the ball skews away off the outside half. Hardik runs around to his left, keeps his eyes on the ball and dives full length to get both hands on the ball to clasp the ball. But he doesn't let go of the ball even as his body and arm and shoulder hits the ground. Terrific catch.
under-edged? A flat delivery outside off, Roy looks for the cut, the ball beats the keeper en route to short fine leg.
another six. The runs just keep coming, the shots too. A legbreak on leg, Maxwell heaves his sweep with enough timing and power over square leg.
too straight, four on the bounce. A loopy delivery on leg, Maxwell clears his front leg and boshes a straight powerful drive to long-on
another push in front of point for a run.
a legbreak, and straight. Slogged to deep square leg.
another googly down leg, worked away to deep midwicket. Right in the gap, so two easy.
a googly on middle, slogged to deep midwicket. Suryakumar misfields, but no damage done.
slow on middle, 78 kph. Maxwell pushes the ball to Krunal's right. He dives and stops the ball.

great catch by Pollard. A slower delivery outside off from Krunal, Pant looks to hit the ball over long-off, wanted to get under that, but the ball just skews away after the bat turns in his hand. The fielder dives to his left and takes the catch, diving to his left. Making a tough catch look relatively easy.
another yorker, on leg, jammed out.
shortish and wide outside off, pummeled to long-on for one.
a yorker outside off, a good defensive option, punched to long-off
80 kph, a slower delivery outside off. Pant gets under the length of that and drills the drive right back at the bowler. Over the bowler and four.
a slower ball down leg, worked to deep square leg for one
a slower ball down leg, worked into the leg side for one.
good length outside off, chopped down to third man.
just over mid-off. Full outside off, Roy nails the drive with so much power and enough timing that even Pollard can't get there with a well-timed leap. He may have done some damage too
a misfield. Full and wide outside off, carved to backward point. A fumble allows two and Roy's fifty
on a length down leg, nudged down to fine leg for one.
flat on middle, worked into the gap at long-on. Roy wants two but he's rightly sent back.
that is huuuuuge! Pant comes charging down again, gets to the pitch and smashes the ball over long-on. Fantastic timing.
slightly shorter, around off, pulled to deep midwicket, one.
good batting, slow on leg, worked away to midwicket
flat down leg, swept down, using just a bit of bat to get that gap. Deft touch. The fine paddle sweep races past short fine leg.
superb shot! Six more. Mumbai's spinners are being mauled. Pant runs down, gets close to the pitch and lofts the ball cleanly and elegantly over long-on.
another sweep, to deep square leg for a run. May have been another googly, to avoid bowling in the arc.
84 kph, four more. Markande being taken for plenty! Short on middle and leg, Pant rocks back and pulls this neatly through square leg for four.
a googly outside off, chopped down to short third man for a run.
juuuust over long-off! A googly outside off, Roy watches the ball till very late and swats a sweep-type stroke with enough power over the fielder
another googly outside off, drilled down to long-off
just over short third man! A googly outside off, Pant stays low and reverse-paddles the ball over the fielder's head at third man. Juust enough elevation

has it bounced? Ground-boot or boot and air? A flat delivery outside off, Roy chops the ball into hos leg, the ball pops up. Kishan dives full length to his right and take the catch full. The soft signal is out, but that's the wrong decision because the ball has hit the ground.
a low full toss, almost a yorker. Jammed the shot into his foot.
didn't read that either but improvised well. Short and wide, slashed away to deep point for two.
short down leg, nudged down to short fine leg for one.
short outside off, the ball turning away, swatted to long-off. Don't think he read that one.
slow on off, pushed in front of point for a quick single. Cover can't stop one.
another short googly outside off, cut to deep point. One.
95 kph, hammered to deep midwicket for four. A googly outside off, he rocks back and hits the ball to the opposite side of the field, to midwicket
he finds the gap this time and gets four. Flat and wide, hit away through cover for four. Rocks back, uses the width and frees his arms.
a googly outside off, moving further across, cut to cover.
short around off, Pant goes back and swats one to cover.
comes down and works the ball to deep midwicket
132 kph, full outside off, chopped away towards backward point.
good length on middle and off, pushed to cover
good length on middle, pushed back to the bowler.
a full delivery on middle and leg, hoicked across the line to deep square leg for one.
full down leg, pushed away to mid-on for a single.

taken! Mumbai strike. A back of a length delivery on middle and off, Gambhir stays on the back foot, looking to pull but he is hurried through the stroke, due to the pace of the ball. All he can do is splice a pull to Rohit at midwicket
a wide yorker outside off, jammed out to cover
hammered for four more. A slower delivery around off, beaten with immense power right over the bowler. These slower ones are not working to Roy. 21 off five
six more! That is humongous. Back of a length on middle and leg, Roy watches the ball onto his pull and goes bosh over square leg.
massive. A slower ball again from Hardik, it's right in the slot. Lofted cleanly and sweetly over long-on.
full and wide, an offcutter, driven to deep cover for one.
heaved away over square leg for four! It's a slower ball, on leg. Gambhir picks the length, stays back and heaves the ball behind square. The ball lands just inside the boundary.
good stop by Pollard. Full and wide outside off, carved away to mid-off's right. Pollard dives away and saves three to prevent a boundary
chipped over the bowler! A cutter on middle and leg, Mustafizur's length is good too. Roy looks to turn the ball away but the ball splices over
shortish and wide, carved away to deep cover for a run. Looking to hit the ball too hard.
full delivery outside off, a badly-timed drive to mid-off. Gambhir under pressure.
shortens the length slightly. Back of a length outside off, punched to deep cover
full delivery outside off, driven to cover.
a slower ball on middle and leg, swatted away to square leg. Just two runs off the over, now Delhi under some pressure.
143 kph, full on middle and leg. That's Gambhir bread and butter. He misses a flick, struck on the pad. Just two runs off the over.
Gambhir struggling to account for the bounce! Back of a length outside off, another swing and miss.
a slower ball on middle and leg, helped along to the square leg boundary. Fine leg gets across.
a swing and miss. Back of a length on off, or just wider. Gambhir backs away and misses a drive. Just over the off stump.
good length outside off, the ball angles away and beats Gambhir. Just the angle.
flat on middle and leg, worked away to deep midwicket, Gambhir style, for one.
googly on middle and leg, nudged to deep midwicket for a run.
87 kph, short around off, hammered away through wide mid-on for four. That's a rubbish delivery
80 kph, flat and wide outside off, swatted to mid-off from the back foot.
huuuge! Runs down to the pitch, gets close enough and T20s the ball away over midwicket. A big hoick across the line, 95 metres.
flat outside off, punched to mid-off from the back foot.
that's a poor ball. Good length down leg, worked away easily through backward square leg for four. Pandya is not happy with that finish, his fault though.
a big appeal. No. Pad says the umpire. Mumbai agree. Gambhir isn't unhappy. So seems like the right decision. Full down leg, Gambhir misses a flick. Clips the pad.
back of a length outside off, Roy stands tall again and smashes a punchy drive to that deep cover. 145 kph, says the speed gun.
that's width! Good length outside off, Roy stands tall and punches through cover for four. On the up.
strays down leg, helped along to fine leg. Mustafizur moves smartly to his left to stop the boundary.
full and swinging back in outside off, worked away with the angle of swing to wide mid-on
full and straight, 134 kph, sliced to deep point for a couple. A valiant dive, has he made it? He has, so two more for Mumbai.
good length on middle and leg, swatted away to the bowler and mid-off for one.
a yorker at 137 kph on the pads, one leg bye down to fine leg. Pitched outside leg stump.
short outside off, carved away down to third man for a couple, well played. Take what you can now.
full outside off, outside-edged down to third man for one.
117 kph, a slower ball on middle and leg, Hardik slogs the ball away to deep midwicket. Picks out the fielder on the boundary. The momentum has been sucked out of this innings.
full delivery outside off, Dananjaya fails to make contact. Another dot ball.
a slower ball outside off, chipped over short cover for a couple.
excellent use of the short ball, a bouncer on off. Dananjaya sways out of the line, dot.

off the pad or bat? Pad, says the umpire. Daredevils want to review. It's a good-length delivery outside off, Krunal gets right across and works the ball into his pad, and then to short fine leg. Big inside edge and that decision should be out. A successful review, can make a big difference to the total. Was looking for the ramp over short fine leg, but insufficient contact to beat his thigh.
it's another low full toss outside off, hammered away to long-off. Just one.
full outside off, Krunal comes charging and drives to long-off for one.
a full, wide delivery is awkwardly slogged to long-on for one.
a slower delivery outside off, carved to backward point for a run.
a low full toss on off, 136 kph, worked to deep midwicket for one.
139 kph, an excellent wide yorker outside off. The ball creeps under the bat. Called a wide, quite harshly.

Roy takes the catch to dismiss Rohit. A slower delivery outside off, Rohit gets under the ball and slices the ball towards mid-off. Not enough timing, not enough power, the only two not-enoughs-of you need at the Wankhede.
a low full toss outside off, carved away in front of extra cover for two. There are three men inside the circle on the off side, so he uses that wrist to slice the ball.
a full delivery outside off, Krunal gets right across and uses his bottom hand to whip the ball towards wide long-on for a single.
lovely shot and a good stop too. A low full toss outside off, drilled past cover. Vijay Shankar makes lots of ground to his right and stops the boundary.
well bowled, the wide yorker outside off, sliced to deep point for one.
a low full toss is bunted to long-on for one. Rohit wants to stay there for the last two overs.
full outside off, skewed away to the sweeper cover for a run.
just over mid-off. A slower delivery outside off, Krunal gets under the length and lifts the ball over the fielder.
another yorker outside off, driven to cover. The innings losing momentum.
full and straight, worked away to deep midwicket for a run.

a first-ball duck for Pollard. He comes down, looking to work the ball into the leg side. But he walks far across while looking to find his first run. The ball, a nothing delivery on off, clips the back of his front pad and then ricochets into the off stump. Not been a great start to the IPL for Pollard.

127 kph, looking for the reverse-hit! A full toss on middle and leg, the friendlies of deliveries to swing into the leg side, but he premeditated that shot. He can't make contact with that high full toss and the ball connects with the stump.
a shortish delivery on middle and leg, pulled to deep midwicket for a couple. Not quite the best timing, but in the gap ably.
hit over cover! A full and wide delivery at 118 kph., Kishan gets enough power behind the shot to hit the ball over cover for four.
short on middle and leg, swatted away to deep square leg for a couple. A 50-run stand

short_text: Shami to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: yorker on the stumps, right on target, dug out by the Mumbai captain
short of a length around off, pulled quietly to deep midwicket for one
that's another shot he isn't in control of. It's a short delivery and Kishan haphazardly pulls as it gets too big on him, and ends up skewing it off the top-edge to the fine leg boundary
another shot to the same fielder but the intent was a lot different on this occasion. He reached out to a widish length ball and threw hard hands looking to force it through the off side
tries to pull off an encore there but this time he finds the short third man fielder

if you want to know about placement, look at that. Kishan simply gets on top of a short of a length delivery by using the depth of the crease and opens the face to run it straight between short third man and keeper

short_text: Christian to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: and finally Rohit gets a move too. Got some catching up to do with the rest of his mates, the Mumbai captain. On this occasion, he makes use of Christian's angle as he bangs one into the batsman and Rohit swivels and helps it along to the fine leg boundary
fails to get entirely on top of this short one and pulls unconvincingly to midwicket
length ball outside off, Rohit fends it away towards the short third man region off the outside of the bat
advances down the ground and uses the wrists to flick with the angle to deep midwicket
full and angled in at off, Kishan crunches a straight drive. Everything alright with that, except that he hit it too straight, so much that it crashes right into the stumps at the non-striker's end
back of a length and angling in on leg, flicked through midwicket
comes running down, gets underneath the length and slogs the ball neatly over midwicket for six more.
the switch hit for six! A low full toss on middle and leg, Kishan knows Tewatia is trying to take the ball away from him with googlies. Helped along over deep backward point.
drops short, Kishan reads the length, hurries back and pummels the pull into the gap at midwicket for four.
overpitched on middle, worked to deep midwicket. Long-on prevents two

short_text: Tewatia to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: 83 kph, looking to come down and turn the ball to midwicket but fails to make adequate contact. Off the pad
drifts down leg for a wide. Another slider.
short and wide outside off, slashed to deep point for one.
short down leg, worked to deep midwicket for a single. A productive over.
that's four. Flat down leg, Ishan helps it down to the fine leg boundary with a paddle sweep, a poor delivery and four.
flat and quick on off, hits the pad and then to third man via the pad
works the ball to deep midwicket, with the spin.

short_text: Maxwell to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: nicely played! Flat and short outside off, Rohit just opens the bat face and taps the ball through slip. No slip. Four.
driven to long-on for a single.

short_text: Tewatia to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: some control now for Delhi. Flat on middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler.

short_text: Tewatia to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: slightly short and wide, tapped down to short third man.
a googly, short and wide, slashed to deep point for one.
slow on middle, driven to long-off with the spin.

given! Tewatia strikes. Suryakumar has been given out lbw, will he review? Yes. He wants to check, did it pitch outside leg? No. Did it slide past leg? Was there some glove? There was no immediate review from Suryakumar, so he didn't think so. There's a thin spike on UltraEdge. HawkEye shows the ball is just clipping the side of leg stump. So Mumbai keep their review, but lose Suryakumar. He was looking for a sweep through square leg, but missed the ball. It pitched on leg and slid on.
comes down and skews a drive to deep midwicket. Didn't quite get to the pitch of that. Two anyway.
slow around off, pushed back to the bowler.
flat outside off, the ball turning in, pushed in front of point for a single.
overpitched down leg, worked away into the gap at midwicket for two. Fifty for Suryakumar, a terrific innings
short outside off, Kishan goes back and punches to long-on for a single.
flat outside off, worked to long-on for a single.
flat outside off, driven to cover.

88 kph, Lewis holes out this time! Another googly outside off, Lewis comes charging and skews an attempted hoick, off the outside half of the bat. It lobs to Roy at mid-off to end a sensational opening stand.
flat and quick down leg, worked away to deep midwicket
short and wide outside off, carved to deep point
juuuust six! Skewed, but six. Some flight outside off, Lewis runs down and doesn't bother about the googly. Goes through with the shot, and just gets enough to clear the straight boundary
over cover for a single. Some flight around middle, Suryakumar looks to work the ball against the spin, but a thick leading edge over mid-off.
flat and wide outside off, carved to deep point for a single.
overpitched outside off, driven to long-off. A nice over from Maxwell.
another flat delivery on middle, punched back to Maxwell. Very tidy
strays down leg for a wide.
flat on middle and leg, worked away to midwicket
another push to long-on for a spin. A lull in play currently
very flat outside off, driven to cover for a single. Jammed out.
flat outside off, pushed to long-on for a run.
decent end. Just three off that over. Flat on off, pushed back to the bowler
goes for the almighty hoick over deep midwicket but makes no contact. A topspinner outside off, a wild swing and miss.
strays on the pads, nudged down to fine leg for a run.
flat outside off, a punch to long-off from the back foot
the googly outside off, punched to cover from the back foot.
on middle and leg, driven to long-on

more absolute filth from Daredevils. A cutter outside off that is a half-volley. Lewis says why both with four when I can check mys shot and get six for it. Smashed over mid-off. That's an 84-run Powerplay for Mumbai, their highest in the IPL
a length delivery around off, that's a much better length. Defended back
another overpitched delivery outside off, Lewis just uses what he's given and throws his arms at the width to get some free IPL runs. Smashed through cover.
a slower ball down leg, pushed away towards mid-on.
four more! 127 kph, a wide yorker outside off is sliced away to deep point for four. Mumbai have 74 with four balls left in the Powerplay.
a slower offcutter outside off and Lewis nails that too. Smashed through cover for four. Bludgeoned almost.
137 kph, more rubbish from Daredevils. Another low full toss down leg, flicked away easily to deep midwicket. He didn't learn from the previous error.
another low full toss on the pads, that's another poor delivery. Suryakumar works the ball elegantly but finds midwicket. Timing is awesome but placement isn't.
on the bounce to mid-off. A low full toss is bunted to the fielder at mid-off, Maxwell
well bowled, a full delivery around off, driven to cover
that's terrific batting. A yorker outside off, a wide yorker. Suryakumar opens the face of the bat, uses the pace again and carves the ball down to third man for four.
this is more filth. Short down leg, would you want the ball anything else? Suryakumar helps that along over fine leg for six. Just uses that pace and erroneous line.
flat around middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler this time.
slightly better, short outside off, bunted back to the bowler.
93 kph, flat down leg, wide. Another extra.

this is tripe! Filth from Nadeem. Short down leg, Lewis rocks back and pulls that easily and gleefully over square leg for a humongous six. Mumbai's fastest IPL fifty. An appalling start from Daredevils.
Maxwell gets to this, on middle and leg, worked away to wide mid-on. Maxwell dives to his right and stops the ball.
another misfield! It's short outside off, Suryakumar stands back and pummels a drive right back to his left. Nadeem sticks out a left hand but can't do much to stop the ball.
well bowled, shortened the length around middle and leg, pushed to mid-on
140 kph, the yorker on off, worked to midwicket. Mumbai are flying at 40 for 0.
bunted for six! On a length on middle and off, Lewis watches the ball late and then just chips the ball with all his muscular prowess over mid-on. Way over for six.
now Boult errs in line, on the pads, worked away to deep square leg.
four more! Back of a length outside off, Suryakumar improvises a late upper cut despite taking his eyes off the ball very early. Somehow he got his periscope of a bat up and ramped the ball over.
brings back the length slightly, shorter and wide outside off, cut away to extra cover.
a nod of appreciation from Rohit. It's too full again and Suryakumar nails his drive right back, a lovely, languid drive past mid-off's right

Boult stops the four! He's running back from short fine leg and just about gets there. That was a sensational effort. A flat delivery on middle and leg, Lewis gets a thick leading edge on his sweep, the top edge lobs in the air over fine leg. He races back, the ball is just beyond his reach and he pulls the ball back in despite losing balance.
darts this one on outside off, pushed away to mid-off
too flat again, on leg. Pushed away to mid-on for a run.
flat and straight, driven to long-on. No turn either.
strays waaaaay down leg. A wide to a right-hander.
another slider, on middle and leg, pushed to mid-on
extremely sloppy from Daredevils. A bad bad start. Flat down leg, worked away to wide mid-on. Maxwell dives to his left but falls over the ball and concedes four.
did he play a shot? Back of a length down leg, Lewis thinks of playing but bails out of the stroke. The ball ricochets down to fine leg off the pad. The umpire thinks there was a shot.
slightly shorter and Lewis reads the length very quickly. He stays back and pulls over square leg. Too short.
past Gambhir's right this time at mid-off. No swing at all for Boult. It's full outside off and a gentle loosener for Suryakumar to drive easily. Drilled.
134 kph, full outside off, driven to cover for nothing.
an overpitched start to begin. Full and wide, Suryakumar Yadav smashes that drive to Gambhir at mid-off, who labours to his left. A fumble allows two.
pitched up and outside off, Sundar lays into a drive and carts it away to the cover boundary to snap RCB's five-match losing streak at home
slower ball, floats away outside off, 107.4ks, foxes Sundar
dug in short and outside off, Sundar leaps and ramps it away to the third man boundary to level the scores. Third man isn't fine enough to cut it off
back of a length and zips through outside off, past the outside edge
back of a length and angling away outside off, punched sensibly through the covers

shortish and outside off, Mandeep swats it across the line to deep midwicket. Mandeep chances a second. It just wasn't there. Dagar, the sub fielder, throws it flat and hard to the keeper, who takes the bails off to catch Mandeep well short of the crease
full-toss on middle, tapped to cow corner for a double
back of a length on middle, hangs back and chips it in the air past the right of midwicket
Tye hushes the Chinnaswamy into silence. He goes short and outside off, AB upper cuts it in the air and holes out to Karun Nair at deep point.  Tye gives Kings XI hope. RCB need 10 off 11 balls
middle-stump yorker, squeezed through midwicket
back of a length on off, Mandeep loses his shape as he swipes an inside edge to square leg
very full and outside off, shuffles across and punches down the ground to long-off
back of a length and outside off, knuckle ball? AB shuffles across off and swats it past the right of long-on

Mohit floats a slower ball on middle from the back of the hand, de Villiers picks it, waits for the ball to arrive and launches it with great authority over the long-on boundary. What a way to bring up a fifty. AB pumps his fists as he acknowledges the dugout. Kohli applauds. Three sixes on the bounce for AB. How the match has turned
off-stump yorker, dug out through cover-point
This is more emphatic from AB and the Chinnaswamy roars in approval. Dragged down outside off, rocks back and nails a pull over midwicket. He sends it soaring into the stands
floated full and outside off, AB goes for the loft. Instead he slices it, but that's enough to clear the boundary at the Chinnaswamy. Up and over the long-off boundary
zippy offbreak on middle, pushed back to Mujeeb, and he lets the ball burst through his hands for a single. Mujeeb and AB collide. Just a single
short offbreak on middle, Mandeep goes deep in the crease and middles a pull to the left of deep square leg
short and wide outside off, AB backs away and slaps it away to wide long-off for just a single
wide of the crease, Mujeeb gets it to hold its line outside off, cracked to the covers, where Karun runs in, collects the ball, and throws it to the keeper. AB is quick enough to complete the single
back of a length and outside off, AB reaches out for the ball with his hands and scoops it off the toe end to long-off
really full on off, Mandeep can't get under it, forced to long-on
back of a length on the leg stump, cramps the batsman for room, off the thigh and rolls past Rahul
floats a slower full-toss outside off, stabbed straight back to Tye
dug short on off, slugged away to deep square leg
down the track and toe-ends a full-toss to cover
low full-toss on off, clubbed away to wide long-on

low full-toss outside off again, AB shimmied outside leg, then jumps across off and slog-sweeps it between deep midwicket and wide long-on. Neither Karun nor Stoinis committed. They simply let the ball through them to the boundary
slower one from the back of the hand, short on middle, dragged away to deep midwicket
back of a length and skids on outside off, Mandeep goes with hard hands and nearly chops it back onto the stumps
another low full-toss on off, AB stabs it down the ground again
low full-toss outside off, AB shuffles across and drills it straight down the ground
back of a length and angling in at off, worked into the vacant spaces at midwicket. Tye chases, stumbles, and RCB sneak two
very full on middle, AB cracks it down to long-on
slower and shorter outside off, chopped to cover
knuckle ball outside off, 117.4ks, pushed down to long-off
full and outside off, forward and laced down to long-off
full and angling in at off stump, tapped down to wide long-on
floats a slower ball down the leg side for a wide

short_text: Axar Patel to AB, no run
long_text: darted short and outside off, chopped straight to backward point off the back foot
Axar loops it up outside off and gets it to break away, driven with the spin to sweeper cover
tossed outside off, stretches out and eases it to long-off for a single
worked off the pads to deep midwicket
flat and spins away outside off, forced to sweeper cover off the back foot
short and angling in at off stump, hangs back and whips the ball away to deep midwicket
Ashwin lobs up a legbreak, dips on middle, tickled away to short fine leg off the inside half
another legbreak, full on middle and leg, nudged to square leg
legbreak, low full-toss on off, tapped back to the bowler

Ashwin has two in two. This is the legbreak and Ashwin has posted a slip to catch it. Wide of the crease, angling in, and breaking away outside off, Sarfraz simply runs the ball to slip, where Nair takes a sharp catch
De Kock runs past a slider and Ashwin hits the top of middle. Slides on with the arm from around the wicket, de Kock steps out, swishes and does not make contact.

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, no run
long_text: back of a length and slides in to hit the pad

short_text: Axar Patel to AB, no run
long_text: fired outside off, driven to cover

short_text: Axar Patel to de Kock, 1 run
long_text: Three fielders, including the bowler, converge but the ball drops in between them. Tossed up and spins away outside off, the ball turns in de Kock's hands as he skews it over the bowler's head. Yuvraj runs in from long-off, can't get there. Axar runs back, can't get there either. The ball was far away from the other fielder

short_text: Axar Patel to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: back of a length on middle, de Kock ventures another reverse-sweep, swatted away fine of short third man for four

short_text: Axar Patel to de Kock, 2 runs
long_text: flat on middle, swept away through backward square leg

short_text: Axar Patel to de Kock, no run
long_text: fired on off stump, reverse-swatted to short third man
short and skids in on middle, punched down to long-on

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, no run
long_text: tucked off the pads to short fine leg

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: low-arm slider on middle, more variations from Ashwin, de Kock goes low and sweeps it away through square leg for four

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, no run
long_text: skidding in to beat the inside edge and hit the thigh

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, SIX runs
long_text: floated up on middle, de Kock races down the track again, gets under the length again and hoists it over Ashwin's head for a thumping six
legbreak? tossed on middle, clipped away through square leg
de Kock runs down the track and hacks it off the inside half to the leg side

short_text: Axar Patel to AB, no run
long_text: back of a length and outside off, AB punches to short cover

short_text: Axar Patel to AB, no run
long_text: fired on off, pushed back to the bowler
tossed outside off and breaks away, driven fluently to sweeper cover off the front foot

short_text: Axar Patel to AB, no run
long_text: shorter and outside off, cracked off the back foot to backward point

short_text: Axar Patel to de Kock, 1 leg bye
long_text: on a length outside off, spins back in to beat the inside edge and hit the pad. The appeal for lbw is shot down. Ashwin calls for a review. de Kock stretches out but is pinned on the front pad below the knee-roll. Impact outside off? The tracker returns umpire's call on impact and de Kock survives

short_text: Axar Patel to de Kock, no run
long_text: de Kock closes the face early and leading-edges it to the left of Axar
back of a length and outside off, the ball flies off AB's bat. He flat-bats it fiercely past the right of sweeper cover. Regal shot.
back of a length on off, shovelled with the bottom hand to midwicket
back of a length and outside off, tip and run to point

short_text: Sharma to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: slower hip-high short ball on the leg stump, that's asking for trouble with the fine leg inside the circle. Swatted away past short fine leg for four
shorter and outside off, punched down to long-on
short of a length on off stump, angling in from over the wicket, AB rocks back and pummels a pull in front of square. Bam!
AB steps out, the bowler shortens his length, forced down to long-off off the back foot
wide of the crease, breaks back in on off, sharp offbreak, punched off the back foot to cover
de Kock steps out and clips it wide of midwicket

short_text: Mujeeb to de Kock, no run
long_text: slid through outside off, shuffles across and clips to midwicket

short_text: Mujeeb to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: looped up outside off, de Kock ventures down the track, takes a half-volley and belts it over midwicket
wide of the crease, tossed on middle, AB presses forward and drives to long-on
flat on middle, whisked to midwicket
sliding into the legs, turned wide of midwicket
pitched up on off, AB meets the pitch and drives a single down to long-on
very full on middle, driven down to long-off off the front foot

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: tossed on middle, steps out and flicks it in the air over midwcket. Stylish from de Kock

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, no run
long_text: slid into the pads, misses the flick
wide of the crease, fired onto the pads, nudged to square leg

Seventeen-year-old Mujeeb bursts through the gate of Kohli. He unfurls a googly from the back of the hand. It pitches outside off and zips back in sharply, Kohli has no clue about this variation. He drives and has his stumps rattled. Mujeeb hits the top of middle. What a ripper from Mujeeb. This game is on
wide of the crease, angling into middle, shovelled away to wide long-on
back of a length and skids on outside off, nearly 97ks, opens the face and glides it to backward point
slower through the air and outside off, not much turn, de Kock is early into the paddle-sweep. He ends up scooping it over the keeper's head

short_text: Mujeeb to de Kock, no run
long_text: speared outside off, drags a sweep to square leg
full and attacking the stumps, tapped to mid-on
pitched up and outside off, 115ks knuckle ball, Kohli now delays the drive. He picks the variation and delightfully drives through the covers
114.8ks knuckle ball on middle stump, de Kock delays his push and plays it to mid-off
short on off, hangs back and works it through square leg
back of a length and slanting in on off, defended back to the bowler
and Kohli welcomes him into the attack with a boundary. Shorter on middle, shimmies out and pulls it away to the long leg fence

short_text: Mujeeb to de Kock, no run
long_text: back of a length on middle from round the wicket, stabbed back to Mujeeb
skidder, stays low on middle, Kohli sits back and shovels it away to deep midwicket

short_text: Mujeeb to de Kock, 1 leg bye
long_text: floated on leg stump, de Kock does not make contact with a flick, off the pad and wanders away square on the leg side

short_text: Mujeeb to de Kock, no run
long_text: darted shorter and outside off, de Kock can't get on top of it. Mistimes a cut to backward point

short_text: Mujeeb to de Kock, no run
long_text: slider outside off, stretches out and drives to the covers
skids on middle, punched to long-off. Flicked out of the front of the hand

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, no run
long_text: full on off, patted to the covers off the front foot

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: fired outside off, slightly overpitched, de Kock leans into it and laces it through the covers

short_text: Ashwin to de Kock, no run
long_text: non-turning offbreak on off, de Kock presses forward and smothers it
floated outside off, short, forced down to long-on
back of a length on off stump, punched away to short midwicket
103ks dart outside off, Kohli uses the pace of Ashwin to his advantage and chops it away past the right of the keeper

short_text: Axar Patel to de Kock, FOUR runs
long_text: Axar goes short and outside off, de Kock skips back and crisply punches the ball between backward point and the covers
arm ball, slid into the pads, tucked to deep midwicket

short_text: Axar Patel to Kohli, no run
long_text: back of a length and outside off, flashed to cover-point

short_text: Axar Patel to Kohli, FOUR runs
long_text: dragged down outside off, Kohli sizes it up and cracks it it away past the left of Mujeeb. He does not get his body behind the ball and concedes four
Baz bags a first-ball duck. Axar darts it short and outside off, Baz makes additional room and looks to slash it away. He picks out Mujeeb at backward point

short_text: Axar Patel to de Kock, 1 run
long_text: heading into the pads, picked off to deep midwicket off the front foot
Woakes bounces out Mujeeb and wraps up Kings XI for 155. Short ball, homing in at the ribs, Mujeeb is too late onto the hook. He splices it to backward point
very full on the leg stump, dragged to deep midwicket off the inside half
sprayed wide outside off, well past the marker
really full on off, opens the face and runs it to backward point
Chahal dangles another wide legbreak. Ashwin runs down the track, but the ball dips, and breaks away sharply. Ashwin swings and misses. De Kock swipes the bails off in a flash
Ashwin dances out, Chahal dangles out a legbreak wide outside off. Ashwin goes through with his shot and flat-bats it over Chahal's head
tossed on middle stump, Ashwin uses his wrists and drives the ball away to deep midwicket
floated up at the pads, deflected to the leg side. Ashwin gets the strike
really full and outside off, squeezed to the covers
pitched up and outside off, opens the face and drives to the covers

full on off, right in the swinging arc, but Tye does not get all of it. He miscues a loft to Kohli at the long-off region. The RCB captain moved to his left from long-on and pouched it in front of AB at long-off. Tye got it off the toe end, giving Kohli catching practice
lifter outside off, flies off the deck, too high, wide
Ashwin shuffles across for a scoop to fine leg, Woakes hurls it wide outside off, Ashwin checks his shot and slices it to point
on a length and outside off, Ashwin backs away, collapses his back leg and lofts it inside out over extra cover
really full and wide outside off as Ashwin steps out and does not connect with a drive
hip-high short ball outside off, swatted across the line to wide long-on
back of a length on off, hoicked away to the left of Mandeep at deep square leg. An overthrow means Kings XI get three in the end. Umesh finishes with 3 for 23
bouncer on middle, 142ks, flies past the hook
back of a length on middle, checks his shot and smoothly chips to long-on
short and outside off, Ashwin checks his punch and slices to sweeper cover
back of a length and outside off, stays leg-side of the ball and pumps it through the covers
short and cramps the batsman for room, Ashwin stands tall and punches to long-on
full and drifts away outside off, carved away to deep point
full on middle, forced down to long-on
slides on outside off, opens the face and guides to point
fired on middle, defended to the leg side
back of a length on off, Tye punches it in the air, Umesh running to his left from deep midwicket swats the ball away to Kohli running across from wide long-on
nearly 100ks on off, forward and pushed down to long-on

Axar has been pinned in front. Umpire Ravi raises his finger almost immediately. Full and angled in from over the wicket, Axar is caught on the crease. He plays around his front pad and is struck on it below the knee-roll. It would crash into leg stump. Axar walks off
full on middle and leg, tapped down to long-on
skips away to the boundary like a pebble on water. Delightful. On a length and outside off, driven on the up between the covers and mid-off
full on off, eased down to long-on for one
Ashwin is early into a drive and sends an inside edge to fine leg
hip-high short ball on middle, Ashwin swivels on the back foot and pulls it elegantly over square leg
sliding into the pads, worked to AB at short midwicket. He makes a sprawling save
short and fast on middle, pushed back
Stoinis dares to step down the track, Sundar drags his length back and hurls it at 103.4ks, Stoinis swings and misses. De Kock gathers the ball and takes the bails off
Stoinis forays down the track, Sundar pulls his length back on off, Stoinis still launches it over the bowler's head, roughly in the direction of the sightscreen. Shot, Stoinis
floated outside off, driven off the front foot to long-off

an appeal for lbw, not given by umpire  Deshmukh. RCB ask for a review. Really full on middle, too full for the sweep, Stoinis misses the shot. This could go onto hit leg stump. The tracker, however, suggests it would head past the leg stump. Stoinis gets away and gets a leg bye

Kulwant returns and provides RCB with the breakthrough. Back of a length on middle stump, Nair swings so hard to the leg side that he loses his shape. He collects fresh air. Kulwant hits the top of middle
back of a length on the hips, swatted to deep midwicket
sliding into the hips, picked up and flicked to deep square leg
really full on leg stump, hangs back and whips it to deep square leg
full and just a shade outside off, tip and run to cover
back of a length on leg stump, skids off the pitch, beats the pull and hits the body
backs away and chops a slider to cover
Sundar hits a hard length outside off, stabbed into the covers
back of a length on middle, down the track and hacked away to long-on
back of a length and outside off, punched through the covers
Stoinis steps out, 101ks, jabbed back to the bowler
Quick fizzer from Sundar, bounces, and Sundar has Rahul top-edging a catch to short third man. Speared at 103.6ks outside off, rushes the batsman into a slog-sweep. Rahul skews it to Sarfraz Khan
big-turning legbreak. Chahal puts it on off and gets it to rip away outside off. Karun can't touch it
flatter and outside off, Karan goes low and reverse-sweeps it to the right of the keeper and left of short third man
near yorker on off, jammed down to long-on
Chahal shifts his line wider of off, Rahul uses his feet and slices it over backward point
Karun steps out, Chahal gives this legbreak a big rip, top-edges a sweep in front of deep midwicket
floats a legbreak outside off, swept against the spin to deep midwicket
full and outside off, driven through the line to long-off for one
darted on middle, backs away and slices an outside edge that does not carry to short third man
straight ball on off, opens the face, and bunts to cover
Karun steps down the track, meets the pitch, and lifts it nonchalantly over short midwicket. AB slides to his right from long-on and stops the ball
clipped with the turn to deep square leg
full on middle stump, backs away and skews it over Sundar's head
pushed through on leg stump, Rahul drops down to one knee and deftly paddles it away fine of short fine leg for four
fired outside off, whipped to cow corner off the back foot
slower legbreak, spins away outside off, driven with the spin to the covers
looks like a googly but the length is short, punched down to long-on
short dart outside off, solidly punched down to long-on
sliding into leg stump, worked with the angle through midwicket
whipped from outside off to long-on. Lovely wristwork from Rahul
good length and on middle, punched up to long-on for one
very full on middle stump, whipped away between deep midwicket and wide long-on
very full and drifting down leg for a wide. Re-set the radar, Mr. Woakes
dragged short and outside off, Karun Nair arches his back, rides the bounce and ramps it over the keeper
back of a length and outside off, Rahul stays beside the line and flashes a single to deep point
back of a length and angling in on middle stump, Rahul inches forward and pushes it back to the bowler
quicker through the air, fizzes off the pitch, clipped through midwicket
rank half-tracker on the leg stump, Rahul pounces onto it and smacks it flat and hard over deep square leg
pushed through on middle and leg, skids in, punched away to wide long-on. Mandeep effects a direct hit at the bowler's end and concedes an extra run
length ball on middle, driven down to long-off
tossed on middle stump, dips, Rahul does not meet the pitch., Therefore, drags it off the inside half past midwicket
Rahul ventures down the track, yorks himself, but digs it out
dipping full-toss on off, 109.9kph, jammed out to backward point. Fifty up for Kings XI in Powerplay but it has come at the cost of three wickets
back of a length on off, drop and run to point
back of a length and kicks up at off, squares up the batsman, pokes an outside edge to point
darted short and swings away outside off, Rahul slashes  and misses
short on off stump, opens the face and glides it to backward point
full and angling into a front-foot push to mid-on
back of a length and angling across off, steered with the angle to third man
short on off, hangs back and fends it behind to the keeper
pitched up and just a shade outside off, driven on the up straight of mid-off. So easy on the eye
pitched up and outside off, driven down to mid-off
short at the body, fended off
dug in short on the leg stump, Rahul picks it up and pulls it up and over short fine leg for a flat six

Umesh is just too quick for Yuvraj Singh. Pretty full and speared in from around the wicket, rushes Yuvraj for pace. He storms through the gate and knocks out the middle stump. Umesh celebrates the wicket with an animated fist pump

banged in short and outside off, chest-high ball, pulled in the air. The fielder comes in, as opposed to staying back at the boundary. He leaps and the ball sails over him. It might have been a straightforward catch had the fielder stayed in the deep
back of a length and just a shade outside off, Yuvraj covers up in defence
full and wide outside off, Yuvraj leans into a drive and finds cover. Hat-trick averted

big appeal for lbw, and the finger goes up. Finch challenges the on-field out decision. Full nip-backer, Finch is caught on the crease, playing around his front pad and missing. Impact in line and the tracker returns umpire's call on leg stump. Finch bags a duck on return
edged and de Kock throws himself to his right to snag the catch. Pitched up and outside off, Agarwal throws his hands at a drive and nicks it behind. De Kock completes an outstanding catch

Dropped? Sarfraz dives forward from deep square leg but the ball dies in front of him. He is writhing in pain. He is clutching his ankle. Talk about adding injury to insult? This was another hip-high short ball on the leg stump, Agarwal short-arms it away in the air but it did not carry to the fielder
shorter and angling away outside off, guided with the angle to backward point
Kulwant continues to dart it on the pads, deflected away square on the leg side
Agarwal shimmies out and punches on the up to mid-off
140.3ks but sprayed down the leg side, Agarwal simply tickles it away fine on the leg side past the keeper
skidding into the thigh, cramps the batsman for room, tucked away to midwicket
Umesh floats a slower ball outside off, Rahul can only force it as far as backward point
hip-high short ball on middle and leg, slower one, short-arm jabbed to deep square leg
Agarwal is matching Rahul shot for shot. He backs away outside leg and fiercely drills it past the left of Umesh and right of mid-off
Umesh hits a hard length on off - neither driveable nor pullable - forced down to mid-on
back of a length and attacking the stumps, hangs back and bunts it down to mid-on
Agarwal now throws himself into the action. Hip-high short ball on middle, Agarwal swivels back and short-arms it over midwicket
wrong line again, drifting into the pads, Rahul picks it off the pads and flicks it past short fine leg. Easy peasy
shorter on off, no room, blocked to the leg side off the back foot
whoa! Back-to-back sixes for Rahul. Sublime timing. Too full and veering into the pads, massive whippage of the wrists from the local boy. Picked up and launched over the square leg boundary

Hit flat and hard for a six! Back of a length and much wider outside off, Rahul extends his hands and scythes it up and over the covers. Dismissive. Shot of a man who's coming off a fastest fifty in the IPL
back of a length and put outside off, Rahul hangs back to this and chops it behind in the direction of slip
full, angling in towards off, then nipping away slightly outside off, Rahul gets right behind the line and gently pats it to the covers

Field up, what?Stanlake hits over the top and secures a thrilling win for Sunrisers. Pretty full on middle stump, yet another slower ball from Cutting, Stanlake does not get all of it but manages to swipe it over midwicket for a boundary. Hooda embraces Stanlake and the celebrations begin in the Sunrisers camp
Hooda shuffles across the off stump, banged in short and attacking the body, miscues a scoop in the air. Bumrah runs in from short fine leg but the ball lands in front of him. Scores are tied
slower ball floating into the pads, tickled away to the leg side. Stanlake and Hooda scamper across for the single. The fumble from Rohit helped their cause
low full-toss outside off, bunted down to the right of long-off. Hooda looks for the second. But Pollard is too quick for him
back of a length and angling away wide outside off from round the stumps, Hooda slashes with all his might, but loses his shape, and only collects fresh air
Cutting loses his line and his head. Sprayed wide past the marker. Left alone
full-toss, angling away outside off, Hooda clears his front leg, then bends his knee, and sends it clattering over extra cover for a six. First six of the chase in the last over

Mustafizur has his hands aloft in delight. Sandeep attempts to clear short fine leg. No dice. He shows his ace early and shuffles across off stump. Mustafiz chases him with a short ball that gets big on the batsman. He miscues a scoop to Krunal Pandya. Not sure if the batsmen crossed over
yet another cutter, nipping away outside off, opens Sandeep up and goes past the outside edge

Mustafiz pockets a one-handed return catch. This was a Mustafiz special: cutter, skipping away outside off, Kaul chips a leading edge to the left of the bowler. Mustafiz stretches out his left hand and comes out with the ball. Mumbai edge ahead
very full and angling across off, another big swing and a miss. Hooda walks up to Kaul and has a word with him
cutter, moving away outside off, Kaul pushes away from the body and watches the ball run past the outside edge
back of a length on off, backs away and stabs to cover. Hooda stutters and eventually takes the single
very full and straight - near yorker - squeezed back. Two wickets and three runs off the over. Well done, Bumrah. Sunrisers need 12 off 12 balls

Two in two balls for Bumrah! He has Rashid nicking off now. Pitched up and outside off, Rashid stays leg-side of the ball and aims for an expansive dive. He does not get enough bat on it and only edges it behind to Kishan. Okay, I spoke too soon. Sunrisers still need 12 off 13 balls
Bumrah bounces out Pathan and gives Mumbai hope. Chest-high short ball on middle, rushes a pull, Pathan flaps it in the air. Pollard at short midwicket lumbers to his right and clings onto the ball
inswinging yorker on middle, jammed to the covers for one
wide yorker, squirted to deep third man
back of a length and angling in towards off stump, dragged away towards wide long-on
hip-high short ball on off stump, Pathan was waiting for the bad ball. He gets it now. Helped away past short fine leg for four. Sunrisers will breathe easy
back of a length and outside off, he reaches out for a dab and misses
slower short ball on the leg stump, Hooda has a big slog at it and only toe-ends it onto the pitch. He, however, calls his partner through for a single
rides the bounce of another shortish ball and steers to short third man
back of a length and outside off, sensibly dabbed down to short third man

picked off the hips to deep midwicket. Hooda and Yusuf scamper across for the second. The throw is to the keeper's end and Hooda dishes out a desperate full-length dive and just makes it. The dive saves Hooda
Yusuf reaches out for a cutter but misses it outside off. Beaten. Time out
another slower cutter, dabbed to short third man
full, wide, slashed to sweeper cover
short and angling away outside off, guided with the angle to backward point
shuffles across and pats it to wide long-on for one
cutter outside off, runs past the outside edge
gets on top of a short ball outside off and crunches it through the line to sweeper cover. Sangwan slides to his left but fumbles. He slides back again and stops the ball from reaching the boundary

Yusuf miscues it to long-on, Cutting is at the edge of the boundary, he catches the ball with both hands. He tumbles over then but has the presence of mind to toss the ball back into the field of play before landing beyond the boundary. Cutting saves five runs for Mumbai
back of a length and outside off, sliced away to third man
shortish and outside off, steered down to third man
whipped across the line to midwicket. There's a mix-up between the wickets on the second. Hooda wants it, Pathan sends him back, Hooda dishes out a dive and reaches the safety of the crease
full and angling into a push to short midwicket
back of a length on middle, sensibly knocked into the gap at midwicket
short and outside off, hangs back and hits it to long-on
slower offcutter on off, defended back to the bowler
chest-high short ball on middle, Yusuf hooks it away past the left of fine leg for a one-bounce four
short and on top of off, punched back to the bowler
back of a length and outside off, run down to deep third man

Markande has his fourth with his last ball of the night. Wrong'un, breaks away outside off, Shakib reads it off the pitch, and drags a thick inside edge back onto the stumps. What a spell from Markande. He ends with a potentially match-winning 4-0-23-4
down the track and driven down to long-on for a single
jabbed to the right of the bowler, Markande dives to his right and takes some pace off the ball
full and outside off, googly? sliced to backward point
full on middle, tapped down to long-on
tossed up on middle, presses forward and drives to midwicket
fizzing cutter, swerves away outside off, past the outside edge. The keeper is beaten as well by the bounce or the lack of it. They sneak in a bye
full-toss on the waist, worked away through square leg
back of a length and tucked away to fine leg
Shakib gets on top of a short ball outside off and cuts it away to the point boundary
shuffles across and pushes to mid-on for a risky single
back of a length and outside off, sliced to third man
First-ball four for Hooda. He races down the track and smears it straight past the right of the bowler. Bam
paddled down to fine leg
googly, spins away and bounces outside off, carved to point
chopped from off stump to cover

Pandey ventures down the track and skies it. Rohit runs across to his right from extra cover, this was Markande's catch but he leaves it to his captain. Rohit stretches across to his right and hangs onto it. For a moment, I thought this was going to fall between Rohit and Markande. It was poor shot from Pandey. He steps out, slogs against the turn and holes out
full and spins away outside off, driven to wide long-off off the front foot
really full and outside off, hit to long-off to close out the over
drifts in on middle, blocked back to the bowler
chopped to backward point
full on middle, driven to long-off now
uses his feet and eases it through the covers
flighted outside off, driven to sweeper cover
shorter and spins away outside off, Pandey rocks back and cracks it away to the point boundary

Burmrah snags the catch at the edge of the long leg boundary. Markande has opened the game up for Mumbai. Tossed up and bounces on middle, finds the top edge as Dhawan goes to sweep. Bumrah judges it well in the deep. Just like that Mumbai have taken three wickets in three overs
flighted and spins away outside off, guided to backward point
shorter and outside off, forced down to long-off

short_text: Markande to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: tapped to the covers

short_text: Markande to S Dhawan, 2 leg byes
long_text: good length and spins in to catch the pad. Dhawan takes off for a leg bye and gets another via an overthrow

good length and cutting away outside off, past the outside edge? Kishan goes up for an appeal. Mustafiz isn't  convinced. Not given by the umpire. It prompts another review from Mumbai. Breaks away sharply outside off and bounces in the channel, Williamson attempts a late cut but the ball gets big on him. He feathers it behind. UltraEdge detects a tiny spike. No woody sound, just a little spike, and it's enough to overturn the not-out decision. Former Sunriser Mustafiz strikes
slower offcutter, Williamson plays at the very last moment, he deftly runs it away fine on the off side past the diving Kishan
short and outside off, punched up to cover. A direct hit could have had Dhawan at the non-striker's end

short_text: Mustafizur to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: short on off, chopped only as far as point

short_text: Mustafizur to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: hip-high short ball outside off, Dhawn lines it up and smokes it in front of square on the leg side
back of a length on middle, swatted down to long-on
nurdled through square leg for one

Saha steps out, Markande foxes him with a quicker googly, hits the thigh pad. Lbw appeal, but umpire Llong does not budge. Going down leg? Mumbai go for a review. Spins in, bounces to hit the front flap, the tracker returns three reds. Umpire Llong is bemused. He reverses his decision
Dhawan steps out, has a big heave-ho, drags it behind square on the leg side

short_text: Markande to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: full on middle and spins in, driven to mid-on off the front foot

short_text: Markande to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: half-tracker outside off, Dhawan lays into it and cracks it through the covers. Sunrisers cruising
slower through the air outside off, Saha stretches out and paddles it away behind square on the leg side

short_text: Bumrah to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: back of a length and holds its line outside off, Dhawan chops an inside edge past the leg stump. The ball sneaks away to the fine leg boundary

short_text: Bumrah to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: picked off the pads square of short fine leg for four

short_text: Bumrah to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: Dhawan steps out, slashes and misses outside off
shortish and outside off, run down to third man
slower ball on off, tip and run to the off side

short_text: Bumrah to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: overpitched and outside off, Dhawan meets the pitch and laces the ball through the covers
shorter and faster on middle, forced down to long-on for a single
full and straight, clipped through square leg

Dropped by Kishan behind the stumps. He can't cling onto the rebound either. Saha backs away for a cut, instead top-edges the turning ball. Kishan is undone by the bounce as the ball bobbles out. He dives forward but the ball evades his reach
Dhawan runs down the track and mows one away to deep square leg. Not middled

short_text: Krunal to S Dhawan, no run
long_text: straight ball on middle, defended back to Krunal
tossed outside off, nudged to wide mid-on
full and angling into the pads, picked up and fluently whipped to deep midwicket
shortish and outside off, helped down to third man
overpitched and outside off, Saha clears his front leg and clouts it over the non-striker's head
jabbed behind square off the inside half
rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and secures a single to third man
slower ball on off, guided to point
short on middle, Saha looses his grip and fends it off
banged in short on middle, rushes a hook, top-edged over the keeper for the third boundary of the over
back of a length on middle, defended to midwicket

Cutting runs back from mid-on, drops the catch, and parries the ball away to the boundary. Sangwan hits a hard length on off, neither driveable nor pullable, the bat turns in Saha's hands as he skews it and gets away

short_text: Sangwan to S Dhawan, 1 leg bye
long_text: skidding into the pads, deflected away to the leg side

short_text: Sangwan to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: massive whippage of the wrists from Dhawan. Fullish and outside off, picks it up and sends the ball over midwicket
tip and run to cover. Smart work from Dhawan and Saha

short_text: Bumrah to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: full and straight, driven away to the left of midwicket, sublime timing from Dhawan as the ball skips away to the boundary
on a length and just a shade outside off, Saha loosens his grip and glides a single to deep third man
slower ball on middle and leg, Dhawan waits for the ball to arrive, then  tucks it away to square leg
on a length and outside off, glided to third man
on a length and largely holds its line outside off, Saha stays beside the line and bunts the ball to cover
tucks this shortish delivery to short fine leg for a quick single
slants a length ball across, steered to point. Good stop by Lewis
nearly chopped on!  Looks to force this through cover point but didn't have the width. The bat face turned in his hand as well. Bounces over.
gets this to straighten from off stump, squirted behind point for a quick single

short_text: Sangwan to S Dhawan, FOUR runs
long_text: width outside off, Dhawan slaps this length ball through extra cover.
hops back and tucks this length ball off his hip to square leg

Markande finishes Mumbai's innings with a scooped four. He shuffles across off even before Kaul delivers, the bowler pushes it outside off, Kaul holds his shape and ramps it away fine of short fine leg to end the innings on a high. Sandeep Sharma embraces his Punjab team-mate Markande
very full on off - near yorker, inside-edged behind square on the leg side
knuckle ball outside off, tipped into the covers
banged in short on middle, spliced to long-on
full and outside off, steered past backward point
full and outside off, the free-hit it swiped off the inside half to fine leg
full and outside off, Bumrah has a big whoooosh and misses. Kaul has overstepped? Tight call from umpire Llong
full and angling into a little chip to the leg side. Bumrah averts the hat-trick

big appeal for lbw from Sandeep. This looks plumb. Umpire Nandan, however, shoots down the appeal. SRH challenge the on-field not-out decision. Another knuckle ball, hits the back pad in front of middle as the batsman plays across the line early and misses the ball altogether. It would have crashed into middle stump. Umpire Nandan eventually reverses his decision
Sandeep puts Suryakumar out of his misery. He picks up his second wicket with the knuckle ball. Floated outside off, Suryakumar hits early and ends up dragging a catch to Hooda at long-on
another slower ball, knuckle ball, 109ks, another swing and a miss
slower cutter outside off, barely 103ks, the batsman slogs early and only collects thin air
really full and outside off, toe-ended past the bowler to long-off

short_text: Rashid Khan to Sangwan, no run
long_text: finishes with a legbreak on off, defended. Rashid walks away with outstanding figures of 4-0-13-1, including 18 dots

short_text: Rashid Khan to Sangwan, no run
long_text: pushed through quicker and slides in to hit the thigh

short_text: Rashid Khan to Sangwan, no run
long_text: another wrong'un, thrusts his bat in front of the pad in defence
googly, finishes down leg, wide

Rashid storms through the gate of Cutting with another ripping wrong'un. This is slower through the air, breaks back in from outside off, Cutting ventures down the track, swishes and does not make contact. Rashid rattles the stumps and claims his first wicket of the night

short_text: Rashid Khan to Cutting, FOUR runs
long_text: slider just outside off, Cutting uses the pace of Rashid and scoops it over the head of the keeper

short_text: Rashid Khan to Cutting, no run
long_text: looks like a googly, bounces, Cutting sweeps . and misses
dug in short on middle, Suryakumar holds his shape and swats it away like a fly. Beats deep midwicket to his right
full-toss on middle, clipped through square leg
backs away and flat-bats a short ball to long-on
back of a length and slanting in on middle, punched down to long-on
slower short ball outside off, flashed to backward point. Suryakumar chances a single but it sent back
full and angling into a little chip to long-on
back of a length on middle, swung away to deep square leg
arm ball, squeezed back to the bowler
swept from the stumps to long leg this time
back of a length, slides in on middle, hammered to long-on
Suryakumar finally breaks free. Flighted on middle, he backs away outside leg, and launches it over extra cover
tossed outside off, swept across the line to deep square leg
off-stump yorker, squeezed down to third man

Pollard checks his punch but the ball has carried all the way to Dhawan at sweeper cover. 143.3ks short ball outside off, sticks in the pitch, Pollard yanks his bottom hand off the bat, the ball springs off the bat and into the hands of Dhawan. He slaps his thigh in celebration. What a bizarre dismissal
back of a length and outside off, Pollard can't connect with a little dab to third man
back of a length and outside off, Pollard reaches out for a cut and scythes it away past the right of deep third man sliding in the deep
slower bouncer outside off, bends away, past Pollard's reach
Pollard punches a six over Stanlake's head. Good length ball on off stump or just a shade outside off, Pollard takes a step back and lifts it imperiously with a high elbow
darted into the pads, clipped away to deep midwicket off the back foot
tossed outside off, driven through the covers
down the track and clipped through midwicket for two
tossed up outside off, Pollard charges down the track. He isn't close enough to the pitch but still muscles it over the cover boundary
back of a length on off, Pollard punches it straight back to Shakib
shorter on middle, swatted to long-on off the back foot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pollard, no run
long_text: tossed-up wrong'un, swerves in from outside off, Pollard did not pick the variation. It was tantalisingly close to the off stump
tossed up on middle stump, a bit too full for the sweep, tickled to short fine leg where the fielder fumbles
tucked off the pads to deep square leg
chopped to point

short_text: Rashid Khan to Yadav, no run
long_text: fast legbreak outside off, punched with the turn to cover

short_text: Rashid Khan to Yadav, no run
long_text: sharp wrong'un, starts outside off and breaks back in, cramps the batsman for room, hits the flap of the front pad. It might have bounced over the stumps
back of a length and on a fourth-stump line, Pollard chops his bat down and gets it away fine of short third man for a much-needed boundary
short, on top of off, punched back to Kaul
shuffles across and whips a single to long-on
hurled short on middle, gets big on Suryakumar as he hooks and misses
back of a length on off, punched back, Pollard's bat is in the way, deflected to short midwicket
back of a length on off, stabbed away to short midwicket

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pollard, no run
long_text: quicker googly, breaks back in to beat the inside edge and catch the pad but this is heading past the leg stump

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pollard, FOUR runs
long_text: tossed outside off, Pollard sees the flight, stays still, and lofts it cleanly over Rashid's head for a boundary

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pollard, no run
long_text: very full on middle, forward and hit back to the bowler. Four dots in a row

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pollard, no run
long_text: back of a length and breaks away just a shade outside off, Pollard hangs back and stabs it back to the bowler

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pollard, no run
long_text: skidder on off stump, nearly 98ks, blocked to cover off the front foot

short_text: Rashid Khan to Pollard, no run
long_text: fired on off, run away to short third man
Pollard skips out, manufactures a full-toss, and flicks from off stump to deep midwicket
Pollard shimmies out, Stanlake digs it shorter and outside off, gets it to zip past the bat again
wide of the crease, angling in, straightening and bouncing past the outside edge near the higher part of the bat
wide of the crease, back of a length and outside off, steered down to third man
back of a length and outside off, Suryakumar sizes it up and swats it away to the midwicket boundary with great authority
back of a length on middle, punched down the ground
skidding into the pads, turned to midwicket

Another soft, soft dismissal. Non-turner outside off, Shakib lobs it up in the air. Krunal expects it to turn but it doesn't. He closes the face early and chips a leading edge to Williamson at extra cover
pushed through on off stump, Krunal goes low, and reverse-paddles it away fine of short third man
Shakib tosses it outside off, Krunal stretches out and drives it against the turn in the gap at the covers
low full-toss, dips on middle, nudged again to midwicket
tossed outside off, nurdled through the vacant spaces at midwicket
darted down leg for a wide
off-stump yorker, jammed back to the bowler
back of a length on off, hit down to long-on
picked off through midwicket for a double
pitched up outside off, squeezed to mid-off
back of a length on middle, defended to cover
full and outside off, Suryakumar reaches out for the ball and carves it over backward point
tossed up just a shade outside off, Krunal presses forward and runs it back to the bowler
full and skids in, dragged away to long-on
very full on middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
another arm ball, zips in, inside-edged onto the pad
arm ball, slides in, played back to the bowler
flat, dart outside off, chopped away to the covers

Kaul strikes twice in his first over. He hits the top of off stump and leaps for job. He brings out the knuckle ball, Lewis has no clue about this variation. He is early into his leg-side swing. Kaul cleans him up

good length on middle, Lewis manufactures room and slices it in the air over mid-off. Williamson runs back from mid-off, dives, then swivels around swiftly to stop the ball from the reaching the boundary. Excellent work from Williamson
overpitched and outside off - right in Lewis' swinging arc - he drills it away between the bowler and mid-off. Rasping drive
full and shaping away outside off, squirted to the leg side

Sunrisers have their man finally. Back of a length and angling away outside off, Kishan looks to slog it away against the angle and across the line. Another low-percentage shot. This time he skies it to deep third man, where Yusuf Pathan slides on his knees and completes a sharp, low catch despite being blinded by the floodlights
back of a length on the hips, worked away to midwicket

short_text: Rashid Khan to Lewis, no run
long_text: another fast wrong'un from Rashid. Lewis picks it off the pitch and jabs to cover

Sandeep at mid-off drops a relatively simple chance. Pops in and pops out. Rashid unfurls a wrong'un that slides away outside off. Kishan dares to step out and slog. He only top-edges it hiiiiigh into the night sky. It drops down and Sandeep drops it

short_text: Rashid Khan to Ishan, 4 leg byes
long_text: flat dart, Kishan ventures a reverse-sweep and does not make contact. Off the thigh pad and rolls away between the keeper and slip. The tracker confirms it pitched outside leg

short_text: Rashid Khan to Ishan, no run
long_text: zippy legbreak, breaks back in to strike him high on the thigh pad

short_text: Rashid Khan to Ishan, no run
long_text: fizzes through outside off, no turn, punched off the back foot to extra cover

short_text: Rashid Khan to Ishan, no run
long_text: pushed through on middle, presses forward and drives to mid-off
much fuller and sliding in on middle from around the wicket, catches Lewis on the crease. He quietly defends it to the off side
length ball on middle stump, Lewis creates swinging room outside leg and smears it over extra cover. Hit flat and hard for a six
short ball shoved down leg, Lewis sneaks inside the line and lets it go
back of a length and angling across off, Lewis aims for a big leg-side hoick and instead skies it over cover-point for a one-bounce four
chest-high short ball on the leg stump, pings the glove of Lewis was looking to fend it off
Stanlake responds with a fiery bouncer on leg stump, forcing the left-hander to duck under it
back of a length and outside off, 145ks, the extra pace of Stanlake works to Lewis' advantage. He stands tall and unleashes a jabbing punch through extra cover. Fetch that
around the wicket, full, angling in and straightening to take the outside edge this time. It wanders away fine of short third man for four. Sandeep threatening both edges
Kishan forays down the track, back of a length on middle, he swings so hard that he loses his shape and drags an inside edge past the leg stump and into the fine leg boundary
back of a length on top of off, punched down to long-off for one
back of a length on middle and leg, Sandeep gets it to straighten, defended
back of a length and outside off, punched through the line, the ball bursts through the hands of the cover fielder
First runs in the IPL for Lewis. He launches it into the second tier beyond fine leg. This was a poor ball. Short and sliding outside leg, he picks it off his hips and swivel-pulls it away

Shakib dives forward from square leg and pouches a low catch to dismiss Rohit Sharma. Another failure for him as Mumbai Indians' opener. This was short, skiddy, and attacking the body, Rohit is cramped up. This isn't a full-blooded flick. He chips it in the air and watches Shakib take a sprawling catch

short_text: Stanlake to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs
long_text: even fuller and outside off, Rohit frees his arms and laces a drive through the covers. The ball fizzes away to the boundary

short_text: Stanlake to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: full and outside off, patted into the covers

short_text: Stanlake to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: good length and just a shade outside off, tapped into the covers

short_text: Stanlake to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs
long_text: banged in short and outside off, Rohit reads the length quickly. Skips back and nails a pull into the stands beyond long leg. Sails over the long boundary for a six - the first of the night

short_text: Stanlake to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: shorter and just a shade outside off, Stanlake hits the bat hard, blocked to cover
Lewis pats the ball to the left of the bowler, Sandeep swoops down on the ball but misses the direct hit. Lewis wanted a risky single but was sent back by his partner
good length and attacking the stumps, blocked

Deepak Hooda drops it! Sandeep hits a hard length on middle, cramps up Rohit for room. He goes for a pull, instead skies it in the air.  Three men converge on the ball, neither call, and Hooda runs back from midwicket, stretches his hands only to shell it

short_text: Sandeep to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: good length and holds its line on off stump, Rohit negotiates it carefully

short_text: Sandeep to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: very full and angling in, defended

short_text: Sandeep to Rohit Sharma, no run
long_text: Sandeep starts off with a gem of a ball! Perfectly-pitched ball. Full, shaping to swing away, comes in, then again swings away past the hanging bat

a six to finish! Another swervy slower delivery outside off, Morris stands in his crease and smashes the ball over long-on for six. Rajasthan enjoy their hoemcoming too, beating the Delhi Daredevils by 10 runs
full and wide outside off, smashed over cover for four. But doesn't do much to the crowd or Delhi's mood.
takes the catch! A slower ball on leg, Shankar bunts the ball away again to long-on. Stokes runs in and takes a simple catch to seal Delhi's fate. A match-changing 10 balls from Laughlin.
full outside off, chipped away over cover. Wild cheers from the Rajastahn crowd because they've won this game without any extras in the next three balls.
